title: newManager of Training & Development
company: BLCO Enterprises Ltd. o/a KFC / Taco Bell
description:
Are you looking for a rewarding career? Are you goal driven and people person? Do you have the passion to lead and mold new leaders? Join our team now and become the Manager of Training and Development!

About our Company:

BLCO is a large KFC and Taco Bell franchise operator in Western Canada. We currently own and operate 29 KFC and Taco Bell restaurants across British Columbia, Alberta and Saskatchewan. We are in the process of renovating our current restaurants, and building and acquiring additional restaurants to serve our communities. BLCO is a division of the C21 Development Group and proud to employ more than 700 team members.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Initiate and oversee team building and development (coach, support, mentor, motivate, develop), employee relations, performance management, recruitment and selection, succession planning, training and development, and recognition within region, to ensure restaurant readiness with necessary bench strength at all restaurant level (ARL, RGM, and Shift Supervisors)
  • Design, roll out training plans and set the expectation that will build teams to consistently deliver brand measures at standard or better through working with the ARLs.
  • Partner with Human Resources to deliver an effective employee engagement and help manage turn-over
  • Lead the design of BLCO internal training programs. Oversee and lead strategy for effective restaurant and Operation training, to include core curriculum in LZ (YUM), Budget Management and Leadership, to achieved organizational goal
  • Influence and challenge above restaurant leaders to have a stronger leadership in every store location
  • Define and evaluate team performance, priorities and strategic partnership approach to improve team effectiveness and business impact
  • Culture leader that can identify and develop a talented team with bench strength.
  • Encourage restaurant leaders in celebrating achievement while taking action on non-performance
  • Play a key role in the development and ensure successful implementation of new promotions, initiatives, programs, tools/solutions, and operational standards within region.
  • Participate in the Annual Operating Plan process
  • Consistent development of knowledge and insights that will help and guide above restaurant leaders’ strategies.
  • Identify opportunities for knowledge gap and expertise with regards to technology and business tools usage; and proactively address potential concerns by collaborating with the concerned department and developing a training program to address.
  • Help facilitate in crisis and emergency situation while making sure to champion brand and business protection
  • Promote and provide support in leading in the cross-training of employees to do other jobs within business, increasing job skills and productivity.
  • Educate, coach, and mentor new hires in multiple positions and locations.
  • Identified and communicated to mangers regarding areas needing additional training.
  • Tracked participation, understanding and success of course material and training schedule.
  • Conduct ongoing evaluations to determine effectiveness of programs and make recommendations for necessary modifications.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree or with 8-10 years’ experience as a proven above store leader in QSR industry
  • Detailed understanding of restaurant P&L statements and reports that support financial success
  • Ability to influence and inspire at all levels
  • Ability to develop, implement and monitor – strategy planning/goal setting
  • Strong communication skills and excellent problem solver.
  • Leverage data to build capabilities and drive appropriate actions.
  • Ability to handle and resolve conflict effectively
  • Outstanding coaching and mentoring skills with solid follow-up.
  • Thorough knowledge or familiar with Operation Tools
  • Demonstrated mastery of BOH Systems. Have expertise in Scheduling, Forecasting & Projections systems.

WHAT THIS JOB CAN OFFER YOU:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • Company car allowance
  • Quarterly bonus
  • Employee food discount (all YUM brands)
  • Paid vacation days
  • Cell phone/Mobile allowance

APPLY NOW!

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Materials Manager
description:
Job Description for
Manager, Materials (Miramichi)

The Manager, Materials reports directly to the Production Manager

Job Purpose:

The Material Manager’s primary function is to manage and oversee all Purchasing, Shipping/ Receiving and Warehouse operations.

Responsibilities & Duties:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Material Management:

  • Oversee all purchasing, shipping, receiving and warehouse activities ensuring compliance with corporate material handling strategies, policies, processes and contracts.
  • Ensure that critical material, components, equipment and services are procured at the best value for the company.
  • Create and implement material management procedures and ensure they are adhered to.
  • Ensure safe and proper off loading and on loading procedures are followed and maintained in shipping and receiving.
  • Ensure hazardous goods and shelf life items are properly labelled and stored.
  • Ensure materials to be shipped are properly packaged and all contract specifications are followed.
  • Organize shipping through outside agents.
  • Ensure proper permits are acquired prior to shipping, particularly for oversized loads and dangerous goods.
  • Ensure all company procedures have been followed before products leave the premises.
  • Ensure materials are issued to the production department, as necessary.
  • Remove material deficiencies and surpluses.
  • Maintain and update material management system in enterprise software.

Project Management:

  • Provide information to Project Managers and Purchasing departments as required.
  • Work with Quality Assurance department to ensure product is received and shipped as required.
  • Maintain contacts with Federal Government and Private industry clients as required.
  • Liaise with Brokers and US/Canada Customs agencies as required.
  • Meet with Canada Customs and Canada Revenue Agency auditors as required and ensure that all their concerns and question are answered.
  • Attend departmental meetings as required.

Inventory Management:

  • Ensure inventory levels are accurate
  • Dispose of excess material through vendor resale or scrap.
  • Ensure that excess materials are disposed of in a cost effective manner.
  • Ensure purchasing is aware of inventory levels.

Personnel Management:

  • Provide technical, military, material management and Visual Manufacturing advice to staff as required.
  • Supervise and act as a mentor to employees.
  • Ensure all employees comply with Health and Safety regulations and policies.
  • Ensure that all sections are running at full capacity and allocate resources as needed.
  • Respond to employee inquiries, issues and concerns and resolve accordingly.
  • Ensure all new employees are properly trained.
  • Work with Human Resources to identify development and training requirements.
  • Conduct annual performance evaluations for employees.
  • Participate in the selection of new employees.

Miscellaneous:

  • Work in conjunction with the Safety/Maintenance Manager to ensure the yard is properly maintained and to assist with facility and yard upgrades
  • Ensure proper storage of DND vehicles
  • Ensure protective equipment and uniforms are available to production staff as required

Other:

  • Work well within a team environment.
  • Maintain open communication with all team members.
  • Adhere to all environmental, health and safety regulations and follow the environmental and quality management systems.
  • Travel as required.

Experience:

  • Five years supervisory and warehouse experience
  • Experience working in a large-scale manufacturing environment
  • Material management expertise
  • Experience with MS Office and inventory management software

Education/ Professional Certification:

  • Post-secondary education in a related field

Skills:

  • Excellent organizational and planning skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Able to lead and motivate a team
  • Strong task-management and scheduling capabilities
  • Able to work with minimal supervision
  • Conflict management
  • Negotiating skills

DEW Training Specific:

  • New Employee Orientation
  • Safety On-Boarding
  • Transportation of Dangerous Goods
  • Formal and on-the-job training and certification

Working Conditions and Physical Requirements

  • Sitting for long periods of time.
  • Largely office-based, although at times the job may require travel to meetings.
  • The role can be quite stressful, particularly when production requirements need ingenious solutions. Working with all facets of the operation, trying to pull all requests together to form a feasible and cost-effective plan for purchasing materials and shipping the products. There also can be staffing problems or disciplinary issues to deal with.

DEW is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

DEW is committed to create and maintain an inclusive and barrier-free environment for its employees. Should the Materials Manager have an employment related need that may require workplace accommodation he/she is responsible for informing their direct supervisor so that the appropriate steps can be taken.

Work Remotely

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Management: 3 years (preferred)
  • Procurement: 3 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-01

title: Operations Manager
description:
OPERATIONS MANAGER

Our global steel pipe and fittings client is looking to add a hands-on Operations Manager to their growing team in Edmonton.

Do you:

  • Have previous experience managing in a warehouse and/or pipe yard environment?
  • Value the difference between leadership and management, and can switch between either style as the situation dictates?
  • Thrive in an organization with a global reach that maintains a family-owned vibe of flexibility and connection?

If so, this role is for you.

Reporting to the General Manager, your success will be defined by your ability to oversee diverse accountabilities including:

People Leadership

  • Leadership of the warehouse, pipe yard, and shipping operation teams including supervision, mentorship, and performance management where necessary.

Operations Management

  • Maintaining a hands-on approach with a focus on managing the overall flow of materials in the warehouse while supporting and coordinating pipe yard activities as necessary.
  • Scheduling resources to ensure timely receiving of materials and deliveries to customers to meet promised delivery targets.
  • Operating equipment such as forklifts and overhead cranes in a safe manner when required.
  • Ensuring preventative maintenance schedules are followed for both pipe yard and warehouse equipment.
  • Organizing repairs and maintenance for buildings and property.

Business Strategy

  • Adding creative and valuable contributions to the management team with a keen focus on improving business operations.
  • Analysing and reporting on key performance indicators to support strategic decisions and direction

Project Management

  • Developing and planning project activities with key staff to ensure smooth workflow.

Inventory Management & Quality Assurance

  • Overseeing excellence in inventory control to ensure inventory accuracy.
  • Coordinating the physical inspection of materials to ensure compliance to applicable standards and specifications.
  • Reviewing and approving of material test reports for customer orders and incoming stock to relevant purchase order requirements and stated material test report standards.

Customer Service Excellence

  • Championing superior customer service through a focus on understanding customer needs and expectations
  • Taking a customer first approach and instilling that within your teams

Safety Champion

  • Champion a safe work culture by embedding safety into the fabric of your teams and the work that they do.
  • Participate as a health and safety representative

And of course, other duties as required.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • A minimum five of (5) years of industry related experience (i.e. Oil & Gas, Industrial, etc).
  • A minimum of two (2) years of people leader experience with proven experience in supporting, mentoring, and motivating teams.
  • Experience working in a Small-Medium Sized Enterprise (SME).
  • Elevated client focus with excellent customer service skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • A flexible approach needed for working in a small team environment.
  • Understanding and experience working with OH&S Act, Regulation and Code

To be increasingly successful in this role you might:

  • Have a bachelor’s degree in Operations or related field.
  • Have knowledge of ISO 9001:2015 requirements and certified internal auditor

Our Client takes care of their employees with:

  • Competitive base salaries
  • Potential for performance-based bonus compensation
  • Health and Wellness benefits that include RRSP, Health & Dental, Health Spending Account
  • Corporate benefits like a cellphone
  • Annual vacation starting at 3 weeks

What work looks like:

  • Monday to Friday, 8 hours a day
  • As this is a leadership position, some flexibility in hours is required
  • In-office work with regular involvement in warehouse activities

We thank everyone for their application however only those shortlisted will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Our client is adhering to all provincial and federal COVID regulations.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Warehouse Manager

From $100,000 to $120,000 per year


Edmonton Branch
25 Richardson Drive, St. Albert, AB T8N 7W4


Uline: Where hard work and hustle are valued and rewarded.

Position Responsibilities

  • Manage day-to-day operations of the warehouse, including: freight, returns, receiving, parcels and transfers.

  • Lead and develop warehouse team to deliver unparalleled customer service.

  • Maintain high levels of accuracy in daily operations.


Minimum Requirements

  • High school diploma or equivalent. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

  • Management experience required.

  • Knowledge of warehouse procedures.

  • Strong problem-solving skills.

  • Equipment experience preferred.

  • Performance metrics experience a plus.

  • WMS experience a plus.


Benefits

  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.

  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.

  • RRSP with 5% employer match.

  • Paid holidays and generous paid time-off.

  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.


Employee Perks

  • First-class fitness center.

  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.


About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,500 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

#LI-CB1
#LI-EDM001
(#IN-EDMMANW)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: Procurement and Materials Manager
description:
Who we are

Summerwood Products is a progressive, fast-growing company, looking to fill a critical position. We are comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take great pride in the work they do.

For over 30 years, Summerwood has designed and built a premium range of Prefabricated buildings including garden sheds, home studios, pool houses, cabins, garages, and more.

We are based in Toronto (Scarborough) and ship throughout North America and beyond.

About the job

We are looking for an individual to oversee the selection, purchasing, and inventory of all of our input materials. You will build relationships with suppliers, negotiate favorable pricing and terms, and ensure that all materials are ordered and received in a timely fashion. The position reports directly to our CEO.

We are also looking out for what’s best for you and how we can help you build the career you have imagined.

The successful candidate will be curious and innovative, focused on delivering value to customers and stakeholder is alike. You possess strong planning and organizational skills with high attention to detail.

Responsibilities

  • Identify vendors who deliver outstanding products, services, and value.
  • Coordinate all aspects of the purchasing process with suppliers.
  • Manage inventory such that cash flow is observed and operations are never interrupted.
  • Develop constructive working relationships with stakeholders.
  • Identify and evaluate risks that can impact deliverables and profit margins.
  • Streamline processes and introduce initiatives focused on creating value and overall efficiency.

What you ideally bring to the role

  • Bachelors diploma or degree in a related discipline.
  • 2+ years of experience in material planning, purchasing, or inventory management.
  • Basic construction knowledge, including awareness of procedures and best practices.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Solid foundation in administrative software, including excel or equivalent.
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team

What we offer

  • Competitive salary with bonus targets.
  • Comprehensive benefits package (after six months)
  • Commitment to personal growth and professional development.
  • An impassioned team of coworkers
  • A fun and fast-paced work culture.

Please Note

Summerwood is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

Out of respect for the safety of customers and team members, you are required to be fully vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus.

Please note this is a full-time in-person position.

To apply submit your Resume and Cover Letter!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Expected start date: 2022-02-14

title: Production Manager
description:
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.

Overview of the Role

Reporting to the Plant Manager, this position is responsible for the supervision of plant operations and personnel to produce quality products in an efficient, safe and cost-effective manner.

How you will make contributions that matter:

  • Provides leadership, direction and guidance to production personnel and production supervisors.
  • Monitors the scheduling of equipment and personnel to ensure production requirements are met on a timely basis.
  • Ensures that safe conditions always exist within the work environment; will take appropriate action to maintain the health and safety of employees.
  • Develops and fosters strong and effective functional and cross-functional teams that effectively change systems and procedures through the process of continuous improvement.
  • Effectively uses daily production information to track costs, measure trends, and communicate results, positively re-enforce success and initiate corrective action when appropriate.
  • Ensures the Company’s quality and sanitation standards are met through close liaison with Quality Control, full participation in the HACCP and BRC programs, as well as frequent review and implementation of Company and Government Policies.
  • Administers the Collective Agreement and maintains effective internal and external working relationships.
  • Coordinate with other departments in Saputo.

You are best suited for the role if you have the following qualifications:

  • Superior communications and employee relations skills that are aligned with Saputo Core Values.
  • Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
  • Minimum of 10 years supervisory/management experience preferably in packaging and food manufacturing industry.
  • Familiarity and experience of mechanical manufacturing concepts.
  • Knowledge and experience of SAP is an asset.
  • Able to make effective presentations to diverse groups.
  • Knowledge and experience of the Dairy Industry is an asset.
  • Knowledge and experience of applicable regulations, health and safety, public safety and security, administration and management, transportation principles and methods, change management principles and methods, personnel and human resources, labor relations, financials, customer and personal service.
  • Proven Continuous Improvement experience, implementation & understanding of its concepts.
  • Lean manufacturing/ Six Sigma / Continuous Improvement experience an asset.
  • Work values: develop and maintain working environments that are health and safety conscious, lead by example and offer supportive management, and empower employees to provide service to others and work with co-workers in a friendly environment.
  • Must be available to work at the Edmonton Production Plant Monday to Friday during core hours. May be required to come in or be on-call during non-work hours for certain situations.

We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Advantageous corporate agreements
  • Full range of group insurance benefits
  • Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
  • Purchase option of company stocks
  • Group RRSP
  • Health and wellness program in the workplace
  • Assistance program for employees and their families
  • Saputo products at a discounted price

We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.

Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise.

Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!

The material contained herein is provided for informational purposes only. title: Office Manager
description:
Rockdoc Consulting Inc. is looking for an Office Manager to join our Ontario Team. The general scope of the Office Manager will be to support the operations of the Toronto Lab and Office in providing supervision and direction to the Ontario staff. The Office Manager will report directly to the Chief Operating Officer.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Supervise the daily operation of the team to ensure a smooth flow of samples and reporting.
  • Act as the main point of contact with Rockdoc Client Reps to fulfill client and production needs in a timely manner.
  • Coordinate with our logistics team to ensure the lab has all necessary equipment and supplies through daily and weekly audits.
  • Act as the main point of contact for the Lab Technicians with day-to-day Lab Operations.
  • Regularly evaluate and improve the efficiency and quality of work through development, verification and modification of new and/or existing methods.
  • Oversee the scheduling of all office and lab staff.
  • Collaborate with the designated Medical Laboratory Technologist (MLT) on implementing all necessary controls regarding proper practice and safety.
  • Working closely with the MLT, ensure the lab maintains Rockdoc’s Standard Operating Procedures at all times.
  • Manage and maintain laboratory inventory, ensuring all staff have the materials required to perform specimen analysis safely.
  • Adopt Rockdoc’s “Thinking Lean” philosophy in finding the most efficient ways to accomplish our goals
  • Promote the Rockdoc brand and its philosophy through contributing to an environment of learning, collaboration and fun while providing high-quality valuable services that enable people and clients to achieve their goals.

Experience/Skills:

  • At least 2 years of management experience.
  • At least 2 years of experience scheduling employees,
  • Previous experience in logistics is an asset.
  • Previous experience in a Laboratory environment is an asset.
  • Working knowledge of Zoom, Trello, Slack, and Microsoft Office is an asset.
  • Team management skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills
  • Effective task prioritization

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Explain your previous laboratory experience.
  • Explain your previous management experience.
  • What interests you about the Office Manager position at Rockdoc?
  • Please describe your logistics experience.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-04-29

title: Quality Manager
description:
Keter is the innovative global leader in consumer lifestyle solutions for in and around the home. Keter invents, builds and brings to market an extensive range of patio furniture, indoor and outdoor storage solutions, tool storage systems and household organization products known for their durability, design, and functionality. Keter designs with the most innovative technologies and build with sustainable materials, creating lifestyle products that enhance people’s spaces, elevate their experiences and last a lifetime. With products available in over 100 countries through leading retailers, Keter’s global scale enables meeting the diverse home needs of consumers everywhere around the world.

A. Job Summary Statement:

Manages and co-ordinates all the activities within the Quality Process to ensure that the company produces quality products in line with its standards and those of its customers.

B. Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

· Plans, directs and co-ordinates all activities in the Quality Assurance Process, to ensure quality targets are reached, at the lowest possible cost.

· Design and implement quality and management policies/procedures throughout the company at all levels.

· Exercises supervisory control and direction over the company's day-to-day Quality Assurance activities.

· Ensure employees are fully trained on Quality Assurance subject matter including Standard Operating procedures

· Prepare and participate in all Quality related audits, ensures audits are completed in within provided timeline and corrective actions are completed within the deadline.

· Complete customer surveys, questionnaires and online audits as required

· Keep all customers and internal systems up to date

· Ensure calibration of quality equipment is completed before expiration date annually.

· Initiates and controls inspection practices / procedures relating to material processed and workmanship ensuring that incoming material and parts, work in progress and finished goods meet pre-determined quality standards.

· When deviations from the specification occur, makes the decision with regards to disposition, rework, or rejection of parts. In cases of major importance, prepares the necessary basis for discussion with management, so the most cost-effective solution can be found, ensuring that customer requirements are met. Monitor quality performance by gathering relevant data and producing statistical reports.

· Supervise technical and management system reporting.

· Setting up and maintain controls, documentation procedures and mapping process

· Liaise with customer’s auditors ensuring the execution of corrective action and compliance with customer specifications.

· Where special action is necessary, takes responsibility to ensure that all departments involved are properly informed. Provides necessary leadership in problem solving.

· Participates in product development and ensure quality inspection are established based on the risk assessment.

· Monitors customer feedback and communicates same to Production personnel.

· Liaise with Marketing Department with regards to product label artwork approval and colour approvals.

· Approve Bill of Materials for new items

· Prepare packaging protocol for production floor and provide training to quality leads on new products

· Liaise with customer service, customers, and suppliers to resolve quality issues.

· Handles all consumer complaints and replacements of parts and products within the timely manner

· Prepare and co-ordinate product testing with customer specific laboratory and keep the test log up to date

· Maintains or builds up a close knowledge of Company’s supplier (source and subcontractors) capabilities by:

a. Visiting them at regular intervals.

b. Assisting suppliers when required to ensure a positive relationship through supply base development.

· Inspection and control of incoming raw materials as required.

· Establishes the duties and responsibilities for direct report positions. Has responsibility for hiring, evaluating, disciplining, and terminating of employees within Quality Assurance in conjunction with Human Resources.

· Ensures that Quality Department is staffed with competent personnel in all positions and that their abilities are identified, developed, and utilized. Trains, instructs employees; measures their performance and verifies their adherence to job instructions, quality system requirements and company policies, rules, and practices. Motivates and evaluates staff on regular basis.

· Follow the guidelines and rules as set out by company policies.

· Treats everyone with dignity, trust, and respect.

· Completes other duties as required by the Director of Operations

C. Job Specifications—Skills and Competencies:

· Post Secondary Education in a related field.

· Microsoft Office/Access,

· Minimum 5-8 years of experience in Quality Assurance environment with 3-5 years in a supervisory capacity.

· SAP experience is an asset

· Must display leadership qualities and be a strong communicator

· Skills in problem solving, process control, work instructions and continuous improvement.

· Desire to own decisions and take responsibility for outcomes.

· Communicates clearly with customer focused vision.

· Assigns the highest priority to customer satisfaction while meeting commitments to achieve

business objectives.

· Creates a positive work environment by demonstrating and sharing functional/technical

knowledge.

· Responsible for promoting and seeking excellence in all aspects of business.

D. Health and Safety

· Understands and works in compliance with the Keter Canada Inc’s Environmental and Health/Safety management systems, policies, rules, and guidelines.

· Understands and works in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the regulations.

Keter embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Keter is proud to provide employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation(s) please advise us anytime during the recruitment process and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $90,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • quality assurance: 5 years (preferred)

title: Parts Manager / Senior Parts Technician
description:
JOURNEYMAN PARTS TECHNICIAN/PARTS MANAGER

Join the Airworks Compressors Corporation team and experience a rewarding and challenging work environment with skilled and supportive teammates. We are currently accepting resumes from organized and team-oriented individuals who are looking for a career as a Journeyman Parts Technician/Part Manager at our Edmonton location.

As a Parts Technician/Manager, you will manage and dispense parts inventories to internal and external customers. Some of the job duties will include, but are not limited to:

  • Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of parts and computer systems.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of compression parts and product lines
  • Handle incoming parts inquiries from internal and external customers via phone, email or in person and maintain adequate records of correspondence sent and received
  • Determine customer requirements and expectations in order to recommend specific products and solutions.
  • Ensure material request is available in stock, otherwise source and confirms selected products with the customer to ensure accuracy and completeness of the order
  • Recommend alternate products based on cost, availability or specifications.
  • Prepare quotations, reviews and enters orders and internal stock transfers
  • Accurately process customer transactions such as orders, quotes or returns.
  • Coordinate and cooperates with other departments (i.e. Operations, Accounting, etc.)
  • Manage inventory levels and purchases, including year-end in conjunction with operations and accounting
  • Perform weekly cycle counts as well as monthly and yearly inventory counts
  • Pull and provide parts for internal distribution/service center from works orders
  • Restock consumable parts bins on weekly basis for internal distribution/service center
  • Shipper/receiver duties
  • Excellence in customer service and providing solutions to customers
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

Desired Skills and experience:

  • 2+ years of experience in customer service
  • 5+ years of experience in a related industry or manufacturing environment
  • Knowledge of MS Office applications
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Journeyman or Senior Apprentice preferred
  • Strong customer service and troubleshooting skills with experience analyzing and resolving customer service and client issues
  • Energetic and friendly with excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Self-starter with the ability to prioritize and organize workload in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent attention to detail with a sense of urgency to meet tight deadlines

Benefits and Compensation:

  • Paid vacation
  • Competitive wages
  • Group health and dental plan
  • Clean working environment

Reference ID: Journeyman Parts Tech/Parts Manager

Application deadline: 2022-03-04

Expected start date: 2022-03-04

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $58,240.00-$75,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Customers are required to wear a mask, curbside pickup available, common surfaces are sanitized regularly.

Experience:

  • parts management: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Supply Chain and Materials Manager - Tier 1 Automotive
description:
We are a Global Automotive Parts Supplier confidentially searching for a Supply Chain and Materials Manager in the Concord area.

Position Overview: Procurement, Material Planning, Inventory Management and overall Material Flow in the plant.

Ideal Candidate Background:

  • 5+ Years of formal Management experience in a Materials or Supply Chain position with a Tier 1 or Tier 2 automotive supplier
  • Automotive experience is mandatory (preferably working with steel)
  • Purchasing experience is required
  • Bachelor's Degree or Post-Secondary Diploma in Supply Chain Management or Business Administration (preferred)
  • Experience leading teams (15+ employees) as a team leader, supervisor, manager, etc.

Essential Functions:

  • Develop and execute strategies for meeting Supply Chain Operations KPIs (on-time delivery, cost and inventory reduction, etc)
  • Meet corporate targets and initiatives - Inventory Optimization with Production and MRO
  • Implement and lead purchasing initiatives
  • Responsible for sourcing and resourcing activity within the plant and presenting for approval
  • Communicate with all areas of the plant to ensure the needs of the company are being fulfilled through purchasing
  • Ensure new business supplier product launches on time, in budget, and within specification
  • Manage and delegate tasks based on roles, responsibilities and workload

Work Environment:

  • Combination of office environment and plant floor

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $120,000.00-$145,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Concord, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • automotive manufacturing: 4 years (required)
  • Tier 1/Tier 2 supplier: 7 years (required)
  • materials management: 7 years (preferred)

title: newAssistant Manager of Training & Community Services
description:
Assistant Manager of Training & Community Services

Reports To

Manager of Training & Community Services

Organization Summary

First Aid and CPR saves lives. As Canada’s standard for excellence in first aid and CPR services, St. John Ambulance plays an integral role in our society. Building on a 900-year tradition, St. John Ambulance offers innovative programs and products ensuring Canadians receive the best quality first aid instruction and caring community service volunteer first responders.

 St. John Council for Alberta was established in 1897 and became a registered Charitable Organization in 1996 operating as St. John Ambulance Alberta. St. John Alberta has 7 Training & Community Service Centres across Alberta with 50 employees, 600 volunteers who provide 28,000 hours of community services and 700 instructors who train 100,000 Albertans each year.

Job Summary

The Assistant Manager of Training & Community Services, under the direction of the Manager of Training & Community Services, is primarily responsible for assisting with the implementation, facilitation and maintenance of SJA Training and Community Service Programs throughout the Province of Alberta, including the facilitation of classes including Opioid Poisoning Response Training and Mental Health and Wellness for the Workplace. The Assistant Manager works closely with the SJA Centre Coordinators on the onboarding and professional development of instructors and volunteers as well as with the Provincial Office team providing support on projects and initiatives, as needed.

Competencies

  • Time Management - Balances a myriad of tasks; prioritizes duties as needed.
  • Teamwork - Works cooperatively and effectively with others to reach a common goal. Participates actively in group activities fostering a team environment.
  • Strategic Thinking - Analyzes and interprets the strategic direction of the organization. Has a clear and firm understanding of the vision, mission, values, and objectives of the workplace and uses that information to develop responsibilities, tasks, goals, and initiatives that align with long-term plans and growth.
  • Results Orientation - Able to focus on desired outcomes, and the means by which they are achieved by meeting and or exceeding standards based on past performance, goals, and objectives, as well as the performance and/or achievements of others.
  • Resource and Fiscal Management - Uses resources such as human capital, supplies, products, materials, and other useable items effectively and with foresight to available and limited funds.
  • Project Management - Accurately estimates duration and level of difficulty of tasks and projects. Sets out goals, objectives, and work plans to complete tasks and projects. Determines where work needs to be delegated.
  • Professionalism - Demonstrates professional standards of conduct when governing interactions between individuals in a business environment.
  • Problem Solving - Able to break down a situation into smaller pieces to identify key issues and figure out cause and effect relationships in order to solve. Use logic and analytical methods to come to realistic solution.
  • Organization - Able to create or maintain processes to ensure all relevant information or tools are easily accessible.
  • Negotiation - Gains support of ideas, proposals, and solutions from others; reaches deals and compromises on what will work best for the organization; considers other opinions while holding strong to firm directions and goals.
  • Judgement - Ability to use sound reasoning when faced with various issues. Has the ability to make quick, effective decisions.
  • Innovative - Able to think outside of the box in order to develop creative and new solutions or products that meet current and future needs.
  • Decision Making - Makes concrete, well-informed and thought-out decisions that support the overall organization. Has the ability to make quick, effective decisions even when data and details are limited.
  • Cultural Sensitivity - Promotes an inclusive environment exemplified by understanding all cultural groups.
  • Conflict Management - Foresees potential conflict and takes preventative steps. Handles conflict when it arises, assisting with resolution or determining solutions.
  • Commitment to Health and Safety - Works in compliance with all applicable health and safety legislation and established policies and procedures.
  • Change Management - Able to identify, implement, and communicate organizational changes successfully to relevant stakeholders.
  • Accountability - Takes ownership of personal workload, as well as the workload of employees under his/her direction.
  • Health and Safety Leadership - Ensures that employees are following health and safety policies, procedures, and regulations. Models appropriate behaviors.
  • Leadership - Works well with a wide range of individuals to provide support, coaching, encouragement, and direction.
  • Managing Performance - Identifies employee's strengths and weaknesses and provides long-term direction and support regarding areas of growth.
  • Resourceful - Responds to difficult situations or workplace requirements by using the available tools and information to support decisions and solutions.

Job Duties

  • Implement and apply operational policies and principles designed to enhance and ensure quality control of training programs and community service delivery within the Council in accordance with prescribed provincial and national standards and best practices.
  • Assist with the monitor, review, and evaluation processes established for first aid, safety, and volunteer training and recommend amendments to programs, policies, and procedures where and when applicable.
  • Assist with implementation and evaluation of quality control measures for records management within the Training & Community Services department.
  • Produce status reports on programs, services, instructors, and volunteers, as required.  
  • Assist the Manager with supervision of Program and Community Service Coordinators in the SJA Centres to ensure work is being performed according to established standards, provide training, feedback, and coaching, as needed, and ensure compliance requirements are met as per applicable provincial and national policies and procedures.
  • Assist the Training & Community Service Coordinators, upon request, in organizing community relations programs, open houses, etc. and attend events, when possible, to represent SJA.
  • Attend any meetings, conferences, and seminars having a direct bearing and/or impact on the provision of Training and Community Services, as required.
  • Keep abreast of any upcoming changes in training standards, legal requirements, emergency services, OHS regulations, or policy development having a direct impact on training programs or community services. 
  • Participate in the SJA Health & Safety program activities, as required.
  • Participate in departmental planning activities.
  • Assist with the development and implementation of annual project plans.
  • Maintain qualifications, as required.
  • Other duties and projects as assigned by the Manager and/or Vice-President of Training & Community Services.

Job Requirements

  • Post-secondary education in pre-hospital or education field.
  • Experience in health and safety, training, and volunteer services.
  • Effective leadership skills, with a strong focus on mentoring, coaching, and motivation of employees and volunteers.
  • Ability to identify issues and implement creative and strategic solutions to overcome problems.
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills.
  • Ability to plan, organize, develop, implement, and interpret goals, objectives, and policies.
  • Demonstrated time management skills.
  • Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
  • Clear police record check including vulnerable sector.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs.
  • Ability to adapt to new technology.
  • Project management experience and/or certification, an asset.
  • Instructional and volunteer experience, an asset.
  • Mandatory COVID19 Vaccinations

Work Conditions

  • Working in an office environment with frequent contact to SJA Centres in Alberta, using technology tools such as Microsoft TEAMS.
  • Interaction with SJA employees, instructors, volunteers, and the public at large.
  • Some travel required and flexibility with hours.
  • Occasional weekend events.
  • Operation of desktop computer and peripherals.
  • Facilitating instructor and volunteer workshops and conducting presentations.
  • Salary range $50,000 to $60,000 per annum

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Describe yourself in 3 words.
  • Tell us why you are the best candidate for this job.
  • What is your greatest strength?
  • What is your greatest weakness?
  • How would your former co-workers, subordinates, or manager describe you?
  • When are you available to start?
  • What really motivates you in a workplace?
  • Name an achievement, either personal or work related, of which you are particularly proud.
  • How would you describe your management style?

title: Procurement Clerk
description:
Job ID: 22-39

City of Beaumont
Procurement Clerk

Come join our dynamic team! Beaumont is the fastest growing community in the Edmonton Metropolitan Region, and we are looking to add a skilled Procurement Clerk to our team! Employment with the City of Beaumont offers an opportunity to make a positive difference in the community! We are a forward-thinking organization focused on continuous improvement, innovation, and exceptional customer service. Our Beaumont team is collaborative, professional, and passionate about supporting the vision of a growing, vibrant, and spirited community.

Reporting directly to the Manager, Accounting & Financial Reporting, the Procurement Clerk is responsible for preparing and processing purchase orders, ordering required materials, supplies, and services as well as following up with vendors on shipments and delivery. The position will also monitor inventory levels, verify data, support departments with tenders and procurement and other administrative and clerical tasks as required.

What this role will do:
Implement purchase order system; coordinate purchase orders, ensure payment for goods, services, materials, and contracted services is through an approved purchase order

Research potential vendors, gather pricing data, obtain and review price quotes and product specifications from various suppliers, identify cost saving opportunities and maintain vendor contract information

Participate in selecting vendors, negotiating contracts, controlling costs and reducing vendor related risks

Provide procurement support to departments in daily activities related to purchasing, tenders, and contracts and support continuous improvement processes related to purchasing

Liaise and communicate with the city’s vendors to maintain positive business relations

Create, update, and manage inventory levels and monitor purchase and inventory records

Act as a bridge across departments to support standard operating procedure (SOP) development and implementation to mitigate risk

Perform routine mathematical computations accurately and efficiently

Assist with developing and maintaining program records and report management

Administrator for the City’s Alberta Purchasing Connection (APC) account and other procurement related portals

What YOU Bring:

2-year certificate in supply chain management, procurement, accounting, or logistics related IT

Minimum of 3 years of purchasing and/or procurement experience (a combination of education and work-related experience may be considered)

Excellent communication, negotiation and vendor management skills

Proven ability to deliver a high level of customer service to internal and external customers

Advanced computer proficiency with Office 365 and experience with a wide range of computer systems and software

Knowledge of shipping and receiving

Experience with ERP technologies, and proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word)

What WE Offer:

This full-time, permanent position offers a minimum starting salary of $59,205 - $77,249 (starting salary is negotiable within this range based on suitable experience and qualifications), a 35-hour work week, enrolment in LAPP, and a competitive benefits package. Submit your cover letter and resume, indicating the competition number 22-39 in the subject line by May 22, 2022.

We thank all applicants for their interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please visit the City of Beaumont website for more information!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $59,205.00-$77,249.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Experience:

  • purchasing: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-22

title: Regional Sales Manager - Western Canada
description:
Tempur Sealy is the world's largest bedding provider. The company develops, manufactures and markets mattresses, adjustable bases, pillows and other sleep and relaxation products. Combining a proud history and groundbreaking innovation, the company holds some of the most highly recognized brands in the industry: Tempur®, Tempur-Pedic®, Cocoon™by Sealy, Sealy®, Sealy Posturepedic®, and Stearns & Foster®.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Senior Director, Field Sales, Canada, the Regional Sales Manager, Western Canada is responsible for leading and motivating a team of geographically dispersed sales professionals toward the annual achievement of business plans and goals. This role is responsible for driving the on-going expansion of market share and profitability within the region, while ensuring that customer service issues are resolved in a timely manner. In addition, this role is responsible for ensuring that performance related feedback is delivered in a timely manner and that training needs are identified, and plans implemented to continue the on-going development and improved performance of our field sales team. This role is based in Edmonton, Alberta.

Responsibilities

  • The Key Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Manages a team of direct reports towards annual sales, profit and performance-based objectives for the region on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis;
  • Analyzes both national and independent account performance on both a regional and territory level to identify growth and profit-improvement opportunities. Conducts regular account reviews to ensure that individual representative activity aligns to a master sales plan of advertising, merchandising, promotion and sales training programs to enhance Tempur Sealy’s market share and profitability in each key account;
  • Develops quarterly and annual business plans for the region aimed at increasing market share;
  • Builds strong business relationships with independent account owners, store managers, national account regional management and other decision-makers in order to better understand longer-term strategic plans within the account and influence decision-making to expand Tempur Sealy balance of share and profit margins;
  • Reviews and approves sales pricing and sales catalogue proposals for independent accounts. Works with individual reps to correct errors and improve data quality;
  • Reviews and approves proposed floor sales incentive programs within independent and/or regional to maximize sales time commitment to Tempur Sealy brands by floor sales personnel;
  • Manages the overall regional sales team budget, including employee travel and expense review and approvals, selling and advertising expenses, incentive and other promotional expenses;
  • Conducts field sales visits and activity reviews with each team member to identify strengths, opportunities for improvement and build relationships through on-going coaching and mentorship;
  • Conducts on-going training for Territory Sales Managers and Field Sales Consultants within the region to enhance employee capabilities leading product knowledge training, business acumen, conceptual selling and other key skill sets needed to drive on-going performance improvement;
  • Provides regular follow-up and feedback to each field sales team member aimed at motivating and improving performance;
  • Oversees customer service problems and works with Tempur Sealy operations to ensure a high level of service is provided to each key account on a cost-effective basis;
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • The ideal candidate will bring the following skills and experience:
  • 10+ years of experience in a sales or marketing-focused role within consumer durables and a proven-track record of successful delivery of training materials and development of both independent and regional accounts;
  • Demonstrated strategic approach to business planning with an emphasis on sustained growth amidst different business conditions;
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Bilingualism (French) is a definite asset;
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Experience working with a CRM platform; preferably Microsoft Dynamics CRM
  • A demonstrated ability to work independently while driving multiple competing priorities;
  • Entrepreneurial with the ability to think and act creatively and strategically;
  • Results oriented with “roll-up-the-sleeves attitude” and proven ability to plan and execute;
  • Highly collaborative; great facilitator; leads by example and inspires others to action;
  • Broad understanding of program management concepts and tools, including technical, innovation process, product management, financial, and operations functions;

Required Skills

  • You are a team oriented, self-starter who thrives on attention to detail;
  • You are a comfortable communicator through a variety of methods, always professional, courteous and timely;
  • You are efficient with your time and processes;
  • You are detailed oriented and accurate with your information and work;
  • You are comfortable and can easily navigate an organization’s informal and formal networks.

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada. Any request for an exception under Alberta Human Rights Act must be supported by evidence to be considered.

If a progressive, supportive environment sounds like a great place to work and this sounds like the role for you, please forward your resume and cover letter telling us why you are the ideal candidate for this role.

Tempur Sealy Canada is committed to a diverse workforce as an Equal Opportunity Employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities) and aims to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace where employees feel valued, respected, and supported.

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We thank the staffing industry for their interest but ask to not be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $90,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • sales: 10 years (preferred)

title: Procurement Manager
description:
Founded in 2008, REV’s sole focus is electrical power, its generation, distribution, control, protection and safe utilization. REV is acknowledged throughout our industry as a leader in safety.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Procurement Manger will be responsible for purchasing of products and services, managing supplier/vendor relationships, acting as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders for the assigned products and services, ensuring on time delivery of products, and negotiating with suppliers for favorable price, quality, delivery, and payment terms. The Procurement Manager will lead the Purchasing Department and work closely with Operational Leaders to work on cost savings measures.

You will be based out of our Calgary office located at 3236 – 50 Ave SE. This position reports to VP Operations and collaborates heavily with Project Management, Design, Estimating and Production Teams.

POSITION DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Lead purchasing team, providing support and direction
  • Negotiate pricing agreements with REV vendor partners
  • Prepare Request for Quote (RFQ) packages and communicate with suppliers
  • Lead supplier communication on all changes due to, including but not limited to; Engineering Change Orders, drawing revisions, part revisions, MRP Need Date, Push-outs and Pull-ins, Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs), Goods Receiving, etc.
  • Work closely with Production team to manage alignment of PO Need Date with our Manufacturing Demand Date, ensuring timely communication of date changes between REV and suppliers
  • Develop "production hot list" and prioritize supplier delivery
  • Supplies timely and accurate information for both the performance cycle and global contract negotiations
  • Manage Supplier delivery performance using Microsoft NAV reports and communicate with suppliers as needed
  • Level-load suppliers to reduce capacity and supply risks
  • Monitor Supplier capacity and quality issues that may negatively impact fulfilment
  • Champion Physical Inventory Count process and cycle count process for timeliness and inventory accuracy
  • Track and manage inventory turn, inventory levels, and inventory related metrics
  • Identify inventory discrepancies and drive root-cause analysis and corrective actions
  • Be a subject matter expert in Microsoft NAV ERP Planning and Purchasing processes
  • Responsible for assigned cost savings objective
  • Support key Procurement projects as needed
  • Other duties and tasks as assigned by management to ensure REV’s goals and objectives are met
  • Performs all duties so as to meet the responsibilities listed in REV’s Safety and Human Resources Policy Manual
  • Performs duties according to REV’s quality system procedures and work instructions

TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL POSSESS:

  • Strong leadership skills
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills required with an emphasis on attention to detail
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Suite applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.)
  • Ability to work calmly and effectively under pressure to meet time restraints
  • Must have a positive attitude and be self-motivated
  • Must be able to communicate effectively with vendors
  • Demonstrated skills in negotiations and relationship building
  • Ability to manage large and complex projects

POSITION QUALITIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Logistics, or Business Administration is required
  • Experience with global vendors (Asia, Europe, SA, etc.) is preferred
  • Minimum five (5) years of hands-on Purchasing experience is required
  • Experience leading teams highly preferred
  • Experience in a large industrial manufacturing company preferred
  • Extensive experience working with manufacturing Bill of Materials, drawings, welding and paint specifications, and customer requirements is considered an asset
  • Procurement certifications Supply Chain Professional (CSCP), certified Professional in Supply Chain Management (CPSM) preferred
  • Experience working with financial systems such as Microsoft Dynamics NAV is considered an asset

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $90,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Progressive Purchasing/Procurement: 5 years (required)

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Title: Business Development Manager

Reporting to: VP Sales and Marketing

Location: Toronto Area

Our Company:

Since its founding in 2009, eCAMION has strived to create a greener, more efficient landscape for the energy that powers our homes and communities. eCAMION believes that the time for fast & widespread electric vehicle charging is now – not in a distant future when “EVs are more common” or “the electric grid can handle it.”

What it's like to work at eCAMION

The company is driven by a culture of dynamic, cross-functional teamwork and employee empowerment, and is home to some of the brightest minds in the Canadian energy storage industry. eCAMION has maintained a flat management structure and start-up culture, despite its steady growth in the industry for the past ten years. The successful candidate will be working in high-performing, fast-paced environment under the guidance of our VP Sales and Marketing.

For more information, visit: www.ecamion.com

What areas you will be working on

The Business Development Manager will be a key new role within the company. The Business Development Manager will lead eCAMION’s growth efforts, driving the company’s near and long-term growth trajectory. The primary focus of the Business Development Manager will be to identify and execute on growth opportunities available to the company. The Manager will study multiple markets, identify key areas for expansion, and develop a roadmap for growth in those markets, with the goal of driving the company’s revenue and increasing the company’s penetration. Key responsibilities of the Manager will include conducting strategic market analyses, working cross functionally with teams across the company to execute on growth opportunities, and work on special projects. The successful candidate will also partner closely with the executive team and participate in strategic planning and board related activities.

Key Accountabilities

The responsibilities of the role will include:

  • Identify opportunities (i.e. potential customers) for the company given its portfolio of products and services and capabilities
  • Develop and maintain an opportunity funnel
  • Prepare and participate in the delivery of presentations to potential customers
  • Prepare tailored and detailed financial models to forecast the expected cost and benefit to both potential customers and the company
  • Prepare in depth responses to requests for proposals
  • Facilitate detailed due diligence on opportunities by the company’s potential customers
  • Work with manufacturing, engineering, procurement and operations to coordinate the delivery of solutions to new customers
  • Partner with business leaders and financial sponsor to ensure projects make strategic sense, fit with forward-looking business plans, and are integrated smoothly and fully optimized
  • Work closely with founders and financial sponsor on special projects; examples could include supporting business and/or geographic expansion opportunities as well as maintaining and updating long-term projections and valuation of the business. May include supporting additional investment into the business and/or financing of acquisitions
  • Draft, revise and deliver the opportunity related documents including ‘heads up memos, Letters of Intent/Memorandum, and non-disclosure agreements
  • Participate in strategic planning and preparation of board materials

Candidate Profile

The successful candidate will have the following experiences and capabilities:

  • Minimum 3 years management consulting, public accounting or corporate/business development experience
  • Executive level presence with ability to establish relationships with founders and key stakeholders
  • Exceptional technical expertise, with deep knowledge of Excel and financial analytical skills; 3 or more years of experience in financial modelling and creating structured quantitative and qualitative analyses
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to synthesize complex analysis and data into concise insights and recommendations
  • Experience with green energy technology/ electrification/ EV charging is an asset

Personal Profile & Organizational Values

The successful candidate will be able to lead in a hands-on, fast-paced environment. Key qualities must include:

  • Team player
  • High personal integrity
  • Hungry with a high commitment to results
  • Data driven, quantitative, qualitative and analytical
  • Creative problem solver
  • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational communicator
  • Quick and fact-based decision maker
  • Resilient

Education Requirement:

  • Undergraduate degree required; concentration in Accounting, Business, Finance or Economics preferred. An MBA, CPA or CFA would be a plus

Compensation

Compensation will be competitive and commensurate with experience, including base salary, target incentive and benefits will be offered

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week
  • Flexible Hybrid schedule

eCamion Inc. celebrates and values cultural diversity and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff. We will honor your experiences, perspectives, and unique identity. Together, our organization strives to create and maintain working environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.

eCamion Inc. is committed to providing an accessible recruitment process and workplace. Please let us know if you require accommodation under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Deadline for applications is May 12th, 2022. Our recruitment team will be conducting screening on a rolling basis and cannot guarantee this role will be live until the deadline. Candidates are encouraged to apply immediately.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $90,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Are you proficient in responding to strategic/in depth RFP/RFQs?
  • Do you have a minimum of 2 years experience dealing with large B2B systems such as electricity infrastructure, fleet management, renewables or related industries?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • financial modelling and forecasting: 2 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-12

May include supporting additional investment into the business and/or financing of acquisitions', 'eCamion Inc. celebrates and values cultural diversity and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff. We will honor your experiences, perspectives, and unique identity. Together, our organization strives to create and maintain working environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.', 'Compensation will be competitive and commensurate with experience, including base salary, target incentive and benefits will be offered', 'Extended health care', 'The company is driven by a culture of dynamic, cross-functional teamwork and employee empowerment, and is home to some of the brightest minds in the Canadian energy storage industry. eCAMION has maintained a flat management structure and start-up culture, despite its steady growth in the industry for the past ten years. The successful candidate will be working in high-performing, fast-paced environment under the guidance of our VP Sales and Marketing.']

title: Production Manager
description:
Recruiting: Production Manager

Polycorp Ltd. is the industry leader in the design and manufacture of engineered polymer products for a global customer base in the Mining, Rail and Protective Linings industries.

Based in Elora, Ontario, Polycorp offers employees competitive compensation, excellent benefits and a collaborative team environment. The Company is less than a 30 minute drive from Guelph or Kitchener-Waterloo.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Production Manager. The Production Manager will provide overall direction to manufacturing teams producing products that meet or exceed customer requirements while adhering to corporate policies and cultural tenants. This individual will establish and achieve aggressive targets for cost management, safety, schedules, member relations, customer satisfaction, quality systems deployment, and other directives on multi-shift basis, in a complex 24/7 operational environment.

Position Details:

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

· Primary focus is fulfillment of customer orders on-time, complete, and error-free shipments.

· Leads and manages operation members who are charged with ensuring safety, quality, delivery, and cost objectives are met on daily basis to implement effective operator control systems and to comply with International Organization of Standardization (ISO) 9001 standards.

· Provides leadership and initiates corrective action to resolve non-conformance issues to achieve established objectives.

· Achieves schedule completion consistent with customer demands and expectations. Participates, with peers, key support elements of operations (staffing, equipment, tooling, technical services, and others) to improve overall business results.

· Understands customer satisfaction requirements and plant or product deficiencies; initiates activities to improve plant staff and support departments.

· Production Approach - Focuses on measurable and near-term results and outputs; emphasizes efficiency, cost control, and refinement of processes and procedures that produce incremental gains

· Provides leadership to ensure effective training on methods, equipment, processes, quality standards, safety, material resource planning, communication, and teamwork.

· Implements improvements to planning, methods, products, processes, and work habits to increase efficiency and productivity, resulting in cost savings consistent with business plans.

· Spends significant time on shop floor; flexes schedule and effectively interacts with members across 7 day 24 hours operation; presents pertinent information to members.

· Comfortable to be hands-on within the shop floor environment.

· Embraces diversity in complex, make-to-order environment.

· All other duties as assigned

Qualifications and Experience:

· Bachelors degree, or equivalent job-specific work experience. Preferred areas of study include engineering, operations, business, or construction disciplines.

· 5+ years leadership experience in complex and demanding manufacturing environment.

· Working knowledge of quality, manufacturing planning, inventory control, and engineering documentation systems.

· Working knowledge of ISO 9001 certified quality control systems, lean manufacturing principals, team-based environments and continuous improvement.

· Proven leader in successfully managing large numbers of people, projects, resources, and complexity, achieving superior results.

· Has passion for excellence; always looks for improvement.

· Demonstrated dedication in keeping current with improvements in manufacturing and distribution technologies.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills required.

· Ability to be frequently exposed to production/distribution environment; can flex schedule and effectively interact with members across multiple-shift (24/hours/day) operation; ability to climb/bend/move in a manufacturing environment.

What We Offer:

· Highly attractive compensation, commensurate with experience

· Group Benefit - Health/Dental plans

· Life Insurance

· Employee Assistance Plan

· Paid vacation & holidays

· Education assistance program

Polycorp places top priority on health and safety and AODA compliance. Accommodations provided upon request.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $90,000.00-$115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Leadership: 5 years (preferred)
  • Manufacturing: 5 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-03-31
