The Company is less than a 30 minute drive from Guelph or Kitchener-Waterloo.', 'Extended health care', '· Working knowledge of quality, manufacturing planning, inventory control, and engineering documentation systems.', '· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills required.', '· Primary focus is fulfillment of customer orders on-time, complete, and error-free shipments.']

title: Training Manager
description:
Samsung Ads is looking to add a Training Manager to our Ad Operations team.

About the team

In this role, you will be asked to lead and support all training initiatives and manage training related projects; engaging with subject matter experts on building the necessary content and planning training schedules, sessions, and evaluations.

You will be working with an experienced, passionate team as Samsung Ads/AdGear continues to grow both globally and in Montreal. The team to be trained is currently located mostly in Montreal and Delhi with members in the US and Europe. This team is also responsible for global support of Ad-Operations activities. As an ideal candidate, you have proven experience in managing such projects in a highly dynamic setting, ideally in advertising technology or within a media agency focused on digital. You have outstanding organizational, communication, and leadership skills and you have a consistent collaboration and solutions-oriented mindset.

This role reports directly to the Director of Ad Operations.

All of our employees are currently working remotely from home. In the future, this role will be hybrid based and will require a mix of working from our Montreal, QC office and remote work.

What you will do

  • Assisting the Ad-Operations team in the management and execution of training projects
  • Being responsible for defining, planning, monitoring the execution, and closing of documentation projects
  • Engage with subject matter experts within Ad-Operations to conduct a training needs analysis and identify training gaps with measurable impact on the business
  • Design, plan and implement new training to meet identified needs
  • Enhance training materials and develop processes to reduce the learning curve of Ad-Operations team members
  • Develop an ambitious cross training program to ensure scalability, flexibility, and efficiency of our Ad-Operations
  • Organizing and administering regular onboarding and training sessions
  • Create a robust document control system, training matrix, and audit process to measure compliance against the set standards to ensure the best performance is delivered
  • Work on onboarding platforms and tools that can facilitate training and evaluations
  • Generate monthly reports on training metrics, and present plans to continuously improve training effectiveness, and engagement

What you will need

  • 3-6 years of experience with designing, implementing, and/or administering training programs
  • Bachelor's degree in Communications, Business, Education, English, Computer Science, or another related field
  • Project Management experience with large, complex projects and cross-functional stakeholders
  • Knowledge of project management methodologies, practices, and tools
  • Strong public speaking/presentation skills to address small and large groups in live and virtual settings
  • Excellent organizational skills with demonstrated ability to execute projects and deliver according to objectives, scope, and on time
  • Ability to work independently with minimum supervision
  • Experience in digital media and advertising technologies preferred
  • Instruction Design (video content creation) - an asset
  • Experience with LMS system - an asset

Benefits

  • 100% company-paid comprehensive health & dental coverage as of Day 1. Access to an employee assistance program and a virtual care platform (wellness, medical & nutrition).
  • Personal spending account & Healthcare spending account with Sun Life
  • Generous RRSP Matching Program up to 5%
  • Competitive compensation package, including performance incentive bonus plan based on company, team and personal objectives
  • Minimum 21 days of paid time off

Perks

  • Virtual social committee-lead activities such as monthly wine club night, games night as well as wellness initiatives like virtual yoga and meditation, art therapy, aromatherapy classes
  • Access to learning and development opportunities (your own LinkedIn Learning license, Pluralsight, professional development program, continuing education and more)
  • Officevibe - anonymous feedback from our teams to know how you're really doing and keep you engaged
  • Onboarding framework which ensures you're set up for success from Day 1 to Year 1. This also includes a buddy program (someone who will be there for you) from Day 1
  • Amazing discounts through Samsung Employee Discounts website and access to Perkopolis website with great rebates, coupons and promotions
  • Summer Fridays
  • Generous Employee Referral Program
  • Giving Back Program which includes donation matching & volunteering initiatives including one paid volunteer day
  • certain benefits & perks apply to only full time permanent roles. Please ask TA for additional details.

Life at Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.

We are proud to have built a world-class organization, grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.

Are you hesitant to submit an application because you're not sure if you check every box? Apply anyway! We would love to hear from you and figure out what you can add to the culture here at Samsung Ads.


Samsung Ads cherche à ajouter un responsable de la formation à notre équipe des opérations publicitaires.

À propos de l'équipe

Dans ce rôle, il vous sera demandé de diriger et de soutenir toutes les initiatives de formation et de gérer les projets liés à la formation; collaborer avec des experts en la matière pour créer le contenu nécessaire et planifier des programmes de formation, des sessions et des évaluations.

Vous travaillerez avec une équipe expérimentée et passionnée alors que Samsung Ads/AdGear continue de croître à la fois à l'échelle mondiale et à Montréal. L'équipe à former est actuellement située principalement à Montréal et à Delhi avec des membres aux États-Unis et en Europe. Cette équipe est également responsable du soutien global des activités d'opérations publicitaires. En tant que candidat idéal, vous avez une expérience avérée dans la gestion de tels projets dans un environnement très dynamique, idéalement en technologie publicitaire ou au sein d'une agence média axée sur le numérique. Vous avez des compétences exceptionnelles en matière d'organisation, de communication et de leadership et vous avez un état d'esprit cohérent axé sur la collaboration et les solutions.

Ce rôle relève directement du directeur des opérations publicitaires.

Tous nos employés travaillent actuellement à distance depuis leur domicile. À l'avenir, ce rôle sera hybride et nécessitera une combinaison de travail à partir de notre bureau de Montréal, QC et de travail à distance.

Ce que vous ferez

  • Assister l'équipe des opérations publicitaires dans la gestion et l'exécution des projets de formation.
  • Être responsable de la définition, de la planification, du suivi de l'exécution et de la clôture des projets de documentation.
  • Collaborer avec des experts en la matière au sein des opérations publicitaires pour effectuer une analyse des besoins en formation et identifier les lacunes en matière de formation ayant un impact mesurable sur l'entreprise.
  • Concevoir, planifier et mettre en œuvre de nouvelles formations pour répondre aux besoins identifiés.
  • Améliorer les supports de formation et développer des processus pour réduire la courbe d'apprentissage des membres de l'équipe des opérations publicitaires.
  • Développer un programme ambitieux de formation croisée pour assurer l'évolutivité, la flexibilité et l'efficacité de nos opérations publicitaires.
  • Organiser et administrer des sessions régulières d'intégration et de formation.
  • Créer un système de contrôle des documents robuste, une matrice de formation et un processus d'audit pour mesurer la conformité aux normes établies afin de garantir les meilleures performances.
  • Travailler sur des plateformes d'intégration et des outils qui peuvent faciliter la formation et les évaluations.
  • Générer des rapports mensuels sur les mesures de formation et présenter des plans pour améliorer en permanence l'efficacité de la formation et l'engagement.

Ce dont vous aurez besoin

  • 3 à 6 ans d'expérience dans la conception, la mise en œuvre et/ou l'administration de programmes de formation.
  • Baccalauréat en communications, affaires, éducation, anglais, informatique ou autre domaine connexe.
  • Expérience en gestion de projet avec de grands projets complexes et des parties prenantes interfonctionnelles.
  • Connaissance des méthodologies, pratiques et outils de gestion de projet.
  • Bonnes compétences en prise de parole en public/présentation pour s'adresser à de petits et grands groupes dans des contextes en direct et virtuels.
  • Excellentes compétences organisationnelles avec une capacité démontrée à exécuter des projets et à les livrer conformément aux objectifs, à la portée et dans les délais.
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome avec un minimum de supervision.
  • Expérience dans les médias numériques et les technologies publicitaires préférées.
  • Instruction Design (création de contenu vidéo) — un atout.
  • Expérience avec le système LMS — un atout.

La vie chez Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads est une société de technologie publicitaire avancée en croissance rapide qui vise à permettre aux marques de se connecter aux audiences de Samsung TV lorsqu'elles sont exposées aux médias numériques en utilisant les données les plus complètes de l'industrie pour créer la plateforme d'audience connectée la plus intelligente au monde. Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale telle que Samsung et faire des affaires dans le monde entier signifie que nous pouvons travailler sur de grands projets complexes avec des parties prenantes et des équipes situées dans le monde entier.

Nous sommes fiers d'avoir bâti une organisation de classe mondiale, fondée sur un esprit entrepreneurial et collaboratif. Travailler chez Samsung Ads offre l'un des meilleurs environnements du secteur pour découvrir à quelle vitesse vous pouvez grandir, ce que vous pouvez réaliser et à quel point vous pouvez être bon. Nous nous épanouissons dans la résolution de problèmes, en innovant et en profitant de chaque partie du voyage.

Avantages

  • Couverture médicale et dentaire complète payée à 100 % par l'entreprise dès le premier jour. Accès à un programme d'aide aux employés et à une plateforme de soins virtuels (bien-être, médical, et nutrition).
  • Compte de dépenses personnel et compte de dépenses de soins de santé avec Sun Life.
  • Généreux programme de contrepartie REER collectif jusqu'à 5 %.
  • Paquet de rémunération concurrentielle, y compris un plan de primes de rendements basé sur les objectifs de l'entreprise, de l'équipe et personnels.
  • Minimum de 21 jours de congés payés.

À-côtés

  • Activités virtuelles dirigées par un comité social comme la soirée mensuelle du club de vin, soirées de jeux ainsi que des initiatives de bien-être comme le yoga et la méditation virtuels, l'art-thérapie, les cours d'aromathérapie.
  • Accès à des opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement (votre propre licence LinkedIn Learning, Pluralsight, programme de développement professionnel, formation continue et plus).
  • Officevibe : des commentaires anonymes de nos équipes pour savoir comment vous vous en sortez vraiment et vous garder engagé.
  • Cadre d'intégration qui garantit que vous êtes prêt à réussir du jour 1 à l'année 1. Cela inclut également un programme de jumelage (quelqu'un qui sera là pour vous) à partir du jour 1.
  • Des remises incroyables sur le site Web Samsung Employee Discounts et un accès au site Web de Perkopolis avec d'excellents rabais, coupons et promotions.
  • Les vendredis d'été.
  • Généreux programme de recommandation d'employés.
  • Le programme Giving Back, qui comprend des initiatives de jumelage de dons et de bénévolat, y compris une journée de bénévolat rémunéré.
  • Certains avantages et à-côtés s'appliquent uniquement aux postes permanents à temps plein. Veuillez demander des détails supplémentaires à l'AT.

Vous hésitez à soumettre une candidature parce que vous n'êtes pas sûr de cocher toutes les cases? Postulez quand même! Nous aimerions avoir de vos nouvelles et découvrir ce que vous pouvez ajouter à la culture ici, chez Samsung Ads.

title: Manager, Advanced Materials and Asset Integrity
description:
Manager, Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity

InnoTech Alberta is seeking a Manager to lead the delivery of client services and execution of programs from the Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity team. With a focus on supporting Alberta’s energy and manufacturing sectors, the Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity team works closely with industrial clients to de-risk advanced material and manufacturing technologies, evaluate material performance, and provide applied research services to enable solutions for asset reliability and integrity issues such as wear, corrosion, material degradation, and fouling. Specifically, the team provides the following services:

Advanced Materials and Asset Reliability Management :
Materials Performance Assessment and System Integrity Solutions - Assess, characterize, and validate materials, coatings, and deposition techniques for industrial applications including:
Assessment of component corrosion and wear resistance in actual field and simulated pilot and bench-scale environments including mechanism validation, integrity monitoring, mitigation technologies evaluation, and asset longevity solutions
Development and provision of specialized material analytical methods to evaluate material performance in support of client innovation pursuits and solutioning requirements
Develop, evaluate, and validate advanced NDT technologies for material performance monitoring in niche applications
Multi-Phase Flow Monitoring - Evaluate and validate technologies for characterization of pipeline multi-phase flow regimes and dynamics, flow control and metering, leak detection, and pipeline component integrity monitoring leveraging our advanced flow loops of different scale and computational modeling capabilities
Novel Materials Development - Develop novel materials, coatings, and manufacturing techniques to improve asset integrity, improve equipment performance, and lower environmental impacts

Advanced Metal Manufacturing:
Additive Manufacturing - Advance and validate additive manufacturing technologies and processes for fabrication of components for harsh environment applications
Sustainable Manufacturing - Improve equipment performance and lower environmental impacts through advanced and sustainable manufacturing
Welding Quality and Productivity - Enhance welding quality and productivity through advancement and de-risking of welding and inspection technology application, adaptation, and deployment and supporting procedure development

Are you our next Manager of the Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity team? You would be a good fit for this position if you:
Have strong leadership and coaching skills and enjoy working in a team environment
Are resourceful, creative, and forward thinking; always looking to tackle new challenges and develop innovative solutions to problems
Excel at building positive and productive working relationships both internally and with external stakeholders
Want to make a difference within Alberta’s energy and manufacturing sectors

We are game changers
InnoTech Alberta, a subsidiary of Alberta Innovates, is a leading research and technology organization serving the needs of industry, entrepreneurs and the public sector. Our leading-edge expertise and industrial-scale research and demonstration facilities accelerate and de-risk technology development and deployment for our clients with a focus on industrial solutions and commercial application. With over 230 employees, InnoTech operates within several locations across the province, including Vegreville, Edmonton, Devon, and Calgary. We are Alberta’s innovation engine - with 100 years of bold ideas that feed, grow, fuel, and build Alberta’s agriculture, energy, environment, and forestry sectors. Visit us at: InnoTechAlberta.ca

Intrigued? Here’s some more information about the position:
Reporting to the Director of Advanced Materials & Energy Pilot Operations, the Manager is responsible for leadership of Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity staff activities and provides oversight of day-to-day client service delivery from the team, ensuring optimal scheduling of workforce, assets, and pilot-scale facilities to meet client needs. The Manager further oversees team business development efforts and is responsible for financial management, planning and reporting activities. Contribution to the development and execution of corporate and Division strategic, business, and operational plans and internal/external stakeholder engagement are also key functions of the role.

This position will be responsible for, but not limited to, execution of the following:
Client Service Delivery
Responsible for oversight of day-to-day client service delivery within the team and the development and execution of projects, programs, and initiatives in alignment with defined Division priorities, including:
Ensuring program/project deliverables, timelines, resources and budgets are defined and effectively managed, records management and audit requirements protocols are adhered to, stakeholders are effectively engaged, reports are prepared and delivered, performance targets and deliverables are achieved, and project management practices and standards are understood and consistently applied,
Delegating tasks and projects to the appropriate staff members to develop skills and effectively manage client service delivery workload,
Managing and forecasting workforce and asset allocation ensuring effective and optimal scheduling and prioritization,
Managing team’s pilot-scale and lab facility capacity including required development, operation, maintenance, and decommissioning to meet client needs.
Ensure consistent application of workplace health and safety standards and practices
Business Development
Oversees team business development and revenue continuity efforts, including:
Contributing to identification and pursuit of business development opportunities,
Monitoring and analyzing industry market intelligence, industry best practices, and emerging trends
Preparing and presenting business cases and recommendations as required
Supporting Division’s branding and market positioning initiatives and promoting InnoTech initiatives and priorities.
Leadership and People Management
Responsible for the management and leadership of team staff activities, including:
Ensuring establishment of team and individual goals and objectives and effective performance management and mentorship of staff,
Monitoring productivity, work quality and workloads, deliverability of results, and adherence to policies and standards,
Managing recruitment, career / skill development, training, and succession planning activities,
Developing strategies to attract, engage, develop, and retain qualified staff,
Leading through change process/events,
Facilitating and developing a productive, innovative, and collaborative work environment .
Financial Management

Responsible for management of team financials, including:
Development and monitoring of team operational, capital, and staff budgets,
Preparing financial forecasts and variance reporting,
Managing and authorizing expenditures within budget and approved limits,
Ensuring timely submission of required internal and external reports and financial documents.

Strategic and Business Planning & Execution
Contributes to the development and execution of corporate and Division strategic, business, and operational plans.
Responsible for the execution of applicable elements of the Division operational plans as pertains to the Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity team
Stakeholder Relationship Management
Pursues, develops and maintains relationships with external stakeholders, industry colleagues, government representatives, consultants and outside service providers
Initiates and coordinates collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders, peers and colleagues to understand business activities and issues, collaborate on projects, programs and initiatives, and identify opportunities to leverage resources, remove roadblocks and influence outcomes.

Qualifications and skills we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree or PhD is preferred) in Materials Science, Engineering (Chemical, Materials, or Mechanical), or in a related scientific or engineering field is required; equivalent work experience will be considered; Engineering candidates must possess Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation and be registered or eligible for registration with APEGA.
Minimum 7 years of technical, business, and project/program management experience is required with strong program and project management and delivery skills.
Minimum 5 years of managerial experience is required, preferably in an innovation environment or applied research and development setting.
Demonstrated leadership experience and working collaboratively with others is required with strong people management, leadership, and coaching skills.
Working experience with labor relations is required.
Ability to develop and maintain client and stakeholder relationships.
Strategic and business planning skills.
Strong operational planning skills, priority management approach, and delegation abilities.
Exceptional verbal, written, listening and interpersonal skills to convey concepts and information.
Negotiation, conflict management, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Financial management and business acumen.
Business development skills and sales support.
Demonstrated ability to deliver results by influencing and working through others.
Proactive and demonstrates initiative.
Ability to generate respect and trust from staff and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated knowledge of intellectual property, patents, contracts and agreements.

Why InnoTech Alberta?
We offer our employees opportunities to work on projects that will expand their skill sets while witnessing the visible impacts of their efforts. We value the development of our employees and create opportunities for working in capacities that allow new skills to be learned. We know that the wellness of our team is the most important part of our business, so we offer a strong benefits package and generous vacation and paid time off programs to promote work-life balance.

Additional Information
InnoTech Alberta has implemented a Vaccination policy in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. InnoTech Alberta employees are required to disclose proof of full vaccination or participate in a rapid antigen testing program. New hires will be required to disclose their vaccination status as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety. We thank all candidates in advance for their understanding of this policy.

The final candidate will be required to undergo a security clearance. All interviewees must be able to meet the requirement specified in the Physical Demand Analysis. This document will be supplied during the interview process to the successful candidate. This competition will remain open until a successful candidate is found.

Job Type: Full-time
skills: ['Advanced Metal Manufacturing: Additive Manufacturing - Advance and validate additive manufacturing technologies and processes for fabrication of components for harsh environment applicationsSustainable Manufacturing - Improve equipment performance and lower environmental impacts through advanced and sustainable manufacturingWelding Quality and Productivity - Enhance welding quality and productivity through advancement and de-risking of welding and inspection technology application, adaptation, and deployment and supporting procedure development', 'Are you our next Manager of the Advanced Materials & Asset Integrity team? You would be a good fit for this position if you:Have strong leadership and coaching skills and enjoy working in a team environmentAre resourceful, creative, and forward thinking; always looking to tackle new challenges and develop innovative solutions to problemsExcel at building positive and productive working relationships both internally and with external stakeholdersWant to make a difference within Alberta’s energy and manufacturing sectors', 'Responsible for management of team financials, including: Development and monitoring of team operational, capital, and staff budgets,Preparing financial forecasts and variance reporting,Managing and authorizing expenditures within budget and approved limits,Ensuring timely submission of required internal and external reports and financial documents.', 'Additional InformationInnoTech Alberta has implemented a Vaccination policy in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. InnoTech Alberta employees are required to disclose proof of full vaccination or participate in a rapid antigen testing program. New hires will be required to disclose their vaccination status as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety. We thank all candidates in advance for their understanding of this policy.']

title: Manager, Innovation – Materials
description:
Company Description


Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.


Job Description


Job Purpose:

The Innovation Lab is on a mission to generate unique value to bring the future of Canada Goose to life. We are here to enhance and support the company core values as a Product Led, Function First brand while retaining Canada Goose’s unique culture and point of view.

This is a unique chance to impact Canada Goose’s innovation initiatives. The Innovation Manager, Materials is a critical role in the innovation LAB, responsible for spearheading innovation initatives and transform ambigious concepts into sustained business value. An Innovation Manager is the initiative owner from scope definition, insights gathering, in-depth research, building business case, product ideation, IP + invention, validation via testing to commercialisation and business adoption.

This role is a primary owner of materials at the Innovation LAB bringing an expert materials lens to the innovation agenda by managing materials research and development of innovation initiatives through the transformation of ambiguous innovation ideas to proof of concepts. This includes the exploration, identification and assessment of innovative and environmentally sustainable technologies by partnering with external and internal partners to sharpen our expertise on new topic areas. This position ensures that the development of raw materials meets or exceeds Canada Goose’s quality standards and sustainability standards, ensuring overall product integrity and excellence.


Key Responsibilities:

Manage and execute on innovation initiatives from ideation to commercialisation

  • Lead and co-lead innovation projects from generation of concept brief from early stage insights research and opportunity identification through to concept validation, commercialisation and business adoption;
  • Synthesize research & human insight to transform them into key conclusions, compelling business stories, and strategic recommendations;
  • Build innovation business cases defined by unique market opportunities in line with the innovation agenda
  • Continuously generate new potential inventions which can be ownable through IP;
  • Execute and manage timeline around delivery of proof-of-concept innovations including component and system testing in both laboratory and contextual environments (wear testing)
  • Work closely with Innovation LAB advanced prototyping, materials, concept design and validation testing experts to ensure a clear understanding of construction and finished details of the concept
  • Oversee the creation and implementation of exisiting/ new testing protocals at a component or system level in the lab with both external and internal partners
  • Oversee testing and research studies related to innovation platforms
  • Drive proof-of-concept prototypes to commercialisation through in line partnerships and GTM process
  • Become a strategic partner to cross-functional innovation stakeholders by bringing a strong understanding of materials innovation and strategy


Establish and deliver excellence in Materials

  • Evaluate a wide set of market insights, customer pain points to identify opportunities for future innovation initiatives in the context of the Innovation roadmap
  • Liaise and collaborate closely with cross-functional partners and key executive stakeholders to develop, establish and continually evolve our innovation portfolio
  • Establish a high standard in Materials R&D within the Innovation Team and in our projects and approach to solutions
  • Continuously build and maintain a network of research experts across areas of interest including individuals and research institutes for future potential collaborations and partnerships
  • Maintain awareness of latest cutting-edge materials being generated in our industry and analogous industries with a focus on sustainable solutions related to the innovation areas;
  • Work with required creative partners to establish visual designs for innovation concepts, in line with Canada Goose aesthetic requirements
  • Work closely with inline Materials and Quality Assurance team to ensure the highest level of quality when concepts are close to commercialization


Experience, Education and Designations:

  • Bachelors degree with a focus on textile/yarn engineering or design; advanced degree preferred
  • Minimum of 7+ years experience working with mills, materials fabricators, 3rd party testing faculties
  • Experience with performance testing, product testing and working in a laboratory setting
  • Deep technical knowledge and understanding of textiles and non-textile manufacturing technologies
  • Experience traveling and working directly with mills, material fabricators, technology providers, and factories across the globe

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:


  • Passion for building sustainable product using best in class materials
  • Knowledge of traditional materials manufacturing techniques and curious about exploring new ones
  • Demonstrates leadership skills
  • Knowledge of research principles and open to gaining new knowledge
  • Self-starter that is organized, detailed, multi-task oriented, with the ability to work as a team-player, while maintaining a high level of professionalism and discretion
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently
  • Ability to prioritize day to day work activities according to the department/business needs
  • Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Demonstrates a high level of flexibility to quickly adjust to change within a fast-paced, creative and innovative team and environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Consistently exhibits Canada Goose’s values, taking pride in being innovative, respectful, passionate, accountable, and entrepreneurial while exhibiting personal commitment


Working Conditions:

  • Working from home, office and laboratory environment (this position is based in Toronto and the person must be located in Toronto)
  • Travel (including international) to field or manufacturing locations when required <20%

We are here to enhance and support the company core values as a Product Led, Function First brand while retaining Canada Goose’s unique culture and point of view.', 'Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.', 'Manage and execute on innovation initiatives from ideation to commercialisation', 'Experience with performance testing, product testing and working in a laboratory setting', 'Continuously generate new potential inventions which can be ownable through IP;', 'Bachelors degree with a focus on textile/yarn engineering or design; advanced degree preferred', 'Establish a high standard in Materials R&D within the Innovation Team and in our projects and approach to solutions', 'Experience traveling and working directly with mills, material fabricators, technology providers, and factories across the globe', 'Minimum of 7+ years experience working with mills, materials fabricators, 3rd party testing faculties']

title: newProject Delivery Manager
description:
WHO WE ARE

Founded in 2010, Ascend Fundraising Solutions online and in-venue fundraising platform and solutions have been used by some of the world’s most notable non-profit organizations such as United Way, Vancouver Canucks foundation, Canadian Olympic Foundation, Canadian Institute for the Blind, Kansas City Chiefs foundation, Boston Red Sox foundation, Big Brothers Big Sisters, Thunder Bay Regional Health Science Foundation, Arizona Humane Society and many others.

We are disrupting the fundraising model by helping charitable organizations, raise funds by using our electronic raffle solutions, raise recurring donations, build on their donor datasets, build deeper engagement from their donor databases, and achieve record donor revenues.

As a leading provide of strategy and technology for 50/50 raffles, sweepstakes, and Catch the Ace raffles, we’ve helped over 500 charitable organizations raise over $800 million on our platform to date, and we’re only just getting started.

We are looking for a full-time Project Delivery Manager to join our team. In this role you will work closely with the IT and Product teams to direct time, material, and resources across various departments to ensure that key projects are delivered on time and on budget. You will develop action plans, project milestones and lead project teams. The projects that you will be responsible for are strategically critical, you will frequently interact with various stakeholders in different departments. This is a fast-paced, multi-faceted role that requires excellent attention to detail, flexibility, and superior time management and communication skills.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop, support, facilitate and implement several projects of large to moderate size, diversity and complexity.
  • Effectively managing projects to deliver on time, on cost and according to expectations.
  • Develop project plans, including scope, budget, deliverables, schedule, and project team responsibilities to accomplish project objectives.
  • Monitor project progress and create project status reports for project stakeholders.
  • Assist with resource scheduling so that team members have the resources they need to complete their tasks.
  • Schedule stakeholder meetings and facilitate communication between stakeholders throughout the project life cycle.
  • Provide leadership, guidance, and motivation to project team members throughout the project life cycle.
  • Coordinate work and provide instructions to project team members.
  • Ensure timely and accurate communication between project team members, and management.
  • Facilitating the resolution of issues and escalations.
  • Lead project scoping activities.
  • Perform risk assessment and implement mitigation plans.
  • Manage project management documents such as the project plan, budget, schedule, or scope statement.

What we’d like to see in our ideal candidate

  • 5+ years of project management experience implementing multiple large projects
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, management or a related field
  • Project management certifications: Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), project management professional (PMP)
  • Leadership capability, negotiation skills and the ability to influence change
  • Working knowledge of project management software- JIRA
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Attention to detail

WHY WORK AT ASCEND?

  • Ascend is a market leader in the fundraising solutions sector and have a proven and highly regarded senior management team.
  • A team that is intellectually curious, dedicated, and has a willingness to get the job done
  • Opportunity to get in at the ground level and have a significant direct impact to the business in the short and long term
  • Help grow a company that helps charities and NPOs fund their charitable causes
  • Beautiful, downtown Toronto office with lake views and close proximity to transit
  • Competitive compensation package, including your preferred hardware.
  • Unlimited Vacation Program
  • Maternity/Paternity Leave Top Up Program
  • Professional/Personal Development
  • Hybrid work environment

AscendFS is committed to building and preserving an open, inclusive, and healthy work environment. We welcome all applicants to apply to join our team. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank you for your interest in working at AscendFS and we will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $95,000.00-$120,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Project management: 5 years (preferred)
  • Jira: 4 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • PMP (preferred)
  • CAPM (preferred)

title: Branch Manager
description:
Branch Manager

Aquatech has earned a reputation as a premier supplier and distributor of dewatering pumps, dredging equipment, bypass pumping systems, industrial pumping equipment/systems and accessories, as well as discharge filtration equipment that is currently in use across North America and the world. Aquatech is well known for having excellent service and support in the industry.

We value our reputation as an industry leader and a highly successful operation that promotes and supports the personal and professional growth of our staff, through offering extensive product training, opportunities for advancement and the ability to influence your pay based on your contributions and results.

This position has overall accountability for financial, operational, and customer service performance of the branch. Maximizing the profitability of the branch by making sure that it runs efficiently and effectively through the management of sales, rentals, and parts and service revenue, inclusive, in some cases, of on-site set-up and management of projects in a contractor-like capacity. In addition, the Branch Manager manages all branch related expenses, inventory levels, staff management, operations safety and appearance, in accordance with Aquatech policies. The services provided by this business include after-hours and emergency response, which could result in work outside of regularly scheduled hours.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage projects undertaken by the branch, including engineered pumping or dewatering systems, service contracts including labor and material, third party services, emergency response and all related safety requirements.
  • Promote sales activity through business development and retention strategies, implementing and executing of annual budgeting/forecasting and ongoing sales and operational growth plans.
  • Develop a strong technical and application knowledge of all manufacturer’s lines of equipment represented by Aquatech.
  • Lead meetings with sales and operations staff, and manage all staffing requirements including interviewing, hiring, training, assignments, schedules and directing of work - review performance including rewarding and disciplining of employees.
  • Monitor and supervise employees through operational and financial reporting for each function.
  • Supervisory responsibility in accordance with Aquatech’s policies and procedures, and all applicable laws and regulations.
  • Responsible for the direction and management of the sales team for development of specialty market segments being targeted, schedule and participate in face to face sales visits, business development calls, job site visits, product demos for customers and engineering firms.
  • Inspect yard and shop daily for safety compliance, ensure all portions of the facility and company owned equipment and vehicles are in a presentable, organized and safe condition, and that all staff are wearing proper PPE and attire as per policy, inclusive on-site activity and contract works.
  • Participate in trade/professional shows and conferences as required to promote Aquatech.
  • Prepare reports and present to executives on a quarterly basis.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  • 5 years of industrial equipment supply management experience.
  • Experience in construction sales, equipment rental, pump application engineering an asset.
  • Solid financial knowledge with budgeting and P&L statements.
  • Rental equipment business experience preferred.
  • Strong Presentation Skills.
  • Must be organized, strong computer skills and strong people/project management skills.
  • Ability to multi-task, think and react quickly under pressure.
  • Ability to travel frequently and for prolonged periods.
  • Valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $85,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

Experience:

  • management: 5 years (preferred)
  • Equipment Rental: 3 years (preferred)

title: Materials Manager
description:
Position Overview: Provides the appropriate material of the right quality, the right quantity, at right place and time, so as to coordinate and schedule the production activity in an integrative way. Ensuring timely shipment of finished goods to customers and sub-contractors. Responsible for managing the receipt and initial disposition of all incoming materials and deliveries (raw material, in-process parts, containers etc.).

Requirements:

  • Responsible for scheduling all steel orders for PSG facilities to meet customer demand ensuring delivery 2-3 weeks out based on Shop Edge information and direct communication.
  • Identify any steel shortages and ensure they are corrected in a timely manner.
  • Complete cycle counts throughout the week to ensure accurate inventory (coils, blanks and finished goods).
  • Daily inventory overview, ensuring data in Shop Edge is correct.
  • Set up new part numbers in Shop Edge and maintain updates to all parts.
  • Identify shortages in product shipments and notify Corporate Plant Superintendents and supervisors.
  • Completes month end sales reports and WIP status.
  • Responsible to complete and distribute all required reports in a timely manner (shipping / receiving discrepancies, short shipments, etc.).
  • Responsible to communicate relevant information (customer, quality, safety, warehousing related) to employees and departments, as required.
  • Interface directly with customers to communicate delivery status as required.
  • Responsible to ensure that the proper packaging is used on all finished goods shipments, as per the packaging instructions and MRP system parameters.
  • Coordinate supplier pickups and deliveries with our approved carriers, as required.
  • Oversee the accurate completion all shipping documentation to all customers within allotted times, as required.
  • Oversee the dispatch of all transportation for outbound freights, as required by our customers and their consigned carrier to meet our ship windows, and for any miscellaneous shipments, as required.
  • Oversee the allocation of shipping containers to all PSG facilities, as required.
  • Provide support to shipping and receiving roles for customer liaison, as required.
  • Provide back up to shipper/receiver roles as required during absences.
  • Qualifications: ·
  • Post secondary education, Materials Management Diploma or related experience.
  • Minimum two years materials management experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to use efficient and effective time management skills to prioritize assignments given from supervisors and plan how best to sequence tasks to meet deadlines. Adjust plans as needed if new loads arrive from suppliers sooner or later than expected.
  • Ability to work as a team with members at all levels and facilities to meet production needs.
  • Team player and promoter of “how can I help?” attitude.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $29.00-$35.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • purchasing & materials management: 3 years (preferred)

title: newCourse Materials Buyer
description:
VFO CS Bookstore

Competition No. -
S103947857

Posting Date -
May 06, 2022

Closing Date -
May 20, 2022


Position Type -
Full Time - Operating Funded

Salary Range -
$46,627 to $62,954 per year

Grade -
07

Hours -
35


This competition is open to all applicants however internal candidates and applicants who were former employees of the University of Alberta in the past 18 months will be given priority consideration before external candidates. Please indicate your internal status using the "Advertisement" drop down menu when applying.

This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).

Work primarily takes place at North Campus Edmonton and this position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed on our Benefits Overview page.

Working for the University of Alberta


The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.

The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.

Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.

Position Summary

Reporting to the Store Manager and working in collaboration with the entire store team, the Course Materials Buyer is responsible for the procurement of course materials, trade books, and special orders of books. This position manages all aspects of purchasing course materials including implementing and advising professors and instructors of deadlines, researching availability of materials and following up with publishers on back orders to ensure the timely and cost effective delivery of course materials. The incumbent will use their discretion to order and purchase appropriate quantities of course materials and trade books and will be responsible for the timely return of unused course materials and trade books to publishers. This position requires a high degree of organization, customer service, communication and professionalism and is the first point of contact for faculty, deans and department administrators.

Duties

  • Using the software program, currently Verba Collect, collect adoptions from professors and instructors for course materials required for the start of term
  • Ensure that all course resources are available for purchase in store and online,
  • Each course resources is adopted in the same manner as a textbook
  • This includes items like lab supplies, specialized paper/pens, etc.
  • Proactively assists professors who have missed deadlines for ordering course materials and determine the fastest provider for the materials to meet the class start date
  • Determines the proper quantities of course materials to purchase deciding on the mix of new, used and buy back course materials for each course for the term
  • Researches publisher databases and online catalogues to ensure accurate and current information for pricing, edition, ISBN, and availability, remainder wholesalers, as well as other sources to procure the best price for course materials
  • Purchases English and French trade books maintaining inventory levels in the store
  • Prepares orders for schools ensuring orders are correct and shipping to the correct customer
  • Devise and implements strategies to improve buying in order to reduce overstock returns to publishers
  • Meet with publishers and key resources to find trends of where customers are buying books
  • Create want lists of used books on Inter-Collegiate Buy Back (ICBB) database of used books available across the country
  • Ensures that all online course materials (eBooks) are ready to be sold at the point of sale by working with the cash team
  • Develops and reports results and analysis of sales and trends
  • Examples include book adoptions, course materials sell through, out of stocks, shipment days, etc.
  • Works with online team to keep online presence up to date on all new and existing course materials
  • Being a leader and champion for inclusive or equitable access programs
  • Helps maintain figures/data on when orders are placed and estimated arrival dates
  • Ensures that course materials stock is no older than 4 terms (1 year)
  • Works with the warehouse staff on the return of overstock and out-dated course materials
  • Maintain accurate pricing on all course materials keeping current with competitors (ie. Amazon, Publisher websites)
  • Ensures timely price markdowns of course materials and trade books when returns options have been exhausted or not available
  • Other duties as assigned. Some examples include:
  • Assists with Strategic Planning
  • Duties related to point of sale (POS)

Minimum Qualifications

  • University or College degree, or an equivalent education and work experience
  • 3 to 5 years of experience purchasing university level course materials and/or general merchandise
  • Self-motivated, creative, entrepreneurial and comfortable working on multiple concurrent projects in a busy, student-and market-oriented educational environment
  • Great organizational and time management skills with the ability to work in a high pressure/time sensitive environment
  • Comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Office and G-suite applications
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent customer service skills including, but not limited to timely communication, proactive problem solving and conflict resolution
  • Demonstrated effectiveness at problem solving and dealing with difficult situations while remaining professional
  • Less than 18 months to be competent in the role after working through one cycle of each event held in the store

How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

COVID-19 Vaccination: Proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 in compliance with the University’s COVID-19 Vaccination Directive. Fully Vaccinated means a status an individual achieves 14 days after having received the recommended number of doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada or the World Health Organization, and requires the individual to maintain the recommended number and type of vaccine doses as updated and required by Health Canada thereafter.

title: Manager, Procurement
description:
| About the role
Reporting to the Director, Procurement, Vendor Management, and Technology & Operations Integration, the Manager, Procurement manages and oversees Payments Canada’s procurement function. They play a key role in understanding the organization’s priorities, and translating them into client-focused delivery.

Responsibilities of the position include:
  • Providing day-to-day leadership to the Procurement team, including establishing objectives and providing ongoing performance feedback;
  • Leading the procurement process and executing day-to-day procurement functions;
  • Driving continuous improvement by developing and implementing system and process improvements that optimize all phases of the fulfillment process.
This role is responsible for providing leadership and direction to the Procurement team. Direct Reports to this role are:
  • Senior Procurement Business Partner.
| What you’ll be doing
  • Lead the procurement process and execute day-to-day procurement functions including: reviewing purchase requisitions and executing purchase orders, entering vendor data into the financial system, and monitoring and reporting on the status of purchases.
  • Improve procurement related processes in order to maintain efficiency, reduce risk, improve internal controls and reduce costs.
  • Maintain purchase data for analysis and reporting.
  • Assist in the approval, qualification, and selection of suppliers by identifying, researching, and evaluating suppliers based on Payment Canada’s processes.
  • Proactively communicate information regarding the status of procurement requests to relevant stakeholders and clients by liaising with suppliers
  • Identify and resolve problems relating to procurement issues by coordinating corrective actions and communicating with vendors and stakeholders.
  • Support business owners and cross-functional teams through all stages of the Procurement process.
  • Establish and maintain positive working relationships with internal stakeholders and external suppliers.
  • Engage internal stakeholders to define, analyze, and prioritize procurement related requirements.
  • Negotiate, track, and report on cost avoidance and savings to meet departmental objectives.
  • Provide education on procurement policies and procedures to internal stakeholders, identifying and recommending continual improvement based on feedback, and identifying opportunities to improve service and reduce costs.
  • Conduct negotiations for the acquisition of goods and/or services.
  • Identify procurement risks and implement mitigation plans, and evaluate and negotiate contract terms, conditions, and pricing in partnership with key stakeholders.
  • Prepare, analyze, and negotiate various procurement processes including Negotiated Requests for Proposals (NRFP), Request for Information (RFI), and Request for Quotation (RFQ).
  • Work with business units to develop statements of work and other contract related support documentation to ensure implementation of
  • fully defined purchase conditions.
  • Identify and resolve issues between the supplier and the clients, and report non-compliance of contractual obligations to key stakeholders.
  • Prepare monthly reports and dashboards associated with procurement activities
  • Coordinate with Finance Business Partners to ensure alignment between budgets and purchases.
  • Lead procurement training and support to all levels of staff to ensure compliance with the procurement program.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain a divisional strategy in line with the organizational strategy, designed to enhance or reliably sustain existing services over the longer term, and to proactively identify opportunities for new or amended services.
  • Provide strong leadership to the divisional team, ensuring the necessary tools and support are in place to enable the team to be successful.
  • Monitor and measure performance of divisional goals against Payments Canada’s strategic goals, as well as plans in support of the corporate scorecard.
  • Attract and retain professionals with the skill sets and competencies needed to deliver Payments Canada’s strategic priorities.
  • Responsible and accountable for all aspects of the talent management cycle (i.e., workforce planning, recruitment, performance management, staff development, succession) for the team, including developing group and individual development plans for team members to support a culture of continuous learning and development.
  • Provide leadership to the team through the creation of a compelling vision and ensure that the necessary tools and support are in place to enable the team to succeed.
  • Champion Payments Canada’s culture, both internally and externally.
  • Establish and operate within budget and ensure compliance with budgetary and financial administration requirements.
  • Encourage an open and energetic working environment and, by example, demonstrate that the team supports the entire organization to meet internal/external objectives.
| You’ll need to have
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Supply Chain Management, or a related field;
  • Minimum of five (5) to seven (7) years of experience in a procurement and contract management role;
  • Minimum of two (2) years of experience in a leadership and people management role;
  • Experience in providing advice and guidance to senior management;
  • Experience in developing reports, policies, and briefing material for a broad range of audiences;
  • Knowledge of procurement best practices, with an understanding of contract language.
| What we can offer you
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Health and dental benefits
  • Defined contribution pension plan (remove for terms)
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Prime downtown locations (Ottawa & Toronto) close to transit and shopping
  • Gym and shower facilities
  • Bike lockers
Please submit your application by April 28, 2022.

| About us

We are a unique organization at the centre of the payments ecosystem and Canadian economy. We are responsible for balancing and leading in an environment of multiple interests, ideas and challenges. We successfully navigate these challenges by adhering to a set of values that in themselves are tensions: Think Big + Act Responsibly, Be Ambitious + Raise the Team, Keep Momentum + Be Rigorous. We are successful as individuals, as teams, as an organization and for our members and stakeholders if we strike to balance these values in all that we do.

Payments Canada is committed to having a diverse, representative workforce and continuing to build an inclusive environment. We encourage applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples, and persons with disabilities. All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications.

We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and a work environment that supports our diverse workforce. Please let us know if you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process. We can be reached at hr@payments.ca.

title: Operations Manager
description:
Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Operations Manager has overall responsibility for H-E Parts International Canada, Ltd., operations at the Leduc facility, and is accountable for its performance and achievement of safety, quality, financial, strategic and operational objectives. This position has primary responsibility for company profitability and cost control. Success is ultimately measured by Adjusted Operating Income performance against budget. The manager is accountable to ensure prudent measures protect employees, the company, its assets and resources. Key objectives or deliverables include the obtainment of company sales, profitability and Operating Income objectives, which will be established annually and adjusted from time to time. In addition, ensuring that the company maintains and adheres to company policies and the highest standards of safety, health, environmental and ethical conduct are critical responsibilities for the position. While not directly responsible for field sales, the position requires collaboration with the sales team to meet overall sales and customer service objectives.

It is the responsibility of every H-E Parts International, employee to insure a safe work environment. All H-E Parts International, employees share the responsibility to insure at the end of the day we return home safely to our families. Our safe work environment value surpasses all other responsibilities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Safety & Communications

  • Ensure everyone goes home safe, every day
  • Provide clear and effective communication with all employees, peers and executive management
  • Coordinate, implement and enforce all safety, health and environmental rules, policies and regulations
  • Clearly communicate employee expectations and regularly provide formal and informal feedback regarding employee performance
  • Maintain and drive performance to achieve key metrics monitoring the performance of the business.

Quality

  • Ensure customer expectations are clearly defined, understood and regularly achieved
  • Ensure customer communication, support and product deliveries are performed on time, within budget and with the highest levels of quality
  • Ensure quality of product being supplied meets customer expectations
  • Ensure the Sales Department is supported with excellence

Operations/Production

  • Oversight of the Shop Leadership and indirectly, all machining, manufacturing, assembly and quality functions
  • Ensure repair and manufacturing procedures are documented, current, communicated and followed
  • Promote a quality culture, reducing in-house rework and customer warranties through effective root cause analysis and corrective action
  • Maintain a “LEAN” environment, continuously improving processes and reducing waste
  • Attend Production Meeting to establish, revise and communicate priorities
  • Lead all vendor negotiations to support the annual business plan
  • Promote efficient and productive interactions between external and internal customers.
  • Collaborate with Sales and Finance to develop annual budget and 5-Year forecast
  • Develop and administer KPI’s to support the Key Objectives of the operation.
  • Safeguard company assets

Purchasing & Inventory Control

  • The Operations Manager’s responsibility includes:
  • Controls are in place for effective inventory management, driving toward maximizing return on our largest investment while simultaneously meeting customer on-time delivery and contractual requirements
  • Effective controls are in place for the flow of goods into and out of inventory, allowing for accurate inventory levels.
  • Regular cycle counts, adhering to Finance Department guidance, are conducted throughout the year.

Administration

  • The Operations Manager is part of the leadership team and as such is an active participant in the other key areas of the business.
  • The Operations Manager has primary responsibility for the hiring, development and management of all staff required to operate the Leduc Branch. The quality of our workforce and their work product shall continually improve due to the Operations Manager‘s influence. Annual goals are to be developed for each employee with regular measures taken of their performance and adherence to company objectives and policies.
  • Asset management – the manager is expected to protect all company interests and assets. All capital assets acquisitions must adhere to HEPI policy, requiring appropriate approvals.
  • Effective utilization of the ERP System, with appropriate controls in place.
  • Coordinating steps to achieve ISO 9001 Certification in Leduc. .

Reporting

  • Performance Metrics – the manager has primary responsibility to meet profitability budget. A monthly operating report is to be submitted to the General Manager, detailing performance against plan and against key operating measures. It is expected that other metrics be implemented to measure key performance indicators for the business.
    • Timely execution – deadlines are regularly met due to the direct influence of the Operations Manager.

DECISION MAKING:

Position will be required to make decisions that affect the entire Leduc branch’s operations.

INTERNAL/EXTERNAL CONTACTS:

  • General Manager
  • Department Managers
  • Other H-E Parts Int’l Sales
  • Accounting, Administration
  • Warehouse team Members
  • Current & potential customers and suppliers.

QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

  • Post Secondary Degree or Diploma in Business, Sales, Engineering or Heavy Equipment Trades is preferred.
  • 10 or more years of Industry experience
  • Fluency and excellent English language skills in verbal and written formats
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office products, and current technology such as Laptops, Tablets and smartphones is required.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude or experience is considered an asset.
  • Previous experience with CRM (Salesforce preferred) and ERP systems is considered an asset.
  • Good Drivers abstract, and current Drivers License are required.
  • A valid Passport or ability to get a Passport is also a requirement.
  • A professional, ethical and exceptional work-ethic is required for the candidate.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of, but not limited to those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the accountabilities of the job. While performing the duties of this position the employee is regularly required to stand, kneel, crouch walk, and sit (including longer periods of driving and/or flying). Must be able to work in a variety of environments, work extremely busy periods with extended hours. On occasion the employee will need to handle materials weighing up to 20-40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include; close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust to focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative, but not limited to those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing duties of this position, the employee is regularly exposed to moving objects (materials) handled and transported through the job sites and in warehouses. The employee may be exposed to airborne particles, oils, gas or other dangerous goods. The employee may occasionally be exposed to sharp and abrasive edges which may result in scrapes, cuts or bruises. The employee is occasionally exposed to changing cold, hot and humid conditions. The noise level may occasionally be loud. All personal protective safety equipment should be worn to minimize dangers and exposures to potential work conditions.

SAFETY:


All employees must complete initial Safety Training. Employees must ensure compliance with all safety policies, procedures, and work practices established by H-E Parts International. Avoid any activity that creates or poses a serious hazard to themselves or others while working for H-E Parts International. Immediately bring any safety concern to your supervisor, or others designated by departmental procedures. If any employee believes that performing an assigned work task or activity may pose a serious risk to life or health, discuss the issue immediately and directly with your supervisor. Prior to operating any equipment supplied by H-E Parts International, employees are to be adequately trained, equipped, monitored, evaluated, and guided as appropriate, to comply with established safety policies, standards, and procedures.

title: Contract Manager
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 103504
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto


Our Purpose


Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.


If you want to be challenged and have a great learning experience this is the role for you.


What will your typical day look like?


We are looking for an individual to assist with the increase in the complexities associated with contractual arrangements and to manage current contracts that have been agreed to that contain elements of risk that needs to be monitored and managed to minimize risk exposure. Primary responsibility will be to manage the life cycle of complex contracts with large clients and a secondary function will include the review of request for proposal and contractual documents to make an assessment on risk and to mitigate the risk through contractual negotiations and/or establishing risk mitigation strategies.


About the team


The role will be supporting both the Consulting within Deloitte and sits within the Service Excellence team that supports practitioners on all their deal services needs. We currently have a team of 15 people and expanding. Consulting's compliment of 250+ Partners / Directors and their teams is growing rapidly.


Enough about us, let’s talk about you


You are someone who is:


  • Proficient in handling legal terms and conditions
  • Can handle managing complex contracts
  • Confident in communicating and articulating positions on contracts
  • Able to build strong relationships and confidence
  • Ability to multitask and managing conflicting priorities


Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.


The next step is yours


Sound like The One Firm. For You?


At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: title

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
Role Summary:

Ottawa Valley Meats is seeking a Purchasing Manager to develop and manage purchasing and supply chain strategies for the organization. This position will lead sourcing for equipment, goods and services to ensure lowest total cost of ownership. This position is responsible for identifying potential supplier sources, negotiating favorable supplier agreements, and managing supplier and vendor contracts. The Purchasing Manager constantly monitors company purchases to deliver best in class goods and service aligned with organization goals.

 

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Responsible for the development and formulation of long-and short-range planning, policies, programs, and objectives for the purchasing functions.
  • Managing overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of procurement for the organization.
  • Responsible for the day-to-day management of the purchasing department, including the recruitment, training and performance review of the purchasing staff.
  • Develop, lead, and execute purchasing strategies.
  • Develop strong relationships with business stakeholders and strategic supply partners to improve business.
  • Liaise with key company employees to determine their product and service needs.
  • Negotiate, maintain, and approve all related cost, pricing, payment terms, and logistics terms.
  • Identify areas for process improvement and implements best practice regarding vendor selection, evaluation, performance, reporting and controls.
  • Create policies and procedures for purchasing risk management and mitigation. Set and manage company purchasing standards for various spend types.
  • Manage supplier and internal compliance to contract terms & conditions for indirect categories.
  • Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness. Maintains measurable metrics for all levels of procurement activities.
  • Works with new vendors to assure timely set up in their system.
  • Assists co-workers on various accounting projects to help increase efficiencies and become more accurate.
  • Communicates with other employees regarding requests for information, supervisor and management team regarding any problems or issues.
  • Maintains confidentiality of financial information, pricing, customer information and other sensitive and confidential information.
  • Adheres to all company policies, standards, and procedures.
  • Direct the establishment, implementation, and maintenance of purchasing and inventory standards.

 

 

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a professional procurement function
  • Minimum 5 years’ leading a team, demonstrated coaching and developing team members experience required
  • Proven ability to lead and collaborate with internal and external teams to analyze business conditions, determine present/future needs and ensure successful and professional procurement activities
  • Strong interpersonal, negotiation, analytical, communication, negotiation and presentation skills required
  • Experience and in-depth knowledge of global supply chain process required
  • Expertise in multiple supply chain fields, experienced in taking total cost of ownership approach for decision making

 

Pay:

  • $50-$60/hour, 35 hours per week

 

Location:

  • 22 Antares Drive, Unit J, Ottawa, Ontario K2E 7Y9

 

Employment Type:

  • Full-time, permanent

 

If you hold yourself accountable and ready to make the Prime move, please send your resume to hiring.ottawavalleymeats@gmail.com.

Ottawa Valley Meats is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.
