title: Now Hiring Licensed Agents
description:
An excellent opportunity for licensed insurance agents now exists due to the growth in our company.  We need dedicated and outgoing licensed agents to learn and grow in our business. Qualified candidates will work with our executives for professional business success!
 
AIL Canada is the only 100% unionized insurance company (Proud Member of UFCW) and currently services the requests of over 48,000 Labor Unions, Credit Unions and Associations. They also work intricately with the International Union of Police Associations on the Child Safe Program - a unique effort designed to expedite the Amber Alert process and help law enforcement better serve our community. 
 
Upon hire, licensed qualified applicants receive: 
- Extensive classroom and field training
- Constant support from management and peers
- An unparalleled compensation program including weekly advance and bonus, renewals and a lifetime-vesting program.
- Company provided resources- AIL reps never have to be subjected to practices that are typical of the industry like cold-calling, solicitation or high-pressure sales. 
- Union benefits such as health care reimbursement, stock purchase program, and a union-negotiated retirement plan
 
In their first year, the average representative makes between $50K - 70K, depending on their work ethic; some even more. 
 
Our mission at AIL Canada is to protect every child and serve all working families. If you are a genuine, hard-working person who isn't looking for your typical 9-5 desk job, and would love to help take care of families, then we may have a spot for you at AIL Canada 
 
Openings are available for both F/T and P/T positions. For those seeking to own and run their own business, representatives can pursue management and the opportunity to operate their own agency immediately.
 
Contact us with your resume.

title: Account Manager, Technical Sales - Calgary Region
description:
This position is based in Calgary, Alberta

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and grow accounts for Master Flo Valve Inc. along with pursuing new customers in Calgary and surrounding area.
  • Technical sales coverage at end users, OEM’s, engineering firms, distributors, valve repair shops and Stream-Flo service centers within Calgary assigned territory. Assigned territory will likely be Southern AB and SK.
  • Primary responsibility to promote Master Flo chokes and control valves, and Stream-Flo ESDs.
  • Will be responsible for a region and accounts outside of Calgary also.
  • Solution selling for specific applications
  • Maintain existing client base and develop new contacts. Perform sales calls and follow-up as required to maintain and grow accounts in all areas of business
  • Manage allocated accounts and support with the utmost proficiency and diligence.
  • Maintain account plans to maximize the growth, communication and value delivered across all assigned accounts.
  • Accountable to sales goals set by Management
  • Develop strong product knowledge to enable clear and concise presentations to customers.
  • Develop a thorough understanding of the market, the potential customer base and the competition.
  • Ensure that proper market intelligence is done and complete details on the project conditions are supplied to inside sales (Edmonton) and the appropriate Calgary sales resource as early as possible to ensure the best efforts are made to submit the most effective proposal possible.
  • Provide input to supply management with details of market intelligence and recommendations.
  • Maintain and provide sales reports as required by the Canadian Sales Manager.
  • Provide input for monthly, quarterly and yearly booking forecasts as required.
  • Prepare and submit itineraries and expense reports in a timely fashion.
  • Represent the company at trade shows, general sales meetings and general industry functions as needed.
  • Prepare strategic project pursuit plans and update monthly or more frequently as required.
  • Make technical sales presentations utilizing the latest in computer and audio video equipment.
  • Maintaining a detailed contact database, with updates to the office administration monthly.

Qualifications:

  • Formal relevant technical education or equivalent of combined education and experience
  • Five to ten years of sales experience, preferably in the oil and gas industry
  • Knowledge/experience with chokes and control valves is highly desirable
  • Strong understanding of valve actuation and automation
  • General instrumentation background/ knowledge is preferred
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail
  • Strong focus on customer service (Internal and External)
  • Self-driven with ability to work independently (results oriented)
  • Ability to influence and persuade others to action
  • Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office and specialized database programs.
  • Knowledge of SAP is an asset
  • Knowledge of CRM systems is an asset
  • Team player with well-developed communications skills
  • H2S Alive Training, CPR Training

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements

  • Must be willing to travel within the assigned territory
  • Overnight travel will be required
  • Mid to high dexterity and mobility for handling products
  • Ability to work under pressure and to meet deadlines

Must possess a valid Alberta Driver’s License (must provide a driver’s abstract)

Master Flo offers a competitive salary, profit sharing and a comprehensive benefit program to prospective employees, as well as the opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial environment, characterized by continued growth and strong business results.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However only those candidates identified for further consideration will be contacted.

title: MTBM Procurement Director
description:
Shanghai Construction Group Canada Corporation, based in Edmonton Alberta, specializes in infrastructure projects involving tunnelling and trenchless construction methods, and is looking for a knowledgeable and experienced MTBM Procurement Director to manage all purchasing, importation, and sourcing activities related to our specialized micro-tunnel boring machines and the parts required for their upkeep and maintenance.

Position Responsibilities:

  1. Overall control of all procurement related to the Micro-tunnel Boring Machines (MTBMs) utilized by our organization (e.g. NP1500 – NP2900, TP1500 – TP2900), including the importation of custom MTBMs to meet project specifications and all related parts；
  2. Responsible for ensuring compliance with shipping and air transportation policies and customs clearance policies；
  3. Responsible for comparing and purchasing domestically manufactured and processed MTBM spare parts in Canada and ensure that any substitute parts meet the necessary specifciations
  4. Document and Analyze the MTBM operation data for spare parts inventory
  5. Provide order acknowledgements based on raw material & capacity and availability
  6. Focal point for the intercompany orders
  7. Manage the overall budget for the department, including capital expenditure plan
  8. Develop and maintain key supplier relationships to provide value to our company
  9. Accountable for contract development, negotiation, recommendations, implementation and administration of all Procurement contracts
  10. Accountable for planning, forecasting and analytics to ensure inventory and supply of equipment, materials and services arrive at the job site when needed
  11. Provide complete documentation for purchasing, contract management, supply chain policies and procedures
  12. Accountable for the research and analysis of the vendor market
  13. Provide efficient, timely and compliant procurement of services and materials in alignment with the business unit requirements and corporate/regulatory policies
  14. Accountable for timely and accurate storage, management and delivery of parts and materials to the business units as per agreed service standards
  15. Provide input to industry standards and guidelines, when relevant

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related

Language Requirement: English

Experience:

2+ years experience with procurement of micro-tunnel boring machines and related parts; 2+ years experience with handling customs clearances as well as cross-border shipping and transportation for similar types of goods and equipment.

title: Associate Director - Risk
description:
• Prepare procedures and work instructions related to risk and opportunity management
  • Assisting in developing Risk Breakdown Structure aligned with project WBS and CBS
  • Prepare risk training materials and train the project team on the principle of risk management
  • Lead and provide technical support to the management of project risk through facilitation of regular risk reviews at the project and program level
  • Maintain risk registers at the project and program level
  • Perform quantitative cost and schedule risk analysis using OPRA (Oracle Primavera Risk Analysis) as well as ARM (Active risk management) and ability to     provide the interpretation of analysis results
  • Prepare detailed project and program risk reports including P50 and P80 cost and schedule risk exposures
  • Responsible for following up with risk owners to assure the mitigation actions are on track
  • Ensure that all program team members comply with the risk management plan, procedures, requirements of the assigned scope of work
  • Reviewing Contractors progress reports and identifying the risks impacting project cost and schedule and reflect them in the risk register
  • Working closely with Lead Scheduler to prepare a high-level schedule to be used for quantitative schedule risk analysis and defining the link between risks and schedule activities
  • Working closely with Cost Lead to monitor project contingency utilization and alignment with cost risk exposures
  • Provide input to Reporting Lead for project and program level reporting


Job Requirements:
  • Minimum of 15 years of related experience
  • Experience in using industry-standard software packages and applications – Active Risk Manager (ARM), Oracle Primavera Risk Analyzer (OPRA), InEight risk management, etc.
  • Experience in using Primavera P6
  • Bachelor of Engineering or Analytical Degree/equivalent qualification
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) and Risk Management qualification is considered an asset
  • Excellent people skills and ability to communicate effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders
  • Excellent MS Office skills – Excel, Word, PowerPoint

title: Data Analyst - Procurement/Sourcing
description:
Client ID: 5391

Senior Project Control Officer

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Project Control Officer

Senior Project Control Officer – Job Description

  • Run Data Governance Process
  • Drive continued data cleanup activities in Ariba and Coupa Risk
  • Execute against business-as-usual data maintenance processes and procedures to ensure continued alignment data standards
  • Develop/implement/enhance reporting against the above – more efficiently
  • Progress tracking
  • Exception reporting

Senior Project Control Officer – Mandatory Skills

  • Advanced Excel – pivot tables, vlookups, working and matching large amounts of data
  • Proven expertise with MS Excel
  • Previous Data Analyst Exp – 2-4 years
  • Superior Analytical & Information delivery skills
  • Must be able tackle complex analyses leveraging data from various disparate sources and deliver succinct, actionable information. (Ideally SAP Ariba)
  • Knowledge of Sourcing and Procurement lifecycle – Vendor Management to align data, review and take action (quality control)
  • Proven process improvement skills

Senior Project Control Officer - Nice to Have Skills

  • Familiarity with Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) disciplines
  • Macros
  • Familiarity with SAP Ariba sourcing tool is preferred
  • Knowledge Power Bi (or similar reporting & insight delivery tools) would be a definite asset
  • Understanding of Lean Management principles would be an asset

Senior Project Control Officer - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Senior Project Control Officer - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

title: Assistant Procurement Manager
description:
• Support the Procurement Manager in the development and deployment of the Program Procurement Plans and Program-wide initiatives
  • Address and manage project and supply chain delivery issues following the defined program approach
  • Support the implementation of procurement best practices and lessons learned across the Program
  • Support the development and deployment of the updated Program Procurement Plan
  • Ensure updated Program requirements, policies, processes, and procedures are incorporated into new contracts at the Program and project levels
  • Manage and support Program-level risk mitigation strategies through the packaging of the Program requirements across the projects and/or delivery contracts
  • Manage the supplier account management and performance management process, including the collate of supplier performance at a Program level to identify issues and develop resolution measures
  • Ensure project’s responsibilities under the delivery contracts are understood and delegated to the project teams as appropriate
  • Conduct independent assurance that project teams are assuring the delivery of the required contract outputs through procurement
  • Support the planning and management of the procurement process for various tenders under the GOE PDP model, including the development of simple and complex tenders using defined program requirements
  • Assume responsibility for daily activities associated with the design, development, management, and control of procurements under the project


Job Requirements:
  • Degree or equivalent with professional work experience in the Procurement or Commercial Management disciplines
  • Minimum five (5) years’ experience managing large and complex projects
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) is considered a strong asset
  • Experience using material management software such as IFS, SAP, Oracle, BPCS and ERP and asset
  • Experience working on large Engineering and Construction projects is considered an asset
  • Should possess an in-depth knowledge of the Ontario Public Sector including but not limited to all the following areas of specialization: Construction, Information Technology, and Engineering
  • The ability to conduct procurement projects in public sector procurement
  • Understanding of various Procurement models (IPD, CCDC, DB, DBB, AFP/P3) and experience in issuing procurements to the supply chain under various models
  • Understanding in working with multiple stakeholders in the implementation, deployment, and administration of Program Procurement initiatives
  • Knowledge of Ontario contract law and its implications in the procurement process
  • Deploying and administering procurement initiatives to ensure their deployment and effectiveness in achieving improved program outcomes
  • Experience in contract development in cooperation with legal counsel and contract management
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

title: Inside Sales Manager
description:
This position is expected to be onsite in a hybrid model
As a Sales Leader you will be responsible for attracting, retaining and growing world-class sales frontline consultants.  Create a high performing sales team that consistently exceeds the expectations of employees, customers, and shareholders. You will work closely with the Sales Leadership Team and your frontline sales team to retain customers while driving growth through adoption of new products to the existing customer's portfolio of client'sa products they currently use.
 
Things you'll get to work on:
  • Build and lead a team of Sales Agents to drive exceptional customer experience and achieve revenue goals
  • Optimize the sales levers to produce the best possible close ratio
  • Support the development and execution of the sales strategy as part of the sales leadership team
  • Provide product support, sales coaching and training to the sales team
  • Conduct talent review sessions and drive a high performance culture
  • Identify, analyse and implement process improvements
  • Collaborate across world-wide to share and learn best practices
  • Collaborate with finance to ensure accurate forecasting
  • Combine data and insights
 
Skills:    
  • Seasoned sales professional with a minimum of 5 years of sales or sales leadership experience in a high tech organization
  • Track record of building high performing teams that consistently deliver for all stakeholders
  • Experience partnering across functions to lead new initiatives in service to delivering business results.
  • Track record of success working and influencing a fast-paced organization at all levels, being persuasive and effective even where no direct reporting relationship exists
  • A passionate and skilled communicator who can articulate the client's vision in a clear and compelling way that immediately generates excitement, enthusiasm and a commitment to the vision in subordinates, peers and external partners
  • A demonstrated ability to thrive in a collaborative culture that places a premium on consistently performing at the highest level in an extremely fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong presence and credibility with a reputation for unquestioned integrity and management skills that allow for instant credibility with employees, customers, and shareholders
  • A proven motivator of people with undeniable experience in rallying people, not afraid to roll up sleeves and get ingrained in work

title: Procurement Director
description:
DIRECTOR, PROCUREMENT

At Irving Personal Care, we recognize that the key to our success is our people. Irving Personal Care is the only manufacturer of baby diapers and training pants in Canada. Using state-of-the-art equipment and technology, Irving Personal Care produces premium quality private label products for major North American retailers. 

The Director, Procurement will be based out of Moncton, New Brunswick (220 Harrisville Boulevard, E1H 3N5) and will direct the organization's purchasing/procurement/sourcing function to minimize the organization's overall purchasing costs without compromising quality or reliability of supply. This role will provide leadership and direction to the development of the organization's overall sourcing strategy and initiatives while assisting in developing purchasing budgets, plans, policies, systems, and procedures that will achieve the strategic objectives. This role will be a key member/lead in evaluating and negotiating complex or strategically important supplier and vendor relationships to secure terms that are in the organization's best interest. This is a permanent, full-time position. The primary language of work is English. 

Are you an energetic individual with a Can-Do Attitude who is passionate about achieving results and driving improvement? At Irving Personal Care, our culture inspires creativity, nurtures talent, and creates an inclusive workplace. Our employees can thrive and grow their careers across our diverse operating divisions. 


Job Requirements 

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • 10+ years of relevant experience leading/managing an area of the business within the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry
  • 5+ years of personal care experience required
  • Proven track record of achieving results through influence
  • Proven experience in spend management across multiple categories
  • Manufacturing experience with supporting Accounting or Finance experience would be an asset
  • Demonstrated negotiation skills, dispute resolution skills, strong understanding of material planning and business cycle, proven ability to manage multiple projects and tasks, ability to balance internal and external expectations to achieve optimal result
     

The main duties/responsibilities of this role include:

Strategic Planning

  • Includes developing relationships with key or critical suppliers, identifying cost reduction opportunities, process improvements, and conducting market validations of current arrangements. Collaborate with suppliers to support innovation strategy.

Buying and Spend Administration

  • Ensuring that goods and services are being purchased and managed in the most cost-effective manner.

Commodity Planning

  • Responsible for sourcing and selecting suppliers; obtaining proposals and managing contract negotiations. In addition, completing proposal evaluations considering the entire supply chain costs and optimizing all associated costs.

Market Insights and Senior Management Communication:

  • Includes providing category and commodity knowledge for effective decision making. Provide input and advise senior management on issues concerning past, present and future cost trends, and other market developments.
     

Irving Personal Care is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to: 

  • A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan 
  • Employee & family assistance programs 
  • RRSP matching program 
  • Health & wellness reimbursements 
  • Product purchase program 
  • Opportunities to take part in job related training and development 
  • Growth and progression opportunities within Irving Personal Care and the larger network of the J.D. Irving group of companies 
  • Relocation costs (if applicable) 

 

To Apply for this Career Opportunity 

Please apply online at https://careers.jdirving.com/. 

For further details, please contact Recruitment at icprecruitment@irvingconsumerproducts.com  

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  

Irving Personal Care is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

At Irving Personal Care, our culture inspires creativity, nurtures talent, and creates an inclusive workplace. Our employees can thrive and grow their careers across our diverse operating divisions.', 'Ensuring that goods and services are being purchased and managed in the most cost-effective manner.', "Bachelor's Degree", 'Includes providing category and commodity knowledge for effective decision making. Provide input and advise senior management\xa0on issues concerning past, present and future cost trends, and other market developments.']

title: Associate Manager, Procurement
description:
Reference Code: ENG044443

Details and Requirements:

As Associate Manager, Procurement you will:
• Tactical oversight for performance of all aspects of Supply Chain in support of the Procurement Team.
• Directs and facilitates purchasing activity to meet schedule requirements; generates and reschedules purchase orders for sourced goods and services.
• Develop, drive, and execute purchasing projects. Must have functional and operational experience in the field of Supply Chain Management.
• Provide training/guidance related to RFQ’s, SOW’s, negotiations, adherence to policy/procedure.
• Review and approve purchase order packages as per the company policy.
• Collaboratively work with peers across the Business sector to standardize and mature purchasing management processes.
• Facilitates the supplier evaluation program and reports on all key performance indicators.
• Support and drive YoY improvement on standard metrics (i.e. OTD, Pay Terms, Red Suppliers etc.).
• Generate, communicate and keep up-to-date performance measurement reports related to the management of the supply chain and logistics;
• Assist in the management of supplier relationships and supplier performance to achieve program and customer requirement. Interacts with suppliers to ensure appropriate support and execution of deliverables as well as participate in managing supplier relationships and performance.
• Work with the assigned functional and program leaders to track and coordinate all program deliverables, highlighting key program risks and putting plans in place to mitigate those risks, providing regular reports/updates on program status.
• Write and hold mid-year and year-end performance reviews and conduct career development discussions.
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field and minimum 6 years of prior relevant experience. Or, Graduate Degree in relevant field and minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience.
• Experience in procurement, supply chain, and material management processes in an In Service Support Aerospace environ

title: Media Buyer
description:
MEDIA BUYER
 Identify, build, and manage direct relationships with a range of media partners,
platforms, and social influencers in order to facilitate paid marketing campaigns
 Manage an individual spending budget in the six-and-seven figure range and contribute
to overall team goals while maximizing efficiency against key performance indicators
(ex. CPA, CPL)
 Strategize and negotiate with media partners to obtain the most competitive rates and
help ensure the success of each individual paid media campaign
 Research and recommend trends, strategies, and marketing opportunities to ensure
campaigns are always aimed at meeting clients’ business objectives
 Work closely with account managers on ad copy and creative to ensure a compelling
and strategic approach to all paid media partnerships
 Monitor individual spend and campaign performance on a weekly basis in order to
deliver on and exceed client KPI objectives
 Analyze performance data with account managers and provide intelligent synthesis,
interpretation and appropriate action plans based on conclusions


REQUIREMENTS:
 1+ years’ experience executing and managing performance-based paid media campaigns
 1+ years’ experience in business development, sales, or marketing
 Understanding of fundamental media metrics and calculations (CPA, CPL, CPM, CPU)
 Ability to self-manage, foster, and juggle multiple partner relationships
 Ability to negotiate and think critically in pressure situations
 Ability to articulate and communicate effectively with partners and management
 Ability to create and format reports using Word, Excel, & PowerPoint
 Proficient in spoken and written English

 Extremely analytical, detail-oriented and organized
 Works well independently and as a team member

title: Senior Contract Administrator
description:
 Our Client in The Ontairo Public Sector is looking to hire a Senior Contract Administrator on a 12 month contract.

Coordinating and administering the day-to-day activities associated with corporatewide contracts for operating needs of the client
which may
include safety products, snow clearing, towing, tools, laundering for work garments,
electrical, plumbing, janitorial procurement, etc.
 Carrying out Pre-Award and Post-Award activities associated with both the tendering
and contract award phases and full contract administration of the assigned corporate
contract, in accordance with policies and departmental guidelines. Includes
collaborating with usage departments to define contract requirements, prior to tender
or amendment, and solicit for additional requirements and partnering with the designed
Sr. Sourcing Specialists to execute the required procurement activities.
 Process contract amendments, exercising available contract extensions and/or
increase in contact Upset $-Limits.
 Upload relevant contract documents to SharePoint by corporate contract.
 Ensure all changes reflected on each Cost Centre’s Corporate Contract Authorization
form is communicated to the companies in a timely fashion.
 Performing on-going maintenance of the scope of work under each corporate contract
which may include pricing revisions.
 Coordinate and chair kick-off meetings with vendors and authorized contract
clients. The Contract Specialist provides direction and guidance to user departments
and vendors by developing and updating procedures and conducting training sessions
as required.
 Documenting close-out procedures in accordance with the corporate contracts.
 Archive expired contract documents according to Record Retention policy.
 Supports PCM Major Project / Transfor

Advantages
Long Term Contract
Working in Ontario Public Sector
Hybrid Remote/Onsite
Chance to flip to full time

Responsibilities
dor Management
 Monitoring vendor delivery performance; coordinating and resolving vendor claims
(warranty, hardship, etc.) and continually monitoring vendor performance for
compliance with contract terms with respect to commercial and technical requirements.
 Conducting vendor performance and user contract assessment reviews at regular
intervals and taking corrective action to resolve/improve performance issues.
 Resolving disputes between the vendor and the user, including interpretation of
contract terms and conditions, quality issues, delivery requirements, invoicing, etc.
 Preparing Vendor Performance Reports and conducting regular meetings with
assigned vendors regarding vendor performance.

Qualifications
Source and develop potential alternative sources of supply for goods/services to
increase competition and reduce the Total Cost of Ownership. Includes recommending
optimization and strategic opportunities to management and partnering with
Stakeholders to secure required approval for potential secondary sourcing
opportunities.

Summary
Procurement and Category Management Department is looking to fulfill one position on a
temporary basis. Selected candidate will be working closely with existing contract
administrators and category manager as well as working with vendors and clients.

title: Administrateur de contrats
description:
Reference Code: ENG044561

Details and Requirements:

Le (la) titulaire du poste est responsable de l’ensemble des activités reliées aux ententes de ventes de pièces. Il doit répondre aux différentes soumissions et demandes des clients afin de générer un maximum de ventes de façon profitable pour l’entreprise. Il gère l’ensemble de ses dossiers tout en s’assurant de créer et de maintenir la satisfaction
des clients.



TÂCHES


1. Analyse et évalue les soumissions ou demandes de prix et prend les décisions relatives aux directives reçues.

Analyse et étudie les appels d’offres annuelles, complète les documents de la soumission selon les termes exigés, s’assure d’obtenir les garanties, cautionnements et police d’assurances relatifs aux appels d’offres. Complète les bordereaux de prix.

2. Recherche et identifie les produits à soumissionner et coordonne avec les autres départements pour identifier un maximum de pièces et les rendre accessibles.

3. S’assure de faire une analyse complète de tous les paramètres associés aux soumissions. Coordonne avec les autres départements afin d’optimiser notre profitabilité/disponibilité et d’assurer une conformité face aux demandes clients. Recommande les niveaux de stockage.

4. Élabore des scénarios de vente, les présentes aux clients et tente de les influencer afin d’obtenir des engagements d’achat fermes de leur part. Représente la compagnie auprès des clients et s’assure de faire un suivi sur toutes leurs demandes. Mesure leur satisfaction en les questionnant par rapport à notre performance et le service actuellement offert.

5. Analyse les résultats des soumissions, communique les résultats (au besoin) aux autres départements, et coordonne afin de mettre en place les actions nécessaires à l’exécution du contrat.

6. Effectue les rapports et suivis nécessaires à chaque étape des contrats et coordonne les actions à prendre avec le gérant régional de vente et/ou autres départements. Fait les suivis périodiques de performance de contrat
pour s’assurer des engagements

title: IT Procurement Analyst
description:
IT Procurement Analyst – our client requires an IT Procurement Analyst to support the procurement on a large-scale initiative. A full RFP procurement must be held and completed by May 1, 2023 to allow ample transition time. The resource will ensure the completion of compliant, accurate, timely, and high-quality documents. Experience in writing and working with various procurement documents in the development process is essential. 

 

Work is 100% onsite. 

 

Mandatory Requirements Include: 

  • Minimum combined years of relevant education and experience in a role similar to this. Experience must be applicable to this role. Acceptable education includes degrees, diplomas and certificates. (5 years) 
  • 3 years’ demonstrated experience providing procurement specialist services including evaluation of responses, and management of RFP and procurement processes within an large and complex environment. 
  • 3 years’ experience in public sector procurement processes including an understanding of trade agreements and competitive bid law. 
  • 3 years’ active participation in large, complex procurement(s). 
  • 4 years’ experience with procurement processes for IT solutions and services (such as PQR, RFI, RFC, RFP) in public sector. 

 

Desirable Requirements Include: 

  • 3 years’ experience in conducting or facilitating sessions with involvement from internal business units and external organizations. 
  • 3 years’ experience with contract negotiations. 

 

Est. Start Date:   Jun 1, 2022 

Est. Duration:       till Apr 30, 2023 + 1 pos. 6-months extension 

Location:                 Edmonton, Alberta 

Posting #:              54567PROCSPEC


Since 1996, Intellex has established itself as the source for providing quality consultants to both private and public sectors. Our success has led to prefer vendorship for both public and private sector organizations throughout Western Canada.  Our clients and consultants are supported by our internal staff who are experienced in both Information Technology and staffing. We are known for our responsiveness to the needs of consultants and our clients. Give us a call and experience it yourself or visit our website at www.IntellexSystems.com

 

Unless otherwise specified, ONLY candidates located in Canada or USA, and eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship will be considered.

 

For more information about Intellex, these, and other opportunities, please visit our website at http://www.IntellexSystems.com. You can also register to receive opportunities by e-mail. If you are interested in any of the above positions, please submit your resume in Word or RTF format quoting posting #(s) above.

title: Senior Director, Sales, Commercial Repair and Conversion
description:
The Sr. Director is accountable for the sales operation, revenue generation and profitability of repair and conversion at Seaspan Shipyards. This role leads the management of customer relationships by developing and securing new businesses, supervising fulfillment of contractual obligations, resolving operational issues and negotiating settlements. The role optimizes the utilization of Seaspan Shipyard’s equipment to meet customer requirements and increase profitability. This position maintains drydock planning and develops bid proposals for cases for new equipment anticipating future business needs and opportunities.

Duties and Accountabilities

  • Accountable for revenues and expenditures to achieve financial targets. Prepares annual budgets and forecasts equipment utilization, revenue, costs and profits.
  • Develops solid, long-term professional relationships with customers, prospects and industry leaders for Seaspan Shipyards. This includes identifying and pursuing new business opportunities (ship repair/refit and new ship construction) and following up with existing customers to improve service and customer value.
  • Understands customer’s business, anticipating issues and opportunities and providing innovative, cost-effective solutions to meet customer needs.
  • Owns the preparation of quotations for new business and helps negotiate major contracts.
  • Leads all aspects of contractual processes, obligations and issues, including orders, trip planning, invoicing, issues resolutions and negotiating settlements.
  • Reviews the capabilities of existing Seaspan Shipyards assets and makes recommendations for capital additions or removals ensuring fleet capabilities are well matched to customer requirements.
  • Identifies and evaluates growth/new business opportunities (ship repair/refit and new construction), by performing duties such as attending industry conferences, understanding emerging markets (domestic and international), meeting with current and new customers to discuss growth opportunities.
  • Leads the team to plan, coordinate and schedule various jobs and customer requests in a manner that improves efficiency and utilization of Seaspan Shipyards assets, ensuring strong financial returns on capital investment.
  • Works closely with the Maintenance & Repair Division to prioritize and schedule routine maintenance and repairs, ensuring high levels of asset availability and reliability while controlling costs.
  • Facilitates ongoing, regular communication with operations staff and seagoing personnel.
  • Provides input to senior management with regards to strategic planning and organizational improvement. Promotes corporate vision and acts as a role model for health and safety and other programs.
  • Represents Seaspan Shipyards on industry committees ensuring company’s interests are voiced and protected.
  • Performs additional duties as required.

Qualification Requirements

  • Diploma in relevant subject area (Business, Mechanical or Maritime Engineering preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience in marine operations, including experience in sales, customer relations, operations and contract negotiations, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 5+ years of experience in progressively senior leadership positions.

Skills, Knowledge and Competencies

  • Experience working with SalesForce is an asset.
  • Knowledge of marine transportation industry.
  • Customer focused with sound negotiation skills.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills, leading by “can-do” approach.
  • Ability to build and manage relationships as well as the management of customer accounts.
  • Leadership skills, including the ability to coach and mentor.
  • Ability to handle budgets and contracts.

 

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

title: Inside Sales Manager
description:
This position is expected to be onsite in a hybrid model
As a Sales Leader you will be responsible for attracting, retaining and growing world-class sales frontline consultants.  Create a high performing sales team that consistently exceeds the expectations of employees, customers, and shareholders. You will work closely with the Sales Leadership Team and your frontline sales team to retain customers while driving growth through adoption of new products to the existing customer's portfolio of client'sa products they currently use.
 
Things you'll get to work on:
  • Build and lead a team of Sales Agents to drive exceptional customer experience and achieve revenue goals
  • Optimize the sales levers to produce the best possible close ratio
  • Support the development and execution of the sales strategy as part of the sales leadership team
  • Provide product support, sales coaching and training to the sales team
  • Conduct talent review sessions and drive a high performance culture
  • Identify, analyse and implement process improvements
  • Collaborate across world-wide to share and learn best practices
  • Collaborate with finance to ensure accurate forecasting
  • Combine data and insights
 
Skills:    
  • Seasoned sales professional with a minimum of 5 years of sales or sales leadership experience in a high tech organization
  • Track record of building high performing teams that consistently deliver for all stakeholders
  • Experience partnering across functions to lead new initiatives in service to delivering business results.
  • Track record of success working and influencing a fast-paced organization at all levels, being persuasive and effective even where no direct reporting relationship exists
  • A passionate and skilled communicator who can articulate the client's vision in a clear and compelling way that immediately generates excitement, enthusiasm and a commitment to the vision in subordinates, peers and external partners
  • A demonstrated ability to thrive in a collaborative culture that places a premium on consistently performing at the highest level in an extremely fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong presence and credibility with a reputation for unquestioned integrity and management skills that allow for instant credibility with employees, customers, and shareholders
  • A proven motivator of people with undeniable experience in rallying people, not afraid to roll up sleeves and get ingrained in work

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.
 
Position: Purchasing Manager
Location: Burnaby, BC 
Salary: $80,000 - $110,000 per year
Status: Permanent Full-Time
Industry: Industrial/ Electrical Construction
 
Responsibilities:
 
  • Plan, collaborate, and consult with each Project Manager to ensure that the material is technically compliant, consistent with the estimate & subject to a delivery schedule 
  • Develop purchasing policies and procedures and control purchasing department budget
  • Identify vendors of materials, equipment, or supplies
  • Participate in the development of specifications for equipment, products, or substitute materials
  • Interview, hire and oversee training of staff (purchasing agents)
  • Among other duties as assigned
 
Qualifications:
 
  • 10+ years’ experience as a purchasing agent in the Electrical or construction Industry or related field
  • Formal purchasing training or education 
  • The designation Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) or registration in the program would be an asset
  • Experience with JD Edwards
  • Experience with distributor/supplier/manufacturer relationship management
  • Experience with Procurement systems
 
IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Merchandising Manager
company: Ashley Homestore Canada - The Dufresne Group
description:
Merchandising Manager Career Opportunity

Ashley HomeStore is currently seeking a MerchandisingManager for our Winnipeg West store located at 1000 St.James St.

As a Merchandising Manager, you will be responsible for maintaining at the store level the Brand’s corporate visual presentation standards and supporting the corporate marketing department as needed.

Ashley is committed to investing in our team members; we offer:

  • Comprehensive benefits plan, educational assistance program and excellent employee discounts;
  • Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Career growth and continuous development;
  • Respectful and family-oriented working environment with strong company values
  • World class training programs;
  • To work at one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies.

As the Merchandising Manager you will:

  • Implement visual presentation direction from corporate office
  • Support the corporate marketing department in the set-up of the Point of Purchase (POP) displays and other tasks as needed
  • Ensure merchandise displays are complete and maintained to the corporate visual standards
  • Maintenance of show room floor to ensure it is kept to standard
  • Maintain and update open transfer reports to ensure flow to store is in line with corporate direction
  • Responsible for Inventory Control Management as it relates to receiving, tagging, maintaining available inventory and discrepancy resolution.
  • Ensure Clearance Flow to budget is maintained
  • Supervise the workload of the visual team (Merchandiser/Porter)
  • Prepare and administer performance evaluations for assigned staff
  • Responsible for the recruitment, training, coaching, supervision and disciplining of assigned staff

As a successful candidate you will have the following:

  • High school diploma
  • Minimum two years’ experience in retail visual presentation.
  • Demonstrated ability for design, balance and colour
  • Able to work independently
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Good computer skills with working knowledge of Microsoft Office products and ability to learn in-house computer programs
  • Able to work retail hours (weekdays, evenings and weekends)
  • Some travel may be required
  • Criminal background check will be required

Plan Your Future With Us!

Apply Now!

Ashley HomeStore welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Director, Enterprise Strategic Sourcing and Procurement
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (â€˜DHCâ€™) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

As a senior leader within the Supply Chain Management and Logistics organization, the Director, Enterprise Strategic Sourcing and Procurement will provide leadership in all aspects of De Havillandâ€™s Enterprise Strategic Sourcing & Procurement. The successful candidate will be an effective leader, collaborator, and strategic thinker with the ability to align the business needs to supply chain strategy, focused on operational effectiveness, efficiency, and sustainable continuous improvement.

 

Location

This position will be located on-site in Calgary, AB, Toronto, ON, or Victoria, BC.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

This role will be accountable for the development of an overall strategic plan for Enterprise Strategic Sourcing with optimization programs focused in key areas and specific performance measures aligned to support business improvements. The utilization of lean best practices, service optimization, and value will be a critical and measurable success factor of this role. The Director, Strategic Sourcing & Procurement will be responsible for developing and creating a high performing team that is highly skilled, diverse, and inclusive.

This position will require Enterprise level execution and sustainment of the following areas:

Sourcing Processes and Compliance

  • Develop a Enterprise Sourcing, Contracting & Procurement policy with aligned and defined standards, process maps, and accountabilities.
  • Create a compliance reporting methodology to drive desired outcomes and compliance for policies, internal control standards and business processes.
  • Establish a New Product Introduction and organization absorption process.
  • Implement a SRM (Supplier Relationship Management) program for critical suppliers.
  • Implement a Contract Management System (CMS) throughout all units within De Havilland.
  • Implement IFS (ERP) throughout all supply chain operations within De Havilland.

Contracting / Procurement

  • Oversee all procurement processes in support of direct and indirect goods and services, maintenance support, and other procurement activities as required, and execute the strategic procurement plan.
  • Establish a formal action driven contract review process for consolidation, synergy and leverage value.
  • Establish a formal action driven process of the Enterprise portfolio is analyzed for cost/ service improvement.
  • Establish a formal cost improvement / cost mitigation program with reporting aligned with the Finance organization.
  • Provide leadership and oversite for all make vs buy decisions.
  • Collaborate closely with S&OP stakeholders (Enterprise material requirements planning, material management, New Product Introduction (NPI) /R&D, etc.) to ensure consistent/optimal contracting and procurement execution and planning effectiveness.
  • Establish and implement ongoing supplier KPIs for performance evaluation of the supply base.
  • Lead, inspire, mentor, and motivate employees to drive optimal performance and maintain strong morale.

Category Management

  • Provide guidance to procurement teams, ensuring supplier adherence to commitments and contractual obligations with respect to quality and performance are met.
  • Centralize procurement data and develop supplier/category intelligence.
  • Develop category specific sourcing strategies to optimize De Havillandâ€™s supplier base addressing material availability, efficiencies, and cost.
  • Develop optimal contracting strategy and supplier development/consolidation recommendations in support of business unit and corporate objectives.
  • Lead strategic Enterprise-wide supplier negotiations (Master Service Agreements) and RFP processes as required to support material or service requirements, capture savings and deliver planned cost reduction targets across focus categories.
  • Establish a flexible, standardized Supplier Business Review process for management of supplier spend, cost reduction targets, and scorecard metrics including on-time-delivery, product quality, capacity, security of supply and technology capability assessments.
  • Collaborate with NPI / Engineering/ Technical services to provide continuous improvement for all SCM aspects of product lifecycle management and supplier quality.
  • Collaborate closely with NPI / Engineering/ Technical services to maintain updated knowledge of future project needs to forecast and manage potential Supply Chain impacts and identify new supplier requirements in a timely manner.
  • Monitor market trends to ensure supplier capacity, identify supply risks, and drive cost reduction opportunities.
  • Liaise and coordinate supply activities across De Havilland, contributing to Enterprise-wide supply chain and supply base initiatives.

Continuous Improvement

  • Lead the implementation of best practices related to Sourcing & Procurement.
  • Evolve the organization to optimize resource effectiveness across Procurement and Contracting in support of Enterprise wide Direct and Indirect procurement needs and standardization initiatives.
  • Establish strong consistent linkages with the materials management and NPI teams at all levels.
  • Develop and implement employee training, development, and mentoring programs for Strategic Sourcing & Procurement teams.
  • Build the framework and execute programs related to succession planning, personnel training, performance management, growth, and transition for all SCM contracting and procurement roles.

Business Reporting

  • Establish monthly /quarterly updates on all key aspect of responsibilities defined above.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • University degree, graduate degree, or additional supply chain specific designation or MBA. Equivalent industry experience may be considered.
  • Minimum 20 years of experience across supply chain sourcing, contracting, procurement, strategic supplier management, manufacturing, and NPI within a commercial setting coupled with strong business acumen is required.

 

Experience

  • Senior leadership experience at the Director or General Manager level, leading multiple levels of reports across geographies with a demonstrated track record of tangible results.
  • Experience with the implementation of policy and governance.
  • Experience with driving continuous improvement.
  • Demonstrated experience in building high performing teams through employee engagement, development, training, and mentorship.
  • Ability to develop and monitor budgets.
  • International experience with supplier development and management.

 

Skills

  • Willingness to adapt to changing business culture and corporate objectives.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to influence and confidently deliver messages using simple language or to simplify complex messages.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess the importance of tasks and decisions and set priorities, focusing time/energy on the most important issues/opportunities.
  • Ability to build effective relationships and interact with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Solution and detail- oriented, customer service focus, and positive â€œcan doâ€ team attitude to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Strong negotiating and influencing skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead a team through change, as well as to promote personal and professional development among subordinates.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Vendor Marketing Manager - Microsoft (Remote Contract)
description:
*This is slated to be a 12 month contrac

Overview:

  • Key responsibility of this role is to support the attainment of revenue and profit goals of the company.

  • Vendor provided marketing funds are a critical tool in creating differentiation for Tech Data in the marketplace.

  • Through the execution of programs, events and communications- marketing activities have a substantial impact on the company’s profitability.

  • Vendor Marketing managers will be responsible for the attainment of marketing revenue and profit goals of assigned vendors and product lines through the successful design, sale, execution and administration of marketing vehicles while ensuring the maximum utilization of available Co-op and MDF, and vendor satisfaction with programs.

  • Inter and cross-departmental co-operation with stakeholders will be a critical factor in the success of this role.

  • Vendor Marketing managers will develop, sell, execute and manage custom marketing programs for their assigned vendor base through the use of standard project management methods. They must ensure that all projects are entered online correctly, and that billing and marketing planning reports are completed accurately and on time.

  • VMs also maintain a monthly report showing activities for each vendor.

  • Vendor Marketing managers provide all aspects of on-site event logistics and support of single-vendor projects from beginning to end, including registration, greeting attendees, on-site issue resolution, tear down and hosting vendor attendees.

  • In the case of multi-vendor projects and events, the VM will perform all the same duties, as required by the project owner. In multi-vendor events, the VM will also host any vendor attendees. Vendor Marketing managers are responsible for and accountable to the budget of each of their programs and events, and must adhere to all company guidelines regarding the spending of co-op/MDF and company funds.

  • Vendor Marketing managers are responsible for all aspects of proof of performance, including running of reports to demonstrate the effectiveness and impact of marketing programs for their assigned vendors.

  • Vendor Marketing managers are a key contact point for the vendor within Tech Data Canada, and so act as a liaison to other departments in the company.

  • Vendor Marketing managers may be required to prepare content and present to both internal and external clients on a regular basis. The Vendor Marketing managers may have to attend off-site meetings and events.

  • Some travel may be required (domestic and international).

Essential Duties & Responsibilities Required :

  • Selling marketing vehicles/program

  • Design, implement and execute vendor programs and events

  • Negotiate, track, maximize Co-op/MDF

  • Communication of programs to internal/external customers

  • Ensure successful closure (bill, POP) of programs and projects

  • Performs other duties as assigned by Manager

  • Provide back-up support for peers as necessary

Qualifications, Required Knowledge Skills & Abilities and Working Conditions:

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

  • The requirements listed below are representative of the specialized or technical knowledge, skills and related experiences.

  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Knowledge/Skill/Ability:

Preferred Educational level:

  • University Degree

University Degree Specialties/Major Subjects:

  • Business, Business/Marketing

Type of work experience:

  • Purchasing/Sales/Marketing Within a distribution environment

Years of experience in the industry:

  • 3-5 years 5+Other

Related experiences:

  • Customer service skills

  • Strong communication skills both oral and written

Additional skills:

  • Computer literate w/ strong organizational skills

Sales skills

  • Project and event management skills

  • Computer literate with sharp analytical abilities

Special Training Required:

  • Marketing or Business related courses

  • The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned as needed.

Job Dimensions:

  • Sales – quarterly product revenue and marketing revenue targets

  • Profitability –product and marketing profit

Working Conditions:

  • Continuous Sitting and/or standing in the same location

  • Standing and/or walking in the same location

  • Lifting or handling material of moderate weight

  • Concentrated attention to multiple tasks

  • Located in a comfortable indoor area

  • Exposure to factors such as temperature extremes, moving machinery, noise and fumes

  • Exposed to pressure from deadlines

  • Work is repetitious or unchanging

Cultural Competency Requirements:

  • Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

title: Senior Proposal Manager
description:
Altasciences is a forward-thinking, mid-size contract research organization offering pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies a proven, flexible approach to preclinical and clinical pharmacology studies, including formulation, manufacturing and analytical services. For over 25 years, Altasciences has been partnering with sponsors to help support educated, faster, and more complete early drug development decisions. Altasciences’ integrated, full-service solutions include preclinical safety testing, clinical pharmacology and proof of concept, bioanalysis, program management, medical writing, biostatistics, and data management, all customizable to specific sponsor requirements. Altasciences helps sponsors get better drugs to the people who need them, faster.

title: Senior Manager, Workforce & Vendor Network Management
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly. 

The Senior Manager, Workforce & Vendor Network Management will be responsible for the performance management of our vendor network as well as day-to-day delivery service level performance across our internal and external servicing teams.

This Senior Manager will lead a team of WFM Analysts and Vendor Managers in monitoring and supporting the real time operations across various contact centers ensuring that Affirm delivers best in class service while performance measures are met or exceeded.

Workforce Management

The Workforce Management team ensures we have a sufficiently staffed network of agents supporting customer interactions. This team will determine staffing models based on the forecasted volume, drive scheduling and monitor real time service level performance. The overall goal is to meet the service level targets by managing the forecast accuracy and the adherence against the schedule.

Vendor Network Management

The Vendor Management team ensures strong performance management across our network of vendor partners, operational readiness meeting growth and scale requirements, as well as driving excellence in our front line servicing execution. This team takes partnership to a new level through its ability to work with the vendors to drive optimal business outcomes.

What You'll Do

  • Responsible for service level management and resource administration across all servicing teams, acting as a single point of contact for the WFM structure for Affirm senior leaders and our Vendor Partners.
  • Lead all aspects of intra-day management of scheduling procedures, analysis of real time workload requirements and case routing, & manage performance in line with critical metrics.
  • Drive effectiveness of the WFM through ongoing process analysis and redesign, and support of key internal optimization projects.
  • Lead cross functional meetings that recap current performance, trends in other performance drivers (Volume, AHT, occupancy, Adherence / Compliance, etc.), root cause analysis of service failures, and drive accountable parties for results against related action plans.
  • Generate and use performance data and analysis to propose improvements, generating cost efficiencies and enabling a culture of thoughtful planning, open and clear communication
  • Conduct analysis of assigned queues to identify opportunities to improve service level, cost, and employee happiness. Develop recommendations and articulate strategies effectively to cross functional partners.
  • Drive performance excellence in our outsourced partners through cultivating and maintaining strong relationships, establishing standards and guidelines for our partners, and driving accountability to key performance indicators
  • Ensure two-way open communication throughout the servicing organizations. This includes keeping key partners informed of any real-time impactors (spike in volumes, outages, etc.) and providing recommendations on mitigating the impact
  • Drive employee engagement and a high-performance culture within the team, ensuring effective performance management, coaching, and development of the team and creating an environment where people can excel through accountability, support, and empowerment

What We Look For

  • 7+ years experience in Workforce Management, Vendor Management, and/or Planning and people leadership experience.
  • A strong communicator, motivator, and decision-maker with demonstrated ability to work effectively with people at all levels
  • Previous experience bringing maturity to an early-stage WFM program
  • Self-starter with strong sense of urgency and accountability who has excellent focus on attention to detail with the capability to work and make decisions in a fast paced environment
  • Proven flexibility in fast paced environments where priorities may change quickly and
  • Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to evaluate and solve problems incorporating multiple perspectives.
  • Ability to make, articulate and implement data-driven decisions
  • Experience with leading workforce management tools and methodologies
  • Experience with workforce planning in an omni-channel, multi-skilled agent environment
 

Location - Remote Canada

#LI-Remote

Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia.  Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account. 

[Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorados Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of waysnot just candidates who check all the boxes.
 
Inclusivity:

At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and thats why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2021 DEI Report.

We also believe Its On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

title: Procurement Metrics Advisor
description:
Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.
Strategic Procurement (SP) is comprised of several Category Management teams and a Centre of Excellence (COE). The successful candidate will report to the Manager, Strategic Procurement, Centre of Excellence who has responsibility over Knowledge Management (KM), Data Analytics, Line Maintenance, Governance and Compliance, and Sustainable Procurement within SP. Given the cross-functional nature of procurement at Air Canada, this opportunity will also provide visibility to key stakeholders in other parts of the organization.
In COE, activities are often project-based, providing variety, exposure to different parts of the business with the opportunity to continually develop the skills necessary to progress to senior sourcing roles. The successful candidate will be expected to translate a passion for learning into meaningful analysis and insight resulting in bottom-line impact.
The Procurement Metrics Advisor will be responsible to analyze, report and maintain all Source-to-Pay data. He/she will focus on process improvement, data analytics, KPIs reporting as well as reports automation and standardization. These projects and initiatives are highly visible ‘enablers’ for the SP department and are often mandated by AC’s Leadership. Examples from the past two years include: streamlining of the contract process, contributing to the configuration and testing of the SAP Ariba Suite modules, developing and calculating departmental Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), conducting the annual refresh of the SP ‘Historic Spend Report’ (HSR), developing and delivering training, etc. Additionally, the successful candidate will have to support complex and data-heavy sourcing initiatives led by SP Category Managers.
  • Develop data analytics and support Governance
    • Produce consistently accurate qualitative and quantitative analysis
    • Produce regular reports, data models and key deliverables
    • Contribute to defining Source-to-Pay (S2P) and Sustainable Procurement KPIs and identify relevant performance analysis data
    • Create and maintain reports/dashboards that allow users to understand SP’s performance compared to internal benchmarks and non-compliance to SP policies
    • Monitor and measure S2P and ESG KPIs and performance metrics
    • Generate insights and provide recommendations to Category Managers and AC Senior Management to inform and support effective decision making
    • Automate creation of reports and dashboard by leveraging technology (using tools such as Power BI)
    • Develop subject-matter expertise in assigned areas of focus
    • Provide ad hoc reporting and analysis as needed
  • Lead the automation and steady-state of Spend Analysis
    • Create a plan to automate spend Analysis in conjunction with the IT team.
    • Lead the IT Data Analytics team by providing guidance on the vision and coordinating with all stakeholders involved to ensure they can create the automated data flow
    • Automate spend enrichment and analysis dashboards for monthly refresh of Spend Analysis
    • Mine opportunities through Spend Analysis
    • Measure and report on contract Meta Data
    • Leverage power BI to trigger reports & visualize spend data
  • Enhance tools and systems and provide support to users within SP
    • Lead process or reporting improvement initiatives to increase SP’s efficiency
    • Collaborate with the Manager, Procurement Platforms for the deployment and updates of SAP Ariba Source-to-Pay (S2P) modules
    • Responsible to organize, manage, maintain and create Procurement Master Data (for example for Ariba S2P modules and Spend Analysis)
    • Become Ariba Spend Analysis SME and collaborate with IT to configure and feed it
    • Contribute to testing requirements including the preparation of test scenarios and test scripts and provide effective user acceptance testing (UAT) according to business needs
    • Responsible to develop and document data policies, rules, responsibilities, and data management processes and provide technical assurance for its ongoing implementation
    • Mentor and train other team members and/or develop training material to transfer knowledge
    • Perform any other tasks related to the maintenance of SP Procurement Systems and tools
  • Support sourcing initiatives and the corporate procurement process
    • Prepare complex category baseline
    • Develop and use models to consolidate and analyze supplier RFx responses
    • Author project summary documentation, using spreadsheets (Excel) and graphs, tables, etc. (PowerPoint)
    • Establish category knowledge by reviewing historical spend and buying practices
    • Coach KM analysts to increase their ability to analyse large and complex data sets
    • Perform any other Procurement related duties as assigned

  • University degree in a relevant field of study (business, math, engineering)
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a similar role with hands-on data analysis
  • Ability to analyze unstructured data, creating intuitive, informative reports and visualizations
  • Ability to adapt to multiple data management platforms, as well as manipulate and combine multiple data sources and present insights
  • Must be detail oriented, self-motivated and time efficient
  • Ability to work well with a multi-disciplinary team of professionals
  • Strong organizational skills are essential
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills plus the ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and accommodate changing priorities. A strong entrepreneurial spirit and desire to learn will also be critical
  • Knowledge of Power BI
  • Experience with Source-to-Pay SAP Ariba solutions is an asset
Due to the confidential nature of our work, a high degree of professionalism and discretion is required. Flexibility with work hours may also be necessary.
Conditions of Employment:
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.
  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required
Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion
Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will report to the Director of Contracts, Traditional Accounts, Business Aircraft, and lead all contract activities following execution of new aircraft purchase agreements through to contract closeout. More specifically, you will:

  • Support aircraft delivery objectives by providing ongoing commercial and/or legal support to internal and external customers;
  • Support and manage aircraft purchase payment inflow objectives by overseeing the contractual payment schedule, invoicing customers in accordance therewith and ensuring appropriate follow-through to successful and timely receipt of funds;
  • Drive business results by anticipating risks and, in concert with internal stakeholders, initiate creative and effective mitigation plans to protect aircraft delivery schedules as well as payment inflows;
  • Lead negotiations and draft an array of contractual documents including amendments, assignments, escrow agreements, letter agreements and service agreements;
  • Engage with management to raise unresolved contractual risks in a timely way;
  • Liaise with internal stakeholders, including Deal Management, Sales, Legal Services, Finance, Tax, Risk Management, Program Management and Customer Account Management to ensure rigorous contract compliance and adherence to corporate policies, all while delivering an exceptional customer experience;
  • Serve as key resource to the business and internal stakeholders on complex matters and critical issues related to the interpretation, analysis and execution of and under the aircraft purchase agreement;
  • Initiate correspondence to customers in accordance with the purchase agreement and ensure appropriate follow-up;
  • Participate in customer meetings as well as departmental and program reviews, as required; and,
  • Contribute to process improvement and governance activities related to the functions of the department.

You may be required to occasionally travel and work extended hours during peak business periods.


Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have a Bachelor’s degree in Law, or Commerce, Business Administration or equivalent.
  • You have strong business acumen combined with at least five (5) years of contract drafting, negotiation and/or contract management experience.
  • You have strong interpersonal and communication skills and can advocate with confidence and diplomacy.
  • You have excellent analytical, organizational and time-management skills.
  • You take initiative, make sound decisions and are detail oriented.
  • You show strong leadership and have the ability to work autonomously with minimal direction.
  • You thrive in a deadline-driven, results-oriented environment and have the flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing priorities.
  • You have a high level of proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of Salesforce.com application would be an asset.
  • You are bilingual in French and English. Knowledge of a foreign language would be an asset.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.
