title: Advance Sourcing Manager
description:
At Flex, we welcome people of all backgrounds. Our employees thrive here by living our values: we support each other as we strive to find a better way, we move fast with discipline and purpose, and we do the right thing always. Through a respectful, inclusive and collaborative culture, a career at Flex offers the opportunity to make a difference, invest in your career growth and join our purpose -- to make great products that create value and improve people’s lives.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Director of Supply Chain Management the WD134416 Advance Sourcing Manager will be based in Markham, Ontario . Create and implement a global advance sourcing strategy aligned with business segments and global commodity material management objectives.

Here is a glimpse of what you’ll do…

  • Work with a multi-disciplinary team.
  • Create and implement a global advance sourcing strategy aligned with business segments and global commodity material management objectives.
  • Engage in the early Design phases and guide all stakeholders on the selection of suppliers, technologies and components for Design led projects to create value for Flex and our customers
  • Drive strategic procurement initiatives to maximize cost reduction and supplier performance.
  • Consolidate input from commodity managers, site materials management, and personal efforts for consolidated program sourcing documents that maximize flexibility and maintain cost to performance targets both internally and externally.
  • Support Design Services Procurement Manager (DSPM) activities for new programs for specific Global customers. Provide forward price projections, as required.
  • Direct interaction with Business Development and Global Account Management team members in assisting with customer meetings, escalations, and provide support in the sales cycle.
  • Identify JDM/ODM sourcing risks and implement adequate mitigation strategies.

Here are a few of our preferred experiences/competencies…

  • BS in Electrical, Electronic Engineering or equivalent (Preferred)
  • 5+ years of experience of related experience or Automotive industry
  • Detail Oriented and excellent organization skills
  • Demonstrated attention to detail in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Extensive customer interfacing skills are required. Presenting, meeting with customers, managing escalations, as needed
  • Tactical experience in management in supply chain.
  • Effective communication, negotiation, and leadership skills
  • Experience in manufacturing, technology, management consulting or other related industries
  • Exceptional collaboration, team building, and communication skills with prior experience with global teams.
  • Strong critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills and able to exercise mature judgement.
  • Experience working with NPI and implementing strategies.

Here are a few examples of what you’ll get for the great work you provide:

  • Medical, dental and vision benefits; option of basic or enhanced plan
  • Life Insurance
  • RRSP
  • PTO – paid time off
  • Most roles allow for flexible work schedules
  • Access to learning content – everything from project management to interpersonal skills to Lean concepts
  • Personal Spending Amount of $300 for wellness, ex: gym membership, fitness classes, etc.

KT36

Job Category

Global Procurement & Supply ChainFlex is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the recruitment process. Please advise us of any accommodations you may need by e-mailing: accessibility@flex.com.

title: Procurement Officer
description:
The Officer, is mainly responsible for fulfilling requests for external consultant services and other tasks associated with consultants' contractual management. Also, fulfilling non-complex procurement process requests for goods and services and daily procurement requests, in consideration of approved guidelines, directives and policies.
Job Description/Roles
  • Process and execute purchases with an understanding of the requirements to ensure optimal value is obtained by BDC, in consideration of approved guidelines, directives and policies.
  • Manage the external consultant requests by identifying and analyzing the business needs of internal clients, sourcing firms, coordinating the selection, negotiation and drafting of agreements as per established guidelines.
  • Manage and maintain all the consultant's contractual information.
  • Manage the reporting regarding the consultant requests for all the KPIs and regular meetings.
  • In collaboration with the manager, Procurement, provide advice and accompany internal clients in their procurement process for specific acquisitions, in compliance with approved guidelines and policies:
    • Prepare documentation relevant to the procurement process in accordance with the nature of the products and services required (RFI, RFQ, RFP, etc., including descriptions of services, instructions to participants, price matrix).
    • Identify potential suppliers and evaluation criteria.
    • Analyze and compare proposals and participate in evaluation committees.
    • Negotiate so as to obtain the best performance at the best price while ensuring the quality and consistency of products and services.
    • Prepare recommendations for grants.
    • Negotiate and draft contracts with the support of the technical, legal, tax, security and any other department required, based on the nature of the services.
    • Ensure that documentation of contract terms, vendor performance, etc., is made available and is regularly updated.
    • Ensure that the proper support, advice and a high level of customer service is provided to internal stakeholders.
  • Keep abreast of public procurement trends, as well as the Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) and Shared Services Canada (SSC) standing offers and align the right procurement method (leveraging public agreements, when possible) to meet internal partners' needs and expectations.
  • Adhere to BDC's processes, directives and policies, and escalate non-compliance concerns as required.
  • Provide support to other team members when required.
  • Perform any other task related to his or her position.
Requirements:

Professional Experience

  • Minimum of two years' relevant experience

Educational Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, supply chain or equivalent experience

Knowledge and Skills

  • A team-oriented, self-motivated person
  • Diligence, self-reliance, and concern for efficiency
  • Customer orientation
  • Ability to quickly adapt to change
  • Above-average problem-solving skills
  • Proficient typing
  • Organizational and time management abilities
  • Good drafting skills
  • Proficiency in other Microsoft Office tools
  • Bilingualism
MANDATORY: Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19
Acosys Consulting Services thanks all applicants. Please be advised that only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. If interested, please forward a copy of your resume by email to: e.petrini-woolley@acosysconsulting.com

Acosys Consulting applies the principles of employment equity and invites women, indigenous people, members of visible and ethnic minorities and persons with disabilities to submit their application and expressly mention their group membership status.

title: Contracts Coordinator
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Join our NRB Modular Solutions team, where our people are driven by a desire to innovate, do social good, and move construction forward.

As a Contracts Coordinator, reporting to the Manager, Contract, you will be part of the team responsible for the administration and management of all contracts for all the divisions of NRB and ensures Corporate policies governing contracts are adhered to. As part of the Contract Administration team, you will also be responsible for communicating contractual terms to multiple client groups within the organization to enable adherence to the terms and conditions of contracts.

Your work will include:

  • Prepare, review and evaluate contracts, contract amendments and change orders.
  • Working with the Modular Solutions team, administer, manage and ensure compliance of all Modular Solutions contracts with clients, vendors and business partners.
  • Working with Corporate Legal, develop requisite offers of credit, security registrations and other contractual securities and ensure proper registration.
  • Serve as the point of contact for clients on contractual matters, acting as Modular Solutions contractual representative, ensuring timely review, approval and reconciliation of variations, changes and claims.
  • Prepare and issue letters, memoranda, and approval documents related to contractual manners.
  • Reconcile and report on all invoicing as per the contract
  • Collaboratively work with Sales and Operations teams to find solutions regarding challenges or issues with the administration of contracts.
  • Track key performance indicators for reporting to leadership team
  • Maintain a general sense and knowledge of industry activities in order to advise/consult on contract related issues.
  • Identify continuous process improvements

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Hybrid work arrangements because we care about work life balance!
  • A place where people matter, not only at work but in the community
  • Job security as we are in growth mode
  • Benefits coverage starts on your first day
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader

Follow NRB Modular Solutions on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in a contracts administration position is required.
  • 3 to 5 years commercial/business in an entrepreneurial environment would be an asset.
  • Accounting and/or legal experience would be an asset.
  • Intermediate to advanced skills in the use of the MS Office suite.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
About the Company:

We pride ourselves on being a down-to-earth organization with serious commitment to building things right. As a leading general contractor of mixed-use, residential, commercial, and special projects, we have become one of British Columbiaâ€™s largest construction companies with notable â€˜Canadaâ€™s 2021 Kincentric Best Employersâ€™  award and current employees in the  â€™40 Under 40 in Canadian Constructionâ€™  list. With clear purpose and principles, we are an organization that is cultivating dedication and growth in our people, clients, and communities. Learn about what we do from our current and up-coming projects  here.

 

About the Role:

Axiom Builders is looking to bring on a Purchasing Manager to join the growing team. You will work directly with our project teams to ensure the timely delivery of materials and services across our construction sites. The successful candidate has a passion for construction and is able to support our Superintendents and Project Managers in sourcing the right material for the job and is able to build and maintain relationships with our vendors. Key responsibilities include:  

  • Create, track, and expedite material requests in a timely manner;
  • Work with Accounts Payable and Vendors to resolve invoice discrepancies;
  • Own the central purchasing function and continue to support the successful execution of projects;
  • Build long-term relationships with internal stakeholders, and suppliers;
  • Communicate proactively and regularly with Superintendents and Project Managers on upcoming purchasing needs;
  • Travel to sites when required.

 

What you Bring:

The ideal Purchasing Manager has a balanced background in both high-rise construction and construction materials. You bring a problem-solving mindset. You are eager to learn from our experts and leaders to become the best in the industry. You are a determined individual who values ownership and accountability within a growing team.

 

Required Skills and Experience

  • Two to three (2-3) years of construction purchasing and material management experience in a high-volume, fast-paced environment;  
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and exceptional ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders;  
  • Experience using Microsoft Office;
  • High-rise residential, commercial and mixed-use construction experience within the local market will be considered an asset.

 

Your Rewards

We are not only committed to the growth of the business, but also to the success and development of our people. We recognize that people are the drivers behind our success, and we provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

 

At Axiom Builderâ€™s, we offer a competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage:  Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost;
  • RRSP Matching Program: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your salary;
  • Professional Development and Education Support: We are keen on internal growth and development, which is why we are excited to fully support you in your pursuit of achieving further education;
  • Company Development: Our annual development conference that is hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts;
  • Leadership Development: Our proprietary Leadership Development program designed to support your continued growth, development and leadership capabilities.

 

Whatâ€™s Next

We are always on the lookout for talented people who are passionate about what they do. If you want to love what you do, and believe that with the right tools and opportunities you can grow with us, simply add your resume through our Careers Portal or email:

careers@axiombuilders.ca

to join our incredible team.  While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

 

Follow us on our LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition Team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.

title: Lead, Procurement
description:
Lead, Procurement



Description



L3 Technologies MAS, located in Mirabel (QC) , is a subsidiary of L3Harris Technologies, Inc.



As Lead, Procurement at L3 MAS you will:



+ Be responsible for plans and implements activities related to the procurement of goods and services, follows up on all awards through completion of order.

+ Negotiates with suppliers and analyzes suppliers’ operations to determine factors that affect prices and to determine lowest cost consistent with quality, reliability, and ability to meet required schedules.

+ Reviews proposals, negotiates prices, selects or recommends suppliers, analyzes trends, and maintains necessary records.

+ May prepare request for proposals (RFP) and bid packages.

+ Negotiates and settles with suppliers regarding damage claims, rejections, losses, return of materials, over-shipments, cancellations and engineering changes.

+ Follows applicable anti-corruption ethics, laws, and regulations.



The Lead, Procurement is a subject matter expert with comprehensive knowledge of job area and in-depth knowledge of project management. Manages large, complex project initiatives of substantial importance to the organization with minimal oversight or direction.



+ Communicates within and outside of the organization to explain and influence changes to practices, processes and approaches.

+ Makes significant improvements in processes, systems, or products. Provides input into new products/processes and implements operational plans that have measurable impact on business or functional results.



Essential Functions:



+ Nature of Supervision : Work is guided by individual annual goals and objectives with minimal oversight or direction. Frequently responsible for providing guidance, coaching and training to other employees across the Company within area of expertise. Frequently responsible for managing large, complex project initiatives of strategic importance to the organization, involving large cross-functional teams.

+ Communication & Influence : Communicates within and outside of the organization which include customers or vendors. Works to influence others to accept individual or team’s views or practices and changes to concepts, practices and approaches. Communicates with leadership regarding matters of importance to the functional or business area. May conduct briefings with leaders.

+ Innovation & Complexity : Work consists of making significant improvements of processes, systems, solutions, or products to enhance performance of job area. May develop new concepts or standards. Opportunities for problem solving and innovation are undefined, where information is difficult to obtain. Conducts extensive investigation to understand root cause of problems. Problems span a wide range of difficult and unique issues across the function and/or business area.

+ Organizational Impact : Implements strategic goals established by leadership. Establishes operational plans for job area with short-term impact on results (e.g., less than 1 year). Provides input into new products, processes, standards and/or operational plans that will have measurable impact on the achievement of overall function or business results.



Qualifications



Qualifications:



+ Requires comprehensive level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.

+ May have in-depth knowledge of project management.

+ Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 9 years of prior relevant experience.

+ Graduate Degree and a minimum of 7 years of prior related experience.

+ Bilingual (French & English).



Operational requirements:



+ Must be eligible for registration to the Controlled Goods Program ;

+ Must be eligible to obtaining and maintaining the government of Canada’s “Reliability” status and Level 2 (Secret) security clearance;

+ Location not accessible via public transportation, car required.



L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue, 48,000 employees and customers in more than 100 countries. L3Harris.com



L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do.



At L3 MAS you will:



+ Contribute to the continuous improvement of the company and be recognized for your impact;

+ Enjoy a flexible work schedule allowing you to conciliate work-life balance;

+ Participate in gathering sports and social activities organized by the staff for the staff;

+ Have access to exclusive on-site services such as massotherapy, cafeteria with outdoor patio, fitness and language classes, seasonal tire change, annual vaccination clinic, charging stations for electric vehicles and more;

+ Benefit from a Comprehensive Employee Benefits Package, including a customizable group insurance plan that fits your needs and lifestyle, and a Group RRSP with contribution match-up.



L3 Harris Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. L3Harris is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or other related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, provincial or local laws. L3Harris maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law.



_We thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted._



Primary Location CA-Quebec-Mirabel



Schedule: Full-time



Shift: Day - 1st



Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time



Organization: Division L3 MAS
Req ID: 115835

title: Director, Procurement - Aluminum
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing! If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co.

We are seeking a Director, Procurement - Aluminum to join our team in a Remote capacity. 

Here is some of what we have to offer:

  • Paid vacation and an annual bonus
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Pension plan with company match
  • Opportunity for fast advancement and career growth 

Reporting to the VP of Aluminum Procurement, this role will support Aluminum procurement activities, more specifically the development and execution of supplier strategy, cost negotiations and savings, contract management, procurement analytics etc. The incumbent will also develop strong internal customer focus and collaborate with internal stakeholders to meet or exceed external customer expectations.  

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Integral part of the Aluminum commodity procurement team, develops solid understanding of Aluminum commodity business in support of service center and manufacturing business units.
  • Assisting branches / regions source material and providing information regarding corporate sourcing strategies.
  • Evaluates import procurement opportunities and presents options to regions and branches to secure lower cost materials.
  • Leads cost reduction initiatives associated with various cost drivers such as freight and mill extras.
  • Supports new sales/business development initiatives by evaluating options within the procurement market place for suppliers that provide best cost and most optimal technical and manufacturing solutions.
  • Develops in-depth understanding of aluminum commodity, its technical specification, and applications to provide product expertise to internal customers and an advantage in negotiation.
  • Develops cost models and tools that provides full transparency to cost drivers and supports on-going business initiatives.
  • Participates in the development of supplier scorecards and performance reviews.
  • Builds trust and open communication channels with regional and branch level procurement teams to understand needs and problems and build resolution plan.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s in Business, Engineering and or related field or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum 7 years of progressive experience within Aluminum commodity, preferably an aluminum producer.
  • Strong knowledge of aluminum commodity.
  • Prior experience in manufacture of aluminum products and/or Product Development will be an advantage.
  • Strong analytical skills with deep expertise in creating cost models and advance level cost evaluation tools.
  • Technically oriented to quickly understand aluminum commodity and its applications.
  • Strong leadership skills and proactive work ethic.
  • Outstanding communication and relationship building skills with both internal stakeholders and external vendors and suppliers.
  • Excellent computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and business intelligence). 
  • Ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change.
  • Self-starter and ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to travel as required.

title: Manager, Procurement Technology (12-mo contract)
description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney. 

CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe.  Join our team and look forward to:

  • Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
  • Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
  • Accelerated exposure and responsibility
  • Global career development opportunities
  • Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
  • A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.

Job Description

As a foundational step in 2021, an Enterprise Vendor Governance and Procurement function was formed in Finance. The new function oversees the development of a global, scalable, and agile approach to the Fund's end-to-end management of procurement and vendor risk and is anchored on three key principles of vendor performance, risk, and cost management. Procurement technology is a critical component to streamline the Fund’s Procure-to-Pay (“P2P”) processes and is aligned with the Fund’s overall vision of disciplined cost management.

The P2P technology platform will:

1. Streamline the end-to-end purchasing, invoicing, and payment activities across CPP Investments business functions by standardizing, simplifying, and automating processes with straight-through processing, enhancing the control environment; and

2. Create organization wide synergies with better spend monitoring and analytics, through increased visibility of vendor expenses and promoting a more cost-conscious culture.

The Procure-to-Pay Specialist (Manager) position is on a contingent basis for a period of one year, with the option to extend for an additional term. As part of the Finance group, this position reports to the Director, Enterprise Vendor Governance and Procurement within the Corporate Accounting and Procurement team. This role will serve as the team’s P2P subject matter expert, engaging with internal and external cross functional stakeholders.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Provide leadership and project management on behalf of the Corporate Accounting and Procurement team. 
  • Facilitate requirements gathering sessions. Document and validate results with subject matter experts and support the creation of strong system specifications that enable the development and/or acquisition of appropriate systems to meet business requirements.
  • Build process design flows, identifying efficiencies and leveraging the capability of digital resources.
  • Participate in process design meetings and translate outcomes into process documentation.
  • Lead change management activities including enterprise training and stakeholder presentations.
  • Conduct process walkthroughs and validation with business subject matter experts, documenting key risks, mitigating controls, performance measures, cost drivers and business continuity plans for processes.
  • Focus on increasing efficiency of Procurement and Accounts Payable operations, with a focus on streamlining, simplifying, and automating processes across the entire P2P lifecycle.
  • Review and analyze enterprise Procurement and Accounts Payable processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement with the P2P technology platform.  
  • Liaise with business subject matter experts to brainstorm and document innovative solutions or alternatives.
Qualifications

  • University degree preferably in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration.
  • Supply Chain Management Professional designation (SCMP) an asset.
  • Certificate in Business Process Management, Business Analysis and/or Change Management an asset.
  • Minimum of 5 experience in a related role in an organization of comparable size and complexity - preference for experience within the investment industry.
  • Experience with procurement and payment systems with proven capabilities to improve manual processes through automation design and execution.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of accounting principles, procurement lifecycle, invoicing, and payment activities.  
  • Project and change management experience, having led, or participated in a system implementation/integration across multiple teams.  
  • Strong technical aptitude, root cause problem solving abilities and sufficient systems knowledge to effectively recognize and resolve integration and system issues.
  • Proven ability to liaise with stakeholders and business subject matter experts in gathering of business requirements.       
  • Experience with standardizing, simplifying, and automating processes to enhance internal controls.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present in a concise manner.
  • Exceptional organizational and analytical skills with great attention to detail.
  • Advanced Microsoft skills – Office, Project, Visio, and PowerPoint.
  • Exemplifies CPP Investments’ Guiding Principles of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance.


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-AL1

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer:

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered.  CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

 

Mandatory Vaccine Policy

All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

title: Procurement Key Account Manager
description:
Key Account Manager, Northern Europe (Procurement)

Our entire Accor estate expands across the world. With over 300,000 experts committed to rejuvenating the hospitality experience we pride ourselves in being the employer of choice, so live limitlessly, come as you are, grow with us, work with purpose and explore the endless opportunities in store.

We are worldwide Augmented Hospitality leaders, the best at what we do. Heartists is what we call ourselves, generous, passionate, attentive and free, whether we are welcoming guests, connecting with our peers or serving others, it’s all in our DNA!

Our Talents enrich our culture and are huge contributors to success of our brand. Each Heartist has a story to tell of their own journey at Accor. We welcome you to take a step into our world and begin the next chapter of your career journey with us as Procurement Key Account Manager Northern Europe!

Here is a snapshot at some of the responsibilities you will hold:

  • Increase purchases made through our services instead of them sourcing through other channels. Doing benchmark and analyze to accelerate the integration of the new comers and existing partners

  • Define action plan for the integration to raise compliance (hotels to target, actions, timing, and frequency of visits). Monitor performance, visiting hotels & establishing strong relationships with Hotel owners & managers 

  • Develop cost saving business case for new & existing Accor partners  

  • Build relationships & convert new hotels to Accor Procurement services  

  • Collect input from field on how Procurement offering needs to improve  

  • Collect price benchmarking data from the field to ensure our price levels are competitive 

  • Follow-up performance vs targets – focus on additional revenues 

Your profile? You will already come with a Bachelors Degree from a commercial background (Procurement related ideally), you will be curious in your thinking, autonomous and entrepreneurial in your approach. Your communication skills will be exemplary and you will have the ability to articulate your ideas seamlessley through the use of Microsoft Office.

To acknowledge your hard work, loyalty and commitment to us, we offer an extensive benefits package; competitive salary, bonus, season ticket loans, subsidised gym membership, private medical healthcare, pension, and of course complimentary hotel stays (to name a few). 

Your Accor experience begins now, so if you are looking to take the next step in your careeer journey then we want to hear from you!

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: Administrateur(trice) de contrat (Montréal, QC, CA)
description:
Concours: 137277
Titre: Administrateur(trice) de contrat
Statut: Temporaire
Durée: Indéterminée
Lieu: Montréal
Fin d'affichage: 16/05/2022

MISSION

Administrer les contrats qui lui sont confiés selon la réglementation en vigueur.

VOS DÉFIS

  • Participe à la préparation des clauses particulières pour le chantier et à l'examen des documents d'appel d'offres avant leur publication.
  • Coordonne l'analyse des soumissions et prépare les recommandations  du chantier pour l'attribution des contrats.
  • Planifie, dirige et contrôle l'administration des contrats incluant l'inspection et/ou la surveillance, la vérification des décomptes et les paiements aux entrepreneurs.
  • S'assure de l'application efficace des programmes d'assurance de la qualité des entrepreneurs.
  • S'assure de la préparation et du suivi des plans de surveillances.
  • Initie et gère les avenants selon la réglementation en vigueur.
  • Analyse et négocie les réclamations en vue d'un règlement équitable.
  • S'assure de la mise à jour des dessins conformes à l'exécution des différents contrats.
  • Coordonne la préparation des rapports historiques des contrats sous sa juridiction.
  • Gère la réalisation des produits de son unité administrative et les ressources humaines, matérielles et financières nécessaires. Contribue à la gestion de l'unité administrative à laquelle il appartient.

.

VOTRE PROFIL

  • Détenir un diplôme d'études collégiales dans un domaine pertinent (DEC). Détenir un baccalauréat dans un domaine pertinent est considéré comme un atout.
  • Avoir de cinq à sept ans d'expérience.

CONDITIONS

Hydro-Québec, reconnu comme LE meilleur employeur au Canada en 2022 selon Forbes

Choisir de travailler sur nos différents chantiers de construction, comporte de nombreux avantages dont:

      • La santé et sécurité à la priorité N°1 dans notre environnement de travail
      • Une culture de collaboration, d’équité et d’inclusion
      • Des défis passionnants et stimulants dans le cœur de l’action !
      • Un salaire compétitif
      • Un régime de retraite à prestations déterminées 

Pour en connaître davantage à propos d'Hydro-Québec, n'hésitez pas à vous abonnez à nos différentes plateformes telles que LinkedIn et Facebook 

PARTICULARITÉS

 

  • Doit détenir un permis de conduire de classe 5.
  • Horaire de 40 heures du lundi au vendredi.

Le candidat retenu fera l'objet d'une vérification administrative de sécurité.

Diplôme obtenu à l'extérieur du Canada : Nous exigeons l'évaluation comparative des études émise par le Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l’Intégration. Vous devez présenter le document officiel sur demande.

Pour que votre candidature à ce poste soit prise en considération, vous devez déposer votre candidature sur notre site emplois.

Hydro-Québec applique un programme d'accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Nous vous invitons à lire la déclaration de l'entreprise à cet égard. Nous communiquons uniquement avec les personnes retenues à la suite de l'analyse des dossiers.

title: Contract Manager
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

2

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Senior Contract Manager, the Contract Manager role plays a critical part in our organization, with responsible for managing Finning’s mid to largest customer agreements of $100K to $100M in revenue. The Contract Manager needs to be fully aware of the benefits, potential risks, and other necessary details of each contract Finning is a signatory on.

Job Description:

Major Job Functions:

  • Contract Management - Manage contracts. Includes: Monitoring contract compliance and performance, reviewing schedule adherence, managing annual contract escalation and pricing adjustment processes (e.g. quarterly foreign exchange and annual price), communicating and clarifying contract content, responsibilities and commitments, and reporting and communicating on key performance indicators/measurements (KPI’s) (50%)
  • Contract Implementation - Monitoring contracts, and moving forward with extension, close-out, or renewal of contracts (25%)
  • Relationship Development/Management - Manage core mining product contract life cycle costing. Includes: Developing relationships, internal product knowledge, standards, and processes to assist and support contract lifecycle costing, and management (25%)

Detailed Job Functions:

Contract Implementation:

  • Continuous Improvement to existing company contract policies to ensure compliance and reduce any potential risks
  • Achieve or exceed targets set for contract adherence,  profitability and contract pricing updates
  • Ensure that the BluePrint process is thoroughly followed and adhered to and that any deficiencies are addressed and communicated, where appropriate, in a timely manner to Mining Management

Contract Management:

  • Ensuring all contract details align with federal, provincial, and local laws, as well as cooperate guidelines, policies, objectives, and goals
  • Develop, initiate and manage contract management best practices and processes, define roles and responsibilities, and educate, support and provide expertise to internal stakeholders on contract management
  • Thoroughly understand Caterpillar equipment and all aspects of contract life cycle costing, and transfer knowledge gained to Mining Management, Product Support, Mining Account Managers and Underground Mining Systems Management through liaising with various key knowledge holders (e.g. Caterpillar, Drills, Shovels and Underground Mining Systems employees), attending technical and product training, and conducting site visits
  • Ensure that contractual requirements, terms, obligations, and rights are adhered to, by the customer and Finning (Canada), are enforced and upheld by contract owners in a timely manner and that contract deadlines are met
  • Create awareness and responsiveness, and increase understanding of contract owners and other internal stakeholders on all contractual requirements, obligations and rights for contracts, through regular, timely communication, training, providing support and managing best practices and processes, ensure appropriate actions are taken and initiating continuous improvement initiatives
  • Review existing contracts, assess contract life costing, obligations and terms, fully understand customer and Finning (Canada’s) contract responsibilities, determine contract accuracy and future concerns, and communicate findings to Mining Management

Relationship Development/Management:

  • Develop and maintain excellent long-term relationships with Cat Global Mining, Finning Branch and Sales operations, internal relationships and Mining customers

Knowledge:

  • An in depth product and market knowledge of mining equipment and their respective application
  • Ability to read, interpret and explain documents such as Master Agreements, financial reports, legal and service agreements.
  • Ability to write routine reports and effective correspondence for internal and external audiences.
  • Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees.
  • Proven skills in written and verbal communications, planning, organizing, leadership and interpersonal relationship building.
  • Solid computer skills including Microsoft Office suite, customer relationship management (CRM) systems, and tools for data analysis, marketing and design.
  • Strong data analysis and visualization skills.
  • Ability to relate to all levels of employees and be a team player who motivates and educates other team members.
  • Ability to set and manage priorities for both individual and internal responsibilities and tasks.
  • Ability to travel across the territory to visit customers and branches is required.

Education & Experience:

  • Business and/or financial degree, MBA would be an asset
  • 5 to 7 years of prior contracts management experience in a mining or heavy equipment industry  environment
  • Prior indepth experience in equipment and/or in project management
  • A comprehensive understanding of contract management best practices, processes, and methodology, specifically contract formation, contract document preparation and pricing commercial and business acumen
  • Excellent understanding of business operations and financial analytics
  • Excellent organizational and planning, analytical, research skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, and verbal and written communication skills, specifically, excellent presentation and negotiation skills
  • Deep understanding of contracts, contractual language, and contract governance

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Procurement Manager (Ottawa, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Medical Ltd. provides its customers, who conduct life-saving medical procedures for patients around the world, the benefit of decades of experience in the development, manufacturing, packaging and delivery of medical isotopes and radiopharmaceuticals. Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300 highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. BWXT Medical Ltd. is part of the BWXT nuclear power segment (NPG) of BWX Technologies, Inc.

Procurment Manager

 

We are currently recruiting for a Procurement Manager for our facility in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

JOB OVERVIEW

To manage the risk and opportunities associated with responsibility for all company purchases and to ensure company requirements for quality, cost and schedule are achieved. To maintain and develop supplier relations at management levels. To manage the sections resources effectively, ensuring personnel are motivated, trained, developed and department is operating efficiently within established budgets.

 

 

JOB STRUCTURE AND COMMUNICATIONS

  • Reports to the Director of Kanata Operations
  • Will be responsible for procurement activities for both Fuel Operations at Nuclear Energy Canada (NEC) (30%) and BWXT Medical (70%)
  • Team of buyer’s report to this role.
  • Strong conveying, influencing & negotiating skills with both suppliers and internal departments is required

 

ACCOUNTABILITIES

 

Section Resources Management

  • Manage budget, salary and performance reviews, providing executive management with performance measures, benchmarks, statistics and reports related to section performance and projects
  • Ensure supplier quality, on-time delivery, and cost levels are consistent with BWXT standards and policies
  • Negotiate savings across a diverse supply chain
  • Manage staff (motivate, coach, train, develop)
  • Develop section procedures and guidelines as well as setting section operating standards/policies relative to procurement

Contract Negotiations

  • Lead the negotiation of major purchases and the strategic discussions at supplier locations.

Develop/Approve Strategies

  • Ensure strategies are developed to provide optimum competitive advantage to BWXT.
  • Develop and approve procurement strategies in conjunction with staff.

Supplier Relationship

  • Build and maintain supplier relationships through regular meetings with key supplier senior staff.
  • Resolve supplier conflicts when necessary.

Process Improvement

  • Actively participate in the process improvement team
  • Direct initiatives on quality, cost reductions, and process/efficiency improvements

Staff Management & Development

  • Conduct annual performance reviews and staff meetings, conduct interviews and approve

Compliance

  • Understand and ensure staff compliance with applicable external codes, regulations and

guidelines as well as internal standards set by BWXT.

 

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE

  • Technical Degree/Diploma or Technical certifications in the areas of Supply Management, Logistics or related fields.
  • Typically, fifteen (15) or more years’ experience in procurement &/or equivalent work-related
  • experience.
  • Supervisory/managerial experience in Supply Management &/or Logistics.
  • Demonstrated management capability at a senior level
  • Strong business acumen
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong negotiation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Material/product knowledge

 

BWXT Medical Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
Why Work for Us?

Innovation. Act with Integrity. Collaboration. Embrace Diversity. Care

We come from many countries, cultures, races, ethnicities, abilities and nationalities. We bring our passions including singing, biking, swimming, dancing, cooking, volunteering, parenting, coaching and much more! We are proud of our nearly equal balance of men and women and strengthened by our non-binary and transgender team members. Every employee belongs.

We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.

Company Description

Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics, initially focused on the treatment of cancer.  Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates.

Zymeworks is seeking a highly-motivated professional who is looking to grow their career with our company.  

This position will report to the Associate Director, Legal and will be based in either Vancouver, BC or Seattle, WA.

As a condition of employment, Zymeworks requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and provide verification of such.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drafts, negotiates, and facilitates execution of a broad range of agreements in a timely manner with vendors, contractors, and collaborators.
  • Reviews, identifies, and mitigates contractual and business risks in third party agreements and presents findings to management.
  • Manages and administrates executed agreements to ensure internal and external compliance.
  • Liaises with internal/external stakeholders in the negotiation of contracts and associated statements of work.
  • Supports internal stakeholders as the contracts subject matter expert in order to provide contractual and commercial risks and issues. Provides mentorship and leadership within the organization. 
  • Ensures accurate, easily accessible, and complete records of the Company’s contractual and business matters.
  • Monitors contract expiration periods, engages with internal stakeholders to determine renewal priorities and changes in the business drivers, and manages the process for renewals, amendments, or extensions.
  • Actively works to foster an environment of effective and collaborative working relationships amongst employees, management, and external partners.

Qualifications and Education

  • University degree in law, business, or related discipline and a minimum of 5 to 7 years’ related experience with the successful negotiation and execution of a broad range of agreements, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
  • Embody and champion Zymeworks’ values: Act with Integrity. Collaborate. Care.
  • Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict confidentiality on matters that require discretion.

Skills and Abilities:

  • Proven interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively as a member of a cross-functional team and effectively solicit stakeholder input. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills and the ability to work effectively in a high-paced, fast-changing environment. Results
  • Has a strong working knowledge of key operational controls, Canadian and international contract law, and financial regulations.
  • Strong leadership and mentorship skills.
  • General understanding of the pharmaceutical drug development process, preference may be given to candidates with pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or healthcare
  • Experience managing and using industry-standard contracts management software.
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills with the ability to confidently present findings.
  • Demonstrated exemplary business ethics, integrity, and transparency.
  • Demonstrated initiative and creativity.
  • Proficiency with MS Office.

NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: Zymeworks values our relationships with our Recruitment Partners. We will only accept resumes from those partners whom have been contracted by a member of our Human Resources team to collaborate with us. Zymeworks is not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received without contract.

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
With stocking service centers located in all corners of North America, and distribution partners worldwide, Connexus Industries is a leading provider of chain and industrial manufacturing solutions.

We are growing and hiring a Purchasing Manager to support the procurement team and develop a cost-efficient and reliable supply base.

Responsibilities include:
  • Select and evaluate suppliers and further develop the existing supply base.
  • Cooperate with quality and procurement teams for supplier selection.
  • Negotiate and conclude contractual agreements.
  • Optimize purchasing processes focused on inventory management, quality, and delivery deadlines.
  • Support cost optimization.
  • Mentor and manage the procurement team.
 
Skills and Requirements:
  • Commercial/technical education with experience in purchasing.
  • Supervisory experience.
  • Experience and understanding of production processes and procedures.
  • Strong negotiation skills.
  • Solid computer skills.
  • Well-organized and conscientious.
 
Connexus offers competitive salary, good benefits, and a spacious clean work environment.

title: Strategic Procurement Advisor
description:
Job Description

The Strategic Procurement Advisor will be responsible for building awareness of specific programs, identifying an inventory and maintaining a database of ‘procurement ready’ businesses within Canada and matching these businesses with internal procurement opportunities and supporting them through the process. The Strategic Procurement Advisor will develop strong relationships within the Canadian supply chain and in particular the Indigenous business community and work closely with VP Procurement and Subcontracts as well as the Indigenous Relations Team and other Divisions of the company to fulfill the objectives of the MP Procurement Team.

Reporting to the VP Procurement and Subcontracts the Strategic Procurement Advisor is responsible for the planning, coordination, implementation, marketing and administration of the Strategic Procurement and Indigenous Procurement Program.

This position can be based either in Edmonton, Calgary or Vancouver.

Responsibilities:

  • Building awareness of the MP Strategic and Indigenous Procurement Program across Canada by coordinating and facilitating information sessions targeted to established businesses/associations/organizations, attending events focused on the Indigenous business community and ensuring coordination of community outreach activities with others in the Indigenous Relations Team.
  • Acting as the first point of contact with Indigenous businesses seeking business support,identifying and maintaining contact with those that are ‘procurement ready’ to connectthem with procurement opportunities within the business.
  • Referring Indigenous businesses that are not yet ‘procurement ready’ to appropriate contacts within the Vendor Management Team (VMS) and external service providers to support their current business needs and ensure registration and their available capabilities.
  • Developing a thorough understanding of the Government of Canada’s procurement processes for the purpose of supporting our internal business development and procurement support opportunities.
  • Keep up to date on available procurement opportunities through the Federal Government Team in Engineering Services for potential matching with a suitable Indigenous business.
  • Ensuring all updates and reporting related to the program are completed by the deadlines provided.
  • Keeping on top of relevant programs, business trends, marketing trends, services, information, and resources to further assist clients with a focus on established Indigenous businesses.
  • Provide internal training to fellow SNC-Lavalin Staff on Indigenous Procurement, so our entire team can have the tools to direct Indigenous Business owners properly.
  • Deliver internal and external presentations and workshops throughout Canada to Indigenous business owners or to stakeholders and service providers who also support Indigenous entrepreneurship, always ensuring that the messaging and content is tailored to the audience.
  • Work jointly with other team members to ensure program information is shared through direct community outreach across the country and we actively and continually engage our supply chain.
  • You conduct outreach and meet with current and potential clients, partners, suppliers, non-profits, and others in the ecosystem to evaluate synergy opportunities, build relationships and provide support to best serve the Procurement teams.
  • Attend community and stakeholder events to share program information and develop a trusted relationship within the Indigenous business community.
  • Work with the VP Procurement and Subcontracts to achieve program targets for financial performance, quality, culture and legislative adherence.
  • Support the VP Procurement and Subcontracts with the PAR Certification requirements as well as being a member in PAR Procurement Sub-Committee.
  • Maintain open lines of communication and are a collaborator with fellow team members.
  • Lend your expertise to other projects that are outside of Major Projects as directed by the VP Procurement and Subcontracts
  • Support and update VMS to ensure accurate data for business analytics purposes.
  • Monthly and quarterly reporting process by ensuring client interactions and amazing success stories are regularly captured.
  • Responsibility for and deliver exceptional program specific reporting.
  • Obtain data, conduct research, and analyse information from across Canada and globally in relation to Indigenous procurement trends, and social enterprise initiatives.
  • Centralize data and information from open-sourced platforms that support SNC-Lavalin Procurement Team and Federal Procurement Team to make informed decisions.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • A degree in Business, Entrepreneurship, Social Sciences, or equivalent combination of education and entrepreneurship experience
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team and independently
  • Understanding of procurement opportunities and processes
  • Commitmentto ethical business conduct and trusted with sensitive information
  • Experience with government and private procurement; with a focus on Indigenous business and government, is an asset
  • A well‐rounded understanding of First Nations, Metis, and Inuit communities, both geographically and culturally, is an asset
  • Speaking and facilitation experience in front of small and large groups
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong ability to initiate, develop, and maintain relationship with stakeholders at all levels
  • Strong interpersonal communication and networking skills
  • Strong ability to contribute to process and plan development
  • You have a valid Driver’s License

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Procurement Sourcing Strategy Manager 1 -17645
description:
The Procurement Sourcing Strategy Manager (PSSM) is a mid to senior role within the procurement team. The PSSM has accountability for developing, prioritizing and successfully negotiating and implementing holistic sourcing strategies, agreements, and commercials within the assigned spend category which will optimize cost and flexibility, drive ongoing service level performance, quality delivery and innovation from the supply-base, and maximize overall Savings throughout the sourcing life cycle, while appropriately identifying and mitigating relevant risks

The PSSM will use his/her in-depth market knowledge across the assigned category and use their structured spend analysis capabilities to develop and disseminate world-class approaches to spend management and procure-to-pay processes. Additionally, the PSSM will provide counsel and support to other procurement team members, and will present strategic findings and recommendations to members of the leadership team.
Furthermore, the PSSM will support Procurement in all aspects of strategic category and supplier management and optimization, ensuring strategy development and evolution in close collaboration with the leadership teams responsible for other spend categories as well as with the internal business stakeholders of the assigned category. In the role, the PSSM will work with his/her category peers), HR, Finance, and relevant stakeholders to ensure that services are procured from the most appropriate and cost-effective source of supply, and will at times lead or support high-priority sourcing activities on ancillary category teams to help balance workload demands.

Through regular and corporate-wide internal stakeholder relationship management, the PSSM will proactively identify and develop internal sourcing funnel opportunities, and will deliver on such opportunities through the development of end-to-end realization of appropriate RFx, and other relevant sourcing, pre-sourcing and post-sourcing activities throughout the source-to-pay lifecycle. Where appropriate, the PSSM will recommend necessary process, systems, templates, and resourcing changes to maximize the value-add of the assigned category team.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement effective category strategy that maximizes value-for-money, service satisfaction, and compliance
• Accountable for all strategic sourcing events and efforts in the assigned spend category (both internally to business unit leaders and externally to service suppliers)
• Maximize spend under management and competitive sourcing through close, proactive, regular stakeholder and supplier engagement, education, and funnel management
• Create and lead medium to large, medium to high complexity strategic sourcing initiatives to optimize category spend and minimize related risks
• Accountable for successful delivery of strategic sourcing events per negotiations objectives and outcomes, incl. sourcing business case and benefits realization, regular supplier performance reviews, additional business development.
• Effectively lead, direct, and appropriately leverage and prioritize workload capacity against funnel of sourcing events and source-to-pay activities
• Provide strategic and market insights on transactional movements in annual spend associated with the specific category and/ or with strategic suppliers within the assigned sourcing category, and adjust sourcing strategy and approaches accordingly.
• Create/ deliver/ manage strategic plan and approach to achieving Savings targets, track and manage results, take remedial actions, present updates, analysis and recommendations to leadership.
• Maintain and disseminate latest category related market trends and insights
• Mentor and educate other team members on procurement concepts, financial analysis, strategic sourcing techniques and practices, and stakeholder engagement
• Provide strategic and thought leadership, direction and project oversight to cross functional project teams during prioritization and implementation of special projects aimed at improving category enabling processes, systems, templates, etc.

Qualifications
Required Knowledge:
• Deep knowledge of [assigned sourcing category], critical terms & conditions, and market commercials as they relate to sourcing Strategic sourcing training
• Familiarity with sourcing and procure-to-pay frameworks, approaches, methodologies, and strategies (incl. Supplier tiering), preferable in professional services or ancillary categories

Required Skills & Abilities:
• Superior ability to influence and build relationships (both internally and externally) at all levels
• Superior negotiation skills
• Proven leadership, consultative and motivational skills
• Strong project management skills; ability to effectively lead, manage and facilitate small to medium size, cross-functional project teams
• Strong quantitative and analytical skills; demonstrated data analysis capability
• Strong financial and financial modeling/ business case acumen
• Ability to work effectively and comfortably with executives in a large organization
• Excellent problem solving, strategic thinking, planning and decision making skills
• Ability to maintain perspective, confidence, and resilience in face of difficult contract negotiations, tight deadlines and unclear or diverging client expectations
• Superior organizational, prioritization and time management skills. Ability to multi-task and re-prioritize quickly, and to deliver in over-subscribed, resource-constrained environment
• Strong verbal and written English communication and presentation skills

Required Professional Designation/Certification:
• Bachelors degree (MBA would be an asset). Relevant experience in a large consulting firm a definite plus
• PMAC designation would be an asset
• Membership in relevant procurement related associations/ interest groups (SIG, others) preferred
• Experience in account management or business development related positions a plus
• Experience working on business development/ sell side of professional services for a major professional service provider (advisory firm or systems Integrator) a plus
• Experience with e.Sourcing, Spend Analysis, Contract Management, Vendor Management, Procure-to-Pay tools, procurement and finance related SAP (or other similar ERP system) modules

Must to have skills:
1. Exceptional Communication Skills
2 Experience reviewing/editing/negotiating legal agreements within a procurement role
3. Have the ability to understand the downstream effects of clauses in contracts and be able to renegotiate anything that negatively affect the business.
4. Experience conducting sourcing events (RFx)

Nice to have skills:
1. MBA
2. French Speaking
3. Engineering/legal background

Required Experience:
• 7+ years of experience in external labour/ professional services sourcing/ procurement/ vendor management line function or sourcing/ procurement related consulting/ advisory
• Strategic sourcing experience
• Category spend management experience, incl. target setting, tracking + reporting
• Effective, prioritized sourcing opportunity identification, development + execution experience
• Advanced services (including services reselling) contracting and negotiations training and experience, and superior professional services negotiations skills + track record
• Intimate familiarity with master service agreements
• Experience negotiating, papering, operationalizing, and enforcing effective, innovative, scope-appropriate contract SLA frameworks
• Proven experience planning, structuring, and executing sourcing deals and leading major end-to-end sourcing events, with on-time delivery of savings objectives
• Proven Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) and contract compliance management experience
• Risk management experience
• Extremely strong track record of highly effective, proactive in-house stakeholder management, influence, and collaboration at all seniority levels within a large corporation and a complex, fast-paced, capacity constrained environment
• Experience leading others
• Experience preparing business cases

title: Administrateur de contrat
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Accélérez votre carrière au sein d’un groupe d’ingénierie mondial à forte croissance. Chez SEGULA Technologies, vous travaillerez sur des projets passionnants et contribuerez à façonner l’avenir au sein d’une entreprise pour qui l’innovation est indissociable de l’ingénierie.

Impression 3D, réalité augmentée, véhicule autonome, usine du futur… rythment le quotidien de nos 10 000 ingénieux collaborateurs, pourquoi pas le vôtre ?

À côté de chez vous ou à l’autre bout de la planète, vous trouverez chez SEGULA Technologies l’opportunité qui donnera un sens nouveau à votre carrière !

Description du poste

Le (la) titulaire du poste est responsable de l’ensemble des activités reliées aux ententes de ventes de pièces. Il doit répondre aux différentes soumissions et demandes des clients afin de générer un maximum de ventes de façon profitable pour l’entreprise. Il gère l’ensemble de ses dossiers tout en s’assurant de créer et de maintenir la satisfaction des clients.

Responsabilités : 

  • Analyse et évalue les soumissions ou demandes de prix et prend les décisions relatives aux directives reçues. Analyse et étudie les appels d’offres annuelles, complète les documents de la soumission selon les termes exigés, s’assure d’obtenir les garanties, cautionnements et police d’assurances relatifs aux appels d’offres. Complète les bordereaux de prix.

 

  • Recherche et identifie les produits à soumissionner et coordonne avec les autres départements pour identifier un maximum de pièces et les rendre accessibles.

 

  • S’assure de faire une analyse complète de tous les paramètres associés aux soumissions. Coordonne avec les autres départements afin d’optimiser notre profitabilité/disponibilité et d’assurer une conformité face aux demandes clients. Recommande les niveaux de stockage. 

 

  • Élabore des scénarios de vente, les présentes aux clients et tente de les influencer afin d’obtenir des engagements d’achat fermes de leur part. Représente la compagnie auprès des clients et s’assure de faire un suivi sur toutes leurs demandes. Mesure leur satisfaction en les questionnant par rapport à notre performance et le service actuellement offert.

 

  • Analyse les résultats des soumissions, communique les résultats (au besoin) aux autres départements, et coordonne afin de mettre en place les actions nécessaires à l’exécution du contrat.

 

  • Effectue les rapports et suivis nécessaires à chaque étape des contrats et coordonne les actions à prendre avec le gérant régional de vente et/ou autres départements. Fait les suivis périodiques de performance de contrat pour s’assurer des engagements des clients, et communique les résultats aux autres départements pour optimiser leur efficacité.

 

  •  Participe et contribue à l’amélioration continue des processus de ventes de pièces
Qualifications

  • DEC technique administrative ou l’équivalent
  • Trois (3) ans d’expérience pertinente (incluant le service à la clientèle)
  • Connaissance de l’anglais parlé et écrit (niveau supérieur)

 

Ou

  • BACC en administration ou BACC en sciences de la consommation
  • Un (1) an d’expérience pertinente (incluant le service à la clientèle)
  • Connaissance de l’anglais parlé et écrit (niveau supérieur

 

TECHNIQUE

Maîtrise du logiciel Microsoft Excel (niveau avancé) et SAP.



Informations supplémentaires

SEGULA TECHNOLOGIES est une entreprise attachée à la mixité et à la diversité, nous reconnaissons et recrutons tous les talents.

title: Contract Administrator
description:
Mission

This position will provide the opportunity to join our innovative, supportive, and dynamic water and wastewater engineering group. You will be working on a variety of infrastructure projects including water and wastewater treatment, water supply, storage and distribution, and wastewater collection.

Responsibilities

  • Management of inspection services and quality assurance
  • Manage the measurement of construction progress and the preparation of payment certificates
  • Management of written and photographic record keeping including the submission of reports
  • Review and provide recommendations of Contract Change Requests and Claims
  • Provide conflict resolution and field solutions with respect to unforeseen construction issues
  • Management of responses to Contractor’s RFI’s and clarification requests
  • Attend and lead construction progress meetings
  • Liaise with the contractor, client and Municipal officials on project updates and progress, including preparation and issuance of project reports
  • Familiarity with current traffic control regulations
  • Familiarity with relevant environmental regulations, municipal approvals and local by-laws
  • Other duties as assigned

 Profile

  • Positive attitude with good leadership, communication, interpersonal skills and employment record
  • Over 10 years of contract administration or relevant experience in municipal treatment and transmission infrastructure
  • Experienced in project planning, risk management, cost management, schedule management and preparation/administration of contract documents and specifications
  • Ability to interpret construction drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work both independently and cooperatively as part of a team
  • MTO Class ‘G’ driver’s license in good standing and access to a personnel vehicle
  • Effective communicator possessing demonstrated skills in dealing with other staff, contractors, and the public, with matters arising from construction projects
  • Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
  • Possess working knowledge of the Occupation Health and Safety Act and its Regulations, and Ontario Provincial Standards and Specifications (OPSS) for Municipal projects
  • Demonstrate skills in the use of computer utilizing programs such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Project, Outlook)

title: Contract Coordinator
description:
About Toyota Financial Services

Toyota Financial Services (TFS) provides retail, leasing and wholesale financial services to Toyota and Lexus dealerships and customers across Canada. TFS is a member of Toyota Financial Services Corporation (TFSC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation in Japan with the Canadian operation headquarters in Markham, Ontario

What Sets Us Apart?

At Toyota Financial Services (TFS), you will help create best in class customer experiences in an innovative, collaborative and team focused environment. TFS is an important part of the Toyota family, an award-winning global company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, continuous improvement and environmental responsibility.

TFS currently has an exciting permanent opportunity as a Contract Coordinator, reporting to the Supervisor, Contract Funding. This role will reside in our Markham Head Office.

What you will be doing:

 • Accurately process lease and loan contracts. Meet or exceed department KPI’s.

• Verify incoming documents for thoroughness & accuracy.

• Ensure all contract documentation is received and relevant documents completed and signed as required, at time of funding.

• Adhere to booking procedures, plans & programs.

• Provide clear and thorough explanations to dealers of contract discrepancies and information needed to complete funding of contracts.

• Respond to dealer inquiries on the Dealer Queue.

• Work shifts from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. Flexibility in working weekends as required.

• Other duties as required, including supporting other team members and departments with tasks/responsibilities.

 What you bring:

• High School Diploma minimum, Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree preferred.

• Bilingual (English and French) preferred.

• 2 years’ related work experience preferred.

• Excellent interpersonal skills and telephone manner.

• Strong computer and data entry skills; Ability to navigate quickly through multiple applications/programs.

• Organized and detailed oriented; ability to work in a fast paced and busy environment

• Flexibility to work extended hours to support the team

• Strong learning agility and flexible in taking on new tasks and responsibilities
