TFS is a member of Toyota Financial Services Corporation (TFSC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation in Japan with the Canadian operation headquarters in Markham, Ontario', 'What Sets Us Apart?', '• Excellent interpersonal skills and telephone manner.', '• Adhere to booking procedures, plans & programs.', '• Provide clear and thorough explanations to dealers of contract discrepancies and information needed to complete funding of contracts.', '• Other duties as required, including supporting other team members and departments with tasks/responsibilities.']

title: Advanced Sourcing Manager
description:
Advanced Sourcing Manager


The Advanced Sourcing Manager works with Curtiss Wright project teams, supplier's and Engineering to provide sourcing project support, determine technology design approaches and alignment of supplier capabilities in order to provide cost and quality advantages. Serves as a liaison for cross functional sourcing participation with a proven track record of managing commodity supply at both tactical and strategic levels, driving supplier relationship management and procurement needs within a global services model. The role will be responsible for managing global supplier/distributor relationships and will also act as a primary Supply Chain interface into Curtiss Wright's Embedded Computing business units for NPI cost optimization across commodities.


_RESPONSIBILITIES_


+ Based on Curtiss Wright business objectives negotiate SOW's, pricing, lead times, VMI, customer flow-down, and other key requirements with Distributors

+ Serves as an active product development team member in all phases of the sourcing processes to ensure cross-functional objectives of New Product Development/ NPI

+ Negotiating and incorporating terms into supply agreements or contracts where appropriate.

+ Working with the Operations team identify, evaluate, implement, and monitor value-added Distributor services that can be leveraged to improve efficiencies, delivery and optimize total cost.

+ Lead QBR's with all key portfolio suppliers, partnering with other Curtiss Wright functions/departments to consolidate inputs, drive key messages, and identify and manage corrective action plans.

+ SC support for all PDR's and CDR's for new product development (Preliminary/ Critical Design review) and work with the technical team to support cost targets as well as pricing for high-cost components

+ Function as project lead for all Contract manufacturing (CM) and machined supplier transactions and set up PRR's (Product readiness reviews)

+ Work with Quality department to support PCB/ PWB mechanical issues and participate in supplier site audits as required

+ Participate and function as the PCB/ PWB team member and provide SC support as needed for all sites and manage SCM activities for multiple sites

+ Create QBR reports and review with Sr Staff

+ Lead Cost negotiations for high-cost components and initiate long term contracts to secure pricing

+ Obtain forecasts from the BU's and provide to key contract manufacturers.

+ Conduct new supplier research and development activities and drive supplier approvals

+ Own the PWB/ PCB procurement specification document to keep up with technology changes and flow downs to suppliers and initiate necessary revision updates as needed on Agile/Oracle platform

+ Act as point of escalation for vendor-related issues, using influence and negotiation skills working with various functions both internally and externally to find creative solutions that will meet Curtiss Wright's business needs.

+ Define, establish, and execute new process to enable Supply Chain proactive engagement with business units to support new product roadmap costing.


_SKILLS_


+ Solid organization skills with the ability to manage strategic, operational, and tactical responsibilities in a "roll up the sleeves" hands-on culture focused on delivering results.

+ Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills including influencing and collaboration, with the ability to develop and sustain strong relationships at all levels with internal peers and partners, as well as suppliers.

+ Strong analytical skills and a talent in seeking out relevant benchmarking and other data to build compelling pricing arguments and business cases.

+ Excellent negotiation skills, with a proven track record in successfully concluding and executing vendor agreements structured to meet corporate objectives.


_EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE_


+ Must have 7 years of experience in Supply Management including commodity sourcing, negotiating, and management

+ Experience in sourcing and procurement with Electronics, Machining, and knowledge of PWB/ PCB

+ Experience in Distributor engagements strongly preferred

+ Experience managing supply chain in compliance with AS9100 requirements

+ Six Sigma / Lean Manufacturing knowledge / experience will be an asset

+ Working knowledge ERP (SAP) desired

+ Bachelor's Degree in Science, Business Administration or Engineering preferred


The position is to be based in Ottawa and will report to the Sr. Director, Supply chain management.


25% travel required and must meet CGP, ITAR requirements.


This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.


#LI-AC1

title: Contract Administrator (High-Rise Architecture)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group is seeking a Contract Administrator to become a vital part of our team in managing and performing site reviews for residential high-rise projects through the construction phase. Working with senior staff, you will be responsible for attending site meetings, conducting site reviews and liaising with and coordinating with stakeholders, as well as managing daily site activities and requests from Owner, Contractor and consultant design team. Other duties and responsibilities would involve responding to Contractor’s requests, reviewing and processing of Shop Drawings, handling Request for Information, issuance of Supplemental Site Instructions, Change Notices, Change Orders and Payment Certification.   This person would be responsible for making decisions on site as well as liaising with the office project architect. 

Most of the Things You'll Be Working On:

  • Review and comment of Contract Documents
  • Review and comment of Specifications
  • Review and comment of shop drawing submittals together with technical data sheet
  • Site Review and Meeting coordination
  • Reporting, Supplemental Instruction Contemplated Change Notice, Change Orders, review and issuance of Certificate for Payment
  • Consultant coordination and liaison
  • Office documentation 
Qualifications

You'll Need To Have:

  • Architect or Intern Architect, Graduate of a recognized university program or Graduate of a recognized technical college.
  • OAA registered technologist preferred
  • 8 to10 years experience with commercial, mix-use high-rise residential, senior living or healthcare projects
  • Experience in wood, steel and construction detailing
  • Thorough knowledge of the Ontario Building Code
  • Building envelope knowledge or accreditation
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Extremely well organized with good interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Autocad
  • Ability to coordinate consultants and office staff


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada. 

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.

#LI-AC1

title: Manager, Procurement (Food & Beverage)
description:
Company Description

Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Ltd. (MLSE) is Canada’s preeminent leader in delivering top quality sport and entertainment experiences to our fans. MLSE is one of North America’s leading providers of exceptional experiences. It is the parent company of the National Hockey League’s Toronto Maple Leafs, the National Basketball Association’s Toronto Raptors Major League Soccer’s Toronto FC, the Canadian Football League’s Toronto Argonauts and development teams with the Toronto Marlies (American Hockey League), Raptors 905 (NBA G League) and Toronto FC II (United Soccer League). MLSE owns or operates all of the venues its teams play and train in, including Scotiabank Arena, BMO Field, Coca-Cola Coliseum, Ford Performance Centre, BMO Training Ground, and the OVO Athletic Centre. MLSE also provides fans in Toronto incredible live music and entertainment events. MLSE strives to deliver championships to our city and our fans and bring the world to its feet.

Who We Are

We celebrate the diversity, individuality, and personality of our peers, striving to be the best in class, in every class. We believe in Respect, Resilience, Commitment, and Ambition. We work for, with, and around the people that inspire us to try, persist, and achieve more.

Our work goes beyond games, seasons, trophies, and tours. Our success is measured by more than a scoreboard. Our team is stronger when we stand united. We create, we celebrate, we build, and we become better!

What we choose to do next, means everything! It defines greatness, builds character, makes history, and brings the world to its feet.

So, are you in?

Job Description

POSITION OVERVIEW

Our Procurement team is aligned in categories to cover the strategic sourcing needs of our various departments. As the Manager, Procurement (Food & Beverage), you will drive a wide range of sourcing activity both within the food & beverage team as well as across other categories, with a primary focus on supporting the strategic sourcing and purchasing/supply chain needs for MLSE’s teams, events and venues/restaurants.. You will be a key contributor towards improving overall value offerings, controlling budgetary costs, and improving contractual service level outcomes with the suppliers of your departments. You will report and work closely with the Senior Director, Procurement towards tracking key performance indicators and the achievement of overall corporate targets.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • In collaboration with the Senior Director, Procurement and the Senior Food & Beverage leadership team, lead / manage / support the strategic sourcing activity for the applicable (or anticipated) primary departments:
    • Food & beverage
    • Additional department or team support may be required based on business requirements.
  • Oversee the time-sensitive supply chain operations for all of MLSE’s venues in delivering food & beverage and other products to our facilities, through management of MLSE’s F&B order desk and MLSE’s receiving department. This includes responsibility for the hiring, scheduling, management and processes for the staff in these areas, which is vital to the success of MLSE’s operations and events.
  • Engage continuously with internal customers on their evolving business requirements and facilitate the direction of sourcing strategies in addressing both current and future needs.
  • Accountable for research, preparation, issuance and management of RFPs, including baseline spend analytics, associated negotiations, and evaluation of responses.
  • Integral in the drafting, negotiation and execution of associated contractual agreements, in collaboration with the legal department and applicable internal customers.
  • Accountable to establish and handle specific service level agreements within supplier contracts and track associated supplier KPIs/obligations.  Successful management of all ordering, fulfillment, on-time delivery and quality control performance for all of MLSE’s food & beverage suppliers is critical.
  • Lead supplier relationship management review sessions seeking to enhance overall operational performance and outcomes.
  • Establish efficiency in each department’s daily supply/service procurement activity within MLSE’s inventory and ERP systems and ensuring accuracy of system’s contractual parameters for each supplier.
  • Collaboration with other MLSE internal departments such as ED&I, Global Partnerships, and MLSE Foundation towards cross-departmental goals
  • Assist with preparation of annual planning process.
  • Participate in other tasks and ad-hoc requests as required, including support for other sourcing activity in other categories on an as required basis.
Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS

  • Related work experience in any of the fields of procurement, food & beverage, negotiations, and/or sports/entertainment, are all of benefit.  
  • Experience in purchasing/receiving for complex organizational needs is essential
  • Past experience overseeing and leading a team with examples of process improvement and team development.
  • Graduate or Postgraduate degree in Business Administration, Finance or Commerce
  • Previous education/courses related to negotiations, marketing, or account (CPA) an asset
  • Applied knowledge of Oracle Cloud ERP or similar ERP system would be an asset
  • Expert understanding of Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong team orientation with ability to collaborate with internal and external customers
  • Strong business insights, including deep understanding of procurement, negotiations, financial analytics, supply chain/logistics and specific category of business supported
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, while working under tight deadlines and/or handling multiple priorities. Project management experience demonstrating this is an asset.
  • Effective communication skills (written/verbal)
  • Preference for a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  • Available to work evenings/weekends if and when required


Additional Information

Please apply by: May 13, 2022

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. If you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com. Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

title: REGIONAL MANAGER, PURCHASING AND STORES
description:
Company Description

ABOUT EACOM

At EACOM, a subsidiary of Interfor, we transform more than wood. Our talented team of 1,100 employees is committed to working, building, and growing together. Embedded in northern Ontario and Quebec communities, our mills have a long, rich history. We responsibly manage and transform forest resources into high-quality wood products. From the Canadian woodlands to the North American home building market, we strive for sustainability, collaboration, safety, and continuous improvement.

Job Description

We are looking for a Regional Manager, Purchasing and Stores based in Montreal or at one of our Ontario or Quebec sites of EACOM Eastern operations of Interfor.   

Reporting to the General Manager, Finance Operations, and assisted by a dedicated team of Buyers and Inventory Coordinators based in the Ontario and Quebec sites, you will be responsible to structure and administer purchasing platform from which all Interfor Eastern division operations can secure goods and services in the most efficient, cost-saving, and value-added manner.    

RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Lead, guide and supervise his team composed of staff dedicated to inventory, corporate purchasing as well as buyers for each site.  
  • Develop key relationships with business stakeholders and strategic supply partners to maximize results and tie down Purchasing Department functionality adapted to the business. 
  • Identify cost reduction opportunities and develop strategies to achieve financial goals, including cost saving initiatives related to utilities purchases. 
  • Negotiate and manage master agreements with major vendors. 
  • Provide support and expertise to negotiating contracts for capital projects. 
  • Work with vendors to consolidate and standardize parts inventory at all mills. 
  • Manage mobile equipment leasing program. 
  • Ensure stores reorganization and functional improvement. 

PROFILE 

  • High sense of rigor and integrity 
  • Strong coaching and leadership skills 
  • People oriented coupled with communication skills 
  • Commerce acumen with strong negotiation and analytical skills 
  • Action oriented and minded towards continuous improvement 
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Logistics, Marketing or in any relevant field 
  • Over than 10 years of relevant experience in similar role in manufacturing industry 
  • Supply Chain Management Association (SCMA) certification (asset) 
  • Bilingual, French and English 
  • Familiar with the Microsoft Office suite and integrated management software packages such as SAP 
  • Be available and interested in traveling approximately 25% of the time 
  • Possess a valid driver's license 


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Contracts Administrator
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood currently has an opportunity for a Contracts Administrator at our Mining & Minerals office in Saskatchewan,This person will be working at our Construction site located near Rocanville in Saskatchewan.   This role reports to the Senior Manager, SCM and will have you working alongside other team members locally.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Operate in accordance with appropriate and current corporate execution procedures and Project Specific Procedures,
  • Undertake contracts activities under direction in accordance with the project execution plan/schedule and/or contracting strategy, within approved budgets and in line with project processes and procedures
  • Monitor and update the Contracts Status Plan
  • Support prequalification activities co-ordinating the input from other disciplines as appropriate and prepare qualification report and list of tenderers form for approval.
  • Support the preparation of contract enquiry documentation, including where applicable the expediting of scopes of work, terms and conditions of contract, enquiry documentation and the like.
  • Process tender information received in response to enquiries. Participate in and/or direct pre-tender and/or tender evaluation meetings and prepare notes of meeting when required.
  • Undertake / monitor the administration of contracts (i.e. processing of payment certificates, price variation summaries etc.) and ensure the satisfactory operation of procedures.
  • Make recommendations to Senior SCM Manager with respect to exceptions to the Terms and Conditions
  • Support claims mitigation activities.
  • Understand the different interfaces between disciplines in the administration of contracts.
  • Develop and maintain construction progress activities utilizing our Project Management System.
  • Identify contract matters which will adversely affect the cost of the program.
Skills / Qualifications:
  • 5-7 years progressively more responsible pertinent experience
  • 3-5 years of experience in EPCM environment
  • Strong organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Must be legally able to work in Canada at time of application
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: DIRECTOR, PURCHASING
description:
Job Description:

 

JOB TITLE:   DIRECTOR, PURCHASING

DEPARTMENT:   CORPORATE SUPPORT SERVICES

POSTING NUMBER:   104730

NUMBER OF POSITIONS:   1

JOB STATUS & DURATION:   Full Time Permanent

HOURS OF WORK:   35 hour workweek

LOCATION:   The City of Brampton has implemented a gradual reintegration of staff into the workplace.   Beginning on April 4, 2022, onsite work location of two (2) days a week will commence.   Beginning on July 4, 2022, this will increase to three (3) days a week. There will be continued opportunities for hybrid work from September 2022 onwards, and weâ€™ll continue to evaluate to determine which hybrid model works best.   Once working onsite, you will report to the location of City Hall - West Tower.

SALARY GRADE:   10

HIRING SALARY RANGE:   $151,487.00-$170,423.00

MAXIMUM OF SALARY RANGE:   $189,359.00

JOB TYPE:   Management and Administration

POSTING DATE:   April 19, 2022

CLOSING DATE:   May 22, 2022

 

AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY:

Reporting directly to the Commissioner, Corporate Support Services, the Director, Purchasing is the Cityâ€™s most senior procurement professional. This position will be responsible for building the Purchasing team into a strategic sourcing operation that provides outcome-based, effective and efficient services to acquire goods and services for the City.

 

This position is responsible for building strong relationships with senior leaders across the City and to become a trusted advisor regarding their business requirements.   This position will contribute in a meaningful and business-oriented manner to many of the Cityâ€™s most important projects. This position will enable the City to fulfill both its legal and stewardship obligations, while doing business in the marketplace.

 

  1. STRATEGIC VISION
  • Develop, lead and execute complex cross-functional procurement strategies which drive improvements and optimization throughout the organization.
  • Advancing a Sustainable Procurement Program that embodies a culture of innovation, efficiency, and sustainable leadership.
  • Build the Purchasing team into a strategic sourcing operation that provides outcome-based, effective and efficient services to acquire goods and services for the City.
  • Oversee operational excellence and integrity by establishing goals and objectives to promote optimum effectiveness and ensure implementation of appropriate policies and practices that meet the Service Plan goals and objectives.

 

  1. TEAM LEADERSHIP
  • Lead and be accountable for the Purchasing team in its day-to-day activities.
  • Lead, motivate and retain a team of high performing employees that is capable of delivering results.
  • Coach, mentor and initiate training of staff to guide their professional development and succession planning.
  • Lead the implementation of opportunities to increase the productivity of the Purchasing team, reduce risk to the City, and improve project outcomes and increase quality of service to client departments.
  • Lead strategic change to meet organizational goals, particularly in aspects related to decision making and generating consensus.

 

  1. EXECUTION
  • Be accountable and responsible for the stewardship of the Cityâ€™s procurement policy and procedures, as well as identification and implementation of improvements
  • Oversee the supplier selection and negotiation process with a view to achieving total cost, service and quality improvements on an on-going basis.
  • Measure and track performance; lead the development and delivery of analytics to support effective target-setting, cost management; savings and procurement strategies.
  • Manage conflicting priorities to deliver the highest value initiatives that support key objectives while respecting organizational capacity.
  • Identify and define sourcing best-practices; partner with key stakeholders to ensure adoption
  • Develop the annual expense budget for the division and achieve management targets.
  • Complies with all Health & Safety regulations and policies.

 

  1. CUSTOMER SERVICE
  • Provide qualified strategic and tactical procurement advice to staff, departmental clients and other stakeholders.
  • Liaise and interact with government agencies, public and private sector organizations, departments and Council to exchange information and acquire knowledge.
  • Deliver quality procurement services in a timely and cost effective manner.

 

  1. RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT
  • Build effective working relationships at all levels, particularly with senior leaders in client departments across the City, ensuring the highest possible level of client satisfaction and being established as a trusted advisor.
  • Build and foster strong working relationships and collaborative arrangements with internal and external customers, stakeholders, business and community leaders, sponsors, public and the media

 

  1. COMMUNICATION
  • Ability to interact with internal and external key stakeholders, community groups, government agencies, public and private sector organizations
  • Attend Council, Committee and Senior Management Team meetings to represent the division, provide expert advice and recommendations to influence decision-making that have positive outcomes.
  • Liaise with departments to develop specifications which facilitate acquisition of high quality goods and services from reliable vendors at reasonable prices.
  • Present findings and recommendations in a compelling way at the senior level.
  • Review and approve business proposals, reports prepared by staff for presentations to senior management, Council, stakeholders and recommend changes as required to influence effective decision-making.
  • Provide professional consultation, including reports to Council and Committees.

 

  1. CORPORATE CONTRIBUTION
  • Maintain an awareness of developments within the disciplines of the division to develop short and long-term plans and recommend innovative strategies for growth and expansion.
  • Ensure purchasing compliance with provincial and federal statutes and regulations and municipal by-laws and policies.

 

  1. BUDGET ACCOUNTABILITY
  • Direct and control the divisionâ€™s budget, ensuring approvals and spending are consistent with operating objectives to ensure budget compliance.
  • Ensure that all financial and procedural requirements are carried out in accordance with corporate financial policies.
  • Use of effective resource and expense management at all times to meet corporate policies and guidelines.

 

  1. TEAMWORK AND COOPERATION
  • Ability to foster engagement, debate and discuss building of consensus to achieve Service Plan goals and objectives.
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment to achieve Service Plan goals and objectives while respecting diverse cultural backgrounds and perspectives.
  • Demonstrate success developing and implementing multi-faceted Service Plans for diverse stakeholders with wide-ranging impacts.
  • Promote teamwork and integration between sections within the division and with other stakeholders participating in cross-function program initiatives.
  • Demonstrate corporate values at all times.

 

 

SELECTION CRITERIA:

 

EDUCATION:

  • Post-secondary degree in Business Administration, Law or another relevant discipline
  • Completion of a CPA designation (CA, CMA, CGA) or Masterâ€™s Degree in a relevant discipline is an asset
  • Professional designation from a recognized purchasing association - Certified Supply Chain Management Professional (CSCMP) or Certified Public Procurement Officer (CPPO) or Certified Professional Purchaser (CPP)

   

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • 7-10 years progressive Purchasing experience; preferably in Municipal environment
  • 5-7 years leadership experience; Ability to lead, influence, direct and motivate staff
  • Senior management experience in a large highly diversified public or private sector

   

OTHER SKILLS AND ASSETS:

 

  • Knowledge of construction law, related legislation
  • Experience in tendering practices and public procurement
  • Experience leading strategic change to meet organizational goals
  • Strong diplomatic, facilitation, influencing, collaborative and consensus-building skills
  • Experience contributing in a significant capacity to complex, solution oriented projects
  • Expert knowledge of Municipal, Regional, Provincial and Federal Governments, applicable Legislations and awareness of current social, economic and political priorities
  • Ability to interact with internal and external key stakeholders, community groups, government agencies, public and private sector organizations
  • Ability to work with suppliers and manage supplier relationships
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Experience developing policies and procedures and ensuring compliance
  • Ability to prioritize highly complex tasks with critical deadlines
  • Highly-developed Analytical skills for complex problem solving; Fiscal and Financial acumen
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office/SharePoint
  • Experience working with a large corporate Enterprise Financial System

 

 

#LI-NR2

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Alternate formats will be provided upon request.

 

Interview:   Our  recruitment  process  will  be  completed  with video conference technology.

                                                                                                                   

As part of the corporationâ€™s Modernizing Job Evaluation project, this position will undergo an evaluation which may result in a change to the rate of compensation.   Any changes affecting this position will be communicated as information becomes available.

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above (quoting reference #104730, by May 22, 2022 and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A criminal record search will be required of the successful candidate to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

title: Senior Sourcing Manager
description:
Job Description:

IGM Financial Inc. is one of Canada's leading diversified wealth and asset management companies with approximately $271 billion in total assets under managements. The company provides a broad range of financial planning and investment management services to help more than two million Canadians meet their financial goals. Its activities are carried out principally through IG Wealth Management, Mackenzie Investments and Investment Planning Counsel.

 

Under IGM Financialâ€™s unique business model based on leading brands and multi-channel distribution strategy is Mackenzie Investments, founded in 1967.   Mackenzie Investments is a holistic asset-management partner for thousands of Canadian financial advisors and the investors they support.  

 

At Mackenzie Investments You Can Build Your Career with Confidence.

 

We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them. As part of our team, you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.   We are proud to be recognized as one of Greater Torontoâ€™s Top Employers (2022) by Mediacorp Canada Inc. for empowering our employees with the tools to thrive while working remotely, while also providing resources to ensure physical and mental wellness were put front and centre.

 

Join an unstoppable team that is embedded in continuous learning, understanding, and knowledge sharing. You will thrive in our supportive environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn, while receiving the feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities. We are dedicated to offering a hybrid work environment when applicable.

 

Mackenzie Investments is a diverse workplace committed to doing business inclusively - this starts with having a representative workforce! We encourage applications from all qualified candidates that represent the diversity present across Canada â€“ including racialized persons, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+ community, gender diverse and neurodiverse individuals, as well as all who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

 

Job Purpose

  • The Senior Strategic Sourcing Manager reports to the Director of Strategic Procurement and is responsible for leading the execution of procurement activities in the functional areas of Procurement Strategy, Strategic Sourcing and Contract Development supporting corporate services business units. The Senior Strategic Sourcing Manager will be responsible for leading the end-to-end sourcing activities for developing complete and comprehensive procurement packages for high complexity / dollar deals and supporting the shared team of Sourcing Managers on small to medium complexity / dollar deals by providing coaching and guidance.
  • Where appropriate, the Senior Strategic Sourcing Manager will support the Director of Strategic Procurement on confidential and highly strategic RFx deals and complex negotiations supporting real estate and facilities, human resources, client operations and marketing initiatives.

 

Key Accountabilities

  • Strategic Oversight
    • Leads the strategic procurement plan for their assigned Business Unit(s) by translating it into a set of implementable and measurable plans and targets
    • Sets the direction of business requirements, spend analysis, sourcing strategy development and management, contract management, compliance, vendor management, commercial risk management and procurement methods for their assigned Business Unit(s)
    • Contributes to the development and implementation of the goals, objectives, and budget for their assigned Business Unit(s)
    • Collaborates with the assigned Business Unit(s) to develop the annual procurement plan and ongoing supplier engagements    

  • Category/Supplier Strategy
    • Provides advisory to assigned Business Unit(s) relating to sourcing strategies, market research, spend analytics and vendor management  
    • Leads development of business unit sourcing / procurement strategies leveraging market trends to meet objectives of each procurement activity
    • Analyzes and understands all potential risks at the category/supplier level that can put safety, compliance, or public relations image at risk and to develop appropriate mitigation strategies
    • Continuously support and contribute to the development of innovative procurement strategies to drive continuous improvement and client value
    • Monitoring and identifying potential new entrants and non-traditional vendors
    • Remains actively involved in industry-related groups, associations, and regulators

  • Strategic Sourcing
    • Interacts with the assigned BU(s) to develop business requirements for all RFX / competitive bid processes; where appropriate, provides strategic advisory support on technical specifications for all deal complexities / dollar values
    • Lead internal resources and client groups in supporting the development of a sourcing strategy or planning of a sourcing exercise and ensuring alignment with the overall category strategy
    • Leads and manages the RFx deal team of Procurement resources and internal client groups in preparation of RFX / competitive bid documents and evaluation criteria based on internal customer requirements, available templates, and category expertise for high complexity / dollar deals
    • Leads and manages the RFX / competitive bid process from issue, evaluation, negotiations, and vendor selection for high complexity / dollar deals
    • Manages the evaluation of RFX responses against a set of pre-defined criteria, including management of Business Unit responses for high complexity / dollar deals
    • Collaborates with client groups in recommending and providing decisions on optimal vendors that best meet the evaluation criteria and objectives of the business
    • Provides coaching and oversight on the execution of low to medium complexity / dollar deals led by the team of Sourcing Managers
  • Contract Development & Management
    • Leads the drafting, negotiating, and finalizing of contracts on high complexity / dollar deals based on the sourcing event outcomes while providing coaching and oversight on low to medium complexity / dollar deals    
    • Collaborates with BU in seeking proactive resolution of contractual disputes, manages variations and claims  
    • Coaches BU contract owners to drive performance and compliance of contracts  
    • Oversees contract change orders, amendments, and management is being managed effectively by the team of Sourcing Managers and Senior Procurement Specialists    
    • Responsible for reviewing and ensuring contract package is completed and forwarded to the contract administration function  
    • Ensures appropriate responses and/or documents are provided to address the requests from internal and external stakeholders    
  • Talent & People Management
    • Ensures performance objectives are clearly defined and articulated  
    • Provides timely and comprehensive feedback on staff performance during review periods  
    • Coordinates workforce planning to maximize productivity while meeting project demands; promotes collaboration amongst the team  
    • Retains quality people; develops a team of professionals by cross-training, coaching, and mentoring  
    • Leads development plan for closing competency gaps for the Procurement staff and the development and deployment of procurement training to improve capabilities  
    • Responsible for training and skills planning for the strategic and tactical and operational procurement staff  
    • Responsible for creating the development plan for closing competency gaps in Procurement and the development and deployment of procurement training to improve capabilities  

 

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field â€“ business, engineering, or related field is preferred.
  • 5-7 years of experience in procurement or sourcing and analytic function. Leadership in governance, process, systems, and data functions are considered an asset.
  • Professional Supply Chain Certification (i.e., CSCP, PMAC, SCMP) is considered an asset.
  • Ensures performance objectives are clearly defined and articulated
  • Provides timely and comprehensive feedback on staff performance during review periods
  • Coordinates workforce planning to maximize productivity while meeting project demands; promotes collaboration amongst the team
  • Retains quality people; develops a team of professionals by cross-training, coaching, and mentoring
  • Leads development plan for closing competency gaps for the Procurement staff and the development and deployment of procurement training to improve capabilities
  • Responsible for training and skills planning for the strategic and tactical and operational procurement staff
  • Responsible for creating the development plan for closing competency gaps in Procurement and the development and deployment of procurement training to improve capabilities
  • Experience in data visualization tools, such as Tableau is considered an asset.

 

Please visit our career page by clicking on the following link: https://www.mackenzieinvestments.com/en/careers

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in Mackenzie Investments; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Mackenzie Investments is an accessible employer committed to providing a barrier free recruitment experience. If you require an accommodation or this information in an alternate format at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team who will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Purchasing Manager - Amico Group of Companies
description:
PURCHASING MANAGER – Amico Group of Companies
Richmond Hill, Ontario

Would you like to work for a global company that is dedicated to personal career growth? Amico Corporation is a leading manufacturer of Medical Equipment with 9 manufacturing facilities employing over 750 people across North America.

Qualifications:
  • Formal college or university education completed, preferably in a Business program
  • Minimum 5 years professional working experience
  • Minimum 3 years management experience
  • Strong organizational and leadership skills
  • High degree of awareness for supply chain risk analysis
  • Demonstrated experience in areas of procurement, sourcing, and management
  • Knowledge of BV/SAP is an asset
  • Proficient computer skills (MS Outlook, Word, Excel)
  • Possesses strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Mandarin speaking is an asset
  • Experience or working knowledge in metal fabrication and manufacturing industry is preferred

Responsibilities:
  • Lead a team of Purchasing Agents to ensure a sustainable supply chain for production
  • Liaise with cross functional teams such as suppliers, production, engineering and customer service to ensure goods are available to meet production requirements on time
  • Collaborate with Sourcing team to cost reduce while maintaining regular operations undisturbed
  • Review cost analyses from Purchasing team with Management to forecast and propose ordering plans
  • Provide training, coaching and mentorship to team members. Drive a culture of creativity, innovation and continuous learning
  • Ensure that all direct reports are familiar with, trained on, and follow all quality system procedures related to their job
  • Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficiency of team
  • Vendor management alongside with team members to develop good rapport
  • Monitor inventory levels and expenditures
  • Prepare regular reports as required by Management
  • Develop strong product knowledge together with Purchasing team to better facilitate day-to-day procurement needs with vendors
Amico Corporation offers:
  • Opportunities for Advancement
  • Comprehensive Benefit package
  • Employer Paid Vacation
  • Employee Referral Program

For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com.

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Director of Vendor Management & Procurement
description:
At Figment, our mission is to create an Internet that is truly decentralized where users can freely interact, share, collaborate, and exchange goods and services in a trustless environment. We offer staking, middleware, and application layer solutions for token holders and developers investing in and building on Web 3 technologies. Together, we can build a better Internet.

Summary

The position is responsible for leading Figment's vendor management and procurement activities and capabilities as well as strategic vision and direction. Reporting directly to our CISO, you will be responsible for driving high-level strategic conversations and decisions with vendors. In this role, you have a direct impact on Figment's ability to source, select and manage the relationships with industry leading partners and vendors. You must be comfortable with handling multiple projects, priorities while ensuring expectations are managed and met. You will also have the opportunity to manage a team of talented individuals, grow their skills through coaching and leadership as well as develop their career growth within the organization.

What you will be doing

  • Own and manage all things Vendor Relations, Procurement and Inventory
  • Being internal point of contact for vendors and nurturing relationships over time
  • Working with internal stakeholders to ensure vendors meet our needs and performance standards
  • Apply effective strategic sourcing and negotiation strategies 
  • Monitor vendor performance, deliverables and ensure contractual obligations are met
  • Analyze pricing, vendor stability, and proposals to ensure a fair, ethical and level playing field
  • Advise on costs, risks and business impacts of decisions
  • Lead and mentor and grow a team of Procurement Specialists 
  • Act as a coach for team members, with a strong sense of empathy and transparency
  • Participate in regular review meetings with cross-functional teams to pulse check on vendor performance
  • Participate in strategic meetings with vendors and business leaders to ensure execution of defined strategies
  • Actively seek ways to streamline business processes; research and provide information on industry category trends and best practices
  • Lead reporting, through data analytics dashboards and metrics 

What you will bring to the team

  • Proven track record of vendor relationship management, with at least 5+ years of experience
  • Clear understanding of licensing models, budget allocation and management 
  • Ability to lead, coach and mentor a team, demonstrating leadership and empathy
  • Strong communication skills and a natural ability to build and nurture relationships
  • Being keen to solve problems, juggle multiple priorities and drive projects autonomously
  • A strong sense of responsibility in maintaining confidentiality of sensitive information 

Types of vendors you will be dealing with

  • Public cloud providers, such as AWS and GCP
  • A variety of SaaS tools and products
  • Application virtualization tools
  • Experience in dealing with licensing model
  • Financial systems 

Experience managing these types of vendors will be key in this role! 

What you could bring to the team

  • An interest or experience in the blockchain space 
  • Experience working in high-growth, fast-paced organizations

Benefits & Impact 

  • Remote First + Hybrid Working Environment: Fully remote first teams with regular team retreats to foster team bonding. 
  • Professional Culture: A culture of honesty, professionalism and risk taking in a high growth environment
  • Work/Life Flexibility: remote work with a flexible PTO policy - 20 days PTO plus 5 flexible days. 
  • Family-Friendly Benefits: best in class parental leave and flexible arrangements 
  • Health & Wellness: company-paid medical/vision/dental for employee and family
  • Compensation: Comprehensive package including competitive salary, bonus and equity

About Figment

At Figment, our mission is to support the adoption, growth and long term success of the Web 3 ecosystem. This is Figment's unique approach: we make it simple to build on the next generation of blockchain technology.

We provide enterprise grade node and staking infrastructure and developer tools while also actively participating in community & governance.

title: Director, Procurement (Logistics)
description:
Description


Hey, we’re Article. We’re a digital-first furniture brand that’s working to make everyday living better by providing an easy way for people to furnish their space. We don’t have brick and mortar stores, so we’re able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. Recently named one of Canada’s fastest growing companies for the second year in a row, we’re on the hunt for talented, enthusiastic team members to join us in one of our fulfillment center locations near Vancouver, Houston, Jacksonville or Los Angeles.

We’re looking for a Director of Procurement to define and execute our Logistics spending. You will be an integral part of managing our contracts for our inbound ocean freight, drayage, domestic less than truckload/truckload, parcel, home delivery and warehousing facilities. As a subject matter expert, you will be advising the business teams on new spending initiatives and creating real bottom line value for the business. 

Team Size/Dynamic: Reporting to the VP of Logistics, you will be a key part of driving our Procurement Operations team. We are currently looking to grow and establish a team of six procurement professionals specializing in Ocean, Real Estate, Fleet, Drayage, Linehaul and WH Consumables. As part of the Procurement Operations team, you will collaborate closely to provide an effective spend management process while being supported by our Warehousing, Delivery, Transportation and the newly formed Logistics Excellence team. 

What you’ll do


  • Manage our total Logistics spend across facilities, supplies, equipment; build a culture of long-term saving on procurement costs
  • Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve the effectiveness of the function
  • Anticipate/forecast industry changes to ensure our business is informed and adapting
  • Use the best tools possible, such as Request for Quotes, Request for Proposal and Reverse Bids to ensure the best results
  • Innovate on how we spend, ensure we have the best solution
  • Support our Operations with solutions that are better than today
  • Manage our vendors and partners, find new ones that fit us better, set us up for success

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise


  • 10+ years of experience in Procurement
  • Experience and knowledge in ocean freight, domestic truckload and industrial real estate 
  • 5+ years leading teams that execute the day-to-day vendor and pricing management
  • Well versed in balancing cost, service and quality
  • Negotiation and networking skills
  • Ability to make data-based decisions
  • An industry expert, you know people and people know you

Benefits


We want Article to be an amazing place to work, and we do our part to take care of our team. In addition to a competitive salary, we provide:
  • A team-oriented work environment. Article is lucky to employ a wide range of experts and seeks to facilitate a culture of mentorship and curiosity. We take the job learning seriously, and we have a lot of fun doing it. 
  • Most HQ staff are currently working from home due to COVID-19, and we plan to return to our beautiful office as soon as it is safe for everyone to do so. The Article space is housed in a converted warehouse with in-house photo studios, an airy open layout, an open kitchen filled with snacks, and a variety of ice cream choices just up the street. 
  • A dog-friendly office. We love our dog friends here at Article. If you have a well-behaved, well-socialized pup, we’d love to have them in the office too.
  • The tools you need to get your job done well! We supply state-of-the-art laptops and the software you need to succeed.
  • Access to a benefits package with all the bells and whistles
  • Onsite fitness equipment, change rooms (including towel service!) and bike storage
  • Discounts on our products so you can style your home how you like it
  • Regular extra-curricular activities, such as socials, open-mics, picnics... even cross-country skiing! We’re open to suggestions for fun new activities so bring a few ideas along.
Ready to become a Particle? Apply today. We're excited to meet you.

#INDARTICLESCz
#LI-Remote

title: Senior Director of Inventory Management
description:
Reporting to the VP of Customer Support and Inventory Management, the SR Director of Inventory Management, leads key performance reporting, order planning activity, inventory allocation, data maintenance, and all inventory auditing activities as well as overseeing our Central Parts Warehousing and Machine Pre-Delivery Inspection Centers. Supporting the SR Director is a team of highly motivated and professional Directors and Managers that have responsibility and oversight for each specific business unit, currently:

  • Wholegoods & Standard Attachments – Distributed Products
  • Parts & Commodity Attachments – Distributed Products
  • Central Warehousing and Pre-Delivery – Distributed Products
  • Parts, Attachments & Central Warehousing – Manufactured Products

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Provide leadership and management to drive continuous improvement in product planning, order management, stocking levels, inventory turns, fill rates and distribution process.
  • Lead the tracking and analysis of asset configurations, sales history, and trends.
  • Develop reporting for all necessary metrics and key performance indicators as required.
  • Accountable for all stocking logic management.
  • Working with vendors to understand order lead times, future constraints, or products changes.
  • Implement supply chain solutions to provide the most efficient delivery to dealership locations, while helping to control costs.
  • Provide broad guidance to the team and ensure they have the necessary knowledge to effectively manage the inventory within their area of responsibility.
  • Provide leadership on parts pricing strategies to ensure Brandt achieves margin expectations while achieving revenue targets.
  • Responsible for strategic implementation and inventory management of all future locations.
  • Continually evaluate practices and processes while developing and implementing improvements.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Previous managerial experience and be a highly motivated individual who possesses excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Strong work ethic and character.
  • Must be an analytical thinker and be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Products, especially Excel.
  • Experience within the equipment industry, inventory management, warehousing or supply-chain.
  • 10 years of relevant management experience and/or post-secondary education in Business Administration, Mathematics, Analytics, or similar discipline would be considered an asset.

title: Materials Buyer
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

Reporting directly to the Manager, Buyer, the Materials Buyer will be responsible for procurement functions directly associated with the company's needs for raw materials. They will manage relationships with suppliers, strategically forecast material demands and accurately maintain purchase orders including delivery dates and pricing.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Adhere to and enforce compliance with purchasing policies, procedures, regulations, and laws
  • Develop a close working relationship with suppliers
  • Submit orders for the organization in a timely and cost-effective manner.
  • Coordinate the onboarding and setup of new vendors and any vendor modifications that are required
  • Assist in ad hoc pricing management with the supplier along with the return of items to vendors and coordinate subsequent credits, refunds, or replacements
  • Optimize on-hand inventory levels to improve cash flow and develop stocking strategies to ensure a smooth flow of raw materials in alignment with the production schedule
  • Investigate and resolve invoicing discrepancies submitted by vendors compared to the negotiated terms using diplomacy and tact
  • Remain abreast of pricing trends, changes, restrictions, or any other variables that could affect purchasing strategies
  • Apply strategic forecasting methods to ensure the availability of all necessary materials required to support the business. Including providing vendors forecasts, ITP’s and greige orders
  • Provide recommendations to the Replenishment Planning Manager regarding expected or unexpected material shortages and make alternate arrangements in the event of shortages or delayed deliveries to minimize impact on the organization
  • Coordinate the disposal of obsolete and excess materials as governed by specific laws and policy thereby maximizing financial return


Experience, Education and Designations:

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a buyer and/or inventory planner
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office software suites
  • Experience with ERP systems, bonus points for experience with D365


Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:

  • Knowledge of inventory control procedures
  • Ability to work in a high pressure and fast paced environment
  • Team orientated with a customer service approach to work
  • Strong time management, organization and multitasking abilities
  • Sound analytical thinking, planning and execution skills

title: Contracts Administrator
description:
About NCR


NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a leading software- and services-led enterprise provider in the financial, retail and hospitality industries. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with 36,000 employees globally. NCR is a trademark of NCR Corporation in the United States and other countries.




Reporting to the Manager, ATM Management Services, the Contracts Administrator is responsible for the review and interpretation of vendor and client contracts to ensure that clients’ accounts and ATM set up/ changes are done accurately and in a timely manner in the master database. The consistency and maintenance of accurate data in all systems is crucial to the successful operation of equipment and numerous reports distributed both internally, to management, and externally to clients.




Duties & Responsibilities:



+ Contract review for compliance with Cardtronics policies and Network guidelines and regulations


+ Enter contractual data into internal systems in order to activate or update ATM’s for processing transactions


+ Enter/update and validate daily and monthly settlement/account profiles for customers based on contractual obligations


+ Enter/update accounts payable and receivable customer profiles in ORACLE Review orders from Sales to validate terms and conditions are met


+ Scan all relevant contractual data into internal systems


+ Create physical file and store according to internal policy


+ Update all contractual changes in internal systems


+ Assist customers with settlement reconciliation questions


+ Work with sales team and distributors to ensure compliance with Cardtronics polices and Network guidelines and regulations


+ Ensure that all network web applications are kept up to date


+ Other duties as assigned Knowledge





Skills & Qualifications:



+ Post-Secondary education or equivalent experience


+ Strong attention to details and quality control, with the ability to identify contractual risk.


+ Ability to work autonomously or within a team environment



Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.




EEO Statement Integrated into our shared values is NCR's commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment.


Statement to Third Party Agencies To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR employees, or any NCR facility. NCR is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
Kinetic Construction provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on the Lower Mainland and Vancouver Island. “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement” is who we are, in our day to day these values operationalize as “Together Building Better”. Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods to complete large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Vancouver, Victoria and Courtenay. We collaborate with like-minded partners to create a better industry for everyone.

Our people are the most important factor to our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture and the necessary support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner, curious and driven to succeed as a team we want you to be part of our team.

Kinetic Construction Ltd. has an opportunity within our Vancouver Branch to bring in an experienced Contracts Manager to provide support to the Branch Manager and Estimating Manager in bid tender and pursuit preparation, pre-construction services and project management. This position will be accountable for the successful delivery of construction projects within the Vancouver Branch Office.

  • Degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related discipline
  • 10+ years’ experience in ICI Construction, or related field
  • LEED understanding
  • Demonstrated success in multiple project delivery methods
  • Effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Highly effective negotiation, diplomacy and conflict-resolution skills
  • Advanced knowledge of construction techniques
  • Commitment to working in a team environment and good team building skills.
  • Experience (or commitment to learn) Lean Construction practices
  • Effective with Microsoft Office and Procore
  • Ability to establish strong working relationships with subtrades and clients

Key Attributes:

  • Teamwork: Collaborates and proactively assists and involves others
  • Passion: Inspired to meet and exceed goals both individually and as a team
  • Respect: Contributes to a positive working environment
  • Excellence: Consistently challenges the status quo in the spirit of continuous improvement
  • Integrity: Accountable and transparent; ethical and fair
  • Community Minded: Actively involved in the communities in which we live and work

Together Building Better:

  • 100% employee owned
  • Competitive compensation and bonus
  • Strong benefits package
  • Substantial vacation time
  • Stable work-life balance
  • Training, education, and development opportunities
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Supportive culture
  • A healthy and positive work environment
  • Perks through our strategic partners

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected to move forward in the application process will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Contract Manager (Multiple Locations, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Reference code: 103504   
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto 

 

Our Purpose


Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
 


If you want to be challenged and have a great learning experience this is the role for you.
 

What will your typical day look like?


We are looking for an individual to assist with the increase in the complexities associated with contractual arrangements and to manage current contracts that have been agreed to that contain elements of risk that needs to be monitored and managed to minimize risk exposure.  Primary responsibility will be to manage the life cycle of complex contracts with large clients and a secondary function will include the review of request for proposal and contractual documents to make an assessment on risk and to mitigate the risk through contractual negotiations and/or establishing risk mitigation strategies. 
 

About the team


The role will be supporting both the Consulting within Deloitte and sits within the Service Excellence team that supports practitioners on all their deal services needs.  We currently have a team of 15 people and expanding. Consulting's compliment of 250+ Partners / Directors and their teams is growing rapidly. 
 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you


You are someone who is:
 

  • Proficient in handling legal terms and conditions
  • Can handle managing complex contracts
  • Confident in communicating and articulating positions on contracts
  • Able to build strong relationships and confidence
  • Ability to multitask and managing conflicting priorities
     

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? 
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Purchasing Manager | Purchasing Manager
description:
GN Thermoforming Equipment in Chester, Nova Scotia is looking for a Purchasing Manager. The Purchasing Manager will participate in the procurement of and manage direct materials buyers to obtain goods and services in the most efficient and effective means to satisfy the requirement.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Locate, qualify and develop appropriate sources of goods and services.
  2. Solicit and evaluate bid requests from appropriate suppliers and manufacturers to determine the ranking of suppliers for potential purchases.
  3. Negotiate with suppliers for optimal results of cost, delivery, quality and service.
  4. Measure supplier performance in terms of cost, delivery, quality and service.
  5. Process purchase orders through the business system.
  6. Follow-up and expedite timely receipt of backordered items.
  7. Coordinate inbound freight means to meet delivery and cost requirements.
  8. Verify and resolve discrepancies between purchase orders and invoices.
  9. Coordinate the return of faulty and/or incorrect goods, and negotiate credit for rework labour incurred by GN.
  10. Participate in the resolution of disbursement error and inventory discrepancies.
  11. Inform manufacturing personnel and manager of situations or conditions which would cause to miss scheduled deliveries, quality, or cost objectives after taking all actions required within their own area of responsibility and control.
  12. Provide general oversight of purchasing function for direct goods and services as directed.
  13. Participate in purchasing function for other non-direct goods and services as directed.
  14. Identify and make recommendation on areas for improvement within departmental direct reports, departmental processes, and supply chain.
  15. Recommend and determine assignment of purchased goods to self & other direct report buyers to ensure workload and company initiatives are met.
  16. Establish and maintain key relationships with top suppliers.
  17. Create and keep track of savings opportunities throughout all locations.
  18. Administer annual pricing negotiation process with supplier base to minimize cost increases and lock suppliers into long-term agreements under fixed pricing.
  19. Perform other related duties and special projects as may be required.

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS:

  1. Bachelors or Technical Degree in Business and/or 5 years’ experience in Purchasing.
  2. High proficiency in MS365 including MS Excel & Access. Syspro ERP would be an asset.
  3. General computer skills.
  4. Oral and Written Communication skills.
  5. Interpersonal skills.
  6. Purchasing certifications (SCMP, CIPP) would be an asset.
  7. Management experience in a manufacturing environment would be an asset.

ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  1. Must be willing & able to travel domestically and internationally.
  2. Office & factory floor setting.
