title: Manager, Menswear Buying
description:
Company Description

SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else™.

SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description

Reporting to the Vice- President, Menswear Buying  the Manager, Menswear Buying  is responsible for achieving SSENSE seasonal Menswear buying targets and executing on the Menswear Buying strategy by building and leading a team of Buying Professionals and ensuring outstanding relationships with vendors. The ideal candidate is a demonstrated leader with an elevated taste level, exceptional analytical abilities, and the  ability to execute merchandising strategies to effectively drive the buying plan in a fast-paced, hyper growth environment.

Responsibilities

People Leadership & Development - 25%

  • Manage the growth and development of a team; coaching on all aspects of the business including data driven analysis, negotiations, issue management, and SSENSE POV
  • Collaborate with Senior Leadership to establish the short term objectives for the department and ensure team's are engaged towards achieving the department's missions. 
  • Translate topline Menswear objectives into group and individual merchandising strategies. 
  • Lead, motivate, and inspire the team, clearly communicating goals and targets and fostering an environment focused on growth
  • Work with Senior Leadership to create and support effective engagement action plans for the team based on employee feedback resulting in a transparent, collaborative, inclusive and productive work environment for all team members 
  • Provide regular reporting on the development of the team and its deliverables to the Vice- President, Menswear Buying 
  • Hold weekly one-on-ones, conduct performance reviews, analyze individual KPIs and assess promotion readiness to help each contributor evolve in their role
  • Design, create and lead training sessions for the team to upskill their capabilities in opportune areas resulting in successful business expansion
  • Lead hiring efforts to attract and retain top talent of Buyers
  • Responsible for managing the onboarding and training of new team members

Vendor Relationships - 35%

  • Work with Senior Leadership to identify new business opportunities and execute on the go forward strategy, ensuring updates are communicated back to senior leadership in a timely manner, tasks are delegated out to direct reports and ensuring continued alignment throughout the year
  • Lead strategic external negotiations relating to high-investment and priority partnerships 
  • Provide mentorship and guidance in external negotiations to ensure delivery of strategic and seasonal menswear targets
  • Maintain a strong pulse on the market and identify strategic opportunities to attract new brands to SSENSE
  • Develop relationships with new vendors and negotiate terms, conditions and exclusivities
  • Optimize brand and product performance by negotiating terms and marketing opportunities through co-op
  • Foster, develop, and maintain strong vendor relationships in order to be recognized as a driving force in fashion

Operations -  40% 

  • Attain seasonal targets including budgets, margins and sell through for defined team 
  • Create monthly reporting recap with key findings, results and new developments and present to Senior Leadership
  • Optimize Buying  processes by identifying opportunities and present actionable solutions to Senior Leadership
  • Review all purchase orders for defined team and provide guidance based on thorough analysis and industry trends
  • Maintain a small portfolio of brands and ensure performance targets are achieved
  • Ensure seasonal and special project deliverables are consistently met
  • Partner with the Merchandise Planning team and Senior Leadership to identify opportunities; translate opportunities into actionable strategy 
  • Manage the team schedules including travel, time-off requests, and oversee all people management operations pertaining to direct reports  
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Fashion, Commerce, or a related field
  • A minimum of 2 years managerial experience in a similar role
  • A minimum of 5-7 years experience as a Buyer, preferably in the fashion, e-commerce or luxury industry. Menswear experience is preferred. 
  • Thorough understanding of the global menswear landscape with pre-existing relationships with vendors
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in both French and English 

Skills

  • Strong leadership, time management, and problem solving skills
  • Highly analytical with a strong understanding of retail math
  • Well spoken and articulate with excellent oral communication skills
  • Confidence and credibility with solid track record in networking and negotiating
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a natural ability to build relationships


Additional Information

We are accepting applicants who reside in NYC and London, UK.

title: Procurement Project Manager
description:
Location: Toronto, Canada

Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.

Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification & Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office. Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!

The Procurement Project Manager provides efficient and cost effective purchasing support to Projects contributing to the profitability/competitiveness of the Procurement work packages. PPM role is fully integrated within a Project Team responsible to manage the procurement scope for equipment and subcontracting for delivery within the budget, schedule and at the required quality.

PPM works upstream with the Project team and Category Manager, to develop the Procurement strategy in line with contractual Project requirements.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Procurement Project Manager is responsible for timely and cost-effective provision of supplies and services for projects according to the project schedule, sales forecast, and project costing. The PPM manages and coordinates the interfaces among Project Management, Engineering and the project supply chain for the projects in accordance with company policies and procedures.
  • Work with the Project team, to develop the Procurement Strategy and ensure the strategy is in line with contractual requirements and communicated within the Project and Procurement NORAM team
  • Development of the Acquisition Plan to identify how the procurement strategy to be implemented across the Project, following Thales Procurement Management Process tailored to the Project.
  • Implementation of the Acquisition Management Process following Chorus guidelines
  • Participate to formulating and implementing the Make/Team/Buy strategy for the Project as applicable
  • Focus supply chain costs optimization early in the life cycle ensuring savings are achieved against budget Analyze costs of equipment and systems to identify focus areas or opportunities for reduction
  • Develop and implement Purchasing Savings Opportunities plan (competitiveness plan)
  • Identify Procurement/Suppliers Risks and develop mitigation plans.
  • Collaborate with and influence Engineering for the Design and Delivery Management, including methodology for achieving the design release schedule and savings.
  • Project execution through implementation of the Acquisition Project Plan: ensures convergence of risks, cost and lead times within the specified quality parameters and engage corrective action for any deviations to plan with minimal supervision on assigned projects
  • Review package progress and performance formally with GTS Family purchasing team and ensure issues are tracked, managed and escalated as required
  • Conduct  and contribute to the Post Mortem Analysis (lessons learned) with Family  buyers, PMO and Engineering for the Acquisition work packages in the Project

Key Requirements:

  • B.Sc. or B.Eng. in Engineering or equivalent relevant degree
  • 7 +  years’ experience in a project-based organization, Project Management experience
  • Maintain and demonstrate superior interpersonal written and oral skills in daily relations, negotiations, and reporting
  • Maintain complete and effective lines of communication with Project team members and senior management
  • Report on a regular and periodic basis achievements, issues and goals

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ability to interface well and influence effectively at all levels including internally and externally with customers, partners and suppliers
  • A strategic thinker who has the ability to work innovatively with sometimes-unclear briefs; a persistent and tenacious high achiever, with the ability to quickly learn new skills and concepts with the desire to become a future specialist, manager or leader.
  • Self starter, able to work with little supervision

#LI-Hybrid

Thales is required to follow mandatory customer policies as well as Federal and Provincial legislation, now and in the future.  This includes, but is not limited to, vaccination mandates and travel requirements.  This role requires you to work on a customer site and/or travel.   Therefore you must follow all mandatory customer policies and Federal and Provincial legislation as a condition of employment

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Software Vendor Management Lead
description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking and resolution minded Software Asset Management Lead who will be primarily responsible to provide analytical & operational support for the SAM practice across the landscape, and work to ensure and contribute efficient management of the software assets. Engagement and background with Procurement process is of benefit, as expectation is active support of lifecycle planning activities. Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and values teamwork.

If you feel you have the right profile please email me your word resume to aaron.lail@randstad.ca

Advantages
Focal Point

Captures Line of Business satisfaction trending and motivates change
Take a leadership role towards entrenching a “service culture” within IT
Develops key leading measures to drive efficiency of service
Drive maturity of the framework aligned organizational strategy

Responsibilities
Software Vendor Engagement

Establish & maintain relationships with our software vendors (publishers)
Assurance that publishers are aligned to internal security controls
Collect information for supporting budgeting, compliance & cost comparisons
Partner with Stakeholders to ensure alignment to IT strategy for software assets
Work in partnership with Finance for forecasted renewals
Support Procurement to ensure license entitlement & cost optimization
Work cohesively with Software Asset Mgmt. (SAM)
Optimize the use of IT assets throughout their life cycle
Act as an escalation point between 1st line (SAM) and vendors/LoB/management

Qualifications
What you’ll bring

Knowledge of Financial, Commercial & Risk would be of benefit
Scope of awareness of IT environments
Understanding of IT Contracts & Contract Management
Proficient in MS Office suite – specifically Excel
Analytical background and ability to present data (effectively)

Summary
Process Optimization & Control Framework

Depth of knowledge on ISF/P&O standards to support SAM directives
Identify opportunities within the current approach to improve vendor engagement
Influence culture shift to support high adoptability of changes
Lead process change & drive service improvements (includes TaT)
Lead efforts driving cost efficiencies & operational effectiveness

What you’ll bring

Knowledge of Financial, Commercial & Risk would be of benefit
Scope of awareness of IT environments
Understanding of IT Contracts & Contract Management
Proficient in MS Office suite – specifically Excel
Analytical background and ability to present data (effectively)
Abilities

Ability to manage customer expectations & communicate effectively
Able to make good judgments/decisions after detailed investigation
Ability to prioritize business need and understand inherent risk
Can adapt and is collaborative to the needs of different environments and people
Able to work independently or in a team with minimal direction

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Director, Procurement
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Company Overview

Intersect Power is a team of friends driven to preserve our planet for future generations through low-carbon energy and infrastructure solutions. Founded in 2016, the privately held clean energy company develops and owns some of the world’s largest clean energy resources serving customers in retail and wholesale energy markets across North America. The company is redefining the scope of the clean energy industry by enabling new pathways between clean electricity and the broader economy to enable the deep decarbonization of our economy. We are on an aggressive growth trajectory and are staffing key positions.

About This Position

The Director, Procurement will be responsible for engaging with the supply chain and driving equipment supply and EPC contracts independently. This position will report directly to the Vice President, Procurement and work closely with the Development, Engineering, Construction, Project Finance and Legal teams.

title: Contract Advisor
description:
Description:
Are you an experienced IT Procurement specialist with business & procurement technical knowledge and skills?
Agilus is recruiting for a Contract Advisor in the Oil and Gas Industry in Calgary, Alberta.
You will be responsible for managing the organization’s software agreement including reviewing, monitoring, executing, amending, and filing.
Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with IT and in-house legal counsel for reviewing various contractual documents
  • File agreements and any other contract related document as per organization’s policy
  • Support the Software Asset Management (SAM) team through negotiations of software licenses
  • Ensure transactions are conducted as per company’s contract risk management policy and process
  • Prepare weekly periodic reports as required

Must have:
  • 3 – 5 years related experience including reviewing, drafting and negotiating software contracts
  • Excellent understanding of contractual risk and able to interpret contract language
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to work effectively in a team situation and make good judgements regarding priorities with limited close supervision
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

Total rewards:
  • $42.00 hourly
  • Competitive compensation
  • Opportunity to work with an industry leader

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email aokanlawon@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
Job Description


We are seeking a driven individual with a passion for the produce industry. One of our clients is looking to add a strong Purchasing Manager to their team. Responsibilities include:


1) Manage daily purchasing activities, supervise staff and allocate tasks

2) Manage suppliers appropriately to achieve desired results and foster long term partnerships

3) Partner with the Category Managers to help implement and support category purchasing strategies

4) Provide guidance to buyers to ensure the purchase plan is followed

5) Create metrics to track and report on the department's performance

6) Provide regular feedback to team and drive for continuous improvement

7) Ensure that all procured items meet the required quality standards and specifications

8) Identify and capture cost savings through negotiation, improve quality and implement process improvements

9) Coordinate with inventory control to determine and manage inventory needs

10) Work to improve purchasing systems and processes

11) Train new employees in the purchasing process and how to use the purchasing system

12) Participate in projects, as needed

13) Provide support and escalate issues to the Senior Director of Procurement

14) Perform other duties as assigned

 

Critical Requirements


1) A university degree is required. Although all candidates are welcome and encouraged to apply, preference will be given to those with degrees in a relevant field

2) Appropriate full-time work experience is mandatory (no students or fresh graduates please)

3) Recent experience in the produce industry is strongly preferred

4) Preference will be given to candidates with recent experience in purchasing management


If you are qualified and aspire to work for an excellent, established company whose employees believe in teamwork and make great contributions to the industry, then this could be a golden opportunity for you. Please apply ASAP!


Compensation and Other Details


Base Salary: Highly competitive package, commensurate with experience

title: Contracts Manager
description:
You thrive on helping your team succeed through sharing the vision and using hands-on leadership to get the job done. You enjoy coming up with innovative recruitment strategies that lead to exceptional results. We're looking for a forward-thinking manager to lead our sub trade coordination team for a temporary one-year term.

The Contracts Manager is responsible for overseeing the sourcing of construction related trade contractors for multi-family residential builds throughout Western Canada. The role oversees day to day department tasks, risks associated with new and existing contracts, resources and strives to continually improve the Company's financial, product quality and operational performance.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Coach and supervise the day to day activities of sub trade coordinators
  • Assist with daily issues, questions, guidelines, processes
  • Implement team goals and provide performance feedback
  • Proactively address internal and external subtrade related conflict.
  • Responsible for Scope review, management and creation.  Review sub contract scopes for accuracy and job specificity.
  • Implement and train contract management process with Sub Trade Coordinators- change orders, back charges, RFIâ€™s, scope development, risk analysis, onboarding, payment schedules, contract negotiation techniques
  • Align budget lines, payment schedules and work schedules
  • Research and recommend contract management best practices process improvements
  • Initiate dispute and contract default resolution- including written warnings.  Ensure contract scopes, terms and conditions are being adhered to and enforced
  • Communicate and highlight sub-contractor risks- resource overlap and contractor planning
  • Supervise the negotiation creation, execution of contracts to maximize financial and operational performance
  • Administer and manage contracts with sub trades or required services
  • Negotiate contract terms and conditions, documenting any agreed changes and/or amendments
  • Over see and Coordinate the acquisition of new and replacement contracts 
  • Liaise with construction project teams on a continuous basis to ensure quality standards
  • Define and communicate detailed description of scope of work and payment schedule
  • Support construction site staff and Project Managers in coordinating sub trades timelines and onsite performace
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with customers, vendors and key stakeholders
  • Manage sub trade related warranty claims
  • Attend bi weekly back charge meetings.
  • Attend trade deficiency meetings.  Help resolve outstanding and overdue deficiency work. 
  • Network through industry contacts, association memberships, trade groups, and employees

REQUIREMENTS

  • Post-Secondary education in Business, Construction Management or equivalent
  • Experience in the residential construction industry
  • Familiar with design principles and practices
  • Comprehensive knowledge of contract laws and regulations
  • Ability to interpret, write and negotiate contractual agreements
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office and construction management software
  • Working knowledge of MS Project 
  • Proof of COVID-19 vaccination

 

Why Seymour Pacific?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Contracts Director (trice)
description:
Come make a difference in a modern city, in full expansion, which is committed to its citizens. An environment where your creativity contributes to the realization of great stimulating projects favoring the well-being of the Lavallois. In addition to offering you career opportunities, you will be part of a large public organization with human dimension.

For its supply service, the city of Laval is looking for a ( e):

Construction Contract Administrator Temporary extension with possibility of permanence

The challenges await you:

Under the authority of the immediate supervisor, you will ensure the management and monitoring of contracts between the city and various suppliers and entrepreneurs. You will coordinate the contract administration process. You will ensure that the deadlines are respected. You will follow up, establish the merits and negotiation of entrepreneurial claims, you will assist the project manager in managing business items and will be responsible for contracting communication with entrepreneurs. You will prepare and submit to your superior recommendations for your area of ​​expertise.

You will attend the preparation of works contracts, develop tender documents, contractual clauses and follow up on service and work contracts.

The desired profile:

  • have a university baccalaureate in engineering or economics or other related field;
  • have five (5) years of experience relevant to function;
  • possess experience in construction contract administration;
  • Possess experience in writing tender documents, construction design, turnkey, qualification and performance;
  • possess experience in setting up Delivery schedule point;
  • Have experience in reviewing descriptive plans and quotes;
  • Understanding the legal issues related to the field of construction;
  • Bo Knowledge of French in writing;
  • hold a valid driver's license to be able to travel on the territory of the city.

here's what we offer you:

  • a one-year temporary position with possibility of permanence;
  • a 33.75 hours schedule for reconciling work and personal life;
  • an easily accessible workplace.

The process:

The selection process includes different steps such as:

  • an interview;
  • pre-employment checks and a Security Enabling Survey.

.

The city of Laval is continually looking for competent and dynamic professionals who wish to join an enterprising organization. The city is committed to providing you with a stimulating workplace!

Take part in the change now and apply by going to our website:

The City of Laval applies a program to access equality into employment. It values ​​diversity and invites women, visible minorities, ethnic minorities, Aboriginal people and people with disabilities to apply. For the latter, do not hesitate to inform us of special arrangements necessary, in the event that you are invited to a selection process.

title: Gestionnaire d'Achats (Procurement Manager)
description:
ENGLISH WILL FOLLOW

Gestionnaire d'Achats

Joignez-vous à nous en tant que Gestionnaire d'Achats et vous chercherez un rôle déterminant pour votre carrière basé à St-Bruno (QC), CA.

C'est le responsable Achats qui gère directement les acheteurs et l'équipe Achats dans son périmètre : relaie aux Achats toute information ou décision qui pourrait impacter les activités respectives telles que les changements d'organisation, les difficultés des fournisseurs, les instructions locales/centrales, les décisions de Make or Buy. Il relève directement du responsable ou du directeur des achats de son PL. Agit en tant que facilitateur entre la fonction d'approvisionnement et les membres opérationnels du PL. Prend en charge l'exécution du projet et l'engagement de l'appel d'offres en gérant la performance QCD des fournisseurs. Responsabilité opérationnelle des achats sur la négociation, cross sites/business bundling. Animer le plan d'épargne.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS :

Management et développement d'équipe :

  • Gérer les effectifs et la dotation
  • Manager l'équipe Achats locale en lien étroit avec les Achats centraux (CM, PLSD, Directeur de Domaine, Méthodes & Outils)
  • Surveiller la charge de travail de l'équipe d'approvisionnement locale et procéder à l'arbitrage
  • Développer les compétences de l'équipe
  • Promouvoir le Code d'éthique d'Alstom et adhérer aux normes de conduite éthique les plus élevées.

Performances achats :

  • Appliquer et soutenir les règles, processus et outils d'approvisionnement d'Alstom
  • Challenger les achats centraux (CM, PLSD, directeur de domaine) pour sécuriser l'exécution et la rentabilité du projet en phase d'escalade
  • Appliquer la Gouvernance locale de la gestion des risques
  • Fournir au site central d'approvisionnement des informations pour avoir un impact sur les stratégies de produits
  • Assurer la conformité du Panel Fournisseur (Panel Cible défini par CM)
  • Partager avec CM, PLSD et le directeur de projet l'analyse des risques sur le déploiement des stratégies de matières premières sur les prochains appels d'offres. Partager et suivre avec CM & PLSD le plan d'atténuation commun pour garantir que l'attribution des affaires futures soit conforme aux stratégies de produits de base (leader CM)
  • Assurer l'amélioration continue au sein de toute l'équipe d'approvisionnement locale (SMART)
  • Gérer les performances QCD locales des fournisseurs et effectuer des performances QCD régulières (min. mensuelles) des fournisseurs, résoudre les problèmes majeurs et garantir la réalisation des objectifs

Engagement d'appel d'offres :

  • Soutenir, challenger et valider PTM dans la gestion des appels d'offres (Local and Global Commodities)
  • Accompagner, challenger et valider les engagements Achats Produits Locaux

Exécution et rentabilité du projet :

  • Soutenir l'équipe d'approvisionnement locale pour faire face aux négociations commerciales et contractuelles pendant la phase d'exécution du projet
  • Suivre les performances de l'approvisionnement dans le projet et publier un plan d'action en cas d'écart
  • Analyse les risques et établit un plan d'atténuation approprié
  • Formaliser et partager les REX sur les principaux enjeux
  • Soutenir SSM et PPM lors de l'achèvement de la revue de projet (en particulier FAI Go à temps)
  • Commande sécurisée OTD Go et bon de commande passés à temps
  • Excellence opérationnelle & Cash focus :
  • Soutenir la chaîne d'approvisionnement pour surveiller et sécuriser les stocks de matières premières et les objectifs de l'OTIF
  • Soutenir la qualité sur le traitement et l'amélioration de la NCR, la gestion CONQ S1
  • Soutenir le service de comptabilité pour s'aligner sur la comptabilité des factures et les jours payables
  • Participer activement à l'amélioration continue industrielle

PROFIL REQUIS :

  • BS en affaires
  • Diplôme d'ingénieur ou d'école de commerce (Souhaitable)
  • Expérience professionnelle en approvisionnement
  • 5 à 10 ans d'expérience en Industrie
  • Minimum de trois ans d'expérience professionnelle dans les achats
  • Connaissance technique et solide du marché de la marchandise
  • Solides compétences en leadership et en relations interpersonnelles (leadership, communication, capacité à convaincre)
  • Capacité à travailler dans un environnement matriciel
  • Management d'équipe, négociation, vision stratégique,
  • Gestion de projet, background industriel, background qualité et supply chain, Finance Project
  • Axée sur les résultats
  • Négociation et vision stratégique
  • Anglais courant avec un esprit international


L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

______________________________________________________________________

Procurement Manager

Join us as Procurement Manager, and you’ll be looking at a career-defining role based in St-Bruno (QC), CA.

It is the Procurement leader that directly manages the buyers and the Procurement team in his scope: relays to Procurement any information or decision that could impact respective activities such as organizational changes, supplier difficulties, local/central instructions, Make or Buy decisions. He/she reports directly to the Procurement head or Director for his PL. Acts as a facilitator between Procurement Function and PL operational members. Supports Project execution and Tender commitment by managing the suppliers’ QCD performance. Operational procurement responsibility on negotiation, cross sites/businesses bundling. Animate Savings Plan.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Team management and development:

  • Manage headcount and staffing
  • Manage local Procurement team in close link with central Procurement (CM, PLSD, Domain Director, Methods & Tools)
  • Monitor local Procurement team workload and process to arbitration
  • Develop team competences
  • Promoting the Alstom Code of Ethics and adhering to the highest standards of ethical conduct.

Procurement performance:

  • Apply & support Alstom Procurement rules, process & tools
  • Challenge central Procurement (CM, PLSD, Domain Director) to secure project execution and profitability in escalation phase
  • Apply the Local risk management governance
  • Provide to central Procurement site input to impact commodity strategies
  • Ensure the Supplier Panel Compliancy (Target Panel defined by CM)
  • Share with CM, PLSD and Project Director risk analysis on commodities strategies deployment on coming tenders. Share and follow with CM & PLSD common mitigation plan to secure future business award is in line with commodity strategies (CM leader)
  • Secure continuous improvement within whole local Procurement team (SMART)
  • Manage Supplier Local QCD performances and Perform regular (min. Monthly) supplier QCD performance, solves major issues and secure objectives achievement

Procurement Tender commitment:

  • Support, challenge and validate PTM in tender management (Local and Global Commodities)
  • Support, challenge and validate Procurement commitments for Local Commodities

Project execution and profitability:

  • Support local Procurement team to face commercial and contractual negotiation during project execution phase
  • Track Procurement performance in project and issue action plan in case of deviation
  • Analyzes risks and sets appropriate mitigation plan
  • Formalize and share REX on main issues
  • Support SSM and PPM on project gate review completion (in particular FAI Go on time)
  • Secure OTD Go Order and PO placed on time
  • Operational excellence & Cash focus:
  • Support supply chain to monitor and secure raw material inventory and OTIF objectives
  • Support quality on NCR treatment and improvement, CONQ S1 management
  • Support accounting department to align on invoice accounting and payable days
  • Actively participate on industrial continuous improvement

REQUIRED PROFILE:

  • Business School and MASTER in Purchasing
  • Engineering or Business School Master’s degree (Desirable)
  • Procurement professional background
  • 5 to 10 years of experience in Industry
  • Minimum of three years working experience in purchasing
  • Technical and strong market knowledge of the commodity
  • Strong Leadership and interpersonal skills (leadership, communication, ability to convince)
  • Ability to work in a matrix environment
  • Team management, negotiation, strategic vision,
  • Project management, industrial background, quality and supply chain background, Finance Project
  • Results oriented
  • Negotiation and strategic vision
  • Fluent in English with international mindset

title: Vendor Manager – MS Suites
description:
Department Overview:

• Client Bank Group’s Enterprise Real (ERE) Department provides a variety of services to support all business units across Canada, the US and internationally and is responsible for the company’s retail and corporate global real estate portfolio.
• ERE provides real estate strategies and solutions that align with the business units objectives and ensures that service delivery is timely, cost effective and meets business needs.
• The Corporate Real Estate Team is part of Enterprise Real Estate and is responsible for managing the Canadian Corporate Real Estate Portfolio (including some international locations) for ERE.
• Service lines managed include Program & Project Management (Design and Construction), Facilities Management and Transactions Management.

Job Description Key Accountabilities include:

• N.A FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM:
o Oversee and manage the relationship with 3 vendors providing food services for client N.A. portfolio
o Locations: Mississauga, Ottawa, Scarborough, Markham, Toronto, New Jersey, Maine, South Carolina, New York, Florida
o Vending machines across Canada and the US
o Review MSA for changes noted within the contract
o Ensure required documentation is in place
o Annual Review of SLA for amendments
o Set up QBR meetings, review agenda and financials ahead of time. Ensure burning issues are addressed at meeting.
o Weekly meetings with vendor to ensure the program is running well and address any issues that require attention
o Review plans for changes to locations, premises, equipment, pricing
o Approve purchases under the Improvement Fund
o Approve subsidy invoices where applicable
o Submit EPAY as required
o Act as a SME when new Real Estate projects require food offerings
o Bring industry experience and knowledge to drive key decisions
o Assist with RTO related activities
• RFP Support:
o Assist with building a SOW(s) for new projects working with Strategic Sourcing Group and Vendor Management where required
o Assist with transition of vendors depending on outcome of RFP
• Design Standards:
o Support the development of design standards for Food Services across our footprint in partnership with our Architect and Design Team

Reporting:

• Reporting and data entry support will be required to develop BEOs for events
• Review monthly financial reporting as it relates to the MSA(s)
• Provide oversight on quarterly spend reports for each of the pillars under the Hospitality umbrella
• Set up QBR meetings, review agenda and financials ahead of time. Ensure burning issues are addressed at meeting.
• Review monthly financial reporting as it relates to the MSA.
• Other duties as assigned
• Flexible Work Options
• Flex Time & Flex Place
• Prioritize and manage own workload to meet service level requirements for service and productivity.
• Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; escalate issues where appropriate.
• Be knowledgeable of practices and procedures within own area of responsibility and keep abreast of emerging trends for own functional area.
• Protect the interests of the organization identify and manage risks, and escalate non-standard, high risk transactions / activities as necessary.
• Conduct reporting and / or meaningful analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs/ policies/ practices.
• Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process/performance improvements where opportunities exist.
• Acquire and apply expertise in the discipline, provide guidance, assistance and direction to others. Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite.
• On assigned projects/initiatives, use project/process management software / tools and applicable templates to prepare documentation, track, monitor and report information, and maintain database(s) as applicable.
• May lead work streams by acting as a project lead / subject matter expert for small scale projects / initiatives in accordance with project management methodologies

Skills:

• Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills.
• Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time.
• Basic knowledge of production processes, quality control, costs and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods.
• Basic knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, and production methods.
• Basic knowledge of computer software, such as MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Project, Visio etc.

Must Have:

• Project Management experience
• Relationship management with vendors
• Time Management skills – prioritization
• MS Suites – Office, Excel – formulas and analytics,
• Previous exp. managing a budget
• PowerPoint Decks – possibly presenting (analytics, sales, consumption rates)
• Hospitality focus – in food and multi-unit execution

Nice To Have:

• RFP Experience (request for proposal) (vendor transition)
• Previous banking exp.
• Work with industry leaders in food service/hospitality in the GTA

Education/Experience:

• Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field.
• 5-7 years experience required.

Degree/Certifications Required:

• Background in Hospitality (Business or Administration)

Interview Process:

• 1 round, Webex or teams

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
The Opportunity

Dessert Holdings is North America’s Premium Dessert Company, recognized for providing our Retail and Foodservice customers with chef-inspired innovative desserts made with real ingredients, a flexible and low-cost supply chain, and best in class service. The Holding Company is based in St. Paul, Minnesota, it is an umbrella organization of four premium dessert companies and brands: The Original Cakerie, Lawler’s Desserts, Atlanta Cheesecake Company and Steven Charles. The Original Cakerie, founded in 1979, is a leading manufacturer of high quality frozen desserts for retail and foodservice customers across Canada and the U.S. with locations in Vancouver, BC and London, Ont. Lawler’s Desserts, a manufacturer of gourmet cheesecakes, layer cakes, pies and other premium desserts for the foodservice channel, is based in Humble, TX. Atlanta Cheesecake Company, headquartered in Kennesaw, GA, is a manufacturer of premium cheesecakes sold through the retail trade in the in-store bakery or frozen aisle. Steven Charles, has been innovating gourmet desserts for 25 years for retail and food service customers with manufacturing in Aurora CO and Pembroke NC. Together, the companies serve over 250 customers in Canada, the United States, Mexico and Europe. Dessert Holdings is a portfolio company of Bain Capital, a private equity firm that focuses on high growth businesses.

The Position

The Purchasing Manager's overall responsibility is to lead, organize, manage, and evaluate the purchasing team, purchasing activities and purchasing policies, including the identification of opportunities for purchasing improvements. This includes the skills to manage, direct, and coach both direct and indirect reports to ensure procurement plans are executed. The Purchasing Manager will work closely with the supplier community to identify and manage cost and risk.

Key Technical Responsibilities and Contributions

  • Using best practice MRP, assure the materials required for production are at the manufacturing plant at the right time, in the right quantity, with the right price.
  • Negotiate supply agreements with suppliers and engage in all aspects of contract management.
  • Review and assess total supply chain risk and identify opportunities to minimize and eliminate risk.
  • Understand supplier capabilities and capacity to secure uninterrupted and reliable supply, developing alternate sources of supply for key risk categories.
  • Liaise with key internal stakeholders; warehouse, QA, R&D, operations, finance and accounting to ensure procurement best practices are followed.
  • Maintain the organization's purchasing policies, procedures, standards, and strategies in order to ensure process transparency, fairness, impartiality, and confidentiality.
  • Develop and implement category initiatives across the product portfolio to optimize cost, quality and service
  • Comply with and maintain knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, standards, and best practices.
  • Prepare or oversee the preparation of reports and statistics related to the purchasing function for upper management.
  • Identify, qualify, and select vendors of materials, and conduct overall supplier management.
  • Generate and/or review consumption reports, and demand forecasts
  • Analyze market and delivery systems to assess present and future material availability and alternative sources of supply.

Team Leadership

  • Build and lead team by evaluating and utilizing team's skill sets to increase results through positive, open leadership.
  • Lead the hiring, career development, and performance management processes of team members.
  • Interview, select, coach, train, manage, and appraise the performance of associated personnel and mentor select staff.

Education and Work Experience Requirements

  • University degree required
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience within the CPG industry
  • Must have experience with food ingredients and packaging material working in a manufacturing environment in North America.
  • Experience in developing a high functioning team
  • Experience working with multiple customer groups, stakeholders and a cross functional team environment

Specialized Knowledge and Skills

  • Specific knowledge of purchasing buying systems, principles, practices, techniques required
  • Knowledge of ERP system concepts
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills including ability to analyze spreadsheets and data to identify opportunities and trends
  • Strategic orientation to problem solving

title: Head of Stock
description:
Company Description

Head of Stock | Vaughan

Are you looking for a dynamic and stimulating work environment? 

Are you detail oriented, able to manage multiple priorities and lift 50lbs?

If you answer yes, we would love to connect and discuss this exciting opportunity.

Job Description

What would you be doing? The Head of Stock takes care of shipping, receiving, ecommerce order picking and packing, This key player is also responsible for ensuring the updating of the inventory, as well as the appropriate labeling of products according to the prices in effect in the store so that a proper collaboration between the merchandise, sales assistants and clients is being completed.

He's also responsible to lead the stock personnel & oversee the daily operation.

 

What is in for you?

We care about your well-being and ensuring that is our mission. Let’s explore some of the benefits:

  • Canadian Family business that prioritizes the well-being of its employees;
  • Growth opportunities within the company;
  • Professional training and development;
  • Group insurance program (medical, paramedical and dental) ;
  • Referral program (up to $ 1000);
  • Discounts on all Linen Chest products.
Qualifications

  • Available days, evenings and weekend;
  • Excellent leadership skills;
  • Organizational skills;
  • Problem solving skills;
  • Good physical condition;
  • Team player.


Additional Information

Come and have a career within the large Linen Chest family!

title: Director of Logistics, Purchasing and Mail Room Services
description:
Position Profile:

Humber River Hospital. Lighting New Ways In Healthcare.

 

Five years since opening our doors as North Americaâ€™s first fully digital hospital and we remain unwavering in our belief that we can change the hospital where we work, the community where we live, and the world of healthcare beyond our borders. Serving a community of 850,000 residents in North West Toronto, Equity Inclusivity and active participation in the North West Toronto Ontario Health Team are key initiatives important to our Team.  At Humber River Hospital, we use a custom combination of technology and clinical expertise to rebuild elements of care. We make technology work for staff and physicians; giving them more time to spend with patients, to eliminate inefficiencies, and to reduce the chance of errors. Humber River Hospital is formally affiliated with both the University of Toronto and Queenâ€™s University and committed to becoming a community academic hospital. Clinical Excellence, Optimizing Care through Technology and Community Connection frame our Research Strategy.    

 

At Humber River Hospital, weâ€™re not hoping for a renaissance, we are making it happen. As part of our dynamic team, you can lead the way, as we continue our journey towards high reliability care!

 

Lead our team of procurement and purchasing experts as we work together to acquire the resources and equipment needed to deliver compassionate care that is responsive to the healthcare needs of our community.

 At Humber River Hospital, the procurement of externally provided products and services are essential in our day-to-day operations.   The management and distribution of our supplies are critical in ensuring we are able to consistently deliver the high-quality, safe care that we are known for. As we continue to advance our logistics and purchasing operations, we are seeking a Director of Logistics, Purchasing and Mail Room Services to provide strategic leadership and oversight for the provision of procurement, supply management and mail room services. This individual will be accountable for developing a centralized, hospital-wide procurement and vendor management program. Working with the different programs, the Director of Logistics will ensure the cost-efficient and strategic procurement of goods and services throughout Humber River Hospital in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and operational policies and guidelines.

Are you a strong leader with a strategic and innovative mindset? Do you have the data-driven and professional negotiation skills to problem-solve key purchasing and logistics challenges? Have you built a strategic procurement function within a hospital or a public sector organization?   If you answered yes to any of the questions above, we invite you to read the details below and apply to this exciting career opportunity at Humber River Hospital.  

Reporting Relationship: Senior Director, SPD, Biomedical Engineer and Supply Chain Management

Location: Humber River Hospital, Wilson Site

 

Position Responsibilities:

  • Develop, oversee implementation, and monitor supply chain practices (e.g. receipt, storage, delivery, acquisition methods, and bulk supply orders).
  • Manage the operations of Logistics, Procurement, and Mailroom.
  • Develop, maintain, communicate standards to all departments and determine appropriate material flow systems.
  • Develop performance metrics; analyze stock usage, turnover, and expiry to develop cost savings and standardization.
  • Create risk management and mitigation strategies to meet government processes and documentation requirements.
  • Be responsible for the overall procurement strategy, identifying and evolving best practices and transforming the organization into a center of excellence for the organization.
  • Work with programs and business units on the selection of suitable vendors.
  • Ensure that vendors are compliant with Humber River Hospital policies and guidelines.
  • Evaluate vendor relationships with a strategic enterprise view, including soliciting information and feedback about vendors and tracking that information for future utilization of the vendor; bench-marking the quality of the goods/services, price and any potential risks with vendors.
  • Standardize RFP process for the organization and assisting business units in conducting RFPs.
  • Ensure that the RFP process is effectively utilized in accordance with purchasing policies.
  • Manage the oversight of contracts and compliance; contract review process; interpret, negotiate contentious contract issues contracts and manage contracts through their lifecycle.
  • Maintain ethical procurement practices to ensure conformance with applicable trade agreements that are defensible in the public forum and meet organizational standards for broader public sector (BPS) negotiation and other procurement requirements.
  • Price analysis of product purchases and services costs to find cost savings and â€œoverall valueâ€ and risks of purchase and maintenance of contract and manage costs.
  • Establish and maintain vendor relations to achieve organizational outcomes.
  • Manage and update Procurement and Logistics and product recall process and documentation in a timely and efficient manner to meet organizational procurement standards.
  • Develop and participate in corporate procurement projects to meet corporate priorities
  • Work with business units to ensure that the organization is receiving the best pricing and terms, including overseeing bidding process within the organization to ensure competitive pricing.
  • Train business units on business negotiations and optimal business terms for procurement of goods or services.

 

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate degree in Business or Finance
  • Certification in Logistics/Supply Chain and Procurement form the Purchasing Management Association of Canada (PMAC)
  • Membership in good standing with the Healthcare Supply Chain Network (HSCN)
  • Eight (8) years of logistics and purchasing experience in an enterprise environment (healthcare/hospital preferred).
  • Five (5) years of progressive management and leadership experience.
  • Three (3) yearsâ€™ experience dealing with the Broader Public Sector (BPS) procurement and contract management
  • Strong financial analysis, cost management, warehouse and Just-In-Time (JIT) supplies management.
  • Critical thinking and prioritization skills required.
  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to set priorities, solve problems with evidence-based decision making practices and resolve conflicts in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Excellent interpersonal and organization skills with an ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.
  • Basic computer skills required.
  • Excellent attendance and discipline free record required.

Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Humber River Hospital, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the hired employeeâ€™s first date of employment  Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospitalâ€™s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis

 

 Why Humber? Why Now?

Humber River Hospital is on an exciting transformation journey of redefining patient care, as we leverage the most advanced technologies to enhance all aspects of delivering high-quality, safe care. We continue to build a people-centered workplace with excellent staff and physician engagement by hiring passionate, diverse and inclusive healthcare professionals. People who care and encompass our values of  Compassion,  Professionalism  and  Respect. People who are committed to making a positive difference.

We are a  Huron Consulting  hospital, focused on building our evidence-based leadership practice and hardwiring a culture that WOWs.

Humber River Hospital is a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network (TAHSN), which is a dynamic network of academic health organizations providing leading edge research, teaching and clinical care.

We have collaborated with TAHSN member institutions in addressing the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. Our membership in TAHSN supports our strategic pillar of advancing Humber River Hospital as a community academic hospital.

Humber River Hospital was the recipient of the 2021Excellence in Patient Safety Award by the Canadian College of Health Leaders. This award recognizes teams that are committed to improving patient safety within a healthcare environment, through leadership, innovation, culture, and best practises.

Why? Because at Humber River Hospital, we know it is our people and our ability to innovate that allows us to consistently deliver a great patient experience and the best quality outcomes. After all, we are the hospital that believes  exceptional care...healthier community.

 

 

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However, the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience may vary. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.

 

Humber River Hospital is committed to inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives our culture of innovation. By bringing together a variety of different perspectives, it fuels our creative thinking, generates new ideas and creates solutions designed to address tomorrow's healthcare challenges today. We take pride in providing professional development and career advancement opportunities for our employees including minorities, women, veterans and individuals with physical and developmental disabilities. We also provide accommodation to applicants and all of our employees - from hire to retire.

 

Let us know what we can do to help you be successful during your recruitment experience at Humber River Hospital.

title: Contract Manager
description:
Company Description

Improving healthcare through innovative technology is at the core of Intelerad’s work. Our scalable medical imaging platform connects clinicians to a powerful imaging ecosystem that is fast, smart, and tapped into the data they need, no matter their location. We’re focused on delivering a best-in-class medical image management solution that improves provider efficiency, decreases the cost of healthcare, and improves the overall health of populations.  

Headquartered in Raleigh, NC and Montreal, Intelerad has nearly 800 employees located in offices across six countries. The company empowers nearly 2,000 healthcare organizations around the world with the speed, scalability, and simplicity needed to increase business performance while, most importantly, improving patient outcomes. Intelerad’s modern enterprise solutions have been acknowledged by a Best in KLAS recognition, ranking #1 for PACS Asia/Oceania in the 2021 Best in KLAS: Global Software (Non-US) report.

Job Description

Purpose
Our Contract Manager is responsible for managing contracts from creation to customer acceptance and partnering. Reporting to the VP of Legal, the successful candidate will provide efficient, effective and commercially minded legal counsel in an effort to minimize risk and ensure a robust compliance regime.


Responsibilities
● Prepare contracts, renewal contracts and amendments for new and existing clients
● Perform analysis and pricing preparation
● Present to and negotiate with clients
● Manage contracts and amendments in Salesforce.com
● Work closely with all specialized departments involved in the contract management
● Share contract knowledge with finance, installation teams and Client Services
● Assist in process development for Legal, Deal Management and Finance
● Provide quotes for additional services and products (back-up)
● Provide weekly and monthly reports for contract status and new installation status
● Respond to any questions related to contracts
● Participate in internal projects
● Provide legal support for topics such as corporate records, shareholder documentation, intellectual property, privacy matter, insurance, lease, etc.

Qualifications

Employment Prerequisites
● Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
● Solid understanding of contract drafting and contract best practices
● Ability to understand financial details
● Flexible, positive, and well-organized team player, comfortable working in a fast-paced software and technology environment
● Ability and desire to work independently and with little oversight
● Outstanding work and academic record
● Ability to clearly communicate and present ideas and results to diverse business and technical audiences


Desired Competencies
● Experience working with technology companies



Additional Information

All applicants meeting minimum qualifications will be required to complete a 30 minute online assessment as part of your application.

Intelerad and Ambra Health Combine to Form the Global Industry Leader in Cloud PACS and Enterprise Imaging

Intelerad Partners with Strategic Radiology to Bring Innovative Medical Image Management Solutions to More than 1,300 Radiologists Across the US

Meet Intelerad’s Leadership Team: https://www.intelerad.com/en/about/leadership-team/

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are looking for a dedicated and experienced Purchasing Manager for our corporate office, based in Burnaby. Some travel to Regional Offices may be required.

The Purchasing Manager is responsible to plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the activities of Houle's purchasing activities and develop and implement the purchasing policies.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Plan,collaborate, and consult with each Project Manager to ensure that the material is technically compliant, consistent with the estimate & subject to a delivery schedule that allows Houle to meet its commitments on each project.
  • Monitor, maintain, negotiate and ensure compliance with all vendor agreements
  • Ensure Purchasing Agents as well as Project Manager/Estimators in all regions are following best practice
  • Develop purchasing policies and procedures and control purchasing department budget
  • Identify vendors of materials, equipment or supplies
  • Evaluate cost and quality of goods or services
  • Negotiate or oversee the negotiation of purchase contracts
  • Participate in the development of specifications for equipment, products or substitute materials
  • Review and process claims against suppliers
  • Manage the supplier rebate program
  • Interview, hire and oversee training of staff (purchasing agents)
  • Identify potential business opportunities
  • Assist the Purchasing Agents and Estimators as needed for the day-to-day pricing and procurement of commodities for all Houle projects
  • Overseethe ongoing maintenance of our database for material pricing
  • The development and training for our procurement system
  • Work with vendors to obtain value added services

Experience and Skills:

  • 10+ years' experience as a purchasing agent
  • Experience in the Electrical or construction Industry
  • Demonstrated ability to work with individuals at all levels of the organization
  • Formal purchasing training or education
  • The designation Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) or registration in the educational program of the Supply Chain Management Association an asset
  • Experience with JD Edwards
  • Experience with distributor/supplier/manufacturer relationship management
  • Experience with Procurement systems
  • Proven ability to negotiate
  • Proven ability to manage risk
  • Proven leadership ability

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Purchasing Manager". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Contracts Manager
description: Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month. We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today. Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible. Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs?  If yes, consider the following opportunity: We support and encourage employees to find long term success and explore opportunities that play to their individual strengths and passions. We value lateral moves as much as vertical promotions – we believe all roles should develop your skills, broaden your experience, and help you build a rewarding career at Rogers. We’ve established a new set of internal hiring rules to help you find long-term success at Rogers. Click here to access Your Career @ Rogers – Ground Rules and become familiar with the new requirements. As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are temporarily working from home. Rogers is investing in our service expansion plans and will be growing our Access Networks PMO team to support a number of initiatives to extend our network reach to more costumers and businesses nationally.The Contracts Manager is accountable for the development and implementation of contractor resource strategies for, Cable and Unified Fibre Plan Access, Networks capital programs.  This role partners closely with the Access Networks SLT, Centralized Planning, and Procurement in order to determine contractor resource needs for Access Networks’ capital programs while supporting the business’ requirement for cost savings and improvements.   What you will be doing  Engage with the National Access Networks Engineering & Implementation, Centralized Planning, and Procurement to determine contractor resource needs per program/initiativeDevelop contractor resource strategies in order to deliver on all program deliverables (Cable & Unified Fiber Plan) with the Access Networks PMO and Regional PrimesProcure and implement contracts with all required vendors for regional delivery teamsManage and improve on the existing contractor resourcing processAssist with program recovery/mitigation plans at a contracts level as requiredAnalyze, recommend, and roll out cost improvements to the regions through new service contractsDrive unit cost improvements through new service contractsLeverage best practices from all stakeholder groups and integrate into the processPerforms other duties and assist with special projects as assigned What you have  Minimum 5 to 10 years of relevant work experience in telecommunications, engineering and/or network constructionStrong understanding of designing & building PON/HFC networks and systems. Well versed on industry & Rogers standards, Outside Plant Engineering, and construction methods.Post-Secondary education in telecommunications, electrical engineering, or a related fieldExperience with writing contractsStrong working knowledge of all Microsoft applicationsExcellent presentation & communications skills, with experience presenting to stakeholdersCommitment to quality performance and teamwork across multiple disciplinesDetail oriented with an aptitude for tracking progress across many initiativesExcellent interpersonal skillsStrong organizational and time management skills and ability to effectively interact with cross functional teamsPersonal Competencies: Leadership; Problem Solving / Judgment; Customer Service Orientation; Teamwork and Collaboration; Initiative; Achievement Orientation  As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis. Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: Full timeShift: DayLength of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10%Posting Category/Function: Technology & EngineeringRequisition ID: 260035 At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @https://digital.rogers.com/

title: Stock Manager (Richmond)
description:
Since our inception in 2010, OAK FORT has curated collections that reflect our design philosophies. OAK FORT is a belief that fashion should be uncomplicated and thoughtfully designed. We are not distracted or fettered by trends and will continue to provide attainable luxury to like-minded individuals.

As the Stock Manager, you will be responsible for:

Sales Generation

  • Provide exceptional client experience by executing OAKFORT Sales Culture
  • Build and manage client relationships through client database recording
  • Be a brand ambassador by keeping up with new arrivals, product knowledge, and wearing current merchandise
  • Provide industry knowledge through awareness of products and prices in the market
  • Drive sales through OAKFORT eCommerce purchases and social media platforms
  • Maximize sales during special events and customer services
  • Process cash desk operations with engagement, efficiency, and accuracy

Staff Development

  • Source top candidates to build a high performing team
  • Build our team by welcoming and supporting onboarding of new employees
  • Build and maintain relationships with store team, peers, and relevant partners
  • Support development of high performing staff to maximize productivity
  • Provide timely feedback and active informal training to staff
  • Inspire and motivate team through demonstrating leadership qualities
  • Initiate and communicate team objectives and updates with Management and Stock Team

Store Functionality

  • Participate in execution of floor management as needed
  • Utilize stock management knowledge to communicate product sales trends
  • Oversee and participate in stock room set-up and organization
  • Ensure the right quantity of stock is in the right place at the right time
  • Maintain proper presentation of merchandise in accordance to corporate directives
  • Efficiently and accurately support with shipping and receiving of merchandise
  • Perform inventory counts upon corporate office direction
  • Support cleanliness and maintenance of physical store to create a safe and comfortable shopping experience
  • Adhere to loss prevention policies to prevent external and internal theft

title: Contract Administrator
description:
Contract Administrator
Vancouver, British Columbia
Salary: 70k - 100k
Architecture and Design Firm

OUR CLIENT
Our client, a busy Architecture, Design & Planning firm in Vancouver is currently looking for a candidate to work in the role of Contract Administrator. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Contract Administrator to join a growing team and participate in the development of a variety of innovative and large scale projects across a number of sectors, with a focus on high rise towers.

THE JOB
The role will will be focused on making site visits and liaising with construction managers, owners representatives, general contractors and their sub-trades. In addition to administrating change control procedures, contract administration methodologies and policy development, you will ensure that projects adhere to the contract documents and the building and safety codes. You will be involved in the execution of a variety of projects including public/civil projects, high rise, mixed use and tenant improvements.

WHAT'S REQUIRED
The ideal candidate will have the following credentials;
  • Possess an Architectural Technology Diploma/Certification or related Architectural education
  • 5+ years' experience in the industry with at least 3+ years doing contract administration for Architectural projects 
  • Some experience with large high rise, mixed use projects an asset but not essential
  • Familiarity with Revit and AutoCAD software, as well as Microsoft Office Suite
  • Able to review and mark up shop drawings
  • Ability to work collaboratively with project teams and company stakeholders
  • Excellent presentation, negotiation and communication skills 
WHAT TO DO NOW
If you believe this position could be the right fit for you, apply now or email your resume directly to lshalev@talentsphere.ca.
We thank all candidates for their application, however, only those who meet the requirements above will be contacted.

Keywords: Contract Administrator, Architectural Technologist, CA, Contract Specialist, British Columbia, Vancouver, Architecture, Project Coordinator, Intermediate Contract Administrator, Calgary

We look forward to hearing from you.
