title: Assistant Procurement Manager
description:
The Assistant Procurement Manager is a key member of the Rohit Communities team, responsible for developing strong relationships with stakeholders to attract the best procurement opportunities. This creative and innovative candidate will play a leading role in recognizing and bridging the gap between the company needs and the new market changes.

 

WHAT WILL YOU DO IN THIS ROLE?

  • Develop, maintain, and negotiate all contracts/tender packages for Rohit Communities Edmonton
  • Assist with contracts for other company divisions
  • Develop and maintain strong supplier relationships
  • Source new suppliers and materials including through business networking
  • Manage the tendering process from start to finish
  • Manage quality control through supplier management
  • Maintain, update, and verify direct cost and indirect cost budgets
  • Evaluate and adjust for variances to budgets
  • Participate and lead cost review and cost to complete review
  • Create project proformas, projected margin statements, and feasibility assessments
  • High level scheduling and project management for subdivisions
  • Forecast inventory requirements and control inventory
  • Perform tender and pricing analysis for presentation to stakeholders
  • Update Executive Management on supplier and market changes
  • Advise Executive Management on innovative procurement ideas and opportunities
  • Identify process issues and lead process improvement activities to reduce cost or improve throughput
  • Conduct periodic technical expert toolbox sessions on site
  • Coach and mentor team; develop a succession plan; identify and develop the next generation of managers and leaders in the organization.

 

WHAT DO WE LOOK FOR?

  • An Engineering bachelorâ€™s degree or a quantitative-focused Business or Mathematics/Statistics degree.
  • Comprehensive experience establishing vendor agreements including the ability to strategically assess and mitigate risk with vendors and suppliers through well-structured agreements.
  • Considerable knowledge of laws, ordinances, and regulations pertaining to corporate purchasing practices.
  • Proven success in a supervisory, management or leadership role in residential construction purchasing
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills to communicate effectively with all levels within the organization and with external stakeholders.
  • Strong writing skills for creating reports, correspondence, contracts, requests, bids, and other documentation.
  • Knowledge of the appropriate tools for grading, analyzing, and assessing materials, equipment, supplies, services, and other commodities.
  • In-depth business level understanding of job costing and any construction job costing Enterprise Resource Planning software (we use Constellation Newstar).
  • Exceptional forecasting ability with strong analytical and interpretive skills.
  • Strong computer skills in a Windows environment.
  • Knowledge of the local trade market in Alberta (specifically Edmonton and area) in the residential and low to mid rise commercial construction industry in considered an asset.
  • Strong skills in mathematics, statistics, and accounting.

 

WHO ARE WE?

Rooted in family values and entrepreneurial spirit, Rohit Group of Companies was founded in 1986 by Radhe Gupta. Together with his wife Krishna and son Rohit, Radhe grew the company from a small home builder to a diversified organization with operations in home building, residential and land development, residential rentals, commercial assets, and real estate lending.

This vertical integration has positioned Rohit Group as an award-winning industry leader in Canada with operations in Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Saskatoon, and Ottawa.

Experience. Opportunity. Efficiency. Integrity. Innovation. Perseverance. Balance. Leadership. These are the 8 core values that are at the heart of Rohit Group.

 

The Rohit Group celebrates diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please click here to contact us with the position and location you are interested in.

 

GROW WITH US

As a valued member of our team, you will be awarded a competitive salary evaluated on knowledge, skills, and experience, plus:

  • $1,200 Annual Phone and Computer Allowances
  • Competitive Health, dental, vision, and life/disability insurance plans
  • $600 Annual Personal Wellness Spending Account
  • Encouragement and financial support for continuous learning & development programs and numerous opportunities for growth and mentorship
  • Corporate Wellness Program (recreational facilities, fitness, and health centers)
  • Employee discount program on Rohit products
  • 100% Employer matched RRSP program
  • $2,000 per referred hire as part of our Employee Referral Bonus
  • And many more!

Experience. Opportunity. Efficiency. Integrity. Innovation. Perseverance. Balance. Leadership. These are the 8 core values that are at the heart of Rohit Group.

If our values resonate to you and are looking for an exciting opportunity and a rewarding career, look no further. We are always looking to add talented individuals to our team. Apply now!

title: Project Procurement Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a Project procurement engineer to join our Procurement DS Americas team in Boisbriand / Canada.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a Project Procurement Engineer you’ll be responsible for supporting business for all NPIs and being the bridge between Procurement and the businesses

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What you’ll do

  • Project management

  • Support Innovation Deliverables (NPDL)

  • Value Chain E2E and Product Lifecycle management

  • ERP & Procurement tools

  • Contracting & Negotiations

Your qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration or Economics and 5+ years of procurement management experience

  • Project management – Experience managing High complexity projects

  • Lead Cost Down projects, DfX (Design for excellence) and Value Engineering 

  • Knowledgeable regarding the costing toolset (Should Costing, NPV, TCO, cost roadmaps)

  • Build Long term supply base strategy

  • Stakeholder management

We are an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

To be eligible for this position, you must legally be permitted to work in Canada and travel within North America, without any additional sponsorship support from Signify. #LI-TR1

What you’ll get in return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who we are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

title: Default Officer (12-Month Contract)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Canada's Challenger Bank™

Equitable Group Inc. trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: EQB and EQB.PR.C) and serves a growing number of Canadians through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank™. Equitable Bank has grown to become the country's eighth largest independent Schedule I bank with a clear mandate to drive real change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Founded over 50 years ago, Equitable Bank provides diversified personal and commercial banking and through its EQ Bank platform has been named #1 Bank in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks 2021 and 2022 lists. EQ Bank provides state-of-the-art digital banking services, like the Savings Plus Account that reimagines banking by offering an everyday high interest rate, plus the flexibility of a chequing account, as well as a wide range of smart banking solutions for Canadians, like fast international money transfers, US dollar accounts and a suite of registered products.

Level 4 out of 12

Purpose of the Job

The successful candidate will be responsible for enforcing the conditions of the mortgage contract on residential and commercial loans in default, while adhering to policies and procedures of the Mortgage Services department.

#LI-Hybrid


What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]

 Competitive discretionary bonus
✨ Market leading RRSP match program
 Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
 Employee Share Purchase Plan
 Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one
 Generous vacation policy, personal days and even a moving day
 Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues
 Annual professional development allowance and a comprehensive Career Development program
 A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience


Equitable Bank is deeply committed to inclusion. Our organization is stronger and our employees thrive when we honour and celebrate everyone’s diverse experiences and perspectives. In tandem with that commitment, we support and encourage our staff to grow not just in their career path, but personally as well.

We commit to providing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment for all applicants. Please let us know of any accommodations needed so that you can bring your best self to the application process and beyond.All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position. 

We can’t wait to get to know you!</section>

title: Global Sourcing Manager (Government Supply Chain)
description:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

Viasat is looking for an experienced Global Sourcing Manager to join our growing Government Supply Chain team! In this exciting role, you will work with cross-functional teams to support new and ongoing programs and manage Requests for Quotes, Statement of Work development, pricing & contract negotiations, procuring goods, managing key suppliers, participate in the Sales & Operations Planning process, and analyze performance metrics. Your forward-thinking and ability to think creatively will come into play as you develop, manage, and implement effective sourcing strategies based on customer requirements and technology trends. Your excellent communication skills and ability to drive results and influence key stakeholders will allow you to communicate and assess daily issues, including engineering changes, to meet the needs of the business and easily interact with division leaders. In addition, you will also establish and foster effective strategic supplier relationships to ensure performance and timely resolution of issues and negotiate and administer optimal terms with suppliers that consider cost, quality and supply continuity in support of unique program requirements.


Job Responsibilities

  • As a flexible member of the Government Supply Chain team, you will support multiple business areas in our Government Systems organization.
  • Collaborate with key internal stakeholders to understand their procurement and sourcing needs. This includes early and active involvement with the supply base and supporting growth planning and scalability. This also includes partnering with Planning to analyze historical spend/forecast spend and ensuring supply continuity
  • Manage quote efforts - including the collection of requirements, management of supplier communications, review of bid responses and award
  • Negotiate business area and project-specific agreements that minimize financial and business risks, and provide optimal terms and conditions
  • Provide senior-level procurement support to internal stakeholders on supplier contracts
  • Continually monitor and develop suppliers within assigned business areas to achieve procurement targets in price, delivery, and quality. Includes maintaining day-to-day and strategic supplier and internal customer relationships as the lead point of contact. Also includes facilitating supplier business reviews and maintaining strategic relationships while serving as the primary resource to resolve issues and problems.
  • Successfully track, forecast, and implement strategic initiatives that deliver benefits to the organization
  • Execute the procurement strategy in compliance with the FAR/DFARs


Our ideal candidate will demonstrate:

  • Ability to effectively manage senior leadership level relationships
  • High personal integrity and ethics
  • Ability to negotiate strong pricing, business, and legal terms
  • Ability to logically manage issues and conflicts with suppliers
  • Ability to foster a collaborative work environment, influence others, and to act as a change agent
  • Ability to adapt and embrace change in a constantly evolving business landscape
  • Flexibility to learn and to work in a variety of commodities
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply knowledge

Requirements

  • 5 - 10+ years of corporate procurement/purchasing/sourcing experience
  • Strong industry experience in Government sourcing/procurement
  • Proven track record with establishing/maintaining strong relationships with critical suppliers
  • Strong communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation skills including the ability to present to Sr. Managers.
  • Ability to plan and execute risk procurements in support of high-volume production ramp
  • Bachelor’s Degree in business, Supply Chain, or related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong MS Office Suite skills (Word, Excel, Power Point)
  • US citizenship required
  • Ability to travel up to 10%

Preferences

  • Experience with contract management, project management, and supplier relationship management within a low-volume high-mix environment
  • Advanced degree
  • Experience with ERP system, Oracle or similar.
  • Experience in an entrepreneurial, high-tech environment.
  • Leadership experience

If the Federal Executive Order for Government Contractors becomes effective, this role may require vaccination.  In such instance, absent an approved accommodation based on a religious or medical reason, employees in this role will be required to be fully vaccinated no later than applicable deadlines, which are unknown at this point.  Viasat will strive to give individuals as much notice as practicable if a vaccine mandate becomes applicable to this role.


To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click here!

title: Directeur de l'approvisionnement
description:
Directeur de l'approvisionnementFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Bâtiments intelligents transforme les bâtiments commerciaux, industriels et résidentiels de manière numérique afin d'en optimiser le confort, l'efficacité, la sûreté et la sécurité, et ainsi améliorer la qualité de vie dans les bâtiments de l'avenir grâce à des solutions, des services et des produits d'électrification sûrs, intelligents et durables.Notre usine de fabrication de produits d'éclairage d'urgence àDorval, auCanada, recherche un directeur de l'approvisionnement pour diriger son équipe. d'approvisionnement et de logistique au sein de la division Bâtiments intelligents, Solutions centrales en automatisation des bâtiments et des domiciles. Vous vous prononcerez sur des plans d'approvisionnement local et les mettrez en œuvre pour atteindre des objectifs commerciaux et appuyer les initiatives d'approvisionnement régionales et mondiales.Relevant du directeur mondial de l'approvisionnement et du directeur de l'unité de fabrication, vous assurerez l'excellence dans l'exécution des stratégies d'approvisionnement et de logistique qui permettent à l'entreprise d'optimiser les coûts, la qualité et la fiabilité des fournisseurs et des produits fournis. Vous vous occuperez de la mise en œuvre, de l'entretien et de la conformité des activités d'approvisionnement et de logistique, appliquerez et mettrez en œuvre des normes, outils et processus pour veiller à une bonne qualité, à une livraison à temps, à des prix optimaux et à une durabilité. Ce poste est au grade 12, et vous devrez gérer une équipe de spécialistes en approvisionnement.
Vos responsabilités

  • Gérer et perfectionner une équipe de spécialistes en approvisionnement conformément aux politiques des ressources humaines et des directives d'excellence en approvisionnement et en logistique du Groupe pour veiller à ce que les activités d'approvisionnement répondent aux objectifs et aux attentes.
  • Mettre en œuvre des stratégies d'approvisionnement efficaces, conformément aux stratégies régionale et mondiale d'approvisionnement du processus d'amélioration continue (CIPS) de l'entreprise et de la catégorie pour s'assurer que les fournisseurs ont la capacité et les aptitudes nécessaires pour répondre aux exigences actuelles et futures de l'entreprise.
  • Assurer le respect et la pleine utilisation des outils et processus mondiaux d'ABB, y compris l'optimisation et la normalisation des processus.
  • Mettre en œuvre des programmes pour favoriser l'amélioration des coûts, de la qualité, de la livraison et de la continuité des affaires conformément aux directives du Groupe en matière de profits et pertes et aux objectifs des activités locales et du secteur d'activité local. Ceci comprend l'exécution d'activités d'approvisionnement pour appuyer le développement de produits, la continuité des affaires et les projets de gestion du cycle de vie.
  • Assumer la responsabilité des IRC pour favoriser l'amélioration du rendement, ce qui comprend la planification et le suivi des activités d'approvisionnement, du coût, des budgets, des dépenses en approvisionnement dans les pays émergents, des économies prévues et des exigences contractuelles.
  • Assumer la responsabilité du rendement interne, du rendement des fournisseurs, de la qualité et des mesures de perfectionnement tout en résolvant les problèmes associés aux coûts, à la qualité et à la livraison.
  • Exécuter des communications efficaces et transparentes à l'interne, à l'externe et entre les différents centres et unités pour favoriser une collaboration interfonctionnelle.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Avoir au moins 5 ans d'expérience en gestion et en achats stratégiques/techniques dans un environnement de fabrication. Avoir de l'expérience dans un environnement matriciel mondial technique ou industriel est un atout.
  • Baccalauréat en commerce, en génie ou dans une autre discipline pertinente.
  • Compétences avec MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint ainsi que les systèmes ERP.
  • Avoir une capacité démontrée à influencer selon une approche collaborative et axée sur les solutions.
  • Avoir un niveau d'aisance élevé à diriger le changement dans un environnement à évolution rapide et être en mesure de respecter plusieurs échéanciers.
  • Capacité de voyager.
  • Excellentes habiletés en communication orale et écrite, en anglais et en français

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid

title: Purchasing Manager Heavy Duty Truck Parts
description:
Family owned and operated for over 50 years, Bayview is currenty seeking to fill the position of Parts Purchasing Manager.  If you are well versed in the Heavy Duty Truck parts business, have experience with an OEM, Parts Management & inventory control experience, we would like to hear from you.  We understand and practice Ballanced lifestyles, and are open to a conversation with the right candidate. 

Bayview Trucks & Equipment Ltd. is a Full: Service, Parts and Sales Dealer group for Kenworth Trucks and KUBOTA  equipment, with 5 locations in New Brunswick (Saint John, Fredericton, Moncton, Woodstock & Bathurst) and two in Nova Scotia, New Glasgow and Dartmouth, with 3 TRP aftermarket Paccar Parts locations.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • Health & dental
  • RRSP shared contribution
  • Boot allowance
  • Paid training
  • Competitive hourly rates.    

Reporting to the General Manager of Fixed Operations, the Purchasing Manager is responsible for the successful day-to-day inventory movement of 10 Parts departments.You must be well versed with Excel, knowledge of accounting, organized and confident. It is a must to have knowledge of Obsolete parts, days on hand, Turns, cores, Vendor warranty, inventory counts, etc.

Key Responsibilities   

  • Maintain appropriate inventory levels to meet Company needs and optimize inventory turns. 
  • Assist and oversee Parts staff in the branch, as required.  Coach staff on best practices and policies
  • Organize and control freight cost by maximizing drop ship allocations.  
  • Evaluate and recommend parts required based on Company needs.
  • Organize and manage large bulk purchases.
  • Oversee and perform inventory cycle counts to maintain accuracy.   
  • Look up and locate parts in inventory or order parts from suppliers as per policies.
  • Negotiate key purchases in an effort to keep cost low and strong competative advantage.
  • Assist internal employees post-sale with warranty claims .
  • Assist with inter-branch transfers.
  • Maintain a professional appearance and a safe, clean work environment.
  • Assist and control the inventory counts from the Parts Managers.
  • Continously searching for the right product at the right price, making suggestion to purchase.

Qualifications that a candidate MUST possess in order to gain consideration for this position:

  • Previous experience in the Medium / Heavy Duty truck,  industry.
  • High degree of product and technical knowledge.
  • A team player with a strong sense of commitment to the the job.

title: Purchasing Manager Heavy Duty Truck Parts
description:
Family owned and operated for over 50 years, Bayview is currenty seeking to fill the position of Parts Purchasing Manager.  If you are well versed in the Heavy Duty Truck parts business, have experience with an OEM, Parts Management & inventory control experience, we would like to hear from you.  We understand and practice Ballanced lifestyles, and are open to a conversation with the right candidate. 

Bayview Trucks & Equipment Ltd. is a Full: Service, Parts and Sales Dealer group for Kenworth Trucks and KUBOTA  equipment, with 5 locations in New Brunswick (Saint John, Fredericton, Moncton, Woodstock & Bathurst) and two in Nova Scotia, New Glasgow and Dartmouth, with 3 TRP aftermarket Paccar Parts locations.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • Health & dental
  • RRSP shared contribution
  • Boot allowance
  • Paid training
  • Competitive hourly rates.    

Reporting to the General Manager of Fixed Operations, the Purchasing Manager is responsible for the successful day-to-day inventory movement of 10 Parts departments.You must be well versed with Excel, knowledge of accounting, organized and confident. It is a must to have knowledge of Obsolete parts, days on hand, Turns, cores, Vendor warranty, inventory counts, etc.

Key Responsibilities   

  • Maintain appropriate inventory levels to meet Company needs and optimize inventory turns. 
  • Assist and oversee Parts staff in the branch, as required.  Coach staff on best practices and policies
  • Organize and control freight cost by maximizing drop ship allocations.  
  • Evaluate and recommend parts required based on Company needs.
  • Organize and manage large bulk purchases.
  • Oversee and perform inventory cycle counts to maintain accuracy.   
  • Look up and locate parts in inventory or order parts from suppliers as per policies.
  • Negotiate key purchases in an effort to keep cost low and strong competative advantage.
  • Assist internal employees post-sale with warranty claims .
  • Assist with inter-branch transfers.
  • Maintain a professional appearance and a safe, clean work environment.
  • Assist and control the inventory counts from the Parts Managers.
  • Continously searching for the right product at the right price, making suggestion to purchase.

Qualifications that a candidate MUST possess in order to gain consideration for this position:

  • Previous experience in the Medium / Heavy Duty truck,  industry.
  • High degree of product and technical knowledge.
  • A team player with a strong sense of commitment to the the job.
  • Self-starter and motivated to sell.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to handle competing priorities and meet deadlines.
  • Available to work evenings or weekends if necessary 
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Excel is a must.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision. ( think outside the box, make suggestion to improve )
  • Ability to pull reports and manipulate data for generating spreadsheets. 

Experience working with PACCAR systems or KARMAK would be considered a great asset.  

All new hires are required to present a clean criminal reference check.  All employees operating company vehicles are required to present a clean Driver’s abstract.   Bayview will reimburse the cost of these documents when presented with the receipt of payment.   

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Procurement Superintendent
description:
We are St Barbara. A growing gold company with a global outlook. ​

We’re an Australian based, ASX 200 company with gold mining operations in Australia, Canada and Papua New Guinea. Our vision is to be a brilliant, global mining company that grows sustainably and creates enduring, positive impacts.

Our Atlantic Operations Touqouy mine site is located an hour outside of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Situated in Canada’s Ocean Playground, it’s no surprise that Nova Scotian’s quality of life is second to none. Whether you prefer sandy beaches and coastal cliffs, or the culture and energy of city life, you’re never far from either. Halifax is one of the fastest growing cities in Canada and has been rated by Maclean’s Magazine as Canada’s best place to live and work.

Now is an exciting time for our business and for our people. We’re going through a period of significant change and have gained real momentum in transforming our business so that, together, we can build a brilliant future. We’re looking for people who are ready to grow through opportunity and build brilliance with us.​

We are currently seeking a Procurement Superintendent to join our team. This is a full-time, permanent position with our Atlantic Operations based at our Bedford, Nova Scotia office. Reporting to the Manager, Finance and Administration, your role will encompass the leadership of Procurement, Inventory, Logistics, Warehousing and Contract Management for the Atlantic Operations.

The opportunity

  • Project managing the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System improvement initiatives and ensuring the system functions in a way that allows for procure to pay, inventory management, and receipt and issue of goods.
  • Undertaking higher value contract projects in line with Group Procurement and facilitating the front to end process with market testing, evaluation, negotiation and award.
  • Guiding the Procurement Team through the contract process for smaller dollar value projects.
  • Coaching the Business Partners (Departments) on the contract process and scope development for the competitive bidding process.
  • Reviewing and approving documentation submitted by team members.
  • Advising the Company regarding procurement activity required for the Justification For Capital process and sign off thereof.
  • Responsible for inventory count process in compliance with financial requirements.
  • Functional oversight over all goods and services procurement activity for the Atlantic Operations.
  • Ensuring that all inventory items including critical spares are replenished and stocked in a timely fashion and in line with the requirement noted by the Company.
  • Ensuring that inventory pricing is market tested through the fixed price agreement process.
  • Functional knowledge of mine operations and processing plants for the mining sector.  
  • Managing outputs and development of the team and all team members.

Are you ready to come and build a brilliant future with us?

We need the very best people. People who genuinely care for the work they do and the positive impact they can make. People who see challenge as an opportunity for growth and value working with others towards a common goal.​

We would love to hear from you if you have​:

  • A personal commitment to behavior consistent with St Barbara's Values including honesty and integrity, respect, working together, delivering to promise and striving to do better.
  • 10 or more years of relevant purchasing experience.
  • 10 or more years of relevant contract negotiation experience.
  • 10 or more years of relevant inventory management experience.
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in the mining sector.
  • A valid driver's license and own reliable transportation.

For further information on St Barbara and to apply for this role, please visit: https://stbarbara.com.au/working-with-us/current-opportunities/

At St Barbara, we’re committed to finding the best fit for every role. We are a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming diversity in all its forms. All qualified applicants will be given equal consideration, regardless of their race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity. We are the only Australian mining company to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for seven consecutive years. 

We encourage Members of the Mi’ kmaq community to self-identify in their cover letter.

title: Program Manager-Vendor Management- Consumer Panel Solutions Operations - 18 Month Contract
description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

We are looking for driven and talented Program Manager to join us on our Consumer Panel business for a modernization journey by onboarding and managing a vendor to drive executional excellence!

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of the exciting evolution of our Consumer Panel business, building and deploying the next generation of modern Consumer panels at Nielsen IQ.

Job Responsibilities

The role is accountable for the success of onboarding a strategic vendor to deliver on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards, meet the product & panel requirement to ensure organizational readiness inline with the vision and execution roadmap to setup a new consumer service in 18-24 months.

Setup the required process & system to onboard and manage a strategic vendor partner to deliver the strategic and contractual requirement in an effective & consistent performance level.

Monitor for the ongoing delivery of vendor commitment according to delivery cycle.

Establish & lead the query management process as a Single Point of Contact with the vendor by consolidating the query from multiple functional teams and measure the KPI defined (quality/timeliness/cost).

Manage the monthly vendor billing & invoicing process.

Perform regular deep dive analysis with the vendor and cross functional teams to identify root cause of issues/quality escape, formulate corrective and preventive actions to drive specific quality improvement goals for the Vendor including any change management pertaining to data receipt. 

Working closely with the vendor to deliver the financial, productivity and KPIs performance commitment, proactive risk identification and management to drive transformation with right business decisions.

Drive stakeholder engagement, change management and communication across global and regional/local teams to proactively manage deployment risks and mitigate against any slippages.

Provide regular report out to stakeholder for vendor performance status, KPI health, risks, opportunities and escalation.

Challenge all relevant teams by providing feedback, question decisions, process, and performance level.

REQUIREMENTS

5 years of project leadership experience navigating across complex organization

Vendor onboarding & management, operations transition and digital deployment experience is a big plus

Excellent organizational, communication and networking skills are essential - you will be working with multiple stakeholders and cross-functional teams.

Ability to manage multiple stakeholders across functional teams

Strong process-oriented individual with great analytical, problem solving skills and attention to detail

Experience in risk identification, root cause investigation and leading the team to find preventive and corrective actions

Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

Able to work in an individual and/or remote team setting to accommodate various timezone.

Experience in one of the following : Quality, PM, BPI/Six Sigma methodologies and tools would be a great asset

B.S. or B.A. in a statistical, business or technical field

Strong communication skills

Please note this is an 18 month contract opportunity

Additional Information

About NielsenIQ 

NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge.  We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.

NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Vendor Management Coordinator
description:
Job Description:

Are you a data person? Do you excel in math, numbers and analysis?  

 

You will be responsible for cost the administration of the Procurement and Sub-Contract processes outlined by the Supply Chain Management team, and for maintaining the various data logs. This position reports to the Manager, Subcontracts.  

     

You will bring a minimum of 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience in an analyst role delivering on corporate level reporting/initiatives. You will also bring a  post-secondary  education in business, finance or a related field, or an equivalent combination of technical training and/or related experience.  

     

This is a temp, hourly employee position based out of Calgary, AB. It is scheduled until June 2023.

   

What  you'll  be doing:        

 

    • Working closely with operations team to review field requisitions and lead them through the procurement process to obtain POâ€™s for goods and services required.
    • Responsible for approvals and tracking of all requisitions, and sub-contracted commitments.
    • Track KPIs and follow up with the supplier or sub-contractor to resolve issues or discrepancies to ensure timelines are met. Track and report on supplier or sub-contractor compliance to the Project requirements.
    • Research and gain knowledge of regional suppliers to source goods and services.
    • Initiate and maintain vendor communications including managing and resolving vendor performance and issues.
    • Update and maintain data in various systems to ensure accuracy and data integrity.
    • Establish a good working relationship and an efficient way of working with the key stakeholders within the organization.
    • Maintain communication between operations and management regarding vendor relations and initial terms of setup.
    • Working directly with the Accounting team to update vendors account information
    • Other duties as assigned.

We'd love to hear from you if you have:      

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong knowledge of contracts and Supply Chain processes, especially as they relate to filed execution of purchase orders and sub-contracts.
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills; ability to prioritize own work and the work of others
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to resolve issues and conflicts
  • Post-secondary education in a related field (business administration, office administration, supply chain management)
  • Certification in SCMP, PMP or APICS considered an asset.

       

What We Offer            

  • Competitive compensation

     

Other Details:                  

                   

As a condition of employment, qualified applicants who are offered, and accept the role must complete a satisfactory pre-employment Background Check. This may consist of all or a combination of the following: Canadian Criminal Record check, an Employment Verification and/or an Education and Accreditation Verification.    

                   

Candidates shortlisted will require to complete  theâ€¯Profile  People  Survey.â€¯â€¯                      

â€¯                      

The purpose of the  Profile  People Survey tool is to  assist  ClearStream in understanding the behaviors of individuals with the  objective  of supporting the best use of their strengths,  abilities,  and potential.    

       

Why ClearStream:                    

                     

We are the  clear choice  for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.    

                     

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected factors.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
Enghouse is looking for a mid to senior level Contracts Manager to join the global Enghouse legal team. Reporting to the VP, Legal, this position can be a hybrid role, or fully remote. This role is responsible for providing support to internal customers across the global Enghouse business and partners with Enghouse business stakeholders to negotiate commercial agreements.

 

We are looking for someone with no more than 10 years’ prior experience in commercial, technology sector contract review and negotiation.  Although not explicitly required, preference will be given to candidates who have worked in cross-cultural, cross-border and multi-jurisdictional environments.  Experience working in the IT sector is required.   

 

You will be part of a small, global team of highly experienced and commercially minded legal professionals who touch on all aspects of the business, allowing the right candidate to have exposure to wide-ranging legal (IP, immigration, contracts, employment, data privacy, collections) and compliance matters.

 

Your key responsibilities will include:

 

Contracts:

  • Assist with a wide range of customer and vendor agreements, including NDAs, Reseller and Customer agreements, licensing terms, SaaS agreements etc.  Experience with draftingand negotiating SaaS agreements is required.
  • Involvement in the contract whole life cycle, including dealing with initial contact, preparation and sending of template document, negotiation and finalization - QC, formatting, preparing executable copies etc; and requisite internal distribution.
  • Assist with template review activities to ensure standard documents are up to date with current legislation across global jurisdictions.
  • Liaising with other internal departments (Sales Operations) on contract queries, request for contract copies and any other ad hoc tasks in relation to the contract process.

   

 

You should be pro-active with a can-do attitude and ability to work well under pressure and proactively manage workload. You must have the ability to work well in a team but to also have the initiative to work alone. You should be able to demonstrate how your strong communication and networking skills have allowed you to develop good, effective working relationships with internal and external customers.

 

Excellent command of written and spoken English is required.  Fluency in other languages (German, French, Italian, Spanish) would be a very strong asset. 

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Enghouse Systems is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Merchandise Planning Manager - eCommerce
description:
The incumbent in this position partners with the Buying team to achieve the overall financial and strategic objectives of the organization. The Merchandise Planning Manager manages the financial performance of the merchandise and optimizes assortment placement and quantification.

45%: Merchandise Financial Planning:

- Develop and execute merchandise financial plans by product classification aligned to financial targets to establish annual budgets and open-to-buy

- In partnership with the buyer, establish assortment strategies (pricing, buy quantities, commodity blends) to achieve the financial plans

- In partnership with the buyer, establish inventory flow which supports demand and inventory targets; align on optimal units/style

- Validate promotional marketing plan aligns with monthly financial plan

40%: In-Season Management:

- Execute monthly/as needed re-forecast of comprehensive financial plans; re-forecast sales, margin, and inventory based on trend to identify risks/opportunities compared to plan

- Develop and execute markdown strategies to achieve unit sales plan while maximizing margin

- Partner with Buyers to provide strong in-season forecasts and develop corrective in-season actions where required

- Conduct post-season analysis and draft monthly post mortems and strategies for next season with the Buyers

15%: Reporting and Analysis

- Determine sizing requirements by commodity based on pre-season performance analysis

- Provide ad hoc business reports and analysis as needed

- Utilize company-approved tools and processes to support planning and measurement of the business

- This role typically reports into the Director of Planning, eCommerce


Keyword: Merchandise Planning Manager - eCommerce
Required Experience:

- Strong analytical skills

- Strong communication skills with the ability to influence others

- Highly adept in various systems including intermediate to advanced excel skills

- Highly motivated and self-reliant - Experience within Planning and/or Replenishment in a retail organization

- Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

- 4+ years of experience in planning principles, financial budgeting, retail fundamentals, ad hoc reporting and analysis

- Normal office environment

- Role is based in our Mississauga office location

NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description.


From: Carter's|OshKosh

title: Manager, Subcontracts
description:
The Manager, Subcontracts leads all subcontracts management operations from beginning to completion with customers and suppliers, ensuring that all objectives and goals set out in the subcontracts are implemented and achieved. This role manages a team of supply chain professionals.

Duties and Accountabilities

  • Leads the delivery of a major part of company’s subcontract management program while taking ownership for a high number of mission-critical subcontracts.
  • Collaborates closely with project subcontractors as part of the tender process, leading to subcontracts that meet the organization's business objectives.
  • Negotiates terms and conditions of complex project subcontracts to meet the organization's business objectives.
  • Participates in the selection of external consultants or advisors to deliver key projects and/or ad hoc services; ensures that business objectives and requirements are clearly understood and records outcomes, taking appropriate remedial action where needed.
  • Identifies and communicates the actions needed to implement the function's strategy and business plan within the business area or department; explains the relationship to the broader organization's mission, vision, and values motivates people to achieve business goals.

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, Science, Finance or Law, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Minimum 10 years of experience in Procurement including experience managing the procurement of services and large/strategic equipment in project environments, preferably in the shipbuilding industry.
  • Experience in planning and managing resources to deliver predetermined objectives.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in supervision and coordination of people and other resources to achieve specific end results.
  • Professional certification or training through an accredited procurement society such as, the Purchasing Management Association of Canada (PMAC) or New Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP), the Logistics Institute (P. Log.), American Purchasing Society, or the Association for Operations Management (APICS) CPIM program is desirable.
  • Shipbuilding experience is an asset.

Skills, Knowledge & Required Competencies

  • Leadership skills and ability to lead a team towards shared goal.
  • Knowledge and skills to negotiate independently, while providing guidance and training to others on how to help the organization, by acquiring consensus between two or more internal or external parties who may have different interests.
  • Ability to work well under pressure, problem-solve and multi-task
  • Understanding of procurement processes and corporate governance principles.
  • Knowledge of materials management.
  • Expertise in contracting strategies including drafting and execution.
  • Proficiency in expediting, quality surveillance and logistics.

title: Contracts Administrator
description:
Company Description

Do you want to be part of our growing Natural Resources team and help deliver a Program for a key Energy client for Turner & Townsend in Canada?  We are hiring an ambitious and forward thinking Contracts Manager to join our team.

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver.  As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Who are you?

You are a Contracts Manager with 7-10 years post-graduate experience looking for the next step, or are currently undertaking a similar role in a similar environment.

Job Description

Responsibilities of the Contracts Manager:

  • Provide post-award and pre-award contract management services including reviewing procurement plans, contracting plans, scopes of work, specifications, and draft RFP/RFT documents from a post award contract management perspective;
  • Perform day-to-day contract management activities including, but not limited to, attending and/or chairing progress meetings, monitoring schedules, expediting, drafting of change documents as required, facilitate change processes, negotiations, facilitating and negotiation of claims and disputes as required, forecasting, accrual reporting, validation of payment requests, tracking of contract submittals and other deliverables, monitor document controls and contract interpretation;
  • In addition to above contract management duties, assist in the design and implementation of innovative strategies to enhance vendor management and optimize contract spend
  • Responsible for monitoring, analyzing and reporting on a monthly basis the expenditures on all contracts.

Key success factors for the role will include the ability to work with and influence others (both internal and external stakeholders), the ability to understand and optimize detailed contract terms and conditions and the ability to implement continuous improvements to streamline processes.

Qualifications

  • The successful candidate must have a business-related Degree or equivalent (relevant experience in lieu of degree will be considered)
  • Demonstrated experience managing and understanding complex installation, supply, consulting services and construction contracts is required
  • Experience operating within crown corporations or government environments and familiarization with the Energy sector would be beneficial
  • Must possess excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiating, project management, planning and organizational skills
  • Proven abilities (as they relate to contract management) in influencing internal and external parties, managing risk, and optimizing costs through innovation
  • Proficiency with MS Office including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required.

The successful candidate will be required to travel to project sites occasionally.



Additional Information

Turner & Townsend is a leading independent professional services company specializing in program management, project management, cost management and consulting across the property, infrastructure and natural resources sectors. With 108 offices in 45 countries, we draw on our extensive global and industry experience to manage risk while maximizing value and performance during the construction and operation of our clients’ assets. We are an Equal opportunity employer who will ensure accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities upon request

Turner & Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application.

title: Procurement & Logistics Manager
description:
Why join us:

Northland Properties is recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction. We are the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, The Dallas Stars, and Northland Asset Management Company. Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned and operated, with over 150 outlets nationwide, we have home offices in both Vancouver and Calgary and employ over 10,000 talented individuals across the nation. - To be modified and reviewed with Legal.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Summary:

This role is a leadership role and will report to the VP of Construction and Design. The Procurement & Logistics Manager would be responsible for managing a team of project coordinators, buyers, and purchasing assistants and would ensure that all the necessary materials for the construction company's projects, searching for the most cost-effective and appropriate materials for each project. The procurement manager also ensures the materials arrive on time and within budget.

We are looking for someone with servant leadership mindset who works shoulder to shoulder with the team and encourages continuous growth and development.

To be successful as a Procurement Manager, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, be competent in using Bluebeam, Office 365, have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills, have problem-solving and prioritization skills and have the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Plan, organize, direct, control and check the purchasing activities of a construction company.
  • Create purchasing policies and procedures and take part in the creation of requirements for equipment, products, or other materials.
  • Create and maintain a tracking system for material specifications attached to all projects in Construction.
  • Control purchasing department budgets.
  • Identify vendors of materials, equipment or supplies.
  • Control and check cost and quality of goods or services.
  • Discuss or oversee the bargaining of purchase contracts, purchase orders.
  • Look over and process invoices as provided by the suppliers.
  • Responsible for the timely arrival of site-related materials within agreed-upon budget.
  • Interview, hire and oversee training of staff of project coordinators, buyers, procurement assistant.

Essential requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree or college diploma in business administration, commerce, or other construction-related fields.
  • 5-7 years of experience as a procurement specialist or managerial experience.
  • A good understanding of construction processes across all multiple scopes of work.
  • Ability to interpret construction drawings and shop drawings.
  • Experience in leading teams within a fast-paced environment.
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.
  • Excellent communicator with deep people leadership experience who can coordinate a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Competency in Office 365 including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • Ability and willingness to travel.

Desirable requirements:

  • The designation Supply Chain Management Professional (S.C.M.P.) or a registration in the educational program of the Purchasing Management Association of Canada.
  • Exceptional knowledge of construction materials, their uses, and industry standards.
  • Experience with construction project management systems such as PROCORE.

Benefits/Perks:

  • Extended Health and Dental Insurance.
  • Yearly bonus opportunities.
  • Retirement Saving Plan after a year of employment.
  • Employee discounts across the Northland-owned restaurants, hotels, resorts.
  • Cell Phone Reimbursement.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • Work travel reimbursement.
  • Excellent career growth opportunities as part of the growing company.
  • Collaborative, friendly working environment.
  • Applicable relocation expenses.

title: Senior Contracts Coordinator
description:
You love the idea of thinking ahead and planning, while being able to juggle last minute changes. You thrive on speedily reacting to change and love all the fluctuations that are thrown at you with a momentâ€™s notice. Youâ€™re a strong team leader and knows whatâ€™s needed to get the job done.

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Facilities Coordinator to lead a team in the organization and evaluation of property maintenance assignment. The ideal candidate has experience maintaining third party contractor relationships to ensure quality and cost effectiveness.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide leadership and direction for the Coordination department ensuring the success of the Facilities Coordinators and Facilities Administrators
  • Communicate effectively with fellow Senior Facilities Coordinator to ensure consistency in the coordination policies and procedures throughout the portfolio
  • Monitor departmental performance against goals to ensure that progress is being made, and that corrective action is taken if necessary.
  • Coordinate and monitor all project and contractor activities for properties from start to finish.
  • Set priorities for preventative maintenance work orders, maintenance requisitions and scheduled work.
  • Requisition work to be completed with the Regional Purchasing Agent
  • Maintain third party contractor relationships and ensure quality and cost effectiveness
  • Organize invoices and submit to Accounts Payable department
  • Work with Facilities Supervisors, Maintenance Leads, Site Managers and Maintenance Technicians to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Ensure all safety procedures during all repairs and maintenance are followed
  • Create and budget new projects, manage costs, in Yardi
  • Communicate and set up accounting needs to start and close all jobs
  • Coordinate capital upgrade projects from start-up to completion
  • Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget
  • Coordinate day-to-day operational aspects of projects and scope
  • Oversee requests for information, issues, subcontractor change orders, back charges, construction schedules
  • Resolve any problems or inconsistencies which occur throughout the construction project. These may include procurement, contract negotiations, scheduling, financial/budgeting, equipment, manpower, quality, safety standards and commissioning
  • Use project scheduling and control tools to monitor course of the project, issues and overall project health
  • Organize, compile and submit supporting documentation on completion of project

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum five years' experience in a service coordinator role
  • Strong computer skills using MS Office Suite and ERP system
  • Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills
  • Must have a valid driver license and clean driverâ€™s abstract
  • Experience with fire suppression and life safety systems considered an asset

 

 

WHY BROADSTREET?

Broadstreet Properties is a family owned and operated property management company partnered with Seymour Pacific Developments to build apartment and townhome communities. We are a growing organization made up of diverse team members who are motivated to continuously innovate our approach to asset management. We consider employee wellbeing a priority and are dedicated to protecting the health and safety of our teams while ensuring a workplace that is respectful of everyone. Broadstreet Properties Ltd. practices equal opportunity hiring and onboarding processes and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees irrespective of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other status protected by law.

title: Group Leader -Contract
description:
Group Leader -Contract ( Job Number: 220485 )
Brand : Estée Lauder Companies
Job : Manufacturing - Supply Chain
Primary Location : Americas-CA-ON-Toronto
Schedule : Full-time
Shift : 1st (Day) Shift
Job Type : Standard
Description

POSITION SUMMARY

The overall mandate for the Group Leader, will be to manage the departments to produce company products and to manage all aspects of Production (filling and assembly and Packaging) to deliver business results established for safety, quality, customer service, and cost through continuous improvement initiatives and development of the organization.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:

1.Employee Management

  • Employee management across all 3 shifts
  • Ensure labour levels meet planned requirements for Production floor
  • Set and monitor department objectives for functional area
  • Carry out quarterly and annual Performance reviews for direct reports
  • Form a training and development plan for direct reports
  • Give general and specific direction to Supervision in order to meet short term and long term goals

2.Management of Department Activities

  • Support validation and change management program
  • Set, monitor and control budgets for Production cost centers
  • Agree cost standards for production, monitor and control to meet or exceed objectives.Analyze and report on deficiencies
  • Resolve Manufacturing/Production issues to meet all objectives, including Efficiencies, Quality standards, Safety standards and Customer Service Levels, Plant absolute / net attainment
  • Assess labour to achieve production requirements (Launch, S/L, etc.)
  • Commit to monthly production targets and balance forward plan

3.Continuous Improvements – LEAN implementation

  • Identify and implement methods to improve overall performance of each functional area
  • Identify, justify and support Capital Expenditure Program for functional areas
  • Implement Continuous Improvement by engaging, empowering and enabling the workforce
  • Develop, implement and control process improvements for functional areas (Sop’s and training / procedures etc.)

4.Health Safety

  • Ensure employees are trained in safety procedures and are following safety requirements
  • Ensure reports comply with all statutory and Corporate EHS policies e.g. PPE, WHMIS, GMP, ISO 14001, etc.
  • Ensure Incident and Accident reports are completed in a timely manner for functional areas, investigate and facilitate appropriate actions
  • Ensure housekeeping and GMP requirements are met by reports
  • Support validation and change management programs, ensure requirements are met for functional areas
  • Ensure effectiveness of our Behavioral Based Safety program

5.Special Projects Duties

  • Support company teaming initiative
Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent – Engineering or Business Degree Preferred or equivalent experience

Experience: A minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment with demonstrated progression through various levels of management and responsibilities

Competencies:

  • Demonstrated people management and development capability and proven success in leading and inspiring teams to excel
  • Experience with Lean, Six Sigma, or other Continuous Improvement principles and programs including engagement and implementation of these initiatives
  • Thorough knowledge of the entire supply chain as well as inventory management principles – Supply Chain Management concepts
  • Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PPT) and SAP preferred

WHO WE ARE

Our Brands: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc.is one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Prescriptives, Lab Series, Origins, Tommy Hilfiger, MAC, Kiton, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Donna Karan New York, DKNY, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Michael Kors, Darphin, Tom Ford, Smashbox, Ermenegildo Zegna, AERIN, RODIN olio lusso, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, By Kilian, BECCA, Too Faced and Dr. Jart+.

Our Heritage: Since Estée Lauder founded our Company in 1946 with four cosmetics products and unlimited dreams, we have grown virtually every year on the key principles she established: creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship. The Estée Lauder Companies are committed to building world-class brands by developing talented people. We champion a professional organization that emphasizes excellences at every level. Our people are our greatest asset and the success of our company is the result of the talent, passion, and vision of our creative and highly dedicated employees, who set a global standard for innovation, service and quality. The Canadian Supply Chain and Canadian Innovation Centre is at the core of that innovative spirit. ( http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/the-lauder-family )

Our Culture Values: Our culture is often described as a rare mix of family values with a high-performing public company with a mission of “Bringing the best to everyone we touch and being the best in everything we do. This unique mix translates into a caring, collaborative and compassionate workplace that is also demanding – with a competitive spirit that is a powerful source of motivation. Above all else, there is a focus on long-term, sustainable growth which engenders loyalty and commitment from internal and external stakeholders. We are a values-driven organization. Our actions are rooted in the Lauder Family values of respect for the individual, uncompromising ethics and integrity, generosity of spirit and fearless persistence. Building on these core values we also abide by the following principles: http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/culture-and-values .

To learn more about our unique corporate culture in Canada, please visit LinkedIn .

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: CA - Manager, IT Procurement
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

 

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

 

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect  our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are  Empowered  to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote  Sustainability  through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize  Training  and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are  One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give  Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an  Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at  www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for an Commodity / IT Procurement Manager to join our team to work remotely in Ontario, Canada

 

Working with IT and Procurement leadership, the Manager, IT Procurement  is responsible for establishing contracts and ensuring the cost-effective supply of IT services and commodities. The incumbent will oversee the daily activities of the technology purchasing function; reviews technology purchasing decisions, orders, and vendor contracts; assists with the ordering of materials and supplies from vendors; researches, interviews, and negotiates with suppliers to obtain prices and specifications; creates purchase orders for the acquisition of materials and performs related administrative tasks. This position should be and remain familiar with a variety of the information technology concepts, practices, and procedures.

Responsibilities:
  • Interfaces with broad ranges of stakeholders to help identify and analyze opportunities for driving value, reducing costs, and consolidating the supply base
  • Assist IT Asset Management team with purchasing and managing process for all IT assets
  • Responsibility for product support and warranties, leasing, maintenance, and software contracts, as well as hardware purchases, and license information.
  • Provides analysis on complex and ambiguous data and presents findings to upper management
  • Acts as an internal change agent to align employees with the strategic vision
  • Responsible for IT spend playbook ensuring renewals and contracts are kept current and reviewed regularly prior to renewal
  • Identifies systemic issues and continually improves processes
  • Negotiates and executes IT contract agreements that align to the organization and stakeholderâ€™s goals.
  • Identifies, communicates, and executes on projects to create value and drive down cost across the organization
  • Performs sourcing administrative functions such as having Non-Disclosure Agreements, contracts etc. executed by appropriate parties
  • Upholds the Crawford Code of Conduct
Requirements:
  • Degree or diploma from credited post-secondary
  • 3-5 years of experience in a purchasing role
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Strong subject matter knowledge in IT purchasing ($5M+ contracts)
  • Project management skills, training or related experience
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong technical, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated skills/behaviors working in a team environment
  • Ability to influence peers and lead cross-functional teams
  • Demonstrated problem solving methods
  • Self-starter, possessing high degree of self-motivation and bias for action
  • Experience or understanding of ERP systems
  • Interface with a broad range of stakeholders to help identify and analyze opportunities for driving value, reducing costs, and consolidating the supply base
  • Provide analysis on complex and ambiguous data and present findings to upper management
  • Act as an internal change agent to align employees with the strategic vision
  • Identify systemic issues and continually improve processes
  • Negotiate and execute contract agreements that align to the organization and stake holders goals.
  • Identify-communicate and execute on projects to create value and drive down cost across the organization
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

 

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

 

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

 

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

 

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.
