title: Contract Manager
description:
Job Title:Contract Manager
Location: Toronto, ON
Duration: 12 Months
 
Duties:
  • The Contract Manager / Legal Counsel is required to manage the bids and proposals cycle for the Contracts group: to be responsible for risk identification, risk mitigation recommendations, preparation of compliance statements and sales contracts and related agreements.
  • To ensure compliance and governance procedures are implemented in the bids and proposals cycle.
  • To draft and negotiate terms and conditions to ensure protection of company interests and the preservation of project profitability.
 Key Accountabilities:
  • To review RFPs and customer contracts to identify and prioritize legal and commercial risks.
  • To develop contractual positions and provide contract interpretation to the bids and proposals team, project team and senior management.
  • To prepare contract compliance matrices, risk assessment questionnaires and other pre-bid documentation.
  • To manage the development and implementation of a negotiation strategy for contract negotiations, from pre-award to execution.
  • To draft and negotiate contractual documentation including preliminary agreements, intra-unit agreements and customer and/or supplier contracts
  • To ensure compliance with governance policies for new business contracts.
  • Liaise directly to bids & proposals team, finance, legal and other departments.
  • Liaise directly with risk management analysts, brokers and sureties in connection with all contracts bonding and insurance related matters.
  • International travel to Customer’s facilities as required representing Contracts in the discussion and negotiation of commercial/contractual issues.
  • Oversees large, complex contracts held both locally with the Canadian government and/or Canadian business, as well as internationally. Manages risk associated with each contract; ensures all risks associated with operations is anticipated, identified, and managed. Participates in negotiations as required. Resolves legal points of contention with customer.
  • Works positively with other specialist groups (Finance, Bids, Legal, Tax etc) within a matrix organization to develop complex bids and proposals as part of a multi-functional bid team with the common objective of winning new and profitable orders.
 Requirements:
  • Post-secondary education- in Law, engineering, business or equivalent.
  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a complex international engineering or high-technology environment or equivalent or in house legal department.
  • Legal concepts underlying commercial contracts including claims management.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and inter-personal skills with international cultural awareness.
  • Financial concepts underlying commercial contracts.
  • Ability to assimilate different commercial approaches.
  • Strong English writing capabilities, particularly with respect to the drafting of legal and commercial provisions in proposals and contracts, is a mandatory qualification.
  • Negotiation skills and ability to effectively reach negotiated compromises.
  • Organize and prioritize contractual and commercial risks and issues
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team environment.
  • Able to perform detailed analysis and drafting as well as appreciate the broad business and strategic context
  • Able to identify key commercial and legal risks, assess degree of severity and probability and articulate clearly to senior management in both written and presentation form, together with proposed mitigations.
  • Able to represent the company professionally and with competence in negotiations with international clientele.
  • Able to adapt to different contractual and commercial approaches, and navigate cultural norms, to arrive at negotiated compromises within approved parameters.

title: Airbus Canada - Acheteur - Approvisionnement stratégique en matériel et pièces / Buyer – Strategic sourcing Material and Parts
description:
**ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**


Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.

Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des Hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.

Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.

Un poste lié à la gestion de l'approvisionnement a vu le jour au sein de l'approvisionnement en matériel et pièces (avions commerciaux). Vous rejoindrez l' équipe d'approvisionnement stratégique en matériel et pièces d'approvisionnement (PM) .

Ce poste est disponible dans le cadre de projets partagés/collaboratifs entre les Achats et d'autres fonctions qui sont un facteur clé de croissance des affaires pour le Programme A220. Dans ce contexte, en contribuant à l'approvisionnement en matériel et pièces (PM), la mission est de fournir et de sécuriser la stratégie d'approvisionnement en matières premières, les contrats et les conditions commerciales pour l'introduction de nouveaux produits.

Dans ce rôle, vous aurez l'opportunité d'être un acteur de cette évolution en participant au développement commercial de notre département d'approvisionnement 220 Matériaux et Pièces pour la marchandise Pièces Standard & Quincaillerie (1 poste ouvert) et pour la marchandise Matériaux Métalliques ( 1 poste ouvert).

le poste est basé à Mirabel.

Tâches et responsabilités:

Vos principales tâches et responsabilités seront les suivantes :

  • Consolider la demande interne principalement liée aux grands projets du programme A220 et mettre en œuvre les solutions de sourcing optimales alignées sur la stratégie d'approvisionnement en matériel et pièces d'Airbus
  • Effectuer des demandes de devis avec les fournisseurs pour des besoins ponctuels
  • Effectuer l'analyse des prix des fournisseurs et construire l'analyse de rentabilisation associée
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe multifonctionnelle (MFT) basée en Europe pour s'assurer que tous les besoins internes des clients/programmes sont pris en compte
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les parties prenantes internes pertinentes du client (par exemple, chef de projet, programme, ingénierie, méthode, commande, ...)
  • Soutenir les organisations de la qualité, de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et des commandes dans les opérations quotidiennes
  • Gérer les informations contractuelles et effectuer des revues régulières afin de garantir le respect des termes du contrat d'approvisionnement
  • Contribuer à la notation des fournisseurs, à l'évaluation des risques et à la gestion des écarts en prenant les mesures appropriées pour protéger les intérêts d'Airbus
  • Négocier les demandes de changement, gérer les processus d'approbation et d'autorisation correspondants et assurer les commandes associées
  • Gestion des KPI opérationnels et financiers et lancement d'actions en cas de besoin
  • Gestion des données commerciales des fournisseurs dans le système SAP

Compétences requises

Vous possédez les compétences et l'expertise suivantes :

  • Vous avez un diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires et idéalement en génie industriel ou équivalent
  • Vous avez au moins 3 ans d'expérience et une connaissance des activités Achats et Acheteurs
  • Vous êtes un négociateur efficace avec un dossier commercial et contractuel avéré
  • Bonne connaissance des processus de la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Vous avez la capacité de créer des analyses et d'utiliser des outils tels que SAP
  • Vous êtes orienté client et avez une connaissance des activités de service client
  • Vous démontrez des compétences en communication et en présentation combinées à une façon de résoudre les problèmes au sein d'une équipe
  • Vous avez une solide connaissance de MS Office et d'autres applications informatiques clés actuelles (G Suite)
  • Votre niveau de négociation en anglais et en français est un plus.

Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Airbus Canadasouscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.

***************************************************************************************************************

Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.

Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.

At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.

A position related to sourcing management has arisen within Material and Parts Procurement (Commercial Aircraft). You will join the Procurement Material and Parts Strategic Sourcing team (PM).


This position is available in the frame of shared/collaborative projects between Procurement and other functions which are a key enabler for business growth for the A220 Program. In this context, contributing to the Procurement Material and Parts (PM) the mission is to deliver & secure Procurement Commodity strategy, contracts, & commercial conditions for New Products Introduction.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to be an actor of this evolution by taking part to the Business development of our 220 Material and Parts procurement department for the Standard Parts & Hardware commodity (1 open position) and for the Metallic Material commodity (1 open position).

The position is based in Mirabel.


Tasks and Responsibilities:

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

  • Consolidate the internal demand mainly linked to the A220 Program major projects and implement the optimal sourcing solutions aligned with the Airbus Procurement Material and Parts strategy
  • Perform Request for Quotation with suppliers for ad hoc needs
  • Performing analysis of supplier prices and build associated Business case
  • Collaborate with the Multi-Functional Team (MFT) based in Europe to ensure all internal customer/Program needs are taken into account
  • Closely collaborate with relevant internal Customer stakeholders (e.g. Project leader, Program, Engineering, Method, Ordering, ...)
  • Supporting Quality, Supply chain and ordering organizations in the daily operations
  • Managing contractual information and performing regular reviews in order to guarantee compliance with Procurement contract terms
  • Contribute to supplier rating, risk assessment and managing deviations by taking appropriate actions to protect Airbus interest
  • Negotiating of change requests, managing corresponding approval and authorization process and ensuring associated ordering
  • Managing operational and financial KPIs and launching actions in case of need
  • Managing supplier commercial data in the SAP system

Required skills

You have the following skills and expertise:

  • You have a university degree in Business Administration and ideally in Industrial engineering or equivalent
  • You have at least 3 years' experience and knowledge of Procurement and buyer activities
  • You are an effective negotiator with proven commercial and contractual back round
  • Good knowledge of supply chain processes
  • You have the ability to build analytics and using tools such as SAP
  • You are customer minded and have knowledge of customer Service activities
  • You show communication and presentation skills combined with a problem solving way of working within a team
  • You have strong knowledge of, MS Office and other current key IT applications (G Suite)
  • Your negotiation level in English and French languages is a plus.

Please upload your resume in French and English.

The use of the masculine gender has been adopted for ease of reading and has no discriminatory intent.

Airbus Canada subscribes to the principle of employment equity and encourages women, aboriginals, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

title: Sourcing Associate Manager
description:
Procurement Operations are seeking a talented Software Sourcing Associate Manager to manage sourcing and contracting of software licenses and services globally for Operations and for delivering services to our Clients. This includes driving supplier selection process and contract negotiations. 

The software sourcing associate manager will have responsibility for sourcing activities in the software category on behalf of the global stakeholders. You will be expected to understand the client requirements, identify, plan and deliver sourcing initiatives, and take responsibility for delivery against agreed targets for the software category together with the category manager. The software category associate manager will need to work with peers globally to take advantage of existing contracts



Why Mentor Tech Source?

Mentor Tech Source is the result of 25 plus years of extensive experience in providing Hybrid Model Staffing and Engineering Services in the ever evolving Software Economy.

  • We have a unique hybrid contingent staffing service composed of domestic and international sourcing
  • We have a 24/7 recruitment cycle due to the fact that Mentor has offices in many different time zones
  • We work day and night to provide our consultants and employees with best working environment

title: Subcontract Administrator - Bilingual
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Southern Ontario team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Bilingual Subcontract Administrator is located in Scarborough and typically reports directly to the Subcontract Manager. Their primary focus is assisting in subcontract management under the direction of Subcontracts Team. This role is open for full-time applicants. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Primary Support Contact for the Subcontractor Prequalification Process (SCPQ)
  • Liaison with IT Department regarding the SCPQ and support HSE and Finance inquiries
  • Provide back-up support when necessary to Issue subcontract purchase orders in ERP system, including preparing and editing any subcontract agreements while ensuring proper supporting documentation has been submitted
  • Adjust subcontract purchase orders as required by Operations including Change Orders
  • Scan, post and file contracts and subcontracts as required
  • Request and update Certificate of Insurances
  • Assist Director by arranging for signatures, sending and preparing documents for courier, and preparing expense reports
  • Administrative support as required

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Change Orientation
  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Maximizes Business Performance and Team Effectiveness

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Post-secondary education is considered an asset

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 1-3 years' experience in a construction setting managing subcontract agreements and working with subcontractors is a strong asset

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Fully bilingual in English and French

Proficient user of:

  • MS Office (Word, Excel, Project)
  • JD Edwards or an Oracle-based ERP system is considered an asset
  • DSI platform is considered an asset

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Director of Estimating , Contracts and Procurement
description:
Are you currently aDirector of Estimatingor aSenior Estimator, Estimating Manager or Contracts Managerlooking for a Director level job with a highly reputable, forward thinking, entrepreneurial developer in Toronto? Are you interested in working for a company that encourages autonomy, career development, and innovative thinking? Are you interested in being a part of a company working on mixed use, urban infill and high-rise condo projects visible across Ontario? Then read on!

What’s in it for you?
If you are an experienced Senior Estimating & Contracts professional with the drive to succeed, and are looking for a change to take your career to the next level, and be more involved in strategy and divisional leadership then this is your next move. This is a unique opportunity to lead and grow at a scaling company determined to leverage real estate development to deliver social and environmental impact.

If you’re a skilled communicator and natural collaborator who brings financial acumen, deep construction expertise and related networks, apply now

Our client has built an internal company culture like no other. The company has creative flair, they are forward thinking into the future of people and the planet and they are looking for someone with similar values. Our client is looking for a Director of Estimating soIf you’re a skilled communicator and natural collaborator who brings financial acumen, deep construction expertise and related networks, apply now

You will be an integral part of the leadership team working closely with all the heads of department. In this fast-paced and hard-working company, you will alsohave the chance tosee projects through their entirety and assist in every stage to the close-out.

Our client is a unique, leading developer with an excellent reputation, looking for somebody like you to join their team.You would be compensated well with a salary and benefits package respectful of your experience.This is an incredible opportunity that won’t be around for long!If you have questions about this incredible role, or are interested in hearing more about it, apply now to hear more.

During COVID and lockdown measures all roles are “work from home”

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Materials Management New Graduate
description:
At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived as a result of embracing differences.



Job Description:

Rewarding opportunities for new grad business professionals at Fluor, the World’s leading professional services EPFC Company


You can be a part of one of the world’s leading Engineering, Procurement, Fabrication, and Construction companies. You will be challenged to make a difference designing some of the World’s most complex, large-scale, and innovative projects.


What will you do in the early part of your career?

Objective of delivering value through world-class procurement and material management systems, capabilities, and processes by leveraging advanced sourcing methods; global market knowledge and Fluor’s global purchasing volume to obtain the best pricing, quality and service for our clients


Fluor’s Materials Management Department:

Our Clients depend on Fluor's expertise for timely procurement of materials and equipment for their projects. We have built a global network of trusted suppliers to meet Client objectives, delivering critical items to projects in a timely manner to meet project schedule and cost requirements. The Materials Management Department performs a number of key functions in which the successful candidate will assist in on a given EPC project.

• Procurement

• Expediting

• Logistics

• Material Planning


Main responsibilities will include:

• Support execution excellence by managing the quality and timely delivery of equipment from the manufacturer or supplier to job site.

• Purchase Order execution strategy development

• Identification of materials from Engineering, negotiate prices and schedules with suppliers

• Management of Purchase Orders on a global basis

• Ensuring the best commercial and legal deals have been achieved in order to protect both the price and schedule of a project

• Material quantity tracking and reporting

• Analysis and negotiation of additional costs in order to generate approved change orders.

• Review and approval of contractor and supplier invoices.

• Generation of daily, weekly or monthly reports to provide project stakeholders

Job ID: 131821BR

City: Vancouver

State: British Columbia

Country: Canada


We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

title: Materials Management Trainee
description:
WE GIVE DOWN-TO-EARTH A WHOLE NEW MEANING

We’re Lehigh Hanson. Our products build cities and towns, including stadiums that hold thousands of fans, and bridges that support millions of vehicles. We have thousands of employees across hundreds of locations in the U.S. and Canada, making us North America’s leading supplier of cement, aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt, and related construction materials.Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.

We might be a big company, but we appreciate and encourage our people to share their ideas and help shape our future. We want every one of our people to play an active role in growing our business. With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects.

We’re a tight-knit team. While we strive to be the best, we do it with an attitude that is humble, accessible and down-to-earth. We don’t ask you to “fit in” to our culture. We invite you to add to it.

Lehigh Hanson Materials Limited is seeking a Materials Management Trainee based inEdmonton, AB.The Materials Trainee Program provides you the opportunity of hands on experience in operations across the region while learning all aspects of our business. This is achieved through the delivery of a development program combined with critical experiences and projects that are important to our business.

The successful candidate will be immersed in a 24 month program designed to provide exposure, training, and hands-on experience in all aspects of the aggregates and concrete business including production, sales, maintenance, supervision, quality control and logistics.

TheMaterials Management Traineerole is based in Edmonton, AB. This position's start date will be approximately the first week in May 2022.

What you will get to do:

  • Participate fully and actively in all assigned development activities
  • Apply knowledge and work collaboratively on various team projects related to training and development
  • Support the aggregate and concrete division in achieving production goals through partnering with experienced professionals and managers in different departments (safety, operations, human resources, environment, maintenance, quality control)
  • Participate in daily and weekly production and maintenance meetings
  • Learn basic supervisory skills by working side by side with experienced supervisors
  • Responsible for reporting and tracking key performance indicators


Who we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mining, Geology or Engineeringor similar disciplines will be considered
  • 2 plus years of related work experience
  • Project experience - start to finish
  • Must have a strong desire to work in a mining and industrial environment
  • Prior manufacturing or mining experience is a plus
  • Strong communication skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to be a self-starter and take initiative
  • Ability to adapt to change and respond well under pressure
  • Solid interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Ability and desire to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Ideal candidate will have a strong desire to move into progressively more responsible roles and can relocate if required
  • Travel within the Edmonton area is required
  • Must be willing to relocate within Canada after the term is completed

Work Environment

  • Role operates in a office and manufacturing environment with moving mechanical equipment, inclement weather, heat, humidity, elevated noise levels, and dusty conditions

  • We are a drug free work environment.

What we have to offer

  • Competitive base salary
  • Highly competitive benefits programs
  • Pension plan with an automatic company contribution as well as matching contributions
  • Applicants must be residing in and currently authorized to work in Canada. Our pre-employment process includes: reference checks, a medical including drug & alcohol testing, and a criminal record and drivers abstract check may be required.

title: Junior Contract Administrator (1 Year Contract)
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

Summary:  Reporting to the Manager, Operational Support, the JR Contract Administrator will be part of the team responsible for the administration and management of all contracts for the Energy Services and Workforce Accommodations West divisions of Dexterra. As part of the Contract Administration team, the JR Contract Administrator main role will be to provide support to SR Contract Administrators. Role a one year contract with the opportunity to extend or become full time.

The Junior Contract Administrator performs some or all the following duties:

 

  • Provide administrative support to Contract Administration team
  • Reconcile and report on invoicing as per the contract
  • Perform data entry into various platforms (NetSuite, Agiloft)
  • Organize and maintain digital contract files
  • Prepare, review, and evaluate contract documentation and distribute as required
  • Provide various reports to different stakeholders
  • Create and maintain Rental Orders within NetSuite
  • Review invoices and backup documentation for accuracy
  • Assist in the contract process to ensure corporate policies are adhered to
  • Identify continuous process improvements
  • Obtain Workers’ Compensation Clearance letters for various provinces
  • Other duties as required.
Qualifications

  • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in an administration position is required.
  • Diploma or degree (or equivalent) from an accredited university or college in Business Administration is an asset.
  • 1 to 3 years commercial/business in an entrepreneurial environment would be an asset.
  • Accounting and/or legal experience would be an asset.
  • Intermediate to advanced skills in the use of the MS Office suite.

 

Competencies

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with others.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and detail oriented skills.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work under minimal supervision.
  • Capable of identifying and implementing process improvements.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Displays ethics and integrity in his/her work; accountable and dependable.
  • A creative and innovative thinker.

Working Conditions

  • Working out of the Edmonton regional office with a flexible work schedule
  • Training, as necessary, in required safety protocols
  • Some overtime when required


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Junior Material Management
description:
onsidering a change? Challenge yourself with Fluor!
Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.
Fluor team members are at the core of Fluor’s successes and instrumental in executing projects safely, smartly and with the highest quality. If you value teamwork, empowerment in your career and are eager to champion Fluor’s project execution, this opportunity just may be for you!

Job Description:
This position serves as a material planning, purchasing, expediting, logistics, or field purchasing team member who, with guidance from Purchasing Management, handles project material or non-project procurement support for an office, group of overhead departments or indirect procurement category within established Material Management Plans, policies, and procedures. This role assists other material management specialists and technicians, as required.
• Monitor and report Supplier's performance toward completion of all deliverables in accordance with the Terms and Conditions of the Purchase Order
• Collaborate across all disciplines including Material Management, Supplier Quality Surveillance (SQS)/Quality, Engineering, Project Data & Document Management (PDDM), and Construction
• Generate documents, organize and manage files, and maintain tracking data and reports
• Distribute bid packages, correspondence, and other documents, as necessary
• Identify and qualify potential bidders for purchases and contracts
• Perform data entry proficiently into the approved Corporate Reference Tool for Material
• Other duties as assigned

title: TERRITORY SALES MANAGER (Quebec)
description:
Territory Sales Manager for Quebec

Job Summary
The Sales Manager is accountable for managing business across all categories at major retail and food service clients in Quebec. Working with supervisors, brokers, and internal business partners (marketing, product development, R&D, supply chain, finance), the incumbent is ultimately accountable for delivering annual sales targets (budget) for assigned customers, while ensuring profitability goals are met. The Sales Manager will be a part of the Canadian retail team reporting to the Director of Sales for Canada.
Responsibilities
  • Build well thought out, effective annual business plans that leverage the company’s core strengths,delivering budgeted sales growth and profitability.
  • Develop strong, productive business relationships with key customers with priority being Key accounts to be their “go-to” strategic partner.
  • Leverage base product portfolio to support production efficiency while using innovation selectively to create a point of difference for the company with the customer.
  • Prepare and present business proposals that include pricing and merchandising ideas, while incorporating market insights and analytics.
  • Collect local market and competitive information and report findings to appropriate sales and marketing contacts.
  • Work closely with R&D/product development to ensure adherence to commercialization processes/timelines.
  • Provide forecasting for inventory requirements, especially as it relates to made-to-order and/or seasonal products.
  • Demonstrate baked goods in customer meetings and in trade show environments.
  • Maintain a personal presence with R&D/product development in Toronto.
  • Take the time to “shepherd” own initiatives while developing solid, respectful relationships with key internal contacts.

Requirements
  • Must be fluently bilingual with previous experience working with clients in Quebec
  • Minimum 5-7 years previous sales experience is required, preferably in food products, ideally with baking industry experience
  • Post-secondary degree is preferred
  • Skilled negotiator, able to write reports and business correspondence
  • Effective at presenting information and responding to questions from groups
  • Quick thinking, goal-oriented individual who can prioritize activities and has the drive, energy, and follow-through to achieve results in a rapidly changing, fast-paced environment
  • Experience working with food brokers and distribution is an asset
  • Creative problem-solver, able to manage multiple constraints and overcome barriers

title: Territory Sales Manager - Aftermarket
description:
A leading manufacturer and distributor supplying to the transportation industry currently requires a Territory Sales Manager

Responsibilities
  • Parts growth by working with assigned dealers and distributors
  • Developing retail sales strategies for new business and expand sales to existing customers
  • Ensure dealership parts merchandising are current to increase retail parts sales
  • Increase awareness and growth of products
  • Training dealer and retail personnel on parts systems and programs
  • Calling on fleet customers in the assigned dealer markets
  • Engage aftermarket suppliers for local support to assigned dealers and fleet customers
  • Develop sales strategies and increase the overall sales of products
  • Build new business relationships with business owners in the transportation/trucking aftermarket part distributors, service shops, fleets etc.
  • Manage current customer partnerships with all channel levels.

Requirements:
  • 3-5 years of experience in territory sales (preferably in automotive parts/ heavy transportation aftermarket or technical channel distribution products)
  • Possess an entrepreneurial mindset in developing accounts in a consultative manner
  • Self motivated and enthusiastic with an upbeat selling style and energetic attitude
  • Efficient time management and exceptional organizational skills are required
  • Ability to influence and negotiate pricing and terms
  • Must have strong presentation abilities to customers and to group audiences
  • English verbal and written communication skills
  • Clear background check
  • Ability to travel 20-30% a year within North America by air and vehicle
  • Valid and clean G class driver license record
  • Ability to use MS Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word and Power Point)
(This job provides a competitive salary plus bonuses. Also included is travel expense reimbursement, laptop, cell phone, paid vacation and holidays.)

title: Client Relationship Manager
description:
Job Description

We are Canada Life

 

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

 

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

 

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing. 

  

Be your best at Canada Life.

 

We are looking for a Client Relationship Manager

 

Reporting to the Regional Manager, Client Services this role focuses on developing strong relationships through proactive servicing of the group retirement plan customers in our region, participating in finalist presentations and working with a team to implement new sales. Being able to work independently and as part of a team to build strong customer relationships is the key to success in this role. By focusing on the needs of our customers and building their trust you will grow our group retirement business through the retention of customer assets, increasing plan membership and contributions as well as transfer new assets from other financial institutions. This full-time opportunity is a great way to build on your group retirement and customer service expertise as part of a team dedicated to improving the physical, mental and financial well-being of Canadians. What you will do

  • Creating and executing an annual service plan to proactively service a defined block of customers
  • Developing customized project plans for new case implementations
  • Responding to general and technical questions regarding plan operation and legislation from plan administrators, advisors and consultants pertaining to all types of group retirement products including; RRSP, DPSP, RPP, IPP and RRIF.
  • Developing and delivering presentations for use with group customers and plan members
  • Working closely with the Communication & Education Manager to ensure appropriate educational sessions and communications are provided to customers
  • Identifying customer needs and growth opportunities and providing appropriate products and solutions
  • Introducing new product and service enhancements

What you will bring

  • Highly adaptable, driven to be your best, and proven initiative.
  • A career progression that demonstrates a strong understanding of group retirement customers, products and processes along with success in servicing a large customer base
  • Post-secondary education in a related field demonstrating knowledge and understanding of business principles
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in the financial services industry
  • Ability to communicate effectively (verbally and in writing) demonstrating a polished, professional manner and ability to listen, negotiate and collaborate
  • Proficiency with MS Office programs (Word, Excel & PowerPoint)
  • Organizational talent showing skill in self-management, prioritization and success meeting tight deadlines
  • Analytical aptitude with strong capacity to make decisions and be innovative in problem solving
  • Strong presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships with Clients and Advisors
  • RPA Designation (CEBS Program)
  • Ability to work closely with the sales team and the finalist sales presentations
  • Comfort working independently and as part of a larger team
  • Valid driver’s license and vehicle are necessary due to the travel requirements

 

 

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today 

 

We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!

 

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  

   

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  

   

   

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted  

*LI-KL1

#LI-Remote

title: Service Manager (Planet Ford)
description:
Drive for Excellence


When its comes to Fords, Planet Ford is a king in the industry. Rated one of the top 25 dealerships in Canada, we have a proven track record for quality and service for the last 15 years.

Part of the Performance Auto Group, a leading automotive group, we are committed to integrity, believe in employee empowerment, passionate about innovating, care about a great guest experience and giving back.

Planet Ford is looking for an experienced Service Manager to join their Dynamic Team.

About you.

You are friendly, hard-working and motivated to join our high volume dealership. Planet Ford works together at being the best while maintaining a happy, family like environment. You are positive, empathetic and a problem solver when dealing with guests. Joining our team will give you the chance to be coached by the best and celebrated for your successes.

Here’s what you’ll deliver:

  • Establish and maintain good relationships with customers and to exceed their expectations.
  • Develop and maintain a culture that values excellent customer service through effective training, supervision, coaching and performance management.
  • Review and implement Service Centre policies and procedures that improve the Customer Experience through high quality repairs and building customer relationships.
  • Develop and implement a long-term strategy and action plan to attract and retain customers.
  • Coach team members to provide excellent customer service.
  • Recruit, develop, motivate, recognize and hold accountable a Service team that will meet established objectives and targets for sales and profitability.
  • Improve sales and profitability for the Service Department.
  • Conduct monthly meetings with department employees to discuss activities and problems of mutual interest.
  • Review the previous month’s sales/profit to determine where improvements can be made.  
  • Establish and enforce product-knowledge standards.
  • Actively support, encourage, and motivate sales personnel daily to maintain high morale.
  • Monitors the operating budget by tracking sales and expenses.
  • Promotes service safety and security procedures.
  • Uphold all rules and procedures (i.e., support enforcement, including disciplinary action as necessary).
  • Work in strict compliance with the Laws of the Province of Ontario and Canada including, but not limited to, the Employment Standards Act (ESA), the Motor Vehicle Dealers Act (MVDA) and the Accessibilities for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).
  • Understand and comply with all federal, provincial and local regulations that affect service operations, such as the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), waste disposal regulations, etc.
  • Comply with all company policies, standards and procedures. 
  • Other duties as required by management.

What you need to succeed:

  • Post Secondary Degree/Diploma in Business Administration. 
  • Minimum 5 years experience in the automotive service industry.
  • Minimum of 3 years of management experience in the automotive industry.
  • Previous experience as an Assistant Service Manager or Service Advisor is recommended. 
  • CDK experience preferred. 
  • Strong communication skills are required to work with customers, employees and vendors. 
  • Required to maintain the profitability of their department while controlling expenses and maintaining customer satisfaction.
  • Ability to support the organization’s goals and objectives. 
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Demonstrate effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills. 
  • Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy.
  • Exceptional customer service orientation.
  • Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and work well under pressure.
  • Ability to manage stress and work with tight deadlines.
  • Highly self motivated and directed.
  • Must be willing to be flexible with work schedules. 
  • Must have valid Class ‘G’ Ontario driver's license and clean drivers abstract.
  • Automotive Technician’s License is an asset.
  • Ability to work flexible hours and work around a changing schedule.

What’s in it for you?

  • Excellent management support and guidance
  • Opportunities through our Internal career mobility program
  • Access to health, dental and vision insurance
  • Disability, critical illness and life insurance for the unexpected
  • Our Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family's wellness
  • Discount on vehicles, service and parts for you and your family
  • Discounts to retailers and service providers across the country
  • Free and engaging employee events 
  • Did we mention we love giving back to our communities?! 

We thank all applicants, however only those contacted for an interview will be considered. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome  applications from people with special needs. Accommodations will be provided throughout the selection process as requested. For any inquiries please email us.

title: Buyer
description:
Job Number: 44463 
Group: Cosma International  
Division: Modatek Systems 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: MILTON 

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Role Summary

The Buyer is responsible for the procurement and management of components for the front and rear suspension, frame assembly modules (including steel, stampings, weld assembly, coatings, tooling, fixtures, etc). 

Key Responsibilities

•    Develops and executes effective bidding, negotiation, and pricing strategies to provide with the best value for the dollars spent in a manner that meets the budget, policies, ethical standards and audit requirements. 
•    Conducts market studies to maintain a fair and reasonable value for product for program duration
•    Supports continuous improvement culture that enhances relationships with suppliers to achieve goals
•    Establishes solid multiple sources to ensure continuous supply and availability of purchased components and directed-buy components for production, prototype, and tooling.  
•    Participates in design reviews in order to ensure the successful launch of new products and tools
•    Ensures successful implementation of approved engineering changes by closure of all commercial issues with suppliers while supporting on time delivery, and maximizing profits
•    Prepares reports for KPI monthly goals and targets
•    Prepares, negotiates and executes all contracts according to policies and procedures and government regulations
•    Procure all emergency requirements in cooperation with requisitioning departments and other supporting segments to ensure project completion
•    Communicates effectively with all requisitioning departments, and arranges for proper and accurate information exchanges between originator and suppliers
•    Ensures that all applicable GST and Provincial Tax Exemptions are claimed 
•    Reconciles variances between Purchase Orders and Invoices (Price, Quantity, Free On Board (F.O.B.),  Inco terms, Terms of Payment)
•    Ensures purchase orders are entered in a timely manner
•    Maintains supplier files, purchase prices, price fluctuations and quality records (CMS/SharePoint)
•    Resolves material claims with suppliers
•    Adheres to Modatek’s core values; integrity, respect, trust, honesty, fairness and loyalty
•    Performs other duties as required

Key Qualifications/Requirements

•    Post-secondary Degree/Diploma in Business Administration or Materials Management
•    Three (3) to five (5) years supply chain experience
•    Excellent computer skills (Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint)
•    Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal)
•    Good mathematical and problem solving skills
•    Analytically minded and possess excellent negotiating skills
•    Ability to work to meet deadlines and multiple demands
•    Ability to uphold confidentiality
•    Driven and detail-oriented attitude
•    Demonstrates the ability to work effectively in a team environment
•    Ability to work overtime to meet customer needs
•    Eligible to travel outside of Canada with a required valid passport
 

Additional Information

Division Description
Located in Milton, Ontario, Modatek Systems is a division of Magna International. At Modatek, our dedicated team produce chassis systems utilizing innovative hydroforming, automated welding, and electrostatic coating processes within a large, safety-focused facility.

What we have to offer
Our people are our greatest asset. As a valued Modatek team member, we offer you:
•    A great work experience with a dedicated and diverse workforce
•    A focus on safety, health and wellness, including a corporate wellness program, fitness membership discounts, and a subsidized cafeteria with health conscious options
•    Competitive extended health benefits
•    A group RRSP with employer matching
•    Participation in the Employee Equity and Profit Sharing Plan
•    Company paid uniforms, allowances for prescription safety glasses, earplugs and safety shoes
•    Staff appreciation events
•    Continuous training and development, including an educational reimbursement program
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Intermediate Customer Success Manager
description:
Who are you?

 Vancouver, BC or Remote (Canada)

 As a Customer Success Manager at Absolute, you are front and centre with our customers helping them achieve their goals and ensuring value driven engagements. You are highly organized with excellent interpersonal skills, a passion for technology and a strong customer focused approach.

Building strong customer relationships, you regularly engage with stakeholders to ensure their goals and priorities are identified and ensure value driven engagements.

Being an advisor to your customers, you share with them best practices and industry trends while being the voice of the customer internally with our Product teams.

This is an opportunity to join an amazing growing team that believes in professional growth while working with cutting-edge solutions to support our customer’s mission-critical applications.


Responsibilities:

  • Be the “voice of the customer” within Absolute and lead the effort to deliver an overall positive customer experience
  • Continuous learner, interested in learning new technologies and how to help solve real world problems
  • Engage with decision makers and key stakeholders to identify customer priorities and use cases in relationship with Absolute
  • Build ongoing customer relationships to understand their processes and challenges and then develop strategic success plans so to ensure their satisfaction and product loyalty
  • Collaborate with Product teams to stay current on new features and advancing technologies while providing a channel for continuous customer feedback
  • Build relationships internally across Sales, Service and Support teams to escalate customer needs and identify expansion and renewal opportunities
  • Work cross-functionally with other internal teams such as Onboarding, Marketing and Sales to cooperatively drive, maintain, and improve customer health and value perception
  • Use data intelligence to identify risk events happening (login frequency, product adoption rate, security settings, etc.) and proactively outreach to customers to resolve
  • Become a technical product expert of Absolute and contribute to building new processes and sharing best practices within the larger Customer Success team

 What You Will Need:

  • 4+ years Customer Success experience within a SaaS high-tech work environment working with enterprise customers – experience with Federal, Healthcare, Financial and Professional Services industries a bonus
  • Exceptional ability to communicate and foster positive business relationships
  • Strong aptitude for technology with the ability to explain technical concepts and theories to both technical and non-technical users
  • The ability to effectively lead and direct a virtual meeting with a diverse set of attendees
  • Team player, that strives to develop win-win situations for customers and colleagues
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.  Must be exceptionally comfortable and capable when speaking to a wide spectrum of internal and external professionals, from executive to junior level
  • Ability to take initiative, own processes and work independently as required
  • Experience with CRM tools (i.e.: Salesforce, Gainsight) or Device Lifecycle management software an asset
  • Bonus: Experience in IT, Information Security, Cyber Security

Why Work For Us:

You’re resilient and passionate about securing the Work from Anywhere era. So are we.
We’re in search of the best and the brightest – everyone from innovators, sellers and marketers to financers, operators and especially customer relationship managers – we’re looking for top tier talent to help us shape the next decade of security, drive innovation that enables customers with truly disruptive solutions and are dedicated to making a meaningful difference. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada with international offices in Victoria – BC, Seattle – WA, San Jose - CA, Boulder - CO, Ankeny – IA, Austin - TX, Reading - UK and Ho Chi Minh City – Vietnam, Absolute Software (NASDAQ: ABST) (TSX: ABST) accelerates customers’ shift to work-from-anywhere through the industry’s first self-healing Zero Trust platform, ensuring maximum security and uncompromised productivity. Only Absolute is embedded in more than half a billion devices, offering a permanent digital connection that intelligently and dynamically applies visibility, control and self-healing capabilities to endpoints, applications, and network access to ensure their cyber resilience tailored for distributed workforces.

Our vision is to be the world’s most trusted security company – and to empower end users to connect securely and from anywhere, to all the applications they need to collaborate and get their work done, without interruptions and with an optimal network experience. Absolute currently serves approximately 16,000 customers with more than 13 million activated endpoints globally. G2 recognized Absolute as a Leader in the Winter 2022 Endpoint Management and Zero Trust Networking Grid Reports, reflecting our continued customer satisfaction across product lines. To learn more about Absolute, visit our website at www.absolute.com or visit our YouTube channel.

Absolute is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Director of Sales
description: Exciting opportunity to get on board with a hyper-growth SIEM solution. An up-and-coming company with a name that is disrupting the marketplace is looking for a Director of Sales for their Northeastern territory. This person needs to have sales leadership experience preferably in the SIEM or Observability industry. This leader will join a team that is performing at the head of the company and help them take the next step to disrupting the industry.

title: Territory Manager-in-Training - Toronto
description:
We believe in rising to a challenge, creating a vision, and providing a solution. We believe in dedication, hard work, and a job well done. We believe in superior service, strong relationships and building lasting impressions. Who are we? We are EFCO.

At EFCO, we believe in helping those responsible for the construction of the world's concrete structures with a safe, reliable, and cost efficient concrete formwork solution. We do this by engineering, designing, manufacturing, supplying and field servicing forming and shoring products for concrete construction. Our Core Values represent the manner in which we expect to do business with our customers and interact with those people around us in the business community. At EFCO, our core values are at the very heart of who we are and what we believe. Quality. Innovation. Integrity. Super Service. These 4 Core Values describe very high standards of professional behavior that all EFCO employees must seek to achieve.

DUTIES

  • Developing long-term relationships with contractors, architects, and trade organizations to maintain and grow sales in your territory.
  • Communicating with customers to discover their formwork needs.
  • Providing Engineering with proper information concerning form requirements on a project, in order to develop the most efficient forming solution for a customer.
  • Coordinating shipments with distribution.
  • Providing customers with superior service.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelors Degree (Civil, Construction, or Mechanical Engineering preferred), or equivalent experience.
  • Knowledge of general business and/or sales processes a plus, but not required.
  • Mechanical aptitude.
  • Knowledge of the construction industry preferred.
  • Ability to read blueprints helpful and drafting experience is a plus, but not required.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Willingness to travel is a must.

title: Field Sales Manager - Georgian Bay Region
description:
Field Sales Manager – Georgian Bay – Mpwr, a division of Kognitive Tech Inc.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, motivated Sales Leader who will be the next Field Sales Manager in our Georgian Region. We are looking for an individual with a drive for the following:

  • Commitment to Excellence
  • WOW Factor Experience
  • Maximizing Efficiencies
  • Respect & Dignity

In addition to these key core values listed above, we are a looking for a value – based leader who is PASSIONATE – passionate about building relationships; passionate about exceeding client expectations both externally and internally; and of course, passionate about sales growth.

Kognitive Tech Inc:

Kognitive Tech Inc. (previously Kognitive Marketing Inc) is a Sales Tech company that was founded in 2006 and was created to help clients increase sales revenue and profitability with world-class customer service. We have 2 main divisions within Kognitive Tech Inc. Our eCommerce division, Optimy.ai which was founded in 2016, offers businesses a video chat tool, Optimy, that is the first eCommerce plug-in that allows for a live video chat within the customer's web browser that is 100% private & secure. Our retail staffing division, Mpwr, is an industry leader in face-to-face retail sales program. Powered by our in-house workforce management system, Mpwr recruits, trains and coaches retail sales representatives to offer the best solution possible for the customer.

Responsibilities:

· Responsible for training and empowering new representatives who drive the results in the Georgian Region.

· Working closely under the direction of their Regional Leader to strategically optimize results leading to a high direct profit for their region.

· Executing effective training with new hires once they have completed online orientation to ensure team members graduate at a high performing level with excellent product knowledge and solid understanding of the sales materials

· Attend a weekly zoom call with your team to discuss their successes and provide information on new initiatives

· Focus team on In-Store Features that will entice the public to acquire and activate the products

· Motivate and encourage team members by building authentic relationships, aligning them to become a high performing team consistently

· Manage technology assigned to staff and provide technical support as needed

· Attend a bimonthly social/training session with the team to train staff, take part in a fun activity, build the team mentality and recognize achievements and accomplishments.

Selection Criteria:

· 1+ years of sales experience

· 1+ year of leadership experience, preferably in sales, with proven track record of sales growth and team building

· Ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders at all levels of the organization with excellent written, oral, and presentation skills.

· Ability to prioritize projects effectively, juggling multiple projects with tight deadlines.

· Confident, self-motivated, with good communication and collaboration skills and work independently with minimal supervision.

· Must be able to travel across the Ottawa Region to various store locations.

Benefits to Working at Kognitive Tech Inc.:

  • Competitive total rewards and compensation package
  • Growth opportunities within a leading-edge organization
  • Medical and Dental benefits
  • Being a part of a successful, growing organization who is committed to investing in our people.

Equal Opportunity:

Kognitive Tech Inc. and all its divisions are committed to equal opportunity employment and diversity in the workplace. We are committed to providing all candidates with disabilities with equal opportunities, standards of goods and services and as an employer. We are fully compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (2005), as applicable.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

#transformationalleadership #WOWfactorexperiences #changinglives #investinginourpeople

title: Sales Manager, Home Improvement
description:
Who we are:

Financeit is a point-of-sale financing provider serving some of the largest home improvement and retail organizations in Canada.

Our platform helps businesses of any size close more sales by offering customers affordable monthly payment options for their next big home improvement, vehicle or retail purchase. Financeit is small enough that you can make an impact within the company and large enough to make an impact in the market.

As focused as we are on creating unique, category-defining products, we are also building a distinct and inclusive culture. We’re a diverse and dynamic team seeking the best and brightest talent to help us achieve our company goals, and to continue to build on our award-winning culture.

About the role:

We are in search of an experienced sales leader with proven success in leading a sales team, developing sales strategies and delivering growth results. As the Sales Manager, you excel in leadership, one on one performance management, analyzing data metrics, and achieving targets. You are responsible for overseeing the operational results and performance management of our field sales team.

The Sales Manager will collaborate across many departments and participate in strategic planning, forecasting, and systems initiatives. Moreover, the successful candidate will focus on delivering measurable results within the organization that leads to growth in overall company performance and of the sales team.

What you’ll do:

Business Development & Sales

  • Own and drive volume growth in Ontario by mapping to key relationships in the territory
  • Contribute to the development of sales operations and processes
  • Work with the Business Intelligence team and utilize tools to deliver accurate reporting of team performance and goals
  • Guide direct reports to develop and execute strategic sales plans that will win new business, drive increased loan volume and improve partner retention
  • Coach team to ensure seamless and positive merchant experience
  • Lead sales team to identify and secure new volume opportunities

People Development

  • Responsible for hiring, developing, and retaining talent and building a high performing team with complementary skill sets
  • Coach and support sales teams with industry knowledge and selling methods
  • Execute all aspects of the performance management culture, including development discussions regular coaching and feedback and performance improvement plans

Optimization and Implementation of Marketing Strategies, Products and Services

  • Measure and evaluate business strategy implementation against intended results
  • Work closely with business leaders to support marketing campaigns and the creation of vertical-specific marketing materials for merchants and consumers
  • Work closely with product management to integrate the company's products and services into existing and prospective customers’ businesses
  • Minimum of 3 years of sales leadership experience
  • Experience with sales in the Home Improvement space
  • Success leading teams and developing sales strategies
  • Coaching experience and proven track record of developing people
  • Proven success with building successful sales relationships and achieving targets
  • Experience with partner acquisition and development
  • Experience in consumer lending or SaaS is an asset
  • Ability to work with data, create appropriate reporting and track results
  • Strong CRM skills and management process including communication and workflow tools, such as Slack, Salesforce, Jira, etc.
  • Results-oriented and hands-on approach

Winner of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture in 2018 and 2021, we offer more than just the basics. Take advantage of:

  • An award-winning culture with a collaborative & inclusive team
  • Competitive base pay + commission plan
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage + Lifestyle Account
  • RRSP Matching and Parental Leave Top Up Program
  • Weekly virtual yoga classes, meditation & workout sessions
  • Virtual events such as Lunch & Learns, company parties, fun team activities and charity initiatives
  • Career learning and development programs


Next Steps:

If what you just read excites you, we’d like to hear from you! Please submit your application and we’ll contact you if you become selected for a phone interview.

Financeit is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Service Manager
description:
• Overseeing the day-to-day operations of both Plumbing and HVAC business units to ensure the consistency of service delivery.
  • Managing, planning, and executing Planned Maintenance Agreements, Projects, and Jobs
  • Surveying, taking off, and completing medium to large sales quotations and Planned Maintenance Agreements
  • Build and maintain excellent customer relations, resolving issues and concerns including proactive onsite visits.
  • Act as a technical resource to customer and field employees
  • Develop any potential sales or customer service opportunities to maximize portfolio growth
  • Overseeing quality control and ensuring regulatory compliance
  • Supervising, motivating and coaching field technicians and contractors
  • Ensuring health and safety policies and company policies are adhered to
  • Ensure the supply of parts in both warehouse and on team members vehicles are sufficiently stocked and organized
  • Ensure team members are equipped with well-maintained and functioning tools, equipment, and gear so they may execute their day-to-day tasks completely and efficiently
  • Audits the effectiveness of service operations and makes changes to improve performance.
  • Ensures that contractual obligations are delivered, and customer satisfaction is achieved
  • Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
  • A minimum of 2 years experience as a Service Manager for a Plumbing or HVAC company
  • Plumbing 306A, or G1 TSSA, or Refrigeration 313A Licence
  • $80,000 - $150,000 / Year
  • Dental
  • Extended Health
  • Life Insurance
  • Vision Care
  • Company Vehicle & Phone
  • Life Time Gym Membership
  • Gear and Tools
  • Paid Training
  • WFH Days

title: Service Manager
description:
About Clutch:

At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. 

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Clutch, founded in 2016, is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital and Azure Capital Partners.

The Role

As Clutch grows its inventory, the Service Manager will play a vital role on the Clutch team. We're looking for a highly motivated self-starter to help ensure our vehicles are up to our high mechanical standard.You will be working closely with management to build Clutch Alberta's service/repair operations. You will play a leading role in the recruitment and management of our automotive service technician team. In the early days, you will also be responsible for performing vehicle inspections, maintenance work and minor repairs such as brakes, suspension, tires, batteries etc.

Our ideal candidate has experience working on European vehicles in addition to other foreign and domestic brands. They will also be highly organized, have strong communication skills, and excellent attention to detail:

What You'll Do:
  • Hire, manage and mentor a team of Automotive Service Technicians
  • Build a cutting edge automotive service operation
  • Assist in planning for future growth, including expanding shop infrastructure and helping build new processes
  • Ensure our mechanical reconditioning is industry leading, while continually finding new ways to reduce costs
  • Perform Clutch standardized vehicle inspections (stationary and road tests)
  • Diagnose and assess vehicle issues and damage, both internal and external
  • Make recommendations about vehicle repairs and the best course of action
  • Perform repairs and preventative maintenance, such as oil changes, suspension and brake work
  • Create documentation of repairs and estimates
  • Assist in the coordination of work with third parties when necessary
  • Adhere to and continually help improve Clutch's high mechanical standards
We're Looking For:
  • Hands-on Automotive Service experience and knowledge
  • Previous Shop Foreman or Service Manager experience is an asset
  • Red Seal certification is an asset
  • Experience working with a variety of car brands (domestic, import & European)
  • Team player above all else
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize competing demands
  • Desire to learn new skills
  • User of technology (Google Drive, Slack etc.)
  • Valid Driver's License (Clean Driver's Abstract)
Why You'll Love it at Clutch:
  • Competitive Salary & Equity Incentives
  • Health & Dental Benefits from day one
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget - for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Build and run a state of the art service operation from the ground up
  • Opportunity to work for an ambitious and fast-moving startup
  • Opportunity to be part of Clutch's fast growing service team
  • Job Type: Full-time

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email 

talent@clutch.ca

.

We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve.', 'Perform Clutch standardized vehicle inspections (stationary and road tests)', 'Generous Time Off Program', "Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates.", "Adhere to and continually help improve Clutch's high mechanical standards", 'Build a cutting edge automotive service operation', 'Assist in the coordination of work with third parties when necessary', 'Build and run a state of the art service operation from the ground up', 'Experience working with a variety of car brands (domestic, import & European)', 'Previous Shop Foreman or Service Manager experience is an asset', 'Perform repairs and preventative maintenance, such as oil changes, suspension and brake work', 'Make recommendations about vehicle repairs and the best course of action', 'Create documentation of repairs and estimates', "We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
We pride ourselves in achieving exceptional results in operating hotels from our ability to blend the superior science of hotel management with the art and professionalism of hospitality. Are you seeking a successful company to grow with? Do you have what it takes to grow with us? We are seeking a dynamic Sales person to join our team. This unique individual must possess excellent communication skills in customer relations, be aggressive in targeting new business and exceed established goals for their market segment.

In addition, they will develop new clients for boosting hotel sales. We are looking for a dynamic, proactive person who can take the initiative and maintain as well as build the existing client base.

Our Managers understand the meaning of true Customer Service; they are professional, teamoriented, possess good work ethics and are extremely results driven.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
  • Targeting new business opportunities.
  • Building and maintaining existing relationships.
  • Develop and maintain a contact and customer database within the following market segments: - Canadian Corporate Market - Incentive and Corporate Group Travel - Industry Partners Develop and promote product image and awareness by direct mail campaigns and attendance of key travel and tourism tradeshows.
  • Prepare sales proposals to clients incorporating clearly defined terms and conditions.
  • Establish an effective sales call cycle for key customers, partners and contacts.
  • Maintain a clear line of communication on sales commitments to Hotel/Chain Operations.
  • Work to achieve agreed goals and objectives.
  • Applicants must be able to communicate information and ideas clearly.
  • They must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be able to handle everyday situations quickly and effectively.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit is a definite asset.
  • A minimum of two years hotel sales experience and an excellent network of contacts are required to succeed in this position.
DUTIES:
  • Research & develop new corporate business for the Hotel through direct outside & inside Sales efforts.
  • Conduct cold calls and prospecting on potential clients.
  • Attend industry events and trade shows.
  • Prepare proposals and contracts.
  • Complete weekly sales reports.
  • Assist in the preparation of the Sales & Marketing plan

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Diploma or Degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management would be an asset.
  • Commitment to exceeding guest expectations.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of a variety of computer software applications, including the Microsoft Office Suite and Maximizer.
  • Superior written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to set priorities for self.

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.
