title: Sales Manager
description:
Company Description

Do you consider yourself a trailblazer and leader? Do you thrive in environments that allow you to be entrepreneurial? Do you see yourself as one who likes to share your knowledge and train others?  Then A & A is for you!  A & A Customs Brokers is searching for a passionate and results-driven Sales Manager. 

A & A is a full-service international logistics company specializing in customs brokerage. Being a part of our team means sharing in our excitement about cross-border trade.

Job Description

About the role:
The Sales Manager position is a full-time role that will be responsible for working closely with the leadership team on everything from conceptualizing transformational sales strategies to how we approach our business by segment, industry, and geography.

The successful candidate will represent the voice of the customer, drive initiatives across the organization and deliver a long-term impact on A & A’s business. This role can be based anywhere in North America and reports to our Chief Operating Officer.

What kind of experience and demonstrated success will YOU bring to A & A? Here are just some of the key skills and abilities we are looking for:

  • You have the ability to partner with and influence leaders across all areas of business within an organization 
  • Ability to build a best-in-class sales team. Past experience in hiring, training, and coaching sales professionals would be an asset
  • You’ve led strategic development initiatives as it relates to customer & sales growth, scale, and retention; you also have the demonstrated ability to identify key opportunities for business improvement and new revenue-generating opportunities through marketplace intelligence, internal analyses, and qualitative insights
  • You have exceptional analytical skills to identify new revenue-generating opportunities
  • Understand the competitive landscape and can identify gaps and opportunities in our products and capabilities in collaboration with senior sales leadership
  • Drive execution of strategies and associated roadmaps, partnering with global Sales leaders to ensure alignment and collaboration
  • Help drive scalability and productivity in the organization, ensuring clear strategies are in place, comparing to industry or internal benchmarks for best-in-class commercial and enterprise performance
  • Solid track record in solution selling, building &  managing a highly productive sales team
Qualifications

Must Haves:

  • Minimum 5 years experience in a senior sales management role
  • University degree or Post Secondary Diploma in related discipline or equivalent business experience
  • Logistics experience in Freight, Warehousing, and Customs Brokerage (asset, but not required)
  • Outstanding communication (written and verbal), customer service, and interpersonal skills
  • Exceptional analytical skills
  • Demonstrated ability to drive >20% YOY growth and strategy for a sales organization
  • Previous experience selling in marketing, sales, or customer contact centers
  • You have strong negotiation skills and a persistent mentality
  • You are a clear and direct communicator and open to constructive feedback


Additional Information

What’s in it for you:

  • Competitive compensation to attract next-level talent 
  • Commission plan, benefits (health & dental), RRSPs, tuition reimbursement programs, professional training, paid time off as well as other fun perks (ie. Honeymoon High 5, paid sick leave, 16-weeks paid maternity/parental leave, as well as other paid leaves of absence)
  • Ability to work remotely or in a hybrid should the candidate be local

We are a values-based organization and a dedicated group of professionals who value teamwork, learning and development, and innovation. We take a great deal of pride in developing long-term relationships and in supporting our community and our environment for over 40 years!

To learn more about us, visit: https://www.aacb.com/

#ServewithEthusiasm #MakeitHappen #PlayasaTeam #Learn&Grow

A & A Customs Broker is a fair and equitable company. We welcome and encourage applications from all candidates regardless of ethnicity, race, religious beliefs, disability, age, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Buyer
description:
Buyer – Purchasing Dept
 
General Description
 
This position will be responsible for ensuring that we have the right product in the right place at the right time in order to maximize sales and minimize costs.  The successful candidate will be responsible for all purchasing ensuring profitable margins in accordance with prescribed purchasing regulations and procedures.  Buyer will work closely with the Proax Sales Team, Branch Managers and Accounting Department.  Reviews and analyzes purchase orders; interprets purchasing procedures to departments and vendors; investigates and develops sources of product; prepares bid specifications.  This position requires the use of initiative and independent judgment along with a degree of technical knowledge.
 
Responsibilities
 
In this position, your main objective is to actively manage the commodity vendor relationship. Your responsibilities will include obtaining quotes, placing purchase orders, provide forecasts, expediting deliveries and communicating vendor performance metrics. 
  • Create purchase orders to fill orders and maintain stock levels for 5 branch locations utilizing existing approved vendors.
  • Resolve purchase price variances and inventory adjustments
  • Provide feedback to Sales and Branch Managers regarding product supply issues 
  • Perform required expediting functions as required; follow-up with suppliers on status of orders/backorders
  • Prepare regular stock rotation with Vendors
  • Work with Sales to resolve customer service issues
  • Arrange and Monitor the logistics of scheduling shipping requirements and ensure that we are receiving the best freight rates available
  • Work with Accounts Payable to resolved Purchase Order pricing or quantity issues to support prompt vendor payments
  • Develop a strong positive rapport with all our vendors, and become the main contact
  • Work with Vendors to ensure product availability, delivery scheduling and to solve any pricing or other issues.
Work Experience Requirements
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization 
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • well organized with the ability to multi task in busy work schedule
  • 2-3 years inventory management & purchasing experience preferably.
  • Analytical skills to process and present data and reports for problem solving 
  • Self motivated person who enjoys challenges
  • Good attention to detail
  • Strong negotiation skills
Education Requirements
 
  • Supply Chain Management Professional designation (SCMP) or enrollment in the Strategic Supply Chain Management Leadership Program
  • Strong computer skills; Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite software and Excel Windows is required with five years of experience
  • Familiar with product line of automation controls would definitely be an asset
  • Bilingual (French/English)

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.
 
Position: Purchasing Agent
Location: Burnaby, BC 
Salary: $55,000 - $65,000 per year
Status: 1 Year Contract
Industry: Industrial/ Electrical Construction
 
Responsibilities:

  • Identify potential business opportunities
  • Responsible for day-to-day pricing and procurement of commodities for all projects
  • Assist with the maintenance of database
  • Support the senior purchasers with ongoing maintenance of our Database
  • Assist all Estimators as necessary to obtain pricing for Estimates and Projects
  • Among other duties as assigned
 
Qualifications:

  • Electrical and/or Electronics Technology training or experience
  • Formal purchasing training or education
  • Accubid experience an asset 
  • Procurement systems familiarity in the Electrical Industry
  • Ability to negotiate
  • Proven ability to manage risk
 
IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Selling Sales Manager
description:
Selling Sales Manager Career Opportunity!

Dufresne Furniture and Appliances is currently looking for a results driven Selling Sales Manager for our Saskatoon store located at 102-810 Circle Drive East.

As a Selling Sales Manager you are accountable for the day-to-day management and coaching of Sales Associates to effectively execute the Dufresne sales approach. You are also responsible for maximizing store sales and profitability by achieving mutually agreed upon targets in key areas and ensuring the delivery of an exceptional guest experience both personally and by your team.

Dufresne Furniture and Appliances is committed to investing in our people; we offer:

  • Industry leading earning potential with performance incentive based pay;
  • Comprehensive benefits plan, educational assistance program and excellent employee discounts;
  • Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Career growth and continuous development;
  • World class training programs.

As a Selling Sales Manager you will:

  • Set sales goals for each Sales Associate with the Store Manager
  • Meet or exceed established goals both on a personal and team basis.
  • Develop sales plans and strategies with Sales Associates and monitor their progress
  • Train and coach Sales Associates on products, upcoming promotions, selling skills and administration
  • Ensure all guests receive exceptional customer service
  • Motivate sales team to meet or exceed expectations
  • Recruit, hire, train and coach Sales Associates
  • Develop a customer contact follow-up system to maintain & grow a personal customer base.
  • Follow up with all customer contacts made but not closed after the initial visit

As a successful candidate you will have the following:

  • Post-secondary education in business, marketing or related field or combination of education and related experience
  • 2 - 4 years of proven sales experience in a related environment
  • Previous supervisory experience in a team environment
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of MS Office products and ability to learn in-house computer programs
  • Outstanding communication, coaching, and relationship building skills
  • Must be available to work days, evenings and weekends
  • Criminal Record Check required

The Dufresne “Better Experience” is for everyone. Our guests, our team members – what about you?

Apply now!

Dufresne Furniture and Appliances welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: District Sales Manager - Mobile Hydraulic Fluid Power
description:
Join the leadership team at SunSource, one of the country’s largest and most successful fluid power value add distributers. SunSource is a leader in fluid power and related technology applications for the North American industrial and mobile hydraulic markets. Not only is our expertise and broad range of products and solutions unrivaled in our field – our local perspective and comprehensive support systems have secured our place at the forefront of the industry.

We are currently seeking a District Sales Manager (DSM) for the Mobile Hydraulic business unit, managing sales territories in Toronto, ON and surrounding areas.   

Reporting directly to the Mobile Regional Vice President, you will manage 6+ Account Managers to meet critical sales objectives. Specifically, you will develop, coach and lead the sales team to be at the desired productivity levels to achieve established goals in terms of sales, district profitability, and specific company initiatives.

While managing sales operations for the specific district, the DSM will also develop and manage positive relationships with key suppliers. The success of the DSM in achieving these objectives will be measured by sales and team performance based on established plan.

Required Education and Experience:  

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering is preferred; 2 year Technical degree is a minimum requirement.
  • 5years of industrial sales experience demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility.
  • 3+ years experience in sales management.
  • Experience in distribution of fluid power products, specifically mobile hydraulic OEM’s is integral in the success to this position.


Knowledge and skills:

  • Proven ability to motivate and manage a sales group is required.
  • This includes ability to obtain productivity improvement, and to help account managers achieve higher sales levels.
  • The successful candidate should have P&L familiarity, including the ability to work with and/or establish budgets, forecasts, sales reports, etc.
  • The ability to take a long-term business view of sales is important.

title: Area Manager in Training - Ottawa Area
description:
Summary

The Area Manager in Training shall provide leadership, direction, and accountability for the Retail Store Team in a designated region. The Retail Area Manager in Training is a leader in driving result through effective sales team management, customer/guest engagement, coaching and mentoring using all available business KPI’s.

Responsible for managing multiple priorities, the supervision of a team of Store Managers, retail projects, execution of initiatives to enhance performance, execution, driving top line sales with a strong focus on profitability.

The Retail Area Manager in Training will provide sound leadership and coaching for all direct reports and will work closely with the Retail District Manager, Store Operations and all Head Office partners to ensure and support the growth and development of the region’s retail team through established goals and objectives which align with revenue, operations and customer service targets to enhance profitability.

The Area Manager in Training shall be responsible for the achievement of aggressive operations goals and targets, focused on high levels of customer satisfaction and overall store level performance.

Job Duties

  • Ensures the communication, understanding and belief in the company's goals and mission statement. Coaches all employees to work towards a common company objective.
  • Responsible for company monthly and weekly revenue and profit projections.
  • Oversees Store Managers to ensure that daily and weekly staff schedules are in direct relation to daily, weekly revenue.
  • Review monthly sales objectives and develop strategies to achieve targets
  • Gives prompt and proper direction to Store Managers and Direct reports
  • Provide leadership and support for all direct reports to ensure they excel in their roles to enhance employee engagement in order to drive results and achieve top performance.
  • Develop a positive collaborative working relationship with staff and partners to aid company performance
  • Adheres and enforces all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Attends to any emergencies as they arise at the store level and provide resolution or the appropriate level of communication.
  • Identify operational and merchandising deficiencies in all stores and provide solutions and guidance to all stores
  • Leads any training initiatives to achieve organizational goals and objectives.
  • Assumes responsibility for job and store profitability by finding areas of improvement and implementing initiatives.
  • Develop a positive working relationship with all levels of the organization to accomplish the company’s mission.
  • Adheres and enforces all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Attends Store and Head office meetings as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B. S.) from four-year college or university; or five to seven years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 3-5 years in the retail Industry in a multi-unit role.
  • CannSell Certification and Clean police record check.
  • Cannabis Retail Store Manager license from AGCO an asset.
  • To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of word processing software, spreadsheet software, e-mail software and use of the Internet.
  • The candidate must be well spoken and possess the ability to speak clearly and confidently in all business settings. The ability to conduct and reside over meetings.
  • Excellent Business Math skills. The ability to read, understand and calculate math calculations such as discounts, interest rates, percentages etc. Ability to apply concepts of basic math and written skills.
  • The ability to delegate, set expectations and monitor progress of all direct reports.

Motivate, inspire, provide, and accept feedback to and from employees

Reports to:  Retail District Manager

title: Regional Inside Sales Manager
description:
TradeRev has changed the automotive industry with its revolutionary product. Built as a multi-platform live auction app, TradeRev’s online automotive remarketing system has made a huge impact in the industry and has acquired quick user adoption with a fast-growing client base. As a subsidiary of KAR Auction Services, Inc. and partnering with our sister company ADESA, we are continuing to expand TradeRev’s footprint in the dealer-to-dealer online space in the US and Canadian markets.  

  

Why Work with Us?  

Whether your Fun is in working with new technology, learning skills, collaborating with awesomely talented people or growing into a Specialist, Team Lead or People Manager, we want to feed this fire in you. If you have the work ethic, skill and motivation, we will help you find a path that leads you where your passion wants to go. So come on; let's have Fun together.  

  

Our Core Values: We are FHAB. Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.  

  

Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/ 

  

Position Overview  

  

The Regional Inside Sales Manager will be responsible for the development, management, and strategic utilization of the Inside Sales team. This person will oversee a team of inside sales representatives and drive their team hit monthly goals, as provided by the Senior Director, Inside Sales.  

 

Responsibilities and Duties:  

  • Build and manage a team that contacts partners through phone calls, email, texts, etc. to communicate opportunities to extend initiatives with the company.

  • Ensure high-quality experience for all customers engaged by the inside sales team. 

  • Work to continuously improve the team’s customer engagement while motivating them to achieve their budgets.  

  • Work in partnership with the Senior Director, Inside Sales and other departments to develop and execute strategic business plans. 

  • Provide feedback and recommendations to the Senior Director, Inside Sales. 

  • Advocate client requests within the organization.  Resolve customer issues and complaints.

  • Maintain a strong working knowledge of operations and affiliated company activities. 

  • Maintain an effective relationship and line of communication with Market Sales Directors. 

  • Identify opportunities and/or gaps to improve operations and our product.  

  • Create and analyze reports including sales results, dealer activity, and buying progressions and reductions, sales trends.   

  • Learn the product inside and out. Understand how the technology was created and why it exists.

  • Hold all direct reports accountable to meet aggressive timelines and job responsibilities. 

  • Research, Identify, Create, supervise, and monitor daily sales initiatives (event sales) to meet established sales goals. 

  • Provide focus and guidance for the Inside Sales Teams on potential sales opportunities  

  • Coach and mentor team members to assist with their professional development, based off best practices and experience  

  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned 

​

Qualifications & Education Requirements:  

  • Post-Secondary School required or equivalent experience; Bachelor’s Degree in business, sales, or related discipline preferred  

  • 3-5 years in inside sales, sales and customer service 

  • 2-4 years of proven management skills and experience also required.

  • Background in automotive sales an asset 

  • A good understanding of competitive products and industry landscape is required.  

  • Strong analytical skills and previous customer service/customer-facing experience required.  

  • Exposure to Salesforce CRM & RingDNA or like products 

  • A strong competency in SalesForce and call campaign management is required.   

  • A good understanding of TradeRev systems and user interface is required after hire.  

  • A competency in SalesForce is required.   

  • 10% estimated travel time required.  

  • Must be qualified to operate a motor vehicle and possess a valid driver’s license. 

  • Advanced level of Microsoft Office tools e.g. Excel and Google Sheets 

  • Possess leadership qualities and ability to motivate individuals  

  • Analytical and persuasive   

  • Tech and People Savvy  

  • Self-motivated and a team player  

  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions  

​We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be considered.  

  

TradeRev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

title: Account Director - North America
description:
We are looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic, and experienced Account Director to lead our North American account team, and to forge strong client relationships. 

As our next Account Director, youâ€™re a seasoned pro that has been through the ups and downs of agency life, and you have grown stronger from it. Now youâ€™re able to share that experience to guide our account team, and to help manage some of our biggest client accounts such as MondelÄ“z, Peloton, Diageo, and Keurig Dr Pepper.

Youâ€™ve learned that being an incredible Account person requires you to think 5 steps ahead of your clients, and that proactivity is key. You have energy for days, and you love building trustworthy connections with your team, and with your clients. 

Sound like you? Weâ€™d love to talk to you about this position! 

 

This is a full-time permanent remote position. The ideal candidate can be located anywhere in the United States, with the flexibility to travel to client meetings. 
 

WHAT YOUâ€™LL DO

Relationships are at the core of this role - youâ€™ll be establishing, maintaining, and growing strong client relationships, as well as leading and molding account managers into powerful client partners and buzzmakers, managing their workload and prioritizing their development in relation to your teamâ€™s needs and the needs of your clients.

  • Build strong client relationships: Youâ€™ll maintain and achieve growth on existing accounts, driving client satisfaction at every touch point, and engaging in discussions to take actions to improve the business. You will know the clientsâ€™ brands inside out speaking knowledgeably and confidently on business objectives and priorities.
  • Spot opportunities for account growth:You'll spot merchandising moments and proactively identify areas of opportunity to grow accounts and drive revenue.
  • Lead on strategic planning:You'll have a key role in informing and developing annual scopes of work, quarterly business and account reviews. Youâ€™ll anticipate and understand client needs and workflow to ensure work is delivered on time and budget. 
  • Confident & clear communicator: Youâ€™ll articulate strong viewpoints informed by an understanding of the business and your clients, but also with the ability to handle uncomfortable conversations with grace and positive intent. 
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders: Youâ€™ll work closely with Strategy and Project Management to create plans on managing projects and delivering flawless execution. Youâ€™ll partner with the Managing Director NA and Head of Social in strengthening the client relationship, communicating with candor and leading with respect. 

ABOUT YOU

  • Solutions-oriented: ability to identify red flags and recommend proactive solutions to mitigate any risk. 
  • Proactive & problem solver: having a key eye for identifying and resolving any internal team issues or with the client. You can stretch to fill any need - rolling up your sleeves to get work done. 
  • Outstanding communicator:ability to present, sell, develop presentations, POVs,  and key strategic documents to provide thought leadership and drive innovation.
  • Confidence and gravitas: Inspire confidence and growth in agency team members, a great communicator, collaborator and negotiator. Articulated and persuasive when communicating work and ideas. 
  • Social media savvy:expert in advising clientsâ€™ of best practices and latest social offerings. Youâ€™ll bring consistent knowledge of both client growing opportunities and â€œwhat to avoidâ€ to the team.

 

WHAT TO BRING 

  • More than 7 years of marketing/creative agency account management experience, leading work for high-profile brands.
  • Proven experience in strategic planning, account forecasting, team training and client issue resolution.
  • Proven commercial success, ideally through organic growth.
  • Previous experience in managing several large accounts with minimal supervision.
  • Strong leadership ability and previous management experience
  • Strong strategic account leadership experience
  • Excellent organizational skills, including attention to precise details and accuracy
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent work experience. 

OUR BENEFITS(US Benefits)

  • 100% Remote work: we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance.
  • Flexible working hours
  • 33 days of holiday (including bank holidays): Increasing with length of service up to a maximum of 36days holiday
  • Birthday off
  • Annual Occasion Day off for an important event
  • 1 Volunteer day off
  • Group Insurance Medical plans with generous employer contribution, including one plan that is employer covered
  • Dental and Vision plans 
  • 401k with employer matching
  • Wellbeing Support

The Social Element values 

Work according to the company values

  • Do it Well
  • Be One Team
  • Do the Right Thing
  • Keep Pioneering
  • Make Them Smile

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer.  Our recruitment process is fair, transparent and based on merit, skill and experience related to the role.  We welcome applications from diverse and under-represented groups regardless of their background.

HOW TO APPLY

If all this sounds like you, simply upload your CV/resume and a cover letter (or a link to your cover letter video if you prefer). *Make sure to include the following details in your cover letter/video, or we wonâ€™t be able to process your application:

  • Details of your account management and leadership experience, in particular in marketing/creative agencies.
  • Details of your personal/professional experience in social media
  • Why you are interested in being part of our team at The Social Element

title: Procurement Assistant
description:
Position Description: Responsible for supporting the work of the Procurement Agent/Manager


Reports to: Procurement Agent or Procurement Manager


Essential Duties & Responsibilities*:


+ May be requested to assist in the development of bid lists for trade items.

+ Develop general knowledge of all contract documents.

+ Schedule and/or participate in pre-bid meetings.

+ Spreadsheet development and responsibility: Assist in the preparation of assigned spreadsheets based on template provided by Procurement designed to confirm that bidders have complied with contract documents, scope requirements, quantities of key materials and labor, alternates and unit pricing, schedules and logistics plans, labor costing (Prevailing Wage, Davis Bacon, etc.), M/W/DBE or other business classification requirements, insurance and bonding requirements and any other project-specific requirements.

+ Scope of Work: Assist in the preparation of Scope of Work/Additional Provisions for assigned trades based upon template provided by Procurement designed to identify the complete scope of work including unique scope requirements, alternates and unit pricing, schedules, logistics plans, labor costing (Prevailing Wage, Davis Bacon, etc.), M/W/DBE or other business classification requirements, insurance and bonding requirements and any other project-specific requirements.

+ May include distribution of bid documents.

+ Contact vendors/subcontractors during the bidding phases to ascertain coverage of trade items and identifying problems that may exist.

+ Receive questions from bidders and obtain clarification through the Project Engineer (or Bid period Request For Information (RFI) Lead), if necessary, and forward answers to all bidders.

+ Ensure that a sufficient number of properly submitted bids are received on bid day.

+ Assist in the receiving of bids.

+ Conduct follow-up calls to bidders and participate in scope review meetings.

+ Schedule and/or participate in pre-bid meetings.

+ Conduct scope review meetings with competitive bidders (and with operations staff as required).

+ Lead or assist in the updating of Scope of Work following scope review meetings to ensure that Procurement has a complete buy.

title: Bid Manager
description:
Since 1988, Distributel connects Canadians to the people, passion, and priorities that matter. By constantly challenging ourselves to simplify, add utility, and humanize the ways people do business with us, we will create a valuable experience for our customers in every way. 

Join an award-winning organization in its mission to provide a true alternative to Canadian consumers!

â€‹

LOCATIONS:

  • Toronto, Ontario
  • Ottawa, Ontarioâ€‹
  • MontrÃ©al, QuÃ©bec
  • Edmonton, Alberta
  • Vancouver, British Columbia

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:

Reporting to the Commercial Sales Director, the Complex Bid Manager will be integral to the delivery of strategic bids to both end users and developing bids in conjunction with indirect/channel partners.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Acts as primary point of contact in the bid process, between the client, partner, and internal staff.
  • Sourcing, evaluating, and responding to bids in conjunction with sales, internal commercial departments (such as finance, engineering, professional services) and strategic / indirect channel partners. 
  • Maintains relationships with key partners (such as Microsoft, Telax) and stays current on training, sales funnel reporting, and events.
  • Ensures content, pricing, financial viability, compliance is met and attends/plans strategy meetings with key stakeholders.
  • Conducts and analyses win/lose reviews/feedback.
  • Submits a completed bid to an existing or prospective client, on time and within budget.
  • Ensure that all the client's questions have been answered as fully as possible, and that Distributel has given itself the best possible chance of success.
  • Weekly updates into internal and Microsoft CRM.
  • Lead user on RFP / Bid software.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to communicate technical information in laymanâ€™s terms.
  • Ability to maintain and develop strong professional relationships
  • Self-motivation.
  • Analytical, detail-oriented, organized.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Multi-tasking works well under pressure.
  • Excellent communication skills, written and spoken. French a strong asset.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

  • Minimum 2 years post-secondary in a related field, technical degree, telecommunications, business administration.
  • Experience:  5 years in a technical sales role.

LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

  • V-TSP Microsoft P-Seller Program
  • Clarity Connect Sales Engineer training

HEREâ€™S WHATâ€™S IN IT FOR YOU:

Experience a wealth of opportunities that only a growing company can offer by joining a dynamic team thatâ€™s vigilantly working together towards reshaping the telecommunications landscape.

  • The heart and soul of our compensation program is built from the foundation of our vision, mission and values.
  • Industry-leading Corporate Medical and Dental benefits program, in addition to many other perks that make Distributel a great place to work.
  • RRSP contributions.
  • We promote work-life balance with generous PTO.
  • We provide a great work environment with organized social events.
  • Youâ€™ll have opportunities for growth & development.
  • We have great downtown locations and amazing people.

Distributel connects Canadians to the people, passion, and priorities that matter. Join us in our mission to provide a true alternative to Canadian consumers!

Diversity and inclusion are important at Distributel. We appreciate the uniqueness of all individuals and believe that our differences are what make us stronger. Distributel is committed to providing a workplace that ensures equal opportunities, development, and advancement for all.

WHAT HAPPENS AFTER YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION?

Your application is placed in our candidate pool. When there are job openings, a search will be conducted in the candidate pool. If your application matches the managerâ€™s search criteria, you may be contacted for a pre-screen interview.

Due to high volumes of applications and to ensure a fair selection process, a random selection of applicants meeting all criteria for a job may be used, therefore not all applicants who submit an application will be contacted.

Diversity and inclusion are important at Distributel. We appreciate the uniqueness of all individuals and believe that our differences are what make us stronger. Distributel is committed to providing a work workplace that ensures equal opportunities, development, and advancement for all current and future employees.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or 

recruitment@distributel.ca

.

COVID-19 CONSIDERATIONS: 

We are accepting applications and conducting telephone/video interviews. To ensure the safety of our staff we are following all Public Health Safety requirements. Social Distancing is mandatory.

Please be advised that we currently require any persons working in our workplaces to be fully vaccinated. As a Federally regulated company, any legislation regarding mandatory vaccination for Federally regulated companies will apply to us and our workforce, and that would then include our permanent remote workers as well (Contact Centers).  If the legislation which is currently contemplated comes into force, ALL our employees will be required to self-report on their vaccination status and provide verifying documentation. Should you require medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination, there will be a process to apply for an exemption.

title: Buyer
description:
Company Overview:

Teledyne Micralyne Inc. is internationally recognized for its unique design and fabrication in Micro Electromechanical Systems (MEMS) technology. With over 30 years of experience and business, Teledyne Micralyne is leading todayâ€™s cutting-edge MEMS technology in Canada. Every member of the Teledyne Micralyne team is committed to the following core values: Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and Commitment. Teledyne Micralyne is proud to work with customers as strategic partners towards providing innovative solutions to meet evolving global needs and societal expectations. Teledyne Micralyne is the heart of devices that advance humanity.

ISO9001:2015 and ISO13485:2016 certified.

Position Summary and Responsibilities:

Summary

Responsible for managing day-to-day activities in Supply Chain.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Prepare and issue Request-For-Quotes (RFQ's),
  • Review and process Purchase Requisitions,
  • Provide Supply Chain input to product reviews,
  • Analyze bids and award recommendations,
  • Able to work independently and within a team,
  • Liaise between Quality Assurance, Inventory Control, Production, and Development,
  • Maintain an organized schedule, and plan in advance
  • Review vendor performance through management of Key Performance Indicators (KPI's)/problems/billings/resolutions,
  • Demonstrate proficiency in Excel, Word and Office Products,
  • Exhibit high level of communication skills, including phone and email.
Qualifications:

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Education and Experience

  • Degree in Materials Management, or equivalent degree/diploma,
  • Member of APICS, or working toward  designation,
  • Member of SCMA, or working toward  designation,  
  • Minimum of 3 years in a purchasing/buyer role,  
  • Experience with high tech, or repetitive manufacturing environment would be an asset.

title: Area Manager-Sudbury
description:
We are currently seeking an Area Manager to join our team in Greater Sudbury Area. As Area Manager, working under the direction of the Director, Property Management Division, this position oversees the administrative and maintenance operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide supervision, give direction, delegate to administrative and maintenance staff
  • Cost Management of operating budget â€“ to include determining, dispensing, monitoring, and management of the monthly spending
  • Purchase order processing and contractor management â€“ issuing purchase orders and managing, directing contractors
  • Property Maintenance & Administrative Management â€“ Assigning tasks and duties to 3rd party property manager, administrators and superintendents on a daily basis; monitor progress or status of assigned work; disciplines employees
  • Management and reporting â€“ working closely with 3rd party manager; providing required reports, leasing activity, property and suite inspections and responses in a timely manner to Director, Property Management
  • Management Reporting â€“ Daily, weekly, monthly reporting to company, attendance at conference calls, meetings as necessary
  • Attendance at various meetings during and after regular business hours (i.e. property manager meetings, tenant meetings)
  • Work order processing and administration and oversee the whole workflow from opening of a service call ticket to completion and closing of all work orders in a timely fashion
  • Rent Collection, Arrears Management
  • Lease Administration and Tenant Liaison â€“ Leasing, Market and Affordable Market Units
  • Annual Rent Review Process
  • Preparation of Legal Documents for LTB hearings, Eviction, etc.
  • Conducting in-suite, vacant unit, building and grounds inspections â€“ schedule and/or assign deficiencies to property manager, administrator, superintendent or contractor for completion
  • Respond to after business hours & weekend emergency calls
  • Other assignments within the scope, spirit, and purpose of the job as reasonably requested from time to time by management

Desired Skills and Experience

  • 3 or more years experience in residential property management and knowledge of property administration and maintenance practices
  • Knowledge of various legislations, including the RTA (Resident Tenancy Act),
  • Knowledge of codes & regulations, including Fire Code, Building Code, Occupational Health & Safety Act
  • Knowledge and understanding of building systems (HVAC, Fire Protection, Mechanical, Electrical)
  • Knowledge and experience of LTB proceedings as it relates to the process of serving Notices relating to non-rental payments, anti-social behavior, illegal activity, etc.
  • Strong customer service orientation and delivery
  • Skilled in organizing and supervising multiple simultaneous service requests
  • Energetic leadership. Enjoys leading by example. Using a "can-do" attitude that will positively influence, motivate and energize the team.
  • Proven ability to identify, evaluate and develop new ideas with supportable results,
  • Solid Analytical Strengths. Ability to apply logic and reasoning to effectively manage projects, analyze complex financial, legal, and contractual problems, and provide solutions or recommendations,
  • Ability to respond and express ideas clearly in written and oral communication
  • Experience utilizing Yardi Voyager and Rent CafÃ© and/or similar financial software
  • Strong computer skills â€“ MS Word, Excel, Outlook,
  • Strong Contract Management and Trade Supervision
  • Sound analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to identify risk, thereby mitigating liability
  • Excel at planning and organizing; Ability to meet deadlines proficiently
  • Demonstrates a high degree of integrity
  • Reliable vehicle required
  • Out of city travel may be required from time to time as business needs arise
  • Working hours are generally Monday â€“ Friday 8:00 am â€“ 5:00 pm; occasional weekends; on-call for emergencies only

This is an excellent opportunity for a career-minded property management professional looking to further their career. If this sounds like you, please apply with your resume. We thank you in advance for your interest!

Candidates will only be contacted if chosen for interview. Candidates must be authorized to work in Canada.

Please note: Successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of their Covid-19 vaccination status. Accommodation will be provided to candidates who are legally entitled to accommodation.

We are an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request.

Avanew is one of Canada's premiere real estate services companies managing a wide range of property types providing tenants and landlords with superior service and outstanding value.

title: Wholesale Manager (Remote)
description:
Our Mission is Simple: Be the easiest place to buy and sell your car in Canada


What does that mean? We look at every single aspect of a vehicle purchase and remove all of the friction points.


Here's a few examples:
You can buy a car entirely online, without any salespeople involved
You can have your new car delivered to your driveway, usually the same day
You can spend a week with your vehicle to decide if you love it, and if you don't we'll pick it up


Job description:

  • Building a dealer buyer portfolio
  • Build strong relationships/rapport with various dealerships across the market
  • Contribute to team building and CRM growth
  • Effectively coordinate/collaborate with multiple departments (Reconditioning, Logistics and Accounting)
  • Make improvements to current processes
  • Hit weekly targets based on assigned selling requirements
  • Interview, hire, and train new team members
  • Manage vehicle inventory in Salesforce
  • Provide leadership and guidance, and ongoing feedback to direct reports regarding performance, productivity, work quality and adherence to the company policy and procedures


Skills and Qualifications:

  • Previous wholesale experience is considered an asset.
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Willingness to learn and work at all levels to support department’s goals
  • Basic understanding of the overall automotive industry passion for automobiles and a foundational knowledge of vehicle brands, makes, models and market trends are required
  • Strong negotiation and leadership skills
  • Excellent analytical and decision-making skills
  • Previous experience with Salesforce and other related softwares etc. is considered an asset
  • Able to work flexible hours throughout the week in accordance with auctions across Canada
  • Self starter and ability to work independently
  • Strong multi-tasking skills with ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and under pressure.
  • High attention to detail


This is a truly exciting time to join Canada Drives and we are looking forward to doing great things together! In addition to a competitive salary, we provide:

  • Extended dental and medical benefits
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Excellent on the job training
  • Inclusive, fun, and vibrant work environment

title: Regional Sales Director, Canada, Cloud Native, Linux & Virtualization Solution Sales
description:
Overall responsibility for the regions sales, third party alliances, and customer satisfaction. Develops and implements a comprehensive strategy that maximizes Oracle's opportunities across all products and product lines.

Manages and develops a team of sales representatives including recruiting, hiring, and training new reps on the Oracle sales process. May manage a Regional Manager or Branch Manager. Sells and promotes the sales of Oracle products to customers including negotiating price, other concessions and terms and conditions of the sale. Participates in strategic and tactical planning for the division. Builds working relationships with license, consulting and education field managers in the respective territory to develop joint account plans. Develops and execute a territory plan to maximize revenue. Generates and achieves monthly territory forecasts, and accurately predicts revenue on a monthly basis. Manages escalation. Conducts weekly progress meetings with sales team.

Assists in the development of short, medium, and long term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interacts across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Ability to influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations important. 5 or more years sales or sales management experience within technology industry. Ability to hire and train new sales representatives. Ability to resolve customer satisfaction issues. Demonstrated leadership skills. Effective written and verbal communication skills, ability to present to large and small audiences. Ability to negotiate price, other concessions and terms and conditions. Strong quantitative, analytical and conflict resolution abilities.

title: Customer Success Manager | Remote
description:
YOUR OPPORTUNITY

In this role, you are the face of the company to our customers, which represent many of the world’s best brands. You will be responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction and support with a can-do attitude! You will utilize account intelligence to drive best practices throughout the customer lifecycle, ultimately achieving world-class growth and retention of their assigned book of business.

 

Our Customer Success Managers (CSMs) strategize with their clients to align with their company’s ambitions and goals. You will also collaborate with Customer Success Directors (CSDs) in defining organizational goals and strategic plans to ensure both customer longevity and systematic business growth. Successful CSMs will be great at executive engagement with clients, and collaborating with a team that drives retention and growth by delivering a world-class customer experience for InMoment’s clients.


In this specific assignment, we are looking for a CSM who has market research and analytics experience to lead some of our largest Canadian mobility programs.


WHO WE ARE 

At InMoment, we have a saying: #OwnTheMomentsThatMatter. And we live it! As a team, we recognize that every moment offers a new opportunity to make an impact and leave our mark. We take deliberate action to make the lives of our families, teammates, clients, and community better within every interaction.


We are dedicated to our game-changing mission of Experience Improvement (XI), helping our clients improve experiences at the intersection of value—where customer, employee, and business needs come together. We consistently challenge the status quo in the customer experience (CX), employee experience (EX), market research (MX), and product experience (PX) industries with our hyper-modern technology platform, decades of domain authority, and global teams of experts. And we have more innovation in store!


Are you ready to #OwnTheMomentsThatMatter with us? 


WHO YOU ARE

  • You have 5+ years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, Sales, Consulting, and/or Professional Services with enterprise clients
  • 5+ years experience in a research or analytic role leveraging data to guide business decisions
  • Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) or higher preferred
  • Background in Customer Experience or Market Research (Auto Industry preferred)
  • Experience working with a technical customer base and understanding of corporate IT projects and processes
  • Exceptional written and oral communication and presentation skills to senior-level executives, both internally and with clients
  • Demonstrated experience working independently with minimal supervision
  • Proficiency to manage projects and perform as a team player and leader
  • Aptitude to resolve complex and diverse issues, and meet deadlines
  • Strong mathematical, quantitative, and analytical skills
  • Ability to see patterns in data, and to “tell stories” with the findings
  • Understanding of syndicated research, including analysis and presentation of findings


WHAT YOU’LL DO 

  • The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is the day-to-day point of contact for strategy, insights, and recommendations for client programs. The CSM for this role will own the overall relationship with several key enterprise clients within the mobility business unit and will provide overall leadership to the InMoment account team while engaging with the client on leveraging their CX program to drive value and results. The CSM is responsible for conducting regular business reviews formally with the client to identify future business needs and create a strategic plan to align with Clients’ business initiatives. 
  • You have an understanding of customers’ business priorities, overall market landscape, and organization and ability to develop executive-level relationships to map and link every part of the program to an effective action; closed loop, upsell, cross-sell, rescue to deliver ROI.
  • Oversee the development, administration, and analysis of Experience Improvement programs, ensuring ongoing value to our clients in helping them execute against their business strategies.
  • You are the Voice of the Customer and will conduct regular business reviews to recognize positive outcomes, stay coordinated on open items, and make recommendations for how customers can drive Experience Improvement, across a variety of sources and channels, in more ways, and with broader business applications using InMoment’s solutions.
  • Coordinate the resolution of customer issues. 
  • Achieve gross retention and growth targets. Drive renewal readiness efforts related to account prioritization activities and alignment of necessary organizational resources to support renewal motion requirements. 
  • Be Invested in making a positive impact: on your personal development, on your team, on your customers, and on the company.


WHAT YOU’LL GAIN 

  • Autonomy - We trust our employees and offer an extremely flexible work schedule
  • Vacation and Personal Days - We encourage all employees to recharge!
  • Top up employer assistance Maternity Leave Program
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • Private Medical Plan with dental insurance
  • Employer-paid Short Term Disability and Life Insurance
  • 401(k) with a generous company match, access to a personal financial planner, and both legal and life insurance
  • Access to wellbeing initiatives and offerings such as our Employee Assistance
  • A program that includes counseling sessions, phone and online support on matters such as Family, Health, Money, and Work for you and your family members.
  • Inclusion and Diversity teams - Women of InMoment and InMovement
  • Employee recognition platform points can be used with retailers such as Amazon, and use points for hotels, tickets, gift cards, and charitable donations
  • Employee recruitment referral program with generous payouts! 
  • An opportunity to truly ‘Leave your Mark’ in a global organization. Come join our team!


KEY RELATIONSHIPS

This role reports directly to the Client Success Director. The person we choose for this role will need to be able to work well with other internal departments such as Engineering, System Operations, Technical Support, Solutions Design, and various Help Desks.  As mentioned above, there will also be direct client contact.


At InMoment, inclusion and diversity are at the core of who we are. InMoment prides itself on an inclusive culture that promotes, encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees and clients. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the communities we serve and believe that different perspectives, interests and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Field Sales Manager GTA
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You lead a team of field sales representatives/managers to ensure execution of the sales strategy and achievement of annual KPIs and targets.

How you will contribute

You will:

  • Lead, manage, and motivate the field sales team in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA); Territory represents ~$90M in Sales / covering ~400 Stores across Grocery & Mass customers.
  • Coach, train and develop the GTA Field Sales Team (~15 Direct Reports); Embody our MDLZ values and drive a culture of inclusivity  and foster engagement across the team.
  • Manage winning customer business relationships that facilitate “best in industry” execution of our categories.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders including Customer Account Teams, Category / Brand Teams, Sales Strategy,  Customer Finance etc., to execute the annual plan with excellence across your region.
  • Deliver annual business plan, including agreed upon Retail KPI's and sales targets and provide reporting as required

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

  • Strong track record of leading and developing people.
  • Considerable knowledge of Canadian CPG Landscape acquired over ~10 years of progressive / relevant work experience.
  • A team first mentality and strong bias for collaboration across the organization
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Solid knowledge of sales fundamentals and negotiation processes
  • Perseverance and attention to details

More about this role

What you need to know about this position: The GTA is a critically important territory for Mondelez Canada, with high visibility across the organization.

What extra ingredients you will bring: A desire to learn, grow and accelerate your career development.

Education / Certifications: Bachelors degree required

Job specific requirements: Valid "G" drivers license required. Position will come with a Company Car.

Travel requirements: Daily Travel Only; expected to be in field 3-4 days per week.

Work schedule: Business Hours

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Field Sales

Sales

title: Account Director
description:
Account Directors are the lynchpin to our success and growth: the role is a combination of strategy, project management, client servicing, advisory, and business development all in one. As an Account Director (or Client Partner), you will build influential relationships and provide leadership for our clients, identifying key business outcomes and shaping corresponding programs to deliver against them. You are responsible for all aspects of delivery, collaborating with and providing guidance to our Strategy and Content teams, as well as experts from our Creator Network.


You bring experience from global, top-tier creative and/or digital agencies, and the confidence to work on completely new types of projects; challenging long-standing assumptions, defending recommendations, and delivering high-value client work for category-leading organizations. You inspire teammates to raise the bar on every level – from brief to execution – because you fully understand this new experience economy, how and why expectations are transcending categories, and where the future is headed for B2C and B2B brands.

You are looking for the next big challenge, and like us, you have no small plans.

This is a full-time opportunity offering a competitive base salary, 3-weeks vacation, comprehensive benefits package, and gym access. Our headquarters is a converted two-storey apartment-office in the heart of historic Gastown. If you are not located in Vancouver, but are interested in working remotely or relocating for the role let us know!

Quietly is an award-winning, full-service content marketing agency, working across the entire lifecycle of content, from discovery and strategy to production and distribution. Quietly partners with category leaders such as Adobe, Dell Technologies, Goldman Sachs, Herschel, MEC, Sotheby’s International Realty, PwC, and Slack to understand how content drives their business, devising strategies and executing along the way. Quietly is data-driven to our core, developing technology in-house, as well as stand alone products like Insights.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Drive conversations with C-level executives, assessing needs and identifying opportunities based on what they need to do to succeed in their category

  • Identify and eloquently explain Quietly solutions that provide real business value to our clients, including shaping a POV, determining key outcomes defining the strategic approach, and developing execution plans

  • Develop robust project plans and budgets, driving total clarity into approach and scope, and craft corresponding proposals and contracts

  • Lead and deliver resulting engagements in coordination with Strategists, Content team members and our Creator Network

  • Inspire and encourage team members to continuously elevate the work we deliver, providing insightful feedback and direction throughout engagements

  • Strategically grow your accounts, managing and delivering to revenue and project profitability targets

  • Work with internal teams to evolve our offerings, improve planning frameworks and optimize our delivery processes

  • Proactively stay informed of industry trends and be a content marketing thought leader

  • Maintain strong post-engagement client relationships to introduce new opportunities accordingly

  • Provide support to Business Development

    WHO YOU ARE

    • An experienced client services or account director who is accountable for high-profile, enterprise accounts

    • A track record of managing customer relationships at all altitudes through effective interpersonal communication and partnering

    • Strong project management experience including scoping and budgeting, task management, resource allocation

    • Experience forecasting projected revenue and tracking project profitability

    • Strong presentation, verbal and written skills, with a proven ability to develop well-written documents and engaging presentations

    • A track record in and strong understanding of content strategy and creation, as well as knowledge of paid marketing and distribution, with proven experience in delivering effective business strategy

    • A strong understanding of quantitative and qualitative data, and an analytical mindset

      Our headquarters are located in an incredible converted two-storey live-work space with a gorgeous rooftop patio in the heart of historic Gastown. The building and first floor of our unit are accessible spaces. We’re also open to folks working remotely within North American time zones.

      Quietly values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity and inclusion at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected, and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths.

      We welcome qualified candidates who face barriers to the workforce to apply. If you require support or accommodations throughout the selection process and/or while working at Quietly, please don’t hesitate to reach out to our Head of People & Culture, Parker Bailey, at parker@quiet.ly.



      By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Client Manager - BioAnalytical Services (100% Remote)
description:
Altasciences is a forward-thinking, mid-size contract research organization offering pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies a proven, flexible approach to preclinical and clinical pharmacology studies, including formulation, manufacturing and analytical services. For over 25 years, Altasciences has been partnering with sponsors to help support educated, faster, and more complete early drug development decisions. Altasciences’ integrated, full-service solutions include preclinical safety testing, clinical pharmacology and proof of concept, bioanalysis, program management, medical writing, biostatistics, and data management, all customizable to specific sponsor requirements. Altasciences helps sponsors get better drugs to the people who need them, faster.

title: Sr. Principal/Principal Success Manager
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Customer Success Group

Job Details

The Success Manager leverages deep business, industry and product knowledge to partner with customers and guide them to accelerate business value and return from their investment with Salesforce. In this role, the Success Manager will specialize in one or more lines of businesses, a specific cloud or industry to speak the customer language and ensure customer value realization. They are aligned at the key stakeholder level, building and encouraging positive relationships to help customers progress on their digital journey. Success Managers are working directly with customers that can vary in their market segment, size, solution complexity and life cycle, depending on the customer's needs.

The Success Manager will possess both a Cloud specialization and industry skills that enables them to speak the customer language.


Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate our Customer Success Methodology and partner with customers stakeholders to understand their goals, assess their capabilities, and provide recommendations to help them accelerate the achievement of their business and technology objectives
  • Develop an understanding and knowledge of customer’s Salesforce implementation and evangelize the capabilities of Salesforce across all of our Clouds
  • Guide a customer on org strategy, governance and change management standard methodologies based on customer needs
  • Demonstrate hands-on Salesforce product knowledge by applying platform features and functions to customer business priorities and roadmap
  • Proactively identify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals and work with the account team to build a risk mitigation plan
  • Produce and implement a comprehensive adoption path showing the current state, target future state with timeline, and an underlying enablement Plan.
  • Deliver business value and innovation to a customer’s business by understanding our customers’ key business challenges and potential for growth
  • Working collaboratively with the account team and Salesforce Execs, optimally network within accounts from the Executive-Level down, in order to help customers work towards their goals
  • When appropriate, recommend additional Salesforce services and advisory experts needed to drive success



Requirements:

  • Experienced professional with 7-10 years of relevant industry expertise
  • Bilingual French/English is preferred
  • In-depth knowledge in one or more lines of businesses (LoB) - a specific cloud or industry
  • Strong consulting skills and proven results working as a Trusted Advisor to drive business value for customers
  • Ability to drive effective and influencing conversations at the C-level; facilitate difficult discussions and be adept at handling objections
  • Strong knowledge of Salesforce product and platform features, capabilities, and best use is highly desired
  • Able to articulate the importance and value of Governance to Business and IT executives
  • Good understanding of enterprise architecture principles is strongly preferred
  • Ability to quickly grasp and distinctly explain technological and business concepts

*LI-Y

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes.Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement withSalesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Customer Success Manager - Pharmacovigilance & Safety (Remote)
description:
Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva’s software helps our customers bring medicines and therapies to patients faster.

We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation. As a PBC, we are committed to making the industries we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.

Veeva is a Work Anywhere company which means that you can choose to work in the environment that works best for you - on any given day. Whether you choose to work remotely from home or work in an office - it’s up to you.

The Role

The success of our customers is core to Veeva's mission. Our commitment to customer success is delivered by fostering proactive partnerships and providing best-in-class services. Vault Safety (PV) Customer Success Managers (CSMs) are specifically focused on the success of our Vault Safety customers. They work alongside our product, support, sales, and services teams to ensure full product adoption and best utilization of Veeva solutions in order to achieve optimal business value. 

Our Safety CSM team is comprised of highly-skilled individuals with deep life sciences and Pharmacovigilance domain experience. By combining our customer knowledge with deep product expertise, we help customers identify areas of improvement, develop best practices, and drive industry transformation.

This is a remote, full-time permanent role with Veeva. This is a customer-facing role and we have no work location requirement if you are in close proximity to an airport and able to meet future travel requirements.

Veeva Systems does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B, OPT) for this employment position.

What You'll Do

  • Own a Customer Success strategy for Enterprise and emerging mid-sized life-sciences customers
  • Establish relationships and consistent touchpoints with assigned customer contacts
  • Effectively demo Vault capabilities including use-cases, best practices, challenges, and how to address known gaps
  • Guide customers on best practices to optimize the consumption of Veeva releases (e.g. change management and validation)
  • Influence and drive change within customer organizations, including governance, consulting, key business process reviews, application reporting/adoption initiatives, and feature enablement
  • Build and manage customer working groups and communities so that our customers have an avenue for peer-to-peer interactions and the development of best practices

Requirements

  • 7+ years of experience working with life-sciences companies in the Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance domain with demonstrated understanding of drug development processes and technologies
  • Strong knowledge of Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance processes and regulations
  • Hands-on implementation experience or use of safety databases like ARISg or ARGUS
  • Proven ability to translate between IT and Business stakeholders to ensure business goals are achieved
  • Track record of leading life sciences software implementation projects as a consultant, business analyst, IT lead, and/or business sponsor
  • Must be able to take complex business and software concepts and articulate them to an audience of varying perception levels
  • Ability to balance day-to-day project execution and long-term Customer Success within a fast-paced, collaborative team environment
  • Ability to travel 25%
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent knowledge

Nice to Have

  • SaaS/Cloud experience
  • Participation in industry efforts outside of day-to-day job responsibilities
  • Detailed understanding of emerging PV regulations/industry best practices, trends, and/or standards
  • 21 CFR Part 11 and/or GxP domain knowledge
#LI-RemoteCanada

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

title: Sales Director
description:
Our core is science. Our solutions are accessible. Our mission is to empower people.


Carebook’s family of powerful, highly engaging, customer centric digital solutions empower pharmacies, employers, and insurers to enable their customers, employees, and insurees to take control of their health journeys, every step of the way. Carebook is the connector to a new model of healthcare and currently serves over 3.5 million license holders around the world.


Based in Montreal, with offices in Winnipeg and Kelowna, and led by a world-class team and board of directors with extensive global business and healthcare industry experience, Carebook’s core is science and technology, its philosophy is people-ﬁrst, and its goal is accessible, connected health for everyone.


Carebook is pursuing a disciplined M&A strategy in parallel with organic growth to expand in the pharmacy vertical and to open both employer and insurance verticals. One of Carebook’s key strategies for growth is to build out its platform with leading technology and accretive acquisitions. Carebook recently acquired two leading companies, InfoTech and CoreHealth, with both companies offering robust products and software platforms, strong management teams and blue-chip client bases.


Carebook's shares trade on the TSXV under the symbol "CRBK" and the company's shares also trade on the OTC Markets under the symbol CRBKF and Frankfurt Stock Exchange under the symbol PMM1.


More at www.carebook.com

 

We are currently seeking a Sales Director to join our team.  This position can be based remotely anywhere in the US.


As the Sales Director (or Sr. Director of Sales), your daily duties will consist of:

 

  • Identifying targets, prospecting and setting meetings with Enterprise/Global companies. 
  • Conducting a thorough discovery process. 
  • Preparing a targeted, customized and highly articulated value proposition for each prospect.
  • Working with large and complex accounts, learning the organization and strategy of the client, structuring relevant value propositions.
  • Running meetings with senior executives, from getting a champion on board to getting the buy in of executives.
  • Building meaningful relationships with clients and prospects.
  • Working with the product team to articulate the final product with the client.
  • Preparing proposals and working on agreements with the support of the Company’s executive team (building pricing models, calculating LTV, costs and margin, etc.). 


As the Sales Director, your background should include:

 

  • BA or BS degree (MBA a plus)
  • Selling to employers, benefit managers, corporate wellness providers, group healthcare, brokers, insurance providers, pharmacy or pharma.
  • 5-10+ years of selling to enterprise clients.
  • Strong B2B SaaS experience. 
  • Deal sheet with at least several Fortune 1000 deals and good track record of start-to-finish deals over $100K (minimum).
  • Demonstrated experience in consistently exceeding sales goals.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.
  • Demonstrated closing abilities.

 

Compensation:

 

  • Carebook was selected as one of the best employers to work for and puts people first. We offer strong compensation in addition to a healthy commission plan and stock options. We also offer attractive benefits.
  • Reporting to the CRO, you will work with a high performing sales team, motivating and supportive environment, and benefit from training and personal growth
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.
