title: Sales Director, Toronto
description:
Ask Locala – The Drive-to-Store Platform – is the first and only advertising technology to connect brands to consumers by bridging the gap between digital advertising and the real-world. Ask Locala created a unified technology for marketers to manage, measure, and optimize incremental visits in real-time to online and physical stores. Ask Locala is committed to transparency and full autonomy for its clients and relies on data obtained only with the user's explicit consent. Founded in 2011 by mobile marketing pioneers, Ask Locala has 180+ employees and services more than 600 advertisers worldwide. The company has ten offices in the US, Europe, Asia Pacific, and Latin America. We are seeking motivated and hardworking individuals to joins our fun-loving team!

We're looking for a Sales Director to enter the Toronto market. This role has a lot of potential for growth as it will be our first sales hire in Toronto.

YOUR ROLE:

The Sales Director will report to the Vice President of Sales, Canada. Your main responsibilities:

1) Business development:

  • Develop new business and build a portfolio of new clients within the Toronto territory
  • Schedule and conduct meetings with key agency and brand decision-makers.
  • Meet and exceed pre-determined Quarterly Sales Goals.
  • Ensure 100% customer satisfaction and retention.
  • Act as a team player and client advocate at all times.

2) Sales:

  • Meet with key brand decision-makers and agencies to prove benefit of Ask Locala's technology over competition or current solutions.
  • Own the sales cycle – from lead generation, closure, and renewal.
  • Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas.
  • Collaborate with account management and trading teams to upsell clients.
  • Must have strong negotiation skills.

3) Reporting:

  • Maintain an up-to-date Salesforce profile – Salesforce proficiency a plus.
  • Weekly pipeline updates shared with Team and Management.

4) CRM:

  • Be present and in touch with clients on regular basis.
  • Maintain account and opportunity forecasting with our CRM.
  • Organize ROI focused entertainment activities.

YOUR PROFILE:

You have:

  • Undergraduate degree required.
  • 3+ years of experience at an ad agency, publisher, ad network, ad exchange, ad server, DSP, or other online advertising roles -- mobile advertising a plus.
  • Established relationships with advertising agencies or brands a plus.
  • Superior professionalism and business acumen.
  • Solution oriented.
  • Self-starter – ability to self-motivate and establish new business.
  • Exceptional organization, presentation and communication skills – both verbal and written.
  • Demonstrated ability to deal with change and be a team-player.

At Ask Locala, we are committed to diverse and inclusive hiring and to promoting equal opportunities throughout our processes and beyond. Our offers are open to everyone, regardless of origin, gender, religion, disability, etc. Do not hesitate to apply!

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
KitchenMate offers restaurant-quality meals on-site 24/7 at a fraction of the cost of delivery or takeout.

We believe everyone should be equipped to access, share, and enjoy high-quality meals easily. We are on a mission to make tasty, truly nutritious, and affordable fresh food that fits into people's increasingly fast-paced lives. It presents many interesting challenges in an effort to reduce labor, waste, and inefficiencies, and build a food chain from farm to fork in a digital world.

We are a group of experienced builders, engineers, designers, and chefs working towards a common mission. We are backed by top tier investors from the US and Canada.

We're currently looking for a talented Regional Sales Manager to join our core team to build and manage a world-class Partnership Development team.

As a member of the Partnership Development Team, this role is responsible to lead a group of regionally focused Business Development Leads. This position reports to the Founder & CEO and ensures that all Partnership Development staff are informed, equipped, and empowered to fulfill their role in partnership development strategy.

As KitchenMate's Regional Sales Manager, you will be responsible for

  • Leading Partnership Development and Sales in Ontario
    • Identifying new opportunities and manage end-to-end sales pipeline and process with new prospects within specified industry vertical markets.
    • Working hand-in-hand with business C-suite executives, HR leaders and Facility Operators to articulate KitchenMate's differentiation, value proposition; and highlight business benefits and value.
    • Developing strong relationships with organizations/Lines of Business and their key decision makers in need for innovative employee benefit services
    • Leading the sales process in a consultative fashion, and working with cross functional teams to move leads from qualified opportunities to new business contracts
    • Drive key sales metrics, contributing to customer engagement, market share, net revenue
  • Creating a strong foundation for the Partnership Development organization
    • Optimize our existing Partnership Development and Sales processes
      • Develop and execute Inbound Sales & Outbound Sales strategies & best practices.
      • Assess profitable opportunities from leads received and generated.
      • Formulate and drive demand generation B2B marketing campaigns to achieve business goals
      • Refine the Prospect Experience prior to contract execution.
      • Successfully leverage ideas across clients and industries to formulate the best practices and creative thinking to generate new sales leads.
    • Grow new business account revenue 
      • Use knowledge of the relevant client industry, technology, processes, and consultative sales skills to assess and educate clients on the value of our business and implementation expertise
      • Build executive presence through publication of blogs, participating in conferences, and industry forums
      • Increase our addressable market size by keeping a pulse on the competitive landscape.
      • Design playbooks by customer industries and segments.
      • Structure and negotiate contract commercial terms and conditions terms with prospective business partners.
      • Regularly experiment with new creative business development, sales, and marketing strategies, and lead generation strategies.
  • Scaling the Business Development Team
    • Actively contribute to KitchenMate's thought leadership and provide proactive input for developing next generational offerings and solutions in food services programs.
    • Assemble a world-class team by designing roles, responsibilities, and incentive structures.
    • Co-create onboarding guides and scalable processes.
    • Train and manage new team members

You should have

  • Relevant university degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, or other related fields.
  • 5+ years of experience serving as a trusted advisor to key business partners while acting in business development, sales, or partnerships capacity or marketing.
  • Proven track record building high-performing Enterprise B2B sales outcomes that achieved more than 3M in new business annual revenue.
  • Examples of business wins that were the result of in-depth knowledge of clients' business priorities, challenges and initiatives that translated into opportunities.
  • Passion for food, cooking, nutrition, health & wellness, and/or sustainability.
  • A healthy diet and a basic understanding of the food system.
  • Valid Ontario ‘G' Drivers License and access to a vehicle.

Bonus, if you have

  • Experience selling or marketing a corporate service (such as vending, office snacks, coffee, or food services) to C-Suite, HR, Office Managers, Facilities, and/or Property Managers.
  • Experience using SaaS tools, such as Salesforce, Outreach, Hubspot, and ZoomInfo.
  • Experience in the food & beverage industry, hospitality, food-tech, consulting, or CPG.
  • Worked at a venture-backed startup.

You are someone who is

  • Hungry: You always choose to tackle audacious problems.
  • Brave: You aren't afraid of being uncomfortable or vulnerable.
  • Meticulous: You put a lot of care into every detail.
  • Thoughtful, even under extreme pressure. You seek clarity and understanding before you act.
  • Humble, even if you know the answer. 
  • Calm, professional, and empathetic.
  • Always leading by example.
  • Coachable by your peers and grateful to others.
  • Mentor to everyone on the team. You help everyone around you reach their highest potential.

title: Sales Manager, Direct and Channel
description:
Net2phone is looking to add a Sales Manager to run our direct and channel sales teams.  This is an opportunity for someone to join an established team that is in growth mode.  This position is ideal for an individual that enjoys creating strategies to attain the required results.   As part of a global organization, net2phone Canada operates a modern SaaS sales team approach using Sales Development staff and Channel staff who funnel deals into the Sales team. The Direct sales team then takes the reigns to manage and close the business.

We are searching for an exceptional manager that will lead and develop an engaging group of sales Account Executives and Channel Managers.  This individual will hire, train, manage and ultimately mentor a team of 7-10 sales professionals located across Canada utilizing a set of cutting edge technologies to ensure success of the team.  The successful individual for this role will work cross functionally with marketing and our SDR teams on an ongoing basis.  Net2phone takes pride in developing our talent for a long term career within the company with regular career advancement opportunities.  

Sales Manager, Direct and Channel

The Sales Manager position is a management / coaching opportunity where you will lead a team of 7-10 sales professionals across Canada.

What you will be responsible for:

  • Lead a team of 7-10 sales professionals located across Canada (primarily Ottawa based but also will lead employees located in Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver)
  • Recruit (when needed), train, and optimize a team of AE's and Channel Managers responsible for sales engagements
  • Work with the Director of Marketing and Director of Sales in determining the process, playbooks, career others, and appropriate measurements for the team
  • Implement new tools while managing the usage of existing systems: Salesforce CRM, High Velocity Sales, Salesforce Einstein, Salesforce Inbox, ZoomInfo, Xactly
  • Work in conjunction with the Director of Sales on strategies for both direct and channel opportunities
  • Manage the day to day pipeline 
  • Utilize quantitative methods to measure, report, manage, and optimize efforts
  • Work with key stakeholders to develop reports and dashboards to monitor KPI's.
  • Meet with internal stakeholders to understand funnel requirements and strategy for each business.
  • Help create a fun, high energy environment where people love coming to work and striving to exceed their quotas.
  • Design and review the commission plan and goals with internal stakeholders
  • Build a culture of performance and accountability within the sales team, taking ownership for consistently achieving individual and team objectives
  • Provide coaching and support with the goal of developing the sales skills of the team, ultimately developing individual careers and creating an environment for growth

What we're looking for:

  • At least 5 years of relevant management experience
  • You've been a sales manager before in a SaaS like sales approach
  • Can demonstrate a track record of success and you have experience managing sales teams
  • You can help develop the corporate sales talk track and demo process
  • You're comfortable working closely with marketing teams to leverage content, lead lists and other sales enablement assets to help drive conversions
  • What this role has to offer:
  • Potential career growth. As a leader in our sales team individuals can develop on their existing interpersonal skills, sales strategies, project management and pipeline management all in line with advancement opportunities. 
  • Opportunity to work with Canadian businesses while being a part of a global company.
  • Skill development and mentorship. You will learn how to provide an exceptional prospect experience while juggling numerous tasks in an environment that is high-performing and nurturing.
  • Latest and greatest technology. Not only will you become a net2phone expert, but you will also become well-versed in a variety of industry-leading SaaS tools.
  • A ‘no silo' approach to team collaboration. You'll work with high-performing members from every department in the organization to achieve our transparent team objectives.
  • A voice. You'll be relied upon to provide input into how we can operate more efficiently and drive change in the sales department.

What net2phone has to offer:

  • Competitive compensation and vacation
  • Annual Health and Wellness benefits
  • Optional insurance
  • A modern office (stand-up desks, collaborative rooms, green/outdoor space)
  • A no-stigma approach to mental health and well being
  • Office dogs!
  • A work hard/play hard mentality (foosball, volleyball, hockey, yoga, beer o'clock, bbq's)

net2phone is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees and clients feel like they belong. We encourage applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Manager, Customer Success (Mid-Market)
description:
You take pride in exceeding expectations. You uncover needs by listening closely and asking perceptive questions. You also love technology. Your peers are impressed by your technical knowledge and know-how, which allows you to become their trusted advisor. You are not afraid to convince someone to change their mind and you recognize when you need to change yours. You are excited to take on new challenges and be part of something small that is growing into something big. 

And us?  We are well funded and growing exponentially. In 2021, we won Deloitte's Fast 50 in Canada and Fast 500 in North America awards, recognizing us as one of the fastest growing technology companies on the continent -- and we're just getting started. We are building the world's most advanced tools for e-commerce and interior decor. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies such as Home Depot, local retailers such as Alexanian's, and leading brands such as Crate&Barrel. We are looking for zealous and collaborative challenge-seekers to amplify our momentum and help us create an iconic global tech company.


What You'll Do

  • Grow the people on your team through focused coaching, mentorship, career conversations, and growth frameworks. You're not afraid of the tough conversations, and you love to help people thrive
  • Partner closely with other leaders internally including Sales and Product leadership
  • Be responsible for key metrics such as Net Retention and Customer Health
  • Form relationships with leadership teams across your team's customer book of business
  • Mentor your team and collaborate when escalation is required for customer challenges
  • Build frameworks to create a delightful and effective customer journey
  • Work with your team to manage customer health and create effective strategies to increase health across your customer base
  • Engage as a mentor across the wider Customer Success organization
  • Serve as a key voice of our customers internally with teams such as product, sales, and leadership, and partner with other teams internally to drive best in class customer experiences
  • Create effective journeys for your team within our Customer Success Platform, and ensure full usage of the platform across the Customer Success organization

    Requirements

    • You have at least 2 years of experience in a Customer Success leadership role
    • Direct experience coaching and growing members of a team
    • Experience in SaaS with accountability for key performance metrics
    • You are professional and comfortable engaging C-suite executives
    • You can manage tight deadlines (but you can control much of your own schedule)
    • You are comfortable using spreadsheets, Google Docs and Salesforce
    • You have clear communication skills, both written and verbal


    About our culture

    • We work in tight-knit teams to maximize speed and cultivate an ownership mentality.
    • We cherish curiosity and an obsession for details because we know these details are invaluable over the long run.
    • We promote an environment where ideas are challenged. The best ideas win!
    • We're hyperfocused on our achievements and our ability to execute on our promises. We act with urgency.
    • It's not always about us. We give back to our community to ensure it can grow.
    • We love to compete and have fun. Our game nights are legendary.


    About our products

    Our technology lets you see products in your own room before you buy.
    Imagine you want to redesign your home and have been searching for new tiles for your kitchen, or a new rug for your living room. You definitely want to make sure it will look good in your space. We enable that through cutting-edge computer vision technology, presented in an extraordinarily simple and accessible way. Try our rug demo now! Simply upload a picture of your room using your mobile phone, and slide the rug under your coffee table:   https://www.roomvo.com/rugdemo4r


    About our results

    Our customers see a 5x increase in e-commerce conversion rates and a
    dramatic decrease in the time it takes for their customers to make a
    purchase decision. We are also reducing the world's carbon footprint by
    eliminating trips to the store and avoiding product returns, while also
    saving marriages -- now you can be sure you're buying the right product
    for your home.


    About our office and remote work

    We are located in downtown Toronto with nearby access to both of the main subway lines. Currently, we are all working from home; we encourage our teams to work from wherever they are most productive, and many of us will continue to work from home in the future, either full-time or partially.  While we're all working remotely, we've come up with a few ways to keep everyone on the same page, including a quick company-wide check-in every Monday, remote coffee breaks on Fridays, and ad hoc topical sharing sessions. Another big upside is you get to be around your pets and plants (if you have them).

    About our hiring process

    Now: You upload your resume and complete a brief questionnaire.
    Week 1: We arrange a video call with you to assess your abilities.
    Week 1 or 2: You attend the first video interview. 
    Week 2 or 3: You attend the second video interview soon after.
    Week 2 or 3: You receive an offer. 

    Take the Leap. Apply now.

    Our demo, in case you missed it:  https://www.roomvo.com/rugdemo4r

title: Director of Customer Success
description:
Director of Customer Success

We are currently on the hunt for a Director of Customer Success who is passionate about leading Customer Experience teams with a deep focus on retaining and growing customer bases through value-based meaningful interactions. 

You are an expert in setting the vision and strategy for a world-class customer experience that succeeds in driving revenue and growth. Coaching our growing team on customer engagement, customer retention and overall scale will be your North Star. 

Reporting directly to the COO and as a member of the senior leadership team, you will be responsible for the onboarding team, customer success, and the enterprise customer success teams.  You will work with Sales, Product Management, and Marketing  to ensure the voice of the customer is heard company-wide. 

If you are a curious and passionate individual, intrigued by our vision of improving patient care through technology, we would love to hear from you!

Who We Are
Intiveo is a popular patient communication SaaS product used by 14,000 medical practitioners to communicate with over 18 million patients.
We are a remote-first company and we do it well!
Our goal is to continuously improve patient care by understanding communication needs, behaviours, and preferences.

✨What You'll Do

  • Lead, mentor, and grow the Onboarding, Customer Success, and Enterprise teams
  • Own all touchpoints of the customer journey post sale, including onboarding, support, renewals and upsells
  • Develop and execute on the vision and strategic initiatives to accelerate growth and drive strong customer experiences to reinforce retention
  • Build out systems, processes, tools, and team needed to deliver a scalable solution to our growing base of customers 
  • Work with leadership across the company to drive value creation for our customers
  • Define and monitor successful customer adoption and usage of our product
  • Establish and maintain key KPI and OKR metrics to measure and improve effectiveness of the customer success team's initiatives
  • Act as a point of escalation as required, managing customer expectations throughout lifecycle
  • Be a contributing member of the senior leadership team

✨Who You Are

  • 10+ years of customer success experience with a minimum of 4 years experience managing a team of managers/team leads
  • Understands that leadership is more successful when executed with a coaching and mentorship mindset
  • Experience in driving strategy and scaling metric driven customer success initiatives
  • An excellent communicator able to engage people in your vision and drive change through an organization
  • Strong project management skills: ownership, decision-making, relationship building, conflict resolution, and problem-solving skills
  • Analytical and critical thinker 
  • Data focused with a strong understanding of SaaS metrics and the drivers used to move the needle on them
  • Results-focused and solution-oriented mindset. Self-motivated, highly organized, and efficient.
  • Exposure to Zendesk, Salesforce Service Desk, and other CRM tools
  • Keen on rolling up your sleeves!

More About Intiveo

We are committed to creating a culture that is inclusive and welcoming of different perspectives, life experiences, cultures and identities. We believe that our differences make us stronger and that many unique perspectives, experiences and backgrounds make for better ideas and more well rounded decisions. Simply put, we love our diversity!

Want to see more? Check out our Culture Book here!

title: Sales Manager in Training
description:
Overview:

CANADAâ€™S MOST SUCCESSFUL HOME FURNISHING RETAILER, THEREâ€™S NO LIMIT TO WHERE YOU CAN GO!

Leonâ€™s Furniture Ltd. is a family-owned, publicly traded company that has been a part of Canadian homes, and families for more than a century. We are committed to providing our dedicated associates with secure jobs, and a safe and satisfying work environment, and will strive to support their ongoing pursuit of personal development and career advancement.

LEONâ€™S IS LOOKING FOR TALENTED APPLICANTS FOR POSITION OF  SALES MANAGER IN TRAINING


The ideal candidate  has  the drive and determination to continue to make Leonâ€™s the number one choice for the Canadian consumer, and shares our core values, which are deeply embedded in our culture and reflected in our actions:  Honesty. Integrity. Hard work. Family.

Our dedicated Sales Manager Training Program provides all the training you will need to be a successful Sales Manager within our organization.  

 Your training will help to prepare you for the following responsibilities:

  • Managing sales team; floor management
  • Training and people development
  • Interviewing and hiring
  • Resolving customer issues Ensuring company policies and procedures are met
  • Managing daily operations within the store
  • Ensuring general safety and security of store and employees
  • Shopping the competition
  • Daily and weekly sales meetings
  • Preparation and management of sales promotions and contests
  • Other duties as assigned

         

REQUIREMENTS

  • High energy
  • Strong leadership and people skills
  • Ability to train and develop others to succeed
  • Goal oriented
  • Willingness to relocate advantageous but not necessary
  • And most importantly, a POSITIVE ATTITUDE!

WHY LEONâ€™S?

  • On-going training and development to ensure your success
  • A  fast-paced, dynamic, and fun environment with a  great team
  • A generous employee discount program
  • Profit sharing

 

ONE SIMPLE CLICK COULD CHANGE YOUR LIFE. APPLY NOW

title: Purchaser Co-op
description:
Does working with in the automotive industry excite you?  Sterling Fleet Outfitters customize commercial vehicles for a wide variety of industries and customers.  Join a dynamic work environment that will take your career to the next level. Among the many benefits of working here, you'll find a strong team culture and a willingness to learn, competitive pay and excellent medical benefits.

Position overview

  • Processing customer Orders
  • Placing Purchase orders (Stock and Custom order)
  • Participate in Inventory counts
  • Follow up with suppliers to ensure:
    • Receipt of order
    • Confirmation of delivery date
    • Shipping to deadlines
    • Obtaining shipment tracking
    • Arranging and managing freight

The candidate

  • Energetic, cheerful and creative
  • Team player
  • Strong communication & creative writing skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft office, You love using formulas in excel
  • You are professional and enjoy looking for solutions
  • You are looking to build your career in Procurement/Supply Chain field

    The advantages

    • Working with a dynamic team
    • Opportunities for training and development

      Temporary Position – May 3, 2021 to August 31, 2021

      Rate of Pay:  $18.00 per hour.

      Hours:  Flexible Schedule:  guaranteed to have minimum of 420 hours, up to a maximum of 672 hours over the 4 months.

title: Buyer
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Power Generation Region team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Buyer will purchase general and specialized equipment, materials and business services for use for the region.  The Buyer will provide technical and administrative support to the company with emphasis on sourcing, negotiating price and purchasing material, assist in estimating, provide field staff support and issue purchase orders in a timely fashion.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Understand vendor marketplace and market conditions
  • Understand and interpret technical specifications and needs of end-users
  • Plan, coordinate and execute procurement activities for nuclear equipment, materials and services
  • Review bidder information, prepare and issue RFP and tender documents, evaluate bids, and provide recommendations
  • Negotiate contracts as required
  • Complete contract administration activities
  • Work with QC inspectors to conduct surveillance and inspection and test plans as required
  • Review and escalate claims as required
  • Communicate relevant information to internal stakeholders (engineering, construction, QC, accounts payable)
  • Monitor and track vendor performance
  • Develop and maintain relationships with existing and prospective vendors

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively (excellent verbal and written communication skills)
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable (proven ability to accurately handle a high volume of transactions, meet deadlines and prioritize workload)
  • Problem Solving and Innovation (Strong analytical and critical thinking skills)
  • Teamwork and Collaboration (Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a variety of people in a professional manner; Flexible team player with the ability to function independently while working in a team environment)
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Familiar with Planning Processes

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelors' Degree, Diploma, Designation or equivalent in related field

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of procurement experience preferably for construction or nuclear projects in an EPC environment
  • Strong understanding of nuclear, mechanical or electrical materials
  • Experience on projects with medium to high risk and complexity
  • Experience negotiation supplier terms and conditions
  • Past involvement in strategic planning and implementation
  • Experience in a supervisory role is an asset

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Proven understanding of procurement and contract administration  process
  • Strong communication, organization, analytical, and negotiation skills
  • Ability to implement Change Management processes.  
  • Basic understanding or project management, engineering and construction processes, procedures and relevant software
  • Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment
  • Intermediate Computer Literacy; Microsoft Office programs and JD Edwards
  • A Security clearance will be provided by the client

title: Director Acquisition – Sales and Financing
description:
About our Client

Mallette, a Network

Our firm is ranked among the 10 largest chartered professional accountancy firms in Canada. Mallette has an operational structure that is both simple and efficient. Without a registered office, the critical areas of the firm's management and development are entrusted to regional and provincial joint work committees where partners and employees combine their ideas and expertise. This innovative way of doing things makes it possible to integrate new, clear directions in a short period.

Firmly established in Quebec, the Mallette family has more than 1,100 employees in 31 offices working in different fields of professional expertise, including certification, taxation and legal services, advisory services, actuarial services as well as trustees and managers.

Aiming to always surpass itself, Mallette strengthens its leadership position by joining the ranks of a major international alliance, TIAG (The International Accounting Group). This association allows Mallette to offer its clients support in their business outside Canada guided by local experts at reasonable costs while allowing our firm to maintain its personality and independence.

Mallette is also the largest Quebec-owned firm that offers the widest range of services dedicated to Quebec SMEs.



Culture and Values

Human Relational Approach

Renowned for its work atmosphere, dynamism and competent employees, Mallette also stands out for its relational and human approach with its diverse clientele.

Relationships in the Business Community

Our people are involved in the business community to which they belong. This involvement translates into a sustained presence in the community and economic organizations, social and sports clubs, non-profit organizations, etc.



Brief Description


Constantly growing, Mallette is currently looking for a Director Acquisition – Sales and Financing and other transactional services to join its team in the advisory services department. He will participate in the growth of the business transaction team in the greater Montreal area.

The Director will take on various mandates from A to Z in the context of acquisition, sale, corporate financing, and due diligence files. More specifically, its role will consist of:


Main Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Manage all transactional aspects, including in particular merger and acquisition, business sale and divestiture, financing, due diligence, growth strategies and optimization of the use of capital
  • Advise clients on various complex transactional issues and collaborate with other internal Mallette departments when the situation requires
  • Take charge of the planning, implementation, post-transaction monitoring of files as well as post-acquisition integration support depending on the nature of the intervention
  • Supervise and train less experienced resources during the execution of buy-sell and business financing mandates
  • Participate in business development activities and promotion of the firm's services

Qualifications Required

Training

  • Hold an undergraduate university degree in business administration with a specialization in accounting or finance or a graduate degree
  • Hold a recognized accounting designation (CPA)
  • Titre d’expert en évaluation d’entreprises (CBV/EEE) (un atout) Expert title in business valuation (CBV / EEE) (an asset)
  • Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) title (an asset)

Professional Experience

  • Have between 5 and 10 years of relevant experience related to the transactional field

Key Skills

  • Intermediate level of Excel
  • Bilingualism (an asset)

Aptitude

  • Pragmatic professional judgment in complex problems with clients
  • Good communication skills and strong business development skills
  • Teamwork and collaboration with colleagues, directors and partners from other departments and firms in other regions
  • Good writing skills
  • Autonomy and resourcefulness

Among the Challenges of the Position

  • Participate in the development and growth of the firm in the Montreal region
  • An important role within a team of dedicated professionals
  • Become an essential resource in the region
  • You will have the chance to participate in a larger type of transaction

Why Join MALLETTE

  • Possibility of progression within the firm
  • A complete group insurance plan
  • Employer participation in a group retirement plan
  • Reimbursement of expenses for fitness, sports and office equipment
  • Reimbursement of costs for obtaining personal or legal financial planning services
  • Cumulative annual vacation at the rate of 8% of gross annual salary (4 weeks)
  • A reduced work schedule during the summer
  • A 40-hour workweek
  • Unique recognition programs
  • Privileged access to a virtual healthcare platform
  • An active and committed social club fully funded by Mallette
  • A conscious, friendly and stimulating environment
  • Free coffee, meal allowance with catering service and more!



Follow TALINKO on LinkedIn and visit our Web site

Only the people selected for an interview will be contacted. We support the principle of employment equity.

TALINKO is a recruitment firm of middle and senior executives also offering support in the recruitment of members of the board of directors or advisory committee. We operate in different business sectors.

Please note that the masculine is used to lighten the text, without prejudice to the feminine form.

title: Sales analytics manager
description:
Behaviour is seeking a motivated Sales analytics manager to join the team responsible of Sales, Business Development and partnerships within the Marketing business unit, to work across Behaviour games portfolio. The Sales analytics manager will use quantitative and qualitative data to work cooperatively to build sales optimization strategies on digital and retail products. The ideal candidate is passionate about games and about finding new ways to improve its performance.

-----------------------------

Description de poste

Behaviour est à la cherche d’un ou une Gestionnaire analytique des ventes motivé.e pour joindre l’équipe Ventes, Développement d’affaires et partenariat au sein de l’unité d’affaire Marketing, pour travailler sur le portfolio de jeux Behaviour. Gestionnaire analytique des ventes utilisera des données quantitatives et qualitatives pour collaborer à l’élaboration d’optimisation de stratégies de ventes de produits digitaux et physiques. La personne idéale pour ce poste est passionnée de jeu vidéo et vise constamment l’amélioration des performances de celui-ci.  

In this role, you will:

  • Take part in crafting and communicating the sales strategies
  • Monitor the sales daily, to develop action plans to optimize the sales performance
  • Working with Sales & Partnerships managers, identify opportunities, coordinate analysis and recommend optimizations
  • Actively collaborate with data analysts to promote data-informed decision-making
  • Design & conduct tests to optimize the sales strategies
  • Present and communicate the sales performance results to immediate supervisor and other stakeholders
  • Be proactive and suggest approaches to optimize performance

What we're looking for:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field required and experience in the videogame industry preferred
  • In-depth knowledge of current marketing and sales best practices
  • Exceptional analytical, problem solving, communications, and teamwork skills
  • Ability to make decisions based on the analysis of metrics, to follow up on these decisions, and to demonstrate their positive impact
  • Excellent ability to present and communicate complex results at different layers in the organization
  • Ability to build trust and relationships with teammates from various disciplines, to collaborate and influence decisions and outcomes

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez :

  • Participer à l’élaboration et la communication de la stratégie de ventes
  • Demeurer en veille constante pour élaborer des plans d’actions dans le but d’améliorer les performances du produit; 
  • En collaboration avec les gestionnaires de ventes & partenariats, identifier les opportunités, coordonner les analyses et recommander les optimisations
  • Créer les synergies avec les analystes de données pour approfondir les prises de décision fondées sur les données
  • Concevoir et effectuer des tests afin d’optimiser les stratégies de vente
  • Communiquer la vision et la stratégie de vente à l’interne ainsi qu’à des partenaires externes
  • Être proactif et proposer des fonctionnalités de jeu dans le but d’en améliorer les performances;

Ce que nous recherchons:

  • Diplôme d’études supérieures dans des domaines quantitatifs requis et expérience dans le jeu vidéo souhaitée
  • Connaissance approfondie des meilleures pratiques de ventes actuelles sur le marché
  • Compétences exceptionnelles d’analyse, de résolution de problèmes, de communication et de travail d’équipe
  • Capacité à équilibrer les prises de décision basées sur des analyses métriques. D’en faire le suivi et de démontrer les retours positifs qui en découle 
  • Excellente capacité à présenter, communiquer des résultats complexes a différents niveaux de l’organisation
  • Capacité à tisser des liens de confiance avec des disciplines transversales afin de collaborer et influencer de manière plus efficace

title: Sales Manager -Best Western Plus Kelowna
description:
We are looking for a Part-Time Sales Manager to join our busy hotel 

Why join our team?  

Our people understand that one member’s success is the success of the whole team. Regardless of the roles we play we are united by our core values: Family, Quality, Industry, Winning, and Honesty. Pomeroy offers competitive wages, plus incentive programs, flexible schedules, paid on-the-job training with lots of opportunities to grow. We also offer Pomeroy and Best Western World wide stay and travel programs for employees and families.

Position: Part-Time Sales Manager ($25 per hour)

5 days a week – 4 hours a day

  • Hotel name: Best Western Plus Kelowna Hotel & Suites 
  • Address: 2402 Highway 97N Kelowna BC
  • Part-time position - 20 hours per week - remote work available

How do you contribute to our success as a business:

As a part-time Sales Manager, you are authorized to exceed guest expectations by helping create their “picture perfect” guest experience. You will enjoy helping others with their group arrangements as they stay at our award-winning green hotel.

This position generates revenue to meet or exceed budget expectations.  Works closely with the Director of Sales to develop an effective marketing plan and direct the sales effort as described in the marketing plan.  Manages Group Blocks for SMERF, assists with Events/Catering bookings as assigned. 

  • Coordinating sales effort by responding to telephone or email guest inquiries in regards to Groups and/or Events in a timely manner.
  • Responds to Hotel Planner, CVENT and other online Group RFP channels.
  • Creates group blocks in INFOR and checks the accuracy and additional information needed in Jonas Chorum.
  • Follows up with all details concerning group reservations such as cut-off dates and payments.
  • Monitors revenue management techniques of availability control, to achieve the maximization of room sales and revenue under the guidance of Director of Sales and GM.
  • Assists with decisions regarding overbooking of the hotel, using good judgment to ensure all bookings are carried out an organized and efficient manner.
  • Initiate contact and billing procedures, ensuring any deposits and/or credit applications are received with adequate information and within an acceptable time frame.
  • Maintains a high standard of customer relations and customer service.
  • Maintains all sales systems, such as sales records and reports, conference calendar, traces of history and potentials, logs of groups not previously accommodated, and mailing lists.
  • Establishes and maintains accounts and develops relationships in the marketplace.
  • Identifies and analyzes competition, both locally and regionally.
  • Ensures prompt and systematic servicing of all Group and Event enquiries.
  • Reporting of new groups and events to management and front desk in a timely manner.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

 Education/Passions/Experience 

  • Degree in Business or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Minimum of three years of sales and events experience required; hospitality sales preferred.
  • Excellent computer skills and ability to learn new technologies.  Must be innovative and self-motivated.
  • Must be able to work independently and have the drive to succeed.
  • Outstanding communication and organization skills.
  • Must maintain a high level of professionalism through correspondence and by telephone.

About Pomeroy Lodging Pomeroy Lodging is Western Canada’s leader in hospitality and lodging. Driven to meet every need, we own and operate a comprehensive range of hotels and resorts throughout the West. Our investment goes well beyond the walls of our hotels and the land we build on. Pomeroy Lodging is committed to investing heavily in our people, properties, and communities. Pomeroy Lodging LP is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Pomeroy Lodging LP does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status, age, gender, race, religion, sexual identification, or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Retail District Manager - East
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

You’re an original. So are we.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™

Reporting to the Regional Director, you will motivate and inspire store leadership in Eastern Canada to create an environment that ensures customer satisfaction, maximum productivity and profitability by implementing brand developed business plan. You will develop store management team to ensure organizational capacity to meet all goals. 

About the Job

  • Ensure financial goals are met
  • Analyze business trends and create plans to increase sales, and control expenses to improve overall profitability within district
  • Ensure merchandising and customer services disciplines are in place that support the rapid expansion of our retail network
  • Develop, coach and motivate a team of Store Managers to ensure operational and customer service standards are maintained, and that sales and performance goals are met
  • Ensure administration of loss prevention, inventory control, safety and security programs - control of company assets and merchandise
  • Model behavior that respects the background, experience and cultural differences of others while upholding the values of Levi Strauss and Co.
  • Strategize with Home Office partners to maximize business opportunities and set all of our business goals
  • Recommend new products to positively affect sales
  • Maintain store appearance in all doors following visual presentation standards
  • Promote an environment that encourages participation, creativity and learning by sharing best practices and building on the ideas of others within district and region.

About You

  • (7+ years of combined college education and work experience may be substituted for a degree)
  • Minimum 7 years of retail experience 
  • Minimum 2 years of multi-store management experience
  • Solid experience and demonstrated skills in supervising and coaching store leaders
  • Apparel experience preferred
  • Achieve positive results through the coaching and development of others
  • Understanding of multi-unit retail business analytics
  • Enjoy managing multiply projects and working with Home Office partners

We put a lot of thought into our programs to provide you with a benefits package that matters. Whether it is for medical care, taking time off, improving your health or planning for retirement, we've got you covered. Here's a snapshot:

  • RRSP match up to 4%
  • Five hours of paid volunteer time per month with nonprofit organizations
  • Product discount of 60% off regular-price merchandise

Our policy is to provide equal opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, marital or family status, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or other protected classes prohibited by applicable law. Company policy prohibits harassment of applicants or employees on the basis of any protected classes.

#LI-DA1

LOCATION

Richmond Hill, ON, CAN

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

title: Area Manager
description:
PTW is a leading industry solutions provider delivering construction, fabrication, and maintenance services. Our network extends across Canada, and the United States. We create and deliver innovative industrial solutions to customers in the agricultural, mining, oil and gas, petrochemical, pulp and paper, nuclear and renewable energy industries.

PTW is hiring an Area Manager to join our team in Medicine Hat, AB!

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Area Manager is accountable for all aspects of branch operations, customer service and the delivery of branch results consistent with PTW’s operational expectations. This role is responsible for the direction and leadership for the overall operations, and to effectively and efficiently manage the development and directions of the operational team to drive the growth of revenue, technical productivity and promote high quality customer satisfaction while building relationships. 

A DAY IN THE LIFE…

  • Manage all aspects of branch operations that include but not limited to employees, scheduling, efficiency, cost control, preventative maintenance, revenue opportunities and inventory levels.
  • Develop and implement new business strategies for creating or improving processes and procedures to improve branch performance.
  • Monitor branch performance against goals to ensure that progress is being made, and that corrective action is taken if necessary.
  • Required to visit active worksites a minimum of twice per month to discuss safety and work practices displaying visible safety leadership.
  • Responsible for appropriate staff levels to meet requirements of the branch.
  • Responsible for recruitment, hiring, terminations and performance management.
  • Develop and manage business relationships and customer contacts.
  • Manage the morale in the branch by setting and demonstrating a strong business ethic for dealing with employees, suppliers and customers.
  • Enhance and develop processes and practices to meet the goals of the department.
  • Ensure the consistent delivery of high quality service in the branch to exceed customer expectations.
  • Assist with budget preparation.
  • Monitor financial performance to ensure the branch is meeting or exceeding budgetary commitment.
  • Analyzes and reports on the branch’s key performance indicators and industry/market trends.
  • Develop and implement strategies around improving the financial performance of the branch.
  • Analyze employee and customer concerns and present options to solve their issues.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum of five (5) years in a management or senior supervisory role.
  • Journeyman Electrician and/or Instrument Technician.
  • Preference given to those with post-secondary education in business.
  • Advanced knowledge of the industry and company operations required.
  • Excellent management, negotiating and organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to lead a team and achieve results.
  • Experience in budgeting, project management and operations.

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

  • Travel may be required for this position.

Why PTW?

Competitive Wages and benefits plans | PTW Apprenticeship Tuition Program | Quality work | Safety and quality are built into everything we do | Safety Training and PPE provided | Consistent work | Opportunity for advancement | Learning and development | Opportunities to travel, stay local or relocate | Team atmosphere | People-focused company

ADDITIONAL INFO

We care about your health and safety. At PTW, we follow all protocols set by the provincial and local governments. We also implement measures as required by our clients and our own Health and Safety team.

PTW is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

OUR VALUES GROUND US: CARE | EXCELLENCE | PASSION

title: Central Region Sales Manager
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security


At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.


At Allegion: We’re Redefining Security . Allegion products help keep people safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 highly recognizable brands sold globally like Schlage, LCN, Von Duprin, Glynn Johnson, Locknetics, Ives etc., we specialize in security around the doorway and adjacent area: everything from residential locks and portable security to commercial locks, exit devices, openers and closers, electronic access control and workforce productivity solutions.


At the core of this $2.7 billion business is the knowledge and experience of over 11,000+ dedicated employees across the globe and - we’re growing!


The CentralRegional Sales Manager will interact with all levels of Allegion employees and customers while providing direction to the sales team and driving revenue opportunities. The Sales Manager reports to the VP of Regional Sales and will lead and manage the sales team to ensure customer satisfaction and loyalty to the full product portfolio of Allegion security products and services.


What you will do


+ Interpret appropriate distribution for all Allegion brands to meet market demands and execute account rationalization to minimize channel conflict.

+ Partner with VP of Sales to create, implement, and execute annual business plan.

+ Lead the sales team in accomplishing revenue, pricing, and expense goals.

+ Manage profitability of brands while maximizing sales through controlled pricing.

+ Utilize sales and management background/experience​e​ to mentor, coach and develop sales team. Responsible for performance management, talent review, employee development, talent acquisition and employee engagement.

+ Implement and manage new construction/after-market​ strategies with sales team.

+ Drive sales team’s use of CRM software to generate, pursue and track sales opportunities.

+ Develop and maintain relationships with internal and external customers and Allegion team

+ Maintain excellent industry/territory knowledge by gathering market data of competitive activity. Adapt to change in marketplace.

+ Provide comprehensive reports to Regional Vice President and Business Leaders as required.

+ Maintain awareness of all Allegion policies, guidelines, and procedures and ensure compliance.

+ Develop local strategies to align with the Long-Range Plan (LRP).

+ Responsible for driving the AOP sales plan, managing costs and overall territory budget to meet financial goals.

+ Execute channel strategy. Develop new channels for changing strategic needs.

+ Responsible for Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning (SIOP) process.

+ Develop and maintain relationships with distributors, architects, and end user through demand creation activities and channel partner productivity programs.

+ Drive the use of the sales funnel process in CRM to track and capture both new construction and aftermarket opportunities.

+ Continuous communication with team to ensure employee engagement in business initiatives, strategy, and overall direction. Host (and present at) team meetings.

+ Participate in internal product and program deployment teams.

+ Understand and provide guidance as it relates to competition.


+ Must be willing and able to travel up to 75%


What you will need


+ Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or Technical field

+ 7+ years sales experience leading a high performing sales team

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Demonstrated experience influencing others with a bias for action

+ Strong customer focus

+ Industry specific experience preferred

+ Must possess a valid driver’s license


Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if: 


+ You are seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others.  With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html) .

+ You value personal well-being and balance because we do too! 

+ You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development.  As we grow, we want you to grow with us. 

+ You want a culture that promotes work-life balance.  Our employees enjoy generous time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work! 


What You'll Get from Us:


+ A commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging: making a difference and leading with purpose

+ High energy, influential, cross collaborative team environment

+ Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through Clifton Strengths testing and coaching.

+ Customized individual development plans and growth maps to help you unlock your full potential and career graph with Allegion.

+ Competitive base salary

+ Flexible, Hybrid model of working


+ Health, dental and other insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)   

+ Tuition Reimbursement  

+ Employee Discounts

+ Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”  (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)


Want to know more about us? Follow this link https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/index.html to learn more.


Apply to join our team today. We look forward to hearing from you!


We Celebrate Who We Are!


Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team .

title: Seller Success Manager (Account Manager)
description:
Seller Success Manager (Account Manager)

Marketplace

Marketplace team at Best Buy is growing and looking for a Seller Success Manager.  The Marketplace Seller Success Manager is primarily responsible for driving growth for a portfolio of sellers within a defined range of product category(s). This involves helping sellers adapt to our unique platform services and regulations, while partnering to maintain a continuous promotional strategy that aligns with Bestbuy.ca’s aggressive growth mandate.

The Marketplace Seller Success Manager will utilize data and analytics on a daily basis to uncover opportunities for further sales growth within our seller pool and will work with the eCommerce Retail Team on the online promotional and merchandising plans. You will provide feedback and analysis on funnel performance to internal partners as well as to sellers.

As a Seller Success Manager, you will…

  • Works directly with key sellers in an assigned set of categories and responsible for developing and executing the quarterly and annual strategy
  • Delivering category and store level insights, for continuous revenue growth
  • Work collaboratively with the rest of the Seller Success Team to plan cohesive marketing strategies that drive up Seller GMV and contribute to the overall Best Buy EComm goals & plans
  • Meets targets set for Sellers and accountable categories (monthly/quarterly/annual)
  • Proactively identifies areas requiring improvement (in process or technology); seeks out and recommends solutions (leverages 3rd party research)
  • Expected to take on projects that deliver long-term team success, lead project management decisions

We hope you are passionate about…

  • Partnership – having a strong connection to your clients and your internal team is paramount to you
  • Growth – the only way you see moving forward is through growth, both as an individual & team, and for our external partners
  • Having fun while being the best

The experience we need…

  • 3-5 years’ experience in account management, ecommerce, sales, business development or related industry
  • You have Hustle! You are resourceful, tenacious, collaborative and have strong business acumen
  • Lead on projects & initiatives on behalf of the team
  • Diploma or bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or Ecommerce
  • Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills

Bonus points…

  • Experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google AdWords, Salesforce

We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology.

Join our amazing team!

We are looking for people just like you.

title: Canadian Sales Manager
description:
Construction software company seeks energetic, experienced field focused sales representative to demonstrate, sell and train on construction software productivity tools, production tracking, machine control modeling, and estimating software to heavy construction contractors.

Background
Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, construction, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector, and mobility applications.

Our family of companies includes leading suppliers of various technology and software solutions tailored to the specific needs of heavy construction contractors. These include modeling, estimating, production tracking 3D reality capture, and more.

Job description
You will be responsible for personal selling, product demonstrations and training on site and via web conference to business owners, superintendents, foreman and estimators across Canada.

The target customer base includes 15% established accounts, and 85% new accounts. You will be involved with lead generation, prospecting and qualifying new account opportunities with support from corporate marketing activities.

It is expected you have a strong understanding of the heavy construction segment including the challenges faced in the field. Collaboration with all key internal stakeholders is required including direct sales colleagues in other regions, training, R&D, technical support and marketing.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Make or exceed sales quota on a monthly basis
  • Keep up to date with new products and general market conditions.
  • Promote the company's products/services addressing or predicting customers objectives. Actively promote new products and developments to existing and new customers.
  • Ensure that you are fully prepared for all activities when demonstrating solutions to customers and prospects
  • Carryout live software demonstrations for construction companies
  • Provide trustworthy and intelligent feedback on general market conditions.
  • Disciplined use of salesforce CRM and other administrative requirements
  • Attend industry and company specific conferences and events.
  • To adhere to all statutory regulations and to Hexagon policies at all times

*The above duties are neither exclusive nor exhaustive and the post holder may be required to carry out other appropriate duties.

title: Senior Purchasing Specialist
description:
This is your opportunity to join the team at ACCEO Solutions Inc, a division of Harris Computer, a company specializing in the development of innovative solutions for retail management (in the hardware field).

ACCEO Solutions offers an exceptional work environment where our values of quality, creativity, respect, responsibility and integrity are lived every day. Our team is composed of competent professionals and we are looking for a purchasing specialist to join us.

Main responsibilities of the position include:

  • Procure equipment, software and necessary materials to complete our projects and fulfill client requests;
  • Maintain procedures to ensure accurate and current records of inventory and on-order status;
  • Ensure accurate receipt and movement of inventory;
  • Participate in cycle and annual counts of inventory components, as required;
  • Maintain the optimal level of inventory to help ensure project work is completed on schedule while minimizing costs associated with carrying inventory;
  • Develop and maintain new and alternate sources for designated purchased items;
  • Negotiate favorable pricing and terms;
  • Maintain the highest level of supplier relationships;
  • Identify and implement cost reduction opportunities with respect to the purchased products;
  • Coordinate with Sales, IT team and management to finalize purchasing needs;
  • Implement best practices and improvements to existing processes/approaches, as required;
  • Research and keep abreast with emerging technology as it applies to the role.

What you need:

  • Proven experience in purchasing, procurement and inventory management
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Able to negotiate and maintain strong relationships with vendors
  • Well-versed with Excel, Outlook, and ERP software
  • Able to work in a collaborative environment

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education or relevant experience
  • Experience and proven history of negotiating substantial savings and operational efficiencies through supplier contracts and agreements
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience it a role requiring strategic and operations focus on the procurement and inventory management
  • Effective and professional negotiation skills
  • Experience in managing stock levels and forecasting purchasing details
  • Experience working in the IT-industry is an asset

title: Territory Manager - Survey
description:
Brandt is the exclusive Canada wide dealer for Topcon and Sokkia Positioning. We provide industry leading technologies to the building construction, surveying, engineering, governmental and mining markets. These markets are adopting and expanding the use of technology at record pace, and seeking solutions to improve accuracy and productivity in their field operations while optimizing their field to office workflow.

Brandt is currently seeking a Territory Manager - Survey for ourEdmontonand northern Alberta region.In this exciting role, you will be responsible for prospecting and developing new business opportunities, as well as maintaining and growing existing customer business. You would be in the enviable position of developing and executing a key business to Brandt’s strategy, while backed by a best in class support organization to help you grow and maintain your business. We offer a competitive compensation package with a generous commission program. At Brandt, you will have extensive career opportunities with an industry-leader that continues to grow and diversify.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities with new and existing customers, following trends in the market, and aggressively discovering leads.
  • Maintain and grow existing customer business through regular customer interactions in the assigned territory.
  • Understand, position, and sell the full line of GeoPositioning products offered by the company.
  • Meet all sales targets and performance indicators.
  • Complete all sales documentation in a timely and accurate manner
  • Develop sales plans, marketing and promotion strategies for territory.
  • Prepare customer status reports, including but not limited to sales call activity, closing, follow –up, and prospect reports as required
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
  • Highly motivated, self-directed and energetic entrepreneurial outlook.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills.
  • Ability to build relationships and prospect new accounts.
  • Ability to present and negotiate with clients.
  • Must be available to travel as needed; a recent driver's abstract and valid passport are required.
  • Sales industry experience and/or knowledge of Surveying and Construction industry is considered an asset.
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Engineering, Construction or Surveying considered an asset but not required.
  • Proficient computer knowledge and skills including Microsoft office suite.

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Eaton’s Wiring Device Division is currently seeking a Regional Sales Manager to join our team. This role covers Western Canada.This position will be basedremotely from a home office within a reasonable distance of a major airport.

Position Overview:

This position is responsible for the attainment of overall sales objectives in the assigned geographic region. The objectives are achieved through effective execution of sales initiatives and through the managing and effective coordination of manufacturer’s agents.

The RSM will be expected to achieve and maintain a balanced sales portfolio that achieves targets for both project and stock sales. It is imperative that the RSM builds and fosters commercially productive relationships with the principals of assigned Sales Agencies and the top management of the regional distributors and T5 contractors and T5 engineering consultants. This position is also responsible for product and solution presentations. The RSM shall develop and execute a training and enablement plan for the assigned Sales Agents, distributors, and consultants. The RSM is expected to possess the knowledge and technical aptitude to effectively deliver solution overviews and articulate their value propositions to drive specifications.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

In this function you will:

  • Achieve sales budget by developing sales plans and supporting agents at target customers and advancing project opportunities
  • Maintain and advance a pipeline of open projects for the assigned district
  • Manage manufacturer’s agents to ensure sales budgets are met in the district
  • In collaboration with the Channel team, drive and promote programs & initiatives that optimize our access to market through authorized distributors
  • Strategically develop and implement conversion plans
  • Demonstrate rigor in following up on critical sales and project schedules. Lead and coordinate resources to resolve quality issues or delivery of scheduled commits, as required
  • Drive new product sales
  • Execute plans to increase Eaton Wiring Devices product demand through specification with end users, contractors and aligned consultants
  • Coordinate and execute structured seminars for target engineers, contractors and distributors per plan. Drive attendance at scheduled events and roadshows in collaboration with Sales Agencies
  • Coordinates activities with the national accounts sales (or segment specific lead) organization to maintain and further develop relationships with key accounts. May act as liaison with established key accounts.
  • Analyzes sales levels and trends through market research and initiates pro-active or corrective actions as required to ensure attainment of objectives. Reports on district business updates as required
  • Works closely with and coordinates activities with all departments within Eaton’s Cooper Wiring Devices Business to ensure that company-wide goals are achieved.
  • For districts in which the RSM has direct reports, the RSM shall demonstrate effective hiring, placement, training, supervision and motivation of employees in order to build a high performing team of self-starting employees with a Customer First attitude to achieve Eaton’s Cooper Wiring Devices Business goals.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Post secondary degree in Business or Engineering from an accredited institution
  • 3 years experience in Sales Management
  • Driver's licence and clean driver's record
  • Ability to travel up to 25%
  • No relocation is being offered for this role. Candidate must live within Western Canada to be considered.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years experience in sales or marketing; or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Minimum 3 years experience with the Canadian Electrical Industry
  • Bilingual (French & English) written and oral an asset

Position Criteria:

  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Strong analytical aptitude and complex problem-solving skills
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment as part of a team
  • Effective time management, prioritization skills

Why work at Eaton?We provide benefits that are industry competitive and focused on employee well-being. Listed below are programs that are offered globally, but program availabilities may vary by site.

  • Flexible work options to help balance work/life demands (at participating Eaton sites)
  • Healthcare/retirement savings programs
  • Competitive compensation packages to reward skills and performance
  • Tuition assistance or financial help for ongoing learning and development
  • Health, Dental, Vision & Wellness programs
  • Donation matching (U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico)

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Sales

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ES CRDS WD Wiring Devices

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?: Yes
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time
