title: Sr. Enterprise Relationship Manager (Remote-Toronto)
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Citrix builds the secure digital workspace technology that frees 400,000 customers to do their very best work from anywhere. By joining our award-winning workplace, you’ll be included in the globally diverse, collaborative team that values work-life balance. Come see why Fortune named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Let’s innovate and grow together! What we're looking for: . You are a successful, SaaS Sales Professional with more than 12 years of industry experience supporting Enterprise Strategic level customers. You have a history of proven sales achievements marked by successful quota attainment. You have experience developing and encouraging deep multi-year relationships with C-Suite or equivalent. You are ready for the challenge and reward of being part of a groundbreaking software services company, leading the way toward guiding companies to achieve their goals, and forging a path toward Cloud migration. You share our vision of migration to the Cloud and are passionate about delivering Cloud solutions to customers. This is a remote based position with travel to customer locations or corporate meetings, as needed. Position Overview As a Sr. Enterprise Relationship Manager, you will cover 6-10 large Strategic Enterprise accounts with a history of consistent revenue generation. You will articulate Citrix’ solutions promoting the entire Citrix portfolio. You will increase share of wallet through product and service solution revenue generation being a strong technology thought partner for the customer. You will be part of a winning team supporting Citrix’ cutting edge solutions, will be motivated by a challenge, and are ready to reap the rewards of successful partnership with customers through sales accomplishments. Role Responsibilities You will establish relationships and engage with C-suite and IT management to find opportunities and sell Citrix products and services direct to existing named Fortune 500-1000 accounts. Understand their business and IT strategies, challenges, priorities and goals and creatively develop and articulate solutions to support these needs. You will carry a revenue quota to meet or exceed sales targets and demonstrate continuous progress towards achieving account strategies and meeting quarterly revenue goals. Effectively conduct quarterly business reviews. You will lead and negotiate sophisticated contracts; understand and navigate account procurement practices to optimally close profitable multi-year licensing contracts. You will establish and maintain close relationships with inside sales, systems engineers, consultants, and sales specialists to bring to bear internal resources. You will establish and maintain relationships with resellers, system integrators, and any other external partners to develop and achieve account strategies and opportunity plans. You will own the customer relationship and drive prompt resolution of customer issues and ensure high levels of customer satisfaction with Citrix products and services as well as serving as the primary client contact for non-technical or support issues requiring escalation. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience required. 12+ years of technology sales experience. Must reside in the local area with ability to travel to customer accounts and attend corporate meetings as needed. Preferred Skills/Requirements 15+ years selling to Enterprise Strategic level customers. Strong relationships within the Toronto Financial Services Vertical Demonstrated success selling SaaS solutions. Direct and channel sales experience. Proven ability to close complex deals and/or negotiate software license agreements. Strong verbal and written communication skills with confident ability to present in front of C level customers. Consistent track record of meeting or exceeding a sales quota in excess of $2 Million a year, with experience selling into large strategic accounts up through C Level Management. Experience documenting activity within a CRM tool- such as Salesforce. Experience in a minimum of 1 to 2 of the following areas of expertise: application and core technology (database, operating systems, application platforms, hardware, networking), internet solution selling (service, hardware, software), and/or networking, security and/or WAN optimization. LI-MK1 Functional Area: Enterprise Relationship Manager What you’re looking for: Everyone is welcome at Citrix. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and a culture of belonging, and celebrate bringing our courageous, authentic selves to work. We believe this way of working helps us innovate, and it’s just one of the reasons why our employees continuously recognize Citrix as a great place to work. Citrix helps make work more sustainable to benefit the planet, our business, and our communities. For more than 30 years, we have empowered individuals and organizations to work remotely or work from anywhere, reducing commuting emissions and energy consumption in the process. We are the #1 leader in Virtual Client Computing (VCC) and #2 in the Application Delivery Controller (ADC) space, and we have key partnerships with top cloud providers. We’ll give you the tools, learning opportunities, mentorship, and flexibility to achieve your goals. Come see why you belong at Citrix, with our culture supporting purposeful innovation and growth from within. The Benefits We offer a competitive total rewards package* that includes: 18 weeks of paid parental leave Health and wellness benefits Employee assistance program Retirement benefits Time off and absence programs Professional development and mentorship opportunities Paid volunteer time and charitable matching of employee donations Employee resource groups And more! **Please note that benefits may vary based on location. Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications. Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.html Citrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance. At this time, we are requiring personnel entering a Citrix office, traveling for business or attending a Citrix event to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you choose to remain unvaccinated based on a specific medical need or a sincerely held religious belief and need to access our offices, Citrix will work with you to provide you with reasonable accommodation where possible. Learn more about our COVID-19 policies. By applying, you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.</section>

title: Manager of People Enablement
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">We are looking for a leader to help us build enablement solutions to accelerate the effectiveness and capability of our company. We need your help to scale quickly and effectively. You will determine enablement priorities & objectives. You will distill complex concepts and processes into clear and digestible information, both in written and verbal communication. You will lead the entire process of establishing a library of resources, tools, and training programs. You will build enablement programs and solutions that are high impact and scalable, always keeping the end goal in mind! 

About TealBook
TealBook is a big data company that offers an unparalleled Supplier Data Foundation, Supplier Intelligence Platform, and Universal Supplier Gateway. By using TealBook, our customers have the data they need to make critical decisions, resulting in empowered and transformative procurement strategies. By leveraging machine learning and AI, TealBook is introducing ease and transparency to the supply chain ecosystem.

Our team enjoys a competitive compensation package that includes health benefits, flexible work schedules, and a nurturing workplace environment. We’re located primarily in Toronto and Cincinnati, OH and utilize collaborative technologies to bridge geographic gaps. The health and safety of our employees is our highest priority, and in the era of COVID-19, our employees are encouraged to work from where they feel the safest.

Our guiding values were decided by our team and we’re committed to living them every day. We’ve built an inclusive, transparent culture dedicated to celebrating each other. We see failures as learning opportunities, we welcome feedback and new ideas, and we set clear goals and expectations so that every team member feels empowered to succeed.

Tealwork is Teamwork-The impact we have is always greater when we work together. We bring our authentic selves, unique experiences, perspectives, and passions across teams, functions, and geographies to solve problems and deliver better results.

Trust Through Transparency-We build trust through communicating honestly, authentically, and with respect. We hold ourselves accountable, we admit to our mistakes, and we do what we say we'll do. Our success is rooted in trust through transparency.

Deliver Delight-We are all customers. We listen to needs, we challenge our ideas of what's possible and prioritize work that will drive success and build satisfaction. We constantly look for ways to differentiate ourselves and ensure interactions and experiences deliver delight.

Will to Win-Change is the only constant. We don't just believe this; we face the unknown head-on. We have the courage to challenge the status quo, continuously adapt, change, and evolve. We act with urgency, align our priorities with the company deliverables and drive decisions backed by data.

TealBook is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity, and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the requirements for the position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.</section>

title: Client Success Manager
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Ogury is the kind of place where things don’t just happen fast - they happen now. As a global leader in mobile brand advertising, we’ve created the Ogury Advertising Engine - an integrated stack of technology designed and optimised to deliver high-performing mobile brand campaigns for more than 1500 advertisers.

Here, we focus on execution and on getting things done as one team. It’s where an incredibly diverse and inclusive community of people come together in a workplace that has integrity at its heart. It’s an environment that demands grit as we passionately persevere in the face of every challenge. And it’s somewhere that encourages creative thinking, so we can all accelerate together.

Our story began in London in 2014. Since then, we’ve quickly become a 450-strong - and still growing - team with 18 offices around the world, and we’re not stopping there.

At Ogury we know the future is now. So let’s get your story started. Now.

About the role:

The Client Success Manager is the coordinator of all things campaign, working closely with the sales and Ad Ops team to ensure that we deliver the best in market campaign results and provide world class service to our clients, building strong relationships. The CSM role couldn’t be more diverse with no one day being the same being involved in all aspects of the campaign life cycle.

#LI-LDP1


Ogury is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce</section>

title: Sales Strategy Manager - Ready to Eat Cereal (12-Month Contract)
description:
As a Contract Sales Strategy Manager within our Ready to Eat Cereal (RTEC) category at Kellogg Company Canada, you will use your strategic thinking skills to represent our brand to some of the world’s most respected and recognized retail operations

You’ll have a passion for collaboration and a vision for success as an important member of a cross-functional commercial team

Within this 12-Month Contract opportunity, you’ll utilize your expertise in Canadian trade and consumer packaged goods to work across multiple functions, developing sales strategies, ensuring flawless execution, and monitoring performance of assortment, merchandising, pricing, shelving, and promotional initiatives

At Kellogg Canada, we love our people and they love our company culture and opportunities

Our Kellogg K-Values are at the core of who we are, what we believe, and what brings us together

We value work/life balance, diversity & inclusion, and of course, great food

What’s not to love? Now is the time to take your career further

Come join us! HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING + Performing Analytics – Proactively track and analyze business and brand results on a national, regional, and customer basis

You’ll handle bringing data to life to make our well-loved brands even stronger! + Collaborating for Success – Work alongside our marketing, shopper, and finance teams, providing perspective and identifying solutions to our business and brand opportunities in the marketplace

Leveraging the category management and shopper insights team, you’ll identify and analyze pricing, distribution, and other category and brand opportunities at the banner and region level

+ Working Cost-Effectively – Partner with our account executive, RGM, and finance teams to manage trade spending efficiency and effectiveness

We’ll look to you to ensure adherence to feature price guidelines for all categories

+ Providing Key Insights – Evaluate the performance of multiple product launches, corporate promotions, and other initiatives

Your effective communication skills will ensure the results are well-understood among internal and external stakeholders

+ Partnering with Supply Chain – Verify the right product is available at the right time and in the right format for the right channel

Bring your eye for precision to the table and watch your sales grow! + Sharing Best Practices – Confirm the development of best practices for optimal execution and effectively implement them at the customer level

You’ll improve performance and fill knowledge gaps as you pass along important learnings

YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS Required: + A comprehensive understanding of theCanadian trade and current trade philosophies + Experience translating corporate objectives into meaningful and effective programs + Experience within the consumer packaged goods industry managing multiple key customers + Experience managing internal and external stakeholders across various levels and functions + Proven experience managing customer accounts + Client-focused, with a strong capacity to build credibility and trust + Strong verbal and written communication skills Bonus Points: + Post-secondary education + Are you tech-savvy and skilled with PC applications? You will excel here! + We’d love it if you are fluent in both English and French! WHAT’S NEXT It’s best to apply today because job postings can be taken down and we wouldn’t want you to miss this opportunity

To learn more about us, click on the link below: + Kellogg K-Values (http://www.kelloggcareers.com/global/company-and-values.html) THE FINER PRINT This position is a 12-Month Contract Opportunity

At Kellogg Canada, we take great pride in our comprehensive total rewards program

This program is an important way of recognizing the value and contribution of our employees

Kellogg Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer that strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people

Accommodation is available upon request for applicants

LET’S CREATE THE FUTURE OF FOOD Kellogg Recruitment

title: Media Buyer
description:
About Wavemaker

We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content and technology. The Wavemaker way is globally consistent. Fueled by the world’s most powerful consumer data, we understand where and how marketing can intervene decisively to help brands win more sales.

Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know it’s not easy, but if it’s in you, we will get it out of you.

Our 7,600 people across 90 markets provoke growth for some of the world’s leading brands and businesses. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by:

  • deep knowledge we have of our clients’ business
  • confidence to challenge what’s gone before
  • the support to go further than we thought possible

We are a part of GroupM, WPP’s global media investment management company. Discover more on wavemakerglobal.com, Twitter and LinkedIn 

 

Role Context:

The Media Buyer is responsible for the overall execution and management of their assigned client’s broadcast & video requirements; negotiating, purchasing, and monitoring to ensure that final buys deliver on the approved plan objective and strategy. 

Core Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for stewardship and day-to-day maintenance buys
  • Communicate buy changes to vendor reps e.g.: cancellations, shifts, brand changes
  • Prepare, check, verify and issue buying analyses
  • Generate and analyze campaign reports- including pre and post documents
  • Collaborate with Client Service teams on specific clients
  • Oversee the resolution of billing discrepancies
  • Assist Manager in all phases of account/client management
  • Develop a deeper understanding of client needs and strategy
  • Play a key role in the budget and client billing process to ensure accuracy
  • Compile and analyze marketing and media data to support implementation decisions

Required Skills/ Experience:                                           

  • Minimum 1-2 years work experience as an Assistant Media Buyer
  • University or College degree/diploma in Media, Marketing, Business, or related field and/or relevant years of experience
  • Buying experience on all levels (national & regional)
  • Demonstrates understanding of media basics and concepts
  • Proficient with DDS, Infosys, and Microsoft Office Suite

Qualities:

  • Digitally savvy: uses digital and social media, demonstrates passion about emerging media, Google Analytics, Google Images, ability to search and research topics, etc.
  • Interest in video disciplines (traditional, on-line, digital, etc.)
  • Interest in emerging technologies and the burgeoning video ecosystem
  • Embraces PACED (Passionate, Agile, Collaborative, Entrepreneur, Diversity) core values
  • constant change
  • Thrives in fast paced environment

 

GroupM and all of its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity and inclusivity. We are committed to creating a safe and respectful work environment and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive and collaborative we are, the more great work we can create together.

GroupM encourages all qualified candidates to apply and has an exceptional record of accommodating the needs of our staff. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process, please let us know. GroupM thanks all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Purchasing Administrator
description:
Location: Edmonton, AB, CanadaJob Type: ContractDate: 4/26/2022Job ID: MJ327244426Category: Office Professionals
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client in the Construction industry to recruit a full-time Purchasing Administrator for a 2-month contract (with strong potential for extension). This role is looking for an ASAP start date.
 
*This role will be mostly focused on Purchasing Administrative type duties but there may be some requirements to assist in the Warehouse. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable lifting up to 50 pounds and being a part of hands-on work in the Warehouse on occasion. *
 
Responsibilities:
  • Data entry responsibilities: population of purchase orders, parts inventory log adjustments, receiving purchase orders
  • Matching and scanning purchase documentation for accounts payable reference
  • Assists with gathering and fulfillment of parts and consumables requisitions to shop and field staff
  • Involvement in work order fulfillment, adjustments, and charge-outs
  • Generate and distribute monthly consumable invoices for various divisional crews
  • Order stationery supplies through the main office for purchasing/warehouse as required
  • Support the Purchasing team, Parts technicians, and Warehouse staff
  • Support shipping and receiving of goods and materials, confirming quantities and conditions, noting discrepancies and damages, and stocking shelves in the warehouse if needed
  • Update parts inventory; including cycle counts, adjusting quantities, assigning bin locations, tagging shelves, and cross-referencing after-market with OEM numbers
  • Correspondence with suppliers and vendors on missing paperwork, backorders, missing credits, price, and receiving discrepancies
  • Assists with return and credit process in the warehouse
Qualifications:
  • Intermediate to advanced abilities in Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Self-motivated, able to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be comfortable in an industrial setting and lifting up to 50lbs if needed
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills, and attention to detail
  • Ability to thrive under pressure, multi-task, as well as prioritize and identify urgent requests
  • Encouraging and supportive team player who can work both independently and in a team environment
  • Exposure or experience with working in the construction industry; experience in road construction would be considered an asset
Job ID: MJ327244426
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Regional Sales Manager - Eastern Canada
description:
WE'RE LOOKING FOR A REGIONAL SALES MANAGER

POSITION LOCATION: EASTERN CANADA


The Sales Manager reports to the VP Sales & Marketing, and is responsible for representing Airbus Helicopters Canada Ltd ("AHCA") in a specific geographical area regarding sales and lease of aircraft and related services. In this position the Sales Manager promotes all products AHCA has to offer in order to generate new business and build relationships with potential customers. The Sales Manager actively monitors the Helicopter market and identifies potential customers to satisfy to their needs.


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES


Sales Generation

  • Perform follow up on sales leads generated by prospect/customer calls, aircraft demonstration tours and/or "cold calls".
  • Maintain contact with Airbus Helicopters North America ("AHNA") customers by regular and/or periodic visits to their sites, with the goal of booking new helicopter sales. Activities include:
    • Diversify contacts within AHNA customers beyond primary contact to develop and maintain broad customer knowledge and needs.
    • Stage and integrate prospecting sales call activities into customer meeting schedules and travel routing.
    • Meet with each non-AHI customers or end user a minimum of three times annually to gather intelligence on future opportunities.
    • Establish meetings with existing AHNA customers and end users a minimum of four times annually to maintain awareness of AH status including near, mid, and long-term purchase requirements.
  • Coordinate customer and prospect meetings/data exchange with appropriate AHI Market Segment Sales manager (MSM).
  • Assist in the development of territory marketing and sales strategies and forecasts to remain competitive in anticipation changing market conditions.
  • Develop strategies and relationships with AHNA Customers or Sales Prospects to foresee and execute the necessary steps to move a Prospect through the Sales Process to secure new helicopter Sales Booking
  • Maintain knowledge of competitor's products and sales activities, and possesses an awareness of the comparison to AHI products.
  • Interface with the Program Management Team, Delivery Manager, and Marketing/Events Department to ensure that aircraft deliveries are in accordance with customer and company standards as required.
  • Exchange intelligence and share customer feedback as appropriate with Territory CSM and Regional Technical representatives on a minimum bi-weekly basis
  • Perform aircraft demonstrations and ferry responsibilities as required.

Market Analysis

  • Compile data and prepare market analysis and forecast presentations for quarterly marketing meetings.
  • Attend local and national trade shows and exhibits for purposes of developing new business contacts and general public relations activity.
  • Assist in the recommendation of policy changes as it relates to advertising and promotions.

Administration and Reporting

  • Prepare and submit timely/accurate reports including detailed customer prospect contacts, expense reports and plans for upcoming week.
  • Compile data and prepare formal and informal presentations for prospective customers
  • Monitor travel and related budgets to operate within company guidelines.

MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • University Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Aviation or related field.
  • Minimum 7 years direct marketing/sales experience in the aircraft/helicopters industry
  • Prior experience as helicopter pilot is preferred
  • Strong sales and marketing techniques is preferred

EXPERIENCE

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are required (French-English)
  • Proficiency in sales of Aeronautic products
  • Advanced computer skills
  • Ability to multitask and set priorities
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Business oriented
  • Problem solving skills
  • Project Management Skills
  • Demonstrated Sales competences
  • Decision making and ability to arbitrate in a timely manner
  • Work independently under general supervision
  • Ability to work under pressure and deadlines
  • Ability to set targets and follow set action plan to reach them

title: Director of Sales
description:
Location: Halifax, NS, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/11/2022Job ID: BG372160411Category: Sales
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client in Halifax to find a talented Director of Sales to join their team. 
 
This role will focus on driving sales and gaining market share in Atlantic Canada with a focus on motivating the sales team and designing strategic sales. This individual should bring proven leadership skills in connection with exceptional negotiation and communication skills.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Design and implement strategic marketing plans to reach sales targets. There will be an emphasis on management and distribution to a well-established dealer base
  • Cultivate and nurture relationships with existing customers with occasional travel required throughout the Atlantic provinces
  • Develop a strategy related to increasing the current commercial customer base
  • Establish and refine sales processes by assessing costs, competition, supply chain, volume, and profit margins for current and new products
  • Oversee dedicated sales training programs for new and existing employees
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, or any relevant field
  • Proficient with technology with an emphasis on experience with Microsoft Excel
  • 3+ years in a sales leadership position with proven experience growing a team and driving successful sales strategies
  • In-depth knowledge of marketing techniques and best practices
  • Capacity to manage various projects with experience managing tight deadlines
  • Excellent negotiation and leadership skills
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Job ID: BG372160411 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Vice-President Global Sourcing
description:
Company Description

Who we are:

At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. We believe fashion empowers our customers to put their best foot forward when it matters the most. From the design table to the stores and our digital channels, we are always finding new ways to create memorable customer experiences, backed by a strong brand portfolio and powered by the most passionate people in the industry.

Job Description

Reporting to the Chief Global Sourcing Officer, the Vice President Global Sourcing defines, and executes a global sourcing strategy, develops a top tier team, and supports Reitmans (Canada) Limited’s profitable growth initiatives. Accountable to lead strategic sourcing operations that impact our 3 iconic retails brands and propels us into the future, this executive leader applies the ethical and environmental standards in global sourcing and supports the achievement of sustainability goals across the supply chain.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain and execute a multi-year supply chain roadmap that aligns with company growth plans and addresses opportunities for continuous process improvement;
  • Develop and grow factory partnerships that helps meet our business objectives for innovation, product development and speed to market, price/value and quality;
  • Monitor global risks, establish strategic direction, and set goals for international sourcing strategy;
  • Define organizational structure, set objectives manage workloads and results to achieve goals while adopting best practices;
  • Ensure high employee engagement at every level through effective motivation, coaching, training, and development of personnel on the team;
  • Build and maintain cross functional partnerships and relationships across the company as well as with external partners’,
  • Champion sustainability and sustainable innovation throughout the supply chain;
  • Strive for continuous improvement through tried-and-true as well as cutting-edge tactics for achieving maximum speed and flexibility in product lead times;
  • Build and lead a fabric team that supports a fabric first initiative.

 

Qualifications

Qualifications and Competencies:

  • University Degree in supply chain management, manufacturing, or another related field
  • 12+ years of proven leadership in sourcing and manufacturing along with leadership experience in growing, building, and mentoring teams;
  • Strong understanding of supply chain, global logistics, ethical practices and manufacturing;
  • Ability to work cross-culturally and across time zones;
  • The ability to travel (when safe to do so) estimated 4 trips to Asia a year


 

Additional Information

What we offer (Why work with us):

  • A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Paid Time Off ( Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Additional benefits include monthly bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement
  • 50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Penningtons, Reitmans & RW&CO.)
  • Generous Employee Referral Policy (50$-500$)

If this inspires you…let’s talk. Send us your resume today! 

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited has several hundreds of stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference. 

There are many ways to wear a career at RCL! #ReadytoRCL 

Reitmans (Canada) Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for providing an accessible candidate experience. 

We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Operations Purchasing Coordinator - Contract
description:
Water Made Exciting!

At Soda Steam, we are growing fast and looking for problem-solvers and thought leaders that are ready to grow with us. If you have the energy and determination, then we'll provide the tools you need for success.

Job Summary:

As an Operations Purchasing Coordinator, Contract, you will report to the Supply Planning Manager. This position is responsible for the production planning for the filling factory, local purchase/work order management, performing periodic analysis to inform the Business on supply planning and inventory management of raw materials and supplies to meet customer demand while optimizing investment in inventory and cost. The role is a 14 month maternity leave contract role.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Filling Factory team to create the weekly production plan for the Filling Factory
  • Create and maintain Purchase Orders and New Vendors in the system as required.
  • Manage clear, timely communication with suppliers and internal stakeholders.
  • Analyze and maintain adequate supply of Factory materials (corrugate/components/misc.)
  • Create, co-ordinate and execute co-pack work orders as needed to meet or exceed customer requirements.
  • Create, co-ordinate and execute transfers between Plant and US Operations as required
  • Manage clear timely communication for Inventory reconciliation of Corrugate and Container Inbounds.
  • Track and update reports for Inbound containers from Suppliers weekly
  • Support overall operations activities; promote operational excellence initiatives, etc.
  • Backup and support to the Supply Planning Manager




Country:
Canada

Requirements:

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Operations Management or Supply Chain Management preferred
  • 3+ years planning experience (i.e., demand/supply planning, inventory management)
  • Superior quantitative and analytical skills
  • Strong critical reasoning and problem-solving ability
  • Detail-oriented, organized with solid time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills, able to work collaboratively across functions
  • Advanced user experience with analysis software/tools (e.g., MS Excel, MS Access)
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (i.e., Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
  • ERP systems experience plus
  • APICS certification a plus
  • Great attitude and a team player!

SodaStream Canada is committed to an inclusive, recruitment and selection processes. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, SodaStream Canada will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please advise the Human Resources Department

title: Outside Purchasing Representative
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Reporting to the Business Development Manager, the Outside Sales Representative is responsible for developing the used car purchasing facet of the Kenny U-Pull market by developing strong relationships with suppliers and constantly searching for new clients. You will work closely with the call center and logistics team and strive to surpass purchasing objectives.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Solicit clients and develop your own client base (dealers, garages, auction houses, etc.);
  • Build solid relationships within the automobile and recycling industry;
  • Follow up on client leads in person, by telephone and email, as well as through social media;
  • Negotiate purchasing terms;
  • Communicate effectively with other departments.
Qualifications

  • At least 5 years of sales experience;
  • At least 2 years of experience in business development;
  • Prospecting experience; 
  • Ability to cover a 2 hour territory from home office
  • Valid G driver’s licence and good driving record.

Skills required

  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment;
  • Good with numbers and mental calculations;
  • Proficient in Outlook and Excel;
  • Leadership skills;
  • Customer service;
  • Analytical mind.


Additional Information

  • Work schedule: Monday to Friday; 
  • Permanent, full-time position;
  • Travel (80% of the time on the road).

What we offer:

  • Group insurance after three months;
  • Group RRSP after six months;
  • Vehicle provided and gas paid;
  • Competitive salary bonus plan;
  • Social events (BBQ, sugaring off, draws, etc.).

Be part of a reputable organization offering stability and outstanding career opportunities. Apply now!

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Area Manager
description:
Apply by visiting the link below:
https://jobs.elections.on.ca/

What to expect in this role
The Area Manager (AM) oversees several paper-based voting locations and supervises poll officials on election day.
 
Reporting to the Returning Officer or designate, you will:
  • Supervise two (2) to five (5) voting locations on election day. The ability to travel and provide your own transportation between voting locations is a requirement of the job and mileage is paid. 
  • Act as a liaison to relay information between the voting locations and the Returning Officer. 
  • Report any services that are disrupted, incidents that occur or complaints that are made at the voting location to the Returning Officer in a timely manner. 
  • Contact poll officials to ensure your team is available to work on the prescribed days and times. 
  • Complete tasks manually, using paper forms and lists at voting locations. 
  • Ensure staffing resources, supplies and poll layout conforms with Elections Ontario standards. 
  • Ensure all voting locations are free of any partisan campaign materials. 
  • Ensure all voting locations are accessible to the electors.
  • Supervise poll officials and voting locations to ensure proper procedures are being executed.
  • Assist electors with disabilities, if required. 
  • Ensure Scrutineers and candidate representatives are following guidelines set forth within the voting locations. 
  • Temporarily backfill a poll official role, if required. 
  • Resolve any issues at the voting location escalated by the poll officials as they arise. 
  • Ensure all assigned voting locations promptly close on time, and that all electors that entered the voting location prior to close can mark and cast their ballot to vote. 
  • Complete the paper-based Ballot Statement of the Poll form after the closing of the polls. 
  • Communicate the results to the returning office. 
  • Remove all posters and signage after closing on election day. 
  • Ensure poll supplies from the voting locations are returned to the returning office after closing on election day. 
  • Ensure time sheets from the voting locations are returned to the returning office after closing on election day.
 
What you need to qualify:
  • Access to a cell phone and vehicle to travel to and from the returning office and voting locations.
  • Availability to work up to 13 hours on election day.
  • Availability to attend a training session.
  • Ability to read and observe voting procedures at the voting location.
  • Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and problem- solving skills to resolve issues and communicate solutions to staff and the public in an efficient and timely manner.
  • Ability to understand, rationalize and resolve situations efficiently as they arise.
  • Ability to identify and verify information provided by an elector in a timely manner via hard copy or mobile device.
  • Ability to complete paper-based forms with clear and legible handwriting and good attention to detail.
  • Ability to calculate, tally and track number the number of ballots manually.
  • Ability to stand and work for long stretches of time (up to 13 hours).
  • Ability to learn quickly, follow directions, and complete repetitive duties.
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Must be a Canadian citizen and at least 18 years of age on election day.

Apply by visiting the link below:
https://jobs.elections.on.ca/

title: Area Manager
description:
Our Connected Home team is proud to offer our customers seamless and simple technology that fits into any lifestyle. Our fibre network supports millions of customers with high-speed Internet, TV, and Smart Home Monitoring to keep Canadians connected to the people and things that matter most. We know that our customers rely on us to provide them reliable connectivity, that is why we have made a commitment to providing the fastest and most consistent network in the areas we serve.  We are growing our Connected Home team and are looking for team members that are collaborative, digital-first, fast-moving, bold-thinking, and focused on delivering impact in everything they do. Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada. 
Let’s make your possible at Rogers. Are you up for the challenge and the fun? If so, consider the following opportunity: This position is responsible for the successful management of a team of Field Client Account Specialists focusing on selling Rogers products and services to residential customers within Toronto and surroundings region focusing on the MDU segment.
 
Successful candidate to Utilize advanced knowledge of products and services as well as sales process experience to maximize sales and effectively work assigned territory. And to ensure your team’s success, you’ll monitor performance metrics on a daily basis and provide coaching as needed.
 
The Field Sales Area Manager is an important role accountable to develop plans & drive sales results and reports to the Regional Sales Manager.
 
Responsibilities:
 Leverage directed sales leads and identifying new sources of opportunities for sales in single family units (SFU's) Utilizing customer facing door to door sales tactics (up to 95% in field presence)Manage and coach a team of internal Client Account Specialists targeting customers within Single Family Units (SFU's) by going door to door.Develop and implement sales plans by leveraging directed lead strategies to ensure all sales and revenue targets for Ignite TV, Ignite Internet, Rogers Smart Home Monitoring and Wireless are met or exceeded.Train and coach Client Account Specialists on Sales Process, Territory Coverage, Systems, Tools, Promotions and Plans and highlight key differentiators to increase and/or maintain the Market Share for new and existing Rogers customersAnalyze Salesforce dashboard, sales reports and territory sales breakdown for each Client Account SpecialistGather and provide feedback on market insights and competitive intelligence for assigned territoryParticipate and Coach Sales Reps through regular door-to-door field workMotivate and provide strong leadership to sales staff through performance management techniques such as quality evaluations, individual sales plans and ongoing coaching, guidance, and monitoring of Client Account Specialists productivityWork collaboratively with District Sales Manager to address process gaps and barriers to sales performanceEnsure adherence to all sales training and certification requirements for all team membersDocument best practices and ensure constant evolution of the teamAssist in designing and developing promotions to achieve targeted market share and revenue within territoryHiring, onboarding/offboarding and training of the Client Account SpecialistsRole-modeling best-in-class sales behavior at all timesPosition must assist in maintaining the confidentiality of customer and business data at all timesLearning, adhering, and enforcing all applicable Health & Safety regulations, both legislatively mandated, and as outlined in Company policy 
Qualifications:
 Core Competencies: Customer Focus; Teamwork; Communication; Accountability; InnovationPost-secondary school educationDemonstrated ability to drive team performance within a customer-centric sales environmentAdaptability in a fast-paced, changing work environment3-5 years Telecom Industry or Door to Door sales management experience is an assetAvailable to work flexible work shiftsDemonstrated leadership abilitiesProven track record to coach and motivate a teamBilingual / Multilanguage abilities an assetStrong Interpersonal and Communication SkillsStrong computer skills, with excellent knowledge and ability in Microsoft Office suite (Work, Excel & PowerPoint) and handheld devicesAvailable to work on a flexible schedule: days, evenings, weekends & statutory holidays to meet customer needs. Must have a valid driver’s license and vehicle available​As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: Full time
Shift: Flex Time
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 857 York Mills Rd. (055), North York, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 50%
Posting Category/Function: Sales & Account Management
Requisition ID: 267074
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work: Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment
 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.
 
Posting Notes:  Sales & Marketing

title: Client Relationship Manager - Express Scripts Canada
description:
JOB SUMMARY:


The Client Relationship Manager, Client Services is responsible for supporting the Account Management team with daily operational activities to ensure the relationship with the clients are effectively maintained. The primary focus for the position is executing client-specific operational deliverables, monitoring service trends, providing proactive service-related consultation, and owning issue resolution. The Client Relationship Manager is the day-to-day client contact and is accountable for all operational deliverables as assigned.


This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


+ Assist the Account Management team by providing client-facing support. Maintain ownership for assigned deliverables and ensure operational and service excellence.

+ Build and maintain trusting and open relationships with the clients as the first point of contact for inquiries and requests

+ Administrate regular system release initiatives and related activities

+ Coordinate deliverables with internal operational departments to ensure client satisfaction. Escalate issues when appropriate to drive resolution

+ Monitor and identify emerging service trends to proactively mitigate any issues

+ Provide support to Account Manager on various strategic initiatives and promotion of ESC’s products to the marketplace.

+ Manage client invoicing

+ Chair, facilitate or attend internal and external meetings as required

+ Participate in various projects as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS:


+ Post-secondary degree in relevant discipline or equivalent work experience

+ 5 years of relevant experience in a B2B service relationship, or group insurance service role

+ Expertise with group insurance claims adjudication systems and process

+ Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills

+ Proficiency with Microsoft Office PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook

+ Demonstrated strong business acumen, analytical problem solving and critical thinking skills

+ Client-centric approach to all tasks

+ Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple deliverables based on urgency

+ Established organizational skills with attention to detail

+ Proven project management abilities

+ Capacity to work in a high volume, deliverable focused role with a cross section of operational teams

+ Confidence to question and challenge the status quo and provide solutions in order to achieve optimal outcomes

+ Experience in Group Benefits or Pharmacy Benefit Management industries is required


NOTE: Internal candidates should apply before May 11, 2022.


Express Scripts Canada is a Cigna company


Express Scripts Canada is a subsidiary of Express Scripts, a Cigna company. Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, wellbeing and peace of mind of those we serve. Cigna offers an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioural health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products.


About Express Scripts Canada


Express Scripts Canada is a leading health benefits manager and has been recognized as one of the most innovative. Our clients include Canada's leading insurers, third party administrators and governments. We work with these clients to develop industry-leading solutions to deliver superior healthcare in a cost-controlled environment. We provide Active Pharmacy™ services to more than 7 million Canadian patients and adjudicate more than 100 million pharmacy, dental, and extended health claims annually. Through our proprietary consumer intelligence, clinical expertise, and patients-first approach, we promote better health decisions for plan members, while managing and reducing drug benefit costs for plan sponsors.


It will be a condition of employment that the successful candidate obtains an Enhanced Reliability Clearance from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to provide supporting documentation to receive clearance if required.


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a positive work environment built on solid corporate values, integrity, mutual respect, collaboration, passion, service and alignment.


We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace. By embracing diversity, we build a more effective organization that empowers our employees to be the best that they can be.


We are committed to creating a working environment that is barrier-free and we are prepared to provide accommodation for people with disabilities.


If you require accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: eschr2@express-scripts.com Do not email eschr2@express-scripts.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

title: Purchasing Coordinator
description:
Description:

Reporting to the Procurement Manager, the Purchasing Coordinator - CLINICAL, will be responsible for the procurement of goods andservices within the guidelines of the Broader Public Sector (BPS) Procurement Directive. This role will also be responsiblefor the planning, development, implementation and management of the key procurement strategies that includes the creation and evaluation of formal request for proposals, negotiating contracts, contract management and seeking out new
opportunities to support HHS’ strategic plan. The Department is responsible for approximately %24250 million in spend annually on goods and services that support clinical, administrative, information technology, facilities and maintenance, at multiple HHS sites and for multiple end users.



Qualifications:

Reporting to the Procurement Manager, the Purchasing Coordinator - CLINICAL, will be responsible for the procurement of goods andservices within the guidelines of the Broader Public Sector (BPS) Procurement Directive. This role will also be responsiblefor the planning, development, implementation and management of the key procurement strategies that includes the creation and evaluation of formal request for proposals, negotiating contracts, contract management and seeking out new
opportunities to support HHS’ strategic plan. The Department is responsible for approximately %24250 million in spend annually on goods and services that support clinical, administrative, information technology, facilities and maintenance, at multiple HHS sites and for multiple end users.


This position will be expected to support the Clinical portfolio, including Peri-Op Services, MDRD, and Trauma, subject to change as necessary. The PurchasingCoordinator - CLINICAL is responsible for:

• Preparing RFx documents (RFP, RFQ, RFI etc.) in compliance with the BPS Directives and including Canadian Bidding Law and Contract Law.
• Maintaining compliance with all internally and externally mandated policies and audit requirements, as well as all internalsigning authority policies and procedures.
• Facilitate and coordinate the day-to-day procurements within a commodity team, consisting of a Contract Analyst and a Purchasing Clerk.
• Price and contract negotiations and is expected to support standardization and quality product selection with the end users.
• Providing procurement consultative services to the Hospital end users; including contract management, vendor management, vendor performance appraisals and liaison with GPO's (Medbuy), SSO's (MSCS) and other outside interests.
• Overseeing the accurate maintenance of all Purchasing Databases’ and Systems.
• Experience in Public Procurement for the Healthcare sector is preferred along with formal proposal document development and contract writing.
• Regular status updates and project monitor will also be requirements.


This position will be expected to support the Clinical portfolio, including Peri-Op Services, MDRD, and Trauma, subject to change as necessary. The PurchasingCoordinator - CLINICAL is responsible for:

• Preparing RFx documents (RFP, RFQ, RFI etc.) in compliance with the BPS Directives and including Canadian Bidding Law and Contract Law.
• Maintaining compliance with all internally and externally mandated policies and audit requirements, as well as all internalsigning authority policies and procedures.
• Facilitate and coordinate the day-to-day procurements within a commodity team, consisting of a Contract Analyst and a Purchasing Clerk.
• Price and contract negotiations and is expected to support standardization and quality product selection with the end users.
• Providing procurement consultative services to the Hospital end users; including contract management, vendor management, vendor performance appraisals and liaison with GPO's (Medbuy), SSO's (MSCS) and other outside interests.
• Overseeing the accurate maintenance of all Purchasing Databases’ and Systems.
• Experience in Public Procurement for the Healthcare sector is preferred along with formal proposal document development and contract writing.
• Regular status updates and project monitor will also be requirements.


Monday to Friday- 37.5 hours a week


Monday to Friday- 37.5 hours a week


1. Degree in Business Administration, Commerce, Finance or related field

2. Minimum of five years work experience in a related field, preferably including procurement experience in a large, complex organization

3. Demonstrated leadership ability and strong interpersonal skills

4. Demonstrated ability to expedite the decision-making process using value analysis techniques

5. Demonstrated excellence in communication, team building, and the ability to initiate and model positive change

6. PC proficiency and knowledge of spreadsheet, database, project management and word-processing software applications to access/analyze financial data, and to prepare reports and correspondence

7. Excellent skills in work organization and operating under pressure

As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Employee Health Services.

3. Demonstrated leadership ability and strong interpersonal skills

Guidelines for submitting an Application ~ UNION staff, who choose to submit their application through hard-copy mail, fax or email will need to have their application (ONA & OPSEU: with accompanying skills profile) available to the Recruitment Staff before 4 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.
This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:
Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement
Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement
Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement
Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement
Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Planning Coordinator, Contract (Toronto, ON, CA, L4W 5M3)
description:
Job ID: 209314 
Location Name:ON-FSC Toronto Off (0581)
Address:5560 Explorer Drive, 2nd Floor, Toronto, ONL4W 5M3, Canada (CA)
Job Type:Full Time
Position Type (Regular/Temporary):Contract
Job Function:Logistics/Operations
Is This Position Eligible for Remote? :  

 

At Sephora Canada, we’re passionate about finding and sharing beauty in the world. Our constant innovation, our ability to see and lead trends, and our focus on providing an outstanding customer experience make us the most-loved beauty community and top of mind for every Canadian. We find beauty in our communities, in our differences, our experiences, and in the spirit of our employees.

 

ABOUT THE SUPPLY CHAIN TEAM:

Clients can’t wait to get their hands on our fantastic products. It’s one thing to promise beauty. It’s a whole other thing to deliver it. That’s where our Supply Chain department comes in. It takes planning, analysis and strategy to build brand partnerships, accurately forecast client behaviour and manage inventory levels across our network. Inventory Managers collaborate with operations and logistic experts to deliver beauty to our clients across the country. Our energetic and innovative team continually improves speed and accuracy to deliver on our promise to our clients.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Planning, forecasting, and allocating product are the crucial first steps in the product’s journey to our clients. It takes analytical, strategic, and results-oriented inventory management professionals to build our brand partnerships, forecast client behaviors and optimize inventory levels across our network. Operations and logistics complete the products’ journey into our clients’ hands. Responsibilities include:

  • Review & action In-Stocks to ensure a healthy position for Core & Newness (SKU/Store level). Work in partnership with the Planner to ensure appropriate WOS levels, work with brands on ETA for back instock & communicate to back to leader
  • Track Core & Newness purchase orders to ensure timely receiving of inventory to all Canadian DCs & Stores to meet the business needs. Close purchase orders (POs) on a regular basis to ensure inventory is captured in replenishment
  • Manage and oversee allocations with analytical insights that support sales performance
  • Create manual purchase orders as needed (ie. newness, new stores, adhoc Promotional support POs)
  • Provide visibility to fill rates with planner & brands partners
  • Communicate and elevate late key launches to planner & merchant focused on inventory strategy
  • Ensure timely receiving of inventory for Newness launches, Animation, Promotional events, and communicate any risk to the business
  • Set up newness in JDA/Blue Yonder for accurate purchasing & allocation of inventory
  • Generate reporting on vendor/brand fill rates & lead time accuracy

 

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • You have a Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in business, retail management, or a related field
  • You're technically savvy with advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • You love tackling problems and using your strong analytical skills to find solutions
  • You have a strong aptitude for numbers
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment, and relish in working collaboratively with cross-functional groups.
  • You have strong communication skills and are a flexible team player

 

 

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE:

  • You’ll be part of a unique culture and family of passionate and inspiring individuals.
  • You’ll work alongside the best talent in the industry – people you’ll be proud to work with.
  • You’ll have access to the global community of luxury group LVMH (Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy) for endless career opportunities.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to be part of a community that drives meaningful social and environmental change and receive matching donations to support your charitable giving.
  • Benefits you can mix and match, depending on your needs.
  • Employee Assistance Program services for those times you need extra support.
  • Holidays, time off, summer hours and flexibility to support work-life balance.
  • And of course, there’s our incredible swag – free product gifts throughout the year and tons of discounts with our brand partners.

 

This position requires that the employee be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencing employment and that they agree to obtain any future required boosters or vaccinations as recommended by the government of Canada or the health authorities of the province in which you would be working and in accordance with Sephora Vaccination Policy. If you are not able to obtain a COVID-19 vaccine for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Sephora.


COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

title: Selling Sales Manager
company: Ashley Homestore Canada - The Dufresne Group
description:
Selling Sales Manager Career Opportunity

Ashley HomeStore is currently seeking a Selling Sales Manager for our Winnipeg W store located at 1000 St.James St.

As a Selling Sales Manager you are accountable for the day-to-day management and coaching of the Sales team to effectively execute the Ashley sales approach. You are also responsible for maximizing store sales and profitability by achieving mutually agreed upon targets in key areas and ensuring the delivery of an exceptional guest experience both personally and by your team.

Ashley is committed to investing in our team members; we offer:

  • Industry leading earning potential with performance incentive-based pay;
  • Comprehensive benefits plan, educational assistance program and excellent employee discounts;
  • Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Career growth and continuous development;
  • Respectful and family-oriented working environment with strong company values
  • World class training programs;
  • To work at one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies.

As the Selling Sales Manager you will:

  • Set sales goals for each Sales Associate with the Store Manager
  • Meet or exceed established goals both on a personal and team basis.
  • Develop sales plans and strategies with Sales Associates and monitor their progress
  • Train and coach Sales Associates on products, upcoming promotions, selling skills and administration
  • Ensure all guests receive exceptional customer service
  • Motivate sales team to meet or exceed expectations
  • Recruit, hire, train and coach Sales Associates
  • Develop a customer contact follow-up system to maintain & grow a personal customer base.
  • Follow up with all customer contacts made but not closed after the initial visit
  • Shops the competition on a regular basis.  Maintain knowledge of their pricing, programs, products, and service

 As a successful candidate you will have the following:

  • Post-secondary education in business, marketing or related field or combination of education and related experience
  • 5+ years of proven sales experience in a related environment
  • Previous supervisory experience in a team environment
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of MS Office products and ability to learn in-house computer programs
  • Outstanding communication, coaching, and relationship building skills
  • Must be available to work days, evenings and weekends
  • Criminal Record Check required

Plan Your Future With Us!

Apply Now!

Ashley HomeStore welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Procurement Specialist
description:
Summary

Transport Canada is seeking a Junior Procurement Specialist to provide advisory support in the development of a Request for Proposal (RFP) for a contract for the operation and maintenance of the Transport Canada Motor Vehicle Test Centre (MVTC). The successful candidate will act as an RFP writer and be required to write sections of the Statement of Work and Evaluation Criteria to help ensure the Department develops a good quality MVTC RFP and receives compliant bids following the posting period.

Responsibilities

  • Generate and propose revisions to sections of the RFP including, but not limited to:
    • Statement of Work (SOW): commercialization and marketing, site/facility maintenance, general administration, reporting requirements and performance measurements
    • Evaluation criteria for technical requirements
    • RFP: Basis of Payment and supporting payment mechanisms
  • Participate in the development of the MVTC transition contract with the current MVTC operator

Mandatories

  • Hold a valid Reliability Clearance
  • Bilingual (English and French)
  • Hold a valid Covid 19 vaccine certificate to allow for possible onsite work
  • Post-Secondary education
  • 2 + years’ experience as a Procurement Specialist
  • Previous experience working on multi-million dollar and multi-year federal government procurement projects.

Assets

  • Previous experience working on projects related to scientific or laboratory assets
  • Previous experience working on implementing contracts and associated payment structures dealing with commercialization of public assets.
  • Previous experience writing sections of Request for Proposals on commercialization and marketing, and facility maintenance.
