title: Director of Client Account Management
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 105021
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.

What will your typical day look like?

Setting Strategy, Relationships, and Influence

  • The Director of Client Account Management plays a leadership role in strategic planning, managing a large and diverse team and working alongside Chief Client Office (CCO) leadership team to best support our clients and business:
  • Build and nurture the client account management team to ensure the team is providing quality and effective services
  • Help the team develop long-lasting relationships with clients and encourage them to gain a deep understanding of the client's needs, and develop tactics to deliver client service excellence
  • Build relationships with internal stakeholders to best position client account management needs
  • Anticipate and solve problems, and manage internal stakeholders to resolve issues proactively
  • Prepare and execute the annual client account management business plan to drive growth and strategy
  • Work proactively with the LPA team to improve operations and processes to align on annual account planning process
  • Collaborate across CCO business groups to set strategies and proactively suggest areas for improvement
  • Work closely with LPA Managing Partner, Industry Managing Partners, and Chief Client Officer to support the LPA portfolio and represent the CAM team
  • Oversee the development and delivery of management reporting and monitor key performance indicators
  • Synthesize, communicate, and continuously improve the account management process and drive change
  • Monitor and report on economic, industry and competitive developments

Leadership
  • Attract and develop a highly engaged, skilled and sought after team that is client focused and can collaborate with senior executives
  • Contribute to the overall culture and strategy of the team as a national team, that delivers its service with a high degree of distinction.
  • Be a positive influence and enabler of change to be able to adapt the CAM team to address the ever-changing needs of our clients and the external environment
  • Work with internal stakeholders to identify and understand emerging/existing needs and appropriately leverage the broader team to support the growth goals of the LPA portfolio
  • Lead various practice and/or firm wide initiatives to foster integration and collaboration across industries, regions, and businesses
  • Proactively drive innovation and accountability in all aspects of client account management

About the team

Reporting to the Large Priority Accounts (LPA) Managing Partner, the Director is responsible for setting the strategy and orientation of the Client Account Management (CAM) team. This national role is an exciting opportunity to lead a diverse and highly skilled team of client account managers that proactively manage and work alongside Lead Client Service Partners (LCSPs) and account teams on the firm's most complex and critical clients.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

  • Bachelor's degree with Minimum 10 years' relevant experience in a leadership a role
  • Proven experience as a client-focused business advisor with deep analytical and problem-solving skills and an ability to build influential relationships with key stakeholders at all levels
  • Experience in client account management is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in executing a business planning and forecasting process across a national business.
  • Proven ability to coach, lead and motivate a team of professionals in day-to-day execution and forward thinking client service business support in a large complex matrix environment on a national basis
  • Effective leadership, consensus building, conflict resolution, negotiation and team-building skills
  • Strong executive presence and communication skills with an ability to build and maintain relationships and lead others through change.
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment in interpreting firm policies and business strategies
  • Able to work in a fast pace environment

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Manager, Developer, Equity, Strategic Planning, Management, Technology, Finance, Strategy

Apply now "

title: Key Account Manager - Pet Nutrition
description:
The Key Account Manager is accountable for delivering business segment objectives and share of customer volume by delivering sales strategic objectives at the lowest possible cost. They are also responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive customer business plans to deliver annual operating plan within trade investment plan

What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or equivalent.
  • 4+ Years' experience in Sales, Marketing, Category Management for Fast Moving Consumer Good Industries
  • Prior Account Management experience
  • Fluent understanding of CAS forecasting, Nielsen and trade management system

What will be your key responsibilities?

  • Full responsibility for the P&L and implementation of the activity customer's plan, including sales & marketing programs presentation on retailer sites.
  • Manages the trade promotion budget at assigned customers in harmony with Mars policies and procedures and within assigned budgets
  • Develops comprehensive customer business plans to deliver all business segment objectives
  • Provides timely information, category expertise and priorities
  • consolidating and reporting on retail feedback on executional issues and opportunities.
  • Provides their customer with category information and makes recommendations for Category growth.

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
  • Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
  • An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

title: Buyer
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing! If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co. Due to our continued success, we are seeking a Buyer to join our team in Cambridge, ON. 

Here is some of what we have to offer: 

  • Competitive compensation 
  • Paid vacation and an annual bonus 
  • Health, dental and vision insurance 
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan with company match
  • Opportunity for advancement and career growth!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for identifying and procurement of metal products and processing services that the organization requires.
  • Develops solid understanding of the business needs.
  • Participates with commodity leverage within the region to secure best cost.
  • Develops and maintains strong internal and external customer focus.
  • Aligns with regional Procurement Manager in the execution of procurement strategies for Carbon, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, and Indirect commodities for long products.
  • Takes lead in the demand planning process at the branch level for bundled standard items, contracted business and day to day transactional procurement activities.
  • Identify material/service needs of the organization, find service providers who can supply, negotiate prices and arrange for purchase and delivery of the goods.
  • Create, issue and filing of all purchase orders in a timely fashion.
  • Coordinating with sales group on contractual business and corresponding inventory levels.
  • Provide supplier pricing and lead times to sales group on all customer inquiries.
  • Aligns with regional Procurement Manager to deploy metal supply chain practices within the branch and drive improvements, specifically inventory efficiency.
  • Takes ownership for the inventory performance in the branch.
  • Provides Procurement and Supply Chain Leadership and guidance to sales group.
  • Maintain all open purchase orders to ensure accuracy and expected delivery dates are kept current.
  • Ensures procurement practices at the local/plant organizations are consistent with enterprise wide procurement practices in terms of execution and processes.
  • Reviews and ensures supply side contracts and inventory replenishment commitments are consistent with business needs, sales forecasts and inventory targets.
  • Provides expediting and logistics support to the branch as it relates to all inbound metal freight.
  • Daily review of branch inventory and open orders.
  • Support Office Administration functions as required

 

EDUCATION:

  • High School diploma required, Supply Chain CSCMP or SCC an asset, or related field or equivalent work experience

EXPERIENCE:

  • 5 or more years of progressive procurement experience or commodity expertise, ideally within metal processing, Mill/Service Center industries.

 

SKILLS:

  • Multi-commodity experience in Carbon Steel, Stainless Steel and or Aluminum preferred
  • Experience with long products an asset but not required
  • Prior experience in buying steel, aluminum commodities directly from Mills, Metal Service Centers will be of significant advantage
  • Proficient in MS Excel and MS Word
  • Experience working with D365 or other ERP systems is preferred
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
  • Understands supply chain concepts as related to inventory management and risk mitigation. Have gained very good understanding of forecasting and replenishment concepts as part of a supply chain organization directly or indirectly.
  • Data driven with strong analytical skills; able to generate a wide range reports and process data that forms the basis for solid decision making
  • Solid understanding of concepts such as cost drivers and cost analysis
  • A proponent of change who can introduce modern procurement concepts and influence people
  • Excellent oral and written communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills
  • Possess the ability to work with minimum supervision
  • Good organization and time management skills as well as the ability to meet deadlines

title: Corporate Sales Manager | Budweiser Gardens
description:
Overview:

Overview:

The Corporate Partnership Sales Manager is primarily responsible for generating new business revenue with local, regional, and national companies through the sale of integrated sponsorship packages ofâ€¨the Budweiser Gardens and London Knights Hockey Club assets. The Corporate Partnership Sales Manager will sell fully integrated marketing, media and promotional programs that include marketing rights, on-premise signage, game sponsorships, promotions, event marketing, media exposure and select premium seating elements.

Responsibilities:

Duties:

  • Work with the Director of Partnerships & Premium Seating to implement the goals,  objectives, policies, and priorities of all corporate sales programs and  activities
  • Prospect, sell, activate,  and maintain corporate sponsorships, advertising and premium seating partnerships for the venue, and special events
  • Regularly engaged in the business of making sales, and presentations away from the primary place of business
  • Design sales proposals and presentations for potential corporate partners
  • Prepare advertising, sponsorship and premium seating contracts and addenda; identify issues with contract language; address issues with and make recommendations for resolution; negotiate corporate sales pricing and other rates as required
  • Achieve corporate partnership revenue goals and budgets
  • Work with London Knights Hockey Club team to coordinate the fulfillment of all aspects of contractual obligations including tickets, signage and other branding and promotions
  • Meet with corporate  partners and outside agencies at their place of work to get all branding created and placed in a timely manner
  • Interact in a professional manner with senior level management and ownership
  • Oversee the service of corporate partnerships through various means including direct contact, newsletters, partner gatherings and client entertainment events
  • Identify key open categories and new categories as prospective new business leads
  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
  • Renew and grow existing corporate sponsorship through continued outstanding service and up selling of additional sponsorship assets into current partnership agreement
  • Track prospecting, sales, and inventory, and manage sales reports
  • Manage corporate sales and select premium seating inventory in a fiscally responsible manner
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in advertising or sports sponsorship/arena sales
  • Experience in the London and surrounding marketplaces preferred
  • Proven track record of generating new business and retaining clients
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in sales, public relations, business administration, hospitality management, or other related field
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to spend time on the road conducting sales pitches to new prospective clients
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and holidays is required
  • Outstanding communication skills are essential for interactions with clients, operational leaders â€¨and other senior executives.

 

 

Vaccination Statement:

We are committed to ensuring all our buildings and office locations are the safest in the world for artists, teams, employees, and fans. Based on recent encouraging trends in the U.S. and Canada. We highly encourage our employees to continue to get vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19.    Should circumstances change, we may need to reinstate vaccination requirements, in whole or in part, to safeguard the health of our employees, guests, performers, athletes, and partners.

EEO:

Oak View Group is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis (â€œprotected classâ€) including, but not limited to veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

title: Procurement Analyst
description:
About the Company

For over 35 years, Array has been a leader in the retail display and in-store merchandising services industry; we work with top brands like EstÃ©e Lauder, Sephora, Ulta Beauty, and Lâ€™OrÃ©al, to name just a few. We bring brands to life by creating great retail experiences.

We are leveraging our deep industry knowledge and design innovation, we continue to accelerate our position as an industry leader, grow globally, and pivot to better serve our customers. 

With over 1,800 employees (globally), our teams are composed of critical thinkers who are data-driven, innovators and builders with a strong work ethic, and customer-focused visionaries. Joining us now is a chance to make a mark on our business and your career.

Who we need

Reporting to the Director - Sourcing & Procurement,  we are adding a Procurement Analyst to our team in Toronto. You will support the branch Category Manager in creating and executing category improvement strategies and all procurement activities. This will involve taking a deeply analytical approach to carrying out market research and providing reliable data to inform procurement decision-making.

What our new Procurement Analyst will do:

  • Conduct and compile market research. You will thoroughly research the market, analyze your findings and compile this data into reports that will build a database of actionable market intelligence for the procurement team.
  • Support the category managerâ€™s procurement and sourcing efforts. You will assist category managers in identifying new suppliers to include in RFPs, help in contract development, aid in supplier negotiations and prepare purchasing order requests as needed. You will also identify future sourcing opportunities and find new, better products for the company.
  • Support category improvement efforts. You will aid in the development and implementation of category cost-cutting initiatives, performing cost-avoidance tracking to monitor success. You will also identify new technologies that improve the procurement process.
  • Provide customer support. You will work with internal customers to determine product requirements and specifications, develop a scope of work and help them prepare bid documents for RFPs.

The skills you bring:

  • The education and experience. You have a Bachelorâ€™s degree in either Accounting, Finance or Business. Additionally, you have 1 to 3 years of experience in procurement or sales background.  
  • The technical skills. You have a strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly the manipulation of data in Excel and the use of macros and queries. 
  • The interpersonal skills. You thrive in a collaborative environment and can build working relationships with your colleagues for the achievement of company objectives and with external partners of the company to increase customer success. 
  • The analytical mindset. You have a curious mind and a drive to find answers through a detailed examination of data.

Arrayâ€™s Values:

  • Relationships
  • Agility 
  • Creativity
  • Integrity 
  • Quality

Join us

If you feel you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, and Array sounds like a place you want to be part of and grow your career, apply now. We can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience.

Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment

Array is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. title: Buyer II
description:
Job Reference #: 38062

Company Overview

Do you want to work with one of Canadaâ€™s top O&G companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!

Our well established Oil and Gas client is seeking a Buyer II in Calgary, AB. 

What's in it for you?

  • Work with one of Canada's "Top 100 Employers," with possibility of extension or permanent placement.
  • 1 year term
  • Work Location: Calgary
  • Competitive Compensation and Benefits.
  • Representation by an award-winning staffing agency that takes pride in our personalized approach to staffing, ensuring you are a valued member of the team - not just a number.

MAIN FUNCTIONS

Purchases spot equipment, materials, chemicals/catalysts, and service requirements for multiple business lines. This position would typically include senior Buyer with extensive prior experience. Generally this person would be able to provide training and mentoring to junior Buyers.

TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Processes a queue of requisitions and converts to purchase orders on a daily basis.
  • Collects written proposals from vendors as needed.
  • Conducts simple negotiations of pricing and general terms & conditions.
  • Addresses invoice discrepancies from the purchase order or the goods receipt and approves invoice payment for any additional freight costs not accounted for on purchase order.
  • Liaises with the strategic buyer regarding project or turnaround purchases and potential bundles
  • Provides support to ensure timely invoice payment.
  • Handles any PO (purchase order) maintenance for orders processed (e.g. update PO text, update delivery date, etc.)

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

  • Behavioral Skills: adapts, analytical, collaborates, communicates effectively, focus on customers.
  • Functional Skills: PtP (Procure-to-Pay) knowledge, system utilization & efficiency, total system cost, apply controls mindset, application of business & procurement technical knowledge, service excellence, contract development, contract management, negotiating and influencing, relationship management.

CLOSES AS SOON AS A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED - APPLY ASAP

Kindly submit your resume in Word format and ensure your work history includes the Month/Year for every employer.  

**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**

Looking for more opportunities? Check out our website at www.spiritomega.org

Don't see a posting that suits you? Apply to our "General Application" and our recruiters will get in touch when they have a job that fits you!

Follow us "Spirit Omega" on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter for all our new postings.

title: Sales Director/Advisor (Fully Remote)
description:
New Home Development helps make our communities vibrant.  Avesdo supports the leading builders across our nation, and provides them with technology and services that manage the entire purchaser relationship lifecycle from the first expression of interest through the purchaser moving into their new home. As we continue to expand our offering and coverage, we are looking to grow our team of highly experienced Advisors to the leading new home developers in Ontario.  

Youâ€™ve long realized that technology can provide a far more effective purchaser experience than in the past, and that the right mix of this with meaningful and experienced advisory services can drive truly efficient business operations.  Youâ€™re now looking to expand your impact on the real estate industry by becoming a leader of leaders. 

As an Avesdo Sales Director and Advisor, you are someone who leads the conversation and takes initiative to explore new frontiers. You are passionate about how technology can transform the new home buying process, and have successfully persuaded and advocated for change with new home construction industry decision-makers in Ontario. Letâ€™s chat now to explore how you can make your mark on a trillion-dollar real estate industry!

Job Status: Full-Time

Location: 100% Remote Work

Who are we looking for?

  • You have proven credibility with real estate business executives and you enliven, engage, and positively impact them because you know that sales are not just transactions. Youâ€™re a true relationship builder
  • You understand new home development and are able to react quickly and motivate others to adapt to the changing organizational environment
  • You have led multiple new home development projects from inception through to completion and actively contributed to the strategy and execution of the sales process
  • You are a stimulating communicator with a persuasive â€œsellingâ€ style, driving toward results by enrolling the commitment and buy-in of others 
  • You are comfortable and confident using technology as an integral part of the sales process (we use HubSpot, for example)
  • You love to engage with people that you have not previously met to establish and nurture trust-based relationships 
  • You are a â€œhunterâ€ with proven experience. Self-motivated and able to craft and manage sophisticated business relationships,  you donâ€™t shy away from risk
  • You love variety, managing multiple priorities simultaneously with a sense of urgency for goal achievement and you thrive in a fast-paced environment

What you'll do?

  • Become an internal and external thought leader on new home development business challenges, and the growing potential of Avesdoâ€™s technology-enabled services to address them
  • Manage transactions from origination, including prospecting, qualifying, structuring and closing deals, as well as ensuring successful outcomes per discovery and strategy formulation activities
  • Establish relationships with senior executives in the new home development community, and manage a pipeline of new home projects with assigned customers and prospects 
  • Conduct discovery activities to determine key business drivers and outcomes within customer and prospect accounts
  • Evaluate and isolate the risk associated with each deal under current market conditions, and collaborate with all levels of the decision-making process to  overcome challenges and make recommendations regarding pricing, project structure and implementation
  • Meet and exceed your growth targets

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

  • It's official, we are Great Place To Work-Certified. You will enjoy a flexible work environment, unlimited vacation, competitive Base salary variable commission, a benefits package including health, dental and vision care, home office improvement stipend and more.
  • Personal Growth: Be a leader among leaders in an exciting company that is improving new-home development daily. You will also have the opportunity to learn new things, have a front-row seat to a rapidly evolving environment, grow professionally and have the chance to make your mark on a trillion-dollar real estate industry.
  • Great Culture: We all work hard, so to help keep things fun and stress-free for our fully-remote company, we have a number of weekly team engagement activities including our Thursday afternoon virtual board game sessions, Wellness Sessions (meditation, midday stretches, spring step challenge), weekly town hall meetings and so much more.
  • Hyper-Growth: Avesdo is growing exponentially; you'll be joining at an exciting time where your contributions matter every day!

title: Service Manager
description:
Requisition Number: 113757

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Service Manager to directly manage our customer facing Service team. Responsibilities include hiring and performance management; managing the overall performance of a team; providing leadership by fostering a safe working environment; successful resolution of customer related issues; training a team on effective sales techniques; performing goodwill of customers at the customer site while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction; achieving sales, profit, inventory and payroll goals; managing a budget and dealing with operational issues that affect service. Hands-on support of direct reports includes accompanying our service representatives or visiting customers alone when necessary, to assist in the pick-up and delivery of products or services; driving a company-owned vehicle to and from customer locations; lifting, carrying and walking Cintas products in and out of customer accounts while maintaining world-class service and goodwill to customers; performing managerial duties.

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • The ability to meet the physical requirements of the position
  • High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree preferred

Qualified candidates must meet all Provincial requirements for driving a regulated vehicle weighing more than 10,000 lbs. In order to comply with Provincial requirements, qualified candidates must, prior to their first day of employment:

  • Possess a valid driver's license in good standing

 

Preferred

  • Management experience
  • Experience in industrial sales or customer service

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Service 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

title: Senior Manager, Account Services
description:
Job Title: Senior Manager, Account Services

Position Level: Senior Manager

Employment Status: Full Time - Salaried

Service Area: Greater Toronto Area

Job Summary:

The Senior Manager, Account Services (Sr ASM) acts as an Ambassador for Regal Security Inc. (hereafter â€œRegalâ€) by ensuring Regalâ€™s security programs deliver excellent service client satisfaction. The successful candidate will be the strategic direct lead on a portfolio of Regal service accounts, while overseeing other Account Service Managerâ€™s (ASM)and their portfolios in the Greater Toronto Area.

This will involve delivering Regal's "Your Peace of Mind" level of service to our clients at all times through management of the ASM team. The ASM is the primary oversight and support of our employees and ensuring they are securing the property, providing customer service and deterring any criminal or unwanted activities.

Through consistent application of best practices, this role requires recruiting, coaching, training, disciplining and managing personnel issues for assigned staff at site and ASMâ€™s in the branch office and performing administrative functions according to Regalâ€™s policy and procedures to maintain accurate and up-to-date client records.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee and be responsible for daily security operations at all sites in assigned portfolio and branch office staff;
  • Oversight and management of Account Service Managers in the GTA;
  • Maintain accurate up-to-date client files according to Regalâ€™s policies and procedures and notify other Regal Departments requirements / changes / adjustments as may be required;
  • Coordinate with all Regal Service and Operations teams to ensure proper execution of security contract programs;
  • Establish and maintain a positive relationship with all clients in assigned portfolio and establish protocols to meet client SLA and KPI requirements;
  • Review and ensure security protocols and infrastructure are up to date and all staff are familiar with contents. Make recommendations for improvements for client;
  • Set-up and maintain efficient and accurate Timegate Patrols/Inspections inclusive of staffing assignments in Timegate. Coordinate recipients of those reports with the Site Supervisor/Security Director/Property Manager
  • Assist in the maintenance of accurate employee records for on-site training programs as may be approved or warranted for the site;
  • Ensure all assigned staff are following Regal policy & procedures, ie clocking in/out of Timegate etc.
  • Ensure contract compliance is implemented at all sites inclusive of invoicing, training, supervision, post order updating, site/client visit frequency, etc.;
  • Assist with training and/or coordinating site training for assigned staff and arranging (with Scheduling/Training as required) specialty or upgrade training for any systems and or policy/procedures at assigned site;
  • Provide after-hours support to site staff, mobile or scheduling as may be required by being available via Regal assigned cell phone 24 hours per day/7 days per week;
  • Assess and minimize any areas where loss or liability may be put towards the client or Regal;
  • Resolve any client and or employee concerns in an effective and efficient manner; Ensure response to all client requests and complaints in a timely manner;
  • Organize and attend site staff meetings as may be required from time-to-time;
  • Review and ensure Site Protocols binder(s) are up-to-date with clear and concise understanding of commercial/residential building operations and commercial/residential Emergency Preparedness;
  • Document interactions with client accounts and employees;
  • Oversee and/or complete reports related to alarms/emergency situations and coordinate with site staff and/or Property Manager any further actions required based on situation, facts known and position limitations;
  • Complete daily, weekly and/or monthly reports as assigned by VP Operations;
  • Actively participate in Employee Performance Management inclusive of performance review(s), progressive discipline and employee coaching;
  • Assist in developing and implementing processes and/or procedures to improve operational efficiency/effectiveness at assigned sites;
  • Participate in site meetings with Property Management/Board of Directors and various Regal interdepartmental meetings to help resolve issues and ensure service meets operational excellence levels.
  • Attend industry related functions as approved by Head Office from time-to-time.
  • Assist with the set-up of new sites (contracts) including the implementation of patrol/ inspection software, protocol binders, clock-in/clock-out software, etc.;
  • Work to diffuse volatile/inflammatory situations and actively participate in handling personnel issues that may occur from time-to-time at a site;
  • Perform duties of assigned staff as may be required from time-to-time at a site as may be required due to pre-arranged circumstances or emergencies as they arise;
  • Negotiate contract renewals 90 to 120 days of contract expiry;
  • Ensure any opportunities for growth of business is brought to the Business Development team;
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • A proven background of 5 years experience in managing a portfolio of accounts in the commercial high rise and retail security setting;
  • Great verbal and written communication and presentation skills;
  • Demonstrated strong proficiency in negotiation skills;
  • Proven excellent customer service and conflict resolution skills;
  • Must hold a full clean driverâ€™s license and use own vehicle to perform work at head office, client sites, and other business travels

 

The Ideal Candidate will possess:

  • A university degree in business or equivalent qualification is recommended;
  • Valid Security License, Valid First Aid / CPR Certification, & WHMIS Certification;
  • Strong organizational skills in order to manage multiple tasks concurrently;
  • Strong investigation, research and strategic analytical skills;
  • Strong administration, project management, and multi-tasking skills;
  • Adapts well to challenges and works well under pressure;
  • Business to Business sales experience
  • Computer literacy and proficiency required, with good working skills in Apple products, Microsoft Office and Google

 

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary package to be discussed with successful candidate;
  • Vehicle Allowance;
  • Comprehensive medical benefits plan;
  • Company issued laptop and cellular phone

 

#INDREGAL

title: Service Manager
description:
Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse, Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group!  We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today.  Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

 

Letâ€™s talk about the Service Manager Position!

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Support and involve yourself with a high energy, passionate team 
  • Handle difficult situations and tackle them with the tools that we provide or that you choose to bring to the table
  • Table touching, ensuring all guests are receiving that â€˜wowâ€™ experience
  • Lead, coach, and mentor your team to embrace the Canadian Brewhouse values and culture
  • Working closely with your Assistant and General Manager to ensure all ordering and tasks are completed to successfully run the store
  • Support yourself and your team to grow to their full potential within our company!

What do you need?

  • Passion for people - experience in a supervisor role is necessary, food industry is a perk!
  • Willingness to learn and expand your knowledge, as well as grow as an individual
  • Dedication to learning a large database of many Brewhouse procedures - including food, drinks, policies, training programs, values, processes, the list goes on!
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively
  • Ambition and drive to create the best experience for your team and guests
  • A drive to find solutions rather than point out problems
  • Flexibility to work long hours (Days and/or Nights)

Benefits to Joining Our Team:

  • A company Health Spend Account after 3 months
  • A staff discount that we extend to your friends and family - show off your workplace, our house is your house!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about. 
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart.  Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew

â€‹

title: Client Success Lead
description:
Do you have a solutions-driven mindset and an uncanny ability for customer satisfaction? Enkel wants a Client Success Lead, like YOU, to join our growing Vancouver team!  

 About You 

As Enkelâ€™s Client Success Lead, you will liaise and collaborate with our delivery team to exceed client expectations in every interaction and with every service delivered. You will lead with compassion and unmatched problem-solving skills to optimize processes and resolve escalated client issues. With a positive attitude, a passion for customer experience, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves, you will be essential to driving a new wave of accounting and delivering cloud-based solutions to diverse for-profit and non-profit clients. 

A Day in the Life 

  • Collaborate with Enkelâ€™s Accounting and Client Success Teams to analyze client feedback and enhance service delivery and processes. 
  • Own the client success experience from initial query to the resolution of escalated customer issues while leading with understanding and diligence.  
  • Foster a positive client experience by being proactive and transparent with communication regarding timelines, deliverables, and status updates to avoid surprise and ambiguity. 
  • Determine the appropriate resources, team members, and technical queries that must be made to resolve client concerns in a timely manner. 
  • Provide Enkelâ€™s clients with daily and weekly email support to answer routine inquiries and assign queries to the appropriate delivery team members. 
  • Regularly follow up with clients on resolution updates and outstanding inputs needed for the monthly financial close. 

Requirements & Qualifications  

  • 1 years of experience owning your role in Customer Support or Client Success in a service-driven work environment.  
  • Proven work history working with a ticket management system to identify client issues and initiate corrective action.  
  • Technically versed in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, and Slack with a passion for technology and learning new systems.  
  • A client-centric and solutions-driven contributor passionate about optimizing client success and exceeding client expectations.  
  • Outstanding emotional intelligence and analytical ability to de-escalate client concerns with compassion, attention, and care.  
  • Exceptional communication and time-management abilities to prioritize competing tasks and thrive in fast-paced work environments. 

Nice to Haves 

  • A basic understanding of accounting processes and cloud-based tools is considered an asset. 

Why Enkel  

Enkel understands how integral our teamâ€™s meaningful contributions and unmatched expertise are to achieving our ambitious goals. As a new member of Enkelâ€™s team, you can expect:  

  • Competitive compensation package and commission structure to reward your hard work.  
  • Employer-paid health and dental benefits to value the well-being of you and your family.  
  • Generous paid time off with 15 vacation days and 5 flex days to prioritize work-life balance.  
  • Collaborative and tight-knit work culture coupled with social gatherings and company events.  
  • Career development and growth opportunities to realize your personal/professional goals.  

About Enkel  

We started Enkel to disrupt the delivery of accounting services through the use of transformational cloud-based accounting technology. Today we provide managed accounting and reporting services to over 200 Canadian businesses and Not-for-Profit organizations. Enkel is well-capitalized and will be expanding its presence across Canada with the goal of becoming Canadaâ€™s most trusted Accounting-As-A-Service provider.  

We are committed to helping our clients build better organizations by providing them with quality, tech-enabled accounting services. You will find that we are entrepreneurial in our approach to growth. We move at a fast pace, and we donâ€™t believe in accepting the status quo.â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

For this opportunity, we are looking for a candidate located in the greater Vancouver area! Training will be delivered in person with the option for remote, hybrid, or in-office work afterward. Unfortunately, any applicants located outside of Canada or without a valid Canadian working permit will not be considered.  
 
If you are looking to join an innovative, cloud-based accounting firm, we want to hear from you. Click â€œApplyâ€ and submit a resume TODAY!

Powered by JazzHR

title: Channel Sales Manager - West Canada
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Who We Are
At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Designed with simplicity in mind, we currently offer five product lines (video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms and visitor management), which provide seamless visibility through an integrated secure cloud-based software platform. Over 9,700+ organizations worldwide trust Verkada as their physical security layer for easier management, frictionless scalability and cutting-edge innovation. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.



Verkada is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to be a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is support for members and allies of our internal communities like Women at Verkada, Pride at Verkada, Multicultural at Verkada and Parents at Verkada.</section>

title: Contracts Specialist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Long View. A career that helps you get more out of life. 

A Long View career helps you get more out of life. We don’t just say it, we prove it. Every day. We’re proud of our reputation as one of North America’s most dynamic IT providers — and we’re even prouder of our culture that allows our people to live life to its fullest. At Long View, we create an environment of collaboration and support, of innovation and enthusiasm, of inclusion and belonging. As a member of the Long View team, you’ll see how our company’s core pillars — Integrity, Competence, Value, and Fun — resonate through the workplace. And in a recent survey, 92% of Long View team members rated Long View as a good or great place to work!

Are you passionate about providing contract support and solutions to customers and want to work for a company that believes in Integrity, Competence, Value and Fun? 

We are looking for a dynamic and proactive Contracts Specialist. This role based out of Calgary Branch at client site. You will liaise with our Sales team, Procurement team and clients to identify, create, and review contracts.




Want to learn more about our culture and life at Long View? Check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram!

Long View’s mission of building the best and most sustainable team-driven organization requires dedicated and ambitious people. Through employee resource groups, impactful and effective conversations, townhalls and various company-wide training, including how to reduce unconscious bias, we are fostering an inclusive environment. We are committed to taking consistent, positive and lifelong action to be a diverse and equitable workplace because we know that the most effective companies are made up of people with varied identities, experiences and backgrounds.

Long View is an equal opportunity employer. If you have any accommodation requests for your interview or the role, please let your friendly Recruiter know.</section>

title: National Account Manager / Gestionnaire de comptes nationaux
description:
At Brother, welive and breathe the spirit of “at your side” by offering our people careers where they can learn, grow and thrive. And with over 100 years of experience making high-qualityprinters, labellers, scanners, sewing, embroidery, and quilting machines,we’re a rock-solid company with a reputation for being great people delivering a superior customer experience.

Are you a skilled relationship builder? Do you leverage your strong communication skills and ability to effectively influence end-user sales through reseller partners? This could be your chance to join our winning team!

We’re currently looking for a NationalAccount Manager, based of the Greater Toronto Area, who will play a crucial role in managing the direction and growth of our key reseller B2B account base across Canada and National Distribution partners.

What you'd be doing:

Reporting to the Senior Manager B2B Sales, the National Account Manager will possess a high-level understanding of the competitive landscape and market conditions to ensure that Brother is well-positioned to maximize sales and market share within the reseller channel. This role requires exceptional planning, coordination, and internal communication abilities.

Some key responsibilities:

  • Recruit and sell resellers on the value of partnering with Brother
  • Management of key business relationships at all levels including meetings with vendor managers, buyers, marketing managers, business owners, and key decision-makers
  • Develop key relationships with reseller partners to influence end-user sales
  • Creation, presentation, and execution of annual account plans
  • Ongoing evaluation of results relative to key objectives
  • Direct responsibility for the achievement of account sales objectives which require continuous analysis, tracking, and communication of results

What we look for:

  • 5 years of successful IT channel account management or sales experience with proven quota achievement track record
  • Intimate knowledge of the IT channel account management planning and business development process
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Extremely reactive to partner needs
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills (English)
  • Effective presentation skills
  • Passionately drive for results
  • Canada-wide travel 25% of the time to meet partner needs. (Post pandemic)

What you need to know about Brother:

  • Our shared values are Inclusion, Collaboration, Customer Centricity and Social Responsibility
  • We’re an open and honest group of people that foster a challenging spirit in all that we do
  • "At your side" is more than a slogan; it’s our purpose and we do our best to fulfill it every day
  • We’re great people who work hard, play hard and look out for each other because we’re a team – it’s that simple!

What Brother has to offer:

  • We're committed to achieving shared success and we provide opportunities for you to develop through experience, training, and learning via Brother University
  • RRSP program – we match up to 4% base salary per year after your first year of enrollment
  • Insurance package that cares for you as much as we do
  • Wellness subsidy to support your wellness goals
  • Recognition Awards Program: we give and receive kudos through our social recognition program, where you accumulate points towards your preferred reward
  • Friends and Family discount on Brother products saves you, your friends and family money on the things you need

Bring your positive attitude and great personality to Brother today to become our next National Account Manager! #joinbrothercanada #LI-Hybrid

At Brother Canada, we strive to provide an environment where everyone feels valued by respecting individual differences and welcoming diverse life and work styles. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate or make employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Chez Brother, nous incarnons et respirons l’esprit « At your side » en offrant à nos employés des carrières où ils peuvent apprendre, grandir et s’épanouir. Possédant plus de 100 ans d’expérience dans la fabricationd’imprimantes, d’étiqueteuses, de scanners et de machines à coudre, à broder et de courtepointe de qualité supérieure,nous sommes une entreprise solide comme le roc et nous avons la réputation d’être des gens formidables qui offrent une expérience client remarquable.

Êtes-vous doué pour bâtir des relations solides? Tirez-vous profit de vos fortes habiletés en communication et de votre capacité à influencer les décisions d’achats des utilisateurs finaux par l’intermédiaire de partenaires de revente? Si vous avez répondu « oui » à ces questions, c’est peut-être votre chance de vous joindre à notre équipe gagnante!

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un gestionnaire de comptes nationaux, basé dans la région du Grand Toronto, qui jouera un rôle crucial dans la gestion de l’orientation et de la croissance de notre clientèle clé de revendeurs B2B au Canada et de nos partenaires de distribution nationaux.

Voici ce que vous ferez :

Relevant du gestionnaire principal des ventes B2B, le gestionnaire de comptes nationaux met à profit sa compréhension approfondie du paysage concurrentiel et des conditions du marché pour bien positionner Brother sur le marché afin de maximiser les ventes et les parts de marché au sein du réseau de revendeurs. Ce rôle requiert des capacités exceptionnelles de planification, de coordination et de communication.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Recruter et convaincre les revendeurs de la valeur d’un partenariat avec Brother
  • Gérer la relation d’affaires avec les fournisseurs clés à tous les niveaux, notamment en planifiant des rencontres avec les gestionnaires, les acheteurs, les responsables du marketing, les propriétaires et les décideurs clés
  • Développer des relations stratégiques avec les partenaires de revente afin de stimuler les ventes aux utilisateurs finaux
  • Élaborer, présenter et mettre en œuvre des plans annuels pour les comptes clients
  • Évaluer de façon continue les résultats par rapport aux objectifs clés
  • Assumer la responsabilité directe de tout ce qui a trait à l’atteinte des objectifs de vente, ainsi qu’à l’analyse, le suivi et la communication continus des résultats

Qualifications requises pour le poste :

  • 5 ans d’expérience fructueuse en gestion de comptes ou en vente dans le secteur des technologies de l’information, avec des résultats probants en matière d’atteinte des quotas
  • Connaissances approfondies de la planification de gestion de comptes et de processus de développement des affaires dans le secteur des technologies de l’information
  • Excellentes aptitudes en négociation
  • Très grande réactivité aux besoins des partenaires
  • Excellentes aptitudes en communication écrite et verbale (Anglais)
  • Excellentes aptitudes en présentation
  • Personne passionnée par l’atteinte des résultats
  • Disponible pour voyager au Canada pour répondre aux besoins des partenaires (environ 25 % du temps après la pandémie)

Ce que vous devez savoir au sujet de Brother :

  • Nos valeurs communes sont l’inclusion, la collaboration, l’orientation client et la responsabilité sociale
  • Nous sommes un groupe de personnes ouvertes et honnêtes qui cultivent le goût du défi dans tout ce que nous faisons
  • « At your side » est plus qu’un slogan; c’est notre objectif et nous faisons de notre mieux pour l’atteindre chaque jour
  • Nous sommes des gens formidables qui travaillent fort, associent sérieux et plaisir et s’entraident parce que nous sommes une équipe — c’est aussi simple que cela!

Ce que Brother a à offrir :

  • Nous nous engageons à parvenir au succès commun et nous vous offrons des opportunités de vous développer par l’expérience, la formation et l’apprentissage avec l’Université Brother
  • Programme de REER : nous versons une contribution de contrepartie allant jusqu’à 4 % du salaire de base par an après votre première année d’emploi
  • Un ensemble d’assurance qui se soucie de vous autant que nous
  • Une subvention de santé pour vous aider à atteindre vos objectifs
  • Programme de reconnaissance : nous donnons et recevons des félicitations par le biais de notre programme de reconnaissance sociale, dans le cadre duquel vous accumulez des points pour le cadeau de votre choix
  • Des rabais accordés à vous, à vos amis et aux membres de votre famille sur les produits Brother qui vous feront économiser de l’argent sur les articles dont vous avez besoin

Apportez votre attitude positive et votre belle personnalité chez Brother aujourd’hui et devenez notre prochain gestionnaire de comptes nationaux!#brothercanadarecrute

Chez Brother Canada, nous nous efforçons d’offrir un environnement de travail où tous se sentent valorisés en respectant les différences individuelles et en accueillant des styles de vie et de travail variés. Nous sommes un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité des chances. Nous ne faisons aucune discrimination et ne prenons aucune décision d’embauche fondée sur la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, le handicap, ni toute autre caractéristique protégée.

title: Procurement Coordinator
description:
Overview:

At Noble, we help our customersâ€™ businesses succeed by investing in our most important asset: our teammates!

 

Enjoy a rewarding career at our Head Office as a Procurement Coordinator! We are in business to help our customers succeed!

 

The Procurement Coordinator will be responsible for the management of volume rebates from the comparison of contracts to reconciliation and collections.   The candidate should enjoy working autonomously and be open to learning.

 

When you join Team Noble, success is in store for you too. So ask yourself: Are you Team Noble?

 

    What We Offer You:

  • Internal growth opportunities
  • Access to training and development programs
  • Comprehensive benefits package:
    • Medical & Dental coverage
    • Pension and RRSP contribution opportunities
    • Additional insurance coverage
  • Become a part of the close-knit Noble family!
Responsibilities:
  • Review rebate contracts, source approvals and record for tracking income
  • Prepare forecast, analyze for accuracy and review with procurement leaders
  • Provide GL coding to the accounting department for payments
  • Monthly reconciliation of rebate accounts for finance
  • Seasonal tasks â€“ update internal buying guide, issue invoices for services and update prepaid rebates
  • Maintain the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) software
  • Cross training on issuing pricing credits
  • Assist with Pricing and Product File department tasks as assigned
Qualifications:

Must Haves

  • Post secondary education, preferably in a related field
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including advanced Excel skills
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to convey messages in an organized, clear, and effective manner
  • Strong attention to detail, with a penchant for finding and implementing efficiencies in daily tasks
  • Well organized, with the ability to multitask and manage time effectively
  • A personal drive for growth and learning

Nice to Haves

  • Previous experience or exposure to Cognos or other related data intelligence software
  • Previous experience with ERP systems
Who We Are:

From our beginning as a plumbing supplier, Noble has grown to serve the trade in HVAC, Hydronics, Industrial, and Fire Protection. From construction through to maintenance and renovation, we offer an incredible assortment of leading brands.

While weâ€™ve grown and continue to expand, one thing about Noble that hasnâ€™t changed is our commitment to delivering the best service in our industry.

Today, we still judge our success by our customersâ€™ successes. Thatâ€™s why our teammates are passionate about providing exceptional customer experiences and delivering the best value-added service in the business.

When you join Team Noble, success is in store for you, too!

As a Noble teammate you have the opportunity to develop the knowledge and skills consistent with our business. We provide the resources, training, and opportunities to thrive.

title: Sales Manager
description:
*HIRING IMMEDIATELY FOR A SALES MANAGER FOR OUR GROWING EXTERIOR CLEANING BUSINESS*    We are a growing company that believes in treating our Sales Team right.  If you are an energetic salesperson who wants to help us continue to grow our business we want to hear from you!  No experience is needed for this sales position.  We will train you to be a successful sales manager!

The sales manager would be responsible for providing estimates that come up and finding outside leads. We have support staff and great lead generation to keep the schedule full for them.  Are you interested in a professional, positive work environment?  If you answered yes, than this Sales Manager job may be what you are looking for.

If you are looking for a career and not just another sales job we may be a good fit for you.   

Compensation For Our Sales Team:

  • There will be a starting salary of 12% commission with a guaranteed minimum and 15% for outside lead commission
  • Weekly pay will be around $1,296
  • Company car
  • Health benefits
  • Flexible schedule 

Sales Management Efforts:

  • Grow your territory through your sales efforts 
  • Sales Management as we help you grow your territory
  • You'll eventually be responsible for the operations and results of your territory

Sales Efforts:

  • Following up on 20-30 leads a week generated by our marketing efforts
  • Meeting with mostly residential clients to provide estimates and follow up on service
  • Following processes for generating customer referrals
  • Generate your own leads using our sales processes and following up on those leads

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) at Bombardier Aviation is at the front-line of our sales pipeline. They are responsible for crafting the strategies for establishing contact with new prospects, along with supporting the renewal process for existing customers. They work in tandem with the new aircraft Sales team to ensure full alignment on outreach and to catalyze lead conversions.

This position can be based in Montréal (Canada) or Europe (under certain conditions).

In your role, you will:

  • Develop and execute Bombardier Aviation’s lead generation and business development initiatives.
  • Manage a large pipeline of leads (e.g. ultra-high-net-worth individuals, major worldwide corporation executives, etc.) provided to you by the backend Lead Generation team with a focus on maximizing conversions and minimizing cycle times.
  • Forge strong relationships with your region’s Business Aircraft Sales Directors (SDs) through frequent touchpoints and systematic follow-ups.
  • Work hand-in-hand with your SDs to validate strategies, align outreach initiatives, hand-off qualified sales leads, and support end-to-end pipeline governance.
  • Create strategies for identifying, qualifying and contacting new prospects with a goal of increasing Bombardier’s market share and order intake.
  • Develop content for and execute first line and follow-up outreach to identified prospects through multiple channels including direct mail (physical & digital), cold calling, and in-person events (face-to-face interactions).
  • Support the on-going validation and review of existing database contacts.
  • Gain extensive knowledge of the assigned region through both in-depth research (e.g. database reviews, regional publications, web research, sales director interviews, etc.) and in-region intelligence gathering.
  • Provide support to the back-end lead generation research team through targeted guidance, discussion of upcoming strategies, and dissemination of feedback from SDs & prospects.
  • Document and track all initiatives and progress of activities through our CRM platform (Salesforce), along with the support of any other Lead Generation internal governance requirements.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You hold, at a minimum, a Bachelor-level University education;
  • You have, at a minimum, 5+ years related experience in a field such as direct marketing, sales, consulting, etc.;
  • You demonstrate excellent communication, presentation, networking and 1-to-1 relationship building skills;
  • You can manage customer/prospect interactions at any level of an organization (e.g. from aircraft operations personnel to top C-Suite/UHNW individuals);
  • You have a strength at building business development strategies for customers/prospects
  • You have knowledge of any/all of the following areas – business aviation, sales, business development, direct marketing, market research;
  • You have an ability to work in a fast-pace and dynamic environment;
  • You are a motivated self-starter who can meet-or-exceed both self-imposed standards of excellence and high-level productivity and output expectations;
  • You are comfortable leveraging multiple communication and social channels (e.g. telephone, email, LinkedIn, events, etc.) to make connections and start conversations with people;
  • You possess problem solving skills developed within a strategy team, consulting or sales/marketing team (distinct asset);
  • You have direct selling experience in targeting key clients (an asset);
  • You are flexible to work off-hours and travel worldwide on company business - sometimes at very short notice - as required by the role;
  • You demonstrate strong computer skills (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel);
  • You have prior experience with Salesforce (an asset)
  • You master the English language (spoken & written) – Additional language(s) an asset

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Senior Buyer - North America
description:
Location: Mississauga – Head Office

Reports to: Supply Chain Manager

Summary:

Marathon Hardware has 6 locations across Canada and we proudly distribute thousands of innovative products throughout North America. Our products range from decorative hardware, hinges & opening systems, drawers & slides, and kitchen storage accessories. Our roots have been firmly planted in Canada for 30 years. We source products from around the world to find new and innovative solutions to enhance our customer projects. Our people are our core, and our customers are our focus. We take pride in both our team and ability to serve our customers with the utmost professionalism and personability.

We are currently seeking a Senior Buyer to join our Supply Chain team. Reporting directly to the Supply Chain Manager this individual will be responsible for the full cycle purchase order activity across all six Branches in Canada. This individual will create and maintain strong relationships with vendors, and assist with inventory transfers, and any transactional records pertaining to inventory across our branches.

Responsibilities

Purchasing

  • Manage the full lifecycle of purchase order activity in ERP (Epicor Prophet21).
  • Place Purchase Orders with vendors in North America.
  • Follow up with suppliers and expedite shipments where required and ensure purchase orders are on schedule.
  • Set up and maintain stock and supplier records.
  • Receive all purchasing related documentation, verify Invoices, and match supplier Order Confirmations.
  • Review invoices for final payment.
  • Seek out efficiencies and cost savings in the procurement of goods
  • Report increases or changes in lead time to team.
  • Update the system in a timely manner with accurate ETA for each purchase order.
  • Account and add freight cost for required shipments in the inventory system for non prepaid shipments.
  • Monitor and negotiate price increases & reductions, update inventory system, and communicate changes as necessary.
  • Consistently check inventory levels in order to ensure proper stock levels.
  • Handle any issues related to supplier service, such as poor product quality, delivery delays, discrepancies, vendor errors, or any other problems as they arise.
  • Follow up RMAs and credit notes with vendors.
  • Update freight cost for inter-branch transfers.
  • Maintain strong relationships with vendors and act as main point of contact.
  • Process received orders in the inventory system once arrived.
  • Maintain shipment files in an organized manner.
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing on promotions and new product releases.
  • Coordinate with warehouse delivery of shipments.
  • Work with various departments to determine the amount and type of goods required.
  • Act as back-up for International Purchasing when required.

Requirements:

  • University degree in related field.
  • Medium level of Microsoft Excel
  • Experience with Epicor is an asset.
  • 3 + years of material purchasing experience for a distribution environment.
  • Experience with procurement within North America.
  • Extremely organized and looks for efficiency improvements in the operation.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skill is essential.
  • Able to connect with many different types of people and adjust approach accordingly is essential.
  • A high level of transparency and integrity
  • Kitchen or Hardware Industry experience preferred

title: Service Manager
description:
Overview:

Fountain Tire Fort McMurray Gregoire (242 Gregoire Dr) is searching for a friendly and knowledgeable  Service Manager  to manage the operations of the service department to drive productivity, quality assurance and to promote a high level of customer satisfaction.

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive  market wages
  • Regular day shifts
  • Great discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and mechanical services
  • Health, Dental and Vision Benefits  for you and your family
  • RRSP matching program
  • The opportunity for growth that includes the potential to enter our management training program and own your own Fountain Tire store!

 As a Service Manager, your duties will include:

  • Overseeing and managing mechanical and tire services  
  • Setting quality standards and maintaining the  quality of all shop  activities
  • Ensuring completion of shop maintenance and repair work
  • Addressing customer complaints and inquiries in a courteous, professional manner
  • Advising technicians  of work that must be completed
  • Ensuring technicians compliance with company standards  regarding  quality, safety, and customer service
  • Managing the morale in the shop by setting and demonstrating a strong business ethic for dealing with employees, suppliers and customers
  • Maintaining the cleanliness of the shop

Our ideal candidate has/is:

  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Service Manager or Service Advisor providing Service Estimation
  • Knowledge of mechanical services
  • Effective leadership skills, with a strong focus on operations and business processes
  • High level of integrity and accountability
  • A customer service focus
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with team members and customers
  • Strong communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Continuously looking to learn and use new skills and the demonstrated ability to recognize opportunities for improvements
  • Flexible, patient, and calm when working with tight schedules

Interested and qualified? Please apply on-line or in-store today.

title: First Responder Sales Manager
description:
Overview:

For more than 100 years, our passionate mission of safety empowers us to protect lives.

 

MSA Safety is a global leader in the development of safety equipment and pioneering technology that helps protect people and facility infrastructures around the world. We are committed to providing the latest in innovative, best-in class safety solutions that feature integrated systems capability and allow our customers to return safely to their families and friends. Every day our customers place their lives in our hands. In response, we provide them with protection they can trust. It is gratifying to lead the way as a source of inspiration. Would you like to join our team of more than 5,000 employees world-wide dedicated to this purpose? We hope so.

 

Weâ€™re looking for a First Responder Sales Manager with strong technical abilities to join our team in Western Canada. In this role, youâ€™ll demonstrate your sales expertise by driving the sales activities of MSAâ€™s self-contained breathing apparatus, portable instruments, Cairns fire helmets, thermal imaging cameras, firefighter turnout gear and boots and more into the British Columbia region. This is a team-selling position within both a well-established and high growth potential area.   If this sounds like an exciting opportunity, then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

Description of duties and responsibilities:

  • Increase sales of MSA first responder-related products with a primary focus toward professional and volunteer municipal fire departments and other first responder related customers.
  • Up to 30% of selling time will be spent training/working with fire service distributors on how to sell all of MSA's product lines focusing 70% of selling time within first responder market.
  • Partner with other team members and channel partners to support â€œin serviceâ€ product training and other new product implementation activities at end user fire departments.
  • Build factory relationships with fire chiefs, fire fighters and various end users.
  • Coordinate/motivate sales and service coverage within distribution network.
  • Report trends/conditions, competitive activity and sales opportunities into a CRM program.

 

Qualifications:

Qualifications:

Special knowledge, skills and abilities required:

  • Demonstrated selling and customer account management skills in firefighter PPE, including solid negotiation skills.
  • Proven track record of understanding customer needs and developing solutions to assure customer satisfaction related to firefighter PPE.
  • Excellent computer skills including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Strong communication skills (written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal).
  • Proven ability to guide, mentor and motivate others, including distributors of firefighter PPE.
  • Proven planning and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to grasp technical product knowledge.
  • Proven success in training.
  • Experience with social media for communication purposes.
  • Ability to work independently and complete tasks with little supervision.
  • Willingness to travel 50% of the time  within the territory.

Education and experience required:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • This position is available at four different career levels based upon experience, education, etc:
    • Level I:  3 years of sales experience.
      Level II: 4 years of sales experience.
    • Level III:   5 years of sales experience.
    • Level IV:   6 years of sales experience.
  • Masterâ€™s degree in related field may be substituted for up to two years of relevant work experience.

Preferred:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in related field or educational academic equivalent (4 years of relevant work experience may be substituted for a Bachelorâ€™s degree).
  • Firefighter turnout gear sales experience including developed relationships with key fire departments in assigned geography.

Other Requirements

  • Individuals employed in this position are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and must submit proof of vaccination prior to starting their employment with MSA as a condition of hire. MSA will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the applicable human rights legislation.
