title: Enterprise Customer Success Manager
description:
Your Mission:

We succeed when our customers succeed. Customer Success is not only a critical function at AfterShip, but a core value of the organization. As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager, you'll be the go-to individual for AfterShip's Enterprise customers and some of the industry's top DTC brands to ensure there's nothing standing in the way of harnessing the full power of AfterShip's solutions. 

Your attention to detail focuses on the customer needs in order to drive rapid customer onboarding and success. You will apply your passion for eCommerce and product expertise to ensure technical fit and seamless execution of our products. This will ultimately improve renewals and overall success while helping to collect customer testimonials, stories, and feedback. 

This is a high-impact position within the growing Customer Success team. You will have the opportunities to create meaningful impact within our organization and, most importantly, for your customers' businesses. 

Responsibilities:

  • Act as the first point of contact for escalated support issues and file tickets with the appropriate teams ensuring the problem is ultimately resolved.
  • Thoroughly understand all aspects of the AfterShip platform in order to explain the technology to all types of users.
  • Be the client's trusted advisor to ensure they get the correct value out of AfterShip.
  • Help eliminate bottlenecks by working cross-functionally with a global team across time zones (Sales, Support, Product, Engineering) in order to ensure customer success.
  • Communicate best practices and new product features to evangelize with customers, as well as  delivering customer feedback to the Product team.
  • Be responsible for Dollar Retention Rate and Customer Retention Rate.

Requirements

  • 2+ years experience in a customer-facing, technical roles in either SaaS, ecommerce, or marketing automation technology 
  • You have strong customer-facing written and verbal communications skills and radiate enthusiasm, poise, confidence, and professionalism
  • Ability to understand and explain technical solutions in layman's term to client (experience with the following is a plus: eCommerce platforms, order management systems, inventory management, WMS, TMS, supply chain, logistics)
  • You can successfully deliver multiple projects simultaneously with meticulous attention to detail
  • You're comfortable in a growth-paced environment that requires strong time management and prioritization skills
  • You have executive level interpersonal, project management, communication, and problem-solving skills
  • You have prior experience with business reports, preferably in the form of QBRs

Why You Should Join Us:

  • We are super proud of our geeky culture, started by our engineer-turned-CEO, and the diversity of the team, cultivated by a group of amazing people from all over the world.
  • You will receive competitive compensation, benefits from day 1, flexible PTO, and all sorts of tools and resources to empower you to do your best work.
  • You're empowered to choose a work environment that works best for you - whether that is home, hybrid, or in the office full-time. Right now, we have WeWork offices in Toronto, Austin, and Barcelona.
  • You will be part of a company that is on an exceptional growth trajectory as we have been routinely doubling our revenue every year since 2014, and secured a funding round of $66 million Series B led by Tiger Global last year. 
  • We have great ambition to make buying and selling easier for everyone in this world -- one of the most exciting spaces for a technology start-up to be in. There is virtually no ceiling for either what you will be doing or learning here, and we want to support you to grow exponentially, along with the company.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Large Enterprise
description:
Company Description

Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation.  Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator).  We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  

The Zscaler Sales Culture

Winning Technology and Products -We offer the best technology and products for the cloud first world. We pioneered cloud security and continue to grow our 70B TAM by releasing new products every year.

Investing in People – A well-funded and world-class Sales Strategy and Enablement Team to help you succeed.  Sales process, practical methods and training to help you ramp faster and close larger deals as companies accelerate their move to the cloud.

Supportive Leadership – An industry leading leadership team with strong values, off the chart business acumen that will help you succeed quickly, while providing mentorship and career growth.

Competitive; We Play to Win – We are playing in a rapidly growing TAM and huge market mega-shifts that leads directly to Zscaler; tracking a growth path similar to Salesforce, Workday, & ServiceNow.

Job Description

  • You will take ownership of an assigned territory focused on net new logo and upsell opportunities, while leveraging customer references such as the CIO of GE*, CTO of Siemens*, and EVP of Microsoft*
  • You will demonstrate expertise in building business cases which clearly show value and differentiation at all levels of your customer / prospect organizations
  • You will benefit from complementary and robust Sales Engineering, Solution Architecture, Value Consulting and Transformation Teams throughout your sales cycles
  • You will constantly generate pipeline using new techniques, tools, joint field marketing initiatives, trade shows and top tier channel partners (VAR, SI & SP)
  • You will win deals through world-class planning and preparation, as well as being consultative in your approach to solving real business problems
Qualifications

  • 2-5 years of experience evangelizing enterprise technology, with particular focus on SaaS and disruptive networking technologies. Security background a plus
  • Consistent track record of over-achievement; net new logo accomplishments; and keen understanding of how to leverage channel partnerships
  • Maniacal focus on excellence in Pipeline Generation & Opportunity Progression; including meticulous planning and preparation
  • Willingness to be coached and the discipline to work a proven sales process from beginning to end
  • Evidence of ‘team sales’ and the ability to use internal resources, partners, and team members to be successful
  • An ‘in the field’ mentality leading you to meet customers & prospects face to face wherever possible


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

#LI-AM6

What You Can Expect From Us:

  • An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including equity

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team. 

Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com. 

Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Regional Sales Manager (FT)
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.
 
Position: Regional Sales Manager in West Coast
Location: West Coast (Remote Position)
Compensation: $120,000 per year + Commissions
Industry: Architectural / Sheet Metal / Lighting / Retail
EmploymentTerm: Full Time/Permanent
 
Roles & Responsibilities:
  • Work with Sales to identify and pursue new business channels (agency reps, specifiers, architects)
  • Regularly visit with Sales Agency’s within regional territory to develop new and existing accounts, educate specifiers 
  • about products and find business opportunities
  • Maintain all aspects of account relationships with our partners
  • Manage, organize, and present product presentations to key businesses
  • Prepare and deliver presentations, proposals, and sales contracts
  • Respond to customers and co-workers promptly to maintain service excellence
  • Establish and maintain current agent and potential client relationships
  • Identify and resolve client concerns with the team
  • Prepare a variety of sales reports, including activity, closings, follow up and adhere to targets
  • Communicate new products and service opportunities with agents and team
  • Coordinate with inside sales staff to accomplish the work required to close sales
  • Develop and implement special sales activities
  • Participate in sales meetings and marketing events such as seminars and trade shows
  • Project quotes – assist in providing quotes, verifying part number accuracy, and providing 
  • completed quote to both internal and external customers
  • Working directly with national accounts to develop bill of materials, suggest products and increase the opportunity to provide additional products.
Qualifications:
  • 3 -5+ years of successful and related sales experience
  • University or College Degree, with a focus on sales/marketing, an asset 
  • Demonstrated proficiency in written and verbal communication, including creating and delivering presentations
  • Customer service oriented; Excellent account management and influencing skills
  • Demonstrated project coordination skills; well organized, attentive to details
  • Goal-oriented, process-driven thinker with exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work both as an individual and in a team environment
  • Proven track record of personal responsibility and accountability
 IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Director of Sales
description:
JOB OVERVIEW:
"Sunrise is the best place that I've ever worked, simply because of the people. We provide quality care in an environment that feels like home. Our focus is doing whatâ€™s right for the resident. For me, thatâ€™s a big breath of fresh air."

- Sunrise Leader
 

 

At Sunrise, our Director of Sales is responsible for building relationships and developing referrals. This is the key to success for this sales leadership opportunity. Keeping a pulse on local market conditions and potential referral sources can impact lead generation.
ABOUT SUNRISE:
Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise.
 
At Sunrise, you willâ€¦

Make a Difference Every Day
We are passionate about our mission â€” to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest.
 

 

Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive Community
The care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best.
 

 

Ignite Your Potential
We believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals.
 
Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work ®
RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS:
 
Responsibilities:
- Nurturing lead sources
- Organizing strategic marketing events on site to promote the Sunrise Story
- Delivering other creative tactics to convert leads to move-ins
- Training new team members as they gain experience on the Sunrise sales team
- Reinforce the communityâ€™s brand reputation and achieve maximum occupancy goals
 

 

Qualifications:
- Demonstrated sales experience in senior living, hotel / hospitality or related healthcare environment preferred (i.e. hospital, skilled nursing, long term care, hospice, CCRC or home health)
- Previous sales experience and successful track record in identifying and building local relationships to drive business
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to facilitate small-group presentations
- Proven ability to effectively handle multiple priorities with exceptional organizational and time management skills
- Excellent customer service and interpersonal communication skills, as well as a deeply ingrained passion for seniors to successfully nurture relationships
- Schedule flexibility to work one weekend day per week (usually a Tuesday-Saturday schedule) as well as some evenings as necessary
- Computer proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, as well as the ability to learn new applications; previous knowledge of a client relationship management tool for tracking leads preferred

 

Sunrise considers the health and safety of its residents, family members, and team members as its highest priorities.   All offers of employment with Sunrise are conditioned on completing and passing a background and drug test, participating in mandatory vaccine programs (e.g., Covid-19), participating in testing requirements (e.g. Covid-19, TB) and using designated PPE when required.  

 

Sunrise Senior Living offers a comprehensive benefits plan to eligible team members including health, dental, vision, retirement benefits, short-term disability, long-term disability, and paid time off.  Team members may also be eligible to receive a bonus based on their position. Some leadership roles are eligible to receive annual bonuses. All team members have the potential to receive spot bonuses and other incentive awards.

title: Purchasing coordinator
description:
Description of responsibilities

on a daily basis you will have:

  • Manage the supplier database.

  • Search for new suppliers.

  • Participate in the definition of supply strategies (SFT) and ensure their deployment throughout 'A project.

  • Apply the tender process and contract administration procedures; Complete the derogations required if necessary.

  • Prepare tender documents according to technical specifications.

  • obtain Proposals, prepare for commercial recommendations and coordinate technical analysis.

  • Ensure the best quality/price ratio for services respecting the established specifications.

  • Coordinate site visits, clarification meetings, starting and coordination meetings when a contract is carried out.

  • Validate, negotiate and limit the additions of work to the initial contract.

  • in the name of the customer, interpret the contractual clauses and take the necessary arrangements to make them respect.

  • Negotiate credits and supplements according to work revisions and issue the necessary purchase requests.

  • negotiate the Various complaints according to non-conformities.

  • Manage delivery times.

skills required

requirements:

  • Training in supply or administration and practical knowledge of the legal and commercial aspects of supply. Diploma of college studies and minimum of two (2) years of relevant experience or any equivalent combination of studies and relevant experience.

  • Knowledge of terms and conditions of conditions 'Supply (Incoterms) and relevant laws.

  • Excellent knowledge of French and written English and writings.

you are the one we are looking for if you have:

  • Skills for negotiation.

  • skills to develop and maintain harmonious relationships with customers and suppliers.

  • concern for respect commitments.

  • capacity to manage several files simultaneously and to account for the results.

  • capacity to work with timelines tight.

  • Knowledge of the industrial environment (petrochemicals, mines and metals, etc.) (asset)

  • experience in the Supply management (asset)

  • Professional association: AGCA, PMI (asset)

+

Our flexible working policy allows us to offer different possibilities to our employees!

GCM Consultants wishes to offer the possibility to its interested employees to work in an environment that suits them according to their needs, that is to say in the office and/or at home. We want to offer interested employees a better work-family-life conciliation by offering a flexible work organization solution.

title: Account director, automation
description:
Do you want to use your creativity in the proposal of customer solutions?

come and meet us, we share the same values! Génik is a company that has been operating for almost 30 years. Founded in Saint-Jérôme, to create jobs in our region, we are a leader in the design and manufacture of tailor-made automated equipment. Our family now has more than 120 geniuses divided into multidisciplinary teams with exceptional talents.

In addition to collaborating on diversified and highly technological projects, you will benefit from a competitive remuneration program, full benefits (insurance and collective RRSP), a telemedicine service, A flexible schedule, telework and more.

Description of the position

you will participate in particular in the development of existing and new customers, while being a partner confidence in identifying their needs. In communication with the sales team and professionals from other services, you will have as the main responsibilities of:

  • Maintain long -term relationships with a group of specific customers;
  • Respond to customer requests and produce submissions;
  • Identify business opportunities and achieve sales objectives;
  • Anticipate customer needs and highlight our Products and services solutions;
  • Negotiate requests for changes;
  • see customer satisfaction throughout projects.

Your qualifications

  • Baccalaureate in mechanical engineering, automated production or equivalent experience
  • more than five (5) years of experience in design and/or Programming of automated equipment
  • minimum of two (2) years of experience for sale in the field
  • Excellent communication and persuasion skills
  • Capacity 'Make Presentations, to succeed in negotiations and to build relations
  • Master of the French language (spoken and written) and good knowledge of English
  • Availability and status required for regional trips and internationally

title: Purchasing Coordinator
description:
The Opportunity

Dessert Holdings is a leading baked goods platform providing premium layer cakes, cheesecakes, brownies, bars, and other desserts to the retail in-store bakery ("ISB") and foodservice channels on a largely private label basis. We are a rapidly growing company comprised of The Original Cakerie (acq. December 2015), Lawler's Foods (acq. July 2016), Atlanta Cheesecake Company (acq. January 2018) and Steven Charles (acq. December 2021). We are poised for continued growth by bringing high quality products to both retail grocery and food service across North America. Led by a senior team with strong company pedigrees and experience driving improvement – we have exciting opportunities to be a part of this high performance, growth focused organization.

Position Mission:  The Purchasing Coordinator is an important part of the supply chain process. This individual contributes to the success of the organization by supporting the procurement organization through consistent management of data and information.  

Responsibilities Include:     

  • Maintain procurement data and documentation in accordance with internal procedures within ERP.
    • Create New Items numbers in ERP by direction of R&D
    • Update Pricing tables by direction of buyers
  • Request and file receiving documentation (COA, BOL) as requested by operations, QA, or warehouse.
  • Execute and follow through of SharePoint requests by direction of buyers
  • Execute the process and follow through of non-conformance reporting to assure submission and the completion of any return of product to suppliers (RMA).
  • Request credits from suppliers as needed. 
  • Report generation to support purchasing department
    • Daily replenishment report to buyers
    • Daily Open PO reporting/Late PO reporting to buyers
    • Schedule change report generation as required (daily)
    • Monthly material usage calculation report
  • Support corporate projects requiring detailed follow-up from procurement
    • SKU rationalization/commercial projects: weekly documentation of inventory & costs
    • Create purchase orders for test materials – requested by R&D
  • Participate and supports projects associated with the supply chain to improve productivity.

Education/Training/Experience:

At least 2 years’ experience of administrative experience, preferably in procurement and/or manufacturing environment.

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Experience with ERP systems and tools.
  • Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Detail oriented
  • Team and service oriented
  • Must possess clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Problem Solver

title: Buyer
description:
Job Description

Buyer

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

Our Mining & Metallurgy Business Unit is currently looking for a Buyer to be part of our team on a permanent full-time position. This role will be based in Toronto, ON.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

Responsibilities:

  • Actively participate in bid clarifications and/or pre-award meetings
  • Expedite completion and delivery of materials to purchase order or contract agreements
  • Expedite completion and issuance of vendor deliverables (drawings, ITP’s) etc. against the dates in the Purchase Agreements
  • Monitor supplier’s progression, engineering, acquisition and manufacturing and reporting status of activities
  • Coordinate with Purchase Agreement suppliers or sub-suppliers on required delivery dates for materials and deliverables
  • Evaluate and report on supplier performance and, if required, assist in selection of suppliers for inclusion in bidders lists
  • Identify problem areas and initiate or recommend corrective action
  • Obtain tracing information for required follow-up
  • Track material requirements for construction
  • Monitor resolution of over short or damage reports
  • Witness shipment transfers
  • Initiate insurance claims as required
  • Support the Buyer in the verification of invoices
  • Attend Kick-off, Weekly and Bi-Weekly meetings

What will you contribute?

Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 5 experience in a similar role within the Resources industry in an EPCM environment
  • Solid knowledge of expediting functions and materials transport administration
  • Exposure to capital and sustaining projects
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Strong computer skills including experience with project management systems
  • Good organizational and planning skills and detail oriented
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Director of Client Services
description:
Do you want to take a leadership position at a growing digital agency and take our client relationship management practice to the next level?

Evolving Web’s Director of Client Services balances client demands with internal planning, ensuring that we deliver high-calibre web design and development services and work collaboratively with clients. You will be responsible for client retention by maintaining senior-level relationships and identifying additional opportunities with existing clients. You’ll oversee the account and project management team. You’ll also manage the risk associated with clients and goals for each account’s financial health, targets and objectives.

As this is a strategic role, you will be part of Evolving Web’s leadership team and collaborate closely with our co-founders to ensure alignment with our values, strategic objectives, and company roadmap.

In this role, you will be expected to:

  • Build best-practice processes and systems to scale up the account and project management teams, enable them to better serve client needs, and increase opportunities for account growth
  • Drive excellence across the agency in our client deliverables, from strategic consultancy through to creative product and execution
  • Oversee client communications and negotiations, provide senior level client management support, and nurture client relationships
  • Manage the account management team, motivating continued excellence in deliverables and client service
  • Lead strategic conversations to establish long-term relationships with clients
  • Take ownership or strategic leadership of selected client accounts
  • Travel on an as-needed basis to grow client relationships, travel will fluctuate with activity and opportunity and at times the requirement will be greater
  • Work closely with finance on financial reporting, planning, and forecasting for individual clients, and across the entire agency
  • Review and analyze estimates, time entry, invoicing, contracts, and profitability on client accounts
  • Contribute to new business RFPs and pitches
  • Sell new service offerings with the goal of creating recurring revenue accounts and identify new growth opportunities for the long-term

What kind of skills set do you need to be successful in your role within the Evolving community?

  • You have 5-10 years of agency experience
  • A proven track record of successfully managing client accounts in the digital space
  • You have an understanding of Evolving Web’s services and how to position them
  • You are an excellent listener and have the ability to understand client needs
  • You have good estimation and negotiation skills
  • You are motivated by managing client relationships and enjoy making presentations
  • You have experience tracking goals and results at the agency level
  • Experience hiring, managing, and developing a team of that is responsible for the day-to-day execution of client accounts
  • Must thrive on building highly effective teams and possess strong people management skills
  • Should be financially disciplined and feel at home working on Excel spreadsheets and internal accounting and forecasting programs
  • You contribute to the culture of the agency and participate in activities that develop a feeling of belonging to it
  • You have excellent communication skills

Bonus for:

  • Excellent spoken and written French
  • Technical or design expertise
  • Knowledge of Drupal, WordPress, and/or mobile development
  • Experience working with institutional clients
What you get:
  • An environment that encourages continuous learning and mentorship
  • A team that’s big enough that you get to work on creative, meaningful projects and small enough that you can take ownership of your work
  • A collaborative, fun, and friendly environment where your input is highly valued
  • Competitive salary, a health insurance package, and a good work-life balance
  • Collaborations with organizations such as Princeton University, the Government of Canada
  • Diverse, multilingual team members from around the world
  • Remote-friendly workplace, with a beautiful office in Old Montreal

title: Merchant Success Manager
description:
About Blackcart

Blackcart’s Try Before You Buy software brings the in-store shopping experience to eCommerce. We integrate into existing eCommerce stores, enabling shoppers to try products at home for free, and only pay for what they decide to keep. Blackcart-powered merchants see 24% higher purchase conversions, 51% higher average order values and 39% higher net sales. We are a rapidly growing start-up, poised to significantly transform the retail industry with our market-leading Try Before You Buy platform. Read about us in TechCrunch!

Blackcart has raised over $10M from a long list of top-tier VCs and has partnered with top eCommerce retailers to grow sales and delight their shoppers. We are growing our team so we can continue to optimize the online shopping experience!

About the Role

We are looking for a Merchant Success Manager to enable Blackcart’s merchants to drive business results through their Try Before You Buy program and to propel Blackcart into our next phase of growth.

The Merchant Success Manager will report to the Director of Merchant Success and partner with team members across multiple departments including Merchant Success, Sales, Product, and Engineering. This individual will build strong relationships with our merchants and provide strategic guidance and support to grow revenue and customer happiness through try before you buy for their business.

Our ideal candidate combines a passion for customer success and experience managing strategic B2B relationships in hyper-growth technology companies or startups. Equally important, we are seeking candidates who authentically live and breathe Blackcart values and are inspired by our vision to change eCommerce.

As a Merchant Success Manager at Blackcart, you will…

  • Build and maintain Blackcart’s relationships with a set of mid-market and enterprise merchants through delivering high-value engagements, strategic guidance and support throughout the entire post-sales journey from onboarding to activation, retention, and expansion
  • Partner with the dedicated implementation manager to create the onboarding project plan and deliver key onboarding engagements to help merchants plan their launch marketing strategy and prepare internal teams for any operational changes
  • Act as the voice of the merchant and their customers internally. Enable and empower other team members and departments to put the merchant and customer needs at the center of Blackcart’s day-to-day decisions
  • Analyze merchant performance data and program drivers to make recommendations for optimizing business impact
  • Become a Blackcart product expert
  • Plan, forecast, and support execution of merchant’s Try Before You Buy program initiatives
  • Conduct semi-annual business reviews with key merchant stakeholders
  • Partner with Merchant Technical Support and Customer Success to ensure any technical issues are escalated and resolved in a timely manner
  • Own internal reporting including signalling risk, upsell and expansion opportunities

Essential

  • 3+ years of experience managing B2B relationships in the technology/SaaS industry
  • Proven ability to retain and grow client accounts and revenue consistently over time
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate, present, and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
  • Familiarity and comfort using and discussing web software technology
  • Proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple account management projects and initiatives at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Data-driven in your approach to understanding problems and coming up with solutions
  • Committed to continuous learning - you are resourceful and creative with finding solutions during times of uncertainty
  • Passionate about working in a customer-facing role with a focus on providing value and driving retention and growth

Nice to have

  • BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales or relevant field
  • Familiarity with Shopify and/or other e-commerce platforms
  • Knowledge of e-commerce technical infrastructure and integrations
  • Experience training and enabling clients to drive product usage and adoption
  • Experience with working in a high-growth startup environment
  • Love animals (It’s likely that our CHOs, Chief Happiness Officers – Harvey and Unagi – will be sitting in on your interview!)
  • We offer competitive compensation including salary and equity. You grow as we grow!
  • We have an awesome HQ in Toronto and offer full health benefits
  • 500 Startups/venture-backed company
  • Casual work environment with extremely talented staff
  • Become a part of the transformation and empowerment of the e-commerce industry
  • Ability to join an early stage for one of the fastest-growing startups

Blackcart Values

  • Walk in the shopper's shoes
  • Benchmark against the best
  • Speak the truth
  • Run head-first into hard problems
  • Extreme ownership
  • Care for people

If you do not meet 100% of the above qualifications, but still think you would be a great fit for the role, we encourage you to apply! We will consider all candidates with relevant skill sets for this role, even if there are certain requirements they do not meet.

Blackcart is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity. As part of this commitment, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, colour, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status.

We encourage you to connect with us at hr@blackcart.co if you require accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format.

title: Gestionnaire de territoire - Ventes - Ville de Québec
description:
Bimbo Canada compte parmi les premiers producteurs et distributeurs de pains et de produits de boulangerie frais emballés en importance. Parmi ses marques, on compte Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, McGavins® et Vachon®. Dempster’s est la première marque nationale et compte parmi les chefs de file dans la catégorie des produits de boulangerie axés sur la santé et le bien-être au Canada. La société exploite 19 boulangeries et emploie environ 4 550 collaborateurs au Canada. Elle poursuit l’objectif de créer de la valeur en étant à la fine pointe de l’innovation en matière de fabrication et de prestation de services dans l’industrie de la boulangerie grâce à l’amélioration de ses processus et de ses services de distribution et à son souci continu d’offrir des pains blancs et de grains entiers, des tortillas, des bagels, des pains de seigle, des brioches et des petits pains haut de gamme

En 2017, ses ventes s’élevaient à 1,46 milliard de dollars. En tant qu’unité d’affaires autonome de Grupo Bimbo, Bimbo Canada souhaite faire croître ses segments de boulangerie à valeur ajoutée en misant sur la santé et le bien-être tout en se taillant une place dans de nouveaux segments de boulangerie et réseaux de distribution. La société continuera d’accroître sa part de marché et ses marges bénéficiaires au moyen d’investissements dans les catégories de produits à grains entiers et en misant sur la poursuite de ses activités d’innovation dans d’autres catégories de boulangerie et de collation.

Bimbo Canada dessert les principales chaînes d’épicerie, les points de vente au détail et les exploitations de services alimentaires dans l’ensemble du Canada. L’entreprise distribue ses produits de marque dans les segments commerciaux des magasins économiques, grand public et haut de gamme. Elle est la plus importante productrice de la plupart des grandes catégories de boulangerie. Elle fournit également des produits de marque maison aux épiceries et aux services alimentaires.

Résumé des fonctions, à titre de Leader, Marché - Ventes

Relevant du Leader régional - Ventes, le ou la titulaire du poste sera responsable de la réalisation des ventes d’un territoire donné, de son rendement de même que de l’exécution du plan stratégique en misant sur l’engagement des clients, la formation et le coaching du réseau de distributeurs indépendants se retrouvant sur ce territoire.

Le/La candidat(e) sélectionné(e) sera aussi chargé de soutenir les objectifs de l’équipe de ventes sur le terrain, en s’assurant du respect des SOP en magasin et de la communication des initiatives marketing. De plus, il/elle devra veiller à la gestion efficace des différents comptes en identifiant de nouvelles opportunités d’affaire et en veillant à l’exécution des initiatives nécessaires pour maintenir et développer la présence et la pénétration de la marque dans le territoire.

Bimbo Canada étant une entreprisedynamiqueen constante évolution, qui amène à releverplusieurs défiset à sedévelopperquotidiennement, tout en permettant deshoraires de travail flexibles.

  • Le titulaire du poste aura comme principales responsabilités:Établir de solides relations avec les clients, en élaborant des revues d’affaires basées sur leurs besoins / motivations et en développant des plans stratégique mettant en lumière les produits et programmes de Bimbo Canada et qui leur permettent de dénicher des occasions d’affaires;
  • Participer activement au développement des ventes du client en identifiant, proposant et exécutant les plans de vente, les nouvelles initiatives marketing et toute nouvelle opportunité d’affaires;
  • Participer au recrutement, à la formation et à l’encadrement des distributeurs présents sur leur territoire;
  • Assurer, à travers le réseau de distributeurs et les clients, la réalisation des objectifs de ventes, le respect des opérations, des politiques administratives et d’une mise en marché avant-gardiste;
  • Gérer les différentes problématiques rencontrées par les clients et les distributeurs (plaintes, requêtes, etc.);
  • Motiver et accompagner les clients et les distributeurs dans les stratégies de ventes et la gestion de la demande;
  • Présenter aux distributeurs les nouveaux produits, promotions et assurer un service à valeur ajoutée, notamment en identifiant de nouvelles opportunités d’affaires en magasin et avec les distributeurs;
  • Préparer les revues d’affaires en choisissant et recueillant les données pertinentes et appropriées et par la suite, les présenter aux clients et aux distributeurs;
  • Participer, parfois même animer, différentes rencontres de suivi avec les distributeurs et autres revues d’affaires avec les clients;
  • Effectuer du développement d’affaires (sollicitation) en fonction des opportunités d’amélioration observées;
  • Effectuer des tâches administratives et périodiques.

  • Compétences requises:Diplôme d’études post secondaire (collégial et/ou universitaire) dans une discipline appropriée (une spécialisation en gestion des opérations et/ou marketing sera considéré comme un atout) (Note: les candidats détenant une formation équivalente combinée à une expérience jugée pertinente seront considérés lors du processus de sélection);
  • Minimalement trois (3) années d’expérience dans une position similaire au niveau de la gestion ou des ventes dans un secteur de produits de consommation;
  • Agit avec un niveau élevé d’intégrité et traite les gens avec respect;
  • Comprend bien le principe d'analyse et de profitabilité et sait comment l'influencer;
  • Habiletés reconnues en matière de communication proactive et coaching;
  • Reconnu comme leader avec une excellente écoute;
  • Autonome, responsable et posséder un grand sens de l’éthique personnel et professionnel;
  • Excellente habiletés en communication écrite/parlé, français et anglais;
  • Connaissances professionnelles en informatique (Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.);
  • Compréhension et expérience des systèmes de livraison directe aux magasins est un atout.

title: Key Account Manager
description:
Who are Insights?

We are a global learning and development company with product and innovation at our heart. Our purpose is to create a world where people truly understand themselves and others and are inspired to make a positive difference in everything that they do.

Our products are used by some of the most well-known businesses and brands in the world as part of their employee learning and development requirements.

Our business continues to grow in this new world of work with our products in high demand so this is an exciting time to be joining this established team focussing on the growth of our Canadian market.

Our revenue numbers continue to rise and we are on pace to record a record year globally, not just in North America.

As part of the Key Accounts Team, you will develop customer relationships through providing legendary customer experience and thereby growing our existing portfolio of accounts in alignment to our Global Sales Strategy.


What you’ll do to succeed

- Proactively manage a portfolio of accounts through building customer relationships by understanding their business needs and the value Insights can bring
- Qualify and develop new business opportunities within your portfolio of accounts from initial enquiry and building relationships to meet the client needs and enable Insights to maximise potential business opportunities
- Nurture clients to enable long-term relationships and enhance customer loyalty
- Work collaboratively across teams globally with a knowledge of overall business strategy and goals
- Consistently providing a legendary customer experience thereby achieving revenue and contribution targets.
- Plan and prioritise sales activities and towards achieving agreed business goals, maintaining contribution levels, margins and managing productivity output
- Ensure client information is up to date and accurate by using D365 activities tools and systems
- Manage pre and post workshop logistics, liaising closely with wider departments - Delivery team, Client Services, Legal, Finance etc.

How you’ll show up

- Motivated by achieving stretch goals, with a natural drive for results
- Think like a Customer to deliver exceptional client experience, putting the customer at the heart of everything we do
- Inspired and excited by the opportunity to ensure that Insights is seen by its clients as a role model in customer service and customer experience
- Take ownership and accept accountability for your personal performance and development.
- Put the customer at the heart of everything we do
- Resilient, with a commitment to overcome barriers and challenges to achieve your goals.
- Commitment to become a strong advocate for the value that Insights can bring to our customers.

What you’re great at

- Building, managing, and maintaining strong relationships
- Excellent presentation and communication skills with a keen eye for detail
- Proven experience of interacting with clients in a sales/customer services environment.
- Strong capability and experience in Social Selling with experience in LinkedIn Sales Navigator
- Strong organisational skills, with an ability to manage your own workflow
- Developing client relationships in a sales environment
- Solid and proven office administration and CRM experience
- Good IT skills particularly in MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint

This is a remote working opportunity based in Canada, the team is geographically spread but really well connected through technology to ensure that there if full support within this role and a network of peers and leaders who are happy to help. We offer some really meaningful work supporting our clients and we hope that your passion is further enhanced by our product knowledge to best service their needs.

Insights is a company whose purpose is to create a world where people truly understand themselves and others and are inspired to make a positive difference in everything that they do. Not many businesses can share that purpose. Be part of our journey.

Before applying for a role at Insights, please review ourRecruitment Privacy Policy

title: Sales Manager For Dual Branded Marriott Hotels
description:
Job Overview

Develop business through direct sales solicitation for dual branded Marriott hotels.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Establish client base of individuals, organizations, associations, social, and/or corporate businesses through direct outside and inside selling to secure business for the hotel to ensure that room night sales and revenue goals are met or exceeded. Actively prospect and qualify new business.
  • Achieve personal and team goals as assigned.
  • Negotiate guest room rates, meeting room rental, function space, and/or hotel services within approved booking guidelines. Accurately produce and/or review all sales contracts, rate agreements, and/or banquet/catering event orders.
  • Monitor and handle inquiry calls and provide client proposals in accordance with established departmental policies and procedures
  • Work closely with other hotel departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the sales office and prospective clients. Disseminate sales-related information to other departments as appropriate.
  • Arrange and conduct special events, site inspections, and off-site presentations for potential clients. Entertain clients in accordance with established company and hotel policies and guidelines.
  • Conducts tours of the hotel and banquet facilities; entertains qualified potential clients in accordance with company and property policies and procedures.
  • Accurately forecasts all bookings and cancellations.
  • Develops and maintains relationships with key clients in order to produce group and/ or convention business
  • Maintain client files and update information daily in accordance with established departmental policies and procedures. Produce monthly sales-related reports and sales forecasts for assigned area of responsibility.
  • Attend and represent hotel at trade shows and conventions and/or participate in sales trips to key feeder markets.
  • Follow up with clients regularly during and after departure to ensure satisfaction and secure future bookings.
  • Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments. Key departmental contacts include all hotel departments.
  • Interact with outside contacts:
    • Guests – to ensure their total satisfaction
    • Airlines, wholesalers, corporate accounts, travel agencies, ad agencies, etc. – to ensure repeat business, follow up on events, and generate new business
    • Other contacts as needed (Professional organizations, community groups)
    • May assist in developing and implementing sales plans.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Some College plus a minimum of 2 years sales or marketing related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Related degree preferred. Prior hotel sales experience preferred. Must speak fluent English. Other languages preferred.

This job requires ability to perform the following:

  • Frequently standing up or moving within and outside of the facility
  • Carrying or lifting items weighing up to 25 pounds
  • Remain stationary for extended periods of time
  • Handling objects

Other:

  • Communication skills are utilized a significant amount of time when interacting with others; demonstrated ability to interact with guests, employees and third parties that reflects highly on the hotel, the brand and the Company.
  • Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when completing paperwork and management reports, interpreting results, giving and receiving instructions, and training
  • Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are utilized frequently.
  • Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities are used often.
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to travel to attend workshops, tradeshows, conventions, etc.
  • May require a valid Driver’s License.
  • May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: Purchasing Agent (Bilingual - French) - located in Quebec
description:
Apply now to join our growing, diverse team!

Welcome to the world of MRO Purchasing! As a Purchasing Agent, you will be one of our key leaders in ensuring our clients get the parts and materials they need! Every dollar counts, which means you will negotiate pricing on materials with our suppliers to get the best bang for our buck. There is nothing that our Purchasing Agents can’t handle! Apply today!

Highlights for your next career move:

  • Manage and own MRO Purchasing from starting with requisition and ending with receipt for specific clients.
  • Handle transaction negotiations directly with clients offering top-notch customer service all while within timeline of preferred supplier strategy.
  • Develop and drive countermeasures for underperforming key processes and/or material suppliers.
  • Maintain transaction service metrics in an inbound call center environment.
  • Review and handle all invoice exceptions associated with purchasing and the expediting of open orders.
  • Act as a liaison between clients, suppliers, and other involved departments to resolve purchasing related issues and offer resolutions.
  • Proactively communicate with suppliers when delivery dates are approaching and with field team relative to tracking orders, shipments, troubleshooting, and responding to all other questions.
  • Potential traveling to customer sites may be required for training, meetings, or any other team support.

The skills you’ll contribute to our diverse team:

  • Bilingual in French and English.
  • Bachelor’s degree OR if you do not have a degree, extensive MRO/Indirect purchasing experience works as well.
  • MRO/Indirect purchasing is required.
  • Able to collaborate in a client driven environment as this role will be highly customer service driven.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office software.
  • Knowledge of ERP purchasing software.

Every employee deserves great benefits, here are some of ours:

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision
  • Life Insurance
  • Vacation Time
  • Paid Holidays
  • Floating Holiday Time
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • 401K, and much more!

If this sounds like a challenge that you’re up for, click apply!

Who we are:

At SDI, we’re proud to help essential organizations across North America compete more effectively in a challenging global marketplace – and keep our economy moving. We do this by thinking differently, questioning conventional wisdom, and constantly challenging the status quo. We’re evolving the way leading manufacturers, multi-site retailers, and K12/higher education think about their maintenance, repair, and operations (MRO) strategies – the critical supply chain of parts, materials, equipment, and consumables necessary to keep plants and facilities operating safely and productively. Every day, we help companies eliminate waste, minimize risk exposure, and stay competitive on an ever-changing world stage.

EEO

SDI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation for any part of the employment process, please let us know by contacting us at hr@sdi.com.

SDI participates in the E-Verify program.
PM22

title: Director of Client Account Management (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Reference code: 105021   
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.

What will your typical day look like?

Setting Strategy, Relationships, and Influence 

  • The Director of Client Account Management plays a leadership role in strategic planning, managing a large and diverse team and working alongside Chief Client Office (CCO) leadership team to best support our clients and business:
  • Build and nurture the client account management team to ensure the team is providing quality and effective services
  • Help the team develop long-lasting relationships with clients and encourage them to gain a deep understanding of the client’s needs, and develop tactics to deliver client service excellence
  • Build relationships with internal stakeholders to best position client account management needs 
  • Anticipate and solve problems, and manage internal stakeholders to resolve issues proactively  
  • Prepare and execute the annual client account management business plan to drive growth and strategy  
  • Work proactively with the LPA team to improve operations and processes to align on annual account planning process
  • Collaborate across CCO business groups to set strategies and proactively suggest areas for improvement
  • Work closely with LPA Managing Partner, Industry Managing Partners, and Chief Client Officer to support the LPA portfolio and represent the CAM team   
  • Oversee the development and delivery of management reporting and monitor key performance indicators
  • Synthesize, communicate, and continuously improve the account management process and drive change
  • Monitor and report on economic, industry and competitive developments

Leadership 

  • Attract and develop a highly engaged, skilled and sought after team that is client focused and can collaborate with senior executives
  • Contribute to the overall culture and strategy of the team as a national team, that delivers its service with a high degree of distinction. 
  • Be a positive influence and enabler of change to be able to adapt the CAM team to address the ever-changing needs of our clients and the external environment
  • Work with internal stakeholders to identify and understand emerging/existing needs and appropriately leverage the broader team to support the growth goals of the LPA portfolio 
  • Lead various practice and/or firm wide initiatives to foster integration and collaboration across industries, regions, and businesses
  • Proactively drive innovation and accountability in all aspects of client account management

About the team

Reporting to the Large Priority Accounts (LPA) Managing Partner, the Director is responsible for setting the strategy and orientation of the Client Account Management (CAM) team. This national role is an exciting opportunity to lead a diverse and highly skilled team of client account managers that proactively manage and work alongside Lead Client Service Partners (LCSPs) and account teams on the firm’s most complex and critical clients. 

Enough about us, let's talk about you

  • Bachelor’s degree with Minimum 10 years’ relevant experience in a leadership a role
  • Proven experience as a client-focused business advisor with deep analytical and problem-solving skills and an ability to build influential relationships with key stakeholders at all levels
  • Experience in client account management is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in executing a business planning and forecasting process across a national business.
  • Proven ability to coach, lead and motivate a team of professionals in day-to-day execution and forward thinking client service business support in a large complex matrix environment on a national basis
  • Effective leadership, consensus building, conflict resolution, negotiation and team-building skills
  • Strong executive presence and communication skills with an ability to build and maintain relationships and lead others through change.
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment in interpreting firm policies and business strategies
  • Able to work in a fast pace environment

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? 
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Vaughan Cluster Sports/SMERF Sales Manager
company: Hilton Garden Inn & Homewood Suites Cluster
description:
Job Overview

Develop business through direct sales solicitation for Sports and SMERFE market

Duties and Responsibilities

  • This position will be responsible for the following Vaughan hotels: Hilton Garden Inn Toronto / Vaughan, Homewood Suites by Hilton Toronto / Vaughan. The successful candidate will be a proactive seller for new GROUP business in the following segments (Sport, and S.M.E.R.F.E.).
  • Establish client base of individuals, organizations, associations, and social businesses through direct outside and inside selling to secure business for the hotel to ensure that room night sales and revenue goals are met or . Actively prospect and qualify new business and maintain existing accounts and relationships.
  • Achieve personal and team goals as assigned.
  • Negotiate guest room rates and/or hotel services within approved booking guidelines. Accurately produce and/or review all sales contracts and rate agreements.
  • Monitor and handle inquiry calls and provide client proposals in accordance with established departmental policies and procedures
  • Work closely with other hotel departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the sales office and prospective clients. Disseminate sales-related information to other departments as appropriate.
  • Arrange and conduct special events, site inspections, and off-site presentations for potential clients. Entertain clients in accordance with established company and hotel policies and guidelines.
  • Conducts tours of the hotel; entertains qualified potential clients in accordance with company and property policies and procedures.
  • Coordinate and maintain all Sport and SMERFE bookings; including management of reservations, rooming lists, billing and all other tasks related to these market segments
  • Accurately forecasts all bookings and cancellations.
  • Develops and maintains relationships with key clients in order to produce group business
  • Maintain client files and update information daily in accordance with established departmental policies and procedures. Produce monthly sales-related reports and sales forecasts for assigned area of responsibility.
  • Attend and represent hotel at trade shows and conventions and/or participate in sales trips to key feeder markets as required
  • Follow up with clients regularly during and after departure to ensure satisfaction and secure future bookings.
  • Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments. Key departmental contacts include all hotel departments.
  • Interact with outside contacts:
    • Guests – to ensure their total satisfaction
    • Other contacts as needed (Professional organizations, community groups)
    • May assist in developing and implementing sales plans.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Some College plus a minimum of 2 years sales or marketing related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Related degree preferred. Prior hotel sales experience preferred. Must speak fluent English. Other languages preferred.

This job requires ability to perform the following:

  • Frequently standing up or moving within and outside of the facility
  • Carrying or lifting items weighing up to 25 pounds
  • Remain stationary for extended periods of time
  • Handling objects

Other:

  • Communication skills are utilized a significant amount of time when interacting with others; demonstrated ability to interact with guests, employees and third parties that reflects highly on the hotel, the brand and the Company.
  • Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when completing paperwork and management reports, interpreting results, giving and receiving instructions, and training
  • Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are utilized frequently.
  • Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities are used often.
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to travel to attend workshops, tradeshows, conventions, etc.
  • May require a valid Driver’s License.
  • May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: District Sales Manager- Alberta, Canada
description:
NACHURS ALPINE SOLUTIONS is North America's leading manufacturer of specialty liquid fertilizers and liquid industrial products. Founded in 1946, fertilizers are marketed under the NACHURS brand in the US. Manufacturing plants are located in Marion, OH, Corydon, IN, Garretson, SD, Red Oak, IA, St. Gabriel, LA, New Hamburg, ON and Belle Plaine, SK.

NACHURS ALPINE SOLUTIONS is seeking a District Sales Manager for Alberta, Canada

The District Sales Manager is responsible to carry out all sales and marketing activities in a specified geographical territory so as to maintain, develop and grow the overall sales volume in that territory in a manner which maximizes profitability.

  • Plan and organize sales activities and customer/prospect contact towards achieving agreed business goals.
  • Plan and develop dealer/distributor network in specified territory according to agreed market development strategy.
  • Motivate dealers and distributors to promote NAS portfolio of products and services.
  • Educate growers, dealers & distributors on new products.
  • Conduct direct farm visits to growers in order to promote and sell NAS portfolio of products.
  • Conduct direct visits to dealers and distributors to assist in selling NAS portfolio of products.
  • Sell and service equipment related to application of NAS fertilizer products.
  • Install and help to install equipment as related to the application of NAS fertilizer products.
  • Sell storage tanks as related to storage of NAS fertilizer products.
  • Conduct grower meetings to promote the use of NAS products.
  • Attend farm shows to promote the use of NAS products and services.
  • Locate and develop test plot locations as it relates to NAS research & development program.
  • Manage and collect accounts receivable as required to keep receivables current.
  • Perform any other duties as may be required from time to time.

Successful Candidate for this position will be a Self Starter, Motivated to Sell, Willing to travel (3 nights a week on average), Organized and Adaptable.

Nachurs Alpine Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We give consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: Buyer
description:
Our client of the aerospace industry is seeking experimented buyers. The buyers are responsible for all aspects related to the day-to-day purchasing and overall procurement activities to support maintenance and flight operations.

Your role will be to:

-Provide purchasing support to bases or functions as assigned for both direct and/or indirect procurement needs;

-Ensure that the full purchase-to-pay cycle is completed for assigned responsibility;

-Maintain supplier performance and ensure adherence to company standards;

-Identify areas for improvement in the overall cost of procured goods or services and/or supplier performance;

-Administrate payment, warranty or quality issues for vendors as assigned;

-Provide reporting as requested and brief supervisor on issues requiring support;

-Travel, occasionally, to different sites, as well as to some deployment sites with the fleet to act as the on-deployment supply representative;

-Comply with all company policy and collaborate across functions as required.

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

-8-10 years of work experience in a similar role in procurement, purchasing or supply chain;

-Experience in the aerospace industry considered an asset;

-Basic knowledge and capability to navigate and/or negotiate commercial agreements.

Skills:

-Excellent oral and written communication skills;

-Strong interpersonal skills;

-Strong sense of urgency and ability to function in a fast-paced environment;

-Ability to work autonomously and with a problem-solving mentality;

-Positive, professional attitude and the ability to take initiative;

-Strong organizational and follow-up skills including high attention to detail and meeting deadlines;

-Advanced computer skills and proficient with Microsoft Office suite;

-Strong problem-solving skills and solution-oriented;

-Ability to work both as part of a team and independently;

-Demonstrate strong and visible support of the client’s values.

Working Conditions:

-Ability to work a flexible schedule and support AOG duty coverage as required;

-May be required to travel (5-10%);

-Ability to obtain a valid passport.

Up to the task? Send us your application!

As an equal opportunity employer, Personnel Alter Ego values diversity in its workforce and seeks to ensure all groups remain fairly represented. Candidates must have the legal right to work in Canada.

title: Conseiller(ère) régional(e) - Ventes - Inside sales
description:
(Lieu de travail: Montréal)

Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

Niveau d'emploi

NV-06

La principale responsabilité est de développer de nouvelles relations d'affaires et de produire de nouvelles ventes tout en se concentrant sur la conservation de l'actif sous gestion.

À titre de conseiller(ère) régional(e) des ventes - Inside sales, vous démontrez un appétit pour le développement des affaires et un désir de participer à l'atteinte d'objectifs de ventes.  Vous êtes en mesure d’offrir de solides présentations de vente par téléphone.

En partenariat avec le directeur régional des ventes,  vous participez à la conception et à la mise en œuvre des plans d'affaires du territoire pour atteindre et dépasser les objectifs de ventes et d'activités.

Vous contribuez à la prise en charge et au maintien de la relation d’affaires auprès des conseillères et conseillers financiers de votre territoire. Vous réalisez des activités de soutien liées à la vente des produits et services par différents canaux de distribution répondant aux besoins des clients selon les stratégies et les pratiques en vigueur.

Vous devez détenir une solide connaissance du secteur des services financiers, des produits et services de Desjardins Investissements pour vendre et soutenir de manière proactive la communauté des conseillères et conseillers financiers dans le territoire assigné.

Vous apportez votre soutien dans le développement et le maintien des relations d’affaires auprès des conseillères et conseillers financiers de votre région. Vous contribuez à la promotion et la vente de produits et services répondants aux besoins de la clientèle selon les stratégies et les objectifs d’affaires, tout en mettant à profit votre aptitude à viser les résultats.

Vous collaborez à l’analyse des besoins des conseillères et conseillers financiers et à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de solutions adaptées. Vous assurez la satisfaction des clients et la qualité des services rendus, tout en respectant les normes et procédures de l’entreprise. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles et des techniques de vente relationnelles devient alors des compétences essentielles.

Responsabilités principales

  • Effectuer hebdomadairement 250 appels téléphoniques de vente proactifs avec des conseillers financiers indépendants en suivant une approche de vente consultative pour identifier les besoins, les problèmes ou les opportunités afin de positionner la bonne solution d'investissement

  • Offrir de solides présentations de vente par téléphone

  • Maintenir une solide connaissance des solutions d’investissement de Desjardins, de la concurrence et des marchés financiers

  • Démontrer une gestion et une hiérarchisation efficaces des priorités, un suivi en temps opportun des réunions du directeur régional des ventes et des études de cas (illustrations, propositions et optimisation du portefeuille)

  • Collaborer avec le directeur régional des ventes, grâce à une communication efficace et continue, à la planification du territoire

  • Réaliser un plan d'affaires du territoire axé sur l'approfondissement des relations avec les clients réels et s'engager dans des appels de prospection pour étendre la portée de Desjardins Investissements

  • Atteindre systématiquement les cibles fixées d'activités téléphonique et le nombre fixé de rendez-vous à sécuriser

  • Soutenir les campagnes de vente en vedette en les intégrant dans les plans d'affaires et en modifiant les activités au besoin

  • Utiliser efficacement les outils de vente fournis, y compris la technologie (CRM, Morningstar, Equisoft, PowerBI).

  • Exécuter, suivre et analyser l'efficacité / l'impact des campagnes de vente ciblées à l'aide d'EXCEL, des outils d'illustration hypothétique, des calculatrices financières et des présentations WebEx).

Conditions particulières

  • Lieu de travail: Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride flexible #LI-Hybrid

  • Déplacements : À prévoir pour soutenir les efforts de vente du territoire

  • Autres informations pertinentes : Compensation de base combinée à une compensation variable basée sur l’atteinte des objectifs de ventes

  • Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1

Profil recherché

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales (DEC technique) dans une discipline appropriée

  • Un minimum de deux ans d’expérience pertinente

  • Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée (un atout)

  • Expérience pertinente en vente-conseil

Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées

  • Détenir le Cours sur les valeurs mobilières au Canada / IFIC

  • Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire

Connaissances spécifiques

  • Connaissance de l'industrie des services financiers

  • Connaissance pratique des applications (Word, Excel et Outlook)

  • Fortes habiletés de communication en français et en anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

    Compétences transversales Desjardins

    Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action

    Compétences clés au profil recherché

    Maîtriser les relations interpersonnelles, Viser les résultats

    Lieu de travail

    Complexe Desjardins Montréal

    Syndicat

    Non Syndiqué

    Date de fin d'affichage

    2022-05-13

    Famille d'emplois

    Services aux membres et clients - vente (GF)
