title: Gestionnaire de territoire - Ventes - Ville de Québec
description:
Bimbo Canada compte parmi les premiers producteurs et distributeurs de pains et de produits de boulangerie frais emballés en importance. Parmi ses marques, on compte Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, McGavins® et Vachon®. Dempster’s est la première marque nationale et compte parmi les chefs de file dans la catégorie des produits de boulangerie axés sur la santé et le bien-être au Canada. La société exploite 19 boulangeries et emploie environ 4 550 collaborateurs au Canada. Elle poursuit l’objectif de créer de la valeur en étant à la fine pointe de l’innovation en matière de fabrication et de prestation de services dans l’industrie de la boulangerie grâce à l’amélioration de ses processus et de ses services de distribution et à son souci continu d’offrir des pains blancs et de grains entiers, des tortillas, des bagels, des pains de seigle, des brioches et des petits pains haut de gamme

 

En 2017, ses ventes s’élevaient à 1,46 milliard de dollars. En tant qu’unité d’affaires autonome de Grupo Bimbo, Bimbo Canada souhaite faire croître ses segments de boulangerie à valeur ajoutée en misant sur la santé et le bien-être tout en se taillant une place dans de nouveaux segments de boulangerie et réseaux de distribution. La société continuera d’accroître sa part de marché et ses marges bénéficiaires au moyen d’investissements dans les catégories de produits à grains entiers et en misant sur la poursuite de ses activités d’innovation dans d’autres catégories de boulangerie et de collation.

 

Bimbo Canada dessert les principales chaînes d’épicerie, les points de vente au détail et les exploitations de services alimentaires dans l’ensemble du Canada. L’entreprise distribue ses produits de marque dans les segments commerciaux des magasins économiques, grand public et haut de gamme. Elle est la plus importante productrice de la plupart des grandes catégories de boulangerie. Elle fournit également des produits de marque maison aux épiceries et aux services alimentaires.

 

Résumé des fonctions, à titre de Leader, Marché - Ventes

 

Relevant du Leader régional - Ventes, le ou la titulaire du poste sera responsable de la réalisation des ventes d’un territoire donné, de son rendement de même que de l’exécution du plan stratégique en misant sur l’engagement des clients, la formation et le coaching du réseau de distributeurs indépendants se retrouvant sur ce territoire.

 

Le/La candidat(e) sélectionné(e) sera aussi chargé de soutenir les objectifs de l’équipe de ventes sur le terrain, en s’assurant du respect des SOP en magasin et de la communication des initiatives marketing. De plus, il/elle devra veiller à la gestion efficace des différents comptes en identifiant de nouvelles opportunités d’affaire et en veillant à l’exécution des initiatives nécessaires pour maintenir et développer la présence et la pénétration de la marque dans le territoire. 

 

Bimbo Canada étant une entreprise dynamique en constante évolution, qui amène à relever plusieurs défis et à se développer quotidiennement, tout en permettant des horaires de travail flexibles.

 

  • Le titulaire du poste aura comme principales responsabilités :Établir de solides relations avec les clients, en élaborant des revues d’affaires basées sur leurs besoins / motivations et en développant des plans stratégique mettant en lumière les produits et programmes de Bimbo Canada et qui leur permettent de dénicher des occasions d’affaires;
  • Participer activement au développement des ventes du client en identifiant, proposant et exécutant les plans de vente, les nouvelles initiatives marketing et toute nouvelle opportunité d’affaires;
  • Participer au recrutement, à la formation et à l’encadrement des distributeurs présents sur leur territoire;
  • Assurer, à travers le réseau de distributeurs et les clients, la réalisation des objectifs de ventes, le respect des opérations, des politiques administratives et d’une mise en marché avant-gardiste;
  • Gérer les différentes problématiques rencontrées par les clients et les distributeurs (plaintes, requêtes, etc.);
  • Motiver et accompagner les clients et les distributeurs dans les stratégies de ventes et la gestion de la demande;
  • Présenter aux distributeurs les nouveaux produits, promotions et assurer un service à valeur ajoutée, notamment en identifiant de nouvelles opportunités d’affaires en magasin et avec les distributeurs;
  • Préparer les revues d’affaires en choisissant et recueillant les données pertinentes et appropriées et par la suite, les présenter aux clients et aux distributeurs;
  • Participer, parfois même animer, différentes rencontres de suivi avec les distributeurs et autres revues d’affaires avec les clients;
  • Effectuer du développement d’affaires (sollicitation) en fonction des opportunités d’amélioration observées;
  • Effectuer des tâches administratives et périodiques.

 

  • Compétences requises:Diplôme d’études post secondaire (collégial et/ou universitaire) dans une discipline appropriée (une spécialisation en gestion des opérations et/ou marketing sera considéré comme un atout) (Note : les candidats détenant une formation équivalente combinée à une expérience jugée pertinente seront considérés lors du processus de sélection);
  • Minimalement trois (3) années d’expérience dans une position similaire au niveau de la gestion ou des ventes dans un secteur de produits de consommation;
  • Agit avec un niveau élevé d’intégrité et traite les gens avec respect;
  • Comprend bien le principe d'analyse et de profitabilité et sait comment l'influencer;
  • Habiletés reconnues en matière de communication proactive et coaching;
  • Reconnu comme leader avec une excellente écoute;
  • Autonome, responsable et posséder un grand sens de l’éthique personnel et professionnel;
  • Excellente habiletés en communication écrite/parlé, français et anglais;
  • Connaissances professionnelles en informatique (Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.);
  • Compréhension et expérience des systèmes de livraison directe aux magasins est un atout.

title: Agent
description:
The Agent will perform a variety of assignments including concierge-level, residential, or event security, response services, basic driving, and investigations.

Essential Functions:

  1. Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
  2. Provide the client with concierge-level security at the company location and/or events;
    • Deescalate tense situations or individuals that may arise.
    • Write detailed incident reports following any incident, occurrence, or variance that warrants documentation.
  3. Conduct quality investigations and complete investigative reports.
  4. Provide response services related to emergency and crisis planning, high risk terminations, workforce disruptions, natural disaster, civil unrest, and threat monitoring.
  5. Transport the client to and from company location and/or events.
  6. Secure the client's residential perimeter;
    • Review CCTV, manage access controls, and respond to alarms, as needed.
  7. Identify and escalate equipment deficiencies/failures.
  8. All other duties, as assigned.

Education, Experience, and Certifications:

Secondary School (High School) Diploma with law enforcement, military, and/or security experience.

Competencies:

  • Law enforcement, military, and/or security experience.
  • Ontario security license.
  • Concierge-level customer service experience.
  • Able to complete thorough and accurate investigations and reports.
  • Access control systems, CCTV, and alarm monitoring experience.
  • Strong problem resolution skills.
  • Able to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Solid verbal and written communication skills.
  • Computer knowledge; Microsoft Office.

Working Conditions:

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;

  • Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.
  • Regular computer usage.
  • Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers.
  • Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
  • Ability to adjust focus between close and distance vision.
  • Travel, as required.

Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

title: Sales Manager
description:
What is The Mobile Shop?

 

Technology is a part of our everyday lives. We at The Mobile Shop connect thousands of Canadians every year with the newest and most innovative phones and plans that the market has to offer. Our Lead Mobilists (Sales Managers) are our front-line leaders that help drive the success at our stores and mentor the advisors that use their expertise to provide our customers with the right phone and plans for their needs.

 

Our team comprises of a diverse group of Managers and Advisors that push the limits on what it means to provide the best insight and customer service to our customers with the support of leading-edge training and development.

 

A day in the life at The Mobile Shop

 

  • Establish relationships with customers and provide them with the best insights or phones, plans, accessories, and device protection plans that fit their needs
  • Work with your colleagues to drive traffic into the store and boost sales
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends in the telecommunications world
  • Complete weekly coaching programs that help you develop your sales skills and your knowledge of the wireless industry
  • Develop a network of clients that come to you for any upgrades for themselves or their friends and family

 

If you have these things, we think you would be a great fit:

 

  • Experience in a leadership role within retail sales, hospitality or service industry
  • Ability to lead a team of sales associates, train them to succeed and hold them accountable for work ethic, performance and company standards
  • Thinks outside the box when it comes to sales â€“ upselling, referral sales, networking
  • Professional, friendly and a great communicator â€“ the key to success is to always initiate the conversation
  • Always on their feet and driven to succeed
  • Must be bilingual (English and French)

 

What we have to offer:

 

  • Competitive compensation package, including base rate salary and uncapped commission
  • Comprehensive Group Benefits for Full-Time Sales Managers
  • Online, In-Person and Workshop training sessions consistently throughout the year to help develop your skills
  • Unparalleled growth opportunities within the organization. We want you to see this as your career move, not just a job!
  • Employee referral programs
  • Exclusive Partner Program (EPP) choices on all carriers

 

As part of our selection process, please complete our The Mobile Shop Candidate Assessment: https://mobileshop.traitify.com/

 

Think The Mobile Shop is right for you? Check out our Careers page and Instagram for all the details about us!

title: Territory Sales Manager (Abbottsford, British Columbia, CA)
description:
ABOUT THE JOB:

Do you have proven success prospecting, cold calling, and closing business? Do you enjoy selling a customized, creative solution? Do you enjoy working in a commission-driven position with endless upside? Do you see the value of working for a publicly-traded, established, and still-growing industry leader? Territory Sales Managers identify and gain new customers, and grow business and relationships with existing customers, in markets across North America.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

  • Drive lease revenue and value-added revenue within an assigned territory.
  • Conduct prospecting calls and meetings with potential new customers identified through means such as leads delivered through Salesforce.com, referrals, local media, etc.
  • Effectively communicate Williams Scotsman’s value proposition to customers.
  • Develop and maintain a working relationship with the Inside Sales Representative within your assigned territory to maximize Units On Rent (UOR) growth.
  • Grow sales of value-added products (e.g., furniture, steps/ ramps, and other products and services that are ancillary to the unit) in addition to other potential new initiatives.
  • Account Management; expand relationships and revenue generated from existing customers, including Strategic Accounts.
  • Enhance the overall customer service experience.
  • Collaborate with the local branch operations staff who are delivering on the promises you are making to customers.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • A BS in Business, Marketing or a related field
  • 3+ years of B2B sales and account management experience
    • In a relatable industry such as construction materials, auto-leasing, logistics, transportation or other construction-related industries.
    • Using a consultative, solution selling approach
    • Proven measurable past success
  • Experience with Salesforce.com or a related CRM system
    • PC proficiency in a Windows environment
  • The ability to prepare and present professional presentations and proposals
  • Experience negotiating contracts
  • The ability to thrive in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial, time-sensitive, collaborative environment

The opportunity to advance your career is ready for the taking at WillScot; if you’re READY TO WORK, apply today!

WillScot is veteran-friendly. If you have military experience, we want to hear from you!

WillScot, is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment. Disclaimer:  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

WillScot will make accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request and throughout the entire recruitment process.

title: Manager, Forecasting & Sales Analytics
description:
Job Posting for Chervon

Position Details

Position:                      Manager, Forecasting & Sales Analytics

Company info:           Chervon Trading Co., Ltd  http://global.chervongroup.com/

Start Date:                  ASAP

Reports to:                 Dana Eliot, General Manager

Supervises:                 N/A

Has Contact with:      Cross-company contact (North American and Chinese Divisions)

Estimated Start Date: ASAP

Work Location:          Mississauga office (Note: All Health and Safety protocols are adhered to)

Job Type:                    Full Time

Benefits:                     Life Insurance & monthly health insurance stipend provided

Compensation:          Competitive package

Education:                  A bachelorâ€™s degree preferred

Summary of Responsibilities:

The Manager, Forecasting & Sales Analytics will report directly to our General Manager. The focus of the Manager, Forecasting & Sales Analytics role is to:

  • Own the NABU Canada reporting file: Daily tracking of sales by brand and customer,
  • Own the annual master forecast by brand, by customer, working with NA DSP to react and adjust to business changes,
  • Perform financial forecasting, reporting, and sales metrics tracking,
  • Report on financial performance and support General Manager for regular leadership reviews,
  • Familiar with Loweâ€™s Vendor DART reporting system / CTR / Walmart systems,
  • Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements (all levels of the P&L),
  • Creation of new reports to further provide transparency in support of the growth of the Canadian business unit highlighting margins and overall spending trends,
  • Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with annual business plan and forecast revisions,
  • Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and Excel dashboards,
  • Maintain a strong financial analysis foundation creating forecasts and models,
  • Own the customer-facing relationship with Forecasting & Operations,
  • Cooperatively work with Manager, Canada Operations to analyze and minimize Operational Compliance Fines, with external communication responsibility,
  • Manage S&OP process with local Commercial team, NJ back-end team and NA office,
  • Own and represent the complete 52-week Sales/Inventory forecast and goals for Canada business for both OBM and ODM businesses,
  • Manage inventory in Chervon 3PL warehouses; rotate goods in from domestic warehouses along with new goods coming from Nanjing, China,
  • Conduct regularly scheduled Forecasting, Inventory, internally and externally and support with conference calls, physical meetings,
  • Deep integration with China & Canada Commercial teams and US Operations/Finance teams on all deliverables.

Travel:                                  This position may require some North American travel.

Languages:                         Fluent in English, and French is a big asset

Other:                                   Must be eligible to work in Canada and travel internationally (valid driverâ€™s license and passport)

Company Profile

Chervon Trading Co., Ltd. Chervon has always been committed to helping to build a better world by building better tools. We focus on hand-held portable power tools, stationary bench tools, laser and electronic equipment and outdoor power equipment. With world-class R&D, testing and manufacturing capabilities; collaborating sales & marketing groups; industrial design professionals and service teams throughout the world, we can provide satisfying solutions that meet or surpass our customersâ€™ expectations. Today, Chervon-built products are sold by more than 30,000 stores in 65 countries. We pride ourselves on being a TOP 10 player in the global power tool industry.

Competencies

  • Leadership to be a self-starter, adaptable to new business requirements and owns key areas of responsibility across global offices,
  • Detail-oriented to manage key business deliverables internally and externally, including overseas teams daily,
  • High degree of financial acumen, Excel skills, ERP experience a plus,
  • Entrepreneurial teamwork attitude and engaged with Chervon IDEA philosophy,
  • Strategic thinking that adds value to the business plan of profitable growth,
  • Project planning to organize a complex business calendar of events and required executions to meet deliverables,
  • Understands all aspects of Demand Planning including Forecasting, Horizon Planning, Vertical Integration managing long lead times
  • Significant experience with complex product flow configurations to maximize efficiencies while also optimizing costs and lead time,
  • Business acumen to adapt to expanding needs in a diverse role that must engage extensively with inside and outside stakeholders to accomplish goals,
  • Analytical to bring continuous-improvement to Forecasting, Financial and Operational role components,
  • Ownership of regular meetings with key customers/teams regarding Demand/Supply meetings and making recommendations where appropriate various improvements to the overall operation to drive efficiencies for both customer and Chervon,
  • Communication proficiency and cultural professionalism to be effective in a global team, particularly experience working with an overseas office,
  • Presentation skills to be effective at a senior level internally and customer-facing on detailed role performance analysis,
  • Retail knowledge; any deep experience of Customers Power Tools/DIY/OPE businesses,
  • Inventory management of multiple, brands, skus with ownership of ITO and all performance metrics associated with product flow/transportation cost optimization,
  • Ability for 20-25% international travel, including USA, Asia is required,
  • Leadership-level role, requiring schedule flexibility and ability to work extended hours in required situations, including evening phone calls with overseas teams, weekend travel, industry, and internal events,
  • Experience leading a team of individuals to achieve and exceed expectations.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position does not have supervisory responsibility.       

Work Environment & Hours

This job operates in a professional office environment at our Mississauga location

Hours:   9am â€“ 5pm

Required Education and Experience:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred;
  • Sales forecasting and analysis experience with major retailers including Loweâ€™s, Walmart, CTC, and Amazon;
  • Sales experience in related categories preferred (Power Tools/ Outdoor Power);
  • Strong phone etiquette; experience with Microsoft Office & ORACLE;
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills within all levels of an organization.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Amico Lights
description:
Regional Sales Manager
Amico Lights Corporation – Richmond Hill, ON

Join a growing and dynamic team. Manage and recruit various distribution channels to help promote and market our products into the US healthcare market. Consult directly with C-level clinicians at some of the biggest hospital systems in the US. Travel is required.

Position Details Include:
• Managing and growing a regional territory within the US
• Live product presentation to key decision makers in hospital that include: Nursing Directors, Doctors, Purchasing agents, Facility

Directors and Project Managers
• Grow and foster new relationships with key Architects, Engineers and Equipment Planners within your region
• Work closely with the Regional Sales Managers of other Amico divisions on the larger construction projects
• Work directly with local Amico reps in the US
• Training, Recruiting and Managing of sales/distribution channels in your region

Qualifications:
• University or College Education preferred
• 2-4 years of sales experience
• Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
• Proven track record of prospecting, qualifying, and closing sales
• Must be able to travel and drive in the US

Compensation Competitive Base Salary + Uncapped Commission + Bonus Incentives + Benefits

This is the ideal position for someone looking to grow their sales career and have a very tangible impact on a specific region. If you like to travel, are highly competitive and you are considered to be a high achieving sales professional, we are a great fit for you.

Only qualified applicants will be contacted

title: Contract Specialist - (Job Number: 43642)
description:
Description43642
Qualifications

Come join the City of Edmonton’s Corporate Contract Management Team and apply your subject matter expertise in overseeing and managing corporate contracts. 


As the Contract Specialist you will exercise the highest level of judgement, diplomacy and confidentiality with respect to contract and supplier management processes. In this role you will be responsible for managing the City’s corporate contracts after their execution and administer the appropriate change mechanisms. 


Your success will be measured by your ability to achieve results in a respectful, inclusive and service-minded way. With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • Identify, analyze and document current issues, trends or risks associated with the administration and management of assigned contracts in a portfolio, propose corrective actions or improvements to maintain or increase best value to the City 
  • Run effective implementation and roll out of negotiated contract terms and conditions to stakeholders 
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory and corporate policies, administrative directives and procedures for managing contracts and amendments 
  • Provide strategic advice and guidance to procurement teams and business areas while recommending the appropriate contract changes or amendments 
  • Provide mentoring and coaching to other team members and business areas in both interpreting and explaining contract requirements, risks, terms and conditions to stakeholders to support compliance and inform proper decision-making 
  • Maintain strong levels of customer service to business partners and suppliers while managing a demanding portfolio 
  • Create supplier scorecard, contract management plan and manage supplier performance throughout the life of the contract or a project 
  • Work closely with suppliers, lead meetings, assign action items and follow-up on a regular basis to ensure that performance contractual obligations and deliverables are met 
  • Partner with suppliers to lead continuous improvement, problem solving, waste elimination and other value-enhancing opportunities 
  • Perform additional related duties as required

title: Sales Manager
description:
We are Aaron’s - an industry leader in the sales and lease-to-own retail
industry known for quality brand names and superior customer service.
We provide our team members the opportunity to reach their full
potential in a team-oriented, high-energy, recognition-based environment
with competitive pay and benefits. This is much more than a job – it is
a career with purpose.


Aaron’s Sales Managers help us put our best foot forward and bring our customers one-step closer to ownership by leading the store’s sales and marketing function. As a Sales Manager, you will define the exceptional experience that drives our reputation and customer loyalty by serving as the brand ambassador for all Aaron’s products. You will ensure team sales performance by selling merchandising, pricing and demonstrating exceptional people skills to foster new customer growth.


Skills for Success

Sales Managers are relationship builders, and the most successful ones understand it is not about a transaction, but rather long-lasting relationships founded on first names and trust. They are sales-focused, passionate about marketing, and highly motivated leaders who encourage people to bring their best. Like all Aaron’s team members, Sales Managers share our purpose and passion for making a real difference in the lives of others and the rewards that come from creating strong personal connections for life.


The Work


+ Support every customer’s ownership goals by building authentic customer relationships that drive sales

+ Manage the overall sales functions of the store by setting and achieving daily, weekly and monthly sales goals, which include both inside & outside sales; including updating the goal board daily

+ Generate new business by developing and implementing community marketing strategies

+ Review and close lease agreements, which includes confirming customer identification, collecting money and obtain customer signatures on lease agreements

+ Assist General Manager with operational functions that include taking inventory regularly, performing routine service calls, stock balancing and product exchanges

+ Assist General Manager with product ordering, including planning for future sales and events; including driving sales goals with Customer Service Representatives, delivery drivers and leading the sales department

+ Manage customer service calls and work with service vendors to ensure a top-notch customer experience

+ Ensure customer care and satisfaction by executing the Aaron's customer service program and providing outstanding service and promptly resolving customer concerns

+ Monitor and ensure efficient operation of the cleaning station in the warehouse; including neat and orderly merchandise

+ Clean and certify merchandise in the cleaning center for all items personally returned

+ Ensure the showroom floor is stocked, cleaned and follows Aaron’s No-Holes Policy

+ First up to assist with deliveries if a Delivery Driver is not available

+ Safely operate company vehicle

+ Any other reasonable duties requested by management


Requirements


+ United States at least 21 years old with a valid state Driver’s License and compliance with the Company’s Driver Qualification Policy; including satisfactory MVR (driving record). Canada at least the age of 18.

+ Must meet DOT requirements to obtain certification in required states (United States)

+ Ability to work schedule of hours varying from 8 am to 9 pm

+ Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. without help and up to 300 lbs. with the assistance of a dolly

+ High School diploma or equivalent preferred

+ Two years of college or two years of previous management experience preferred

+ Strong organizational and communication, both verbal and interpersonal skills

+ High energy with the ability to effectively perform all functions of the store and multitasking effectively

+ Proper telephone etiquette

+ Uphold the Aaron’s Brand and protect company assets

+ General product knowledge preferred

+ Maintain a professional appearance

+ Proficient computer skills


Total Rewards

Team members enjoy access to career training and
advancement opportunities, and are rewarded with competitive
compensation and a comprehensive benefits package, which includes:


+ Paid time off including vacation days, sick days and holidays

+ Team Member purchase discounts


About Aaron’s

At
Aaron’s we offer sales and lease-to-ownership of specialty items
including furniture, consumer electronics, home appliances, and
accessories throughout Canada and the United States. Our
customers shop at Aaron’s for the same reason you should choose us for
the next step in your career – our ability to positively influence
people’s lives. If you are looking for a company with the passion and
dedication to make a difference in the lives of customers and team
members alike, join us today.


Aaron’s is committed tocreating a diverse and inclusive work environment where team members’differences are celebrated. All qualified applicants will receive equalconsideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour,race, citizenship, ethnic origin, place of origin, creed, disability,family status, marital status, gender identity, gender expression, sex(including pregnancy and breastfeeding), sexual orientation or any otherground protected under applicable human rights legislation. Candidateswho require accommodation during the recruitment process should contacthrsupport@aarons.com.

title: In-Store Service Agent (Part Time) - North London
description:
As Canada's fastest-growing specialty retailer of consumer electronics, Best Buy ensures it offers one of the best work environments in the country. Employee experience is at the heart of everything we do. We take a holistic approach to how we recognize and reward hard work and achievements. True to our vision of unleashing the power of our people, we encourage our employees to learn, grow and advance within our organization.

As an In-Store Service Agent, you will strive to create an amazing customer experience by understanding the customer's needs, inspiring them to see what's possible with the latest technology, identifying and creating complete solutions according to their needs and lifestyle, and retrieving all the necessary products and services for them.

… Maximize long term relationships with our customers through the implementation of Best Buy Programs, ensure that we are "amazing" when responding to customer concerns, that we escalate issues to management when it is required, and that we make contact with every customer.

…Ensure that you are consistently learning and developing your skills through the participation in company training programs, that you are maintaining current knowledge of the latest technology products and industry trends, and that you contribute to the sharing of knowledge and expertise within the store sales team when required.

…Achieve company targets and standards on key areas of performance, ensure that we are complying with all Health and Safety standards, and that you are "continuously improving" your contribution to teams performance.

• Continuously learning and developing their own skills
• Contributing in a positive, inclusive way within a team environment
• Enjoys developing rapport with others and has “amazing” communication skills

We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology.

title: Territory Manager - Foodservice (Contract)
description:
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

The Territory Manager is responsible for the commercial performance, growth, and viability of protein products across all categories and customers in their portfolio. This individual is a highly entrepreneurial leader, passionate about customers, and brings a proven ability to build meaningful relationships and partnerships with large customers. The Manager knows how to successfully connect customer strategies and needs with Maple Leaf’s capabilities and objectives to build winning solutions.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:

  • Lead selling efforts with GFS Ontario and Toronto Region– both existing and new customers.
  • Manage and deliver P&L objectives including Volume, Sales, and Gross Profit. Inclusive of monthly/quarterly/annual reporting and forecasting against key metrics for the business.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the customer’s strategy and oversee the development of joint customer business plans that support the broader Foodservice strategy and objectives. Inclusive of volume, GP, trade spend, promotional plans and business development plans.
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver business objectives and align priorities and resources across functions to support business strategies and priorities. These teams include: Marketing, Distribution, USA, Finance, and Supply Chain.
  • Build and maintain knowledge base of competitors and operator/customer trends in the marketplace/industry and integrate this information into strategic recommendations.
  • Develop a detailed database of opportunities by customer, competitive landscape, financials, and timing.
  • Be part of building a growth culture, rooted in discipline and fundamentals, that delivers winning customer partnerships, by instituting operating rhythms and practices for awareness and alignment of priorities within the team.
  • Forecast and deliver budgets for the function with control of direct trade spend.
  • Other projects/duties as assigned or needed.

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
  • Employee Assistance Program

What you will bring:

  • Diverse perspective that complements the skills, strengths and opportunities of the team.
  • At least 5+ years of progressive sales experience managing customers, strategies, and business.
  • University degree in business or related area.
  • Excellent business and financial acumen.
  • Consistency in delivering results focusing on overall profitability.
  • Track record of simplifying complex situations, including financials, to develop executable and profitable solutions.
  • Ability to synthesize data, insights and inferences into a coherent and logical chain that others can execute on.
  • Deep industry and market knowledge.
  • Ability to understand ML and customer goals and translate into clear and concise customer strategies with effective action plans.
  • Ability to influence and leverage cross-functional resources (dedicated and/or shared) to identify and solve strategic issues.
  • Exceptional story telling and communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Strong negotiation skills including listening, probing, identifying interests, and mutually solving problems.
  • Excellent relationship building skills (in a direct and virtual environment). Track record of leveraging relationships to maximize benefit for both parties (Maple Leaf Foods and customers).
  • Ability to effectively adapt to different personality types to maximize value out of negotiations.
  • Established track record of influencing at all levels of an organization to get things done.
  • High energy, self-motivated, and proactive.
  • Comfortable in a fast paced and high-performance culture.
  • Confidence and ability to respectfully challenge decisions and/or status quo.
  • Creative and strategic thinker who consistently looks for new and impactful ways to drive results.
  • Highly aligned to MLF Values.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
Championing diversity and inclusion is a critical component to advancing our collective purpose and vision, living the Maple Leaf Leadership Values, and delivering winning results. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired; please contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.

title: Technical Customer Success Manager (EdTech, Higher Education)
description:
Prioritizing the goals and needs of our customers is essential for our customer-first strategy here at Altus. We are expanding our Customer Success team with two new curious, caring and driven technical customer success managers to help execute best-in-class onboarding and success management of customers using our data warehouse and analytics products. As a core member of our Client Enablement team, you’ll have the opportunity to work closely with Deans and leaders in higher education, consulting alongside them to solve the unique problems of decision-makers in higher education institutions globally. You will also work with and learn from a dynamic team of experienced Technical Customer Success Managers while you help enable our company and team growth.

The work you do will contribute to our greater mission of creating a world filled with more people-centred, empathetic doctors, nurses, teachers and other professionals.

The role

You will manage the partnership with clients using our Analytics products and work to ensure they achieve their desired outcomes through how they approach and use our software. On average, you’ll work with 10-15 clients across the customer lifecycle, with a maximum of three actively onboarding at any given time. Leveraging both an understanding of our customers and the nature of their work in higher education, you will work to onboard them to new Altus products and solutions. You’ll collaborate with the Sales, Customer Success, Product and Research teams to advocate for partners' needs and ensure an increase in value.

This is a full-time position that reports to our Senior Manager, Enterprise Accounts, Jennifer Fines. We are a remote-first company with the flexibility to choose where to work within Canada.

In this role, you will:

  • Direct the client in collaboration with the sales team to develop a success plan for each new client’s onboarding
  • Ensure a successful rollout and high utilization of the software
  • Develop an ongoing plan for success with each assigned client and conduct annual Executive Business Reviews
  • Monitor account health, including data quality issues, and report the specifics to stakeholders to collaborate on solutions
  • Help support the Client Empowerment team understand Analytics and specific customer needs using the product to leverage the team’s support with your accounts
  • Assist with escalated support requests for Analytics from our Client Empowerment team
  • Engage in consultative calls with clients and relevant internal stakeholders
  • Stay up to date and current with Medical Education market needs and requirements, including competitor intel
  • Collaborate with the product team by planning onboarding tasks as development tickets and advocating for customer needs in enhancement requests for discussion
  • Create and update internal documentation on clients and their processes so our teams can collaborate for success

To thrive in the role, you:

  • Have a history of increasing customer satisfaction, adoption and retention
  • Are capable of communicating effectively with higher education leadership in consultative and training sessions
  • Have technical and/or analytical experience, in particular working with data warehousing and dashboarding products
  • Have a basic understanding of data analysis, including the ability to discuss general statistical details (correlations, mean, averages, etc.)
  • Will be curious about our Medical Education market and willing to learn about the technology landscape, data management, and accreditation requirements
  • Are resourceful, able to work both independently and cross-functionally between our teams to advocate for your clients and their success

To thrive at Altus, you are:

  • Able to live our core values of Caring, Curious, Driven while cultivating a positive and professional attitude.
  • Someone who prefers working in an entrepreneurial environment where you get to be a builder, doer, and optimizer, work autonomously, challenge the status quo and help us focus where it counts.
  • A person with loosely held yet strong opinions. You know why you want what you want and remain humble, accept that you can be wrong, and constantly seek to create better solutions.
  • Highly curious about how our business works and genuinely interested in the Higher Education and Education Technology industry.
  • Driven by our mission to create a world served by exceptional professionals.

The interview process

We designed our process to give you a positive experience and follow equitable assessment practices. We've outlined the general steps you can expect to go through below.

  • Intro Conversation. An actual human from our People & Culture team will review your application. If selected, you’ll be able to share your story and experiences and learn more about the role, team, and company in more detail. (Time allocation: 30 - 45 minutes)
  • Meet The Manager. You'll meet your potential future manager via a video call to discuss your background and experiences in more depth. (Time allocation: 30 - 60 minutes)
  • Meet The Team. You'll meet with 2-4 members of our team over a video call. They will assess your technical skills, values alignment, and how you might contribute to our culture. Before this interview, you may complete an assignment that closely mirrors some aspects of the role and present your work to the team. (Time allocation: up to 3 hours)
  • Reference Checks. We'll ask you for 2-3 professional references we can reach out to and chat about your time working together.
  • Wait For a Final Decision. While you wait, the Hiring Manager consolidates and evaluates feedback from each team member who was part of your interview process. We may reach out to you for a quick additional conversation to reach a decision.
  • Receive an Offer. If you are our match and we believe you feel the same way, we'll extend an offer and go over the details with you on a video call. (Time allocation: 20 minutes)

We offer you

  • A Competitive Salary. We've designed our total rewards strategy to compensate you above the Canadian-based tech market rate.
  • Flexible, Self-Directed Vacation. Take time off when you need it. We recommend one week per quarter in addition to federal and provincial statutory holidays and company-wide paid time off, but there are no firm rules. We trust you.
  • Company-wide Paid Time Off. We turn off our work on Altus Days (a bonus Friday off every month) and the last two weeks in December (for the Holiday Season).
  • GRSP Matching Program. If you choose to participate in our Group Registered Savings Plan program through Wealthsimple, we match your contribution up to 2% of your salary each pay period, pre-tax income.
  • Stock Option Plan. To benefit from the growth you contribute to and the opportunity for future ownership in the company, we grant you options that start vesting on your first day of employment.
  • Learning & Development Budget. We've allocated an annual budget of $3,000 you can use towards your professional and personal growth.
  • Access to Health Coverage from Day 1. You can enroll in our comprehensive health, dental, vision, and life benefits plan through Equitable Life of Canada on the day you join us.
  • Parental Leave With Top-Up. Growing your family is an exciting time, and we support and encourage you to take time off with your new loved ones. 4 months of your parental leave topped up to 80% of your salary. You can extend your parental leave with top-up payments for four months if you choose.
  • Sick Time, Other Leave. Take paid time off when you're experiencing illness, a medical or family emergency, the loss of a loved one, or need to nurture your wellness.
  • Choose Where You Work. Work from home, our office space in downtown Toronto, in a coworking space, or take your work on the road for a little while. If you live outside of the GTA and want to rent a coworking desk, we've got you covered for up to $150 per month.
  • Home Office Workspace Equipment. You'll receive a Mac laptop or equivalent of your choice, and we'll support you with other workspace accommodations you need for your home office.
  • Transparency. Through our weekly All Hands and monthly financial updates, you'll have visibility into business metrics, progress, performance and overall company health.

A little about us

At Altus, we've built a HigherEd Program Intelligence Platform that supports higher education programs and students from application to graduation. Armed with data from admissions, student assessment and program operations, schools can identify and train diverse, exceptional and people-centred professionals.

We're a quirky, vibrant, and diverse group of 140+ working together remotely across Canada to tackle challenging problems (like evaluating empathy in someone who wants to train to become a doctor) and some less tough ones (like how to answer that bonus question on Trivia Night).

Our core values are Caring, Curious, and Driven, and we embody these in everything we do. We genuinely care about the well-being of others, we possess an innate desire to learn continually, and every day we strive to be better than the person we were the day before.

We believe diverse and inclusive teams bring more perspective to the table, build better products, drive greater financial outcomes and create a better workplace. That is why we focus on being an equitable company and emphasize a culture of belonging for everyone, regardless of your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, and veteran or disability status.

Thank you for considering Altus as your next career stop!

title: Senior Sourcing and Contracts Specialist
description:
The Senior Sourcing and Contracts Specialist develops corporate-led procurement programs designed to deliver benefits to the organization by leveraging cross-business unit spend and Seaspan ULC’s position in the marketplace. This includes significant efforts to understand the business’ needs, capture all relevant requirements and pair with the supplier suited to provide Seaspan the best value. The role is responsible for managing the sourcing, bid administration, contract drafting, contract review, negotiation, renewals and administration as related to the procurement of goods and services.

Duties and Accountabilities

  • Completes day-to-day sourcing and contracting initiatives, including sourcing, market analysis, category reviews and risk mitigation strategy development.
  • Determines and applies appropriate competitive bid methods to ensure bid processes are conducted in a fair and timely manner while mitigating Seaspan’s exposure to risk.
  • Develops competitive tendering (e.g. RFP), administration, analysis and summary recommendation from inception to completion.
  • Reviews and negotiates contractual terms and conditions.
  • Seeks approval and financial authority to execute agreements.
  • Implements contractual agreements reflecting all agreed pricing, schedules, payment terms and conditions to meet company’s expectations and needs.
  • Establishes supplier internal approvals, purchase orders and transactional elements to enable agreement payments.
  • Performs routine checks-in, providing contract management support and evaluating supplier performance in accordance with agreement and other department KPIs.
  • Identifies, develops, leads and implements strategic procurement opportunities.
  • Applies cost-benefit analysis to assess opportunities that reduce costs and better serve the business.
  • Analyses spending patterns and business processes to recommend changes contributing to cost and operational efficiency.
  • Leads sourcing and contracting initiatives to capture and implement identified strategic procurements.
  • Provides leadership and technical expertise on supply chain management activities to internal customers, including sourcing and contracting advice and mentorship on established agreements.
  • Ensures the integration of procurement services processes across Seaspan and extended business partners (suppliers, customers, finance, operations, legal, risk, etc.).
  • Provides coaching and mentoring on supply chain management best practices; including best-in-class research from various industries on processes, tools, and technologies.
  • Act as a business partner to ensure compliance to Seaspan guidelines, purchasing policies and procedures
  • Supports the development of supply chain management training materials.
  • Performs additional duties as assigned.

Qualification Requirements

  • Diploma in relevant subject area (Business, Economic or Law preferred). Bachelor’s degree is desirable.
  • Completion of Purchasing Management Association of Canada (PMAC) education program for the new Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) or (former) Certified Professional Purchaser (CPP) designation, or American Purchasing Society or The Association for Operations Management (APICS) CPIM program is preferred.
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in supply chain management with a combination of operational and strategic procurement. Including experience in managing projects from start to finish (e.g. major change initiatives, policy/procedure deployment, etc.); and
  • Minimum 5 years of experience leading cross-functional business teams in strategic sourcing, contract management, supplier relationship management, and supplier development; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Experience in large company procurement preferred with experience in heavy manufacturing, construction or transportation is an asset.

Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

  • Knowledge of strategic sourcing, contracting, contract law, competitive bidding, supplier development, category management, negotiation, and contracts administration and management.
  • Ability to develop, collaborative relationships with both internal business partners and external advisors and suppliers.
  • Ability to work alone and with minimal guidance to accomplish goals and objectives.
  • Knowledge of best practices in supply chain management, procurement, material management, inventory control, distribution and logistics;
  • Knowledge of analytical techniques and financial concepts to define and solve sophisticated problems.
  • Communicate effectively verbal, written and presentation skills.
  • Interpersonal skills including problem-solving, decision-making and leadership.
  • Strong customer service focus.

title: Procurement Coordinator
description:
Position Summary: The ideal candidate will have strong interpersonal and administration skills to engage directly with supplier vendor partners, HO Accounts Payable, Director and Plant location shared team members to complete the entirety of the meat procurement purchasing activities for the organization. Reporting to the Director of Procurement, the successful candidate will be thorough, organized and keenly capable to follow the Sunrise Purchasing Process manual throughout.

PRIORITY: Completion of meat procurement order/fulfillment activities, P.O. generation and follow through, all with a high level of communication to stakeholders.

Position Responsibilities:

The following list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties rather they are intended to only describe the nature of the job:

  • Accurately follows all company purchasing policy requirements activated by purchase order and throughout the accounts payables process
  • Relationship build with the sales counterparts of all vendors, ensure status of orders to completeness and highly communicated with all stakeholders at various plant locations
  • Participates with Production Schedule process and stakeholders, updates all committed shipments and ETA’s with direct team and shared stakeholders
  • Supports management of frozen/refrigerated holding inventory (on site, third party) engaging logistics management team and process as needed, communicates regularly regarding updates to usage, damage, launch and in-process relaunch activities with greater team perpetually
  • Provide regular updates to plant leadership and Director (as needed) regarding backorders, aging reports and liabilities
  • Administration of the GRF Approved Vendor files, working with QA for onboarding new vendors and maintenance (completeness: updated Certificates of Insurance, letters of Guarantee, etc., as needed)
  • Report generation using internal measurement tools ( SysPro, Carlisle) to aid in supplier fulfillment and contract metrics

REQUIRED SKILL, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum of 3 years in a Purchasing/Procurement Administration
  • College Diploma or entrenched levels of experience with some industry association learning
  • Non durable good experience, preference for meat protein/food manufacturing environment

COMPETENCIES AND ATTRIBUTES:

  • Strong skills (written and verbal) to share ideas and engage/influence others, including customers and internal stakeholders of the Sunrise Purchasing Process
  • Strong administrative/organization skills, and responsible, demanding presence with vendors
  • Excellent Excel literacy, order entry software (SysPro or like) experience and competency
  • Evaluate business issues/risk, and engage Director of Procurement where necessary to ensure ongoing customer, plant, and company success. and understands when to engage

title: Director of Account Management
description:
Job Description

As our Director of Account Management, you will establish and execute a large-scale growth plan for our Account Management business. This person will work across the organization to ensure we can help our customers expand their use of Vention and become advocates for our solutions. This role requires a rare combination of leadership, planning, and execution skills. You are passionate about the details, very programmatic, and able to lead from the front. Specifically, you understand and are proven in establishing Account Management playbooks and scaling those across a large sales team. In particular, you understand the finesse and relationship between top-down and bottom-up motions to succeed with our customers. More specifically, you will: 

  • Mentor, coach, and lead a team of Account Managers to successfully own and develop their accounts and grow their overall book of business 
  • Contribute to the overall growth and success of Vention as part of the leadership team by being a role model for what it means to succeed and “win as one.”
  • Make a significant impact on the growth and trajectory of Vention by reinforcing and championing our client-centric culture.
  • Analyze customers to understand their goals and to sales motions that create a win-win.
  • Coach, guide, and develop the wider sales team to execute the expansion playbook, overachieve and exceed customer expectations.
  • Bring methodologies, tools, and technologies to bear that can ensure a predictable and scalable high-growth expansion business. 
  • Lead efforts to remove roadblocks to execute on customer commitments and ensure your colleagues and peers are aligned with you on these priorities. 
  • Leading by example, teach the team how to build relationships in the industry and at the executive level in existing accounts and target accounts to gain access to privileged information, manage customer expectations, and resolve conflicts.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including Sales, Application Engineering, Customer Success, Product, Delivery Services, Integration Coaches, Finance, and Operations to ensure a positive customer experience and customer growth
  • Regularly provide insightful customer requirements and knowledge from the target customers to the product and marketing teams to guide the product roadmap.
  • Champion strategies and playbooks to drive user adoption and community engagement within the expansion playbook
  • Review teams’ weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecasts of the existing and potential business for financial and operational planning for accuracy to ensure those teams make correct decisions
  • Responsible for providing bi-weekly reports to senior management of the status of their existing and target accounts to ensure senior management has the necessary information to take required actions to deliver the goals
Qualifications

  • 6-10 years of sales and/or account management leadership experience; with expertise in technology sales, with a preference for SaaS knowledge
  • Experience with both expansion and renewals sales of playbooks
  • An ambassador of the client-centric culture of selling
  • A leader who inspires the team and is proven to work with multiple teams in multiple locations enabling the team to scale 
  • Relevant industry experience a bonus
  • Experience managing a pipeline and forecasting sales with a track record of delivering sales targets and growth
  • Excellent written/verbal skills with a demonstrable ability to build consensus and drive alignment across teams and functions. 
  • Ability to think strategically and bring structure to team
  • Align with Company priorities and devise departmental annual, quarterly and monthly goals
  • Motivates team and  keeps them focused on the highest priorities
  • Located in Montreal QC or Boston, MA with ability to travel


Additional Information

We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.

title: Gestionnaire des Ventes aux Détails - Fly-in, Fly-Out - Havre Saint-Pierre (88905006)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Développez votre carrière avec une entreprise qui partage votre passion ! 

Notre Division Énergie et Ressources a une nouvelle opportunité passionnante de joindre l'équipe de Sodexo en tant que notre prochain.e Gestionnaire des Ventes aux Détails.
Cette nouvelle opportunité est basée à Fermont et fondée sur un horaire en rotation 14-14.

Sodexo s'engage à fournir un environnement de travail sécuritaire aux membres de notre équipe, clients, consommateurs, sous-traitants, partenaires commerciaux, invités et membres du public avec lesquels nous interagissons régulièrement. En tant que fournisseur de services dans de nombreux sites clients, nous exigeons que tous les nouveaux.elles employés.es soient entièrement vaccinés.es contre le COVID-19

Sodexo est le leader mondial des Services de Qualité de Vie, un facteur essentiel de la performance individuelle et organisationnelle. Présents dans 67 pays, nous servons chaque jour plus de 100 millions de consommateurs grâce à notre combinaison unique de services. Nous sommes fiers de notre engagement à respecter les normes les plus strictes en matière d'équité et de diversité. En nous associant à la Fondation Stop Hunger, nous nous sommes engagés à assumer une responsabilité corporative pour lutter contre la faim dans le monde. Commencez votre voyage avec Sodexo, alors que nous continuons à nous développer à travers le Canada ! 

Description du poste

Le gestionnaire des Ventes aux Détails est responsable de la coordination et de la direction de toutes les activités liées aux services tel que bar, restaurant et dépanneur ainsi que de tout le personnel de ces points de services. Ceci inclut, sans s’y limiter, les éléments suivants :

  • Diriger une équipe pour offrir un service de qualité constante dans un environnement multisites avec de multiples offres de vente au détail, à la fois internes et externes
  • S’assurer que les objectifs financiers fixés par le Directeur Général sont atteints
  • Servir de lien entre les opérateurs de marque et les exigences de service de marque
  • Gestion des commandes et gestion du personnel
  • Implication dans l’administration quotidienne des différentes opérations du site   
  • Implication directe dans la compréhension des opérations et s’assurer que les offres alimentaires et de service au sein du site sont alignées
  • Agir comme lien entre les besoins de clients et les offres et les services afin d’aligner l’excellence opérationnelle et la rentabilité
  • Participer à la mise en œuvre, à l'élaboration et à la proposition d'innovations et de croissance de la vente au détail actuelle.
Qualifications

  • 3 à 5 ans d’expérience en gestion Hôtelière, de Service alimentaire ou des opérations de détail.
  • Études postsecondaires en hôtellerie ou en gestion des aliments
  • Certification de centre de conférences/gestion d’événements de préférence
  • Sécurité alimentaire MAPAQ niveau gestionnaire
  • Expérience préalable dans le contrôle de la qualité des secteurs d’activité / marques
  • Maîtrise de l’analyse des applications d’information financière, y compris la gestion de la main-d’œuvre et la gestion des aliments
  • Expérience des fonctions de service, y compris la formation, la gestion du rendement, la reconnaissance et le perfectionnement
  • Solides compétences en communication, y compris les communications écrites, orales et interpersonnelles
  • Expérience démontrée dans la gestion et la direction d’une équipe diversifiée
  • Compétences efficaces en matière de planification, d’organisation et de gestion du temps
  • Proactif avec des tâches de gestion quotidiennes
  • Excellentes compétences en leadership
  • Engagement envers l’expérience client, les relations avec la clientèle et l’excellence du service
  • L’exposition aux techniques et plateformes de marketing des technologies numériques est un atout (POS)
  • Bilingue (Français et anglais)
  • Permis de conduire valide, classe 5

Je comprends qu’être complètement vacciné(e) contre le COVID-19 est une condition d’emploi pour ce rôle. Je certifie par la présente que j'ai reçu deux doses de vaccins approuvés par le Santé Canada et qu'au moins 14 jours se sont écoulés depuis la date de ma dernière vaccination. Je comprends en outre que je devrai fournir une preuve avant de commencer le travail. 



Informations supplémentaires

Ce que Sodexo peut vous offrir :   

  • Un environnement de travail flexible   
  • Une rémunération compétitive et des avantages sociaux de qualité  
  • Programmes de formation et de développement   
  • D'innombrables possibilités de croissance   
  • Responsabilité des entreprises et durabilité   
  • 2021 Meilleur Employeur au niveau de la Diversité au Canada
  • 2021 Employeur Éco Responsable au Canada
  • 2021 Campagne et Fondation des Droits Humaines – Meilleur endroit où travailler pour les communautés LGBTQ Égalité

Sodexo s’engage pour l’Équité et la Diversité en matière d’emploi. Nous ne discriminons contre aucun employé ou demandeur d'emploi en raison de l’origine nationale, la race, la religion, l’ethnie, l’âge, le handicap ou l’invalidité, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité sexuelle ou de genre, le statut de vétéran ou de toute autre classe protégée au niveau fédéral, provincial ou local.
Nous invitons et encourageons les candidatures de personnes avec invalidités. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Nous employons le masculin afin d'alléger le texte.

Nous vous remercions de l'intérêt que vous portez à Sodexo.
Veuillez noter que seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.
Suivez-nous sur les médias sociaux pour nous découvrir ! 
LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers
Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

SodexoSJB

title: Sales Enablement Manager (REMOTE / HYBRID)
description:
Company Description

In 2020, Viral Nation was voted the 4th fastest growing company in Canada. At Viral Nation, we embed brands in culture. We are not a typical ‘big agency.’ We are a team of entrepreneurs, ex-global agency leaders and big talent agency recruiters who came together with a shared vision to do things differently.

We help brands find more innovative ways to deliver better value to their communities by collaborating with the people who know them intimately, understand what they want, and create content that speaks directly to them. We move at the speed of culture and evolve quickly as needed. We continue to do this successfully for some of the world’s largest brands, including Facebook Oculus, Disney, DC Comics, TikTok and Tencent

Who are you:

Viral Nation is looking for a Sales Enablement Manager, who has dedicated channel marketing, enablement and training experience, with a proven track record and deep understanding of sales processes, methodologies, systems and operations. This role will be instrumental in leading and implementing learning programs and building scalable training sessions while supporting other key strategic program initiatives. Reporting to our Senior Director of Product Marketing, you will be exceptionally skilled at working in an innovative, fast-paced environment and help to drive demand and adoption of our products. 

 

 

Job Description

  • Develop a deep understanding of the sales channel, our competition, trends, and customer needs to identify target segments, product positioning and channel differentiation based on vertical and ABM methodology
  • Communicate our strong, compelling position and narrative for new launches to establish our value proposition and placement within the industry
  • Educate and equip internal teams to ensure they have a comprehensive understanding and can deliver clear and effective communications to customers
  • Support and contribute to go-to-market plan and marketing campaigns to create product demand and customer repurchase/upsell/cross-sell
  • Contribute to post-launch measurement and optimization recommendations for future consideration
  • Own the sales channel relationship to gather ongoing feedback and drive programs and launches into the channel
  • Design and build sales training and sales enablement content in conjunction with the product marketing primes with the goal to drive key performance metrics
  • Collaborate and lead the build of enablement assets, identify gaps, orchestrate content development, and roll out launches into the channel
  • Build sales training content that is engaging for both instructor-led and self-based learning
  • Lead the deployment of content through training sessions, events, and ongoing training efforts as needed
  • Measure the effectiveness of training content to identify gaps and areas to improve to inform future content creation
  • Continuously seek out, identify, and experiment with innovative methods of training and educating sales professionals
  • Clearly articulate the ‘WHY’ for Viral Nation related to overall company strategy and goals
  • Collaborate with Product Marketing leads to support and execute launch deliverables
Qualifications

  • 3 years experience creating content for sales professionals in a sales enablement capacity or in a learning and development role with a focus on sales SaaS products within a technical environment
  • Strong understanding of the sales environment and the different roles and responsibilities of sales
  • Proficient in sales methodologies using CRM tools: ideally HubSpot and DealHub.
  • Excellent written and communication skills
  • Excellent time management and project prioritization skills
  • A strong team player who influences behaviour builds collaboration and earns trust
  • Experience influencing cross-functional teams and working with a variety of stakeholder levels
  • Customer-centric with a solid understanding of analytics

What’s in it for you:

  • Top-tier compensation packages
  • 100% paid comprehensive health benefits plan 
  • Be supported and learn from an unrivalled leadership team with many years of digital agency and technology experience
  • Be authentic! Work with an agency that boasts above-average diversity statistics.
  • Dedicated programs to support your mental health and work-life harmony.
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • Team building and social events 
  • Work with some of the world’s most advanced, proprietary social media technologies


Additional Information

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

title: BUYER
description:
Company Description

ABOUT EACOM

At EACOM, a subsidiary of Interfor, we transform more than wood. Our talented team of 1,100 employees is committed to working, building, and growing together. Embedded in northern Ontario and Quebec communities, our mills have a long, rich history. We responsibly manage and transform forest resources into high-quality wood products. From the Canadian woodlands to the North American home building market, we strive for sustainability, collaboration, safety, and continuous improvement.

Job Description

We are looking for a Buyer for our sawmill in Timmins, Ontario.

Reporting to the Corporate buyer, you will be responsible for planning and procurement to ensure inventory efficiency at our Timmins sawmill.

You will co-ordinate the flow of information between the unit and vendors so as to meet the mill’s product and/or service needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • What you’ll be doing specifically:
  • Develop and maintain robust relationships with vendors and contractors so as to better meet product/service needs.
  • Identify vendors of materials, equipment, services, and supplies, and determine product availability, prices, and terms of service and/or product.
  • Make purchases and co-ordinate procurement, in accordance with the contracts in force, per operational needs.
  • Generate and receive purchase orders, perform pickup and stocking, and perform cycle counts.
  • Manage procurement and inventory logistics in compliance with the scheduling principles and corporate guidelines.
  • Ensure the integrity of inventory data, including changing part numbers and updating vendor documentation in the system.
  • Maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure sound procurement management.
  • Handle special orders and co-ordinate customs processes along with shipping by air, sea or land, as needed.
  • Generate and submit various reports for weekly cost reviews.
  • Perform any other duty related to the position.

What you need to succeed with us:

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Attentive to detail, analytical in nature and result oriented.
  • Ability to adapt and organize workflow in a very busy environment.
  • Self-starter and able to work with minimal supervision.
Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • Professional or college diploma in purchasing, logistics, or administration, or the equivalent.
  • Relevant experience in a similar position.
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite
  • Knowledge of SAP an asset.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: National Sales Manager
description:
In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko products quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian-owned and operated.

We are a team of creative, passionate, and entrepreneurial minds and are excited to grow our team with a motivated National Sales Manager to drive sales to our dealers across Canada as well as inspire and lead our Inside Sales team.

As National Sales Manager, you will be managing, coaching, and setting sales direction, along with maintaining key relationships at the executive level with our larger dealer accounts.

You will:
  • Prepare and manage annual sales forecasts.
  • Actively analyze territory performance and deliver monthly/quarterly reviews as well as action plans to support growth.
  • Proactively identify changes in market requirements and competitive pressures to develop sales strategies.
  • Deliver market-specific guidance to the executive team including gathering and reporting on competitive information.
  • Develop and execute operational sales plans to drive company business objectives.
  • Establish promotion calendars, new items, and post-promo analysis.
  • Provide consistent coaching to the Sales team.

What you bring:
  • 10 + years experience in senior sales roles with solid track record of sales success.
  • A highly motivated and passionate individual with a desire to drive results.
  • Ability to lead, coach, motivate and develop the sales talents of inside sales team.
  • Willingness and ability to demonstrate initiative, accept responsibility and accountability for outcomes.
  • Self-starter with entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Comfortable selling to customers both in-person and remotely.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of MS Office programs.
  • Bilingual in French and English is an asset.

What we offer:
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Weekday business hours – Monday-Friday 8 am-5 pm *Some overtime/weekend may be required during the busy season
  • Benefit plan
  • Paid vacation time
  • Company events such as summer BBQs, theme lunches, annual holiday party
  • Discount on apparel and accessories

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


About Choko Motorsports:

In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko product quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian owned and operated.
