title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Strategic Account Manager

ID # 65LE030122SAM

Location: Montreal, Quebec

Term: Full time, permanent


High Tech Genesis is looking for a manager who will be planning, communicating, and following up on your client’s projects. You'll ensure internal teams and resources are on target in reaching customer deadlines and completing assigned tasks.



The successful candidate will have the following skills:

  • A proven track record in relationship building which almost always translate into long-term partnerships
  • 3+ years prospect of closing new business opportunities and contributing to rapid growth
  • Be proactive in getting clients feedback (VoC) on their experiences with our products and services
  • Salesforce experience or another CRM and realize the value of tracking for your pipeline opportunities and using KPI to help develop a sales strategy
  • Deep understanding of B2B technology solution selling, including Cloud-based software and subscription services
  • Observing industry trends and adding more tools to your strategic plan
  • Excellent communication skills (spoken and written) in English
  • Thorough understanding and incorporate latest in technology, design innovations


Note 1: You MUST be legally entitled to work in Canada (i.e., possess Canadian Citizenship, Permanent Residency or Valid Work Permit).

Note 2: High Tech Genesis Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Note 3: In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), HTG will provide accommodation accessible formats and communication supports for the interview process upon request.

Note 4: Please submit an MS Word version of your resume when applying for this position.

Note 5: Salary is commensurate with experience.

title: Purchaser‌
description:
LMI Technologies, recognized as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces, is a medium-sized technology company built on a culture of openness, respect and professional excellence. At LMI our staff work passionately toward the common goal of designing and delivering innovative 3D machine vision solutions to OEMs and System Integrators working in industrial factory automation around the world. The result of this teamwork is high-performance, easy-to-implement and cost-effective 3D sensor technologies that deliver the best results in even the most challenging 3D inline inspection applications.

What will you do as a Purchaser?

LMI‌ Technologies is currently seeking a highly motivated, experienced and qualified Purchaser ‌to‌ join our Purchasing‌ ‌Team‌. Experience in electronics, optics, and machined parts is considered an asset. The Purchaser will be responsible for end to end supply chain activities for their assigned  portfolio of parts, some of these are listed below. 

The Purchaser will report to the Purchasing Team Lead while working closely with other Purchasers and teams. 

  • Conducts‌ ‌all‌ ‌purchasing‌ ‌activities‌ ‌in‌ ‌accordance‌ ‌with‌ ‌QMS ‌requirements.‌
  • Negotiates‌ ‌pricing,‌ ‌delivery‌ ‌requirements‌ ‌and‌ ‌quantities‌ ‌with‌ ‌suppliers‌.
  • Records‌ ‌and‌ ‌issues‌ ‌all‌ ‌Purchase‌ ‌Order‌ ‌(PO),‌ ‌carefully‌ ‌considering‌ ‌applicable‌ ‌quality‌ ‌clauses‌ ‌to‌ ‌ensure‌ ‌LMI‌ ‌requirements‌ ‌for‌ ‌purchased‌ ‌product‌ ‌are‌ ‌clear.‌ ‌
  • Monitors‌ ‌goods‌ ‌delivery‌ ‌ensuring‌ product is ‌on‌ ‌time‌ and meets the quality requirements.‌ ‌
  • Constantly‌ ‌evaluates‌ ‌suppliers‌ ‌based‌ ‌on‌ ‌their‌ ‌quality‌ ‌and‌ ‌on-time‌ ‌delivery‌ ‌performance‌ ‌and‌ ‌updates‌ ‌management ‌with‌ ‌supplier’s‌ ‌performance‌ ‌analysis.‌ ‌
  • Manages‌ ‌Non-Conforming‌ ‌materials‌ ‌and‌ ‌works‌ ‌with‌ ‌suppliers‌ ‌to‌ ‌identify‌ ‌and‌ ‌eliminate‌ ‌quality‌ ‌issues.‌ ‌
  • Maintains‌ ‌optimal‌ ‌stock‌ ‌levels‌ ‌by‌ reviewing and updating system data.
  • Ensures‌ ‌that‌ ‌technical‌ ‌documentation,‌ ‌product‌ ‌configuration‌ ‌and‌ ‌specification‌ ‌provided‌ ‌to‌ ‌suppliers‌ ‌are‌ ‌complete,‌ ‌accurate‌ ‌and‌ ‌up-to‌ ‌date.‌ ‌
  • Promptly‌ ‌notifies‌ ‌suppliers‌ ‌of‌ ‌changes‌ ‌introduced‌ ‌by‌ ‌Engineering‌ ‌Change‌ ‌Orders.‌ ‌
  • Manages‌ ‌status‌ ‌and‌ ‌update‌ ‌purchase‌ ‌order‌ ‌and‌ ‌vendor‌ ‌related‌ ‌information‌ ‌in‌ ‌Netsuite‌ ‌database.‌ ‌
  • Proactively‌ ‌contributes‌ ‌to‌ ‌and‌ ‌implements‌ ‌continuous‌ ‌improvement‌ ‌initiatives.‌ ‌
  • Adheres‌ ‌to‌ ‌LMI‌ ‌Employee‌ ‌Policy‌ ‌Manual.‌

What do you need to be successful?

  • Minimum of 3 years purchasing experience, preferably in a high tech manufacturing environment.‌
  • Relevant post secondary education - degree, diploma or designation.
  • Experience‌ ‌with‌ ‌ERP‌ ‌systems, previous MRP experience preferred.
  • Experience‌ ‌with‌ ‌Quality‌ ‌Management‌ ‌System‌.
  • Solid‌ ‌interpersonal‌ ‌skills‌ ‌to‌ ‌communicate‌ ‌appropriately‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌team‌ ‌environment.‌
  • Solid computer skills (Google sheets, docs, mail) experience preferred but will consider relevant Microsoft Office experience.

How to submit your interest?

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity and working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, please submit your application to our Human Resources team in confidence by clicking the “Apply Now” button.

While we appreciate your interest in LMI very much, we are only able to respond to candidates selected for further consideration. We look forward to talking to you about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career!

Why being inclusive is important to us?

At LMI Technologies, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds, perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilize each person’s talents and strengths.

If you are interested in working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, we invite you to apply and talk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career.

We ensure you, once you complete your application, your information is safe with us. To learn more about how we use your personal data, please review our Privacy Policy (https://lmi3d.com/privacy-policy).

title: Area Sales Director
description:
Overview

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition. Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger – a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other’s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities

Weatherford have a fantastic opportunity to join our established team in Calgary as Area Sales Director. The successful candidate will form a vital part of the sales population. They are regarded as the most senior Company Representative in the Country/Area. They will often have general management duties potentially including being a signatory for the local entity in regards to legislative and financial matters. They are responsible for the delivery of the annual revenue target as agreed with their Sales Leader for their specific area and through effective account management they are responsible for delivering an accurate revenue forecast based on the operational activity and expenditures planned by their customer(s). They are also accountable for retaining the customer base as well as identifying and successfully developing relations with new customers. They are accountable for understanding client needs and they are responsible for introducing the Weatherford portfolio of products and services across the customer matrix.

 

Responsibilities & Duties: 

  • Maintains safety and service quality as a first priorities when working across all areas of the business 
  • Upholds exemplary business principles in accordance with the FCPA and Weatherford overseas trade compliance policies, setting standards of behaviour and performance 
  • Maintains the highest standards of corporate governance, ensuring that all commercial activity is carried out ethically and in compliance with Co policies, relevant laws, regulations, standards and industry practices 
  • Responsible for the Account Plan in SFDC, communicating the plan to all stakeholders, planning resources & activities to achieve the Plans annual performance
  • Adopt and drive consistent & effective use of Technology (SFDC, XAIT-Porter) 
  • Oversee the tender development and response process, ensure all resources are available for highest quality tender submissions via the tender management process 
  • Accountable for addressing budget considerations for proposals as well as addressing technical specifications with the client in conjunction with technical sales 
  • In conjunction with Tech Sales and Sales VP/Director responsible for negotiations, including; contract extensions ensuring SFDC is kept up to date as well as liaise with legal as necessary for drafting 
  • Assemble and disseminate market intelligence including gathering client feedback 
  • Develop and execute strategic plans to strengthen WFT Identity by understanding customer/industry key objectives & challenges -emphasizing and aligning our Core Capabilities 
  • Oversee all areas of business risk and ensure strategies exist to mitigate these as much as possible 
  • Once notified by client of results of the tender process the role is accountable for arranging a debrief in the event of a loss or advising key stakeholders in the event of a win including updating SFDC 
  • Accountable for arranging & facilitating a contract handover meeting with key stakeholders and generating a contract summary sheet 
  • Accountable for reviewing contract performance and that all relevant matters are brought before management

Qualifications

  • Degree educated in relevant oilfield or business discipline would be preferred 
  • Entry level should have a minimum of 4 years industry experience in a combination of field and shore-based sales / technical support roles 
  • If not degree educated then candidates should have at least 18 years industry experience.
  • If the candidate is new to the industry then they must be able to demonstrate at least 18 years successful sales background
  • All candidates should be able to demonstrate that they are commercially astute and have a good understanding of tenders, contracts, negotiations, high margin / profitability achievement as well as the requirements for high quality customer service

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced sales manager to join our growing Business Development team in the new role of Regional Sales Manager.


The Role

In this role, you will be responsible for building, leading, and coaching a group of Regional Sales Directors, and ultimately, growing sales for the overall business. 

Working closely with new and existing sales team members, you will help coach the team to be successful prospectors of new business. Identifying effective sales techniques and effective engagement channels will be critical to your success in this role. If you are motivated not just by achieving a tough sale, but by empowering others to achieve that tough sale, this role may be for you!


The Right Candidate

  • You have a minimum 3 years of sales management experience.

  • You have experience with complex software sales (experience with HR or digital training software is an asset)

  • You have previous experience with relationship/social selling

  • You have previous experience leading/coaching a sales team, and revel in the success of others.

  • You are able to work in a highly collaborative team and are comfortable providing and accepting constructive feedback.

  • You are a clear and concise communicator and have exceptional written and verbal english skills.

  • You are comfortable communicating on a variety of platforms (in-person, virtual, phone, etc.).

  • You are competitive by nature, tempered by a friendly and outgoing personality.


Who we are

Here are the basics:  Founded in 2012, Neovation is a fast-paced, high-performance learning solutions company. We deliver extraordinary learning technologies and engaging training solutions for our global clients. You can find out more about our products and services here. 

Now, here’s what you really want to know about us: at Neovation, our team is composed of bright, passionate, and diverse professionals that motivate each other to achieve shared goals. Innovation and collaboration are celebrated, and new ideas are always encouraged!  We value every team member’s contribution.  We believe that delivering the best, most customer-focused client care, services, and products helps set us apart from the competition.

If you feel you might be a good fit for this role and want to learn more about what it means to be a Neovite, please apply on our website: www.neovation.com/elearning-careers.  


We would also like to thank everyone who chooses to apply, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/ethnicity, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or parental status, veteran status, disability, or political affiliation.

title: Mid-Market Client Success Manager
description:
Create A Better Place For Everyone

OfficeSpace is a workplace management software that gives companies everything they need - an innovative platform, an intuitive experience, and an invested team. Our customers are an extremely diverse group, from the fastest growing technology companies to traditional enterprise customers who are transitioning to a more modern workplace infrastructure. We are working every day to create a better place for everyone, especially our own teammates. 

Given the large wave of traditional enterprise customers transitioning to a modern hybrid workplace infrastructure, OfficeSpace has grown substantially since 2020. Our amazing team consists of 200 employees across the US, Costa Rica, and Canada. If you are ready to join a highly motivated team and immerse yourself in a culture built upon trust, respect, collaboration, and creativity, we would love to hear from you!

 

The Role: Mid-Market Client Success Manager

Our Mid Market Client Success Managers (CSM's) build a strong rapport with our clients, working directly with them to build strong, lasting relationships. These connections allow us to get continuous real-world feedback on our product and identify the daily challenges that workplace and facility managers encounter, and how we can help solve them effectively and efficiently.

As the client's primary contact, the client feedback you capture plays a vital role into the development of new features, workflow updates, and ultimately strengthens the relationship we have with our clients. To fulfill this vision successfully, our CSM's understand both the intricacies of our product and the complexities of software delivery. Our CSM's are knowledgeable, passionate, multi-functional and possess the drive to get things done. They possess impeccable communication skills and pay great attention to detail in every task

As a CSM, they have the entire support staff at their disposal. This allows our CSM's to focus on the client and provide an exceptional level of support to truly wow them. They know their client portfolio inside and out and can work independently with a passion for client success.

 

What You'll Do:

  • Assist clients in moving successfully through the five stages of the OfficeSpace client journey including purchasing, onboarding and implementation, launch and adoption, utilization, and expansion.
  • Develop meaningful relationships and a sense of trust with each client to identify software needs, discover how OfficeSpace's proprietary software solves for those needs, educate them on the capabilities/flexibility of our platform so that they fully understand and maximize the value of the product, and then transform them into platform advocates and champions.
  • Work with clients post-implementation to ensure they are maximizing the client's perception of value to achieve maximum ROI as quickly as possible by streamlining and executing a well-designed onboarding plan.
  • Act as the client's liaison to our internal teams in order to apply their feedback to the future product development and marketing roadmap.
  • Plan and deliver quarterly success plan reviews (SPR's) with each client to discuss integration, usage, strategic vision and further develop the relationship with the client. 
  • Own the renewal process 90 days prior to client renewal dates by guiding them through the renewal process, discussing any opportunities to increase the software's value, mitigating any churn risk, and completing the process on time.

 

The Skills, Experience, and Mindset Required:

  • Proven background and expertise in the Client Success niche, Consulting, or Sales, preferably within a B2B SaaS company.
  • Natural knack for building and maintaining high-valued outcome-based relationships combined with a passion for benefiting clients.
  • Stellar presentation skills, client management and written communication skills as well as familiarity with basic sales processes.
  • Distinct understanding of value-driven knowledge in recurring revenue business models. Experience in a SaaS environment is highly beneficial
  • Proven aptitude to train/demo products in a remote environment, ideally with enterprise software platforms.
  • Skilled in the use of Client Success and CRM software such as Gainsight and Salesforce.

 

Why OfficeSpace?

  • Competitive compensation packages, benefit options, and leave policies.
  • Fully integrated hybrid work environment allowing you to work fully remote or, if location permits, at one of our gorgeous offices in Victoria, Canada; Atlanta, USA; or Escazu, Costa Rica.
  • At OfficeSpace, we value trust above anything else. We trust our employees to take ownership of their work and set themselves up for success. Whether it's flexible hours, remote options, or anything in between, we know that people work best in different ways, and we embrace those differences
  • We work in a fast-paced industry where teams do what it takes to deliver results and help OfficeSpace succeed. We take pride in celebrating our wins and go out of our way to recognize those who have gone above and beyond.
  • Work-life balance is critical as we move to a work environment where the lines between home and office become less and less defined. We value people taking time off when they need it and being able to completely unplug from work so they can recharge their batteries.
  • Pandemic or not, we like to have fun together. Whether it's virtual happy hours, company-wide contests, or in-person holiday parties, OfficeSpace is always looking for ways to keep people happy and engaged with their teammates.

 

 

OfficeSpace is committed to building and promoting a diverse workforce and celebrates the unique qualities that individuals of various backgrounds and experiences offer. We are committed to basing all employment-related decisions upon valid job-related factors without regard to race, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), age, religion, national origin, genetic information, military status, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by law.

title: Procurement Specialist – COUPA
description:
Story Behind the Need:

• Business group: : Global Procurement Services – The Global Procurement Services (GPS) department is client central procurement function. Responsible for more than just cost savings the team plays a larger role in ensuring the Bank achieves optimal value for money spent on all third party agreements negotiated through sourcing. By leveraging suppliers’ competencies and relationships, we work to enhance organizational value. Working as a trusted advisor to the Bank.
• Project: Contributes to enabling suppliers and business users onto client Purchase to Pay (P2P) systems. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

Candidate Value Proposition:

• Be part of an exciting transformation program; not typical day-to-day role. Exposure to project and change management experience. Visibility to Bank’s leaderships.

Typical Day in Role:

• Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
• Applies knowledge of procurement best practice and general business practice to enable transactions with suppliers on client P2P systems that is consistent with Procurement Policy and Procedures, and other related policies.
• Communicates and provides education about the improved controls and efficiency gains of migrating to official client P2P technology platform(s).
• Maintains P2P self-guided training material on intranet sites.
• Recommends and enables the invoicing approach (i.e. online portal, cXML, CSV, other) that aligns to the supplier billing capabilities.
• Works with the technology team to implement integrated invoicing options otherwise facilitates the manual invoice entry.
• Interacts with business unit employees and suppliers for P2P platform onboarding, catalog set-up & maintenance, training, and initial purchase order issuance.
• Prepares and seeks approval of Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) documentation and follows procedures accordingly to ensure data quality and consistent delivery of service according to established Operating Level Agreements (OLAs).
• Prepares and seeks approval of Problem Resolution Procedure (PRP) documentation and follows procedures accordingly for efficient and consistent resolution of common problems to be solved or further escalated.
• Escalates issues to manager, suppliers, or other internal stakeholders and tracks to resolution.
• Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

• 1-2 years of P2P experience. Supplier enablement onto P2P platforms.
• Good knowledge of COUPA platform. Need to have a decent understanding of how it works.

Nice-To-Have Skills:

• COUPA Certification
• Experience with CXML integrations

Soft Skills Required:

• Excellent communication skills
• Analytical skills
• Able to hit the ground running
• Able to work independently
• Able to manage multiple stakeholders

Education:

• Post-Secondary Degree – Business Degree preferred

Candidate Review & Selection:

• 1st round with HM – 1 hour
• 2nd round with Senior Manager– 30 minutes

title: Canada Inside Sales Manager
description:
Company Description

At BorderBuddy, we're working hard to be the leading customer-centric company in the customs brokerage industry. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people. BorderBuddy is seeking an experienced Sales Manager to join our Leadership team. In this role, your top priority is to drive the revenue goals by developing our sales agents and working closely with the marketing and operations lead to ensure the process for our customers is effortless from start to finish. For you to thrive in this role, you must be aligned with our company's core values. You will look for creative and innovative solutions to everyday problems and are driven to be the best at what you do. You're able to evolve and adapt quickly in environments where regulations and processes change constantly. You have an ingrained sense of curiosity and are driven to have a huge impact on the results of the company. While you are comfortable with the unknown, you continue to learn and be curious. 

 

If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply today!

Job Description

  • Work by the BorderBuddy Core Values    

    • Customer Obsession

    • Create & Simplify

    • Learn & Be Curious

    • Own The Outcome

    • Collaborative Team Players

    • Attention To Detail & Quality

  • Maintain and keep current detailed records, reports, and customer data

  • Manage and resolve any conflicts or issues with customers in a timely manner within required guidelines. Develop action plans with the customer to prevent recurrence for sales within BorderBuddy

  • Build a detailed understanding of the mix of business and sales opportunities; share recommendations with the Leadership Team

  • Tracking weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance and sales metrics

  • Mentor, coach, motivate and guide other Sales team members to ensure consistent sales process (e.g., use of Sales Tools, Pricing Guidelines, Best Practices, etc

  • Work with the sales team and any internal resources to improve sales margins

  • Develop and maintain strong personal relationships with parties that refer business to BorderBuddy (Champions)

  • Driving key sales initiatives to successful outcome

  • Actively assess and improve current sales tools, presentation materials, sales collateral, playbooks, pitches, messages, etc.

  • Collaborate with Operations and Sales team members to foresee and avoid potential service issues ensuring customer service expectations are met and exceeded

  • Managing and improving all current workflows within external platforms (pipedrive, dialpad, front, surecall)

Learn ,contribute and implement best practices, meet expectations set out in quarterly metrics, objectives and KPI's

 

30 Days: You’re starting from scratch, and should begin by answering, “What does success look like in the first 30 days?”

  • Understand company's key services

  • Understand what makes BorderBuddy different and unique

  • Understand the importance and execution of Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS)

  • Attend weekly L10 Meetings

  • Understand the high level priorities for the company and the team

  • Connect with members of the leadership team to understand and assess workflow and  process improvements

  • Understand all lead generation channels and workflows

60 days: During the second month, you’ll be able to spend more time in the field. By the 60-day checkpoint, your goal should be to get in the game – show that you can handle the workload and that you’re ready to succeed on the team

  • Facilitate / Scribe weekly L10 meetings

  • Assess and provide suggestions for a proven sales process

  • Understand the customer experience, including what’s working well and where your team can better support customers

  • Understanding the employee experience, including what’s working well and where you can better support your team

  • Lead, manage and be accountable for all direct reports & vendors 

  • Identify and recommend 3 process improvements

90 days: Your plan for days 61-90 should cover how you’ll establish and build relationships, as well as how you’ll provide feedback and input into your own sales organization to drive broad impact      

  • Create and share plan to attend industry related events, auctions and trade shows

  • Create and implement outbound sales campaign plan

Build 1-2 referral (champion) relationships a month

Qualifications

  • 2 years in B2B sales or Sales leadership role consistently meeting or exceeding targets within a service-based industry.

  • Willingness and passion to quickly learn skills and knowledge that you don’t currently possess

  • Highly motivated and self-sufficient, able to work successfully under pressure and in the face of ambiguity – proactively identify when it’s necessary to take certain steps and move ahead with confidence

  • Strong Collaboration, communication, creative thinking and decision making skills

  • A high tolerance for ambiguity and the ability to manage change with an action-oriented drive – must thrive in a dynamic environment.

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbal and written form. Must be fluent in English.

  • Self-motivated and hardworking.

  • Excellent time management and planning skills.

  • BBA, sales, entrepreneurship or equivalent experience

Industry knowledge in logistics/ customs is preferred



Additional Information

Working Conditions

  • This is a 100% Remote Position

  • 8:00 - 4:30 pm Monday to Friday with weekends off

  • We offer a competitive salary, benefits (health & dental), RRSP program, tuition reimbursement programs, professional training, and paid time off.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Manager, Sales and Service
description:
Manager, Sales and Service

Requisition Id: 320348
Business Unit: LTL
Location: 

Regina, SK, Canada, S4N4Y7

 

Solutions driven success.

 

XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO Logistics, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO. 

 

As the Manager of Sales and Service, you’ll be recruiting, selecting, training and supervising employees, as well as providing shipping and logistics solutions to customers in the local sales territory. We’ll count on your experience to maximize employee engagement and maintain ongoing and impactful communication on every level, creating a positive work environment that boosts productivity and dedication. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.

 

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.

 

What you’ll do on a typical day:

  • Supervise all employees reporting to the Service Center, including tracking and auditing employees’ hours, handling payroll issues and personnel changes, administering corrective action and monitoring coaching, training and development
  • Plan the daily manpower needs to ensure freight is delivered and picked up in a timely manner
  • Provide clear and frequent information and guidance to all employees about Service Center productivity and XPO policies and procedures
  • Monitor, analyze and implement all opportunities to cut costs and improve efficiencies; maintain a clean and safe working condition of the facility and equipment
  • Conduct face-to-face customer visits to drive increases in local sales and to support local sales in national and strategic accounts    
  • Grow share of wallet within existing customer base; gain shares from new customers and grow overall market share within your assigned territory
  • Negotiate contracts and pricing with customers 
  • Route proper documentation and procedure control for hazardous material shipments

What you need to succeed at XPO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:

  • 4 years of related work experience
  • Experience in a Less-than-Truckload (LTL) environment
  • A valid driver’s license
  • Availability to work a variety of shifts, including days, evenings, nights and weekends; travel as needed

It’d be great if you also have:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related work or military experience
  • 1 year of experience in a supervisory role
  • Thorough knowledge of LTL industry, transportation rules and regulations, OSHA laws, hazardous materials regulations, NMFC and Tariff rules, and company policies
  • Transportation, Logistics and LTL sales experience; proven track record of sales success and great customer relations
  • Experience working with Salesforce.com or another CRM
  • Business to Business selling experience and use of Business to Business based negotiating tools
  • Outstanding leadership, mentoring and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical skills

This job requires the ability to:

  • Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights (up to 50 lbs. frequently and greater than 75 lbs. occasionally)
  • Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel
  • Walk and stand for extended periods of time on a loading dock that is not climate-controlled and may be slippery

Be part of something big.

 

 

XPO is a leading provider of world-class solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make XPO a great place to work.


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability or other protected status.

 

 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time as needed. Review XPO's candidate privacy statement here. 

 

 If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@xpo.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying. 

 

 Accommodation email must include:
•    Your name
•    Job title with location (city/province) and requisition ID
•    A clear description of the disability accommodation that you are seeking


Job Segment:Service Manager, Payroll, Sales Management, Outside Sales, Customer Service, Finance, Sales

title: Purchasing Coordinator (18 Month Contract)
description:
Location



Toronto - 3381 Steeles Avenue East, Suite 100



Business




As part of Brookfield Asset Management — one of the largest alternative asset managers in the world — we harness our resources to bring a fresh approach, unparalleled creativity, relentless innovation, and sound ESG practices to the planning, development, and management of buildings everywhere. From offices, retail spaces, and logistics facilities to multifamily residences, hospitality establishments, and mixed-use structures — we are reimagining real estate from the ground up.




We see tomorrow, today. At Brookfield Properties, we’re a fully integrated developer so we know what it takes to go from concept to concrete, from blueprint to building. From vision, experience, resources, and ethics, every day we take these ingredients to partner with our communities, collaborating with the places where we work, customizing developments to meet the neighborhoods’ specific needs, and identifying the highest and best use for each property to create unique and lasting places that bring people together. Learn more (https://www.brookfieldproperties.com/en/our-businesses/development.html) .




If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply




Job Description




Your Team


Reporting to the Manager of Operations, Contracts & Purchasing, the Purchasing Coordinator (18 Month Contract) liaises between the contracts & purchasing department, trades, suppliers, consultants, accounting, marketing, warranty care and sales staff to ensure the accuracy of information for production. This position will play an integral role in the preparation of tender documents and oversee the entire tender process. May also be required to issue purchase orders and change orders to the trades. ​


Your Key Deliverables


Purchasing:

+ Review approved addendums from décor/sales and issue associated purchase orders to the trades in a timely manner

+ Review invoice discrepancies and approve or revise purchase orders as required. Investigate with appropriate trades for amounts that are being disputed based on contractual agreements, in accordance with approved corporate policies.

+ Assist Options Coordinator with data entry into Newstar as required

+ May assist with inputting new models into Newstar Enterprise for new and existing communities.

+ May assist with reviewing room measures provided by internal estimator/trades and inputting them into Newstar Enterprise for new models.

+ Maintain and update scope of work documents as required to include in tender packages

+ Assist with the preparation of tender documents for new or existing projects

+ Assist with the review of tender submissions for extras/upgrades

+ Participate in trade negotiations and awarding contracts

+ Liaise with Assistant Contracts Manager and Options Coordinator to ensure that contracts are up to date and that any proposed changes or updates are communicated and reviewed with the team

+ Meet and coordinate with trades as required.

+ Perform other duties as required






Must Haves

+ Post-secondary degree in Construction Management/Administration or suitable combination of post-secondary and work experience in pricing and procurement or construction

+ 1-2 years of residential construction experience, with strong construction process knowledge

+ Proficiency in MS Office applications, specifically in Excel

+ Experience using builder softwares such as Newstar Enterprise is a plus

+ Ability to read working drawings, engineering drawings and trade layouts

+ A sound understanding and technical foundation of various building types, traditional subcontractor work scopes, construction systems and methods, construction specifications, building codes and requirements, construction tendering practices, and contract types

+ Attention to detail and strong ability to multi-task

+ Excellent computer and organizational skills

+ Motivation, integrity and a positive attitude








COVID-19 Hiring Status


All new hires must be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 prior to starting employment.



We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Territory Manager - Cumberland County, Northumberland Shore and Cape Breton
description:
Big Erics is celebrating 75 years in business!
As a proudly family-owned and female lead company, Big Erics employs a diverse workforce throughout the Atlantic Region while working to serve customer needs across North America. With commercial/retail locations in Halifax and St. John's, and sales reps throughout the Atlantic region, our experienced team is committed to providing quality products, value-added services, and the latest innovations to support our customers' success. We are a leader in end-to-end product and serviced based solutions spanning food preparation and service, food safety, facilities maintenance, cleaning, and sanitation.


For more information on Big Erics visit http://bigerics.com


What makes Big Erics a great place to work?
Our Employees and our Customers!
Big Erics is proud to be a leading distributor of supplies, equipment, and industrial chemicals for the food service, janitorial, sanitation, confectionary, education, healthcare , and manufacturing sectors in Atlantic Canada.
Our leadership team is focused on attracting and retaining the best talent in the region. With our continuous evolution, we are currently looking for a permanent full time Territory Manager (Outside Sales Representative) in the Cumberland County, Northumberland Shore and Cape Breton areas. Reporting to the Director of Sales, Maritimes, the Territory Manager will develop, maintain, and grow new and existing customers by promoting the company’s full range of products, with emphasis on expanding customer portfolio and increasing sales volume. We offer a base salary plus commission, complete with group health & benefits package, pension contribution and vehicle allowance + mileage.


If you are an outgoing, high energy problem solver that goes the extra mile to satisfy clients’ needs, please join our team.


What you’ll be doing:
• Building new relationships by identifying and pursuing new customers; conducting cold calls for potential leads
• Become an expert on our products & services to provide customers with solutions that will help their business success
• Become a trusted partner to our customers by providing exceptional service
• Meet and exceed budgeted sales and profit targets
• Using our internal systems to enter orders, create quotes, follow-up on orders and track delivery

Requirements:
• Must have sales experience, ideally at least five years of outside sales experience with a track record of success.
• Managing existing business accounts as well as developing long-term relationships with new clients; Experience with new business prospecting and customer relationship management is essential.
• Experience in the restaurant service industry, food equipment/janitorial industry is considered an asset.
• Have an entrepreneurial mindset and ability to work independently and bring new idea to the table.
• A professional with strong customer service and superior communication skills
• An optimistic attitude with the ability to stay positive in difficult situations
• Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office Suite is essential and knowledge of SAP would be an asset
• Valid drivers’ license with a ‘clean’ record and reliable transportation is required
• Must be able to pass a pre-employment background check and provide proof of full vaccination
• Willingness to learn!

To apply for this position, please submit a resume, answer all of the questions and complete a short questionnaire.  Applications will be accepted on or before Thursday May 5, 2022

title: Senior Buyer
description:
Senior Buyer


Position Description


Job Summary


The Sr. Buyer will be responsible for the procurement of parts, equipment, and materials. He/She will identify suppliers, negotiate prices, monitor supplier performance, support timely payment processing, and address supplier quality issues. The Sr. buyer will support our customers by monitoring and supporting requirements and inventory levels. He or she will support new product introductions, evaluate the existing and potential supply base for lowest total cost, highest quality and superior performance and drive cost reductions to the bottom line. He or she will manage complex tasks independently and act as the primary liaison between the internal customer and the supplier on major issues. He/She must be able to manage their workload with minimal supervision, must be able to multi-task and be able to take the lead on addressing and resolving problems.


Required Qualifications


+ Complete purchase requests with domestic and international suppliers by inputting purchase orders, expediting deliveries, and verifying all transactions.

+ Handle correspondence concerning over-shipments, delivery shortages, changes in quantity, delivery dates, and prices and report such changes to the interested parties in a timely manner.

+ Act as a liaison between suppliers and involved departments to resolve procurement related problems.

+ Ensure stock status is reviewed and acted on routinely to ensure requisitions are placed in a timely fashion. Pro-actively communicate with internal customers when issues arise.

+ Confirm, acknowledge and monitor purchase orders. React to SAP exception messages including expediting materials, updating PO status and interacting with the local team and suppliers to have material when needed.

+ Process non-conforming material requests and RMA (CPAR) requests with supply chain partners.

+ Plans, purchases and expedites material, equipment and services on a broad assignment basis usually involving important and critical items.

+ Authorize payment for purchases by reviewing invoices and related documentation.

+ Resolve receiving, pricing, transport, issues as it pertains to procurement.

+ Maintain appropriate inventory levels / safety stock levels consistent with targeted inventory goals and as set by management.

+ Monitors the maintenance of records regarding pricing and ordering of materials; prepares reports analysis and recommendations

+ Maintain accuracy of stock code information within SAP, including lead-time, pricing, current supplier information, current purchase order data, etc.

+ Ensure SAP parameters are maintained by monitoring minimum, maximum safety, and current inventory levels; making recommendations to management for adjustments to levels.

+ Performs an active role in the Vendor Selection and Assessment process. Seeks new sources of supply, perform periodic performance evaluations; generates on-time delivery reports.

+ Meets with key suppliers, and document performance results in accordance with internal operating procedures.

+ Analyzes purchase price variances and assists in the development of standard product costs.

+ Attends regular meetings for specific product lines and understand materials impact

+ Assists in the creation and maintenance of the Part Maintenance file in the manufacturing database as it pertains to Procurement.

+ Monitor supplier performance by ensuring that product is delivered as scheduled and meets specifications; maintaining appropriate files and records of meetings with suppliers to ensure company requirements are met and that supplier is aware of their performance.

+ Maintain services and office equipment by conferring with suppliers; monitoring and recording service agreements to ensure terms are met.

+ Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops and training.

+ Contribute to team effort by accomplishing other job related tasks as needed; enabling other workers to achieve their job objectives.


Additional Description


+ The internal and external lead-time, re-order point and the lot size must be updated on a regular basis and the latest data must be entered in SAP system.

+ Any known delivery delays or Issues need to be communicated to production.

+ Communicate frequently with internal customers and suppliers regarding, customer service, process improvements and cost saving ideas.

+ Maintain strong relationship with internal Customers (Manufacturing, R&D, Product management, Quality Groups and Facilities). Respond immediately to requests. •Anticipate and prepare for potential issues. Document lessons learned.

+ Demonstrate effective utilization of existing purchasing planning policies, procedures, systems, and documented processes. Recommend and drive improvements. Keep up to date on best practice purchasing skills.

+ Reporting - Complete various reporting requirements, including customer service; cost savings tracking, and supplier performance.

+ Train new department personnel in Purchasing procedures, systems, documented processes, and lessons learned.

+ Establish blanket purchase agreements with vendors setting dollar limitations and time of contract limitations.

+ Support all WCP (World Class Purchasing) requirements


Company Summary


Saint-Gobain Abrasives is the world’s leading manufacturer of abrasives, offering powerful, precise and user friendly solutions enabling customers to shape and surface finish all types of material even the most complex and challenging applications across a diverse range of markets. Every team member is encouraged to develop and leverage their unique expertise and strengths to make the greatest impact on the company and our end users.


Legal Statement


Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).


Senior Buyer


Location: Plattsville, CA-ON


Posting Date: 04/25/2022


Job Code: CAN00100


See yourself here (https://maps.google.com/?q=SG+Canada+-+Abrasives PLATTSVILLE CA-ON)

title: Inside Sales Manager
description:
Company Description:

MaxSold, the leading estate sales marketplace, empowers buyers and sellers to extend the life of things for new generations to love.  With presence in Canada and the US, MaxSold serviced 1,157 communities and 116,630 clients in 2020.  By 2031, MaxSold aspires to be the global market leader for downsizing, estate sales and clearing excess items.  MaxSold is known for its dedication to its core values: Commitment to Customers, Accountability for Results, and Resourcefulness in Achieving our Mission.

Position Description:

Reporting to the Director of Sales,  the Inside Sales Manager is a strong sales leader,  responsible for leading, developing and growing our inbound sales team. The Inside Sales Manager will help to drive the company forward into our next stage of growth, leading an expanding remote team.  This role involves providing exceptional relationship, solution selling and coaching skills for someone who has a proven track record of driving growth in complex and ever-changing business environments and market lifecycles.  It is a team-centered environment which embraces a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encourages teams and leaders to bring their best each day, which in extension drives exceptional sales results. 

Our company is in a state of rapid growth and that can be scary for some! The Inside Sales Manager will not be intimidated by rapid growth, rather find excitement and challenge in supporting it!  Using innovation and thinking â€œoutside of the boxâ€ you will be developing and implementing strategy to ensure the success of your team. Commitment, accountability and resourcefulness are MUST HAVES for this role. If you want to join a company where you have the power to influence growth while having a lot of funâ€¦.this is the job for you!

This position is a remote (work from home) position and therefore you must meet the minimum IT requirements of High speed internet, minimum speed of 10-15Mbps download and 4-6Mbps upload." If you are unable to meet these requirements, unfortunately, you will not be considered for this role.

 

You will have primary responsibility for:

  • Leading a large inbound sales team and delivering results.
  • Formulating and executing on monthly and quarterly sales plans and ensuring your team achieves success in meeting targets.
  • Managing productivity, funnel of opportunities and quality to ensure the team meets established goals. 
  • Providing coaching and mentoring to encourage growth of individual team members.
  • Assisting in the recruitment, onboarding and training of new outbound team members.
  • Assisting in the ongoing improvement and enhancement of policy and processes and implementing new systems as required.
  • Conducting weekly call reviews and monthly progress review sessions with every member of your team. 
 

Work/Life Balance

Our team values work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between personal and professional life is crucial to happiness and success at MaxSold. We are happy to offer a flexible schedule so team members can have a more productive and well-balanced lifeâ€”both in and outside of work.

 

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and weâ€™re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better, more well-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

 

Inclusive and Diverse Culture

Here at Maxsold, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Our core values and leadership principles guide our team members to seek diverse perspectives, to learn from one another, to be curious and to build trust. 

Required Qualifications

  • 5 years of progressive sales experience.
  • 3 years of sales management experience with proven results in building, growing and managing highly prolific sales team(s).
  • A strong customer focus - personally demonstrated that both external and internal customers are high priority by identifying. and responding to needs in a timely manner.
  • Initiative - recognizing opportunities and initiates actions to capitalize on them by looking for new and productive ways to make an impact.
  • Innovative thinking - embraces and champions new ideas and encourages others to do likewise.
 

In addition:

  • You have a drive to continuously improve.
  • You strive to do the right thing, every time.
  • You are happy to give thanks to those who deserve it.
  • You are comfortable in admitting your mistakes and open to learning from them.
  • You want to make an impact, every day!

 

MaxSold is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MaxSold is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Internal Sales Manager
description:
The Internal Sales Manager will be accountable for remotely managing, supporting and developing PVA Consulting Group’s (PVA) Business to Business (B2B) internal sales team. The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic group of passionate professionals working in an organization that values its employees and is committed to their well-being. For 30 years PVA has established a longstanding and proven track record providing its clients with measurable and sustainable Continuous Improvement (CI) results.

 

Supporting the VP’s of Business Development, the Internal Sales Manager will be expected to support sales calls at C-Level and meeting targets within the team based on growth and revenue targets

 

Working alongside PVA’s Vice Presidents of Business Development the Internal Sales Manager will participate in developing and implementing comprehensive sales and marketing strategies that will align internal and external sales efforts and assist in developing new sales channels, such as through social media.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Remotely manages, supports and motivates the internal B2B sales team
  • Manages the CRM system (GoldMine) and ensures data integrity
  • Coaches the internal sales team with effective tactical and technical strategies
  • Generates and maintains timely Executive Sales Reports and KPI’s
  • Maintains daily/weekly communication with Directors and VP’s of Business Development to ensure effective alignment with all sales efforts
  • Develops and updates internal sales procedures as needed
  • Responsible for researching new geographic and business sectors
  • Assists in updating all sales collateral such as brochures
  • Actively participates in the hiring process for the interal sales team
  • Assists in the development of new sales channels, such as through social media

Skills set and aptitudes requirements

  • A proven background with a minimum of 5 years of experience in business development through internal sales and cold calls at C-Level
  • Three to five years remotely managing an internal sales team
  • Skilled in the use of CRM systems, such as GoldMine, Act
  • Proficient in the use of Webex, Office 365 including Excel and Teams
  • Familiar with conducting sales and market research
  • An effective leader and communicator
  • A strong sense of urgency, and works well under pressure
  • Proven coaching and training abilities
  • Organized, ability to prioritize, high attention to detail and respectful of timelines
  • Creative and innovative
  • Bilingual (English and French) would be an asset

What we offer:

  • An opportunity to join a well-established Management Consulting firm and be part of a results-oriented team environment, supported by a passionate group of professionals.
  • A competitive salary
  • 3 weeks paid vacation
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance coverage on the date of hire
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • RRSP Program
  • Paid sick days
  • Mentorship Program
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

title: Planificateur de demande/acheteur
description:
Planificateur de demande/acheteurFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Rejoignez la division ABB Produits d'installation, fabricant numéro un de produits d'électrification en Amérique du Nord comptant 125 ans d'expérience en innovation et en solutions axées sur les clients afin de connecter et protéger les systèmes électriques, ainsi qu'une offre unique démarquée de moyenne tension. Nos produits sont utilisés tout autour de vous, chaque jour - en orbite autour de la Terre, en travaillant sur Mars, dans les trains les plus rapides que nous empruntons, dans les voitures les plus rapides du monde, en traversant les océans, dans les usines produisant votre nourriture, dans les immeubles les plus hauts du monde, dans les hôtels les plus modernes et même dans les murs de votre maison. Avec une gamme de produits comportant plus de 200 000 articles sous plus de 38 marques de commerce de première qualité, les offres de la division ABB Produits d'installation sont disponibles partout où l'on utilise de l'électricité. Nous recherchons une personne extrêmement motivée et énergique qui se joindra à notre équipe en tant que Planificateur de demande/acheteur.
Vos responsabilités

  • Participer à toutes les tâches de planification de demande, notamment l'estimation de la demande de produits à venir, l'analyse de la circulation des stocks et l'élaboration de modèles de prévision.
  • Élaborer des modèles de prévision efficaces en fonction des tendances de l'industrie et de la demande.
  • Soutenir la direction en ce qui concerne les évaluations des risques et les activités d'atténuation.
  • Proposer et mettre en œuvre des solutions pour améliorer l'exactitude des prévisions de la demande.
  • Communiquer efficacement les prévisions et les estimations des stocks à la direction.
  • Surveiller les changements importants dans les prévisions de vente, les budgets et les stratégies commerciales, et en faire état.
  • Effectuer un ajustement mensuel des prévisions.
  • Aborder les problèmes liés à la demande de manière efficace et en temps opportun.
  • Contrôler les niveaux de stocks à l'intérieur du groupe de marchandises attribué au moyen des politiques et procédures établies.
  • Travailler avec l'ordinateur principal du système, produire et analyser les exigences du MRP et exécuter le plan d'action en conséquence (c.-à-d. passer des commandes d'achat, annuler, accélérer, reporter).
  • Effectuer des suivis quotidiens, hebdomadaires et mensuels auprès des fournisseurs au sujet de leurs commandes ouvertes.
  • Assurer la liaison entre ABB et notre base de fournisseurs concernant divers aspects et services (c.-à-d. Qualité, Ingénierie, Gestion des matériaux).
  • Interagir avec le service à la clientèle, à l'intérieur des services de vente et de marketing pour ce qui est de l'analyse, de la prise de décisions et de l'exécution de toutes les activités quotidiennes concernées par les activités d'approvisionnement.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Baccalauréat en gestion des opérations, en commerce ou l'équivalent.
  • Expérience en utilisation du système de plateforme de gestion intégrée (ERP), idéalement sur la plateforme AS400; connaître. SAP est un atout.
  • Capacité d'exécuter plusieurs tâches simultanément dans un milieu où les activités se déroulent à un rythme rapide.
  • Une approche collaborative axée sur les solutions et d'excellentes aptitudes de communication et d'analyse.
  • Être bilingue, à l'oral et à l'écrit (français et anglais).
  • Être à l'aise d'apprendre de nouveaux systèmes.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Programme bien-être
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.

title: Sales Director, Canada
description:
Board Americas is looking for a results-driven Sales Director to join our team as part of our continued expansion in the Americas. Founded in 1994, Board International has built the most agile, flexible, scalable and comprehensive platform over the last 25 years. This well-established, global company is headquartered in Chiasso, Switzerland with offices in over 25 countries throughout the world. We are looking for Sales Directors to help drive our growth in the Canadian Market. Despite our tenure as a market leader, Board still offers the dynamic collaboration and innovation of a start-up environment. We welcome any applicant who will make an impact on this fast-growing and evolving culture.

This opportunity is ideally suited for a candidate with proven ability and experience of driving new business in the enterprise market through close cooperation with internal stakeholders such as Marketing, Business Development, Pre-Sales and Professional Services teams. This position reports to the Country Manager of Canada and can be a remote, work-from-home position that will require some travel.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Gain a broad understanding of the Board platform to effectively position the value proposition of our comprehensive solutions to your Named Account list.
  • Manage and own the full sales cycle from prospecting, qualification and contract negotiations
  •  Build and maintain a pipeline of high-quality opportunities by leveraging our Business Development team, as well as through outbound territory development
  • Meet and exceed sales targets within your assigned territory through the effective management of multiple simultaneous sales cycles
  • Work successfully in a team environment to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5 years of experience in enterprise sales, selling CPM, ERP, or BI software solutions
  • Strong technical aptitude to learn the BOARD platform and explain complex solutions
  • Knowledge of Accounting and/or Financial concepts
  • Familiarity with Budgeting, Planning, and Forecasting processes, Business Analytics, Data Visualization, Data Management, and Financial Reporting
  • A self-starter who works well within a strong team culture while independently managing his/her own work
  • Proven ability to meet and exceed a sales quota
  • Outstanding communication skills
  • Experience working with Salesforce.com

Board International is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Your personal data will be stored for as long as it is necessary to process the job applications that you submitted and for the provision of the service that you requested. Your personal data may also be processed for the fulfillment of the obligations provided for by law. Your data will in any case be deleted without unjustified delay once the aforementioned legal obligations have been fulfilled. Your personal data are collected and used by Board International SA and/or its subsidiaries that are located in the EU or outside on the basis of the appropriate safeguards provided by the European Regulation 2016/679. At any time you may request to access, to correct and/or delete your personal data used by Board International SA or by its subsidiaries for recruiting purposes.

For further question, please refer to our Privacy Policy at https://www.board.com/en/privacy-policy

title: Territory Manager, Barrie
description:
We are the premier foodservice distributor in Ontario. We meet our customers' unique needs by delivering superior service, value and flexibility. This mission is made possible by attracting the best talent in the industry and treating our employees like family. Proudly named one of Canada's Best Managed for the 8th year in a row! 

Join our winning Sales Team for the Barrie region!

 

What itâ€™s all about:
You are an outgoing, tenacious sales professional with a commitment to service excellence. You have a passion for people, business and impeccable service. Your focus is on strengthening Flanaganâ€™s brand and presence in your territory and ensuring our customers have everything they need to make their business, restaurant, and institution successful. You have high attention to detail and can hit the ground running. You thrive in a fast-paced, target driven environment and enjoy working in partnership with a diverse team of people to deliver the best possible results.

What we offer you:

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Pension and RRSP plans
  • A Profit Sharing Program
  • Comprehensive Flexible Benefits
  • Paid Personal Days and a day off for your Birthday!
  • Family oriented culture
  • And much more!

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Growing sales and margin dollars within a designated territory in the Barrie area by increasing business with new and existing customers, ensuring category development and overall customer profitability;
  • Providing individualized sales plan by identifying product lines which best fit the customer;
  • Provide strategic business partnership: Plan sku's listings, targets, budgets, advertising, promotions, etc.;
  • Proactively identify, pursue and maintain a constant pipeline of potential customers that will meet or exceed established quotas via prospecting, networking and referral activities within designated territory;
  • Develop an individual territory strategy and communicate updates regularly on progress.

What we need:

  • Previous sales experience is required and proven sales track record;
  • College Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business and Marketing;
  • Strong organizational and priority management skills;
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills;
  • Superior level of experience providing distribution solutions and negotiation skills;
  • Must have proficient computer skills, should be familiar with Microsoft Office products (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook);
  • Incumbent must have own vehicle and valid Ontario Driverâ€™s license and be willing to use personal vehicle during the performance of his/her duties as required.

 

Be part of the difference!

 

Flanagan Foodservice Inc. is an equal opportunity employer, and has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let us know by submitting your request to accessibility@flanagan.ca so that arrangements can be made for the appropriate accommodations.

title: Associate Director of Sales - (Job Number: TOR001549)
description:
Description

Join our Sales team as an Associate Director of Sales at the Park Hyatt Toronto. Toronto’s effervescent Yorkville neighborhood is one of the city’s shining jewels. Lined with upscale boutiques, Victorian-era homes, and chic restaurants, the posh enclave still retains some of its artsy vibes—leftover from its past life as a bohemian hub for musicians. Here is where you’ll find Park Hyatt Toronto, surrounded by world-class institutions like the Royal Ontario Museum and University of Toronto-St. George Campus. We are looking for a leader who can motivate a passionate sales team while building relationships to grow business and revenue for the hotel. The Associate Director of Sales is a key member of the assistant leadership team.



WHAT ARE THE ADDITIONAL BENEFITS TO WORKING AT THE park haytt toronto?

  • Incentive program that is paid out quarterly with a year-end achievement status based on actualized revenues to goal achievement.
  • Complimentary meal during shift
  • Paid medical days
  • Employer RRSP Matching Contributions
  • Complimentary hotel nights and discounts at Hyatt properties around the world
  • Extended Health and Dental medical benefits for you and your dependents 30 days after joining
  • Tuition reimbursement program

What is exepcted of me in this role

  • Support team with consistent coaching, identify their development and training needs, in a manner that compliments Hyatt’s purpose of caring for people so they can be their best
  • Develop team to ensure they deliver the Park Hyatt Toronto brand experience to every guest through demonstrating and modeling behaviors
  • Develop talent acquisition plans and focus on succession planning and building bench strength within the sales team
  • Organize the team in an efficient manner according to business needs and delegate responsibility accordingly
  • Translate strategic and business goals into concrete and individual actions and objectives
  • Set achievable yet challenging team and individual targets for the store; assess, monitor, and manage performance to ensure these goals are achieved
  • Manage and motivate the team to drive the business: create a positive work environment, empower the team, encourage innovative solutions
  • Promote the facilities of the hotel for banquet hall bookings, F&B and corporate meetings
  • Ensure hotel representation at Trade Shows and Sales blitzes


FIND YOUR PLACE AT HYATT


Be a part of something bigger. Enjoy life every day. Make a difference in the lives of those around you. Love where you work. Join a family that values respect, integrity, humility, empathy, creativity and fun, your perfect opportunity.


At Hyatt, diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of our purpose,to care for people so they can be their best.


Qualifications

Experience

  • Sales experience in hotel, airline, luxury retail or travel related industry is preferred
  • Desire to learn and continually adapt to changing market conditions
  • Natural relationship builder and strong desire to work as a partner with customers
  • Creative thinker motivated by innovation and trying new ideas
  • Results-driven achiever highly motivated by goals and recognition
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and time management skills
  • Proven sales experience with the ability to lead, guide and achieve personal revenue goals
  • Highly motivated, solutions-orientated self-starter with adaptable teamwork styles
  • Strategic orientation with the know-how to problem solve under pressure
  • Refined verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office programs



Primary Location: CA-ON-Toronto
Organization: Park Hyatt Toronto
Pay Basis: Yearly
Job Level: Assistant Director
Job: Sales
