title: Buyer
description:
Sporting Life is a leading, iconic Canadian sports lifestyle retailer. Since 1979, we've been committed to providing our customers and their families with the best possible experience—and we are continuously working to improve it every day. We offer the best in outdoor apparel and fashion, footwear, equipment and accessories for men, women and kids. The mix of sport and fashion is what makes us unique.

YOU live for the great Canadian outdoors and take pride in living the Sporting Life. You relish in the exhilarating experience of skiing, snowboarding, cycling, running, tennis, hiking and camping and want to inspire our customers to do the same. You believe in the spirit of team, adapting to the ever-changing retail environment, being part of constant innovation and working alongside the best leaders, associates and vendors in the business. We are looking for those who live what we sell every day and who celebrate the love of sport and an active way of living.

As a Buyer, reporting to the VP of Apparel you will be responsible for the development and execution of assigned product class business strategy to maximize sales and profit in our store and web business. You will contribute to the business by utilizing strong leadership, buying, and planning skills.

Your Responsibilities

Category Management: Develop and execute merchandising and marketing strategies for assigned product category in all distribution channels (Retail Stores & Web).

  • Maximize profitability for category – sales, margin, inventory turn, GMROI etc.;
  • Develop category merchandising strategy with Director of Purchasing that differentiates Sporting Life from competition and meets/exceeds our annual metric goals;
  • Create and optimize product assortments in all distribution channels;
  • Collaborate with marketing to bring executable ideas forward to align with key items, campaigns, and strategies to communicate to our customer base;
  • Define and implement category pricing and promotional strategy;
  • Create and oversee special sales-based activities (i.e., vendor contests, programs, events, etc.);
  • Communicate category initiatives/issues internally and externally;
  • Lead and direct cross-functional teams to execute special projects and category initiatives;
  • Collaborate with stores, either by conference call or store visit, to ensure all product needs are addressed;
  • Ensure the standard ETI process for POD is updated weekly;
  • Ensure Web ETI has been reviewed and is updated;
  • Ensure all web content is loaded at time of product being released.

Vendor Management: Manage assortments, inventory, and finances for each vendor. Secure favourable product costs, sufficient supply and vendor funding to support strategic business goals.

  • Foster positive relationships with vendor community to achieve strategic company goals;
  • Constantly evaluate vendor performance and programs - negotiate vendor terms to meet profitability targets.

Inventory Management: Partner with Planners to ensure category meets/exceeds inventory, turn and GMROI goals.

  • Collaborate with Inventory Planner to implement and manage supply chain initiatives to optimize performance metrics;
  • Develop & execute the merchandise financial plan to achieve the current years targets with the help of the planning department; identifies & actions inventory issues as required,
  • Plan and execute effective product life cycles – including negotiating vendor markdown monies, RTV’s, etc.; markdown cadence; in season & aged inventory management;
  • Work with Inventory Planning Team to achieve key in-stock levels and turn goals.

Leadership and Staff Development: Lead, coach, develop, and empower Merchandising Analyst and Associate Buyer. Lead and direct cross-functional support team without direct authority.

  • Ensure the daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly checklists are being reviewed and managed by POD.

What You Offer

  • A love of fashion, sport and a healthy, active lifestyle
  • Post-secondary education (University preferred) with a focus on merchandising, business or economics;
  • 5–7 years progressive experience and well versed in brand/category management, procurement, contract negotiation and vendor management within the retail industry;
  • 3 - 5 years’ managerial experience;
  • Ability to multi-task and easily adapt category strategy to current business climate;
  • Strong organizational, project leadership, and time management skills;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • Must be able to work well in a team environment and independently;
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving ability;
  • Strong PC skills;
  • Excellent follow through;
  • Commitment to customer service;
  • Must be assertive and eager to grow in an extremely fast paced organization;

Who You Are

  • You live for the great Canadian Outdoors
  • You live for Skiing, Snowboarding, Cycling, Running and Tennis
  • The mix of fashion and sport is what makes us unique
  • You believe in the spirit of team, joining leaders, being part of constant innovation and working alongside the best staff and vendors in the business


What We Provide

  • Access to the best brands and vendors including training and learning opportunities
  • Competitive compensation
  • Amazing product discounts
  • Professional growth and development

Sporting Life is #unlikeanystoreintheworld

Sporting Life Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, please advise the Sporting Life Human Resources team of any accommodations required to ensure fair and equitable access through the recruitment and selection process.

title: Coordinator, Dropship & Marketplace - 12 Month Contract
description:
Company Description

Current Indigo employees should apply through the Internal Mobility page using your @indigo.ca email address.

Dedicated to telling stories and creating experiences, Indigo is always looking for bright, energetic and customer-focused people who can help bring our exciting mission to life in one of our more than 150 Indigo, Indigospirit, Chapters and Coles stores across Canada. We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.

WHO WE ARE

  • We love books and all things beautiful
  • We are Canada’s Cultural Department Store
  • Books are our heart and our soul and Great Books are JUST the Beginning…

We play by the following rules:

  • We exist to add joy to our customers’ lives each and every time they interact with us and our products
  • Our job is to create joyful moments for our customers
  • We treat each other the way we’d treat a valued friend
  • We inspire each other to do our best work
  • We seek to ignite creativity and innovation every day
  • We give back to the communities in which we operate
Job Description

The Coordinator, Dropship & Marketplace is responsible for supporting the Indigo Digital team in managing the expanded assortment of Dropship & Marketplace sellers. The coordinator will support the day-to-day management of vendor performance and product availability through continuous analysis of order, fulfillment, and inventory flows. The coordinator will be hyper-focused on our customer experience and will bring an analytical competence to ensure our vendors fulfill orders in accordance with our SLAs. This role will specifically support the Thoughtfull and Drop Ship experience.

WHAT YOU’LL DO: 
 

Functional

  • Monitor performance of Dropship & Marketplace vendors through daily, weekly, quarterly review of KPIs; inventory availability, order fulfillment, shipping errors, invoicing discrepancies
  • Provide on-going analysis of order and invoicing data highlighting risks to profitability and customer experience, developing action plans to resolve any issues in a timely manner
  • Find insights at vendor and category levels to continuously enhance drop ship and marketplace performance and growth
  • Manage support requests from vendors and internal partners, prioritizing urgent issues and completing tasks according to SLAs
  • Partner with Finance, Online Operations and Transportation Teams to monitor delivery promises, shipping rates and vendor profitability.
  • Collaborate with customer service and billing teams to resolve customer and vendor order issues in a timely manner
  • Monitor merchant standards for marketplace. Maintaining product performance standards through site quality assurance, market research and ad-hoc vendor evaluations
  • Coordinate mass communications to vendors regarding relevant and critical submission timelines for weekly, seasonal, and major event opportunities
  • Act as an advocate for the customer by placing them at the forefront of all decision-making and design processes
  • Proactively identify and anticipate customer expectations and needs
  • Embrace and seek out technology that creates high tech and high touch solutions for Indigo’s customers
  • Challenge the status quo by consistently identifying areas for improvement, diagnosing issues and working to resolve them

 

People

  • Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily
  • Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn from those more knowledgeable than yourself
  • Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input
  • Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback

 

Cultural

  • Model Indigo’s beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do
  • Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset
  • Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes
  • Embrace, champion and influence change through your team and/or the organization
Qualifications

WHO YOU ARE: 

  • ​​​​​High school diploma required
  • Experience in retail or CPG industry
  • Experience with Shopify Plus an asset
  • Customer success and account management experience helpful 
  • Analytical confidence
  • High level of proficiency with all Microsoft Office suite applications, especially Excel
  • Familiar with E-Commerce
  • Confident speaking with many external vendors and provide support & instructions
  • Able to work independently
  • True belief in teamwork and ability to understand the impact of one’s actions on another team, individual or process
  • Desire for continuous learning and improvement
  • Works proficiently under condensed timelines
  • Self-sufficient and has a strong sense of initiative
  • Hours of work: 37.5 hours per week


Additional Information

At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other; together we can make a positive impact. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer, which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2 and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at 1 (888) 881-3177 (toll free) or Support-HR@indigo.ca if you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process. 

WELCOME HOME

We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.', 'Provide on-going analysis of order and invoicing data highlighting risks to profitability and customer experience, developing action plans to resolve any issues in a timely manner', 'Functional', 'Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset', 'Proactively identify and anticipate customer expectations and needs', 'Experience with Shopify Plus an asset', 'High level of proficiency with all Microsoft Office suite applications, especially Excel', 'Cultural', 'Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes', 'Analytical confidence', 'True belief in teamwork and ability to understand the impact of one’s actions on another team, individual or process', 'Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily', 'Experience in retail or CPG industry', 'Customer success and account management experience helpful', 'Able to work independently', 'Books are our heart and our soul\xa0and Great\xa0Books are JUST the Beginning…', 'Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn from those more knowledgeable than yourself', 'Manage support requests from vendors and internal partners, prioritizing urgent issues and completing tasks according to SLAs', 'Monitor merchant standards for marketplace. title: Ventes internes et support technique (FT)
description:
Ventes internes et support technique
 
Pour poursuivre son expansion, Proax technologies est à la recherche d’un Représentant Technique aux ventes internes
Le candidat recherché devra utiliser ces compétences afin d'offrir une solution complète à nos clients. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement des plus intéressants grâce à l'expérience diversifiée et le dynamisme de notre équipe ainsi qu’à l'accès à notre formation continue. Proax Technologies offre également une gamme complète d'avantages sociaux.
 
RESPONSABILITES:
  • Interaction avec les clients pour vendre et promouvoir des solutions d'automatisation.
  • Répondre aux appels de la clientèle.
  • Évaluer et comprendre les besoins et attentes des clients.
  • Proposer les meilleures alternatives possibles aux clients.
  • Entrée des soumissions et des opportunités.
  • Entrée et suivi des commandes.
  • Saisir les contrats dans le système d'exploitation.
  • Promotions des produits proposés par Proax.
  • Formation continue sur les produits proposés.
  • Faciliter les communications entre la clientèle, les représentants des ventes externes, les techniciens et les représentants manufacturiers.
 
L'EXPÉRIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE:
  • 2-3 ans  d'expérience en service à la clientèle ou vente dans le secteur de l’automatisation ou autre domaine pertinent.
  • Excellentes compétences en communication (orale et écrite), Bilingue, Français et Anglais.
  • Capacité à identifier et résoudre les problèmes.
  • Grande capacité de travailler en équipe. 
  • Motivé, Autonome, soucieux du détail et bien organisé.
  • Attitude positive.
 
Spécialisations techniques:
  • Importante - Formation technique en automatisation, l'instrumentation et contrôle ou autre formation connexe.
  • Atout – Bonne connaissance des produits pneumatiques.
  • Importante - Connaissance des logiciels Excel, Outlook et Word.
skills: ['Attitude positive.']

title: Senior Customer Success Manager, Capital Markets
description:
FINCAD empowers Capital Market participants to solve derivative analytics problems with innovative simplicity. The key to our success for over 30 years is our unique combination of innovative engineering and a highly dedicated team committed to going above and beyond to help customers and partners achieve their goals. FINCAD is now the Capital Markets Group within Zafin. Products and services will continue to be offered under the FINCAD brand. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada with offices globally, FINCAD delivers the technology that instills Confidence in Risk.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer in British Columbia for the last 11 years and a Top Canadian SME employer for the last three years in a row.

As a Senior Customer Success Manager, reporting to VP, Customer Success, you will work directly with our customers to ensure they are getting most value out of our products and services. You will be responsible for executing the strategic customer engagements to augment business value by continuously managing and improving user experience, customer retention and business expansion and continuity. Furthermore, you will act as a liaison between product, service, and sales, incorporating product expertise and customer feedback. Thus, you will be the "voice of the customer."

In this position, you get to:

  • Build strategic senior level relationships with assigned customers and continually delight them with a positive, customer-centric attitude.
  • Provide proactive strategy update with assigned customer accounts.
  • Become an expert in the way our customers operate and educate internal stakeholders on how to support them more strategically.
  • Work closely with Sales, Product Development and Services teams to ensure an exceptional customer experience.
  • Be a customer advocate while capturing customer feedback and reporting requests to internal stakeholders and senior management.
  • Efficiently manage time to focus on essential activities to ensure customer satisfaction, retention, and account growth.
  • Support revenue retention and growth through increased service adoption and increased usage.
  • Identify and forecast expansion opportunities and partner with sales to successfully close such opportunities.
  • Identify and build advocacy relationships with strategic customers acting as a marketing channel through case studies, speaking opportunities, references, etc.
  • Determine usage patterns and use them to gain insights and provide guidance to Sales, Marketing and Product Strategy in identifying opportunities and increase customer satisfaction.
  • Be a customer advocate while capturing customer feedback and reporting requests to internal stakeholders and senior management.

To be successful in this role, you must have:

  • 5+ years of experience in a customer facing role including technology delivery, account management, sales or pre-sales within or servicing Capital Markets clients.
  • Ideally up to 3 years experience in a Customer Success role within Capital Markets.
  • Previous capital markets expertise working with derivatives and fixed income analytics in trading, risk management or related technology is very beneficial.
  • Exceptional stakeholder management skills including the ability to build and nurture strategic relationships within cross functional teams and managing account risks and issues escalations as necessary.
  • Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with the ability to influence multiple stakeholders, prospective and actual clients without direct authority.
  • Empathic communicator being the voice of the customer internally and closely engaged with the customers to maximize the success of their solutions.
  • Skills to proactively orchestrate the customer's journey towards their goals.
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline, such as quantitative finance, financial engineering, mathematics, or physics.
  • PLEASE NOTE: Preference will be give to those candidates that have...
    • graduated with an advanced degree (Masters or PhD) in a technical discipline, such as quantitative finance, financial engineering, mathematics, or physics.
    • worked as a consultant and/or other professional/client services teams on software implementation projects or some experience in product management.

Why choose FINCAD as your preferred employer?

At FINCAD you get to solve interesting problems in an intellectually challenging environment and work alongside very smart and hard-working people to build something that matters. The learning is continuous and in addition to competitive rewards, a flexible work environment, we offer a generous vacation policy.

We have transitioned to a flexible working approach and this role is expected to be remote, ideally in either the US or Canada. A willingness to work flexible hours given global collaboration across the Pacific, Eastern and European time zones is essential.

In addition to competitive salary and a great place to work, we offer:

  • Flexibility: At FINCAD, it's about getting the job done. You have flexibility when it comes to where and when you work.
  • Supportive Environment: We get that our team members have lives outside of work. We are understanding and supporting them in any way we can.
  • Professional Development: We offer a development-focused working environment that provides continual opportunities to learn and hone your skills.
  • Community Involvement: Working at FINCAD means you will be able to give back to your local and global communities with our organized volunteer efforts. And we welcome you taking initiative on where we can get involved more.
  • Time to Recharge: Our people work hard. And we realize it's important for them to have time to relax and recharge. That's why we offer a minimum of four weeks vacation to all employees.
  • Wellness Plans: We provide competitive health, dental and retirement plans in each of the countries we operate.

title: Territory Manager – Andrew Peller Imports
description:
#BeExtraordinary

At Andrew Peller Limited (APL), we deliver the perfect brand experience for every lifestyle, occasion, and generation. Through collaboration, open communication, honesty, drive to win, and accountability, we inspire teammates to be extraordinary every day.

Who We Are

We are of Canada's largest and oldest wine companies with a rich heritage in quality winemaking.

We produce some of Canada's most recognized brands and offer our teammates a challenging and rewarding employment experience.


Andrew Peller Import Agency is a Canadian Importer, warehouser and marketing agent serving English Canada. We specialize in premium wines and spirits from around the world!

We are seeking a Territory Manager to assist in the implementation of the territorial sales plan and corresponding sales strategies (i.e., optimal Liquor Store/Licensee coverage and service, distribution, merchandising, promotion, and development) to maximize sales volume, net profit, and product distribution within territory.

We are looking for a teammate with:

  • Completion of post secondary education, University degree or College, Technical Institute 2 yr. Diploma or equivalent experience
  • WSET 2 or 3 or equivalent
  • Microsoft 365 - being able to use Word, Excel and Power Point
  • EZ Focus or equivalent

This teammate will be accountable for:

Sales Results

  • maximize sales through all trade channels
  • ensure volume, distribution, promotional, merchandising, and public relations activities identified within Regional Sales Plan are effectively implemented and executed through regular and consistent coverage of independent liquor stores (as set out in the business plan), with strengthened sales, listings, facings, and inventories and with licensees; strengthen sales, new accounts, features, and inventories.
  • ensure sales outputs (case sales, listings and new accounts) meet targeted objectives
  • ensure product sales meet profit targets via effective use of time and financial resources

Financial/Administrative

  • operate territory within approved expense budget
  • knowledgeable with respect to company expense policies relative to travel, entertainment, Liquor/Retail Store coverage/licensee coverage and wine donations including ability to exercise judgment in terms of obtaining prior approval before committing company with respect to time, effort, and expense
  • preparation of prescribed daily, weekly, and monthly summaries for submission to Sales Manager

Business Development

  • maintain productive business relationships with all key Liquor/Retail Store/Licensee personnel and industry contacts
  • monitor, communicate (to Sales Manager), and recommend solutions regarding competitor activities and developments, market/product opportunities
  • communicate company sales policy to customers
  • develop new business opportunities through sound public relations activities and superior customer service, including:
  • giving presentations to various interest groups (imparting wine knowledge, etc.)
  • ensuring prompt and proper handling of all customer concerns and complaints
  • maintaining exemplary professional conduct and accepted social and industry practices when representing the interests of the company

Communications

  • active participation in sale meetings; ensuring relevant information is disseminated and acted upon accordingly
  • communication of relevant sales and competitive information to appropriate personnel (i.e., Sales Manager) on a regular and timely basis as agreed upon by both parties

Security

  • ensure equipment, sales aids, miscellaneous allowances, and service stock issued are being used consistent with company policy

We are conducting an internal and external search simultaneously. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest; only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Per our "Internal Job Posting Policy"; internal candidates must have been in their current position for one (1) year and their performance must be in good standing.

Andrew Peller Limited is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environment. We are happy to discuss any need for accommodation and will make every effort to meet those needs in a timely manner. Please advise the Human Resources Department if you require accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection processes and/or within the work environment. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Strategic Account Manager


Advert:


People make Sage great. From our colleagues delivering ground-breaking solutions to the customers who use them: people have helped us grow for more than thirty years, and people are driving our future as a great SaaS company. We're writing our next chapter. Be part of it!


At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.


We invite you to join us and help us write our next chapter. Follow us on our social media sites to join in conversations about open positions and company news! #lifeatsage #sagecareers. If you would like support with your application (or require any adjustments) please contact us atcareers@sage.comfor assistance. All qualified applicants will be thoughtfully considered and never discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.


Job Description:


The Account Executive role at Sage Intacct is a field sales position selling an industry leading cloud-based Financial management system. Sage Intacct offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources, and outstanding support to assist you in selling our compelling business applications. This role is part of a highly successful company/team supported by robust extended teamed and benefiting from seasoned leadership team focused on maintaining a highly motivated overachieving team in an exciting growth market.


You will be responsible for establishing and maximizing strategic direction and execution of co-sell sales cycles for large scale Sage prospects and customers. Will maximize sales opportunities, drive business development, establish and manage executive/primary relationships, and provide a single point of contact within Sage for top business prospects and customers. Three main focus areas - sales specialist, business growth consultant, and problem solver.


Key Responsibilities:


Key accountabilities:


• Develop and manage complex sales cycles - often involving multiple Sage products and decision makers through strategic planning and securing the appropriate resources (either Sage or Partner) to best support the opportunity at the optimum point in the sales cycle

• Business growth Sales Executive providing advice and value guidance to Sage prospects maximizing opportunities to build and accelerate revenue.

• Build and manage customer relationships and opportunities as a trusted advisor and single point of contact for Sage Customers

• Monitor goals set by Sage to increase product revenue. Develop and execute on key performance metrics such as New License Revenue, Product Revenue, pipeline strength, by month, quarter and fiscal year.

• Create and execute action plans to engage appropriate Sage cross functional resources to contribute to sales and development efforts


Qualifications:


• Bachelor's degree required in business-related B.Comm, Administration, Accounting, or technology-related field

• 5+ years’ experience selling in a full sales cycle SAAS environment

• Knowledge of accounting, CRM, ERP or HRM solutions

• Experience with mid-market sales cycles with deal cycles ranging from 60-120 days

• Ability to be resourceful and able to come up with creative solutions to day-to-day challenges

• Ability to follow/create a proven sales process


Do you love where you work? WE do!


Who is Sage?https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/careers/who-we-are/

How we make a difference:https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/sage-foundation/

Champion of Business Builders:https://www.sage.com/en-us/products/

Life at Sage:https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/careers/life-at-sage/


Our comprehensive total rewards program included:

• Extended health, dental and vision coverage

• On-going training and professional development

• 21 days paid time off from the start

• Paid 5 days to volunteer through our Sage Foundation

• Matching Retirement contributions

• And, so much more…


#LI- CM1


Function:


Sales


Country:


Canada


Office Location:


Remote


Work Place type


Hybrid

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Regional Sales ManagerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's NEMA Motors Division markets, designs and manufactures the market-leading Baldor-Reliance® brand of industrial motors. As the #1 global manufacturer of NEMA motors, our quality products are designed to reliably and efficiently meet the challenges our customers face. Our business is investing in technology, tools, people and processes to ensure our general purpose and application-specific solutions perform as expected, every time. The successful candidate will be responsible for regionalizing and managing sales strategies for the regional Motion sales team. Responsibilities will include deployment of business development initiatives and customer account coverage strategies to reach and surpass Sales targets for the promotion and sales of Electric Motors and Variable frequency drives for ABB's Motion business area in the Western Region (AB, BC & Yukon).Particular focus will be placed on regional pipeline management and forecasting to build and execute a successful sales plan. The successful candidate will work closely with National sales management, division leaders and industry segment managers to ensure increased market penetration and YoY growth.
Your responsibilities

  • Develop and drive implementation of the regional sales growth strategy for the assigned region.
  • Ensure achievement of sales volume and product mix targets.
  • Manage, support and coach sales team to maintain regional pipeline level in line with budget expectation.
  • Drive regional actions key pursuits of end users, OEMs and System Integrators.
  • Identify opportunities with existing and potential customers and determine penetration strategy.
  • Develop and maintains a strong relationship with key accounts and regional decision makers.
  • In collaboration with local account managers, manage channel partners Annual Order Plan and conduct Quarterly Business Review. Define & support key actions to close gaps to budget if necessary.
  • Manage the regional opportunity funnel and create monthly and quarterly order forecast.
  • Coach Front end Sales team to make winning decisions, plan better, and effectively allocate resources based on customer needs and potential for growth.
  • Build and manage long term customer relationships and manage resolution to specific customer needs and issues. Identify and develop sales opportunities. Ensures a positive customer experience throughout the sales process.
  • Prepares account plans using company tools, including SALESFORCE.com. Performs regular status reviews and proposes recovery plan(s) in cases of potential order shortfalls.
  • Creates added value for the customer and ABB and ensures the successful outcome of transactions, contracts, and proposals by using effective sales techniques. Communicates details in accordance with ABB offering and strategy (delivery time, payments, and general terms and conditions).
  • Ensures efficient marketing activities and value proposition to customers.
  • Identifies and drives the development of new market opportunities in the designated market and ensures know-how sharing and cross-collaboration.
  • Manages administrative procedures in sales processes and supports collection and project management activities when needed.
  • Prepares offers in coordination with the bid and proposal department and/or the Marketing Manager. Ensures appropriate technical and financial aspects of offers, including prices and trading conditions.

Your background
  • 5 years of experience in sales.
  • Bachelor's degree from accredited post-secondary institution , preference towards Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience.
  • Good knowledge of Electrical Motors and Variable Speed Drives.
  • Ability to travel 30-40% of the time.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Procurement Coordinator
description:
Candidates are invited to apply for the above position to work at our Corporate Office located in Markham, Ontario 

 

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors across Canada, operating under the Extendicare, Esprit Lifestyle, ParaMed, Extendicare Assist, and SGP Purchasing Partner Network brands. We are committed to delivering quality care throughout the health continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors population. We operate or provide contract services to a network of 120 long-term care homes and retirement communities (69 owned/51 contract services), provide approximately 8.3 million hours of home health care services annually, and provide group purchasing services to third parties representing approximately 81,100 senior residents across Canada. Extendicare proudly employs more than 23,000 qualified, highly trained and dedicated individuals who are passionate about providing high quality care and services to help people live better. 

 

Reporting to the Manager, IT Asset & Procurement, the Procurement & Mobile Coordinator will work with the Asset & Procurement Manager to establish processes for the ongoing management of IT inventory, handle inbound and outbound shipments , process purchase requests and help troubleshoot issues with mobile devices. 

 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide support tracking and maintaining the IT Inventory
  • Prepare purchase requests and purchase orders ensuring proper approval has been obtained and order product from vendors. Review purchase requisition orders to verify accuracy, terminology, and specifications.
  • Placing orders with suppliers
  • Provide support for all mobile device activations and cancellations across the organization
  • Help troubleshoot issues with mobile devices
  • Respond to customer inquiries about order status, changes, or cancellations
  • Track and update the status of orders to ensure accuracy at all times
  • Ensure minimum inventory levels are maintained at all times
  • Providing support to ensure all IT inventory is shipped out in a timely fashion. Ensure inbound shipments are reviewed and verified
  • Perform weekly inventory counts/audits, resolve discrepancies, and maintain accurate records and report results.
  • Document all procurement requests & mobile device issues within our ticketing system and ensure all tickets are managed and updated in a timely manner
  • Any other duties that may arise from time to time which fall within the parameters of this role and within the level of skills, competency, and training of the incumbent
  • Comfortable lifting items that weigh up to 15 lbs

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Strong problem solving, time management, and decision-making skills
  • Able to work under deadlines
  • Strong communicator with excellent interpersonal and customer support skills.
  • Good MS Excel skills - ability to construct well-structured thoughts
  • Collaborative style with the ability to work well and communicate with individuals at all levels of an organization. 
  • Experience in handling administrative tasks and executing them proactively 
  • Customer-focused attitude, with the ability to understand, anticipate and identify customer needs while using information to provide the best service possible

 

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care, and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodation needs must be provided in advance.   To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

 

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Purchaser - Amico Clinical Solutions
description:
Purchaser - Amico Clinical Solutions
Richmond Hill, On

Amico Group of Companies is a leading manufacturer of Medical Equipment and Architectural Products with 8 manufacturing facilities employing over 750 people across North America.

We are currently seeking a Buyer to join our Purchasing team based out of Richmond Hill, Ontario.

Qualifications:

  • Formal college or university education
  • Demonstrated experience managing suppliers, performance and developing long-term relationships
  • Experience in Metal fabrication, surface finishes, custom manufacturing is an asset
  • Highly organized, creative and self-motivated
  • Excellent verbal and communication skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Preparing and executing RFQs/RFPs
  • Sourcing vendors, negotiating and finalizing agreements
  • Liaise with cross functional teams such as suppliers, production and customer service to ensure goods are available to meet production requirements on time
  • Negotiating terms and delivery for lowest total cost
  • Continually seek opportunities to improve services and reduce costs including freight
  • Review purchase requisition requests daily
  • Expediting overdue orders and rush requests
  • Monitor and manage inventory
  • Other duties as required

Amico Corporation offers:

  • Opportunities for Advancement
  • Comprehensive Benefit package
  • Employer Paid Vacation
  • Employee Referral Program

For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com.

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Customer Success Manager - Ezra
description:
Job Role: Customer Success Manager

Location: Toronto, Canada

Who we are

We redesigned coaching for the digital age.

Ezra delivers the highest quality professional coaching to employees using industry leading app-based technology. Our world class technology enables quality coaching sessions, a seamless user journey and regular reporting like never before.

With 50+ years’ experience delivering world class coaching in 66 countries we’re best placed to drive the coaching revolution. In just over a year, we have grown to become the fastest growing virtual coaching solution globally, supporting many of the world's leading companies with high impact, 1:1 personalised coaching.

At Ezra we use innovative technology to achieve the greatest user experience, but the heart of the service is the quality and diversity of our global coaching pool. 

Now, everyone can be better with a coach.



The Role

To aid our rapidly expanding growth, we are looking for a pro-active, energizing Account Manager to support client management efforts, from supporting efforts to close prospective clients to onboarding clients and managing existing accounts.

This is an exciting role with significant stretch opportunity, with the individual expected to play a critical role in Ezra’s current and future growth.

 

What you’ll do

Key Accountabilities:

  • Provide effective and proactive first-level service to the Ezra prospective and existing accounts, supporting the overall retention and expansion of account relationships
  • Project manage the client onboarding set-up, from close to launch date collaborating with key functions that play a role in the implementation process
  • Effectively support sales, product, operational delivery and finance functions
  • Oversee all reporting requirements at account level during the Ezra Program
  • Key day to day relationship contact for our client stakeholders



CSM Key Activities

Sales and Operational Support:

  • Manage information flow between sales and delivery (bridge from sales to delivery)
  • Develop a complete understanding of the contract and project requirements to ensure ease of implementation. 
  • Coordination and attendance at client onboarding meetings to define key milestones and communications
  • Work in partnership with our Coaching Solutions team to onboard the relevant coaches based on the client’s objectives and needs
  • Host regular coach and participant training sessions in the lead up to a new program launching and post go live to extract themes and insights
  • Daily use of Ezra project management tool to ensure the timely implementation of new programs
  • Maximize adoption and engagement of all Ezra participants
  • Provide daily support to the Ezra Team as needed
  • Help Ezra evolve existing and new processes that will enhance the client and participant experience
  • Execute production and delivery of client reporting needs, utilizing Ezra’s Reporting Capabilities
  • Assist in the development of client-facing materials and collateral as appropriate (e.g., proposals, presentations, Annual and Quarterly Reviews)
  • Stay well-versed in and be able to explain and articulate Ezra’s Product and Platform capabilities

Account Retention & Expansion:

  • Proactively plan and prepare for client reviews, compiling account reporting including PPT presentation and data analysis to provide data insights and trends
  • Utilize key metrics to identify ways to recognize and capitalize on opportunities within assigned accounts
  • Develop, foster and maintain client relationships to ensure account retention
  • Participate in all aspects of Ezra sales community (training, systems, processes)
  • Proficiency in SFDC and consistency in managing and updating SFDC

 

About you

  • 3+ years of Customer Success or related corporate experience 
  • Experienced project manager with proven experience in a customer success role
  • Willingness to work in a fast-paced start-up environment and comfort around operating with an element of ambiguity
  • Critical thinking skills: ability to problem solve independently and quickly
  • Confident, accurate and clear communicator
  • Self-starter able to operate in a high pressure, deadline driven, virtual environment
  • Ability to influence others without direct authority and, at times, challenge the status quo
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite
  • Knowledgeable of marketing/sales messaging principles
  • Passionate about clients and participants needs



What we offer

  • Salary: Depending on Experience
  • Your own world class coach
  • Regular team social events

 

We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to having a thriving, diverse team where everyone has a voice and feels able to be themselves.  We believe that through valuing our uniqueness and respecting our differences, we can achieve more, and that diversity adds to our culture. Attracting and developing a diverse workforce that reflects the communities in which we serve is essential to us.

title: Area Sales Manager
description:
Working at Motion (Canada) is about partnering – with our teams, our suppliers and our customers. We work hard to deliver the kind of culture and benefits that make the experience more than just a career move – you’ll partner with some of the most talented and humble men and women driving our industry forward. We just like to think that we’re real people with real expertise. But that’s enough about us.

WHO YOU ARE
You will have a keen business sense, a strong will to learn and a desire to partner with others in a highly collaborative sales environment. As the Area Sales Manager, you will have outside sales industry experience and product familiarity, coupled with experience managing and supporting an outside sales team by providing objectives, training and direction.  And since top salespeople usually have high curiosity levels, you are constantly expanding your knowledge. Your computer skills are sharp and you’re comfortable interacting on social media. And you know that supporting your sales team in their sales initiatives is your primary goal, but assisting your sales team in solving your customers’ problems before they even know they have them is what really brings the job to life for you!

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Area Sales Manager will plan, lead, organize, and controls oversee the activities of the assigned sales representatives within the Edmonton region. The role will support and enable the sales representatives by providing objectives, training, direction and marketing initiatives.  You will also assist your sales team in building positive, profitable long-term customer relationships by ensuring they are providing top notch customer service so they can wow their customers every day.  Sure it's a challenge but you thrive in a fast paced environment and enjoy being a mentor, but lucky you - you love what you do - and success seems to follow!  
You will report into the Division Vice President for Alberta, and under their guidance, you will:
  • Provide customer service strategy and support for the region
  • Analyze and assess market conditions and implement marketing initiatives
  • Analyze and prepare sales forecasts and reports
  • Collaborate with sales team in setting and achieving short and long-term sales goals
  • Identify critical skills for the sales team and assess and assign sales territories
  • Review and audit expense reports and prepare and administer sales budget
  • Accountable for territory profit margin and sales growth goals achieved through training and coaching the sales team
  • Hires, trains, assesses, and evaluates staff performance.  Coaches and directs the activities of the sales team.  Prioritized workload with available resources.
  • Interacts with other department heads and sales team to assure quality service levels.  Identifies new sourcing opportunities and maintains current customer service levels.  Interacts with vendors to review performance and evaluates potential new vendors
  • Coordinates special events, develops marketing tools, and assists the Division Vice President
  • Accountable for territory profit margin and sales growth goals achieved through training and coaching the sales team
  • Coordinates with sales team to prepare quotes on competitive situations.  Evaluates and recommends special discounts
REQUIREMENTS
  • Typically a bachelor's degree and 5 to 7 years of experience in industrial sales coupled with 3 years of management experience
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to set clear directives
  • Ability to develops and maintain strong customer knowledge base and ongoing relationships
  • Ability to delegate tasks and hold others accountable for completion
  • Experience in fluid power systems, applications, and design would be an asset 
  • Desire to grow your skills and career through business and personal development
  • Share your big ideas, learn from your mistakes, ask for help and lend a hand when needed

READY TO BE A PARTNER?           
Submit your well-crafted, error-free resume below and think about:
  • Your learning and development goals
  • Your definition of team player and integrity
THE WORK EXPERIENCE AT MOTION CANADA INCLUDES
  • Comprehensive flex benefits 
  • Competitive salary and bonus plan
  • An attractive pension plan
  • Company vehicle
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Great company culture with a strong leadership team
  • Growth and Development opportunities
  • Open and frequent communication
  • Timely feedback on individual performance and career development opportunities

title: Conseiller(ère) à la vente - Sales Advisor
description:
Tu aimes offrir aux clients une expérience de magasinage remarquable et tu te démarque par ton bon sens de l’analyse des besoins, Corbeil Électroménager est lentreprise pour toi!

Quoi de mieux que d’accueillir les clients, apprendre à connaitre leur projet ou la raison de leur visite et proposer des produits qui répondent à leur besoin réel ? Nous ne mettons pas de pression abusive sur nos employés, car pour nous, le plus important c’est que les clients trouvent les produits appropriés grâce à tes judicieux conseils.

Tu détiens une expérience professionnelle dans la vente, tu es sympathique et souriant(e) ? Viens vite rejoindre l’équipe, on t’attend!

Si tu es quelqu’un qui a envie de travailler dans un environnement de travail stimulant, dynamique et de contribuer à une entreprise qui prône le travail d’équipe et les valeurs humaines, alors nous vous voulons dans notre équipe!

En plus d’avoir un emploi qui te stimule continuellement, tu auras accès à plein d’avantages, comme :

  • Des rabais corporatifs
  • Une panoplie d’évènements sociaux
  • Un régime d’assurance avec un partage du coût de la prime
  • Un Gym au siège social
  • Des possibilités d’avancements
  • La possibilité de se faire rembourser les frais de scolarité
  • Un programme de reconnaissance et un programme de bien-être au travail
  • La possibilité d’adhérer à un REER collectif
  • Des journées personnelles payées en plus des vacances
  • Un programme d’aide aux employés

Viens visionner les vidéos de nos employés qui tentent de réussir des défis culinaires en équipe et apprenez en plus sur l’expérience employé Corbeil!


TON AVENIR SE PRÉPARE AUJOURDHUI

FAIS ÉQUIPE AVEC NOUS POUR LES BONNES CAUSES.

Fort de son équipe de 400 employés passionnés, qui partagent une volonté commune de bâtir une organisation responsable, impliquée dans sa communauté et sensible à la cause environnementale, Corbeil Électroménagers est un important détaillant canadien soucieux de toujours mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle dans le domaine des appareils électroménagers.

** Lutilisation du genre masculin inclut le féminin et nest employée que pour faciliter la lecture.

______________________________________________________________________________________

Sales advisor

You enjoy providing customers with a great shopping experience and you stand out by your good sense of needs analysis, then Corbeil Électroménager is the right place for you!

What could be better than welcoming customers, getting to know their project or the reason for their visit and offering products that meet their real needs? We do not put undue pressure on our employees, because for us, the most important thing is that customers find the right products with your good advice.

Do you have professional experience in sales, are you friendly and smiling? Come and join the team quickly, we are waiting for you!

If you are someone who wants to work in a stimulating, dynamic work environment and to contribute to a company that promotes teamwork and human values, then we want you on our team!

In addition to having a job that you like, you will have access to many advantages, such as:

  • Corporate discounts
  • A variety of social events
  • An insurance plan with a sharing of the cost of the premium
  • A Gym at the head office
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • The possibility of being reimbursed for tuition fees
  • A recognition program and a well-being at work program
  • The possibility of joining a group RRSP
  • Personal paid days in addition to vacation
  • An employee assistance program

Go watch the videos of our employees who try to succeed in culinary challenges as a team and learn more about the Corbeil employee experience!


YOUR FUTURE IS PREPARING TODAY

TEAM UP WITH US FOR GOOD CAUSES.

With its team of 400 passionate employees, who share a common desire to build a responsible organization, involved in its community and sensitive to the environmental cause, Corbeil Électroménagers is a major Canadian retailer concerned with always better meeting the needs of its customers in the field of household appliances.

* The use of the masculine gender includes the feminine and is used only to facilitate the reading.




Vente Sales

title: Territory Manager
description:
The primary responsibility for this position is to sell equipment in a defined territory and serve drop-in retail customers during scheduled shifts in the branch. Equipment sales includes all wholegoods product offerings including large and small agricultural equipment.

A background in agriculture with previous sales experience is preferred but not required. Training on the features and benefits of the products and selling techniques will be provided.

Responsibilities
  • Sell equipment to customers in their territory (80%)
  • Sell equipment to retail customers in the dealership (20%)
  • Visit customer farms on a regular basis
  • Prepare equipment quotes and present to customers
  • Evaluate trades according to company guidelines
  • Arrange and perform equipment demonstrations as required
  • Teach customers how to operate equipment
  • Deliver equipment to customers as required
  • Provide superior after-sales support
  • Promote all dealership departments
  • Attend various training courses
  • All other duties as assigned by the Sales Manager


Requirements

Competencies Required
  • Service Orientation
  • Networking and Relationship Building
  • Communication
  • Organizational and Environmental Awareness
  • Negotiation
  • Results Orientation

Benefits

The company offers competitive wages and a great benefits plan. Employees can be assured that they and their loved ones will be covered in the case of illness or accident.
  • Short-term and long-term disability
  • Critical illness
  • Prescription drug coverage
  • Dental coverage
  • Extended health benefits
  • Health Spending Account
  • Life insurance including dependent life
  • Accidental death and dismemberment coverage
  • Retirement Savings Plan
  • Extensive safety program
  • Education support



Competencies Required Service Orientation Networking and Relationship Building Communication Organizational and Environmental Awareness Negotiation Results Orientation

title: Dental Territory Manager (Hamilton-Niagara)
description:
"Uncover, understand and exceed expectations of dental practices and their professionals in the Hamilton-Niagara Peninsula." 


The Territory Manager will be responsible for account management and new business development of implants, prosthetics, instruments and aligners used in the cosmetic, replacement and restorative dental industries.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Grow existing accounts while converting competitive accounts and new businesses with dentists, surgeons and implant specialists.
  • Meet and exceed the corporate sales objectives by executing marketing initiatives.
  • Develop a territory business plan and sales forecast.
  • Develop strong relationships with key opinion leaders to facilitate clinical education sessions.
  • Participate in regional and national sales meetings, conferences and dental trade shows.

Requirements

EDUCATION & TRAINING

  • Bachelors degree (Science or Business is preferred) or alternative training with related work experience.
  • Training in "competitive selling" would be an asset.


WORK EXPERIENCE
  • 4+ years of outside sales experience.
  • Dental or Medical Device industry experience is preferred but not mandatory. 
  • Direct selling experience to health care providers would be beneficial.


SKILLS & COMPETENCIES
  • Able to explain complex information in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.
  • Excellent oral and written presentation and communication skills are required.
  • Technical knowledge of how to effectively use business and sales-related technology.
  • A valid drivers license with a safe driving record is mandatory.


OTHER
  • A fully functional home office is required.

Benefits

  • Five-figure base salary.
  • Discretionary bonus for meeting KPIs in the first three months.
  • Five-figure commission at target.
  • Mileage reimbursement.
  • Extended health benefits and employee programs.
  • RSP matching program.
  • Technology provided (computer and mobile devices).


WORK EXPERIENCE 4+ years of outside sales experience. Dental or Medical Device industry experience is preferred but not mandatory. Direct selling experience to health care providers would be beneficial. SKILLS & COMPETENCIES Able to explain complex information in a clear, concise, and compelling manner. Excellent oral and written presentation and communication skills are required. Technical knowledge of how to effectively use business and sales-related technology. A valid driver's license with a safe driving record is mandatory. OTHER A fully functional home office is required.

title: Area Sales Manager (ASM) or Territory Manager (TM): Capital Sales Ontario
description:
Company Description

Cutera is growing.... With growth comes opportunities!!

Territory Overview and Travel Requirements:

  • Territory name: Ontario
  • Reside in Ontario Canada
  • Territory consists of all of Ontario 
  • Travel requirement: 1-2 overnights per week
Job Description

Responsibilities: This role is an individual contributor responsible for lead generation through Cutera’s validated sales methodology providing results that build brand dedication across all our innovative products and technologies.  

  • You will drive the success and growth of your sales territory through cold calling and on-site visits to meet and exceed individual and team goals.
  • Develop prospective new customers and nurture existing relationships to expand the sales of additional results.
  • Educate and demonstrate Cutera’s products’ indications, efficacy, safety, and how these products will improve the clients’ needs and that of their customers.

This position reports to the Regional Sales Manager, but you will be provided daily coaching and territory directives from Area Sales Managers.  

Qualifications

What will You Need – Does the Job Fit? (Qualifications & Experience)

  • Area Sales Manager - income potential at plan is $200k - $250k - dependent on market and sales abilities

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • 5 years’ sales – Aesthetics or medical capital equipment experience and/or strong business-to-business
  • Detailed successful sales track record required (we don’t mind if you brag, show us how good you are)
  • Understanding of the industry and the business challenges customers face
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Territory Sales Manager - income potential at plan is $150k dependent on market and sales abilities

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • 2 years’ sales in either High volume B2B sales or high quota sales that require a high degree of social skills and persistence
  • Knows how to cold call and doesn’t give up easily
  • Proven track record of sales growth and success
  • Self-Starter and takes direction well
  • Open to learning through constructive feedback to improve sales effectiveness and industry knowledge
  • Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills

 

Finally, What’s In It for YOU?

  • Career growth (we are growing and like to promote within where possible)
  • Financial independence with a competitively strong base salary plus astonishingly good incentive compensation plans – Uncapped commissions Bonuses
  • Company vehicle 
  • Benefits – a full slate of medical, dental, vision, AD&D, life insurance, short/long term disability, 401K, ESPP… the list goes on.

title: Distribution Account Manager
description:
Distribution Account Manager- Canada
Axiom Memory Solutions
 
The role of Distribution Account Manager- Canada is your opportunity to manage Axiom’s daily business relationship with assigned distributor partners. You will also engage and educate inside sales teams, field territory mangers and gain market share with their assigned resellers. You will combine your customer service and sales background to hit the ground running! 

This job is remote- Looking for candidates located in the GTA (Greater Toronto Area) 

As the Distribution Account Manager- Canada, your key responsibilities will include: 
Sales – 50%
  • Responsible for growing Axiom’s brand recognition with assigned distributor to expand Axiom’s market and mind share
  • Act as the sales point of contact for distribution sales organization
  • Create quarterly and annual sales plans in collaboration with distribution partner
  • Generate revenue to exceed quarterly and annual sales goals
  • Manage product sales mix to maximize profitability
  • Work with distribution sales organization to prospect and recruit new resellers
  • Work with the internal and field sales teams to assist in the development of new business from existing and net new customers
  • Facilitate proper alignment of Axiom Territory Account Managers with Distributor’s field sales teams
  • Educate and enable distribution sales team to become advocates for Axiom
  • Establish and maintain effective relationships at all levels
  • Manage pipeline and act as a point of contact between Axiom field sales and distribution teams
  • Complete daily sales calls and document outcome

Operations – 25%
  • Manage inventory levels to maximize availability of core sku’s
  • Manage aged inventory to ensure inventory does not surpass 90-days
  • Manage current Axiom catalog (New part setup / Disco requests / Price updates)
  • Manage price protections for on-hand and in-transit inventory
  • Work closely with distribution marketing and purchasing team
  • Research and communicate detailed tracking information to customers or distribution teams
  • Research and approve special pricing claims and rebates
  • Manage appropriate distribution RMA defective and return requests

Marketing – 25%
  • Manage budget, CO-OP and MDF Funds
  • Develop and execute incentive programs
  • Plan, setup and execute all floor days, trainings, showcases and entertainment events

To be a good fit for this role, you will have: 
  • 3-5 years of sales experience in an inside or outside sales capacity.
  • Experience in a lead role in a sales environment preferred.
  • Basic knowledge of computer hardware and networking.
  • Knowledge of the Distribution Channel.

Strong Advantages:
  • A Bachelor’s degree preferred.

Why Join Us?
Serving resellers, VARs, and their end users since 1995, Axiom is the fastest growing memory, storage, and fiber-optic connectivity upgrade provider in the corporate, SMB, and government markets supporting our customers with top-notch personal service. The sales team is passionate about our products and our customers, constantly thriving to expand!

In addition to a competitive starting salary, we offer a comprehensive slate of benefits to include medical, dental & voluntary life insurances, vacation/sick time, and more.
 
Don’t wait! Submit your resume today!
