title: Area Sales Manager
description:
Location



Edmonton - 204, 4212 Gateway Blvd. NW



Business




As part of Brookfield Asset Management — one of the largest alternative asset managers in the world — we harness our resources to bring a fresh approach, unparalleled creativity, relentless innovation, and sound ESG practices to the planning, development, and management of buildings everywhere. From offices, retail spaces, and logistics facilities to multifamily residences, hospitality establishments, and mixed-use structures — we are reimagining real estate from the ground up.




We redefine how home and life come together for over 60 years. At Brookfield Residential, a leading North American land developer and homebuilder within the Brookfield Properties family, we have had one goal in mind – to create the best places to call home. From the development of award-winning vibrant communities to the building of well-designed homes and commercial properties, we are committed to cultivating exceptional life experiences for our customers, partners, employees, and members of the community. Learn more (http://brookfieldresidential.com) .




If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Your Team Reporting to the Sales Manager, and as the senior sales centre team member, the Area Sales Manager (ASM) is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the sales centre. This role will develop and maintain an effective and efficient sales and administration program, manage and mentor all sales centre staff, and assist in the development and planning of future opportunities for Brookfield Residential.The ASM is responsible for generating sales, meeting sales targets, and meeting customer services objectives that coincide with the Regional Homes’ business plan. The ASM also provides exceptional customer service to existing and potential customers; while demonstrating respect and professionalism. The ASM contributes to the preparation and planning of future opportunities for Homes. ​




Your Key Deliverables


Prospecting/ Sales:

+ Develop and implement an effective and efficient sales and administration program capable of achieving or exceeding the targets and goals, as specified in the Business Plan

+ Frequently research the respective region home market; review and compare Brookfield Residential’s products on an on-going basis

+ Prospect and network for new business and customer opportunities

+ Maintain sales centre conversion rates (traffic to offers)

+ Ensure that all required information for the successful execution of sales contracts is submitted timely and accurately to the appropriate departments

+ Oversee all documentation and paperwork load flow related to business

+ Continuous improvement of personal sales strategy and development






Customer Service:

+ Recognize that Business is built on customer satisfaction and devoted to guaranteeing satisfaction to customers

+ Recognize that this role plays a major part in the customer’s experience in dealing with the Homes division, and that the Sales teams are uniquely positioned to impact the customer’s expectation and satisfaction throughout the entire home buying process

+ Conflict resolution as it relates to challenging situations in the course of a sale and post possession, and the timely escalation of matters, where appropriate

+ Recognize that this role is better equipped to satisfy customers with an understanding of the Homes Divisions’ processes beyond sales, including: Construction, Estimating, Marketing, and Administration, and that this knowledge will involve ongoing communications with these groups

+ Liaise with the Construction department to ensure proper information flow, orderly start and delivery of sold and spec homes






Coaching & Mentoring:

+ The Area Sales Manager is responsible for developing the Sales team and ensuring each member understands the requirements of his/her role and the expectations and sales training that comes from BDM






Marketing:

+ Ensure that the Homes Divisions’ assets, ranging from the Home Store, show homes, and spec inventory are presented professionally and marketed according to company standards

+ Provide input for and on innovative marketing solutions, alternative channels and points of product differentiation

+ Review and maintain website content for their project specifics

+ Provide feedback to marketing on traffic demographics and sources






Competitive Analysis & Industry Knowledge:

+ Develop and communicate a thorough and ongoing understanding of competitors’ offerings both in the new home and resale markets, through regular comprehensive competitive analysis of competitor’s plans, specifications, and pricing and overall product offerings

+ Maintain continuous involvement within the respective Regional residential community and homebuilding industry






Must Haves

+ Post-secondary diploma or degree in Business or related area preferred, with minimum of 5 years’ experience in sales

+ Combination of education and experience will also be considered

+ Supervisory experience managing teams of 2-5 people

+ Outstanding sales and customer service record; New home or residential home sales experience is preferred.

+ Proficient computer knowledge i.e. Microsoft Office suite

+ Exceptional time-management and organizational skills

+ Completion of LDP 1 & 2, RIWP, PHBI New Home Sales Professional Program, and Canadian Contract Law.






Your Opportunity




We are proud to offer our employees what they value most:

+ Competitive compensation

+ Excellent extended health benefits

+ RRSP program

+ Generous tuition assistance program

+ Leadership development and mentorship programs

+ A culture based on our values of Passion, Integrity and Community




​

We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: Territory Manager (Pet Business Unit – Animal Health) – Fraser Valley/Interior (BC) CONTRACT
description:
Job Description
225189

OUR COMPANY


At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies that improve the lives of both humans and animals. Founded in 1885 and family-owned ever since, Boehringer Ingelheim takes a long-term perspective.  


Now, we are powered by 52,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. We believe that if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve.  


THE POSITION


The Territory Manager in Animal Health utilizes our BI Animal Health sales model, territory amp; account management, along with business planning capabilities to execute our strategies to maximize performance within the assigned territory. The Territory Manager works with customers, decision makers and cross-functional partners to manage accounts/clinics, understand needs/drivers, build customer value and maintain business relationships as a partner to offer innovative solutions in biologics and specialty pharmaceuticals for companion animals, beef and dairy cattle, equine, swine and avian.


This opportunity is within thePet Business Unit.


Responsibilities


Sales Performance: Meet overall annual net sales objectives for key growth products and portfolio via demand generation within assigned geography; Track progress against goals on a monthly basis; Uses the BI Animal Health sales model to engage customers and, understand our customersrsquo; needs; Positions products based on Plan of Action and customer insights; Fosters a positive working relationship with individual customers and accounts/clinics; Leverages multi-channel and close-loop marketing tools and resources with targeted/segmented customers.


Effective use of Business and Technical Knowledge: Demonstrate an understanding of BIAH products, competitors and clinical studies; as well as current and emerging animal health industry trends; Employs Technical Services Veterinarian(s) to increase product/disease and clinical knowledge; Collaborates with TSV(s) to address customer perspective and/or add-value; Shares insights amp; competitor activity through appropriate channels with relevant stakeholders; Leverages business tools (CRM/Impact Vet/Sales Reports) to assess/understand market, product, account/customer and overall territory dynamics and opportunities.


Territory and Account Management: Adheres to communication requirements and effectively manages time and territory management; Follows-up with customers and cross-functional partners in a timely manner; Develops and reviews customer/business plans and leverages available business tools; Records learnings/insights and call objectives and maintains account/customer data/information in CRM; Leverages pre/post-call process to enhance customer engagement and impact territory performance; Manages expenses amp; regional events budgets; Identifies decision-makers and influencers within accounts/clinics and develops a working relationship; Shares learnings/insights with team members, manager and cross-functional partners; Identifies business opportunities and together with manager/brand team; Undertakes calculated risks.


Teamwork and Collaboration: Exhibits behaviors that demonstrate BI Values and AAI Culture (Accountability, Agility and Intrapreneurship); Demonstrates a growth mindset, is self- directed and open to coaching/feedback; Plans, organizes and collaborates with team members, manager and cross-functional partners; Identifies opportunities and brings forward solutions to address customer needs and respond to challenges; Prepares for and actively participates in local, regional and national meetings; Shares best practices with team and cross-functional partners; Participates in brand champion and strategy meetings as required; Demonstrates leadership, leads by example, role model.


Adherence to Ethical and Industry Standards: Demonstrates high ethical and professional standards with all business contacts in order to maintain BIAH excellent reputation within the industry; Compliance with CAHI Code of Conduct and other related BIAH Standard Operating Procedures.


Requirements

  • University degree
  • History of successful performance in previous roles.
  • Minimum of 3 years sales experience, preferably in the Animal Health industry.
  • AAI (Accountability, Agility and Intrapreneurship (Elements of how We Work at BIAH)
  • Fluent in social media trends and understanding of the power of social media in business.
  • Business acumen - Account management
  • Business planning amp; customer prioritization skills
  • Account Management experience or understanding
  • Strong presentation skills including oral, written and interpersonal communication.
  • Analytical skills including computer and technology skills; Outlook, MS Office, smart phone and CRM tools.
  • Well-developed selling and negotiation skills
  • Self-directed with a growth mindset
  • Collaborative team player
  • Ability to travel (40%,overnights required)
  • Must possess a valid provincial driver s license (based on location of assigned territory)
  • Must reside within assigned geographical territory
  • Bilingual skills (English/French) is a requirement for positions in Quebec

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?


With us, you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives.


We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition,learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.


We also offer acompetitive salary, generous amount ofpaid time off (vacation, personal days, contingency paid time offfor Long Term Contract Employees),comprehensive and flexiblebenefitsplan, Defined Contribution Pension Plan with company matching of RRSPs, Employee and Family Assistance Plan, employee and leadership development programs, and programsto support overallhealth andwellness for employees.


AtBoehringer Ingelheimwe embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities. 


Remoteworkoptions (if applicable for this role), will be addressed with candidates who are selected to participate inthe interview process.


Want to learn more?Visitwww.boehringer-ingelheim.ca


READY TOAPPLY? 


Visithttps://careers.boehringer-ingelheim.com


Create an Accountandlog-in to apply on-line.


We thank all applicants for their interest in our company. Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


BI Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities to support theirparticipation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.  If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.


BI Canada COVID-19 Protocol: BI Canada is strongly committed to providing a safe work environment for employees. We understand the need to enable safe in-person interactions whether at the office, externalvenuesor customer locations. To do this, we need to ensure workplace interactions take place in a low risk environment.


At BI Canada we have introduced a COVID protocol. As of the time of this posting, this protocol requires new and existing employees complete and submit an ldquo;Employee Confirmation Statement re: lsquo;Low Riskrsquo; Statusrdquo; to Human Resources


For those employees who are fully vaccinated, they can on a voluntary basis provide the company with a copy of their vaccination certificate(s) through the Confirmation Statement.


For those employees who are not vaccinated, OR, have chosen not to share their vaccination status, they will be required to take the necessary steps to prove they have tested negative for COVID (through rapid tests that will be provided by the company) no more than 48 hours before they are in an in-person meeting or interaction. Employees will be required to take the COVID test and complete a form for BI, upload a picture of the test result and submit the form automatically. This form must be completed each time an employee takes the test before an in-person interaction with a customer, colleague, supplier etc.


The successful candidate for this Job Posting will be required to complete the mandatory Employee Confirmation Statement on the first day of employment with the Company.


DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS
Applicationsfor this position will be accepted until May 9,2022(6pm EST)


Not exactly the position you are looking for but have someone else in mind? Share it via the button on the bottom of the page with friends or colleagues who might be interested.

title: Agent - Financial Services - Service Signature Montreal
description:
(Work place: Saint-Laurent)

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-04

This person in this position works closely with account managers - wealth management, specialized financing advisors for Signature Service and other specialized advisors from Desjardins’s various components. The incumbent maintains business relationships with members and clients and performs sales support activities and operational activities in line with processes for savings and financing products and services.

General Information on the Position

Main responsibilities

  • Handle recorded telephone messages for wealth management account managers and advisors. Process calls immediately, and refer any calls that require further attention to managers and advisors.

  • Manage the agenda for wealth management account managers and advisors, schedule and confirm meetings requested by members and clients, and let them know what documents to bring.

  • Help prioritize weekly activities for wealth management account managers and advisors and plan follow ups and solicitation activities.

  • Prepare documents for meetings with members and clients. Enter and update members’ data in tools and applications and note sales opportunities for wealth management account managers and advisors.

  • Finalize files after meeting with members and clients, particularly after obtaining their signature, answering their questions about operations, opening accounts, and offering and closing product sales. Update information in line with the action plan by scheduling follow ups and updating financial statements.

  • Process instructions presented in appropriate tools and applications. Integrate, validate and record activities and transactions (e.g., subscription, renewal, modification, repurchase of specialized and other savings products, transfer IN and OUT, account closure, estate settlement, disbursement, renewal, change to mortgage and consumer financing, and penalty calculation).

  • As needed, contact members and clients to confirm transactions or to perform follow-up. Make any courtesy calls requested by the wealth management account managers and advisors. Help prepare and take part in conferences and any follow-up activities for members and clients.

  • Work to develop business by taking part in various solicitation activities.

  • As needed, advise and assist members and clients in the optimal use of various alternative tools and channels to encourage self service (e.g., ATMs, AccèsD Internet and telephone, Desjardins Mobile Services). Sell convenience products and services (e.g., Desjardins access card, Visa Desjardins card, subscription to AccèsD, cash orders). Process required transactions, and follow up with members and clients.

  • Maintain business relationships by contacting members and clients. Carefully listen to them to grasp sales opportunities and to ensure their needs are met and they are completely satisfied. Ensure their files are kept up to date.

  • Ensure that files are complete and compliant, in a timely fashion and according to quality standards in place.

  • Ensure that transactions and operations are secure, while respecting existing policies, practices and standards.

Other working conditions

  • Workplace: The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work. #LI-Hybrid

  • Number of jobs available : 1

Qualifications

  • Attestation of Collegial Studies

  • A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience

Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • Hold a mutual fund representative certificate – Autorité des marchés financiers

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Communicates effectively, Interpersonal Savvy, Situational adaptability

Work Location

Service Signature Montréal

Trade Union

Non Syndiqué

Unposting Date

2022-05-6

Job Family

Member/client sales and service (FG)

title: Buyer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood currently has an opportunity for a Buyer. Reporting to the Project Services Manager, this position is located in our Trail, BC office.  This role has overall responsibility for providing key supply chain management support on mining projects. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key responsibilities

  • Under direction from the Project Procurement Manager and Supply Chain Lead, purchasing of equipment & materials for mining projects
  • Expediting & processing shipping releases
  • Committing purchase orders and maintaining controls to monitor supplier performance and conformance to commercial terms
  • Participating in lead supplier negotiations regarding commercial terms & conditions for purchase of equipment and bulk materials
  • Updating and maintaining procurement plans
  • Developing and maintaining Request for Quotations (RFQ's) and Purchase Orders (PO's) within Wood's integrated project management system
  • Expediting vendor data and material delivery

Skills / Qualifications

  • 5-7 years purchasing experience in a heavy industrial environment
  • Technical diploma or engineering degree in a relevant discipline is an asset
  • Advanced computer skills and experience in a data base environment 
  • Strong organization and communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Construction field experience is an asset
  • Convero, or comparable ERP experience, is an asset

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Channel Sales Manager
description:
Reports to: VP of Sales
Position Type: Permanent, Full Time

Summary:

The Channel Sales Manager will be responsible for creating and executing a strategic channel sales plans to accomplish short, medium, and long-term revenue goals for Norsatâ€™s Satellite business unit. With a focus on our parent company, Hytera Communications, the Channel Sales Manager will develop collateral, deliver training, identify champions, motivate and support the worldwide Hytera sales team to create new opportunities for satellite components, terminals, and satellite networks. This is an exciting new role within the company where the candidate will have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the growth of Norsat.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide training, pricing and positioning support to Hytera channel partners
  • Providing accurate short- and long-term forecasts
  • Meeting quarterly and yearly sales and profitability targets
  • Leading the sale for large channel opportunities
  • Motivating the channel to keep Norsat â€œtop of mindâ€ and to prioritize Norsat
  • Tracking all sales activities relating to customers, pipeline and prospects
  • Contributing to marketing efforts including: new product introduction, pricing, promotional activities, collateral development, and feature requests.
  • Supporting pre-sales technical discussions to convert customersâ€™ requirements into specifications
  • Working with marketing to execute lead generation campaigns
  • Monitoring competitorâ€™s sales efforts and strategies
  • Visiting customers and attending tradeshows

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate degree, marketing, business, or technical discipline
  • Minimum 5 years of channel sales experience with a channel delivering > $5M USD
  • Minimum of 5 years sales experience selling RF products
  • Knowledge of satellite or broadband/communications industry is highly desired
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects from conception to obsolescence

Personal Attributes:

  • Passion for selling success
  • Customer advocate
  • Self-motivated, high energy
  • Superb communication skills (oral, written and presentations)
  • Ability to manage large strategic partners and develop new partnerships

Security Screening Requirement:

Norsat is a secure facility; thus, all employment is contingent upon the selected candidate’s successful clearance from federal security screenings, including Criminal Record Check.


No recruiters please.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are looking for a dedicated Purchasing Agent for our corporate office, based in Burnaby, for a 1 Year Contract position. Some travel to Regional Offices may be required.

The Purchasing Agent is responsible for materials purchasing, processes, and coordination of suppliers for Houle projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Identify potential business opportunities
  • Responsible for day-to-day pricing and procurement of commodities for all Houle projects
  • Assist with the maintenance of "Houle Price" database that is shared as above
  • Support the senior purchasers with ongoing maintenance of our Accubid Database both for material and labou
  • Assist all Estimators as necessary to obtain pricing for Estimates and Projects
  • Assist with the development and training for our procurement system
  • Make product recommendations

Experience and Skills:

  • Electrical and/or Electronics Technology training or experience
  • Formal purchasing training or education
  • Accubid experience an asset
  • Procurement systems familiarity
  • Familiarity with the Electrical Industry
  • Ability to negotiate
  • Proven Leadership skills
  • Proven ability to manage risk

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Purchasing Agent". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. ('DHC') is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing, and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

We are currently recruiting for a Purchasing agent for our Supply Chain department to join our team in Victoria, BC.

SUMMARY OF FUNCTIONS:

As the interface between Viking and a group of our world class aerospace supply chain partners, the Purchasing Agent will be accountable for managing the ongoing and assured supply of aircraft parts and services in line with Viking's requirements. Key accountabilities will include: supplier delivered quality, on-time delivery performance, cost, inventory and vendor continuous improvement. The Purchasing Agent is also responsible for developing and improving the day-to-day relationship between Viking and its supply chain partners.

MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITES:

  • Ensure that all vendor-supplied products and services meet or exceed all regulatory, customer and company requirements.
  • On time release of purchase orders to ERP demand and product lead times.
  • On time delivery of vendor-supplied aircraft products and services.
  • Maintaining purchase order data integrity in line with ERP system and managing exception messages generated from ERP system
  • Working with Viking Supplier Quality Assurance, ensure that all vendors strictly adhere to Viking's Quality Management System.
  • Actively participate in Viking's ongoing Continuous Improvement program.
  • Ongoing review, management and coordination of vendor-related engineering change.
  • Engage fully with Viking's metric-based performance management processes.
  • Seek to develop skills and experience by proactively participating in professional training and development programs.
  • Participate in supplier negotiations and strategies around vendor consolidation
  • Adhering to material spend and inventory targets

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:

The Purchasing Agent will work within the Supply Chain function, and liaise with staff in Operations, Engineering, Quality and Finance. The role reports directly to the Supply Chain Manager. The Purchasing Agent is also responsible for managing the day-to-day relationship between Viking and its supply chain partners.

EXPERIENCE AND/OR EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor of Commerce, Engineering or similar numerate discipline, or equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years' experience working in a procurement role within a manufacturing or operations environment.
  • An understanding of contemporary lean manufacturing principles and practices.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a willingness to learn.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships and work effectively with people at all organizational levels.
  • Intermediate / advanced computer and data analysis skills are desirable.
  • Strong excel skills
  • Experience in data analysis is a distinct asset
  • APICS certification, although not required, is a distinct asset.
  • Aerospace experience, although not required, is a distinct asset.
  • Experience with Visual Manufacturing (infor) ERP is distinct asset.

We thank all candidates for applying, however; only selected applicants will be contacted.

title: Service Manager
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Under the direction of the Branch or General Manager, the Service Manager is responsible for the day to day operational management of an assigned client portfolio within the branch operation. In a branch â€œstart-upâ€ operation, the Service Manager may report directly to a Regional Vice President and additionally be responsible for branch growth and start-up activities.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Those duties necessary to meet the minimum requirements of the position.   Other duties may be assigned:

  1. Act as the primary client contact for the assigned portfolio of accounts. Responsible for regular face to face client interaction and proactive resolution of any operational issues at assigned client base. Maintain ongoing and proactive client contact, including site visits, meeting attendance, timely response and follow-up, phone calls, lunches and other special events.
  2. Define, address and resolve all client issues including personnel/staffing concerns or requests, service issues or requests, execution of company programs, officer performance issues, or other service related items.
  3. Responsible for Service Manager duties for assigned portfolio of accounts, including setting up and managing weekly schedules, inputting payroll, tracking job openings on approved Operations reports, initiating open requisitions with Field Recruiting in the applicant tracking system, evaluating applicants, scheduling and conducting interviews, and hiring qualified applicants to fill open post positions.
  4. Ensure all positions are staffed according to contract requirements and effectively manage branch overtime through proper scheduling and staffing. Maintain a qualified, sufficient pool of rovers or contingent workforce for backfill of vacant positions as needed.
  5. Ensure all post requirements are current and complete at assigned portfolio, including current post orders, training and licensing compliance, staff training, vehicle policy compliance, uniform and appearance standards being met, and other staff and client relations policies being administered according to company standards.
  6. Ensure that policies regarding coaching and discipline are followed consistently, employee complaints are promptly reported, investigated and resolved, and compliance with all employee relations policies is followed consistently.
  7. May work closely with the Sales team assigned to region. May participate in sales presentations to potential clients, go on sales calls, and participate in sales events.
  8. May be responsible, with Branch/General Manager oversight, for new account startups and transitions, ensuring staffing levels are met, training and uniform issues are addressed, and physically participating in startup activities to ensure a smooth transition.
  9. Ensure oversight and regular use of financial reports to manage key branch measurements, such as overtime and scheduling efficiency for assigned client portfolio.
  10. Attend and actively participate in management meetings within region and at corporate. Observe operations and make suggestions for improved efficiency as appropriate, including providing ideas and plans for growth and improvements within the assigned portfolio, branch or company-wide.
  11. In a start-up operation, may also perform duties typically performed by Human Resource Coordinator or Receptionist on an as-needed basis, where such positions have not yet been added to the branch staff.
  12. Others duties as assigned by Branch/General Manager, Regional Vice President or corporate staff.

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:   To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.   The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or experience required.   Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Sales, Marketing or Business preferred with a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years related experience with progressive managerial responsibilities.
  • Prior experience in the security or other service related industry, law enforcement and/or military is highly desired. Experience in scheduling, operations or other functions of the security industry a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative, successfully handle and prioritize multiple competing assignments and effectively manage deadlines.
  • Energetic and focused personality with a demonstrated ability to take initiative, successfully handle and prioritize multiple competing assignments and effectively manage deadlines.
  • Must be highly proficient and fully functional in all Microsoft Office applications and able to effectively utilize all available office management technology.
  • Professional, articulate and able to use good independent judgment and discretion. Must have proven ability to maintain correspondence, discussions and materials in strictest confidence.   Must be able to work overtime as needed.
  • Current state driverâ€™s license, clean driving record (no points in prior 3 years), minimum level of insurance as required by Company policy, and ability to safely operate a vehicle required.
  • Professional, articulate and able to use good independent judgment and discretion.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills required. Ability to successfully interact at all levels of the organization, including with clients, while functioning as a team player required.  

 

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:  

  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use both hands, is frequently required to stand, sit, stoop, talk and hear (communicate verbally in person and via regular telephone equipment), and must be able to read computer screens, correspondence and reports in English.
  • The employee must constantly walk, stand, reach with both hands and arms, and must be able to drive a vehicle. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.   May be required to climb stairs on an intermittent basis at client sites.  
  • The job is generally performed in an office setting; however, during site visits the employee may be subject to adverse conditions such as rain, cold or heat for short periods of time.
  • The ambient noise level is usually quiet, consisting of normal conversations, business machines (copiers, printers, etc.) and telephones, but occasionally may be above-normal for portions of the shift.
  • The employee must be able to concentrate on details, work under deadline pressures, apply sound logic and judgment, and prioritize tasks and responsibilities.
  • Must be able to focus and multi-task in a busy environment, with the ability to successfully handle stressful situations in a calm and professional manner. Includes being able to effectively manage multiple employees with diverse personalities and engage them to perform at optimum levels.
  • Must be able to clearly speak, read and write English.
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

 

Requisition ID:2022-760162

title: Territory Manager - Vancouver BC
description:
Territory Manager - Vancouver & B.C. Province

 

Job Summary:
Reporting to the Regional Market Manager, the Territory Manger performs activities to drive optimal retail service and installation results for mass channel retailers. As a dedicated Hallmark brand advocate, the Territory Manager is responsible for developing effective and professional relationships with store managers in their assigned territory while maintaining existing Hallmark departments and negotiating for incremental floor space in support of various promotions. As a Territory Manager, you will be responsible for managing a team of part-time retail merchandisers that will execute all service activities at store level, and support installation activities, including new programs, new store openings, renovations and revisions.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Manages a part-time team responsible for ongoing and regular service for all mass retailer accounts in the territory, ensuring consistent high quality execution of Hallmark product and promotional programs in each assigned account. Includes Everyday and Seasonal Programs. Accountable for performance management, succession planning, coaching, mentoring, and the ongoing development of team members.
  • Leads and oversees all revisions, renovations, and remodels for mass customer accounts in assigned territory. Includes attending on site and ensuring overall execution according to plan.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs regularly.
  • Develops long term positive retail relationships with store management.
    Responsibility for “retail influence” with store managers to advance product
    and program placement outside of the Hallmark department to drive revenue.
  • Maintains a Home Office and works independently/remotely from management and head office; often works outside of standard work hours.
  • Forges professional partnerships and relationships with store management to create a positive impact on financial success for both the retail customer and for Hallmark.  The underlying goal is to produce a perception of Hallmark and our products which mirrors our brand commitment.
  • Dedicated brand advocate with demonstrated passion and knowledge for Hallmark's vast product line.
  • Manages all resources within budget and according to company policies and procedures.

 Communication Skills:

  • Must display strong two-way communication skills to effectively transfer knowledge, both written and verbal.
  • Must demonstrate professional demeanor in all interactions. Uses a positive and enthusiastic attitude to engage others and gain consensus.
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills and strong knowledge of Smartphone technology.

Qualifications & Experience required

  • University or College degree/diploma/certificate in Business. Administration/Marketing or equivalent in a related field.
  • Must be a self-starter with ability to manage multiple projects and adapt work style/processes in a fast-paced environment.
  • Valid driver's license and vehicle required.
  • Travels on a regular basis – by ground and by possibly by air.  Overnight trips are required depending on territory geography.    
  • Previous experience with managing a part time retail team in service/installation activities is preferred.

title: Area Manager, Vancouver BC
description:
Overview

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. We’re always on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us on this exciting journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that groundwork. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.

 

About the role:

 

At OSL we’re excited to announce that we have partnered with a Global Leader in Vaping and are looking to recruit an Area Manager for Vancouver.

 

We’re looking for a leader. No ordinary leader, but one that can inspire, coach, and develop team members, drive sales, and ensure our clients always have an exceptional experience. As Area Manager, it is your responsibility to make sure your assigned locations are delivering excellence in Customer Experience; they run with operational excellence, support the OSL brand, add value to our client and meet their business goals. You lead by example and always create an environment where team members feel valued, can grow, and function well as a team. 

 

As Area Manager, it is your responsibility to ensure your assigned locations are delivering excellence in Customer Experience; they run with operational excellence, support the OSL brand, add value to our client and meet their business goals. You lead by example and always create an environment where team members feel valued, can grow, and function well as a team. 

 

A little more about the role:

  • Build, manage and grow a team of winning sales associates
  • Responsible for management and development of a dedicated Area
  • Drive continuous improvement throughout the team’s development
  • Responsible for the achievement of all key business objectives in multiple locations
  • Achievement of all KPI'S including, Revenue, Basket Size, and New Sign-Ups
  • Establish targets for sales and payroll
  • Completion of stores operational tasks
  • Execution of merchandising and pricing direction
  • Proactively creates strategies for underperforming locations
  • Coaches Assistant Managers on the effective management of their sales team
  • Proactively recruits, selects, and hires team members
  • Develops succession plan for assigned area
  • Responsible for retention and management of sales team
  • Follows company procedures for on-boarding and off-boarding employees
  • Follows operational guidelines for Area management
  • Proactively builds the relationship internally and externally with client

  

What you bring:

  • 4-6 years multi-unit supervision and management experience
  • The knowledge that when your team is successful, you are successful - your leadership style should reflect this
  • Diploma or Degree in Business, Marketing or equivalent is considered an asset
  • Strong management, coaching, and leadership skills, developed in a retail organization
  • Ability to proactively recruit, select and hire team members from Managers to Sales Associates
  • Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively train and motivate team
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities with a demonstrated sense of urgency
  • Advanced organization skills with the ability to plan and schedule people and tasks
  • Strong customer service orientation towards consumers and direct reports
  • Computer aptitude with proficiency in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, Outlook
  • Understanding of merchandising in a retail environment
  • Ability to drive sales and service while achieving operational standards through a field team
  • Proven ability to manage district budgets, forecast sales and retail metrics
  • Flexible to work evenings and weekend periods, based on business needs
  • Able to travel up to 50%-60% within your assigned area

  

What we offer:

  • Competitive base salary + bonuses
  • Comprehensive health, dental and life benefits
  • Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
  • A supportive workplace culture and work environment 

 

Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

 

OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

title: National Sales Director for Construction Equipment
description:
We are seeking a National Sales Director for a Construction Equipment company in Toronto preferred but can be other major cities in Canada. The firm is a leading global company in formwork, scaffolding and related engineering with over 1,300 Engineers and 8,100 employees worldwide. This position reports to the CEO, and has 25 direct reports (4 Regional Managers, 19 Technical Sales Consultants, 1 Estimator and 1 Administrative support clerk)


Scope of Position:

The Sales Director is responsible for establishing the company as the largest and most competent player in the formwork market. They will develop and execute all key growth sales strategies and assist Regional Managers in developing the local market strategy. They will analyze trends and results, define, and implement a detailed market approach for existing and new markets: customers / segments / products /regions.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities:


• Providing leadership and sales support to the Regional Sales Managers across Canada

• Setting and monitoring targets according to the overall strategy for Regional Sales Managers and ensuring targets are set and monitored for Technical Sales Consultants

• Coordinating sales forecasting and planning and budgeting processes used within the sales organization

• Ensuring Responsibility Matrix is followed

• Ensuring quality sales processes

• Ensuring quality of sales staff by recruiting, selecting, training, coaching, and developing talent

• Monitoring project execution: invoicing, charges, scope, communications

• Monitoring project closeout

• Authorizing credits

• Building and maintaining strong customer relationships

• Ensuring adequate sales processes for large and/or complex projects in segments across

Canada

• Identifying opportunities for sales process improvement

• Providing input in the development and administration of sales incentive compensation programs

• Overseeing bidding activities, ensuring compliance with strategy and material availability

• Monitoring job pipeline and forecasting material needs

• Ensuring use of the company’s tools, such as CRM, amongst Technical Sales Consultants

• Monitoring projects regarding material (status, material needs, returns, closeouts)

• Coordinating project start-ups and monitoring project execution and close-outs

• Supporting proposal and contract design for large / complex projects

• Guiding adequate project monitoring

• Understanding the Occupational Health & Safety Act and safety responsibilities identified in DR2 Health & Safety Management System

• Ensuring that employees are adhering to all established health and safety policies / procedures

• Ensuring that all employees are aware of potential hazards associated with the workplace, equipment and environment and establishing control measures for hazards

• Addressing all employee reports of hazards / incidents / accidents in a timely and effective manner

• Conducting incident / accident / near miss investigations in a timely and effective manner

• Ensuring any reports of workplace violence and harassment are addressed immediately and effectively

• Assuming accountability for health and safety issues and holding direct reports accountable for their responsibilities

• Taking every precaution reasonable for the protection of all workers and visitors

• Ensuring compliance with laws and manages through their team with integrity and in an ethical manner.

• To perform duties as prescribed in the Occupational Health and Safety Act.

• Performs other duties as required


Requirements:

• Post-secondary education, preferably a degree in civil engineering or related field

• 10+ years’ experience in technical sales, business development and sales management

• Experience in the construction industry preferably with formwork and scaffolding systems.

• Understanding and experience with a large scale rental business is needed.
• Strong technical background in formwork and scaffolding systems

• Strong leadership skills with demonstrated experience leading a sale team

• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

• French and English bilingualism is an asset

Qualifications

• Post-secondary education, preferably a degree in civil engineering or related field

• 10+ years’ experience in technical sales, business development and sales management

• Experience in the construction industry preferably with formwork and scaffolding systems.

• Understanding and experience with a large scale rental business is needed.
• Strong technical background in formwork and scaffolding systems

• Strong leadership skills with demonstrated experience leading a sale team

• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

• French and English bilingualism is an asset

title: Senior Media Buyer
description:
Company Description

Publicis Media is one of Canada’s fastest growing Media Agency networks. The secret sauce? A pool of talented individuals who learn from each other (while tapping into global centres of excellence) and transparency at the core of everything we do, from data reporting to billing all the way to agency leadership. The result is a blend of meaningful work for some of Canadas’ favorite brands and endless opportunities to grow for our team members.

PMX (Publicis Media Exchange) is the commercial arm of Publicis Media, driving and delivering value for clients, while fostering and building marketplace leading partnerships with media owners. PMX drives value for the brand agencies through intelligent investment and centres of excellence within buying and digital practices such as television, radio, ooh, search, social, programmatic and ecommerce.

In addition to providing continuing opportunities for career growth we are proud to offer our employees market leading benefit and incentive programs.

You’ll be provided with 3 weeks minimum vacation to start plus additional long weekend Publicis days, holidays closures, your birthday off, free Headspace memberships, wellness and technology credits, and market leading savings and pension plans.

We strive to provide what matters to you personally with the ability to choose and modify programs to suit your lifestyle.

    Job Description

    The Senior Media Buyer negotiates with media vendors to secure the most cost effective delivery of objectives; balancing price with quality factors.  The negotiation is reflective of the strategy & brand requirements of approved campaigns in TV, OLV & Radio in a team environment.​

    This role requires a candidate who is analytical, math proficient, and well organized with great attention to detail. The candidate must be well informed of the TV, Radio & OLV landscape (programming, trends, formats, ownership) trends and research.

    Responsibilities: 

    • Negotiate approved executions – TV (including linear optimized), Radio & OLV ​
    • Work with media vendors regarding tactical aspects of the media buy to achieve campaign objectives and/or fulfill a client request​
    • Manage contracts/ insertion orders and any resulting revisions with media vendors​
    • Input broadcast/OLV media buys ​
    • Actualize media spending​
    • Assist with financials​
    • Clearing of invoice​
    • Train media assistants​
    • Prepare/develop reports in PowerPoint & Excel – routine & custom reports​
    • Usage of all media related systems​
    • Media management - DDS, OLV buying platform​
    • Media Research - nLogic
    Qualifications

    • Minimum of Associate Degree in Media, Bachelor’s degree a plus/preferred​
    • Track record of success throughout post-secondary career and previous employment​
    • Minimum of 3 years of media buying​
    • Media systems’ proficiency​
    • Strong analytical & math proficiency skills​
    • Solid verbal and written communication skills​
    • Technical proficiency, particularly with Excel, Word and PowerPoint​
    • Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving abilities​
    • Able to work successfully with teams, handling multiple projects and meeting tight deadlines under pressure​
    • Detail-oriented and able to produce accurate work product


    Additional Information

    Publicis Media is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. We create and nurture a vibrant work environment that celebrates, values and leverages all aspects of diversity and inclusiveness, attracts world-class talent and serves as the industry benchmark for best practices. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate accommodation for candidates with disabilities or accessibility needs throughout the recruitment process, upon request. Please contact our recruiter for any questions, accommodations or specific requests. We thank all candidates for their interest in Publicis Media, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Architecture Contract Administrator
description:
Company Description

A Canadian leader in architecture and design, Lemay has seen spectacular growth and exciting transformation in recent years.

At Lemay, we believe in design’s unique value to create open and meaningful space to grow. We commit to every design problem with curiosity, invention, and a generous spirit to uncover hidden opportunity. We are a team of transdisciplinary change-makers creating planet-friendly spaces for people and their communities.

We take pride in the diversity of our team in terms of ethnicity, culture, religion, aboriginal status, sexual orientation, disabilities, gender identity and age.  We are committed to providing an equitable, diverse, and inclusive working environment for all members of our team so that each person feels respected and valued. 

Our core purpose: to design generous spaces that create meaningful impact. 

Job Description

Job Description

The Architecture Contract Administrator will be responsible for the administration of all project related documentation and information during the construction phase. The Contract Administrator finds unique and fair solutions to day-to-day construction related activities and challenges. With a humble approach, and a respect for the industry and craft the candidate will work along side various stakeholders involved in the project. Explore various typologies including new build architecture, commercial renovations, high end interior fit outs, post-secondary, data centers, and site and land development among others.

What you'll do

  • Represent the project team as prime consultant contract administrator;  
  • Manage, facilitate and complete the necessary contract administration forms, documents and procedures as required including shop drawings, RFI’s, site instructions, change documentation etc.;
  • Review, respond and provide supplemental information to contractors and clients as required throughout the project;
  • Conduct periodic site visits to ensure construction work is proceeding in accordance with the contract documents;
  • Collaborate onsite with Clients, Contractors, and Engineering partners;
  • Monitor and advise on internal and external project budgets;
  • Maintain project schedules;
  • Support client requirements throughout the lifecycle of a project;
  • Coordinate production of technical estimates and documents required for construction approvals and permits;
  • Develop work plans and monitor project budgets;     
  • Prepare and execute Construction Contracts and Change Management documentation.

How you'll stand out

  • Architectural Technology diploma or direct construction experience;
  • PMP Certification considered an asset;
  • 1-3 years related experience in contract administration, project coordination or direct construction or architectural experience;
  • Ability to build strong relationships and camaraderie with clients, contractors, and partners;
  • Ability to navigate contentious dynamics with a calm demeanor and provide solutions while managing risk and liability;
  • Knowledge in Alberta Building Code, Specification, and Contract Administration forms and procedure
  • Experience in Office, Commercial, Institutional projects;
  • Proficient in MS Office (Project, Outlook, Excel, Word)
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple mandates and priorities simultaneously
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize 

What we offer

  • Hybrid and remote work policy at all times;
  • Summer and flexible hours year round;
  • Onboarding and Mentorship programs;
  • Online training platform plus internal training available to all employees;
  • Competitive compensation structure;
  • Flexible group insurance program (health, dental, medical, paramedical insurance)
  • Health & Wellness Programs: $500 Lifestyle Account, Virtual Healthcare
  • Payment of membership fees to your professional associations;
  • A minimum of 3 weeks vacation;
  • Paid Holiday closure closure between Christmas and New Year;
  • Social activities throughout the year.

Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manager, Small & Mid-Market Sales - Remote, Canada
description:
“The small- and mid-market LMS segments are exploding, and Absorb’s cutting-edge technology is in high demand. We have more qualified leads than we can handle and need a rock star to help us rapidly build our team and process.” – Mark Behl, EVP Inside Sales

The Position:

Are you passionate about software, technology, and sales? Do you define success far beyond your own accomplishments? Are you a passionate people leader with the skills to sell? Absorb is looking for you.

With our recent valuation of $500M USD, Absorb is poised for incredible growth and we need your expertise. As our new Manager of Small & Mid-Market sales, you will support our team as they emerge into an exploding segment that has not yet been tapped into by Absorb. Did we mention that you get to sell Absorb’s cutting-edge LMS?

You will get the opportunity to help scale our existing team to handle the massive demand in the market. With your proven track record of success, you will get the opportunity to mentor and coach a number of like-minded sales individuals. Your ability to identify trends and build pipelines will lead your team of Absorbers to uncapped success.

Not sold yet? Check this out! 

Absorb LMS

https://absorb.wistia.com/medias/kvm8cbkfjs

Key Responsibilities:

  • Effectively help your team of quota-carrying salespeople, to manage a full sales cycle, build and manage a pipeline, and deliver accurate forecasting.
  • Provide support for escalations and participate directly in complex sales situations and negotiations.
  • Hire, motivate, coach, and provide training to increase productivity and development of employees.
  • Provide detailed activity reports, opportunity management, quotes, and forecasting as well as verbal feedback to sales management.
  • Collaborate closely with Marketing, Customer Success, and Product Management.
  • Ensure high-quality customer experience and consultative sales process.
  • Inspire your team through your vision and energy.
  • Meet or exceed team revenue and conversion targets.
  • Analyze reports to identify trends.
  • Create and maintain a collaborative culture.
  • Provide necessary critical feedback to direct reports.
  • Conduct training on skills development, inbound sales, and learning & development topics.
  • Ad hoc duties as required.

Key Requirements:
Minimum Requirements

  • Previous experience being a positive and collaborative leader.
  • 3-5 years of sales management experience with a proven track record of success.
  • SaaS-specific sales experience preferred.
  • HR-related SaaS experience is a plus.
  • Superior coaching skills.
  • Strong analytical skills to identify team trends and patterns to drive results.
  • Personal responsibility to accomplish
  • B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent knowledge

Technologies we use:

  • Absorb LMS, Salesforce, Salesloft, LinkedIn SalesNavigator

The Company:
Absorb Software is a learning technology company based in Calgary, Alberta Canada, with offices in London, Dublin, Tampa, Boston and Sydney.

Absorb offers both Absorb Infuse, the first Learning Experience Platform (LXP) to offer a true in-the-flow learning experience and our flagship product, Absorb LMS, an industry-leading and award-winning Learning Management System for businesses, higher education, government and non-profit agencies around the world. Absorb is setting new standards in learning technology and support, fueling companies who believe that people are their greatest asset.

We exceed expectations across enterprises, industries and continents, helping people learn at the speed of now and preparing companies for the future of work. How do we do it better? We pay attention to the details and go deep where it matters. Turning a culture of learning into a revenue engine for global titans the world over.

Care to join us?

Why work at Absorb Software?

  • This position is eligible for participation in Absorb’s Bonus program as outlined in Absorb’s Bonus Program Policy.
  • RRSP match program.
  • Employer-paid benefits: health, dental and vision.
  • Professional development plans.
  • Career progression/internal mobility opportunities.
  • Inclusive work environment.
  • Casual dress code.
  • Volunteering opportunities.
  • Company/team building events.
  • Games room, meditation & yoga space, state of the art workplace.
  • Flexible remote working options for selected roles:
    • This role can be fully remote.

Additional requirements/information for candidates:

  • In the event a current Absorb employee would like to apply for this role they will inform their supervisor prior to submitting their application.
  • This position will be subject to pre-employment background screening, including a criminal record check.
  • The successful candidate must be able to show proof of legal eligibility to work in Canada without sponsorship.
  • The successful candidate must be able to temporarily work remotely during the Covid-19 pandemic.
  • Incomplete online applications will not be considered.
  • Applicants will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.

Absorb Software (Absorb) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. Absorb is committed to providing employees with an environment free of discrimination, bullying and harassment. All employment decisions at Absorb are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. We will maintain our commitment to and support of equal employment opportunity for all individuals without regard to race, national/ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics or disability. Our commitment to equal employment opportunity extends to any other protected classes which may exist under applicable law.

We acknowledge and are mindful that our Calgary, Alberta operations are located on traditional territories of the Blackfoot Confederacy (Siksika Kainai), the TsuuT’ina, the Îyâxe Nakoda Nations, the Metis Nation (Region 3) and many diverse Inuit, Métis, and First Nations peoples who make their homes in the Treaty 7 region of Southern Alberta. We recognize their distinctive spiritual relations with the land that supports our home and our business. We are humbled that our office is built upon the generous land that sustained indigenous people for centuries.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
We’re looking for Client Success Managers who are responsible for providing value and owning the success of Cvent’s customers with event management solutions. As a Client Success Manager, you will join our dynamic, close-knit Client Services department and support some of the company’s most valuable clients. In this role, you will be responsible for exercising Cvent knowledge to ensure clients are able to realize the full benefits of the Cvent Platform. Client Success Managers help customers to understand, align, and reach business goals by delivering maximum value through product adoption, revenue opportunities, and improved overall success of client relationships

The ideal candidate should be customer centric, extremely motivated with excellent communication skills, and possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment.

 

What You Will Be Doing

  • Ownership of accounts in the high touch market segment
  • Understand and align with customer goals to help achieve desired outcomes
  • Monitor user adoption and system usage, recommend strategies to increase usage/adoption
  • Maintain strong advisory relationship with key client contacts in positions that can significantly impact adoption
  • Conduct strategic business reviews to gauge progress, identify areas for improvement, gather and maintain key client metrics to achieve client/company objectives
  • Understand client’s risks and presenting on recommendations and solutions
  • Cultivate new business opportunities by asking questions, mining opportunities presented and sharing findings with sales
  • Manage activities and liaise between the client and the various departments within Cvent, including Technology, Sales, Client Services and Marketing
  • Document, route and track feature requests, and provide client with progress updates
  • Guide new clients through onboarding by understanding their needs, disseminating training resources and assisting with account setup
  • Opportunities to meet with clients onsite; up to 20% travel required

 

What You Will Need for this Position

  • Bachelor's degree with strong academic credentials. Our Client Services team is made up of people from various educational backgrounds including, but not limited to: business, psychology, communications and computer information systems.
  • 3-5 years of Customer Success experience managing an account portfolio is required
  • Strong business acumen, ethics and high integrity.
  • Comfortable using general office software applications; sales automation products such as Salesforce.com, Gainsight, Zoom and web collaboration tools.
  • Excel at developing client relationships over the phone and in person.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Ability to communicate effectively with clients and internal team members
  • Must be articulate, organized, detail-oriented, and have the ability to multi-task in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment.
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal and written).
  • As described above, this role requires you to go onsite to assist Cvent customers with their events. Certain Cvent customers are currently requiring that any Cvent employee sent onsite show proof of vaccination against COVID-19. Accordingly, you may need to show proof of vaccination against COVID-19 prior to being sent to any customer event or meeting.

title: Customer Success Director
description:
We are seeking a Director, Customer Success that will hold a strategic customer-facing position leading a team of technical experts and Account Managers to support our customer base, maximize recurring revenue and upsell where possible. 

You will be a part of our leadership team, helping drive the success of the business unit. You will be responsible for building out and maintaining our Customer Success team as well as become a key contributor in setting and executing Gtechna high-level strategy, a Business Unit of Acceo Solution Inc (Harris Computer).

As an accomplished, respected leader you will have a reputation for impeccable customer and team management, creativity, attention to detail and strategic insight in the delivery of results and recommendation.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Drive the alignment of customer retention and sales expansion with existing and new accounts
  • Own the financial model and performance metrics, including projections of costs and Recurring revenue forecasts, retention and upsell rates, and net promoter score (NPS)
  • Drive continuous improvement efforts to ensure that each and every customer derive true value from Gtechna - ACCEO in the most efficient and cost-effective manner in line with contractual commitments.
  • Prepare weekly and monthly reports to align performance and identify best practices and performance improvement opportunities
  • Coach and develop a strong and proactive team of Technical experts and account managers
  • Lead the customer support teams
  • Develop, in collaboration with other parties involved, detailed work plans, integrating resources, timelines, budgets and risks throughout the project
  • Identify and analyze key project components to perform accurate risk assessments, including evaluating probability, determining impacts, and creating contingency plans
  • Participate in client presentations and oversee communications to existing clients
  • Identify clear requirements to improve the existing product installed over 150 accounts
  • Identify request for change opportunities requested by the clients that will improve the core enforcement platform.

What you need:

  • 10+ years related work experience with demonstrated senior account management experience, leading teams towards successful customer outcomes, preferably with Municipalities, Enforcement software or Parking Permit software.
  • Demonstrated customer support and sales quota achievements
  • Strong business process development and budget management skills
  • A deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models
  • In-depth experience building and mentoring high-performing teams, you are a people manager at heart, love to mentor, lead and grow everyone around you. You have experience managing performance and having your team deliver results consistently.
  • Experience working with large and complex enterprise accounts
  • Proven ability to lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams
  • High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office - Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Google Docs, Sheets, Slides
  • Advanced knowledge and understanding of CRM tools
  • Fluent in English and French both written and spoken
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • A bachelor's degree or a combination of relevant training and experience
  • Ability to document issues, improvements or new features for the product and engineering team
  • Ability to travel

Bonus points for:

  • Knowledge of Gtechna enforcement software suite and its customer base; North America municipalities.

Gtechna/ACCEO/Harris computer offers:

  • An opportunity to be part of a dynamic team, in a pleasant working environment located in Ville Saint-Laurent.
  • Group insurance plan and RRSP starting day one
  • Stock Purchase Plan after 6 months
