title: Director Sales Executives
description:
What does a great Director Sales Executive Director do?

This is an extremely collaborative role between the Partnership Team, Sales and Product. The ideal candidate will have a software engineering background with a keen sense for business strategy and excellent communication and organizational skills. Their primary responsibility will be to build new strategic partnerships with software partners that will process payments through the Clover Connect technology stack.


In this role, you can look forward to:


+ Prospecting and meeting with potential software providers to integrate with our exciting new payment technology platform, Clover Connect

+ Owning and exceeding monthly and annual targets for driving net-new integration revenue

+ Driving a robust software integrator pipeline

+ Identifying successful strategies for target verticals

+ Engaging in on-going business development relationships with key software partners

+ Building strong and effective working relationships with internal sales, product and marketing team members

+ Reviewing and analyzing available data to determine best market opportunities and programs to drive success

+ Building and cultivating prospect relationships by initiating communications with follow up communications to move opportunities through the sales funnel.

+ Working with the Vice President of Strategic Partnerships along with our Head of Inside Sales and the National Sales Manager to develop and grow revenue forecasts

+ Representing the company in a professional and congenial manner in person, on telephone conversations, and in written correspondence (general correspondence, contracts, agreements, and proposals)

+ Tracking progress of ongoing initiatives including strategic plans and goals, or initiatives as determined by the executive leadership team

+ You will be required to remain informed, track, and communicate any innovative technological advancements in the payment integration space


Basic qualifications for consideration:


+ High school graduate/GED

+ 5 to 10 years in a product or sales role involving software, ideally for merchant services

+ Demonstrated ability to drive quantifiable business results with strategic direction

+ Strong understanding of sales strategy and how sales processes and models work.

+ Experience with integrated software accepting card-present and/or card-not-present payments

+ Strong professional and social networking presence

+ Solid understanding of payment gateways and payment integrations

+ PCI-DSS and PA-DSS Compliance

+ Strong knowledge of ecommerce solutions (e.g., shopping cart technology, hosted checkout, payment links, etc.)

+ High level understanding of HTML5, CSS, JSON, Javascript and RESTful APIs


Preferred qualifications for consideration:


+ Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing in business administration

+ Working knowledge of networking

+ Understanding of cloud technology

+ Understanding POS technology

+ Understanding of hosted web solutions

+ Working knowledge of popular coding languages


To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.


We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.


Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services” But we are.


We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.


We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.


Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.


We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled/LGBT).


Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet.

title: Buyer
description:
Windsor, Ontario & Strathroy, Ontario are two sites located in Canada offering soft gel development and manufacturing capabilities for the Pharmaceutical and Consumer Health industries. We have a broad range of integrated formulation, manufacturing, analytical and packaging services to offer full service turnkey solutions. The location of this position is dependent on the qualified candidate’s location as our two sites are concomitant.

The Buyer reports directly to the Procurement Manager

Reporting to the Procurement manager, the Buyer will control the implementation of strategic procurement initiatives by managing MRP demand information in conjunction with assigned purchasing and inventory control responsibilities.  This to include raw material and MRO procurement as assigned.

The Role

  • Review and analyze daily MRP data for Raw material and / or Packaging Component requirements, managing purchase cost, production planning and inventory value considerations.
  • Issuance, maintenance and follow up of purchase orders and MRP item master input and maintenance.
  • Proactive development of competitive sourcing opportunities in all areas of assigned responsibilities (materials, equipment, supplies, etc.).  Perform cost and value analysis to support purchase recommendations/decisions.  Ensure Vendor GMP compliance/requirements are achieved.
  • Work with local stakeholders to increase the efficiency of the NPI quoting process. Supports on time the BD requirements for the launch of the below key projects.
  • Contribute to the strategic development of supply base management and company initiatives as required.
  • Reactively respond to fluctuations/dynamics from both external and internal material demands and availabilities (i.e. market supply issues, material availability disruption, contaminated materials, etc.).
  • Must be able to work extended hours, weekends as needed, especially when problems occur or when deadlines must be met.
  • Resolve customs issues as required I.e. Routing calls.
  • Compliance to 100% Procurement, EHS, and Quality trainings.
  • Perform other duties as required.

The Candidate

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or Supply Chain Management.

Experience:

  • 3-5 years of experience in MRP or related field.
  • Experience working in a manufacturing, pharmaceutical and/or GMP facility.

Skills Required:

  • Demonstrated knowledge of purchasing and contracting techniques and procedures.
  • Thorough knowledge of MRP database systems.
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office I.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, Microsoft Project
  • Considerable knowledge of laws, ordinances, and regulations pertaining to corporate purchasing practices.
  • Experience in RFP procedures, quote analysis, PO issuance and contract management.
  • Strong writing skills for creating reports, correspondence, contracts, requests, bids, and other documentation.
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Sound analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to respond appropriately in pressure situations with a calm and steady demeanor.

Working Conditions:

While performing the responsibilities of the job, these work environment characteristics are representative of the environment the employee will encounter.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.

Position located in Windsor, Ontario or Strathroy, Ontario.

Regular working hours: 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM or 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM with a 30-minute unpaid lunch.

Physical Demands:

These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential duties of the job. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions of the job.

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel and to manipulate keys on a keyboard. Use of manual dexterity is required. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, bend or twist, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

There is also the potential exposure to chemicals.

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!  Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference. 

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

   

personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.

Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristic protected by local law.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

    

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

title: Director of Sales
description:
• Make your mark with a rapidly growing industry leader!
  • Enjoy a highly competitive salary of $150k-$200k and a host of generous benefits!
  • Contribute to the exciting development of 5G and the evolving telecommunications industry!

About Gap Wireless

Gap Wireless is a leading distributor of products and services for the mobile broadband and wireless markets, serving carriers and contractors throughout North America. The company works with industry-recognized vendors to stock and distribute thousands of wireless infrastructure and Test & Measurement products. Gap Wireless also provides value-added technical/engineering services.

We value the technology innovation enabled by its vendor partners from around the world, and are committed to bringing the best in wireless, mobile broadband, network infrastructure, and RF test and measurement products and solutions to customers throughout Canada and the U.S. At Gap Wireless, we realize that our employees are what makes us great and we are committed to recognizing outstanding work, and ensuring our employees are supported in fulfilling their full potential. 

To learn more about us, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

Gap Wireless currently has an exciting opportunity for a Director of Sales to join our team on a full-time basis, in Mississauga, Ontario on a hybrid work model of in office and work from home. Travel throughout North America may be occasionally required.

In this position, you will be supervising the sales team, building long-term client relationships, and driving demand for Gap Wireless’ solutions. As Director of Sales, the successful candidate will utilize creativity and thorough knowledge of sales process fundamentals to provide innovative ideas for business growth. Ultimately, you should aspire to develop and maintain successful relationships with large, distributed customers and vendor partners.

More specifically, some of your key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Accomplishing sales human resource objectives by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, and counseling employees, in addition to communicating job expectations, planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing job contributions, planning and reviewing compensation, and enforcing policies and procedures for the sales team
  • Achieving sales objectives by contributing marketing and sales information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews, preparing and completing action plans, implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards, resolving problems, identifying trends, determining system improvements, and implementing change
  • Determining annual gross-profit plans by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for all staff, projecting expected sales volume, analyzing trends and results, establishing pricing strategies, recommending selling prices, monitoring costs, competition, supply, and demand, in addition to providing detailed and accurate sales forecasting
  • Providing extensive oversight into strategies for accomplishing company e-commerce goals
  • Being the chief negotiator with large customers and when dealing with new clients and markets
  • Working directly with the Leadership Team, to develop and execute a growth plan
  • Visiting each account manager on a regular basis
  • Monitoring and analyzing performance metrics and suggesting improvements
  • Managing and measuring sales staff to key expenses such as travel, entertainment, etc.
  • Performing research and identifying new potential customers and new market opportunities
  • Staying up-to-date with new product launches and ensuring sales team members are on board
  • Providing strategy for effective turnover of demo instruments and equipment every 6 months

More About You

In order to qualify for this role, you will need 5-10 years of experience in a senior-level sales role with a demonstrated ability to drive sales initiatives. You have extensive experience selling into large strategic accounts using strong negotiation and closing skills, along with demonstrated ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization. Experience managing a high-performance sales team (of 5-10 people), overseeing employee and labour relations, training, and a proven track record of quota achievement is required. A university degree or diploma in Sales, Business Administration, or a Technology related field is an asset. 

As our ideal candidate, you are highly motivated, self-sufficient, and possess strong leadership and team management abilities. You have experience working and communicating with individuals at all levels and are able to clearly develop and deliver effective, measurable strategies to drive growth. You have well-developed interpersonal skills, excellent negotiation skills, and demonstrated customer service experience. Moreover, you possess an ability to understand and analyze sales performance metrics, with a confident and strong-willed attitude. 

Above all, you have the creative ability to see opportunities that others may not, with the drive to continually improve and evolve. 

About the Benefits

As a highly valued member of our team, you will be rewarded with a highly competitive salary of $150k to $200k, negotiable based on skills and experience, along with a host of benefits, including:

  • 100% employer paid extended health and dental insurance
  • RRSP matching
  • $2000 for extended health spending 
  • 21 days paid time off to start 
  • Paid travel and accommodations
  • Car allowance 
  • Employer-paid home internet and cell phone plan
  • A variety of monetary rewards, prizes, and incentives for employees
  • Employee appreciation, team building events, monthly lunches, and Christmas parties! 

If you are driven and eager to make your mark in a rapidly growing and evolving industry, then we would love to hear from you - Apply Today!

You have experience working and communicating with individuals at all levels and are able to clearly develop and deliver effective, measurable strategies to drive growth. title: Sourcing Associate
description:
Job Description

As part of the sourcing operations team, you will gain experience in sourcing talent for executive recruiting. You’ll get to touch each area of sourcing including market research, active sourcing, and candidate engagement, learning a little bit each day from the recruiting team who are passionate about renewable energy!  The ideal candidate is someone who has aspirations to be an executive recruiter but doesn't have that experience yet.  

Work with sourcers and recruiters on open positions to find the right talent.

Create communications for talent communities, email campaigns, and social media posts to target candidates and advertise open job opportunities.

Generate market intelligence reports to arm sourcers and recruiters with knowledge about where the talent is and obstacles in securing it.

Create documentation about new processes and present it to the sourcing team

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Marketing, Engineering, or Energy

A passion for people – communication style that can engage talent and partners

Excellent organization skills – you know how to manage multiple assignments

Solid research skills – you know how to find things on the internet and aren’t scared of new technology

Agility – you can easily shift between tasks/projects

title: Account Director
description:
Company Description

Publicis is an omni-channel communications agency with over 600 employees across our Canadian operations.  The office is the largest in our industry in Canada and boasts talent across various disciplines of marketing and advertising expertise. Publicis carries a balanced split of Canadian, U.S. and Global clients for which we are Agency of Record.  Publicis supports a range of D&I actions through our Driving Change team as well as giving back to the community through a long-standing participation in the Out of the Cold Program. With a strong, active and familial culture, Pub United is the agency’s social club, hosting events as wide reaching as Curling, Trivia Nights and more.

Job Description

The Account Director must be strategically minded, with a background in integrated production. They will serve as a key team lead, the bridge between client and agency, and oversee multiple workstreams on the account. They must be able to build and enhance internal team dynamics, strengthen our client relationships and build trust. They are valued partners to senior brand managers and marketing directors, as well as agency leaders. They are hungry to grow professionally and eager to teach and mentor their junior team members. They are responsible for directing day-to-day agency efforts on behalf of the client, and always champion great creative work and flawless delivery.

Core Responsibilities

Operational Excellence

  • Demonstrating strong organizational skills and attention to detail, and helping to teach and constantly reinforce these skills to junior account team
  • Proficiency in leading and managing multiple projects, end-to-end, to tight deadlines - in a fast-paced environment 
  • Vast experience in broadcast, digital, social production – with clear understanding of process and problem-solving abilities 
  • Strong oral and written communication, across both client and internal communications

Thought Leadership and Curiosity

  • Driving thought leadership and strategic deliverables for the future of the brand
  • Selling and presentation of strategic marketing direction/pov’s, deliverables and recommendations to the client
  • Staying up-to-date on all relevant activities from competitors and peripheral categories
  • Building collaborative and trusted relationships with creative and strategic agency partners Demonstrating a problem solving mentality 
Qualifications

  • Must have 7 – 8 years of relevant experience (e.g. account management, client services, marketing strategy) with excellent exposure to production


Additional Information

Publicis Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of our community. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.  If you require a specific accommodation please contact Human Resources at 416-925-7733 or by email at inquiries@publicisna.com

title: Sales Manager - GTA 18 Month Contract
description:
Job Description

The Sales Manager of the G&E team is responsible for selling Cineplex theatres and venues throughout their designated territory as a meeting and event venue while supporting the Event Manager to manage the event details with the client and venues. The Sales Manager is also responsible for finding new accounts and helping clients reach their event goals. In addition, the Sales Manager works closely with theatre and venue operations to ensure proper event execution as well as various business units within the Cineplex ecosystem.

  • Work closely with clients, theatre and venue teams to ensure exceptional execution of events from inception to post-event follow up 
  • Create and maintain relationships with clients across the region through consistent communication to maximize new and repeat business 
  • Negotiate and prepare proposals, contracts, event profiles and invoices through CRM  
  • Generate new business through effective territory management, targeted prospecting, and attendance at relevant events (includes conducting site visits and open houses) 
  • Maintain good relationships with the film department, operations, finance, marketing, and other internal stakeholders 
Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Minimum 5 years of sales and service experience in a B2B environment
  • Post-secondary education
  • Previous hotel, theatre, convention, or unique venue sales experience will be advantageous 
  • Strong negotiation skills  
  • Understanding of the market and industry trends  
  • Excellent customer service, verbal communication, and interpersonal skills 
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities to tight timelines 
  • Self-motivated and driven to deliver on target 
  • Exceptionally organized, detail oriented with strong time management skills 
  • Advanced working knowledge in Outlook, Excel, and CRM 
  • Bilingual 


Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Accessibility

Cineplex  is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at 

jobs@cineplex.com

.Interested applicants, please apply today.

No Agency Calls Please

title: District Sales Manager
description:
Company Description

Headquartered in Southern California, Skechers has spent nearly 30 years helping men, women and kids everywhere look and feel good. Developing comfort technologies is at the foundation of all that we do—delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products at a reasonable price. From our diverse footwear offering to a growing range of apparel and accessories, Skechers is a complete lifestyle brand.

With international business representing over half of our total sales, we have product available in more than 170 countries and significant opportunities for continued expansion worldwide. We sell our collections direct to consumers through more than 4,000 Skechers stores around the globe and Skechers e-commerce sites, as well as through a network of third-party partners.

A MULTI-BILLION-DOLLAR GLOBAL LEADER IN THE FOOTWEAR INDUSTRY.

Job Description

Company Description

NOW TRENDING: Careers at SKECHERS.

Join our global family of innovators who make an incredible impact every day at one of the biggest footwear brands in the world!  Learn more about our brand at about.skechers.com

Job Description

The Skechers Retail Team obsessively drives outstanding sales gains, fueling growth and expansion for the Skechers brand worldwide! The District Sales Manager is a stores’ expert who passionately leads and develops a talented team of store managers to deliver exceptional store results. This energetic leader is talent, product and sales focused and has the positivity, resilience and grit to solve anything, even on the tough days.

  • Entrepreneur: Drives their district to meet and exceed sales and metrics goals and guides their team in addressing and correcting store performance challenges. Ensures their team is proactively building their sales and conversion by localizing and tailoring their assortment and merchandising to their customers’ wants and needs. Maximizes profitability and a healthy balance sheet by keeping costs and loss in line with goals.

  • Expert: Leverages their deep wealth of retail knowledge and their internal partners to solve problems and remove obstacles for their team, regardless of operational challenges or circumstances beyond their control. Brilliantly shifts gears to respond to sudden changes or demands from corporate HQ and teaches their team how to pivot effectively, staying flexible to the ever evolving retail landscape. Drives compliance with policy and procedure and ensures their team applies those policies consistently. Proactively informs their Regional Sales Manager, retail operations and senior retail leadership if realities in stores, including wins, opportunities and obstacles.

  • People Champion: Always insists on recruiting and hiring top talent and consistently engages their network for referrals. Develops, coaches and mentors their Store Managers and Store Teams to meet their full potential and run successful stores. Focuses on succession planning and ensures constructive and clear performance coaching to help our team meet challenges and improve as needed.

  • Merchant: Translates and trains their team on the company’s strategic objectives within product, in-store marketing, community events, shopping experience, etc. Ensures their stores are a delight to shop and that conversion and customer experience are top-notch.

 

 

 

Qualifications

Retail Leadership is in your blood! You have 5 years of multi-store leadership experience at the District Manager level and have a proven track record at exceeding sales and metrics targets. Equally adept at sales, people, product and operations, you’ve trained and developed countless retail staff and store managers to their own accolades and career growth. You understand the fast-moving world of retail, executing flawlessly while staying adaptable and flexible to the unexpected and unforeseen. You’re known for transparent, open communication and enthusiastic leadership. You’re a retail systems veteran with strong technological savvy and learn new retail systems and applications rapidly. Finally, your grit and resilience are well-honed and you’re happy to be a road warrior, traveling up to 100% by car, air or rail as needed.



Additional Information

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelors Degree preferred, though not required.

  • 5 years of experience in multi-unit retail leadership; prior District Level experience strongly preferred. Deep expertise in retail sales, product merchandising, store operations and talent development.

  • Strong, demonstrable expertise in retail systems, technology and applications.

title: Client Relationship Manager - USA/Canada
description:
Who we are:

Global Shares is a leading provider of public and private global stock plan services. Our employee share ownership plan technology is award-winning, and our range of products and services make equity plan administration simple, secure, and globally compliant.

What we value:

People -We care about our people. We treat our people with respect. We embrace diversity and inclusion. We build open and honest relationships, collaborating across boundaries to meet our clients’ needs.

Bravery -We dare to do things diﬀerently. We provide best service and technology through innovation, creativity and high performance. We challenge the norm, we challenge ourselves and we challenge complexity with simplicity.

Global -We are one global network. We are champions of employee ownership. We work together, incorporating clients and partners as an extension of our team. We foster a global and diverse community, where our people are united through ambition, commitment and shared goals. We are in this journey together.

Integrity- We are committed to professional integrity We conduct our business to the highest standards with skill, diligence and responsibility. Professional trust, honesty and compliance are at the core of our culture

Service -We are client focused. We strive to provide our best service, to drive great client experience through teamwork and high performance.

Why we need you:

We are looking for a talented Relationship Manager for our Strategic Accounts .

Relationship Managers at Global Shares are viewed as trusted partners by our client base and should be tenacious, focused and well-organised individuals who should be at the forefront of our client/partner relationships. The core responsibilities of this role involve managing relationships with users and decision makers in the account, managing revenue and growth objectives, being accountable for customer and partner satisfaction. The successful candidate will demonstrate the key traits of ambition, resilience, interest in the customer’s business needs, along with strong technical orientation and ability to customise and tailor solutions for a variety of scenarios.

What you will do:
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with multiple clients as assigned.
  • Build depth in relationship by initiating contact and developing a relationship with decision makers.
  • Manage the post-sales relationship for strategically significant accounts.
  • Serve as the primary client contact and advocate for day to day and escalated issues and requests.
  • Work closely with implementations, operations and service desk teams to ensure that client is being handled in optimal fashion.
  • Establish and maintain customer satisfaction across named accounts through account planning, proactive client communications, issue remediation and containment, as well as performance measurement.
  • Ensure customer receives the up-most value from the Global Shares product.
  • Leverage internal subject matter experts to help customers optimise their investment, ensure program objectives are being met and measure the value of the solution to their organisations.
  • Meet assigned targets for profitable sales volume and growth objectives in assigned accounts.
  • Actively grow existing account base to identify new value creation opportunities.
  • Keep up to date with industry information which could provide value to your clients or value internally.
  • Build network of share plans advisors and experts in your region
What you have:
  • Minimum 5 years of account management experience supportingglobal companies.
  • Minimum 3 years demonstrable experience in Relationship Management
  • Strong technical orientation and ability to work with complex technical products.
  • Proactive by nature. Go above and beyond to serve as a trusted adviser for your customers.
  • Exceptional personal, listening, written and verbal communication skills are a must.
  • Proven track record of successfully building and nurturing multi-level client relationships.
  • Superior critical thinking, decision making and problem solving skills.
  • Success orientated spirit with focus on customer delight.
  • Project management experience with excellent organisational skills.
  • Ability to tailor message formats and contents to the audience and get heard.
  • Ability to lead and motivate, develop clear and creative solutions to complex problems and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
  • Ability to understand customer requirements, identify, up-sell and cross-sell opportunities.
  • Able to operate in a fast-paced environment.
Nice to have:
  • Share Plans Experience
  • Technical background
  • 3+ years of experience working with Cloud-Based software
What we offer:
  • Opportunity to be part of something special, Global Shares is growing fast, and we want you to be part of our journey
  • Competitive salary
  • 401K Plan
  • Medical Benefits
  • Active Social Club with events throughout the year
  • Opportunity to travel and work in our global offices if desired
What our Interview Process is like:

Step 1- After you apply, a recruiter may reach out to you for an introductory call

Step 2- If your background is match for the role, you may be required to complete a technical assessment (role depended) and/or phone interview with 1-2 people

Step 3- If you continue through the process, you will interview virtually 1-2 times

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Global Shares. Global Shares is an equal opportunity employer.

Want to see more https://vimeo.com/577688726?utm_content=193951621&utm_medium=social&utm_source=linkedin&hss_channel=lcp-34857

title: Sales Manager
description:
Our partner is a rapid growth company on a mission to empower accounting teams to succeed. They are revolutionizing the world of accounting software by disrupting traditional solutions with elegant, cloud-based Accounts Payable Automation software. They were recently acquired by a global company who help simplify the connection between people and what matters. 

We are looking for a Sales Manager to join the growing team.

This is an exciting opportunity for an individual to play a key role in achieving our partner's expansion goals. Your role will focus on growing, supporting, and managing a professional sales team consisting of inbound & outbound Sales Development Representatives. You will work side by side with the VP of Sales to deploy all necessary initiatives to ensure the sales team is exceeding monthly and quarterly goals.

We would prefer this role being based in Vancouver, BC close to the head office.

 

What you'll do:

  • Manage our team of Sales Development Representatives to ensure their success and high performance
  • Experiment with new tactics & technologies to increase funnel generation
  • Train sales development representatives to facilitate individual growth
  • Analyze sales data to identify potential gaps in process
  • Manage the lead pipeline from new to opportunity created
  • Define and execute the market response & outbound sales strategy, and tactics, to achieve company growth objectives.
  • Identify and monitor KPIâ€™s to achieve monthly and quarterly targets.
  • Spearhead our recruitment, onboarding and training of new SDR team members.

 
Who You Are:

  • Previous SaaS experience required
  • You understand MRR and the full sales cycle of a SaaS deal - from cold call to implementation. 
  • Fluency in English with impeccable written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong experience using Salesforce (or another CRM), Outreach, and Google Suite
  • Goal-oriented self-starter who is dedicated to driving sales and growth
  • Organized and process-driven with a strong ability to research
  • You are process and data driven
  • Experience managing a team is considered an asset
     

The Perks:

  • Competitive base salary OTE
  • Flexible Working Options
  • Dynamic open office environment with a equipped with snacks, games, and an on-site gym
  • Amazing Downtown Vancouver location, 2 mins from Yaletown Skytrain
  • We have excellent extended health and dental benefits for yourself and your family
  • You may contribute to a Retirement Savings Plan, with employer matching contributions
  • Weâ€™re champions of diversity and welcome beans of all shapes, sizes and backgrounds

title: Procurement Specialist - Senior - 26 a
description:
The role is going to be Procurement Specialist - Seniorwith the Service Alberta in Edmonton, AB

Please send the following documents to

info@smsoftconsulting.com

byTuesday, April 26, 2022 at 2:00 PM, EST if that interests you and matches your profile.
 

Without mandatory documents, we cannot submit.
1. Updated Resume in word format (Mandatory)
3. Expected hourly rate (Mandatory)
           


Job Title: REQ: 148941 - CL-Procurement Specialist - Senior (RFP Writer)

Work Location: Terrace Building, 4th Floor, 9515 107 Street, Edmonton, AB

Estimated Start Date:  01-Jun-2022

Estimated End Date:  30-Apr-2023

# Business Days:  226

Estimated Hours per Day:7.25

Note:This role 100% on-site and the proposed resources must be prepared to work on-site at the posted location (visible on req page under Requisition Details). Resumes should clearly indicate the candidateâ€™s location.

Project Overview


Service Alberta, the enterprise service provider for the Government of Alberta, is looking for an RFP Writer to support the procurement of a 1GX Print Provider. The current print provider contract expires on August 12, 2023. A full RFP procurement must be held and completed by May 1, 2023 to allow ample transition time, should to incumbent not be the successful proponent.

The Contractor will ensure the completion of compliant, accurate, timely, and high quality documents. Experience in writing and working with various procurement documents in the development process is essential.

Description of Services

  • Develop procurement and contracting documentation most suitable to ensure business objectives are met through a transparent, fair and efficient open procurement process.
  • Assist with the development of recommendations including providing details of resource requirements, dependencies, interdependencies, policy implications pertaining to the procurement and contracting methodology to be applied.
  • Produce and package procurement deliverables for presentation to various internal support teams, steering committee, and other project stakeholders.
  • Manage the procurement aspects of multiple projects, project managers and project governance.
  • Collaborate with business and IT leadership to develop a well-defined project plan that clearly states the projectâ€™s objectives, scope, assumptions, timeline, resource requirements, risks, benefits and budget in relation to the procurement process.
  • Document and report project status against established objectives, milestones, budget and resources and facilitate tracking and closure of issues in relation to the procurement process.
  • Support the development of project schedule plans and strategies, estimate resource requirements, develop and monitor work plans for completion of project tasks in relation to the procurement process.
  • Provide guidance to project resources in establishing work priorities and prompt delivery of project tasks as they relate to the procurement and contracting processes.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Ontario
description:
Description

The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for providing exceptional and proactive customer service and sales support for Kramer customers throughout the Central Canada territory.  The Regional Sales Manager will focus 50% of their time on channel management of current Kramer direct resellers, and indirect resellers purchasing through our distribution network.  The Regional Sales Manager will spend 50% of their time focused on end user business development, including a direct touch approach in establishing life-long Kramer customers. The optimal candidate will drive Kramer market share creation that increases revenue quarter over quarter.

Candidate Qualifications

Pro AV experience required with relationships already in place.  The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to identify, develop, and manage strategic sales relationships and opportunities within the Pro AV and IT reseller channels.  Candidate will exhibit rigorous strategic thinking around building such relationships, but with clear execution strength and solution selling skills.  Candidate is an aggressive self-starter and possesses the organizational skills to leverage resources from the corporate staff as needed.  Candidate will need a strong understanding of the Professional A/V, Networking, Collaboration, and IT value chains.  The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of sales experience with a focus on hunting and managing high level, complex client relationships from the supply chain down to the end user. 

Special attention will be paid to applicants that are successful and have exceeded in the following areas:

  • Key AV and IT Industry Knowledge and Experience
  • Solid AV and IT Channel and End User Relationships
  • Analytical and Sound Judgment
  • Integrity and Credibility
  • Results Driven

Specific Skills & Qualifications: 

  • Bilingual (French / English) is a requirement
  • Proven sales success within both the Pro AV and IT arenas
  • Excellent project management and planning skills, while providing high attention to detail
  • Ability to multi-task and manage several projects at one time
  • Proven ability to understand and practices value added selling
  • Ability to operate/work in a high growth & entrepreneurial environment
  • Motivated, hunter, self-starter who desires success
  • Proven ability to work independently and as a member of a team
  • Proven ability to make sound decisions within established guidelines

Specific Responsibilities Include:

  • Managing a territory covering Ontario
  • Drive monthly, quarterly, and annual sales initiatives for Pro AV and IT channels
  • Build and strengthen relationships with key players / decision makers
  • Represent Kramer at trade shows, end user events, and customer meetings to promote products
  • Actively pursue new business opportunities at the channel and end user level
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date customer information and project pipeline in Salesforce
  • Effectively manage current reseller and end user relationships
  • Work in a team sales environment at the regional level
  • Assist in resolving customer issues regarding sales and service
  • Perform other duties deemed necessary to support the Companyâ€™s business operations
  • Ability to travel regionally up to 50%
  • MUST LIVE IN TERRITORY

title: Client Engagement Manager
description:
What does Shinydocs do?

We are a data-centric software company, on a mission to change the way organizations find, understand, and action their data to make better business decisions.

Founded in 2014, Shinydocs searches, organizes, and understands unstructured data at scale, providing actionable security, compliance, and business operations insights. Weâ€™re partnering with some of the largest companies in the world to revolutionize how they handle information. We are leaders in our field and our people are some of the best and brightest in what they do.

Why Shinydocs?

We are excited that you are here and interested in learning more about us. Shinydocs is committed to provide a barrier-free and inclusive work environment where everyone belongs. We want our team to be able to do their best work, be their whole selves and experience their full potential. We are an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business and  job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.

If you require support and/or accommodation during any phase of our hiring process, please do not hesitate to connect with Samantha Sheen-Manor our Talent Acquisition Business partner (ssheenmanor@shinydocs.com). Weâ€™ll work to learn more about your needs to provide you the best experience possible and know that all information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.  

The future is bright and â€œshinyâ€ at Shinydocs. Weâ€™re a dynamic and diverse team with experience, fueled by passion for the work we do and live by our values of Excellence, Adaptability and Teamwork. Youâ€™ll be surrounded by the best and brightest minds who truly value your contribution. They will be excited to collaborate with you and will be cheering you on every step of the way. Oh and youâ€™ll be laughing often throughout the day, either with others, at each other, or at yourself :-)

  • Satisfying Work: Weâ€™re building new stuff that solves real-world problems for exciting organizations. Everyone here is self-directed, empowered and enabled to do their best work.
  • Remote First: Weâ€™re committed to a remote first work environment. We offer flexible hours and respect our team members schedules to enable them to find the work life harmony that they deserve to have in their lives. 
  • Comprehensive Total Rewards & Wellness Package: We collaborate with our whole team to develop programs that meet their needs including offering fully paid group benefits from day one, Health Care and Wellness Spending Accounts, RRSP matching, a Safe Transportation subsidy, Phone and Internet subsidies, and a Worry-Free subsidy that supports those unexpected experiences and help you provide care for your animal companions too! 
  • Professional Development, Growth & Purpose: Follow your passion and find purpose in your work. Experience learning opportunities through courses, shadowing, Shiny â€œUâ€ Sessions & Show Nâ€™ Tells. 
  • Culture & Communication: Weekly All Hands, Coffee with the CEO, and regular virtual socials and team building activities during core work hours which keeps you connected and respects your work life harmony.
  • Community Commitment: We support a variety of organizations on behalf of our team and we are proud (and active) corporate members of the WIT Network.


If you are curious to learn more and have some of these skills but maybe not all of them we still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique background and learn more about you! 

How will I make an impact?

As a Customer Engagement Manager reporting to the Manager, Engagement and Consulting, you will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of Shinydocs within our customers' environments.

Within your first 30 days, you will learn why Shinydocs is valuable to our customers and learn about the assigned portfolio of projects, shadowing with current team members to gain valuable experience on why Shinydocs is so powerful for our customers.

Day in the Life:

Relationship Pro - Flexibly partner with clients, and internal stakeholders, to set clear expectations, timelines, and manage relationships.

Drive Success - Concurrently lead and manage multiple enterprise customer implementations while driving success by creating customized project plans, guiding completion of tasks on both sides, and evaluating project success.

Tech Savvy - Familiarity with ECMs like OpenText, SharePoint, FileNet, etc. 

Champion Shinydocs Culture - Lead by example; everyone on the Shinydocs team (including you!) contributes to and defines our company culture. 

Not sure if you have enough or the right experience for this job? Apply anyways. Only 1% of candidates will ever meet every single requirement on most job postings. Itâ€™s not a big deal if you donâ€™t meet all our requirements. Diversity of our talentâ€™s backgrounds, skills, experiences and education is what makes us stronger. If you are passionate about what you do, are a great colleague, interested in learning, and willing to work hard, we want to hear from you.

title: Account Director
description:
Overview / Description :

Culture @ Ogilvy Health

Why work

with us?

  • One of Canadaâ€™s best Pharmaceutical Advertising Agencies, experiencing growth and willing to transform health communication in Canada
  • Be part of growing team of young, yet seasoned professionals and opportunity to grow.
  • Participate in sophisticated and groundbreaking professional, patient and direct-to-consumer (DTC) campaigns.
  • Work with Tier 1 Pharma Clients in Canada and on a global scale.

 

 

Reporting to:

 

 

 

 

Director of Client services

 

 

 

Role Summary:

The Account Director (AD) is a senior Account Management partner responsible for the overall client relationship for their Accounts. Account Directors are the client's strategic partner. They listen to client needs and challenges, become experts in the client's therapeutic area (TA) and make strategic and tactical recommendations to help the client's business thrive. ADs put the framework in place to drive results for campaigns â€“ from briefing copywriters and designers, managing budgets to analyzing market research metrics to optimize at next opportunity â€“ ensuring smooth production and rollout. Account Directors must be leaders within the internal agency team to both Account and Creative sides as well as to client teams.

 

Account Directors oversee a team (2-6 direct reports) and are responsible in ensuring their individual performance as well as mentoring them in their professional growth. In addition, ADs are responsible for delivering on and surpassing client expectations. ADs are responsible for client profitability, organic growth and take an active part in new business development.

 

An Account Director at OH is a senior level position where great partners who are smart, strategic and proactive will significantly impact both our business and our client's business. They also participate in process & vision for the Agency and delivering on our mission to change the face of healthcare through innovation.    

 

 

The Opportunity for an AD in our Team:

 

A remarkable opportunity for an energetic, and ambitious person to make his or her mark while playing a central role in the Agency. We are looking for someone with strong pharma and marketing experience to partner with our clients towards making their business thrive. Someone who is ready to invest themselves in a team and be part of building its continued success.

 

 

Next Level Opportunity passed this role:

 

This position is key for someone who wants to take ownership within the company. Different directors with different skill sets can each own a specific expertise and work together for the Agency to continuously develop, grow and optimize. This is a lifelong learning opportunity.

 

 

 

Interested in the Challenge?

 

Contact:

Nadine Lafond, Managing Director

Telephone:

514-313-9968

Email:

Nadine.Lafond@ogilvy.com

Web:

www.ochww.com

Responsibilities / ResponsabilitÃƒ ©s:

Principal Responsibilities

 

  • Develop accounts creatively and financially, and play a positive role in new business development
  •  Drive the client partnership and align agency resources around client priorities
  •  Clearly understands client objectives and strategic imperatives and effectively communicates their needs to the internal team
  • Develop the overall communication strategy and tactical plans, based on a strong understanding of the client's context (TA, business type, corporate priorities & processes)
  • A persuasive and confident approach to creative and strategic mandates
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Effective team management capabilities
  • A keen attention to detail and budgetary restraints
  • Full awareness of creative processes and techniques â€“ including digital platforms
  • Balance the expectations of clients with the execution of creative work
  • Develop internal business planning processes that drive tight alignment and collaboration across multiple stakeholders

 

    Daily Tasks:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Leading a team to provide the utmost level of client service and quality of work
  • Liaising with clients and cross functional teams at a senior level
  • Promoting the expansion of business with existing clients
  • Completing projects to a specific schedule and within an agreed budget
  • Using your skills to push clients, and the agency, creatively and strategically
  • Lead strategic client meetings and facilitate discussions to drive results for accounts
Qualifications :

Important Qualities:

  • Outstanding project management, organization and prioritization abilities
  • Have a passion for the Advertising industry and Agency business
  • Working knowledge of all media (print, TV, radio and digital)
  • For Canadian Accounts: PAAB and ASC understanding and basic negotiation skills
  • Critical thinker with ability to analyze and synthesize data and information
  • Self-motivator, willingness to stay up to date in a fast-pace environment, engagement and persistence
  • Experience in building estimates and managing project profitability
  • Interest in science & health, learning attitude, strategic thinking
  • Attention to detail a must. A service attitude.
  • Results oriented with a can-do spirit that loves to exceed expectations, meet deadlines, and overcome obstacles
  • Able to work independently and to take ownership while being a team player and mindful of others (partnership attitude)
  • Financial management abilities
  •  Enjoy listening, thinking, researching, learning and adding value.
  • Applies the Companyâ€™s ideals to all decision-making business approaches.

   

     Minimum      Requirements:

Pharmaceutical Marketing/Advertising/Communications Experience:

  • A minimum of 7 year of project management experience
  • A minimum of 5 years of pharmaceutical agency experience
  • Science or marketing degree & French are important assets

 

 

 

"If we hire people who are smaller than we are we shall become a company of dwarfs. But if we hire people who are bigger than we are we shall become a company of Giants."

                                                                                                                                                          -David Ogilvy

title: Associate Services Area Manager - Full Time
description:
Overview:

CANDIDATE PROFILE: The ideal candidate has a generalist Human Resource background and proven leadership skills and business acumen.

 

SCOPE OF POSITION: Responsible for the Associate Services operation including hiring, training, uniform purchasing, inventory control and reporting, laundry and all related processes for the area.   Oversee and review seasonal payroll and ensure all corporate deadlines are met.   In conjunction with the Manager, participate in the preparation and execution of seasonal/full time events, training & employee relations.                                                                                                                    

 

BENEFITS: We proudly offer a competitive benefit package for all our permanent associates including a robust pension plan, healthcare, annual bonus, RRSP, 3 weeks' vacation to start, disability insurance, life insurance and more. We also offer some fun perks like passes to the Park for friends and family.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Manage the Associate Services year-round operation
  • Oversee the high-volume administration of seasonal payroll processes/procedures including: timecard corrections; deductions; inquiries; ensuring associates set up direct deposit; closing payroll
  • Train on the usage of the UKG (Kronos) Attendance System; follow-up with departments as needed
  • Hire, train and develop the Associate Services seasonal associates
  • Participate in duty management rotation and successfully resolve complex employee relations issues (i.e. compliance and performance) for over 3,800 seasonal associates
  • Effectively interface with seasonal associates, family members, CW security, police, Service Canada and other outside agencies
  • Negotiate and purchase supplies, uniforms and resale items
  • Collect and analyze inventory data and develop plans accordingly
  • Assist with execution of events, recognition, and motivational programs for entire park
  • Assist with the development and facilitation of training programs as required
  • Assist with budget preparation and track related expenditures
  • Ability to work weekends, evenings and holidays
Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education in Human Resources and/or related experience
  • Proven ability and experience with facilitating training programs
  • Previous experience with employee relations
  • Ability to supervise, train and develop seasonal associates
  • Proven track record with a high volume operation
  • Ability to analyze data and recommend/implement procedures
  • Previous experience with PCâ€™s, debit/credit, POS systems and internal controls essential
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Ability to manage an internal customer service operation
  • Prior exposure to budgets, purchasing, costing and negotiations an asset
  • Previous payroll and /or general accounting experience an asset

title: Sales Manager
description:
Centennial has been serving Saskatoon since 1967, that's more than 50 years. They started as a retail store selling plumbing, heating and electrical parts and have transformed into Saskatoon's premier kitchen and bath showroom and renovator. looking for an exceptional Sales Manager to work as part of their leadership team to help achieve profitable growth and implement their bold vision for the future. This role would be responsible for both the Kitchen & Bath and the Plumbing & Heating divisions.

Objective

As the Sales Manager, you will work as part of a dynamic and passionate team to ensure desired sales metrics. You will create growth strategies, manage co-workers, maintain effective pricing and do whatever is necessary to achieve department sales and capacity goals.

Responsibilities

  • Refine our sales process to ensure profitable sales growth & ensure company standards are met at every touch point.
  • Develop and maintain key vendor relationships, negotiating and closing agreements.
  • Create annual budget, control expenses and meet or exceed plan.
  • Source, simplify and standardize products and eliminate any unprofitable items from the sales line.
  • Use effective change management skills to ensure the company vision comes to life.
  • Lead, Manage, and hold co-workers accountable. Include a performance management process to ensure they are successful throughout sales cycle in installation, renovation, service and showroom sales.
  • Set and review metrics that include annual performance goals, KPI’s, and timelines for the co-workers.
  • Ensure sales tools are accurate, high quality, and meets the customer’s current needs.
  • Make sure incentive programs are equitable and properly documented.
  • Shape company culture by living out agreed upon values, specifically integrity, teamwork, safety, joy, accountability, kindness and efficiency.

Requirements

Experience and Education:

  • 5 plus years with a proven track record in sales management and leadership.
  • Strong understanding of P+L statements, developing accurate financial forecasts based on revenue and sales pipeline activity.
  • Computer experience operating a quoting/estimating system and basic excel.
  • Familiar with local codes and can speak to company product lines in residential construction is an asset.
  • Retail Sales Management experience is an asset.

Skills:

  • Strong Business Acumen
  • Highly organized and detail orientated
  • Handle multiple activities with specific deadlines.
  • Decision Making; complex problem solving
  • Ability to inspire and lead others to attain company goals.
  • Professional written and speaking experience, able to negotiate
  • Passionate about Centennial and loves the brand.

Personal Attributes:

Personable, Goal Oriented, Inspirational, Successful, Motivated, Team leader, Passionate, Strategic, Team Focused.

title: Merchant Success Manager
description:
The Leadership Agency is excited to be working with a fast growing start-up that's the first in their space! This Seed round funded company is an omnichannel ecommerce platform that's disrupting the way this space operates. They're featured in CIX's top 20 of Canada's most innovative companies and are partnered with massive companies like Amazon, and Walmart.

OPPORTUNITY – Merchant Success Manager
  • Operate as an extension of the merchant’s business providing consultation and a deep understanding of their business objectives and delivering programs that can help them to achieve that
  • Become THE expert at operating the Bear platform, understanding the furniture industry, and ecommerce best practices
  • Partner with Merchant Operations to manage and prioritize projects, requests, and tasks
  • Operate as a champion for the merchants and provide timely feedback to appropriate internal teams
  • Develop and share best practices with the rest of the Merchant team to improve quality, effectiveness, and efficiency to best support merchants
  • Operate with urgency when dealing with all customer communications. Speed + Empathy = Success
ABOUT YOU
  • 2-3 years of SaaS experience in a customer facing or account management role
  • Demonstrated track record of providing outstanding customer experiences
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work collaboratively to problem-solve
  • Self-motivated and comfortable navigating ambiguity
  • Previous experience with ecommerce or digital marketing considered an asset
  • Located anywhere in North America
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Working with a team that is passionate and motivated by growth
  • Be apart of a company that’s the first in their market
  • Health and Benefits package
  • Company wide (virtual) events and celebrations for all wins!
  • Flexible hours + vacation
  • Mental Health Hibernation Days
  • Incredible hardware to help build the perfect workspace

title: Sales Manager (Kelowna)
description:
Job Description

Calling all superstar coaches in the auto industry! We are looking for a top-performing, highly motivated Sales Manager to fearlessly lead our exceptional sales team!

 

Can you close a deal in your sleep? Are desking deals, managing inventory and improving profits part of your DNA? If you want nothing more than to provide exceptional, hands-on training and mentorship to some of the top MVP’s in the car business, then look no further!

 

Go Auto is ready to offer a winning team to a winning leader. Think you’re the perfect fit? Show us what you’ve got!

 

What it takes: 

  • Experience as a top producing Automotive Sales Person
  • Results, results, results. You’re motivated by the numbers, and you go above and beyond to make sure the store crushes its goals
  • The box? Never heard of it. You’re an innovative, big-picture thinker who is constantly coming up with new approaches and strategies
  • Working with all people comes second nature to you, and it shows. You’ve got the right attitude to teach, coach, mentor and dive in to close deals
  • You treat every customer the way you’d want your mother to be treated, and provide the “WOW” experience for every client that walks through the door

 You love perks? Well, guess what? SO DO WE!

 

What’s in it for you: 

  • Industry Leading Pay Plans – Crush your targets? Get rewarded! We offer industry leading commission and bonuses
  • Employee Investment Program – Love receiving big returns? We love giving them! We offer an employee investment program that guarantees a 10% return every year (max of 25%) based on Go Auto profits
  • Vacation – Work hard, play hard. Enjoy three weeks of vacation time your first year! After five years, you receive four weeks and after ten years, you receive FIVE weeks of vacation time!
  • Health & Dental – Your health and dental matter here! You’ll Receive comprehensive benefits such as health care, dental and a health spending account
  • Training & Development– Never stop learning and improving! We offer ongoing, top-quality training and support
  • Give back to the community (We donate to causes like the Kids with Cancer Society and Go Auto Fuels the Schools every year)
  • Opportunities to grow in your career path with our promote from within culture
  • Find a career that will change your life

 

At Go Auto we don’t do jobs, we build careers. Ask about one of our many career path success stories during your interview.

 

The first step towards the life you want starts now. Shift into gear and apply today.

title: Director of Strategic Accounts
description:
Who You’ll Work For

REEF transforms urban spaces into community hubs that create jobs and bring new goods, services and experiences to the neighborhood. With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team that’s over 18,000 strong, REEF is the largest operator of parking real estate and delivery restaurants in North America. By connecting the world to your block, we’re making the place you live, the place you love to be.

What You’ll Do

We seek to employ determined high-performing sales professionals with a passion for helping clients achieve transformational business outcomes through the use of disruptive technologies and solutions in a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to entirely transform a $50B industry. As part of the REEF team, you will be responsible for selling the vision of REEF Technology by increasing market share & revenue as well as achieving monthly and quarterly goals. You will expand the REEF network in your designed territory and vertical. You will also manage a pipeline, identify and cultivate relationships / partnerships within the real estate industry. If you’re an individual that’s skilled in working cross functionally with sales, operations and leadership teams, while enhancing REEF’s profitability and growth, we’ve got a Director of Strategic Accounts role just for you!

Enhance Performance and Sales Efforts

  • Execute market expansion plans to achieve growth targets; serve as main point of contact and successfully transition relationship to operations team with contract closing
  • Develop, inform and execute strategic expansion across key markets and portfolios
  • Lead outbound sales efforts and inform all sales materials (i.e. case studies, presentation decks, etc.)
  • Deploy prospecting of both warm and cold leads, email communications, and Social Selling tools (i.e. LinkedIn) in partnership with our marketing team

What We Want from You

  • 3-5 years of consultative sales experience selling B2B services in a prospecting-driven, metrics-based environment
  • Passion for your own professional and self-development
  • Experience in selling a network ecosystems of broad client solutions
  • Prospecting experience is extremely critical – while most leads are provided, the successful candidate will be 100% committed to early-stage deal creation
  • Must be comfortable delivering insight-driven presentations that are counter to industry status quo...the fun part! as our goal is to develop new business with a highly valued and disruptive industry strategy
    • A track record of meeting and exceeding business development goals and benchmarks
    • Disciplined commitment to a structured sales system (targeted prospecting touches/week, meetings/week, proposals/week, etc.) and following a defined sales process is imperative
    • Internal drive and self-motivation will be key as our business development positions are decentralized
    • Experience in underwriting Real Estate Deals preferred
    • Previous experience using Salesforce (or other CRM) preferred
    • Experience in Social Selling and liking/commenting/promoting/sharing our content to help build a stronger brand preferred
    • Business development (hunting) background is much preferable to Account Management (farming)

What We’ll Provide

Medical

Dental

Vision

Life and Disability

401K

Paid Time Off (PTO)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

  • Frequently operate small office equipment such as a computer, tablet, and copier/printer, telephone.
  • Work is performed in a professional office environment.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Work is performed indoors for extended periods of time including up to the entire duration of shift.

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Remote, Western Canada
description:
Job ID:  397599

[[FLSAStatus]]

 

Oldcastle Enclosure Solutions (OES), a CRH company, has united the Carson®, Christy®, and Synertech® brands to form the largest manufacturer of plastic, polymer, and concrete utility enclosure products serving the municipal water, irrigation, electric, communications, and transportation markets. OES has 11 manufacturing and distribution centers strategically located across the U.S. and Canada.

 

Oldcastle Infrastructure - Built For Life from Oldcastle Infrastructure on Vimeo.

 

 

Primex, a CRH company, is the leading solutions provider of Wi-Fi transparent engineered plastic enclosures and connectivity products for the connected home. Our products range from Wi-Fi transparent SOHOpro panels, FTTH Network Interface Device enclosures, Jacks, Wall-plates, POE+ switches, and more! Primex is committed to upholding core values of reliability, quality, and service in cutting edge ways.

 

Position Summary

 

The primary responsibility of the Regional Sales Manager is to maximize sales of targeted products, uncover opportunities and drive sales growth in Western Canada. The Regional Sales Manager will also be responsible for developing new accounts and maintaining relationships at key accounts. Working with the VP of Sales to execute sales strategies in the region, utilizing our dedicated internal and external sales teams and customer support.

 

Position Responsibilities

 

  • Manage a team of external Outside Sales Representatives to drive new business and grow existing accounts in the market
  • Achieve or exceed planned sales levels for all products and services within targeted market segments, regions and/or targeted accounts
  • Conduct sales calls to implement account and/or target market strategies
  • Maintain a high level of knowledge surrounding Primex product lines and their applications to the potential customers. Act in a consultative role to the customer to ensure that they can easily order, install, an add value to their internal programs with our products and services
  • Assist in training and orientation for customer sales organizations as required.
  • Implements regional strategic sales plans to accommodate sales goals.
  • Manage to the budget and forecast for the region.
  • Reviews market analyses and responds to customer’s needs in a focused and service-oriented manner, quickly addressing issues to provide world class results.
  • Provided market based pricing based upon market feedback, and industry knowledge.
  • Manage all selling expenses within the established travel & expense budgets
  • Provide direction to the customer service representatives in support of customer needs
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Up to 50% travel possible

 

Education/Experience

 

  • BS or equivalent industry experience.
  • 3+ years sales management experience in telecom environment.
  • Previous distribution in Telecom or CommData sales experience preferred.
  • Strong business and financial acumen that translate to sound, profitable sales, and business decisions.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to relate across multiple levels with service providers, contractors, engineers, subcontractors, and distribution.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Salesforce.com.
  • Valid Driver’s license and acceptable driving record.
  • Willing to travel to customer sites in the defined Region (Western Canada).

 

What CRH Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

 

About CRH

 

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

 

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!

 

Oldcastle Enclosure Solutions (OES), a CRH Company, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

EOE/Vet/Disability--If you want to know more, please click on this link.

title: Sales Manager - Embedded Linux
description:
Canonical, the publisher of Ubuntu, is a remote-first global software company at the forefront of Cloud and IoT. Our products help companies transform their digital operations from cloud to edge.

Our flagship product in IoT, Ubuntu Core, is unique. It is Linux reinvented for optimal reliability, security and footprint. Our customers come from a wide variety of industries - Automotive, Customer Electronics, Medical Devices, Industrial Systems, Robotics, Gateways, and so many more - but they all have this in common: they strive to meet stringent quality and security requirements. 

To cope with our rapid expansion, we are looking for bright, technically savvy Sales Managers - Embedded Linux to join our team. They will prospect and develop new enterprise accounts for new business and/or further develop and grow existing strategic accounts in their defined territories. 

This is a unique hunter sales position and strategic account development role and requires energy, ambition and focus. In order to be successful, you must be comfortable positioning and selling open source, services, and software solutions to all levels of an organization, and specifically to departments that are developing embedded software and IoT devices. You should also be able to do so across multiple industries.

Key responsibilities 

  • Meet and exceed quarterly and annual bookings targets
  • Articulate our uniqueness on device enablement, application software, and services
  • Close contracts for the design and delivery of Ubuntu Core devices
  • Develop new pipeline through outreach, prospecting, local marketing, and industry events
  • Promote our brand and offerings to further extend market awareness
  • Build, execute and maintain a territory plan
  • Achieve tactical, strategic and financial objectives for the assigned region
  • Manage customer relationships and interactions through all stages of the sales cycle
  • Work with IoT Field Engineers to increase account penetration and ensure customer satisfaction
  • Maintain accurate data and forecasts within SalesForce
  • Establish productive professional relationships with key personnel, influencers and decision makers
  • Coordinate with colleagues, including support, delivery and management resources

Required skills and experience

  • Bachelor's level degree, preferably in engineering or computer science
  • Field experience in enterprise software or technology sales
  • Track record of achievement in sales targets and large account wins
  • Ability to be successful in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self motivation
  • Ability to extend existing relationships with customers
  • Ability to develop joint strategic sales plans for increased revenue and market share
  • Detail oriented with effective follow-up
  • Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time post-covid

Highly desirable

  • Embedded software sales experience
  • Knowledge of open source and Linux
  • An entrepreneurial spirit 
  • Experience with a process-oriented sales methodology

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.
