title: Customer Success Manager, Downstream (Remote)
description:
At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.

We're growing and we are looking to add a passionate Customer Success Manager to our fast-paced and customer-oriented Customer Success team to service the Downstream solution. 

Location

We're a remote-first company and looking to hire this person anywhere between the PST - EST timezone. 

Interested in learning more? Let's get into the details:  

In the Customer Success role, you will:

Build and deepen client success through onboarding, training, and account management.  As a primary evangelist for Downstream, you'll guide brands and agencies to realize the value of our solutions, engendering trust and growing our relationships.

  • Demonstrate the value of our products to new and existing customers and to build alignment and drive adoption of our platform
  • Facilitate kickoff and onboarding customers to jumpstart their use and guidance towards a-ha moments with Downstream
  • Own existing and new customers and ensure their success in using Downstream 
  • Act as account manager with command of all elements (influencers across lines of business, client use cases, opportunities, defined customer success), and owning their project, upsells and renewals
  • Deliver the target performance metrics from the accounts (adoption, expansion, and renewals)
  • Achieve high customer satisfaction (referenceability, happiness, NPS)
  • Build and maintain key customer relationships, and develop and implement playbooks and strategies for expanding their accounts
  • Anticipate, communicate and coordinate new customer needs and/or product enhancements that will help the client  and Downstream improve
  • Develop and deliver thoughtful use case based training to our customers
  • Work closely with our Product, UX and Sales teams to ensure Downstream is capturing friction points, and issues to deliver products our users love and value
  • Partner with customers as their primary point of contact to ensure they are receiving efficient resolution of their reported issues
  • Provide weekly updates and insights to report on customer engagement, usage, health, feedback, and growth opportunities

Who you are: 

  • Experience working with e-commerce tools, brands, agencies, or selling on Amazon, Walmart, or other marketplaces.
  • Hands on keys experience Amazon Advertising PPC and Amazon DSP (both 2 years+).  Bonus: experience with Walmart Advertising.
  • Familiar with with Amazon Sponsored Ad management tools or prior professional experience in digital advertising.
  • Extremely strong communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal. Good meeting presence. 
  • Ability to create content in a variety of forms, including written and video.
  • Able to quickly learn new products and applications in order to be able to help our customers use and obtain value from them (experience using ecommerce tools and Jungle Scout is a plus).
  • Ability to synthesize information and draw conclusions based on trends, and data.
  • Thrives in a rapidly changing, fast ­growing environment and can build extremely strong working relationships across teams, especially when there is shared ownership over some aspects of the projects and initiatives.

Bonus: Bilingual or more (Spanish, French, German, Italian)

Working at Jungle Scout

  • The BEST team. 
  • Remote-first culture.
  • International Meetups.
  • Access to Jungle Scout tools & experts.
  • Performance Bonus. 
  • Flexible Vacation. 
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits & Retirement Program.

We prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At Jungle Scout, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.

Jungle Scout is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

All offers of employment at Jungle Scout are contingent upon clear results of a comprehensive background check. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates prior to the start date.

title: Technical Sales Manager
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

La version franÃ§aise de cette offre d'emploi est disponible:   Version franÃ§aise - cliquez ici

 

 

Overview:

 

As a key member of the BÃ©ton Mobile du QuÃ©bec (BMQ) team in Eastern Canada, the Technical Sales Manager is responsible for the development and implementation of a vision & strategy of our specific marketing and sales for special concrete products such as RAPID SET concrete, LATEX modified concrete, Ultra High Performance Concrete (UHPC) and others in all Eastern Canada, while providing structure & leadership to the entire BMQ team.   As a short term mission the incumbent will primarily responsible for the definition and execution of a clear strategy to increase BMQ products visibility to key specifiers such as engineers, owners, developers and architects. Subsequently, the Technical Sales Manager will have the ambition to achieve aggressive growth in sales targets of special concretes along with the development of new specialized products according to market demand.

 

The Technical Sales Manager will be responsible for the expansion of the BMQ market, and more specifically market capture first and foremost in Ontario. Through this process, he/she will become the internal expert on these products and markets. Along with the BMQ General Manager, this role will include the execution of all logistical and operational procedures and processes necessary to support the development of the company. The Technical Sales Manager will have to work with institutions such as: MTO, MTQ, Hydro one, Hydro Quebec, cities, etc. and the various consulting engineering firms to publicize and specify the various technical solutions of BMQ. The Technical Sales Manager will also work cross-functionally with the other General Managers of other Lafarge markets and divisions to assist them in approaching key customers for BMQ's special products from the product line, quality control, land, the environment, manufacturing and other third parties.

Responsibilities:

 

Safety:

  • Health and Safety: Demonstrate a commitment to communicating, improving, and adhering to safety policies in all work environments and areas.  
  • Ensures all aspects of his/her role are executed in a safe manner.  
  • Obeys safety guidelines when on construction sites and Lafarge operations.

Financial:

  • Grow special concrete sales of BMQ, which includes current General Contractor Companies, Engineer firms and major Authorities.
  • Driving specifications of innovative products to enhance BMQ EBITDA.
  • Bring a strong focus on EBITDA growth through new products and markets, and none-core business opportunities to the concrete product line in ECAN.

Market & Operations:

  • Take the lead on assembling & coordinating cross functional teams to help determine the operational viability of new concrete and special concrete growth opportunities across markets and product lines.
  • Responsible for managing all logistics and operational processes and costs to ensure viability.
  • Play a key role in the preparation and presentation of CAPEX requirements.
  • Understand the parameters in the market place and determine cost viability.
  • Learn and develop Lafargeâ€™s existing network of land and assets to further expand our logistical and asset advantages.
  • Determine and evaluate cost/benefit plans for potential new products and/or sites in the market. With Quality Manager of BMQ and Quality Manager of ECAN Lafarge develop and execute a quality control plan for potential new concrete and/or special concrete products initiatives.
  • In every interaction with customers, prospects, and colleagues, be entrepreneurial and look for new business opportunities.
  • Work cross functionally and with persistence to push through all real & perceived roadblocks preventing us from being entrepreneurial in our approach to growth initiatives.
  • Gain an in depth understanding of the volume & EBITDA potential of our current and potential growth markets in ECAN.
  • Build relationships with customers & prospects to fully understand their real needs, operational and quality constraints, and work collaboratively with customers and Lafarge manufacturing & supply chain to develop mutually beneficial solutions and services.
  • Leverage internal and external resources, your networking skills, and cold calling to gain an in depth understanding of the real needs for bridges, roads, and infrastructures in general and building.
  • Become the internal expert on those businesses. Relying on customer interactions and other intel gathering opportunities, compile or update market studies for our five business and other core initiatives.

Other:

  • The BMQ unit in ECAN is a small, dynamic & entrepreneurial group focused on the development & growth of new and innovative concrete products for special use. As such the incumbentâ€™s responsibilities will evolve and grow.

 

Dimensions:

  • Direct reports: 2 (CSLR)
  • Indirect reports: 18
  • 1 physical site with volume being manufactured on site with 15 mobile plants for a total of 17,000 m3/year (covering all Quebec, Ontario and Maritimes)
  • 3 quality accreditations, BNQ (Quebec) and RMCAO (Ontario) and CSA for Ductal
  • 300+ mix designs
  • 250+ customers
  • Average 1,000 projects per year
  • EBITDA: $1.5M
  • Sales: $7.7M

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Safety on job site
  • Growth market especially in Ontario with Special concrete, minimum 20% growth of special concrete in ECAN per year
  • Promote and grow added value special products sales
  • EBITDA growth, minimum 10% per year
  • Find custom solution for client et specifying special concrete
  • Understanding benefit of our product and its value for our customers.
  • Autonomous and honest.
  • Collaborative and team player.
Qualifications:

 

Education & Work Experience:

  • Graduate degree in Engineering or related field
  • 7-10 years progressive experience in operations or related role
  • Graduate degree in business and/or project management experience would be considered an asset

 

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Extensive knowledge of concrete and its applications, theoretically and practically
  • Excellent knowledge of concrete repair products and methods
  • Entrepreneurial with a demonstrated ability to develop new products, offers or businesses
  • Results oriented, making fact based decisions and following them through to execution.
  • Believes in self, company and market. Is passionate about learning & growing.
  • Takes responsibility for own success, doesnâ€™t externalize, accepts challenges, does not take â€œnoâ€ as failure
  • Operational and logistical experience
  • Leadership skills & ability to influence without authority
  • Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; demonstrated strong presentation skills and comfort working alongside decision makers.
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in the operation and development of new businesses.
  • Experience working with large organizations with multiple priorities and decision makers would be an asset
  • Good organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management and meeting deadlines.
  • Proficient in Word, Excel, Power Point and Gmail.
  • Experience with CAPEX file generation and presentation would be considered an asset

 

Job-Specific Competency Profile:      

  • Business Acumen
  • Driving for Results and Solutions
  • Innovation Management
  • Interpersonal Savvy
  • Organizational and Strategic Agility
  • Timely Decision Making

 

LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Area Zone Manager (Calgary)
description:
Company Profile:

Lennox International(LII) is a leading global provider of innovative climate control solutions for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) markets.

Beginning over a century ago, Lennox International has built a strong heritage of Innovation and Responsibility. Our position as an innovation leader continually inspires us to promote more efficient energy use and a healthier environment through our product operations. Our engaged and diverse workforce is committed to providing climate control solutions that provide the most value and comfort for our customers.

We are proud to have instilled a shared sense of responsibility and commitment among our approximately 10,000 employees located throughout North America, South America, Europe, and Asia.

Job Description:

Responsible for the sales and operational performance of multiple stores within a given geography. Team size and geographic scope are smaller than that of Zone Managers.

  • Directly responsible for recruiting, hiring, training, and developing store teams (Store Managers, Customer Service Associates and Warehouse personnel) with focus on excellent customer service and selling skills.
  • Performs sales and operational coaching, and performance management of store personnel.
  • Responsible for sales of replacement components and aftermarket products through the store network to dealers, contractors, and other relevant segments.
  • Responsible for assigned storesâ€™ profitability based on store sales, margins, and operational expenses.
  • Determines market growth opportunities and executes on the setup and opening of new stores.
  • Responsible for store operations to deliver on the promise of excellent customer service.
  • Responsible for Store safety practices within zone.
  • Coaches stores on inventory practices to ensure accurate inventory through cycle counting and general operational excellence.
  • Provides clear direction by effectively communicating initiatives, priorities, and company strategy.
  • Works closely with Sales team (District Managers, TMs) and Supply Chain/Distribution teams.
  • Additional tasks and responsibilities as determined by the Zone Manager, in order to support the larger zone, and to prepare/develop the Area Zone Manager for future successful candidacy for a Zone Manager role.
Qualifications:

Requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Requires at least 5 years related experience.

Excellent leadership skills and the ability quickly learn how to coach dispersed teams and individuals to meet sales goals. Experience in the financial and operational aspects of store management. Experience developing brand awareness, sales promotions, and marketing strategies. Strong oral and written communications skills. Expert computer skills including Microsoft Office applications required. Advanced customer service and sales skills in retail. Knowledge of HVAC systems preferred.

title: Service Manager
description:
Attention: Service Managers

 

Are You A Service Management Expert Who Wants to Work for a Thriving Company Where You Can Grow, 

Be Recognized, and Be Rewarded For Your Work?

 

WHO WE ARE

We can be your opportunity to grow a great career in the Residential Plumbing and HVAC World.  if you enjoy responsibility and building a diverse team of technicians. Clearview Plumbing & Heating has the commitment to growing YOUR Career!

WHAT WE DO

We want your passion and dynamic attitude to help us grow our Co-Workers. Your leadership and technical skills will add to our team and importantly to you & your family’s future.

THE BIG TASK

You will Be substantially charged with growing your Co-Workers to be Team Players. You’ll build trust with your expertise and attitude about great customer service. Sometimes, you’ll care more about their future than they initially care. The 

Big Task is to shine a light on their potential, then help them achieve it! You’ll be a Teacher, Coach, Manager & Mentor!

KEY SUB TASKS

Know the Clearview Customer Service process and HOW to help your team grow. 

Be practiced! You’ll review service tickets and customer encounters. to constantly improve the outcomes for both the Service Tech and the Customer! You’ll identify the Strengths and compliment them; you’ll identify areas of improvement and take the challenge to improve us!

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

While a technical background is a huge plus, a driven person who really cares about growing successful people may work. Do you fit with our core culture? Do you have Perseverance, Enthusiasm to serve, Solution Seeking Nature, Growth-Orientation, Ownership Thinking, and do you always attempt to make the lives of others easier? 

  • You can train, coach, and manage your team under you.

  • You can help your team to improve in skill sets to create greater efficiency and work performance.

  • Must follow the outline of company policies and procedures.

  • Communicate professionally and respectfully with customers, office staff, and coworkers.

  • Be able to work in a fast-paced environment and juggle multiple priorities.

  • Must have strong customer service skills.

  • Be able to remain calm while resolving customer complaints.

  • Must have a working knowledge of general industry standards.

  • Must have strong supervisory and computer skills.

  • Must have a good driving record and ability to pass a drug test.

  • Typical work week is 8-10 hour workdays, Monday–Friday, with some weekend shifts.

 

WHAT WE OFFER

We have amazing training experiences ;We have a  boatload of great benefit, great base pay, outstanding bonus opportunities. 

LEARN MORE ABOUT US


 

Join a winning company. Only motivated people should apply

 



To get started, click the “Apply” button now and send us your resume.

title: Territory Manager (12 Month Contract) - St. Catharines, ON - (Job Number: 22000456)
description:
Description

At Medigas, the healthcare division of Linde Canada, Inc., yoursquo;ll join talented and diverse people throughout Canada, all working hard to make a difference in our clientrsquo;s lives and make our organization successful. You will work to support, develop and implement challenging and meaningful client-focused programs and you will be trusted to take on responsibility early in your career. Our employeesrsquo; contributions are valuable to our company, our clients, our communities and our shareholders.


Since the late 1960s, Medigas has been a leader in serving the Canadian healthcare market with the provision of home oxygen therapy, respiratory services, medical gases and related medical equipment. Everything we do is born out of our commitment to help people live better lives and to support the medical professionals who make it all possible.


Territory Manager (12-month contract) St. Catharines, ON


Primary Purpose:
The Territory Manager identifies and develops sales opportunities by visiting key (targeted) physicians and referral sources to promote the company#39;s products and services, conduct product training, participate in conferences and meetings. The Territory Manager may also be responsible for the initiation of prescribed therapy in the Medigas office, or the client home including assessment, education, documentation, and follow-up to ensure equipment performance and client compliance.


Key Accountabilities:

  • Identify and develop sales opportunities by visiting key physicians and referral sources to promote the companyrsquo;s products and services
  • Conduct respiratory equipment in-service training with various community partners
  • Collaborate with internal/external partners to achieve sales targets
  • Initiate and monitor of prescribed respiratory therapy in clientsrsquo; homes including assessments, education, documentation and follow up to ensure equipment performance and client compliance with therapy
  • Delivery and exchange of equipment in clientrsquo;s homes may include heavy lifting of equipment up to 60lbs
  • In home client visits may include long distance travel
  • In office consultations with sleep and oxygen clients
  • Build and maintain high quality client and referral relationships
  • Perform all job duties in compliance with Safety standards.
  • Support in the training and development of new employees as needed
  • Participate in a regular on-call rotation
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Education:

  • Registered Respiratory Therapist or a Registered Nurse with current registration preferred
  • Completed Post-Secondary Education

Experience:

  • Healthcare industry experience and a working knowledge of home healthcare equipment and clinical services
  • Prior sales and marketing experience preferred

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

  • Excellent organizational and negotiation skills
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task
  • Able to work under pressure and have strong sense of urgency
  • Must possess commitment to client and personal safety
  • Maintain client confidentiality
  • Clear Driving record/abstract

Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.


We are committed to employment equity for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


Primary Location Ontario-St. Catharines
Schedule Full-time
Job Posting Sales Marketing
Unposting Date Apr 19, 2022, 1:42:30 PM
Jun 18, 2022, 10:59:00 PM

title: Service Manager (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV)
description:
*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are looking for a driven and dedicated Service Manager for our Security team, based in Burnaby. This role requires in depth knowledge of technologies such as Access Control, Intrusion Detection, and CCTV.

Reporting to the Director, Technology, the Service Manager is responsible for managing customers, staff, financials, and core processes for the efficient and effective delivery of Security service (access control, CCTV, and intrusion detection) across the Lower Mainland.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop and lead the Security service team in the lower mainland
  • Lead a team of coordinators, dispatch, and field staff
  • Coach on preventative maintenance requirements and best practices
  • Create and manage SLA agreements with customers
  • Meet with key accounts and manage customer escalations and/or complaints
  • Participate on the leadership team
  • Manage the transition of Security projects to the Security service team
  • Manage team financials including annual budgets and quarterly forecasts
  • Maintain a strong GP% within work orders
  • Maintain a strong utilization rate
  • Schedule resources and ensure all safety protocols are being followed
  • Work closely with Field Management and other leaders
  • Assist with directing other technical experts as needed
  • Liaison with local technical colleges and universities on program development and Co-op programs
  • Manage, coach, and conduct performance management reviews of staff, including mentoring junior designers
  • Support Sales in the development and review of estimates and proposals

Experience and Skills:

  • Management and leadership experience
  • Experience in and knowledge of the security technology industry (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV) industry
  • Experience in a customer service leadership role
  • Superior interpersonal, communication and leadership skills
  • Electrical/electronic experience in designing systems
  • Working knowledge of Lenel, Genetec or Avigilon
  • Security qualifications preferred
  • Financial management and budgeting experience an asset
  • Sound understanding of industry and technology trends

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Service Manager (Access Control, Intrusion Detection, CCTV)". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Bid Manager (remote)
description:
About Us

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit, by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company, building a fare payments and ticketing platform that allows passengers to simply tap and ride using mobile phones, bank cards and smart cards to travel.

Proving ourselves as true innovators and industry leaders, we launched the Justride SDK - a first for public transit - allowing urban mobility providers, like journey planners (Transit) and bike and ride-sharing services (Uber), to integrate our market-leading mobile ticketing platform into their applications, connecting services together for a seamless user experience.

Our platform, Justride, is deployed in numerous cities around the globe, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, The Hague, Los Angeles, Sydney and many more, with an exciting industry-first SDK deployment with Uber in Denver enabling the purchase of public transport tickets right within the Uber application.

Come join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

 


The role

Masabi is looking for a Bid Manager to join our Bids team in London or the USA, working across the business, writing and managing proposals mainly for public transit agencies and operators worldwide.

As a Bid Manager, you will develop a deep understanding of our products and, working closely with internal stakeholders, write, lead and review compelling bids.

This role is the glue between sales, product, engineering, services and finance, collating information from all these functions and proposing solutions to business problems combining that information into a coherent bid to ultimately win new business. This is both an internal and external-facing position.

 


Responsibilities

  • Own bid from qualification to contract award according to internal processes:
  • Ensuring all required reviews and sign-offs are completed in time
  • Facilitating key meetings, such as kick offs, bid/no bid and sign off meetings
  • Manage/provide input into the value proposition, strategy and solution development, commercial considerations and risk management
  • Work closely with the Business Development, Product, Engineering, Services and Financial teams in the preparation and delivery of technical and commercial proposals, including draft terms and conditions, pricing and milestone payments.
  • Manage, review and edit inputs from multiple stakeholders. Document creation, writing and formatting; mainly Word, Powerpoint or Google Docs/Slides
  • Responsible for document production and delivery
  • Actively report bid progress, wins and losses to the appropriate internal teams, determining reasons for bid outcomes and making effective changes where necessary

 


What you will learn

As part of the Bids team, you will be working collaboratively with Business Development, Product, Services, Engineering and Finance which would give you a unique perspective of how a fast-paced technology company operates.

 


About You

  • Have experience writing proposals, technical documentation or similar, in a fast-paced, technology/software environment.
  • Have experience working on complex projects or products where gathering information from multiple stakeholders is critical to developing a competitive bid.
  • Are a perceptive analytical thinker with a systematic approach to problem-solving.
  • Have excellent attention to detail and ideally a good eye for design and layout.
  • Have great interpersonal communication skills and ability to quickly build relationships and rapport with a variety of stakeholders.
  • Have exceptional command of the English language and are able to produce reports, documentation and proposals to a high standard.
  • Are used to working to tight deadlines, with a focus on quality.
  • Have advanced Office skills including Word, Excel and Powerpoint or Google Suite equivalent offer.
  • Preparing and reviewing the commercial terms of the bid, understanding costs and profitability.
  • French or Italian would be considered advantageous (For European based applicants).



Some of our benefits:

  • Competitive salary package.
  • 20 days of vacation per year (not including public holidays), plus the option to buy an additional 5 days of vacation each year. On top of this, our office is shut every year between Christmas and New Year, totalling a whopping 28+ days of vacation.
  • Private Healthcare and Life Insurance via Trinet.   
  • Choice of a workstation. 
  • $250 per year to spend on your home office.
  • Flexibility to work from home whenever you need to and flexible working hours (we are currently operating fully remote due to COVID-19).
  • Ability to work for up to 3 months per year from any country in the world, tax laws permitting.
  • Regular social gatherings with a monthly spending allowance for each employee (when it’s safe, currently used for virtual lunches and events).
  • Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world.

 



Diversity:

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply and we don’t discriminate. Also, please notify our team of any preferred pronouns at any point of your application. 

 



Interviewing:

In light of the continued Covid-19 risks, all interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.


 


Remote working:

Masabi’s flexible working policy will allow you to work fully remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be largely made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year (tax laws permitting).

 

To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

Requirements:

None

title: Director of Sales Strategy - Med Device/Life Sciences
description:
KP Recruiting Group is a consulting firm that provides leadership and exceptional talent to some of the world’s leading companies. Headquartered in the Midwest, KP Recruiting Group has successfully completed countless engagements across the United States. We represent clients in all industries and all sizes. Our mission is to provide exceptional client and candidate experiences in order to get the best possible results. On behalf of our client, we are excited to present the following confidential role. We look forward to hearing from you and discussing the opportunity!

 

The Role:



The Director of Sales Strategy and Enablement will drive sales excellence through the effective training, mentoring, and coaching of Canada sales leaders and our strategic accounts team by optimizing the disciplined and rigorous sales process through the Way of Selling, strengthening Sales Competencies and building critical skills. The talent development of the sales team as well as their impact will be led by the Director of Sales Strategy and Enablement through the Regional Sales Leadership Council.

This role serves on the Leadership Team for Canada.

The Director of Sales Strategy and Enablement is accountable for the execution of a structured One approach to align our offerings to deliver outcomes, with a paramount focus on our customer. The role is responsible for leading sales activities for strategic accounts across Canada, and implementing business development initiatives to accelerate our commercial objectives.


As a proven leader of high performing sales teams, the Director of Sales Strategy and Enablement  will also drive sales excellence through the effective training, mentoring, and coaching of Canada sales leaders and our strategic accounts team by optimizing the disciplined and rigorous sales process  through the Way of Selling, strengthening Sales Competencies and building critical skills.  The talent development of the sales team as well as their impact will be led by the Director of Sales Strategy and Enablement through the Regional Sales Leadership Council.




Responsibilities


  • Lead the identification and strategy development for Canadian Strategic Customers and drive results through a team of Strategic Customer Directors (SCD) and Key Account Managers (KAM) nationally
  • Oversee the ongoing training and commitment to the Way of Selling and align the use of the regional sales tools across BU’s. An expert understanding of the steps, stages, customer milestones, and key fundamentals within the Way of Selling is critical for success.
  • Promote and drive best practice sharing and adherence for effective lead generation and tools to be used throughout the sales cycle
  • Coach, mentor and partner with sales leadership in each business to develop skills for effective Way of Selling coaching, which in turn drives high performing manager to sales rep alignment & execution. 
  • Partner with leaders, strategic customer directors, KAMs and sales managers to identify sales competency priorities and establish a training plan to be executed by and coordinated with the Sales Training Manager. This role will also have direct leadership responsibility for the Sales Training Manager.
  • Establish effective communication between sales managers,  leaders, SCG, VP/GM, marketing and operations in Canada as well as Global Sales Effectiveness partners in order to identify & share trends and opportunities to bring individual Business Unit opportunities together into approach.
  • Advance the customer experience through key insights and feedback directly from customers.
  • Successfully validate opportunities with sales leaders, sales managers and independently for all business units with an objective to drive standardization and excellence in the use of the various stages of the Way of Selling process and salesforce.com.
  • Partner with sales managers, sales representatives and operations as needed to ensure alignment of reporting metrics and dashboards – giving visibility to opportunities and facilitating the retrieval of data to be used in customer communications and marketing campaigns.
  • Accountable for driving discipline in funnel management (WIN Room) for the region.
  • Lead the Sales Council for the Region bringing together the sales leaders from the business units to share best practices, build capabilities and align messaging across the sales teams
  • Lead the National Committee in the planning and execution of the annual Canada Sales Meeting.



Skills and Competencies


  • Experience leading and coaching sales process
  • Demonstrated selling experience and functional sales leadership
  • Demonstrated strong customer/client orientation
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated capability for strategic thinking, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams and to provide sales leadership nationally
  • Strong communication skills (verbal, presentation, written)
  • Exhibits an understanding of adult learning principles
  • Familiarity with salesforce.com
  • Bilingualism (French) is an asset





Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree required, Business or Science field preferred. MBA preferred.
  • Must possess a minimum of 5 years’ experience in the healthcare, MedTech and or medical device industry
  • Must possess at least 5 years of leadership experience, with the demonstrated ability to lead and serve as an effective team member in a large organization including planning, developing, organizing, directing, managing, and evaluating personnel.
  • Proven track record of leading sales teams, driving team and individual performance
  • Computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and Salesforce.com
  • French Bilingualism an asset


Education and Training

  • Bachelor’s or equivalent degree
  • MBA an asset


Benefits

  • 401k Matching
  • Family and Individual Insurance Packages (Health, Life, Dental, and Vision)
  • Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays
  • Long & Short-Term Disability
  • Identity Theft Plans
  • Retirement & Pension Plans
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Programs
  • Advancement & Professional Growth opportunities 
  • Parental Leave
  • & More



Bachelor’s Degree required, Business or Science field preferred. MBA preferred. Must possess a minimum of 5 years’ experience in the healthcare, MedTech and or medical device industry Must possess at least 5 years of leadership experience, with the demonstrated ability to lead and serve as an effective team member in a large organization including planning, developing, organizing, directing, managing, and evaluating personnel. Proven track record of leading sales teams, driving team and individual performance Computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and Salesforce.com French Bilingualism an asset Education and Training Bachelor’s or equivalent degree MBA an asset

title: Client Success leader (Sr)
description:
Client Success leader (Sr)


CGI is seeking an experienced Client Success Leader to join our growing Wealth360 team. As a member of the Wealth360 Digital Wealth Platform team, this role will be accountable for ensuring the success of the client from pre-sales to active product use. This is a highly collaborative and cross-functional role, working to ensure that our clients get the most value from our product.










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
ABOUT US:

Since 1934, E.S. Fox Limited (ESFL) has set the standard for Safety and Quality Assurance. With over 3 million person-hours annually, we self-perform Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Sheet Metal and Refrigeration services. E.S. Fox Nuclear Services have been providing fabrication and construction services to OPG and Bruce Power generating stations, along with their associated nuclear Waste Management facilities, for over 50 years. ESFL Nuclear Services aims to be the provider of choice. Our focus on Safety, Excellence, Continuous Learning & Improvement, Respect, Relationships and our Corporate Social Responsibility continues to keep us close to our clients.

ESFL Nuclear Services has offices in Oshawa and Kincardine along with on-site locations at the OPG and Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Stations. ESFL Nuclear Services provides a full spectrum of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services, in addition to maintenance and manufacturing services, fit to meet the growing requirements of the global nuclear power industry.

With over 800 weld procedures and 45 certifications that are audited by ISO, CSA, ASME, TSSA and CWB, ESFL continues to be a leader in the supply of quality nuclear fabrications for projects all over the world. As nuclear power generation evolves and transitions to Small Modular Reactors (SMRs), ESFL will retain the capability to provide design support for manufacturing, factory fabrication, shipping and logistical solutions, technical services and field construction.

With a strong commitment to health, safety and the protection of the environment, ESFL Nuclear Services has earned a reputation as a people-first, environmentally conscious and socially responsible nuclear services provider.

The Oshawa, ON site is looking for a hardworking, results-oriented and professional Purchasing Agent to join our team.


WHAT WE OFFER:

A rewarding career opportunity in the thriving nuclear industry. We provide great benefits including a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, Group RSP, as well as competitive compensation.


SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

Reporting to the Site or Corporate Manager, Purchasing Agents are responsible for ensuring timely procurement support of construction activities in the field, Request for Quote (RFQ) and Purchase Order (PO) creation and administration in accordance with requirements. The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge and advanced experience of sound Supply Chain and Purchasing principles, along with understanding and aptitude for technical, quality, safety, and business law.


KEY CUSTOMERS SERVED:

  • Suppliers and Subcontractors.
  • Project Management, Estimating, Construction, Engineering, Quality Assurance, Safety, Accounting
  • Prospective Customers/Owner

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND/OR SERVICES PROVIDED:

  • Review and understand technical, quality, safety, schedule and commercial requirements of each applicable Purchase Requisition / procurement task
  • Develop, if necessary, or execute existing procurement strategy to satisfy requirements
  • Prepare and issue RFQ's to suppliers, review and assess quotes, negotiate with suppliers, and generate documentation to justify supplier selection
  • Create, manage, and release Purchase Orders to suppliers in accordance with Company procedures
  • Manage and administrate Supplier until completion of Purchase Order deliverables including as applicable supplier submitted for acceptance; manufacturing shop-drawings, test plans, or other
  • Evaluate and address with suppliers, any areas of non-conformance or inadequacy as related but not limited to; quality/warranty, technical, schedule, and commercial
  • Provide support to the Estimating department by obtaining valid quotes as required
  • Support development of existing and new suppliers
  • Ability to multi-task, and perform in a fast paced environment with strict and tight deadlines
  • Effectively communicate with all stakeholders including Supplier, Customer, and internal departments (Project Management, Engineering, Quality Assurance, Procurement Engineering, Warehouse, Safety, Construction, Finance, etc)
  • Follow Company procedures
  • Must be eligible for security clearance

KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Business related diploma or degree is required; Supply chain management focus is an asset
  • Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) designation or similar would be an asset

SPECIFIC EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

  • Solid knowledge in the fundamentals of the purchasing lifecycle is required
  • Demonstrate analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Project)
  • Previous experience in the construction industry, or supporting industries would be an asset
  • Familiar with stringent/strict Quality Assurance programs would be an asset
  • Five (5) years of relevant experience is an asset

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

  • Well organized
  • Quality minded and detail-oriented
  • Self-starter with demonstrated initiative
  • Planning and persistent oriented
  • Team oriented
  • Strong results orientation
  • Excellent communicator (both written and verbal)

E.S. Fox Limited is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. We will accommodate applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please advise Human Resources to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.

title: MRO Buyer
description:
Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become the window wall and door supplier for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States and Mexico. At Toro Aluminum, we continue to maintain the highest levels of professionalism and integrity, in our relationships with our suppliers, subcontractors, architects, engineers and envelope consultants.

 

Over the years, Toro has been committed and focused to ensure the longevity of our company, through repeat and referral business achieved by customer satisfaction in all areas including, applied testing programs, quality control, design innovations, attention to detail, competitive pricing and service minded attitudes.

 

In order to achieve the highest possible quality standards in our industry we will strive to advocate and provide dynamic leadership in a work environment that encourages employee involvement.

The MRO Buyer will report to the Group Purchasing and Inventory Control Manager.    

RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

 

  • Provide Leadership and direct activities involving Toro Group Purchasing common projects and vendors.
  • Lead new vendor onboarding activities for the group and manage and improve vendor database.
  • Execute MRO purchases for selected Toro Group of Companies and set standards for purchasing methods and policy compliance.  
  • Negotiate price reductions and supplier price increase avoidance.
  • Issuing purchase orders and ensuring vendor performance to them.
  • Hands on interaction with vendors and Toro plant personnel in support of manufacturing operations.
  • Requesting and analyzing supplier quotations.
  • Negotiating product price, delivery and quality.
  • Negotiate price reductions and supplier price increase avoidance.
  • Expediting material for some select inventory stock items.
  • Participate in and support company Lean Manufacturing initiatives.

   

QUALIFICATIONS

 

  • 5+ years purchasing experience in a complex manufacturing environment.
  • Experience in leading a multi-plant centralized purchasing role considered an asset.
  • Experience coordinating multi-plant purchasing activities considered an asset.
  • Experience within the commercial window and door industry consider a strong asset.  
  • Completion of bachelor’s degree in procurement or related field.
  • Completion of SCMP designation (or equivalent experience).
  • Experience and involvement in quality and lean manufacturing initiatives.
  • Excellent communication and time management skills.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and ERP software.

title: Customer Success Manager - NA
description:
Description


What you’ll be focused on:
The Customer Success Manager holds responsibility for accelerating revenue and profitability from client accounts, utilising account management methodologies to understand and support the clients strategy and challenges 

What that means day to day


  •  Working with Alcumus Info Exchange and the client to deliver: Account mapping (understand the business and strategy) ,  Life cycle management (Onboarding, maintenance, development, renewal) 
  • Deliver the optimum customer success management service – develop a shared roadmap and action plan to deliver greater value, extend the reach of key contacts and deliver growth revenues with Key Account organisations  Consult with and manage account stakeholders, to maximise service delivery performance in a consistent and sustainable way. 
  • Maintain strong market knowledge, including competitor and regulatory activity, to ensure threats and opportunities are quickly identified.
  • Support line manager to deliver broader group related goals 

What you’ll need to be successful


  •  Strong Key Account Management experience within a SaaS business (2+ years) Consultative solution selling experience 
  • Highly competent with Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) 
  • Excellent influencing abilities/people management skills 
  • Proven ability to build and develop interpersonal relationships externally and internally 

What you’ll get in return


FOR THE HERE AND NOW – We provide a mature and flexible ‘work your way’ culture, paid time off to relax and unwind, a paid day off to celebrate your birthday, a ‘Giving Day’ to give back to others, enhanced parental leave, an employee assistance program, accessible telehealth benefits, retail discounts, flexible health benefits for all your vision, dental, and health needs, and paid time off when you’re physically or mentally unwell. 

FOR FUN – Our hybrid work environment allows you the flexibility to work your way – whether that’s at home, in our downtown Toronto office, or somewhere in between.  We’ve always got something going on, from charity events and friendly competitions to recognition events and awards; we encourage our teams to get involved and have fun along the way. 

FOR THE FUTURE – We’re committed to providing you opportunities to build your career at Alcumus. We offer development sessions internally to help build your skillset, and offer access to LinkedIn Learning for anything else you’d like to level up on. If that doesn’t cover it, our $1000 annual education reimbursement fund should! 2022 is the year we ‘Grow Our Own’ and have an ambitious target across the company for roles filled internally – we’re looking at our own talent first and promoting team members in all departments! 
Sound interesting so far?

What you can expect if you apply:

A response to your application within 10 working days
An interview process consisting of:
  • An initial discovery call with the recruiter
  • A first stage interview via Microsoft Teams 
  • Additional interview (likely face to face) with the stakeholders you’ll be working with closely in the role
We’re keen to ensure our hiring process allows you to be at your best, so if you need us to make any adjustments, please just let us know.

title: Buyer
description:
Buyer

 

Our client, a well-established manufacturer in the Cambridge region, is seeking a Buyer to join their team for a permanent job opportunity. Reporting to the Purchasing Manager, the Buyer will be responsible for sourcing vendors, negotiating contracts and pricing, along with managing supplier performance. The successful candidate will have 5+ years of purchasing in a fast paced manufacturing environment. This is a great opportunity to join a market leader that offers a competitive salary, benefits, and future career progression!

 

The Buyer job responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

 

  • Daily ERP/MRP monitoring 

  • Obtain the best overall terms for production related components

  • Provide monthly cost saving reports tracked by company KPI’ s

  • Manage and provided supplier performance report cards.

Qualifications:

 

  • University Degree or College Diploma

  • PMAC or CPP designation is a definite asset

  • Working knowledge of an ERP system

 

If you are interested in learning more about the Buyer job opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume to mel@itecgroup.ca


We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity.  Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you require accommodation.  We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs.  By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.  Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Sales Manager - Responsable des ventes
description:
(FRENCH BELOW)

Who are we?

ORO Health is a Grow-up in Med tech, bold and ambitious, with a vision to revolutionize asynchronous telemedicine. 

Since 2018, our website Dermago.ca is the first  Asynchronous Teledermatology platform in Canada with more than 25 000 patients.  

If it is in your genes to constantly question the status quo, and be motivated by challenges. 

If you want to join the growing industry of Telemedicine, then it is time to apply!

ORO Health  is seeking a sales manager to join the growing Sales and Marketing team in this booming market. This is an exciting opportunity to oversee all sales pipeline, planning, and execute deals negotiation and closing. You will be responsible for generating a healthy pipeline and moving leads through the conversion funnel for our B2B white label platform.

You'll be the expert on our team to generate Leads. You will work under the guidance of the Chief Revenue Officer to ensure our growth strategy is well executed, helping deliver high volumes of leads to support our sales organization's success.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate proven success in previous sales roles, preferably in the Health or the IT industry or even better in Health and Med Tech with a good understanding of the overall sales process.

Responsibilities:

  • Achieve established revenue goals, including business growth goals (organic, net new business, cross-selling)
  • Support the creation of a standardized outreach for current and future clients and coordinate its implementation across IT, client management, and marketing and communications
  • Drive sales pipeline in relation to expected growth volumes 
  • Prospect and close deals with  target clients
  • Monitor revenue pipeline and leads, adjusting as necessary to create sustainable growth
  • Contribute to establishing both short-term results and long-term sales strategy, including revenue forecasting
  • Monitor KPIs and processes across the revenue cycle from customer acquisition to engagement to success
  • Monitor and report weekly performance to quickly identify opportunities and recommend pricing optimization to drive accounts closing.
  • Develop a business development plan for specific targets, ensuring measurable outcomes that drive higher account closing performance
  • Work closely with the CRO to develop the growth strategy and target attribution. 
  • Research and report relevant market information and benchmark for each lead and understand customer trends that might drive the sales process
  • Help create weekly and monthly Revenue reports.
  • Collaborate with the Marketing Team to develop powerful sales enablement materials 
  • Work alongside other departments such as IT and Finance to enable a smooth customer onboarding experience 
  • Proactively monitor performance and budgets

Requirements:

  • 5+ years in Sales and Business development ideally in the medical industry and / or IT, ideally Health Tech 
  • Autonomous and self-driven with strong Business acumen and project management skills to lead project to completion
  • Deep knowledge of Business development best practices, lead management, and ROI measurement
  • Experience using CRM tools such as Hubspot as well as the Google suite
  • Strong organization and leadership skills
  • Analytical mindset with numerical aptitude to create and measure pipeline development vs. expected growth including tracking of business growth goals and pipeline development 
  • Experience managing complex cross-functional, technical sales and contract negotiation
  • Ability to be flexible and shift priorities as required by changing project landscape

Why Join ORO Health?

A New Player in Healthcare:  Since 2018, ORO Health has been transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.  

Our Work Matters: ORO Health uses proprietary technology to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person's health journey.  

Focus on PEOPLE:   OROnians are talented, passionate individuals that make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment. 

Diversity and Inclusion: We hire based solely on your strengths and personality, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in this new position.  

Growth and Innovation:   We're already changing healthcare. Grow with us and support our mission to make  tangible difference in Telehealth 

______________________________________________________________________________________

Qui sommes-nous ?

ORO Health est un "Grow-up" dans le domaine des technologies médicales, audacieux et ambitieux, qui a pour ambition de révolutionner la télémédecine asynchrone. Depuis 2018, notre site Dermago.ca est la première plateforme de télédermatologie asynchrone au Canada avec plus de 25 000 patients.  

Si c'est dans vos gènes de remettre constamment en question le statu quo, et d'être motivé par les défis. 

Si vous voulez rejoindre l'industrie en pleine croissance de la télémédecine, alors il est temps de postuler !

ORO Health est à la recherche d'un directeur des ventes pour rejoindre l'équipe de ventes et de marketing en pleine expansion sur ce marché en plein essor. Il s'agit d'une opportunité passionnante de superviser l'ensemble du pipeline des ventes, de la planification, de la négociation et de la conclusion des contrats. Vous serez chargé de générer un pipeline sain et de faire passer les prospects par l'entonnoir de conversion pour notre plateforme B2B en marque blanche.

Vous serez l'expert de notre équipe pour générer des leads. Vous travaillerez sous la direction du Chief Revenue Officer pour vous assurer que notre stratégie de croissance est bien exécutée, en contribuant à fournir des volumes élevés de leads pour soutenir le succès de notre organisation commerciale.

Le candidat idéal devra faire preuve d'une réussite avérée dans des rôles de vente antérieurs, de préférence dans le secteur de la santé ou de l'informatique, ou encore mieux dans le secteur de la santé et des technologies médicales, avec une bonne compréhension du processus de vente global.

Responsabilités :

  • Atteindre les objectifs de revenus établis, y compris les objectifs de croissance commerciale (organique, nouvelles affaires nettes, ventes croisées).
  • Soutenir la création d'une approche standardisée pour les clients actuels et futurs et coordonner sa mise en œuvre au sein de l'IT, de la gestion des clients, du marketing et des communications.
  • Développer le pipeline des ventes en fonction des volumes de croissance prévus 
  • Prospecter et conclure des affaires avec les clients cibles
  • Surveiller le pipeline des revenus et les pistes, et ajuster si nécessaire pour créer une croissance durable.
  • Contribuer à l'établissement des résultats à court terme et de la stratégie de vente à long terme, y compris la prévision des revenus.
  • Contrôler les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) et les processus du cycle des revenus, de l'acquisition des clients à leur engagement jusqu'à leur réussite
  • Surveiller et rapporter les performances hebdomadaires afin d'identifier rapidement les opportunités et recommander l'optimisation des prix pour favoriser la fermeture des comptes.
  • Développer un plan de développement commercial pour des objectifs spécifiques, en assurant des résultats mesurables qui conduisent à une meilleure performance de clôture des comptes.
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le CRO pour développer la stratégie de croissance et l'attribution des cibles. 
  • Rechercher et rapporter les informations pertinentes sur le marché et le benchmark pour chaque lead et comprendre les tendances des clients qui pourraient influencer le processus de vente.
  • Contribuer à la création de rapports hebdomadaires et mensuels sur les revenus.
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe marketing pour développer des supports d'aide à la vente performants. 
  • Travailler avec d'autres départements tels que l'informatique et les finances pour permettre une expérience d'accueil des clients sans heurts. 
  • Contrôler de manière proactive les performances et les budgets.

Exigences :

  • 5+ ans dans la vente et le développement commercial, idéalement dans l'industrie médicale et / ou IT, idéalement Health Tech. 
  • Autonome et autonome, vous avez un sens aigu des affaires et des compétences en gestion de projet pour mener à bien un projet.
  • Connaissance approfondie des meilleures pratiques de développement commercial, de la gestion des prospects et de la mesure du retour sur investissement.
  • Expérience de l'utilisation d'outils CRM tels que Hubspot et de la suite Google.
  • Solides compétences en matière d'organisation et de leadership
  • Esprit analytique et aptitude numérique pour créer et mesurer le développement du pipeline par rapport à la croissance prévue, y compris le suivi des objectifs de croissance de l'entreprise et le développement du pipeline. 
  • Expérience de la gestion de ventes techniques complexes et interfonctionnelles et de la négociation de contrats.
  • Capacité à être flexible et à modifier les priorités en fonction de l'évolution du paysage des projets.

Pourquoi rejoindre ORO Health ?

Un nouvel acteur de la santé :  Depuis 2018, ORO Health transforme l'expérience des soins de santé et donne aux gens du monde entier les moyens de vivre en meilleure santé.  

Notre travail est important : ORO Health utilise une technologie exclusive pour obtenir de meilleurs résultats en matière de santé dans l'ensemble du continuum de soins, à chaque étape du parcours de santé d'une personne.  

Focus on PEOPLE : Les OROnians sont des personnes talentueuses et passionnées qui font la différence, dans un environnement en constante évolution, collaboratif et inspirant. 

Diversité et inclusion : Nous recrutons uniquement en fonction de vos points forts et de votre personnalité, et de la manière dont ces points forts peuvent contribuer directement à votre réussite dans ce nouveau poste.  

Croissance et innovation :   Nous sommes déjà en train de changer les soins de santé. Développez-vous avec nous et soutenez notre mission qui consiste à faire une différence tangible dans le domaine de la télésanté.

title: IT Buyer
description:
Reporting into the Americas Regional Category Manager, the IT Category Buyer will support with the acquisition of IT products and services, focused on Software and Hardware. Responsibilities will include vendor selection, strategic sourcing, negotiation, and vendor relationship. The individual will;


•Contribute and support Capgemini business in the ongoing development of the IT category strategy, collaborating with the different parties in identifying current and future sourcing needs.

•Collaborate with Global and Regional Procurement, during the entire procurement cycle, to identify the right vendor and/or to define and execute negotiation strategy.

•Liaise with all stakeholders and vendors to communicate on new initiatives, identity business opportunities for Capgemini.


Responsibilities


•Support IT procurement activities associated with the acquisition of Software and Hardware.

•You will work with our Regional and Group Procurement to support management of business stakeholders regionally, to ensure that the category strategy, including preferred vendors and global standards is understood and agreed.

•You will support Americas region regarding compliance management, monitoring and reporting.

•You will develop initiatives into the budget process and forecasting Procurement cost savings initiatives within our Procurement tools.

•You will help support the procurement operations transformation and savings initiatives

•You will ensure that category agreements and savings targets and customer satisfaction requirements are met.

•Use appropriate risk management techniques to support the broader procurement strategy.


Key Areas of Skills & Experience


•Must have IT & Telco procurement and software category specific experience (3-5 years), strategic sourcing and proven ability to work in a logical and thorough way with ability to pay attention to details.

•Must have experience negotiating Software License Agreements under different licensing models (i.e. SaaS, Term License, etc). Be familiar with the acquisition of other IT categories such as Hardware, Telco and or IT professional services.

•Ability to demonstrate innovative solutions to complicated purchasing initiatives, in a fast moving and demanding environment.

•Should be perceived as a hard and fair negotiator, who manages and develops suppliers to meet customer requirements.


Personal Qualities


•Be business oriented and customer friendly to ensure excellence in supporting our business community.

•Be a “doer” , project management minded to ensure the delivery of the expected results through the deployment of the defined sourcing strategies,

•Must be flexible and have strong influencing skills in order to use both a facilitative and directive approach to ""sell "" method to stakeholders and negotiate with suppliers.

•Good communication and networking skills and able to work effectively as either an individual or as part of a team in a matrix environment.

•Highly motivated towards achieving cost savings and corporate goals (i.e. commercially minded)

•Must have excellent inter-personal skills in order to become accepted in a challenging environment and driving change in a positive manner

•Experience translating business strategies into accountable priorities for the team

Demonstrated successful managing of individuals or team to achieve goals while maintaining individual or team satisfaction

•Excellent verbal and written communication skills



Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment.


- Demonstrated Subject Matter Expertise in the functional area with 6-8 years (2 years min relevant experience in the role).

- Experience maintaining relationships with individuals in other functional areas

- Demonstrated experience successfully lead at least one project that impacted multiple functional areas

- Experience successfully leading teams on multiple projects

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills


In a world where change happens in a split second, our clients must master the art of balancing business transformation with operational excellence and cost reduction to protect their market leadership and safeguard their workforce.


They need the best and brightest talent to limit business disruption and foster future growth, all while striving to realize a new normal. In this context, it’s our people within Insights & Data that are the core enablers to support our clients in their growth journeys. To give our clients our best and brightest, we pride ourselves on being a fast-paced, fun, ethical place to work, where the “work hard, play hard” mentality holds true. Even more important is our clear commitment to creating a diverse workforce in all areas. In fact, for the ninth time in a row, Capgemini has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute. In addition, we’ve been recognized as a top company for women by Working Mother Media.


Capgemini’s Insights & Data Americas practice is comprised of professionals with data, analytics, and AI expertise, covering the full data- and AI-powered transformation lifecycle. Our people extend into all industries we conduct work with our clients in the areas of; data science, data engineering, data strategy, intelligent process automation, data ecosystems, intelligent industry/IoT, enterprise management, customer-first marketing, and data partnerships/disruptors (such as SAP, Microsoft, Google, AWS, Snowflake, Oracle, Adobe, etc.).


We do great work at I&D that is at the forefront of innovation. We pride ourselves as an inclusive, talented, and accomplished workforce, so please contact us to explore your fit with us.


Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.


This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.


Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant : http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law


About Capgemini


Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of CA17billion.


Visit us at www.capgemini.com . People matter, results count.

title: Regional Sales Manager Advanced Technologies
description:
A AT-BDM is a senior technical salesperson, part of a specialized team, who will work as a business advisor for the local channel and accounts teams. The AT-BDM engages in strategic deals where his knowledge of Lan Edge architecture will affect the reach of Fortinet solution, bring to our customer a more broaden approach to their security needs. The AT-BDM works alongside with peer field channel, account teams, and channel partners that may be involved, throughout the sales process. The AT-BDM is expected to shape the positive outcome of customer engagements such as presentations, meetings while showing the benefits of the proposed access architecture. This role offers high visibility to senior management, networking across corporate teams as well as the opportunity to shape the business and the direction of our access products. Location: West Canada


7+ years of related extensive proven experience in selling or consulting endpoint protection solutions in a customer-facing role.

Experience:

  • Minimum 5+ experience on EDR and/or next generation anti-virus selling and consulting roles
  • Experienced in new product introduction for security platforms
  • Good understanding of security related disciplines like SOAR, SIEM, NGFW and Artificial Intelligence applied to security solutions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, listening, negotiation and presentation skills. Capable of delivering product and technology presentations to technical and business audiences.
  • Ability to work effectively, to add value as a team member, and collaborate with a variety of teams such as engineering, sales, product management and customer support.

Responsibilities:  

  • Understanding of sales process from prospection of new opportunities till closure
  • Maximize Fortinet opportunity while providing value added solutions enhancing the offer with access products
  • Works closely together with the local account managers to maximize the primary business focus 
  • Develops relationships with key decision makers, influencers, and partners 
  • Manages effective working relationships with assigned regional sales and engineering teams
  • Travels within assigned territory is required

Requirements:

  • Experience in managing large deals
  • Excellent presentation skills to executives amp; individual contributors 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A self-motivated, independent thinker that together with the local team can move deals through the selling cycle
  • Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Competitive, Self-starter, Team player
  • Knowledge of Sales Force or equivalent

Education, Certifications, Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent.
  • English required, French a plus.
  • Regional travel required

#LI-KJ1

Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security features without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 450,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com.
 
Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in our company, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
