title: Director of Sales - Travel Trade/Business Events
description:
Elevate your career with this newly created senior sales and business development role in Niagara Falls’ travel/tourism industry!
On behalf of our client, Niagara Falls Tourism,Westridge HR is searching for an exceptional sales professional who possesses the creative drive it takes to be an industry leader in the new world of travel trade and business conference sales.

About Niagara Falls Tourism:

Niagara Falls Tourism is the official Destination Marketing Organization (DMO) for the City of Niagara Falls, Canada. Representing almost 400 member establishments within the city limits of Niagara Falls and throughout the Niagara Region, including accommodations, attractions, entertainment and events, award-winning dining, shopping, spas, theatre, history, outdoor adventures, world-class golf and wineries, Niagara Falls Tourism is the unified voice for tourism in Niagara Falls and a trusted source of accurate information. An industry leader, Niagara Falls Tourism's activities include creating strategies and executing plans to support a thriving tourism industry in Niagara Falls.


More about the role:

Reporting to the President and CEO of Niagara Falls Tourism, the newly created role of Director of Sales will work collaboratively with an experienced team of tourism professionals; managing and executing sales and strategic business development activities that align with their strategic plan. This career opportunity will include the promotion of one of the world’s most amazing natural wonders to global business leaders and travel trade professionals.

The ability to work onsite Monday – Friday at the organization’s Niagara Falls office location with flexibility to attend occasional early or late industry-related meetings is required.

In this senior leadership role, extensive out of town travel to domestic and international destinations is expected; including the requirement to work occasional weekends and attend designated trade shows, marketplaces, sales mission trips, and sales FAMS.


Your key responsibilities in this role will include:
  • Sales & Marketing
    • Promoting, researching, qualifying, and securing travel trade leads for the organization’s membership; which includes key stakeholders in the Niagara Falls travel, tourism and hospitality business community
    • Executing sales solicitations to achieve assigned sales targets
    • Generating monthly sales and project reports; in addition to regular competitive analyses pertaining to market segments and territories to ensure competitive products and services are in place for the organization
  • Communications
    • Establishing sound working relationships and cooperative arrangements with community groups and organizations, including TPN and NPC, as well as fostering relationships with Destination Ontario, Destination Canada, TIAO and TIAC
    • Maintaining a visible profile through membership participation and attendance in appropriate industry associations; including CSAE, MPI, PCMA, etc.
    • Networking with other travel trade professionals to stay current with organization and destination marketing trends and strategies
    • Working collaboratively with the organization’s marketing, communications, and events teams to achieve key business and strategic goals

Ideal candidates will possess the following skills and experience:
  • Successful completion of a related college or university program
  • Current membership in recognized travel/tourism associations
  • 10+ years experience in the travel/tourism industry
  • 5+ years experience in senior sales management and business development
  • Extensive knowledge of local, regional, national and international tourism trends in addition to travel trade and business events markets
  • Expert level understanding of sales strategies, effective follow-up and lead generation
  • Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office, CRM programs and database management
  • Exceptional diplomatic skills as they relate to relevant outside contracts and/or negotiations

sandra@westridgehr.com

if you would like to be considered for the Director of Salesrole with Niagara Falls Tourism.

We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those advancing through the selection process will be contacted.

Westridge, along with our client are equal opportunity employers committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe in fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment that brings people together to realize their full potential. We are committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.
.

title: Sr. Director, Sales China
description:
集团描述

推进出行，使汽车技术更智能、更清洁、更安全，同时使每个人的驾驶充满乐趣。这就是我们麦格纳动力总成的热情所在。我们通过为燃油车、混合动力和纯电动汽车创建世界一流的动力系统解决方案来实现这一目标。我们不仅仅让电气化成为一个流行词，更在逐步实现它。创新是我们的动力，我们推动创新。在麦格纳动力总成实现远大梦想，创造未来的出行世界。

 

岗位概述

POSITION SUMMARY:                                                                                                                

 

As a senior member of the Magna Powertrain (MPT) Sales Leadership Team, the Sr. Director of Sales is responsible for overall business performance and strategy development for China customers.  Partners with other senior leaders to ensure effective coordination and relationships with all disciplines of the organization for a special customer group.  Develops, coordinates and communicates strategies, objectives, policies and programs for all sales activities.  Drives global efforts to identify and actively pursue customers, technology and products.  Guides communication worldwide to establish common strategies and goals and establish best practices for specific customer groups.

其他信息

关键职责

Develop Global Customer Strategy 
– Working with members of the global sales team, the cross functions and product managers within each product group, drives the creation and implementation of an aligned sales customer strategy to increase market share and profitability in each MPT product group.

Managing Activities of the Sales Organization – Provide leadership to insure the achievement of all customer sales revenue targets and profitability.  Coordinates communication and activities between all sales locations and personnel toward accomplishing organizational goals.  Clearly and quickly works through the complexity of key issues, problems, and opportunities to affect action.

Lead the Department – Attract, develop and retain all levels of talent to ensure that people with the right skills and motivation to meet business needs are in the right place at the right time.

 

关键资质/要求

MANAGERIAL / SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITES:

Directly leads a group of directors and support staff. Carries out management responsibilities in accordance with Magna’s policies and applicable laws.  Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

  1. A minimumBachelors Degree required with a post graduate degree highly preferred.   Strong automotive sales background with minimum 10 years of both domestic and international sales experience with proven track record in developing global sales strategies and building a world-class sales organization for specific customer groups.
  2. Must have demonstrated success in satisfying OEMs and Tier 1 suppliers in a complex, competitive automotive market.  Must welcome responsibility, challenge and decision-making.   Broad functional experience in areas of strategic planning, business and market development, market research and planning and promotions.
  3. Strong experience involving joint ventures management team and grow sales target in JV environment.
  4. Strong verbal and written communication skills, emphasizing interpersonal, group presentation, and team facilitation skills.
  5. Strong analytical skills and computer skills (MS Office Suite); experience working with ERP system (SAP) preferred.  

其他信息

 

 

树立意识、团队协作、赋能他人

在麦格纳，我们相信多元化的员工队伍对我们的成功至关重要。因此，我们为成为一个机会平等的雇主而感到自豪。我们根据经验、资格并考虑到工作要求进行招聘，特别是不分肤色、血统、宗教、性别、民族、性取向、年龄、公民身份、婚姻状况、残疾或性别认同。麦格纳非常重视对您个人信息的保护。我们不鼓励您通过电子邮件发送申请，以符合GDPR和当地数据隐私保护法的要求。

title: Service manager
description:
Focused in Quebec for almost 25 years, our client is a family business specializing in the distribution of digital control equipment (CNC).


what our client offers you:

  • a stimulating career in a dynamic and human company;
  • a friendly and stimulating atmosphere;
  • equipment to The cutting edge of technology;
  • medical insurance and travel;
  • possibility of contributing to RRSP and resorting to a bonus system;
  • holidays paid by the employer;
  • Performance bonus.

Job Description

falling under the Executive Director , the holder of the position, in collaboration with his team, will see the planning, organization and management of the operational activities of the Technical Department.

In the first moments of his entry into service, the director will have The role of analyzing, learning and understanding each person's work at the internal of its department.

Key responsibilities:

  • Plan, organize, direct, prioritize and optimize the activities of its sector in order to reach the autonomy and profitability of the department;
  • ensure the management, development and mobilization of its team;
  • Develop new tools and see the continuous improvement of the procedures;
  • participate in the decision of the objectives of the company;
  • check , approve and route labor billing to customers;
  • Prepare and route to customers training quotes, preventive maintenance offers and laser calibration service offers.

Profile Wanted

To mobilize, develop and grow his team, the candidate will have to show a strong leadership, possess excellent skills communication and interpersonal relationships, in addition to being a player team with a good openness.

The nature of his work also requires good management of stress, an ease to make decisions and to solve problems by keeping a balance between the damage Results, employee mobilization and technical skills. With a customer service attitude, the candidate will also have to show professionalism, rigor and a sense of high organization.

Qualifications:

  • training in a related field;
  • Experience of at least 5 years in personnel management;
  • bilingualism (French and English).

The masculine genre has been used for the sole purpose of lightening the text. All applications received will be treated confidentially. Only the selected applications will be contacted.

title: CDS Sales Manager
description:
Reporting to the Director of Sales for Canada, the Copart Dealer Services (CDS) Manager will be responsible for building and managing this business line in Canada. This position will oversee existing CDS Account Managers, while hiring and training new account managers to handle the phenomenal growth in each region.

Job Description:

Take charge of your sales career with Copart Dealer Services. Copart is seeking hardworking, driven individual with a desire to maximize an opportunity that offers an unlimited earning potential. Only individuals with an entrepreneurial mindset that desire limitless opportunity should apply. You will be responsible for building and developing the Copart Dealer Services network across Canada.

Responsibilities:

* Responsible for hiring and training new account manager's in your region

* Must be able to successfully develop, lead, and mentor sales people

* Achieve aggressive sales goals

* Establish sales objectives by forecasting and developing quotas for immediate sales results

* Work in a team-oriented fashion, supporting a unified approach to delivering immediate sales results

* Responsible for establishing new business as well as expanding existing client base of dealerships in an assigned territory, while promoting Copart Dealer "Remarketing" Services

* Possess the ability to continuously develop prospects, leads, and new sales opportunities

* Able to grasp new concepts quickly and to effectively communicate the Copart Dealer Terms & Conditions of Service to customers and prospective customers

* Create, maintain, & provide accurate & timely sales forecasts for your assigned territory

* A proven track record of success as a sales leader

* Must be able to expand existing relationships as well as establish new relationships with sales representative in the field

* Highly motivated and enthusiastic with strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills

* Extensive experience in account management and relationship building

* Ability to work well independently and as a team player to achieve aggressive sales quotas.

* Must be a self-starter and highly motivated to succeed.

* The ability to motivate, recruit, orient, and build a strong team of sales professionals.

* Must be able to follow the established sales process and hold your sales team accountable to execute those methods.

* Must possess excellent time-management, organizational, & problem-solving skills

* Strong judgment is required to manage competing priorities, understand scope and urgency of requests

* Possess a tremendous work ethic and strong analytical skills

For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Learner Success Manager, University of Toronto
description:
What We’re Looking For:

A highly driven and passionate Learner Success Manager to oversee all day-to-day activities and operations related to your assigned cohorts, classes, and/or market(s). Including oversight of instructional staff, and operations including classroom experience, learner outcomes, and cultivating a network within the University and the company sponsoring the program. We are looking for someone who can balance the administrative needs of the job with the relational dynamics of learner support. The goal is to keep learners & instructors SUPPORTED & ensure they’re successful.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:

  • Create a classroom experience that energizes learners and keeps them engaged.
  • Utilize data in SalesForce and other reporting tools to assess classroom satisfaction and provide feedback and solutions.
  • Manage classroom reservations, instructional staff, and operational logistics.   
  • Assist learners in pursuing new career opportunities, work with Career Services to help learners become employer competitive
  • Develop positive working relationships with University contacts, working closely with University Relations to develop and grow the program.
  • Deliver outstanding events, work with the Industry Engagement Team to co-host in-person Demo Days and Virtual Tech Talks
  • Communicate system or process changes within the company and new approaches to student support and classroom management.

The Learner Success Manager (LSM) owns these metrics in the following ways:

  • Learner Experience –  The best marketing will always be referrals from our Alumni network. Our goal is to create a transformative learning experience that learners will always fondly remember.  The Boot Camp is by its nature an extremely challenging program. You will create “magic moments” within the program that celebrates your learners’ success along the way.

  • Instructional Management - You’ll be responsible for managing instructional staff. Your ability to empower these individuals to own their classroom, create a dynamic learning environment, engage in meaningful connections with learners and skillfully present complex curriculum will undoubtedly contribute positively to the Learner Experience.  You will provide weekly feedback from student surveys to guide the classroom experience.

  • Program Completion – It is up to the Learner Success Manager to ensure our learners are supported and meeting the required metrics to complete the program successfully.  

Things That Should Be In Your Background:

  • You have worked in a capacity where motivating others was essential to your success
  • You understand the importance of deadlines and streamlined communication
  • You have managed staff before
  • Knows what makes a dynamic classroom learning environment
  • You have experience in making difficult decisions, tackling problems head-on, and can articulate lessons learned
  • You have a track record of delivering excellent customer/student satisfaction
  • You have successfully worked with a wide variety of individuals from diverse backgrounds
  • You have excellent communication skills and experience in being the main point of contact or representative for a brand
  • You can operate independently in a remote environment and cultivate strong relationships in a primarily remote capacity
  • You have been a part of a growing environment and are comfortable with evolving roles and responsibilities

Other Attributes That Will Help You In This Role:

  • This role is not required to report into a central Trilogy office, as it is important that all LSMs are physically present at their designated University to interact with their students and their University partners.  Frequent interaction and collaboration with co-workers across the world at our other offices and University locations are built into our company ethos.
  • Full-Time Boot Camp programs run during business hours Monday-Friday.  Part-Time Boot Camp courses run during the evenings Monday-Thursday and weekends.  Office hours are held before and after classes. With the LSM’s role focused both on student support and administrative follow up, hours of the LSM role are flexible, however, you will be expected to spread your working time over business hours, evenings, and during class every other weekend or as needed.

About 2U Inc. (NASDAQ: TWOU)

At 2U, we power world-class online education and in-person boot camps. Going beyond traditional learning management systems, we use tech, people, and data to help top universities transform in the digital era—and eliminate the back row in higher ed. We support lifelong learning which means thinking beyond a single degree. It means finding ways for students to gain the skills they need to change careers, evolve their expertise, and meet the challenges of the changing world head-on. We help universities fill those needs—developing new digital education technologies and offerings capable of supporting students at different points in their lives. Whether they need a simple refresher, to learn something new, or to change their career trajectories completely, our university partners are there to help them succeed. Together with our partners, 2U has positively transformed the lives of more than 150,000 students and lifelong learners. 2U, Inc. has acquired and integrated two companies broadening our portfolio of education offerings into short courses with GetSmarter and boot camps with Trilogy. This role supports our Trilogy line of business.

2U Diversity and Inclusion Statement

At 2U, we are committed to creating and sustaining a culture that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities of our employees. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by the ways in which we are different, as well as the ways in which we are the same. 

Benefits & Culture

Working at 2U means working with individuals that are passionate and mission driven. We collaborate on tough problems to deliver the best outcomes for our partners, students, and each other. You will find team members working together in our open office spaces, gathered in the kitchen grabbing a snack, or taking a break in our game rooms.

  • 2U offers a comprehensive benefits package:
  • Medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Life insurance, disability and 401(k)
  • Unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Generous paid leave policies including unlimited PTO 
  • Additional time off benefits include: volunteer days, parental leave, and a company-wide winter break

To learn more, visit 2U.com. #NoBackRow

Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

2U is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans’ status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. 2U’s equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits, pay and dismissal.

title: Buyer/Planner
description:
Company:  Virtek is a high technology company based in Waterloo, Ontario. We are the worldâ€™s leader in providing laser and vision-based projection and inspection solutions. Virtek has a dominant product position in the aerospace, prefabricated construction and industrial fabrication markets.

Virtekâ€™s solutions support manufacturers world-wide in a variety of specialized industries to assist with assembly processes. Our solutions project laser light onto a 3D work surface with high accuracy, speed, and precision for applications such as composite fiber ply layup, paint masking, placement of components or materials, quality inspection and reverse engineering.

For more information, please visit www.virtekvision.com or Virtek Vision on YouTube

Role:

Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, your main objective is to ensure uninterrupted supply of material to support manufacturing while ensuring customer requirements are met

Responsibilities:

  • Action all purchases and exceptions generated by MRP.
  • Manage supplier relationships including supply, negotiations, consolidation. Provide forecasts to suppliers to ensure proper mix and availability.
  • Place purchase orders as required based on demand, reschedule and expedite as schedules change.
  • Place purchase orders for all non-production and services requirements.
  • Conduct price/economic order quantity analysis and compare multiple quotes including piece cost, freight, duty, performance systems.
  • Monitor inventory levels and adjust parameters according to demand and supplier capability.
  • Assist with cycle audits and physical inventory, monitor inventory levels and adjust accordingly.
  • Manage the item master within the ERP (Macola) system maintaining proper source, costs, lead times, reorder points and safety stocks.
  • Develop, implement and track a supplier scorecard to monitor performance and mitigate supply risk.
  • Establish a second source of supply for all critical components.
  • Resolve parts shortages and quality issues with suppliers.
  • Support shipper receiver in the receipt, verification and put away of incoming shipments.
  • Distribution of all non-conforming purchased material. Work with ME (Manufacturing Engineer) to obtain corrective action and closure
  • New Product Introduction. Ensure timely deployment of new product developments (NPI) into manufacturing. Work closely with engineering and configuration management to proactively source and cost all new items and include them in future forecast.

Qualifications & Competencies:

  • Demonstrated experience or education in purchasing/Materials Management and the responsibilities of this role.
  • Experience in MRP functionality including forecasting, planning, purchasing.
  • Designation, Certification, or completed courses in PMAC, SCMA, APICS (CPIM).
  • Working knowledge and understanding of all applicable software.
  • Ability to manage multiple expectations while collaborating with cross functional teams.
  • Ability and drive to take on increased levels of learning and accountability with responsibility, good judgement, and exceptional service attitude.
  • Works effectively with and build relationships with all core groups and suppliers.
  • Self-motivated and positive attitude.
  • Ability to work independently to get the task completed on time.
  • Works well under pressure and is very assertive with suppliers and internal customers.

 

Virtek encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available upon request.  Should you need an accomodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at 519-746-7190 ext. 202.

title: Client Success Manager - SpeedSense
description:
SpeedSense - empowering stressed and overloaded digital product teams to take control of the performance of their website. Our clients go from frustrated, losing sleep, and bleeding market share, to running the fastest site in their industry, earning more revenue, and operating a more profitable business with happier customers.



Top three reasons to join SpeedSense:
 

1. You’ll get to be a part of a company that is refreshingly passionate. Acceptance brings down walls. We do not shame, mock, or belittle even the most heinous code, or its author.


 

2. You’ll play a vital role in a team of big-picture thinkers. We focus on outcomes, staying aligned with our primary objective.


 

3. You'll have the opportunity to be part of a team that is meticulous. We balance our broad perspective with a laser focus on the craft.


 

We are expanding and we are in need of a Client Success Manager to join our amazing team!



Position Vision
 

The Client Success Manager is a passionate and values-led client advocate, equally obsessed with: 

 

  1. Supporting our clients to achieve their goals,

  2. Keeping complex projects on track, and

  3. Fine-tuning the way we operate, to scale and help as many people as possible.

 

This individual loves having everything in place. He or she is a highly organized, clear, and professional communicator who thrives on optimizing and organizing processes and systems. The Client Success Manager seeks a growth opportunity on the ground level. The right person will be highly meticulous in their work, a great communicator, and able to meet deadlines to which they commit, exercising excellent time management.




To be successful in the position, you need to:
 
  • Have 2+ years of managing and coordinating client-facing projects experience
  • Have experience using project management software
  • Have experience creating and refining business processes and systems
  • Have experience with Scrum/Agile software development processes
  • Be proficient with Microsoft Excel
 

It is also nice to have the following: 

 
  • Web Performance subject matter experience
  • Agency experience
  • Product Management Experience

 

What are your Top Responsibilities?


 
  • Act both as an advocate for the client, and for SpeedSense, aligning around our shared mission to speed up their website.
  • Coordinate the smooth and effective execution of client projects, on time, and on budget.
  • Manage client onboarding: facilitating kickoff, building relationships with team members, and coordinating weekly coaching calls.
  • Usher clients through our education program, helping them along their Web Performance maturity path.
  • Identify opportunities for upselling clients on SpeedSense services, garnering feedback on our processes, and SAAS tooling.


What are the compensation and benefits? 
 
  • Salary: $70,000-$75,000 CAD annually
  • Fully remote option
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Health benefits
  • Performance-based bonus
  • Early team member, massive career potential


Where is the location and what are the work hours?
 
  • Remote; Vancouver, BC
  • Full-time, Flexible Schedule
 

We only have one available position and we are looking to hire ASAP. If this speaks to you or you know someone who perfectly fits the description, waste no time and click the APPLY button right now!

title: Technical Sales Manager
description:
The Technical Sales Manager will play a key role at StackPros, where we design, create, deploy, maintain and grow industry-leading Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data Analytics and Cloud For Marketing products, solutions and services.

As a Technical Sales Manager, you will be responsible for helping identify new strategic opportunities as they relate to growing StackPros' footprint and increasing company revenues. Along with the rest of the team, you'll be responsible for analyzing opportunity requirements, and preparing content for proposals to be sent for RFPs, prospect proposals, creating sales collateral, lead events, and partnership opportunities. You will work closely with fellow team members to collaborate on these opportunities from early identification through to initial stages of client relationship management, and continued partner advancement.

In your capacity as Technical Sales Manager, you will continue to advance yourself in becoming a domain expert in the products and services that both we and our organizational partners offer. StackPros, and affiliated sister organization DRVN Intelligence, have successfully established ourselves as one of the strongest Google Marketing Platform + Cloud service and product providers/resellers within Canada. You would be entrusted with and responsible for generating new business through won opportunities, inclusive of direct and partner-based sales channels.

You will be supported by Solutions Architects, Professional Services Managers, Engineers, Developers and Marketing Tech / Ad Tech / Platforms Experts to develop and promote best-practices in areas spanning Digital Communication, Cloud Computing, and everything in-between.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Generate net-new opportunities and successfully close known product and services opportunities related to Marketing Technology, Data Analytics/ML, Cloud Computing, Cloud for Marketing (C4M) and other practice areas that our business expands into
  • Fulfill Business Development and Sales responsibilities, through your own efforts as well as management of/collaboration with relevant team members, to:
    • Directly lead, as well as mentor and guide team members in cultivating and capturing opportunities, including general prospecting, product demonstrations, events, SOWs, RFPs, RFls, bake-offs, etc.
    • Be the main vocal representative of the organization for all external facing discussions with prospects, clients and partners
    • Think strategically about the business and uncover new revenue sources and partnerships
    • Strong focus on lead generation and converting those leads into new clients and projects
    • Lead discussion across functional teams within StackPros and sister company StackPros Inc. to execute on various opportunities
    • Build business cases and see them through to execution
    • Ensure that the overall experience of prospective customers is positive, closely adhering to set deadlines, managing in-person and remote communication, etc.
    • Study and stay informed on products, technologies, and other general information of interest to company or to customers
  • In addition, identify, cultivate and advance partnerships and partner channels through your own efforts as well as management of your assigned team members, to:
    • Scale, nurture, and optimize partnerships beyond launch, identifying mutually beneficial opportunities to grow the partnerships' value (especially our Google Cloud/Marketing partnerships)
    • Maintain consultative business relationships with partners to gain exposure to partners' business initiatives to positively impact growth
    • Assume ownership of partner relationships and sought to continuously grow partnership opportunities
    • Understand the market landscape, including customer journeys, partner journeys, and the current and future StackPros roadmap
    • Understand best practices, including leaders in the space, problems businesses are solving for, pain points and emerging trends
    • Identify new market opportunities for StackPros as well as high-potential, and developing partners
  • Represent StackPros at partner and industry events (including attending, speaking, panels, etc.)
  • Help the organization develop and improve prospect and customer-facing materials, assets and all forms of communication and presentation
  • Fulfill the expectations that we place upon our team members, maintaining unrelenting commitment to the organization's overall success, contributing to and assisting with all areas where members input or oversight is required


Company-Wide Responsibilities:

  • Maintain StackPros’ industry-leading image and status with prospects, and overall value as a partner
  • StackPros will entrust you to act as a representative of the company, interacting with our most important clients and prospects
  • Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations
  • Maintain a dedication toward achieving excellence in StackPros' delivery against client needs and partner relationships
  • Be an enthusiastic, positive and generally awesome teammate, mentor & constantly curious learner


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
  • Technical knowledge of Marketing Technologies, Cloud Computing Technologies at the enterprise level is a strong asset
  • Possess a technical and analytical mindset, capable of understanding the complexities of large enterprise ecosystems
  • 2+ years of business development, enterprise solution selling, or product development experience
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations, including strategic partners


What’s in it for you?

  • "Work from anywhere" in Canada policy
  • 100% employer-paid benefits package
  • Monthly yoga and meditation classes
  • Regular Lunch and Learns from your Teammates
  • Fun Employee Events and Activities (Really!)
  • Participation in Community Engagement

title: Sales Development Manager
description:
About The Job

Overview

Our client is a global SaaS organization headquartered in Paris that is partnered up with some of the most well-known brands in the world. They operate in several different industries/verticals and are actively breaking into the North American market which you will be key in supporting as their first Remote Sales Development Manager in North America.

The successful candidate will be able to quickly learn the product/process and be hands-on in establishing an Outbound Sales strategy/infrastructure alongside the Senior Director of Marketing. Once the strategy has been established and leads are coming in you'll be tasked with growing out a team of SDRs underneath you.

Responsibilities

  • Generating leads via outbound email marketing campaigns
  • Bring ideas to the table when it comes to implementing new software to enhance the tech stack
  • Build out the messaging for Marketing campaigns
  • Qualifying MQLs and working with partners for referrals
  • Work directly with the Sr Director of Marketing on Sales/Marketing strategy

Requirements

  • 2+ years of direct experience working in Outbound SaaS sales in an SDR/AE capacity
  • Experience in CRMs + Marketing Automation Tools such as Hubspot
  • Proven experience in suggesting/implementing tech stacks
  • Strong written communications skills
  • Stay up to date on Software industry trends/influencers

Who You Are

  • Infectious energy as an SDR capacity
  • Interest in emerging technologies with savvy technological instincts
  • Will drive new opportunities with a high degree of motivation that will, in turn, grow the company's client base in new markets
  • A fast-paced environment with an organizational foundation to adapt priorities
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and creative problem-solving skills
  • Elite attention to detail coupled with a strategic thought process
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • Ability to be amenable and responsive in the event of a clients wants and needs shifting
  • Creative solutions come instinctively and a natural curiosity for innovation


About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based Retained Search and HR Services firm that helps companies build and develop world-class teams and helps job seekers find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Director of Partnerships
description:
CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES

The role encompasses 3 main functions, namely:
● Creation, development, and scaling of the our Partnership Program/Team
● Leader of the Partnerships Team and owner of partner revenue targets
● Member of the GTM and Senior Leadership team
As the Director, Partnerships you will build and lead our new partner program, building off the
existing program for accelerated, scalable, commercial growth. We are looking for someone to join our
team who thinks differently about problems and is a self-starter, passionate about making the future of
Advanced Manufacturing better together with our partners.

You will work with Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and other teams across the organization to help build our vision for partners. This means managing a cohesive and programmatic journey for our partners, with the long-term goal of enabling and amplifying our partner impact and building strong symbiotic relationships.

  • Support the build, management and ongoing maintenance of our partner program and team.
  • Support the development of new partner program features and incentives models
  • Recruit partners per our Ideal Partner Profile; train and enable partners on our platform.
  • Optimize and support the growth of the partner funnel and partner revenue forecasting.
  • Support, influence and help navigate the product roadmap for our partners
  • Identify ways to evolve internal/external processes to increase program efficiency, develop new
    best practices, and experiment with new revenue streams.
  • Support partner program strategy, while developing prioritization, driving visibility on what's being
    working on, timelines, and risks, so that leadership, partner marketing, support, and the rest of the team

PREFERRED SKILLS
● Experience in business development or program management
● A proven history of planning and executing highly dependent strategic initiatives
● Strong relationship management skills, with proven experience interacting with a diverse group of
technical and non-technical teams
● Experience working with analytics and making data informed decisions
● Experience with revenue pipelines/forecasting and CRM systems (Hubspot)
● The ability to define and prioritize initiatives while working cross-functionally, and manage
complex stakeholder relationships
● Adaptability to a rapidly growing, constantly changing environment.
● Knowledge and experience with the manufacturing landscape and Industry 4.0

title: Service Manager
description:
At Modern People Solutions, our Owner, Wilson takes a personable approach to understand candidates and clients. We believe in an efficient and personable recruitment process, for candidates and clients. Our interviews are conversations to understand your goals as a candidate, your experience and to connect you with employers, where both of you can be successful together. Wilson has worked for smaller businesses, to start ups and billion dollar equipment companies. Check out our website for more details: www.modernpeoplesolutions.com.

Our client has an great opportunity for an exceptional Service Manager in Dewberry, Alberta! Previous experience would be great, but our client will also consider someone with a technical background, great coaching skills, client satisfaction oriented, eager to learn and take on additional responsibilities.

What makes the role exciting and what does it involve?

  • Overseeing the operations of the service department for agriculture equipment
    • Leading and coaching the service team (A Service Writer, Shop Foreman and Service Technicians)
    • Motivating the team to achieve goals, financial and organizational objectives
    • Annual budgeting, in collaboration with the Branch Manager
    • Creating and driving marketing plans for the service department to contribute to achieving department goals 
  • Final reviews of work orders for accuracy
  • Submission of warranty claims as per OEM guidelines
  • Schedule and assigning work to Service Technicians, as appropriate  
  • Handling client concerns

What are we looking for?

  • Previous experience as a Service Manager, Operations Manager, technical leadership role or leadership role in the agriculture industry would be preferred
  • A degree or diploma in Agribusiness would be an asset, but not required
  • A technical background, certification as a Journeyperson, Agriculture Equipment Technician or Heavy Equipment Technician, understanding of agriculture equipment or experience working/growing up on a farm
  • An understanding of service department metrics and financials would be helpful, but it's something we can teach too
  • Great coaching skills and able to effectively motivate a team to achieve department goals
  • Client satisfaction focused, while also balancing the interests of the company

Why work for our client?

  • A competitive base salary, with a quarterly incentive program
  • A competitive benefits package
  • An RRSP matching program
  • A great company culture, you'll get to work with a lot of amazing people!
  • Tenure bonuses

title: Account Director
description:
Our client is looking for a motivated and enthusiastic communications professional to join and grow with their Corporate & Financial practice in Toronto as an Account Director.

The ideal candidate has strong public relations experience, preferably in an agency environment, and is very comfortable working with integrated teams that deliver the full spectrum of earned, owned and paid approaches, and possesses confidence and familiarity in these areas.

Responsibilities:

  • Owns client relationships, manages day-to-day activity, and provides client counsel.
  • Leads the execution of integrated communications programs – and collaborates well with team members from our government relations, digital, strategy, measurement and creative teams – targeting the public, key influencers and stakeholders as well as internal audiences.
  • Works with a team to research, develop and project manage strategic and tactical implementation of client programs and events.
  • Leads material creation including media and influencer materials, social content, internal and corporate announcements.
  • Supports new business development and plays a strong role in strategic planning and presentations.
  • Manages budgeting, billing, and team utilization of assigned client accounts.
  • Formally manages direct reports and provides coaching and mentoring to other members of client teams within the practice group.
  • Contributes to the firm’s marketing and profile via networking, social media and other activities.

People skills and desired attributes

  • Outstanding communication and active listening skills.
  • Confident, professional, mature disposition.
  • Positive, collaborative and solution-oriented.
  • Proactive, self-motivated and highly reliable.
  • Committed to the growth and success of him/herself and others.
  • Self-aware and open-minded.

    Technical skills

  • Experience managing up reports;
  • Understanding of forecasting, billing time, budgeting, team utilization;
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and produce integrated strategies for clients;
  • Strong command of key tactical elements of communications consulting including content marketing, public affairs, executive support, issues management, internal communications, media relations, influencer relations, stakeholder relations, social media, paid support and measurement.
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills.

    Sector experience

    The Corporate & Financial practice serves a large roster of diverse clients. Familiarity with any of the following sectors is a plus:

  • Financial services (e.g. banking, payments, insurance, investing, credit, lending, fintech)
  • Professional services (e.g. accounting, law, architecture, engineering, consulting)
  • B2B products and services
  • Trade - and industry associations

     

    Qualifications:

  • 8-10 years’ professional experience, including a minimum of two years of managing of people
  • Agency experience, preferably recent
  • University degree and/or relevant college certificate/diploma
  • French language skills an asset

title: Account Officer
description:
Objectives


The Account Officer is responsible provide quality service to existing global clients to ensure high retention rate.





Key Tasks and Responsibilities





Client service:


· Act as the key point of contact for the client and/or the brokers on his or her assigned global clients to provide commercial services on daily basis.


· Communicate with client’s regional or local entities to address issues in order to meet the service level requirement.


· Perform client training sessions for on-boarding as well as attending meetings arranged by leading company entities.








Policy Management:

· Prepare for the program implementation documents and coordinate with local company entities on policy draft review, all aspects of policy issuance requirements.


· Prepare for renewal documents and following up with local entities to ensure timely renewal of the global program.


· Work with internal stakeholders on policy modification and adaptation, filing, and implementation


· Generate policy data reports, create master documents, and other policy related reports.











Education


· 4-year College Degree required


· Major in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Banking or equivalent are preferred





Experience


· Customer experience, especially in particular industry, preferred; Previous experience in global business is a plus








Other requirements


· Excellent verbal and written communication skill in English and French, native French is preferred.


· Microsoft Excel knowledge and experience







À propos d'Aston Carter:

Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.



Numéro du permis d'agence de placement de personnel : AP-2000486 (Canada – Québec) Numéro du permis d'agence de recrutement de travailleurs étrangers temporaires : AR-2000485 (Canada – Québec)

About Aston Carter:

Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider.



The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.



Personnel Placement Agency Permit Number: AP-2000486 (Canada – Quebec) Temporary Foreign Worker Recruitment Agency Permit Number: AR-2000485 (Canada – Quebec)

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Regional Sales Manager
Ladner (Trenant Park), BC, 5213 Ladner Trunk Road, Delta, British Columbia, Canada Req #834

Thursday, April 14, 2022

Westland Insurance Group Ltd has an exciting opportunity for a Regional Sales Manager for the Tri-Cities and Delta/Ladner Region. Are you looking for an exciting leadership role? This role will provide exceptional leadership to Branch Managers and will represent Westland to the market, while implementing and supporting Westland's key initiatives and goals.

What we offer:

  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • Diverse mix of staff and demonstrated work/life balance
  • Career growth opportunities and continuing education programs

The Opportunity:

The Regional Sales Manager will provide leadership to Branch Managers across the Region and will be responsible for sales/growth, employee engagement/development, sales leadership, client service/satisfaction and business development within each community.

In this role you'll:

  • Manage the sales/service team, including hiring, training, and coaching for sales
  • Enhance current relationships with client groups and lead the efforts to attract new clients and proactively represent and build relationships with relevant community and business associations
  • Develop and coach Branch Managers within designated region
  • Execute on performance management and people development plans & initiatives
  • Be responsible for achieving targets within sales and marketing plans
  • Focus on continuous learning and process improvements
  • Manage annual budgeting process
  • Manage region to achieve budgeted revenues, costs, and profitability
  • Travel throughout respective region to ensure increased presence in the branches and communities
  • Maintain a high level of current industry knowledge and actively participate in professional associations related to insurance, staying at the forefront of the profession

Here's what you bring:

  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration or other related field is preferred
  • Fully licensed with Level 3 BC designation, CAIB or CIP designation preferred
  • At least 5 years' management / leadership experience
  • Demonstrated effective leadership within the insurance industry applied in a proactive sales and service environment
  • Proven results in developing, coaching and leading a team
  • Demonstrated commitment to excellence in the insurance industry and the ability to differentiate Westland in the marketplace
  • Demonstrated ability to execute tactical plans that link to the operating and strategic plans of the business
  • High level of personal and professional integrity with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
  • Willingness to travel as required

Westland Insurance Group is one of the largest and fastest-growing independent property and casualty insurance brokers in Canada. With a national network of 195 locations and over 2,100 employees, the company continues to expand coast to coast. Westland's brokers provide expert advice to home, business, farm, life, and auto insurance clients. Since its founding in 1980, Westland has remained a family-owned company that is committed to supporting its local communities.

Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equality and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca
Other details

  • Job Family Active Jobs and Positions
  • Pay Type Salary

Apply Now

title: Buyer
description:
Buyer
2201923

Description

 

About Us

At onsemi, we help improve lives through silicon and software solutions every day. Our intelligent power and sensing technologies solve the world’s most complex challenges and lead the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. We're developing leading-edge wireless-enabled MCUs, DSPs and software that sense and connect the world, or help manage personal health through body worn or implantable devices. Our world-class ultra-low power solutions also contribute to a more sustainable future.  We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in people’s lives.

Why Join Us

We create a diverse set of world-class products in a friendly and team-oriented atmosphere.  We provide an environment of continual learning and growth opportunities including access to several Learning & Development training opportunities.  We provide education assistance programs and support volunteer & charitable programs. In support of a healthy work life balance, we also provide comprehensive wellness and retirement benefits.

What You’ll Do

  • Strategically source and procure products and services for operations/stakeholders at the optimum cost and top quality
  • Supplier quotation review, analysis, negotiation and contract management
  • Supplier validation/accreditation                                                                           
  • PRPO Process
  • Material planning and management
  • Supplier performance and development management                                                              
  • Manage escalation to resolves supplier-related problems 
  • Audit compliance                                                                                                                            
  • Other duties as assigned
 

Qualifications

 

What You’ll Need

  • Degree in Business/Administration/Management/Economic/Science/Engineering (preferred) or equivalent, and 5+ years of relevant work experience                                                                 
  • Must be independent, dynamic and able to work with minimum supervision                               
  • Good analytical, communication and computer skills with advance in Ms Excel                                 
  • Capable of demonstrating optimism, good interaction and negotiation skills, no bias and no discrimination attitude                                         
  • Through understanding of company policies especially code of business conduct
  • Knowledge on value engineering methodology, material management is an added advantage 
  • Knowledge and experience working with MRP systems is an asset
  • Purchasing experience is preferred
 
onsemi promotes a mutually rewarding partnership that creates a customer-oriented organization, encourages innovation and teamwork, and rewards achievement. We value Respect, Integrity and Initiative in the spirit of collaboration and teamwork.  
 
onsemi offers accommodations during the recruitment and interview processes for applicants with disabilities. Should you require accommodation through either process please advise Human Resources. Information received relating to the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

title: Buyer
description:
Apollo Health & Beauty Care (Apollo) is a premium developer of private label and control label health & beauty care products and leverages unique expertise and experience in developing national brand-equivalent products designed to compete equivalently with the most popular national brands. The largest private label and control label personal care manufacturer in Canada, Apollo has formidable penetration and distribution in the North American marketplace and also services customers throughout Central and South Asia, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Building on our core values of Excellence and Commitment, Apollo has established itself as a market leader that attracts the industry's top talent. We are currently searching for an energetic, motivated Buyer to join our Team! RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
  • Review MRP (Material Requirements Planning) Report daily and generate purchase orders to meet production needs
  • Monitor, expedite or delay purchase orders as required and confirm and update ETA’s in ERP system
  • Communicate and escalate delivery issues impacting production in a timely manner
  • Coordinate with Suppliers and/or Logistics to arrange transportation for FOB shipments
  • Track shipments to avoid detention and demurrage charges
  • Ensure materials are available in time to meet new product launches
  • Monitor product transitions and discontinuations to minimize/mitigate liability to Apollo
  • Coordinate with internal staff to review and maintain adequate supplies in order to meet production requirements while keeping inventory to a minimum.
  • Attend and participate in daily production meetings and weekly new product meetings
  • Vendor management and rationalization
  • Multi-source materials to ensure business continuity and negotiate the best price possible
  • Enforce vendor compliance and ensure that Non Conformance Reports (NCR) are addressed and closed in a timely manner
  • Assist with Material Requisition Forms (MRF)
  • Keep abreast of market drivers to take advantage of cost reduction opportunities
  • Solicit and analyze supplier quotes and award new business
  • Liaise with Warehouse staff to optimize space allocation (shared responsibility)
  • Improve inventory turns, manage and keep all inventories current and up to date
  • Verify and authorize invoices
  • Verify inventory as required
  • General office administration and backup coverage for other Buyers on the Purchasing Team as required
  • Other projects as assigned
  • Perform other duties as assigned
 JOB SPECIFICATIONS:KNOWLEDGE/EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: 7+ years’ experience required; post-secondary education required; professional designation or certification preferredINTERPERSONAL SKILLS/CONTACTS: regular access to confidential or sensitive information;  frequent internal interactions and/or frequent external interactions; purpose of internal/external contacts regularly related to complex matters; regular selling, negotiating, consulting, teaching/instructing, or advising; above average level of written and verbal communication skills required for successful job performancePROBLEM SOLVING/JUDGMENT: position is has regular autonomy in terms of level of monitoring and decisions usually do not follow prescribed guidelines; frequent complex analysis required; frequently makes recommendations or referrals of significance; responsible for solving complex problemsMENTAL EFFORT: requires moderate to high levels of concentration and/or attentiveness; moderate duration and/or intensity of efforts; requires higher levels of thinking, watching, listening, verifying, checking numbers, creating or designingPHYSICAL EFFORT: occasional duration or intensity of physical effort; some moderate energy required in terms of standing, walking, lifting, keyboarding, pushing, pulling, sitting, packing, assembling, bending or twisting; includes moderate fine or coarse movementsMATERIAL RESOURCES: moderate to high level of consequence and costs associated with errors as related to losses of time, money, or property; moderate responsibility for machinery, work aids, equipment, materials, properties, products, stock, inventory or toolsINFORMATION RESOURCES: moderate to high level of consequence and costs associated with errors as related to losses of time, money or property; moderate to high responsibility for information and or services; regular access to confidential, sensitive or proprietary informationPEOPLE/POLICIES/PRACTICES: no responsibility for people, policies or practices in terms of assigning work, development, evaluation, supervision, health and safety, performance, scheduling of work, training, coaching, or well-being; may occasionally demonstrate work practices to othersFINANCIAL RESOURCES: regular to frequent responsibility for financial data, money or financial transactions, financial records, expenditures, acquisition, financial analysis or risk management; has high opportunity to cause a negative impact to the organization or cause a serious consequence as a result of an error ENVIRONMENT: works in an environment with occasional or some exposure to dirt, dust, grease, oil, or temperature extremes; may frequently face multiple demands or distractions; may have occasional or regular exposure to poor ventilation, and noise,HAZARDS: limited or little exposure to chemicals, fumes or smoke; has little or unlikely potential of injury, harm, illness or infectious disease; has limited or some exposure to machinery or equipment; may require regular local travel or occasional overnight travel “APOLLO Health & Beauty Care will ensure accommodations are available in consultation with candidates during all stages of the recruitment process”The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Duties outlined on this job description may not be all-inclusive, and can be modified at any time if requested by management. Apollo is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process. Apollo will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known in advance.We thank all applicants for their interest however only those meeting the minimum qualifications will be interviewed.

title: Director of Sales Canada
description:
Victoria Newitt Recruitmenthas been retained byNatreveto search for a Director of Sales - Canada.

Who we are:

Natreve is a mission-driven and ocean-forward premium CPG wellness company dedicated to providing the most innovative, highest quality products, to help you Eat Right and Do Good.
Natreve is proud to be the world's first plastic and carbon-neutral wellness company, with a vision to become the world’s most sustainable wellness brand.

We give back to communities hardest hit by plastic pollution and provide economic empowerment by making plastic a currency. We also invest in renewable energy resources to ensure we decrease our carbon footprint through carbon offset credits.
Protein powders include Whey, Vegan, and Keto options that are available in unique and decadent flavors such as French Vanilla Wafer Sundae, Fudge Brownie, and more.

The Wellness Series offers science-backed drink mixes including Stress Less, Immune Strength, and Sleep Peaceful.
Natreve Whey, Vegan, and Keto protein powders and the Wellness Series are Non-GMO Project Verified, Informed Sport certified, and free from gluten, hormones, artificial sweeteners, flavors, and colors. We are proud partners with The Trevor Project and Equality Now and continue to fight for diversity, equality for the LGBTQ community and sexual exploitation for women and young girls.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities.

Sales

  • Define and execute a sales strategy that focuses on base/new business, increased sales and profitability. Achieve Net Sales and Sales Contribution targets

  • Establish solid customer relationships

  • Directs the selling activities within the region, inclusive of resource deployment and customer interactions

  • Promotional Planning, New Product Presentations, Communicate Marketing initiatives, Category Reviews and Competitive tracking

  • Fully Accountable for Trade Spending for team

  • Seeks out opportunities as well as new sales channels for continued growth


Administrative

  • Responsible for the region's forecasting and sales tracking

  • Forecasting, Planning, Deduction clearing and Trade Spending entry

  • Evaluate market trends and gather competitive information, identify trends that effect current and future growth

  • Engagement in the new product launch process


Management

  • Manages Brokers and distribution relationships and all key accounts

  • Attend a variety of sales meetings: customer meetings, trade shows, conferences as required by management

  • Respond promptly to customer needs and update management on customer service issues to improve service

  • Establishes an environment and foundation for future sales growth.


Competencies

  • Strong negotiation skills

  • Strong Forecasting skills

  • Excellent communication and presentations skills, both written and oral, and the ability to effectively interact with persons at all levels of an organization

  • Strong strategic, analytical, problem solving and decision making skills

  • General business acumen with a solid understanding of, and ability to bring together financial performance indicators, brand management principles and effective selling skills

  • Results oriented individual who can lead and manage projects to completion through consistent teamwork

  • Ability to prioritize workload and multi-task on a daily basis

  • Desire and competency to lead the organization to achieve individual and team goals

  • Ability to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment

  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office/Adobe applications

  • Strong competency with ACNielsen and Workstation and other data management tools

  • Highly energetic and has a strong sense to mission driven goals.

  • Core values are synergistic with companies sustainability goals


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • 7-10 years' sales experience preferably within the Canadian food industry and/or CPG experience required

  • Sales experience calling on national, conventional and natural grocery customers and distributors

  • Experience in managing brokers and sales teams

  • Good understanding of the CPG and Natural food industry.

  • Undergraduate Degree or Sales Degree preferred but not necessary

title: Senior Technologist/Contract Administrator
description:
Senior Technologist / Contract Administrator
Ottawa, Ontario
Architecture & Design Firm

Other titles:Contract Administrator, Intermediate Contract Administrator,Contract Specialist,SeniorArchitectural Technologist


THE COMPANY
The client has decades of expertise in mixed use high-rise residential projects, as well as hotels & healthcare facilities; known for design excellence, the company culture embodies passion and diversity.

JOB OVERVIEW
The candidate will be in a similar role within an architecture / engineering firm, or be a Project Coordinator/Manager at a general contractor; involved in the following:
  • Basic design development, completing working drawing packages & construction documents & working with project teams to finish objectives on time.
  • Make site visits & liaise with construction managers, owners representatives, general contractors & sub-trades
  • Administer change control procedures, contract administration methodologies & policy development
  • Ensure that projects adhere to the contract documents & safety codes
  • Be actively in moved in design discussions & the impact that change orders & directives have on costs and timing

REQUIREMENTS
  • Troubleshooting mindset; ability to proactively collaborate with owner, trades & consultants
  • Possess an Architectural Technology Diploma/Certification or Bachelor of Architecture
  • 5+ years' Canadian experience as an Architectural Technologist in an architecture or construction firm
  • 2+ years contract administration experience
  • A portfolio including mid to high rise residential projects that include retail and underground parking, plus hotels & health care facilities
  • Working knowledge of Revit and AutoCAD, Microsoft Suite
  • French language a big plus
We'd love to hear from you if you're ready to take the next step in tour career.

We thank all candidates for their application, however, only those who meet the requirements above will be contacted.


Keywords: Contract Specialist, Architectural Technologist, CCCA, Ottawa, Eastern Canada, Technical Specialist, Ottawa, Ontario

title: Purchasing Specialist
description:
Location:

Milton, Ontario - Hybrid (3 days/week in office)

Department

Employment Type:

Purchasing Department, Greater Toronto Area Low Rise Division

Full-Time Permanent 

Reports to:

Contracts Manager

 

Who We Are

 

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with an over 40-year history of operations across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

 

What We Offer

 

Under the direction of the Contracts Manager, the Purchasing Specialist provides quantity and cost estimating, data entry and purchasing services in adherence with generally accepted home building principles and Mattamy standards.  atabase and carrying out maintenance of the database as directed. This involves performing various independent tasks as well as assisting the Contracts Manager and working to provide The Best Homeowner Experience.

 

Responsibilities

  • Adhere to division-wide Purchasing requirements related to information required for entry into BuildPro and JD Edwards systems, and act as a key gatekeeper to ensure consistency, accuracy, and adherence to such.
  • Coordination of tender process including documentation, pricing and follow ups for incomplete submissions
  • Manage Trade Portal Website to ensure proper access to documents and to ensure coherent record keeping
  • Review drawings for consistency between architecture, sales & marketing information; ensure conformance with JDE system requirements
  • Assist in PPO & Site/Lot Specific cost build ups.  
  • Assist the Contracts Manager, as required, in analysis of cost comparison and differences in products and services
  • Support the Contracts Manager with the Change Order process by soliciting updated pricing, manage applicable PO’s in JDE; address late changes and process as required
  • Prepare area take-offs from working or design drawings for budget or tender purposes; assist in the peer-review work process.
  • Assist in resolving trade and/or builder issues, as needed.
  • Assist in resolving problems and concerns, providing clarity and assistance to trades and sites related to upgrades, options sold and scopes of work.
  • Establish and maintain working relationships with subcontractors, construction staff and supervisors.
  • Participate in site visits to check performance of trades against scope of work/contract.
  • Assist in Managing lumber, including takeoffs.
  • Distribution of plans to suppliers to have final lumber take-offs completed
  • Provide forecasting to manufacturers and trades when and where required.
  • Revise take-offs to reflect actual amounts/usage as determined by site walkthroughs
  • Ensure suppliers have the most current information including scopes, architectural drawings and all other required documents.
  • Release Purchase Orders appropriately to meet construction schedule

 

What You Bring

  • College Diploma in Architectural Technology or Construction Project Management and/or relevant related practical experience.
  • One to three years or more of progressive experience in the residential construction industry, including experience gained through education cooperative program placements.
  • Conversant with the Ontario Building Code (Part 9)
  • Experience with reading/checking architectural drawings in AutoCAD;
  • Experience in lumber estimating preferred.
  • Strong mathematical aptitude required
  • Self-motivated, prioritizes tasks and works independently with minimum supervision.
  • Strong analytical ability required to accurately compare and contrast trade price quotations.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office (Word, Excel). Competent in AutoCAD.
  • Previous experience in JD Edwards would be preferred.
  • Ability to prepare and analyze budgets and reports.
  • Understanding of the processes of budgeting, tendering and construction.
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills with ability to meet deadlines.

 

Health & Safety
 

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

 

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 

Why Mattamy

 

At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

 

Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2021 & 2020)

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (2020 & 2019)

Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019)

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2021 & 2017)

 

 

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

 

Mattamy Asset Management is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.
