title: Regional Sales Manager (Bilingual - English/French)
description:
Company Description

SquareTrade is the fastest growing company of its kind. We’re revolutionizing a $30b industry with service innovation and attention to customer satisfaction. We partner with some of the largest, most sophisticated retailers and carriers in the world (Amazon, Walmart, The Home Depot to name a few), consistently win industry awards, have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews… and we’re just getting started. A member of the Allstate family, SquareTrade has headquarters in San Francisco and London. We are currently expanding in Europe and Asia Pacific, including Japan and Australia.

Job Description

The Regional Sales Manager is a key role within the SquareTrade Field Operations team. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Field Operations, this role is pivotal in working with key stakeholders including, but not limited to, the Partner Field stakeholders, Channel Sales Leads, and SquareTrade channel partners to grow partner performance within a defined territory.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: 

  • Execute partner playbook within defined territory to deliver timely business insights to each contact. 
  • Work with Account and Field Leadership to prioritize contact and partner initiatives within defined territory.
  • Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders of accounts to drive SquareTrade strategies, actions, and overall revenue. 
  • Field Marketing and Training - in collaboration with Account and Field team create and manage annual marketing plans inclusive of training schedule, incentive contests, POP marketing materials, roadshows, e-learning, etc. Manage activities with budget and track positive ROI.
  • Influence - drive SquareTrade mindshare at channel Senior Management levels through detailed product and sales analysis being a thought leader on all aspects of the business.
  • Travel - ability to travel up to 80% of the time. 

REQUIREMENTS: 

  • Ability to communicate effectively in both written and oral mediums to relay key business opportunities and strategy for efficiency and insight
  • Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to prioritize work and operate effectively in a dynamic organization
  • Must have the energy and initiative to recognize tasks that need to be accomplished and to take action to fill gaps where necessary.
  • Ability to work in a cross-functional environment, across all levels of the organization
  • Flexibility to work in a hybrid environment from virtual meetings to in person store visits

MEASURES OF SUCCESS: 

  • Achieve Territory attach rate targets 
  • Achieve engagement targets with business contacts
  • Build solid relationships with business partners
  • Revenue delivery
Qualifications

  • Preferred location: Greater Toronto Area
  • 7 years of work experience in areas related to retail channels, client relationship building, and sales operations 
  • Key competencies should include: Initiating Action, Contributing to Team Success, Effective Communication, Decision making, Training expertise.
  • Proven presentation and public speaking skills 
  • Efficiency with PowerPoint and Excel
  • University/college qualification
  • Bilingual requirement: Candidate will be required to pass a French Language Test

CORE COMPETENCIES: 

  • Initiating Action: Taking prompt action to accomplish objectives; taking action to achieve goals beyond what is required; being proactive 
  • Contributing to Team Success: Actively participating as a member of a team to move the team toward the completion of goals 
  • Communication: Clearly conveying information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message 
  • Decision Making: Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences 


Additional Information

Our line-up of employee benefits include:

  • Excellent benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and more)
  • Flexible PTO
  • 401K with employer matching plan up to 5% of salary
  • HSA with employer contribution
  • Paid parental leave
  • Monthly internet reimbursement directly in your paycheck
  • Monthly wellness allowance
  • Open access to mental health resources including therapy and coaching for employees and dependents
  • Generous work-from-home set-up allowance
  • Paid volunteer time to give back to the community
  • Access to a diverse array of Employee Resource Groups
  • Flexible and hybrid work schedules
  • Development and career growth opportunities

The Team:  http://www.squaretrade.com/leadership   

SquareTrade is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Director Service Enablement (Permanent)
description:
CoreFactor is searching for a Director, Service Enablement on a permanent/full-time basis for a client in Saskatoon, SK.


This role is 100% remote and be located anywhere within Canada. 

What you’ll do:

Reporting to the AVP, you will drive the vision and effective delivery of a 24/7/365 support structure for the organizations Retailing System. This will include: influencing the technological direction and progress, defining and influencing processes, data and knowledge management, and driving a strong culture across the organization that aligns all stakeholder groups in delivering a top tier service experience.


What youll be doing: 

Maintaining and Enhancing Service Technology
  • Oversee proactive maintenance, upgrades, and support to ensure the stability/availability of related technology platforms and services.
  • Conduct needs assessments to ensure client satisfaction and continually review and reprioritize work based on resources available and the continual evolution of business requirements

Strategy and Planning:

  • Provide leadership on strategic business objectives and long-term planning for the department and input into the long-term vision and strategy for the Business Unit to ensure goals are aligned with organizational goals and industry best practices.

Vendor Management

  • Manage an operational budget of $10+ million, ensuring positive outcomes through prudent management of technology contracts and vendor services.
  • Initiate and manage multiple vendor relationships, outsourced services, and contractors while ensuring that applicable organization standards and performance levels are consistently met.

Fostering a Service Culture

  • Provide guidance, leadership, and standardized approaches to multiple functions and teams to drive excellence in service delivery at all levels of the organization.
  • Effectively and proactively collaborate with other teams across the organization to promote alignment in measurement approaches and performance management related to service quality.

People Leadership

  • Lead a team of managers to deliver diverse solutions across various areas of focus and analyze outcomes and results to gauge the performance of these team members.


Requirements

  • You have a bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science/Engineering, or related field.
  • You possess an ITIL certification.
  • You have a minimum of 10+ years of progressive IT experience focusing on service or applications that directly support service experiences, including 4-5 years successfully managing an IT team and vendor partners/managed services.
  • You have consumer-level support experience related to retail/loyalty programs or similar.
  • You have effective presentation and strong communication skills, with a demonstrated drive for success, ownership and achievement of positive outcomes in past roles.
  • You’re honest and trustworthy, are results oriented and strive to be the best in what you do.
  • You believe in collaboration, building relationships and value the perspectives of others.



You have a bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science/Engineering, or related field. You possess an ITIL certification. You have a minimum of 10+ years of progressive IT experience focusing on service or applications that directly support service experiences, including 4-5 years successfully managing an IT team and vendor partners/managed services. You have consumer-level support experience related to retail/loyalty programs or similar. You have effective presentation and strong communication skills, with a demonstrated drive for success, ownership and achievement of positive outcomes in past roles. You’re honest and trustworthy, are results oriented and strive to be the best in what you do. You believe in collaboration, building relationships and value the perspectives of others.

title: Spécialiste en sourcing
description:
Description de l'entreprise

VOSKER est l’un des leaders technologiques mondiaux de la surveillance en zone éloignée.

Chaque jour, on fournit des technologies de surveillance à énergie solaire et cellulaire dans plus de 50 pays à travers le monde. On est fier de permettre à nos clients de garder un œil sur ce qui compte réellement pour eux, où qu’ils soient.

VOSKER place la famille, l’innovation et la performance au cœur de ses priorités.

Description du poste

Tu souhaites occuper un rôle qui te permettra d’agir comme stratège en attraction de talents? Ton petit plaisir coupable, est de susciter de l’intérêt auprès de profils passifs qui n’étaient pas à l’écoute du marché?

Ça tombe bien, nous recherchons un.eSpécialiste en Sourcing qui sera un.e ambassadeur.rice de notre marque employeur en bâtissant une communauté de candidats.

Tes prochains défis:

  • Comprendre le contexte et enjeux d’affaires de l’organisation, afin d’accompagner les gestionnaires dans leurs besoins de recrutement à moyen et long terme.
  • Travailler en mode proactif pour développer un bassin de candidats pour différents types de postes dans les domaines tels que: technologie, marketing, vente et exécutifs;
  • Faire la veille du marché et user de ta créativité pour trouver de nouvelles pistes de recherche de candidats. Entre autres, surveiller les récentes acquisition/fusion/ fermeture d’entreprises.
  • Créer des partenariats avec différents organismes pour diversifier notre bassin de candidatures;
  • Effectuer des prises de besoin de recrutement avec les gestionnaires et établir des stratégies d’attraction;
  • Assurer un suivi rigoureux de l’évolution des recherches aux gestionnaires;
  • Faire des entrevues de sélections et travailler conjointement avec les conseillères en attraction et acquisition de talents pour offrir une expérience candidat hors pair.
  • Bâtir et entretenir une communauté de candidats,
  • Contribuer à faire briller notre marque employeur;
  • Contribuer à augmenter notre visibilité et notoriété sur les réseaux sociaux. 
  • Partager des pratiques innovantes en sourcing de talents;
  • Faire une veille sur tous les évènements propices à attirer des candidats; 
  • Représenter l’entreprise dans des activités corporatives;
  • Participer à des projets RH.
Qualifications

L’expérience recherchée pour nous amener plus loin :

  • Une expérience de plus d’une année d’expérience en acquisition de talents;
  • Un baccalauréat en ressources humaines ou toutes autres formations pertinentes;
  • Être passionné(e) de l’acquisition de talents afin d’offrir une expérience candidat exceptionnelle;
  • Facilité à naviguer dans des zones grises en ayant une bonne gestion du changement et d’adaptation;
  • Être un poisson dans l’eau dans un contexte de forte croissance;
  • Être curieux(se) de nature et ne pas avoir peur de questionner le statut Quo;
  • Agir en tant que tisseur de liens et connecter avec les gens;
  • Avoir de l’expérience avec LinkedIN Recruiter et être confortable d’utiliser les réseaux sociaux dans le cadre de ton travail;
  • Communiquer autant en français qu’en anglais (écrit/verbal).


Informations complémentaires

Pourquoi choisir VOSKER ?

  • Une équipe de ressources humaines qui valorise l’entraide, l’humour et l’authenticité;
  • Un environnement de travail qui te permet de faire vivre tes idées et te propulser dans tes ambitions;
  • Une culture qui met de l’avant la collaboration et la communication;
  • Un mode de travail flexible et hybride qui permet de tirer parti du meilleur des deux mondes;
  • Un accès gratuit à un professionnel de la santé en ligne 24/7;
  • Une assurance collective comprenant : santé (médicaments et paramédical), soins de la vue, les soins dentaires, vie et invalidité de longue durée;
  • Accès à un programme d'aide aux employés;
  • Un quotidien sans routine, les jours se suivent, mais ne se ressemblent pas.

Égalité d’accès à l’emploi :

Au sein de VOSKER, nous valorisons l’essence de chaque personne et célébrons la diversité qui nous permet de redéfinir ce qui est possible. Nous misons sur la collaboration en offrant un environnement de travail sain et inclusif où toutes les voix sont entendues. N’hésites pas à communiquer avec nous, si tu as des besoins spécifiques pour rendre ce processus de recrutement plus accessible pour toi.

Maintenant, c’est à ton tour de nous parler de toi. Joins-toi au clan VOSKER!

title: Head of Sales - Canada
description:
Company Description

Doka’s expertise in formwork technology is unparalleled in the industry and we are proud of the difference we make globally!  “It’s not just formwork – it’s DOKA” is impressively demonstrated worldwide in buildings like the Burj Khalifa (Dubai), in hydroelectric generating stations like the Keeyask (Nelson River in northern Manitoba) – and in parts of the Brenner Base Tunnel (European Alps). Collaborative teamwork of nearly 7000 employees in over 160 distribution/logistics facilities in more than 70 countries is one of the primary reasons behind our success. With more than 150 years of history as a family owned company, we recognize and appreciate our employee’s work every day by rewarding them with flexible work hours, competitive wages, bonuses, training/development opportunities and a comprehensive group benefits program including RRSPs.

Job Description

Summary of Position:

The Head of Sales - CANADA has full responsibility for overall Sales within the country. This person develops and manages revenue objectives, rental rates, discount and profitability guidelines throughout Canada with person responsible for Sales in each branch. The successful incumbent will be a member of the Senior Management Team and strategic partner in expanding Doka’s presence within the market and will be accountable for maximizing sales that broaden Doka’s position throughout Canada.  The candidate chosen for this role will be based within Canada, preferably in Toronto – however may be located at one of our other Branch locations in Calgary, Vancouver, or Montreal.

This position reports to:

Directly:           Managing Director – Canada (responsible for Sales & Engineering)

Indirectly to:    Managing Director – Canada (responsible for Finance, Operations & Support)

As Required:  The Head of Human Resources - Canada

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement the overall sales strategy for Canada with guidelines for revenue, rental rates, products, as well as types and size of customers.
  • Responsible for setting sales target goals in Canada, expansion and development of customer base, number of active customers and prospect calls. 
  • Evaluates Canada sales territories and adjusts resources as needed to increase market penetration.
  • Involved in regular sales meetings to ensure responsible parties are consistently reviewing territory status, sales skills, organizational skills, strategies, product training and Branch interface with operations and engineering personnel.
  • Closely monitors and develops relationships with major customers throughout Canada.
  • Ensures measurement tools and project tracking systems are in place and effectively being used.
  • Coaches sales team and provides appropriate and timely feedback on their performance. 
  • Serves as a company representative in the major contractor organizations in the Branch territories throughout Canada
  • Initiates and supports sales-training seminars.
  • Serves as the strategist and provides guidance on major formwork proposals.
  • Serves as the point person for all serious customer problems.
  • Ensures regular use and maintenance, by all sales staff, of customer/prospect database
  • Communicates clearly and collaborates with engineering and operations.
  • Overnight travel as required. Additionally, this person may be called upon to make sales or service calls outside of Canada as needed.
  • Collaborates with the Branch or Sales Managers ensuring company and branch sales initiatives are aligned and achieved.  Represents Doka, serving as a presenter of Doka products at industry and contractor events.
Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree with a concentration in Business, Engineering or Construction preferred.
  • 5-7 years related sales management with major project and account sales experience within the concrete forming industry or related construction equipment industry.
  • Strong management/leadership skills, capable of commanding respect.
  • Consistently handles confidential information with a highest level of integrity and delivers the highest standards of service to customers.
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, follow-up and negotiation skills.
  • Effectively manages multiple tasks and handles all responsibilities with a strong sense of urgency.
  • Takes initiative, manages time effectively, and manages and adjusts priorities based on business demands.
  • Knowledge of the construction industry and its marketplace.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints.
  • Excellent communication skills including command of English (speaking, reading, writing).
  • Qualitative abilities including strong analytical skills, technical proficiency and effective selling and problem solving skills.
  • Strong computer skills including proficiency using Microsoft Office applications
  • Must be able to quickly and creatively give sales presentations to potential customers concerning his/her qualifications and experience level, the company’s history and experience and the features and benefits of Doka products

 

Communication

Extensive daily interaction with Sales colleagues across Canada, management and customers.  Consistently delivers high standards of customer service and communicates effectively.

Problem Solving

This position requires the ability to oversee the sales teams at each branch office and serve as an added liaison to customers and national sales function resolving issues at times on short notice with minimal information.



Additional Information

If you have a passion to support business accuracy and development, we look forward to receiving your application for this new role!

This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is located.  If interested, please submit your resume as quickly as possible as interviews will be conducted intermittently.

To qualify:

  • applicants must currently reside in Canada and must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada (Permanent resident or Canadian work permit holder);
  • must clearly state their desired salary expectations in their cover letter;
  • should preferably reside within local area of the facility as  there is no relocation allowance designated for this position.

Important note for remote work - this role is set to work within the office but you may be asked to work remotely, as required.  Working remotely is not guaranteed.

Doka is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  A company of the Umdasch Group.

title: Senior Buyer (Hybrid)
description:
Hybrid Model

This position offers remote work of two days per week. Selected candidate will be required to complete their 90-day probationary period onsite for onboarding purposes and will then move to this hybrid model. 

Position Summary: 

Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Senior Buyer is responsible for all aspects of the procurement process, including supplier evaluation, strategic sourcing, supplier performance monitoring, and analyzing data for cost savings.  The Senior buyer negotiates pricing, vendor selection and/or development, generates and manages purchases while ensuring production requirements are met.

Primary/Essential Responsibilities: 

  • Source and ensure on-time availability of materials required for custom, engineered to order complex products
  • Develop sourcing strategies and lead the procurement process, including execution of supply base and inventory reduction strategies, and commodity categorization
  • Conduct domestic and global market analysis, market intelligence, sourcing strategies, etc.
  • Conduct cost benefit analysis as it relates to sourcing and expedite requirements
  • Assist supplier quality initiatives including supplier evaluation, scorecard preparation and delivery, create and maintain supplier corrective action plans aimed to reduce delivery and quality issues within the supply base
  • Facilitate resolution of supplier quality/fulfillment related issues
  • Achieve quality, cost, inventory, and delivery targets
  • Develop strong working relationships with cross-functional teams including manufacturing, sales, and engineering to understand and anticipate procurement needs to enhance supply chain business processes
  • Manage supplier contracts, supply agreements, with preferred suppliers to ensure that market trends, supplier performance, and future business needs are aligned
  • Support global supply management and cost savings initiatives, including identification and execution of cost savings opportunities with current and potential domestic and international suppliers
  • Actively work with the Planning and Operations teams to develop strategies to eliminate parts shortages and provide forecasts to suppliers and G&W Electric head office to ensure material availability
  • Provide subject matter expertise on purchasing best practices
  • Plan for and execute the procurement of raw material and services from domestic and international suppliers using the in house ERP/MRP systems, expedite materials as required to ensure production needs are met
  • Prepare and evaluate request for quote proposals, negotiation of contract pricing, terms and conditions
  • Assist with new product development related sourcing, supplier selection, and evaluation that aligns with project cost, quality and timeline objectives
  • Preparation/Reporting of metrics related to materials, cost savings, forecasting, and supplier quality
  • Inventory analysis
  • Evaluate and process indirect purchase order and capital requests 
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of purchasing/procurement experience within a manufacturing environment
  • Bachelor's degree or college diploma in business or a related discipline
  • Working knowledge of ERP/MRP systems required.
  • Advanced computer software skills, including MS Excel, Access, Project, etc. 
  • Ability to multi-task under pressure in a high paced environment.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written in English
  • Results-oriented, self-motivated individual with a sense of initiative
  • Ability to work independently and as a team player while solving problems and multitasking in a deadline-driven environment
  • Ability to independently identify and develop solutions to problems that may arise in the course of work
  • Ability to respond effectively to inquiries or comments from internal/external customers and suppliers
  • Must have purchasing background working to support the manufacturing of custom products
  • Must have experience sourcing niche suppliers
  • Excellent knowledge of sourcing and procurement best practices
  • Experience working within a technical engineering environment
  • Resourceful, diplomatic, customer service oriented
  • Strong analytical, decision-making, negotiation, and problem-solving skills
  • Well-developed organization and prioritization skills; detailed oriented
  • Embraces changes with a positive attitude
  • Experience in creating and documenting processes and procedures; knowledge of ISO standards
  • Consistently demonstrates a high degree of business acumen and good judgment
  • Successful experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization and suppliers; able to quickly gain credibility and trust
  • Demonstrates accountability; focused on meeting goals and deliverables on time and at the highest quality level possible
  • Is client-centric; proactively anticipates and actions internal customers’ needs
  • Successfully establishes and maintains long-term relationships with colleagues and suppliers
  • Must be highly focused and able to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada without company sponsorship

Preferred Qualifications:  

  • Project Management training an asset
  • APICS Certified Supply Chain Professional and/or Certified in Production and Inventory Management, SCMA Certified Supply Chain Professional or other supply chain related designation an asset
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing tools and principles an asset

Physical Demands / Working Conditions: 

  • This role is located in the general office environment, with regular visits to manufacturing
  • PC use

Why G&W?

We have established a long lived reputation for product quality and innovation. We believe our greatest asset is our employees and look for highly motivated, self-driven individuals who thrive in a fast-paced challenging environment. Our business is growing and if you are looking to grow and continue your development and reach success, you’ll find it at G&W Electric.  Be a part of keeping the lights on for critical infrastructure needs; hospitals, manufacturing, schools, retail spaces and much more.

To learn more about our company view this video: https://youtu.be/pX1axYRSpYQ

G&W offers the following benefits:

  • Generous Profit Sharing with RRSP Program paid quarterly
  • 17 paid days including Christmas shutdown and vacation
  • Annual performance increases
  • Comprehensive Benefit Package including life insurance, health, dental and paramedical services (all paid by employer)
  • Education Tuition Assistance
  • Job Security
  • Succession Planning
  • Air-conditioned/heated state-of-the-art manufacturing facility
  • Wellness and Gym Reimbursement Programs
  • Training and Developmental Opportunities
  • Continuous Performance Feedback
  • Fun social events, holiday party, bowling nights, and many more.

G&W Canada Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, G&W Canada Corporation will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform G&W Canada Corporation's Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Buyer
description:
Buyer - ( 2201923 )


Description


About Us

At onsemi, we help improve lives through silicon and software solutions every day. Our intelligent power and sensing technologies solve the world’s most complex challenges and lead the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. We're developing leading-edge wireless-enabled MCUs, DSPs and software that sense and connect the world, or help manage personal health through body worn or implantable devices. Our world-class ultra-low power solutions also contribute to a more sustainable future. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in people’s lives.

Why Join Us

We create a diverse set of world-class products in a friendly and team-oriented atmosphere. We provide an environment of continual learning and growth opportunities including access to several Learning & Development training opportunities. We provide education assistance programs and support volunteer & charitable programs. In support of a healthy work life balance, we also provide comprehensive wellness and retirement benefits.

What You’ll Do


+ Strategically source and procure products and services for operations/stakeholders at the optimum cost and top quality

+ Supplier quotation review, analysis, negotiation and contract management

+ Supplier validation/accreditation

+ PRPO Process

+ Material planning and management

+ Supplier performance and development management

+ Manage escalation to resolves supplier-related problems

+ Audit compliance

+ Other duties as assigned


Qualifications


What You’ll Need


+ Degree in Business/Administration/Management/Economic/Science/Engineering (preferred) or equivalent, and 5 years of relevant work experience

+ Must be independent, dynamic and able to work with minimum supervision

+ Good analytical, communication and computer skills with advance in Ms Excel

+ Capable of demonstrating optimism, good interaction and negotiation skills, no bias and no discrimination attitude

+ Through understanding of company policies especially code of business conduct

+ Knowledge on value engineering methodology, material management is an added advantage

+ Knowledge and experience working with MRP systems is an asset

+ Purchasing experience is preferred


onsemi promotes a mutually rewarding partnership that creates a customer-oriented organization, encourages innovation and teamwork, and rewards achievement. We value Respect, Integrity and Initiative in the spirit of collaboration and teamwork.


onsemi offers accommodations during the recruitment and interview processes for applicants with disabilities. Should you require accommodation through either process please advise Human Resources. Information received relating to the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.


Primary Location : CA-Ontario-Burlington

Work Locations :

CAON02 SDT LTD


970 Fraser Dr


Burlington L7L 5P5


Job : Supply Chain

Job Posting : Apr 13, 2022, 11:12:19 AM


Req ID: 2201923

ON Semiconductor is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other federal, state or local protected classes. ON is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals, regardless of protect class status.

title: Area Manager Cornwall
description:
GuestReady is an award-winning startup in the sharing economy built on the success of short-term rental companies. It’s mission is to take the hassle out of short and mid-term rentals, as well as any operations that are related to turning over guests, and to optimize listings to incur a maximum yield for the client. The company is co-founded by seasoned entrepreneurs (some former Ex-Rocket Internet executives), and today manages around 2,500 properties across 20 cities, has sold 1,200,000+ guest nights and generated rental income of €50m+ for owners.

We’re now expanding across the UK and searching for a superstar team member to take on the role of Area Manager in Cornwall. You will be responsible for building GuesReady in the area from the ground up, signing new leads in the area, setting up new partnerships and maintaining service quality. Our ideal candidate must be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to ‘think big’ while paying careful attention to detail. This is the perfect opportunity to become part of a growing global company. 

 

Main Responsibilities:

  • Developing relationships and negotiating contracts with landlords, agents and partners
  • Educate potential customers to the benefits of GuestReady and the holiday rental market
  • Handling inbound and outbound sales through email, phone and in-person
  • Adapt GuestReady’s global best practices to the local requirements
  • Maintain current knowledge with local regulations surrounding the letting market
  • Identifying service improvements or new service by remaining current on industry trends, market activities and competitors
  • Represent the company at conferences, trade fairs and networking events

Requirements:

  • At least 2 years in sales / management with a proven track record of closing deals across B2C and B2B is required
  • Experience within letting and estate agencies is desirable, including a passion for travel
  • Network of landlords, developers, brokers and investors is desirable
  • Strong analytical skills
  • A people person, comfortable interacting with casual hosts and high-end professionals
  • Self-driven, self-motivated, detail oriented, proactive - a hustler!
  • Ability to prioritize, structure and solve problems
  • Experience working with CRM tools such as Hubspot
  • Fluency in English is essential, with excellent verbal and written skills
  • Bachelor’s degree is desirable

Offer:

  • Base salary and uncapped bonus structure
  • Travel expenses
  • A dynamic and international work environment with flat hierarchies and space for your own ideas
  • Flexible remote working
  • Travel and learning credits

title: 2355 Strategic Sourcing &Category Specialist
description:
Job Description: The SS &Category Specialist is responsible for:

• Partnering with stakeholders to understand business objectives related to: IT consulting, business consulting, call center, staff augmentation requirements, and other related services

Category Management:
• Keep category and spend profiles updated, support the development, and implementation of category strategies for professional services to meet our current and future business requirements.
• Identify and coordinate cross-functional team resources responsible for category and sourcing strategies
• Support the development of contract strategy and execution: In partnership with Legal and business partners
• Support and lead sourcing and negotiation strategies to closure.
• Develop negotiation approach, fallback positions, acceptable terms, lead & support negotiations and prepare legally binding and enforceable documents.
• Analyzing spend and cost modeling: Proactively track industry trends, risk and cost data, as well as continual improvement of supplier efficiency

RFx Services:
• Partner internally to develop clear third-party requirements by identifying specific business unit needs, then lead or support the Category Manager and drive to closure the supplier interface for all sole source and RFx services
• Preferred Supplier Management: identify, qualify, and formalize which suppliers are preferred suppliers, and guide sourcing decisions and engagement to them

Supplier Performance Management:

• Monitor supplier financial strength, proactively track and analyze criteria, ensure supplier contractual obligations are met, and research root cause of issues. Work to drive improved performance and manage governance structure to ensure delivery of expectations and compliance with corporate and regulatory policies
• Become a trusted advisor to the business through the analysis of data, conducting market research, sharing of report findings and the delivery of sourcing recommendations
• Ensure compliance with purchasing policies and procedures, ethical practices and adherence to relevant laws and regulations
• Develop and track cost savings initiatives
• Support the continuous improvement of Strategic Sourcing process. Identify metrics, tools, and processes to optimize sourcing activities and efficiencies and work collaboratively with team members to prioritize and drive implementation

A typical day

As the Strategic Sourcing and Category Specialist for Professional Services you will responsible for developing and managing relationships with both internal partners third party contractors and suppliers. You will work with our internal business partners to ensure that the right resources are appropriately contracted to perform the work that is needed. You will Identify and manage change, while creating efficiencies and honing your skills as a negotiator and sourcing professional. The SS & Category Specialist facilitates cross-functional collaboration with other teams to solves sophisticated problems and present recommendations to management.

Your skills/experience

• 2 to 5 years minimum proven experience in strategic sourcing, and supply chain management
• University or post-secondary degree or equivalent practical work experience is required
• Experience with professional services including, IT consulting, business consulting, call centre, and staff augmentation would be considered an asset
• Knowledge of forming category profiles and strategy
• Knowledge of strategic sourcing, contract negotiation, formation and administration
• Understanding of contract and supplier performance management (statement of work, maintenance, and service level agreements)
• Ability to inspire change and work with ambiguity
• Understanding of project management would be an asset
• Excellent relationship building, interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills required
• Strong financial and problem-solving ability; proven eye for business
• Proven track record to perform in a team environment as well manage and lead a cross functional team
• Proven track record of dedication with an ability to execute

Other details

•This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check
•As a condition of employment, all new employees will be required to provide proof of full vaccination with a federally approved COVID-19 vaccine (or proof of a valid exemption)

title: Sales Director - Eastern Canada Mid-market Sales Director
description:
Securonix provides the Next Generation Security and Information Event Management (SIEM) solution. As a recognized leader in the SIEM industry, Securonix helps some of the largest organizations globally to detect sophisticated cyberattacks and rapidly respond to these attacks within minutes. With the Securonix SNYPR platform, organizations can collect billions of events each day and analyze them in near real time to detect advanced persistent threats (APTs), insider threats, privilege account misuses and online fraud.

Securonix pioneered the User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) market and holds patents in the use of behavioral algorithms to detect malicious activities. The Securonix SNYPR platform is built on big data Hadoop technologies and is infinitely scalable. Our platform is used by some of the largest organizations in the financial, healthcare, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, and federal sectors.

title: Gestionnaire des ventes, cannaux partenaires / Partner Sales Manager
description:
Ce poste est basé à Montréal, Québec. Nous ne considérons que les candidats locaux pour le moment.

Description de l'entreprise
Cubeler Inc. est le créateur et opérateur du Business HubMC, un écosystème de PME et d'institutions financières où l'analyse de données et l'intelligence artificielle sont utilisées pour faciliter les transactions entre les membres de l'écosystème. Le Business HubMC est le tout premier écosystème exclusivement dédiés aux entrepreneurs de petites et moyennes entreprises. Elle offre à ses membres :

  • Des prêts et des offres de crédit.
  • La possibilité de faire de la publicité pour leurs produits et services auprès d'un public ciblé.
  • Des possibilités de réseautage local, national et international
  • L'accès à une variété de rapports d'intelligence de marché
  • Un contenu riche et diversifié relatif aux industries dans lesquelles ils opèrent.

Tous les services du Business HubMC sont offerts GRATUITEMENT aux membres.

L'entreprise, dont le siège social est situé au centre-ville de Montréal, est une pionnière de l'utilisation de l'intelligence artificielle et de l'analyse de données à des fins d'amélioration des services financiers. Elle offre un environnement de travail dynamique et fait partie d'un conglomérat international qui a des bureaux dans neuf villes en Chine et au Canada.

Description de poste
L'objectif du Business Hub™ est de fournir aux petites et moyennes entreprises les ressources, les services et l'information dont elles ont besoin pour aider leur entreprise à prospérer.

Relevant directement du vice-président, alliances stratégiques, nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un gestionnaire, canaux partenaires expérimenté pour contribuer et soutenir les efforts de partenariat de Cubeler. Vous serez responsable de l'établissement, du maintien, du soutien et de la gestion des relations à long terme avec les partenaires actuels et potentiels dans le but ultime d'inscrire les PME au Cubeler Business Hub.


Ce que vous ferez

  • Trouver de nouveaux partenaires de distribution (associations commerciales et les chambres de commerce)
  • Travailler directement avec tous les nouveaux partenaires de distribution et leurs communautés de clients respectives
  • Générer l'inscription des PME au Cubeler Business Hub™ en accédant aux clients présents dans les écosystèmes du partenaire
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Marketing pour veiller à ce que les efforts et les stratégies de vente et de marketing soient bien élaborés, correctement mis en œuvre et gérés
  • Responsable de tous les aspects de la gestion des partenaires; identification, engagement, intégration, plus spécifiquement l'inscription des PME au Cubeler Hub
  • Faire le suivi quotidien des inscriptions des PME et modifier les stratégies au besoin

Qualifications indispensables

  • Expérience professionnelle préalable dans divers environnements de canaux partenaires
  • Expérience commerciale, plus spécifiquement envers les PME
  • Diplôme universitaire et/ou expérience professionnelle équivalente
  • Esprit créatif et résolution de problèmes
  • Bonnes compétences d'organisation et de gestion du temps
  • Excellentes qualités relationnelles et de communication
  • Esprit d'avant-garde autonome

Nous offrons 

  • Une rémunération compétitive + les options d'achat des actions
  • Assurances collectives
  • REER collectif
  • Des congés payés tels que des jours de maladie et des jours de vacances
  • Des options flexibles de travail à distance ou hybride

Cubeler Inc. est un employeur équitable. Nous célébrons la diversité et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement inclusif pour tous les employés.

This role is based in Montreal, Quebec. We are only considering local applicants at this time.

Company Description
Cubeler Inc. is the creator and operator of the Business Hub™, an ecosystem of SMEs and financial institutions where analytics and artificial intelligence are used to facilitate transactions among the ecosystem's members. The Business Hub™ is the first ever ecosystem exclusively dedicated to small and medium sized business entrepreneurs. It provides its members with:

  • Loans and credit offers
  • The ability to advertise their products and services to a targeted audience
  • Local, national and international networking opportunities
  • Access to a variety of market intelligence reports
  • Rich and diversified content relative to the industries in which they operate

All Business Hub™ services are offered FREE of charge to members.

The company, whose head office is located in Montreal, is a pioneer in the utilisation of AI and analytics for the betterment of financial services. It features a dynamic work environment and is a part of an international conglomerate with offices in 9 cities in China and Canada.

Job Description
The goal of the Business Hub™ is to provide small and medium sized business entrepreneurs with the resources, services and information they need to help their businesses thrive.

Reporting directly to the VP, Strategic Alliances, we are currently looking for an experienced Channel Partner Manager to contribute and support Cubeler's partnership efforts. You will be responsible for building, maintaining, supporting, and managing long-term relationships with current and prospective partners with the end goal of registering SMEs to the Cubeler Business Hub.


What you'll do

  • Identify and engage with new Channel Partners (i.e.: Business Associations & Chambers of Commerce)
  • Work directly with all new Channel Partners and their respective client communities
  • Generate SME registration to the Cubeler Business Hub™ by gaining access to the clients found within the partner's ecosystems
  • Work intimately with Marketing to ensure that Sales/Marketing efforts and strategies are well developed, properly implemented and managed
  • Responsible for every aspect of partner management; identification, engagement, onboarding, more specifically the registration of SMEs to the Cubeler Hub
  • Track SME registrations daily and modify strategies if necessary

 What you'll need

  • Previous experience working in various partner channel environments
  • Sales experience, more specifically within the SMB sector
  • University degree and/or equivalent work experience
  • Creative thinker and problem solver
  • Good organization and time management skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Autonomous, Forward Thinker

We offer

  • Competitive compensation + stock options
  • Health benefits
  • Group RRSP
  • Paid time off such as sick days and vacation days
  • Flexible remote or hybrid work options

Cubeler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: SDR Manager (Remote)
description:
Job description

AutoLeap is looking for an SDR Manager to join our rapidly growing inside sales organization.  AutoLeap was founded by a strong team of repeat entrepreneurs looking to expand their success into SaaS software for the automotive repair space.

This is a unique trailblazer opportunity with explosive growth potential. You will become an important member of the core team, influence the company's continued success, and help shape the future of the automotive industry.

This is a 100% remote opportunity. We offer a range of benefits, including unlimited PTO and employer paid health, dental and vision.

Why AutoLeap?

AutoLeap is a full-suite shop management solution for the auto repair industry. We are on a mission to improve the lives of shop owners around the world by bringing modern software innovations to their underserved market. We are an international startup that values doing things differently and having fun along the way. Our leadership team consists of repeat CEOs, EY Entrepreneurs of the Year, Canada's Top 40 Under 40, and hails from BCG, Bain, Wharton and Stanford. Our backers range from top venture capitalist including Bain Capital Ventures and Threshold Ventures to leading automotive industry titans including the ex-CEO of General Motors and the CEO of Shift. 

In this role, you will:

  • Oversee a team of 8-10 outbound sales development representatives
  • Hire your team with the assistance of both internal and agency recruiters
  • Develop and retain early career talent alongside our Sales Enablement manager
  • Work closely with our existing sales leadership team, demand generation team, and sales operations team to continue evolving processes and culture 
  • Motivate your team to hit KPIs and quotas to achieve the company growth plan

To be successful in this role, you will need:

  • 1+ years of experience leading a full-cycle, transactional, inside sales or SDR team with a track record of exceeding quotas
  • 1-2 years of experience as an individual contributor in an SMB focused sales organization - including outbound prospecting and cold calling
  • A desire to develop, teach, and grow the careers of young professionals
  • Intellectual curiosity, enthusiasm, empathy, and drive

You will become an important member of the core team, influence the company's continued success, and help shape the future of the automotive industry."]

title: Strategic Account Manager - White Cap Canada
description:
At TTi, people come for the opportunity and stay for the culture!


Job Description Summary


Job Description:


General Responsibility : Working closely with the NAM, the SAM will manage sales activities for all 3 businesses within White Cap Canada (Brafasco, Brock White and NCA). Coordinating the efforts of internal functions to service and profitably grow the accounts.


Specific Responsibilities


+ Manage and develop strong relationships with regionally aligned District Managers,


District Sales Managers and Business Development Managers.


+ Develop and implement annual sales plan for White Cap Canada’s national and regional accounts.

+ Implement and direct our national and regional account strategy with support of the local IC National TR team, JSS and Core Trades.

+ Work alongside and provide direction to IC National TR team: events, branch work, and user work.

+ Coordinate with product/channel management to capitalize on current and future product offerings and ensure we are maximizing the accounts’ potential and meeting company metrics.

+ Must stay abreast to industry trends to understand account needs and positioning.

+ Work with NAM and brand team to build a digital marketing strategy.

+ Extensive communication with key stakeholders and influencers at every level of the customer’s organization. Coordinate and deliver sales presentations effectively utilizing resources available. Promote, sell, and secure business for both existing and new products. Obtain feedback and use effectively with internal resources.

+ Manage expenses and account activity to meet or exceed profit plan.

+ Effectively utilize marketing resources for advertising coordination, promotional materials, and presentation materials.

+ Work with channel marketing, product management, brand, and operations to communicate, support, and execute plan when required.

+ Participate in regional sales meetings and trade shows representing the company and presenting products and programs.

+ Prepare and submit required monthly and quarterly activity/update reports.

+ Expedite the resolution of customer problems and issues.

+ Other duties as required.


Requirements


+ Minimum 4+ years successful sales/marketing experience dealing in the industrial or retail channel with distribution and/or end users.

+ Demonstrated track record of growing profitable sales in the industrial channel.

+ Must possess a team first attitude as a leader who interacts positively to motivate TRs & JSS to work towards a common goal.

+ University degree or college diploma.

+ PC literate in Microsoft Office products. Very strong Excel and PowerPoint skills.

+ Demonstrates strong analytical and organizational skills, including forecasting and planning skills.

+ It is expected that you will be an outstanding communicator, both internally and externally.

+ Consistently bring suggestions and solutions to the table when problems arise.

+ Demonstrated negotiation skills.

+ Takes positive approach and has sense of urgency.

+ Demonstrated ability to work effectively with internal and external resources.

+ Requires a valid driver's license, clean driving record and passport.

+ Ability to travel significantly.


All interested applicants, please submit your resume along with a cover letter by March 25, 2022
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you need to contact us regarding technical accessibility of our website call 443-391-1542. This number is only for technical accessibility issues, not general employment or job posting inquiries.

title: National Account Program Manager
description:
POSITION:                       National Account Program Manager
REPORTS TO:                 Director, National Operations
DIVISION:                       Security-SES
LOCATION:                     Toronto-dedicated on customer site


 
Our team at Stanley Black & Decker embraces the critical importance of employment equity, diverse representation and inclusive work environments.   Our culture is dynamic, results-oriented , focused on change and share a unified passion for creating products, tools and solutions for those who make the world. Wherever you go in our company, you’ll find uncompromised devotion to performance, innovation, customer satisfaction and social responsibility. Now is your chance to become one of these people within our growing Fortune 200 Company. A role with us will give you a strong understanding of how a world class organization creates and implements different strategies across our various commercial brands for a positive outcome.

Recognized as one of Canada's Top Employers For Young People (2020 and 2021) and Greater Toronto's Top Employers (2020 and 2021) and Canada’s Best Diverse Employers (2020 and 2021).    The National Account Program Manager will play a key role in the management of design, installation and service delivery, solutions proposal generation, Stanley CSS operational team support and direct customer interaction in support of national account clients.
 
What You will do:
 
  • Serve as the primary customer interface to effectively communicate and ensure customer satisfaction
  • Act as a liaison between the Stanley branch and the customer
  • Responsible for coordinating new installations for the assigned customer
  • Work directly with Branch Project Managers to ensure projects are completed within expected completion date and booked gross margin.
  • Meet with customer to determine customized security solutions that will meet their individual needs 
  • Responsible for initiating, tracking and coordinating security issues for assigned customer, correcting programming issues, determining vendor involvement and setting response priority to security issues.
  • Responsible for overall installation and service delivery for assigned customer or in assigned area of responsibility.
  • Responsible for collaborating with internal support resources to identify delivery issues and work with the Stanley branch operational leadership to provide resolution.
  • Responsible for solution proposal generation and submission to the assigned customer as required.
  • Maintain the quality, quantity, and timeliness of answers to customer questions or problems
  • Provide monthly reports on the installation service work to customer and direct manager
  • Ensure the timely issuance of technical service reports and the proper dissemination of information
  • Provide technical support, in person and via telephone, to dealers and end users, sales, and customer service
  • Communicate with appropriate departments regarding customer complaints that could develop into product issues, customer dissatisfaction or major product failures
  • Perform other duties as assigned 

What we Need:

 
  • Degree or Diploma in Business, Management, Computer Systems or related field
  • At least five (5) years of financial industry or systems integration experience in a Project or Program Management capacity
  • Strong Customer Service focus
  • Bilingual in English and French is preferred
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency with computer software including MS Word and Outlook
  • Ability to work individually and with a team
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • CPP, PMP, PgMP or CSPM certification preferred



Stanley Black & Decker believes in giving each and every applicant an equal opportunity to succeed on their own merit.  We strive to hire employees that reflect and support the diverse perspectives, experiences and needs of employees and our communities including but not limited to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, and disability. We remain committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our work environments. We know that diversity underpins excellence, and that we all share responsibility for creating an equitable, diverse and inclusive organization. Therefore, in pursuit of our values, we seek employees who will work respectfully and constructively with differences across the organizational hierarchy in actualizing SBD’s priorities, goals and principles of equity and inclusivity. If accommodation is required at any point in the recruitment process, please contact a member of our Recruitment Team. Please note that as part of our recruitment process, candidates in the final stages will be required to complete a background check which may include a criminal background, credit and drivers abstract check.

Stanley Black & Decker croit qu'il faut donner à chaque candidat une chance égale de réussir selon ses propres mérites. Nous nous efforçons d'embaucher des employés qui reflètent et soutiennent les divers points de vue, expériences et besoins des employés et de nos communautés, y compris mais sans s'y limiter la race, l'origine nationale ou ethnique, la couleur, la religion, l'âge, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, le mariage statut, situation familiale, caractéristiques génétiques et l’incapacité mentale ou physique. Nous restons déterminés à défendre les valeurs d'équité, de diversité et d'inclusion dans nos environnements de travail. Nous savons que la diversité sous-tend l'excellence et que nous partageons tous la responsabilité de créer une organisation équitable, diversifiée et inclusive. Par conséquent, dans la poursuite de nos valeurs, nous recherchons des employés qui travailleront de manière respectueuse et constructive avec les différences à travers la hiérarchie organisationnelle pour actualiser les priorités, les objectifs et les principes de SBD d'équité et d'inclusion. Si une accommodation est requise de quelque façon que ce soit au cours du processus d’embauche, merci de contacter un membre de l’équipe de recrutement. Veuillez noter que dans le cadre de notre processus de recrutement, les candidats aux étapes finales devront effectuer une vérification des antécédents qui peut inclure une vérification des antécédents criminels, de crédit et des antécédents des conducteurs.

title: Strategic Account Manager I
description:
As Strategic Account Manager I, you will maintain client relationships with key target accounts that have a major strategic impact on the long-term success of the organization. You will identify cross/up and repeat sales opportunities as well as work to resolve any issues or concerns and ensure customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities:


+ Works with the selling team to create and support the execution of the Strategic Account Plans at key, named accounts.

+ Continuously develops relationships with priority Customer Stakeholders, understands their key Business Issues, and recommends ways to deliver value.

+ Liaison between the field and Global Accounts teams as it relates to pursuing new agreements, Value-Add/Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) commitments, and increasing customer wallet-share.

+ Maintains and manages a pipeline of Opportunities at named accounts, including Renewals, Projects, and Share improvement opportunities.

+ Communicates Customer Activity, Opportunity Status, Renewal Status, and Strategic Plan progress to Manager/Director.

+ Participates in solution development efforts that best address customer needs.

+ Engages Supplier sales resources to enlist their support and create solutions.


Qualifications:


+ Bachelor’s Degree – Sales, Business Administration, Engineering, or relevant field required.

+ 2 years of proven sales experience.

+ 2 years preferred of experience managing multiple stakeholders and projects.

+ 2 years of success maintaining and developing key relationships.

+ Business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership techniques, production methods and coordination of people and resources.

+ Ability to understand where potential exists in assigned accounts and can recognize and create opportunities.

+ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships.

+ Strong negotiation and problem solving skills.

+ Proficiency with CRM software and Microsoft Office.

+ Self-starter and able to work efficiently under pressure.


Travel Requirements:


0% - 25%


_WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination._

title: Sr. Customer Success Manager - Remote
description:
Req ID: 181296

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Client Delivery Executive-Working from Home to join our team in Montreal, Quebec (CA-QC), Canada (CA).

Key responsibilities include:
• The Customer Delivery Executive is responsible for all delivery / support provided to a customer. This includes:

  • Ticket Management and meeting SLAs
  • Reporting
  • Budgeting, Cost management and Invoicing,
  • Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly reviews with the Customer
  • Staffing / Resource Management
  • Address Customer escalations

• The role manages all Infrastructure domains (e.g. Server, Storage, Backup, Network, Cloud, Security, Service Desk, Field Services, Asset Management, Messaging & Collaboration, etc.)
• Establish and maintain positive client relationships with clients, executive and managerial level clients.
• Managing programs, projects, and providing direction and guidance in adhering to client and internal delivery processes, frameworks, workflows and requirements.
• Support New Business Opportunities
• Provides direction and guidance for administration and results for multiple departments within a function or work area.
• Translates business plans into objectives and exercises latitude in managing operations.
• Accomplishes results through the efforts of subordinate manager
• Integrates deep professional understanding and subject matter expertise.
• Develops complex solutions to business problems or customer engagements through in-depth analysis, coordination and negotiation with key decision makers.
• Uses experience, innovation and judgement to make decisions

Desired Skills and Experience
• Advanced influencing and communication skills.
• Advanced client service leadership capabilities.
• Advanced knowledge, understanding and application of project management principles and methodologies.
• Excellent analytical / problem solving skills.
• Excellent organizational and time management skills.
• Excellent budgeting, business financial and P&L skills.
• Ability to develop comprehensive and complex operational and strategic plans.
• Ability to manage Master Agreements, SOWs and Change Requests
• In-depth understanding of NTT Data's goals, customer requirements and competitor practices.
• Typically requires 12-15 years relevant experience.
• Includes 5-7 years managerial/ leadership experience
• Fluent in French (Canadian)

#LI-NAM#INDICS

For more information email jonathan.jokubaitis@nttdata.com

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Senior Buyer - (Job Number: CAL012S)
description:
Senior Buyer

Company: Worley
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Calgary
Job: Purchasing<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 12, 2022
Unposting Date: May 13, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Senior Manager, Procurement NAWGC - SCMP

48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

Wersquo;re not just engineers. Wersquo;re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers andinnovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals andresources get one step closer to solving our planetrsquo;s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition.Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.


Whatever your ambition, therersquo;s a path for you here. And therersquo;s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visitWorley.com

Purpose:

  • Select reliable suppliers, approve purchase orders, supervise purchasing, control price and quality, and ensure timely delivery of engineered packages.
  • Involved in engineering project services, meeting project requirements in regards to procurement of specialized equipment and provide advice in regards to contract services.

Responsibilities:

  • Recommend procurement, plans and strategies for strategic acquisitions of engineered packages and determine procedures within the limits of delegated authority and in accordance with company policies and procedures;
  • Advise on project purchasing strategies and procedures;
  • Source and recommend suppliers in Canada and worldwide who are capable of providing technical solutions and equipment required;
  • Initiate quotations for technical packages both locally and overseas. Undertake the negotiation of purchase contracts, follow-up, schedule, ensure quality standards are met and expedite deliveries;
  • Co-operate with production, research, engineering and other departments in modifications to equipment, product specifications and delivery dates;
  • Review and process claims against suppliers for unsatisfactory materials or equipment.
    Investigate trends in materials and supply prices, recommend the timing and quantity of purchases and establish economical purchase quantities;
  • Educate subordinates in the actions required of a professional supply chain, operating within the minerals and metals industry;
  • Attend production planning meetings and liaise with production personnel in the forward ordering of supplies where lead time is critical;
  • Prepare detailed financial analysis in support of alternative purchasing strategies.

What you will bring


Technical and Industry Experience:

  • Typically, +7years relevant experience.

Education ndash; Qualifications, Accreditation, Training:

  • University Degree, or equivalent, in related field or applicable discipline, or equivalent relevant experience.

Required:

  • Strong understanding of systems, processes and tools related to field. Able to assist others and troubleshoot issues.
  • Highly communication skills. Influence participation in the preparation and delivery of proposals, presentations and reports.
  • Having a growth mindset and engaging in continual personal development and learning.Seeks opportunities to learn, develop and stretch to new experiences.
  • Being comfortable with problems that are complex and filled with uncertainty.
  • Being able to understand problems and perspectives from an external and/or internal client#39;s point of view.

What we offer you


Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.


Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.


If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it#39;s time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.


Please note: No agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy.
