title: Sr. Assistant Manager
description:
Sr. Assistant Manager


Date: Apr 12, 2022


Location: Moncton, New Brunswick, CA, E1G0Z5


Company: Under Armour


Under Armour is the chosen brand of this generation of athletes... and the athletes of tomorrow. We're about performance - in training and on game day, in blistering heat and bitter cold. Whatever the conditions, whatever the sport, Under Armour delivers the advantage athletes have come to demand.


That demand has created an environment of growth. An environment where building a great team is vital. An environment where doing whatever it takes is the baseline and going above and beyond to protect the Brand is commonplace.


The world's hungriest athletes live by a code, a pledge to themselves and everyone else: Protect This House... I Will. Our goal is to Build A Great Team! Will YOU…Protect This House?!


Position Summary


The Senior Assistant Store Manager supports the Store Manager in the daily operations of the store. This includes the responsibility of assisting the store in achieving its sales goals, meeting merchandising standards and delivering operational excellence through effectively leading a high performing team. The Senior Assistant Store Manager is expected to role model Under Armourâ€™s Core Competencies and I WILL behaviors in all actions and interactions in order to create a positive Teammate and Athlete experience.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Leadership


+ Motivate and inspire the team by delivering a compelling vision and purpose, which encompasses Under Armour’s Core Competencies and I WILL behaviors.

+ Act as the leader on duty and consistently models the brand’s Athlete service standards and selling behaviors.

+ Establish and communicate clear expectations while holding the store team accountable for achieving all brand, performance and behavior standards.

+ Build and support effective relationships with all teammates, peers and supervisors to effectively lead positive change.

+ Lead the management team through effective execution of all performance management tools.

+ Effectively communicate with the management team to align and help drive business strategy.

+ Proactively seek personal learning and development opportunities to build leadership skill set and enhance individual performance.

+ Ensure total Store Accountability for all Under Armour Policies and Procedures.

+ Support the Store Manager in the execution of the short and long term business plan that will drive KPI’s and maximize sales results.


Talent


+ Recruit, hire, develop and retain a high performing store team.

+ Teach, train and coach the Assistant Store Managers and team through successful completion of Division of Responsibilities (DOR) to develop future leaders for the company.

+ Recognize and properly resolve teammate performance issues; communicate high priority issues to the Store Manager in a timely manner and collaborate to develop a plan for resolution to minimize risk.

+ Support the mid-year and annual review process for all teammates by providing feedback on teammates’ performance to Store Manager.

+ Proactively networks and recruit to support store’s staffing needs.

+ Drive teammate engagement by recognizing and rewarding teammates for their outstanding performance.

+ Ensure that the teammates adhere to and enforce all employment practices and policies.


Operations


+ Maintain Under Armour brand standards of neat, clean and organized sales floor, cash wrap and fitting room ensuring store environment is safe for teammates and athletes.

+ Support/Lead the efficient and productive handling of all merchandise including shipment receipt and processing, floorsets, markdown optimization and replenishment systems while maintaining backroom standards.

+ Analyze reporting and daily sales trends to make real time strategic business decisions to drive results.

+ Effective use of technology to enhance athlete engagement and drive KPI’s.

+ Contribute to the management of expense and operational costs.

+ Support our Connected Fitness efforts by the promotion of our Apps and Social campaigns and athlete contests as appropriate.


Merchandising


+ Support/Lead all visual directives ensuring mapping and floorset are properly planned and executed seamlessly within allotted timeframe.

+ Analyze merchandise reports and direct brand appropriate merchandising moves to maximize presentation and drive sales.

+ Oversees and ensures efficiency of all daily operational procedures.

+ Ensure store audit compliance and shrink results meet company loss prevention standards.

+ Perform “level-sets” and make sure the store is replenished by pushing all goods to the floor.

+ Ensure store audit compliance and shrink results meet company loss prevention standards.


Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


• Ability to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business, including holidays, nights and weekends.

• Computer and technology proficient.

• Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with athletes and store team.

• Ability to move or handle merchandise up to 25 lbs.

• Ability to freely access all areas of the store; including the selling floor, stock and register area.

• Strong prioritizing, interpersonal, problemâ€solving & planning skills.

• Knowledge and understanding of employment laws including compliance with federal, state and local requirements.

• Strong communication, presentation, delegation and follow-up skills.

• Demonstrated proficiency in sales generation, training, and leading of functional teams.

• Demonstrated ability to analyze business trends and reporting to drive sales.

• Demonstrated ability to coach, provide feedback and manage substandard performance.

• Demonstrated ability to work in a fastâ€paced and deadlineâ€oriented environment.

• Ability to perform Essential Job Functions.


Education And / Or Experience


• Minimum high school education or equivalent.

• Minimum of 2 - 3 years of retail or equivalent management experience preferred.


Other Requirements


Relocation


N/A


_Under Armour is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, ancestry, color, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, creed, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, language, age, history of conviction of criminal or summary conviction offence that is unrelated to the employment or to the intended employment of that individual, social condition, receipt of public assistance, political convictions or beliefs, physical or mental disability, handicap or the use of any means to palliate a handicap, marital status, sexual orientation, civil status, family status, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by protected status._

title: Communications Success Manager
description:
Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world's most recognizable and innovative organizations.Job Description

What this Job Entails:

Responsible for the production of high-quality content that engages employees and customers while ensuring the content being shared is understood not only from the content perspective but why it is needed.  The Communications Success Manager (CSM) will report into a Program Leader at Astreya of which will work closely with to understand the client's program needs and requirements to “get the message out”. 

What we’re looking for is a self-motivated and talented communications success manager to lead our communications success department.  Some of the fundamentals that this person will be responsible for:

  • Clarify the WIIFM for all stakeholders. ...

  • Select credible leaders as needed to help deliver the message. ...

  • Use appropriate communication based on the audience needs: written, verbal, face to face...

  • Create a cascade-down, feedback-up loop. ...

  • Keep communicating all the way to the end.

Your main duties will also include creating informative content, change releases, articles, and other opportunities to share changes, products, and services. The ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, with brilliant presentation and organizational skills.

Your Role & Responsibilities: 

  • Create informative and interesting communications releases for the Program, newsletters, and related change management materials.

  • Develop and implement effective communication strategies that build awareness, and customer satisfaction.

  • Plan and manage the design, content, and production of all communications materials.

  • Work with different departments to generate new ideas and strategies.

  • Supervise projects to guarantee all content is publication-ready.

  • Create communication and strategies for new communications, change, launches, events, and promotions.

  • Lead the communications team staff.

  • Respond to communication-related issues in a timely manner

  • Build strong client relationships. Understand client programs needs and deliverables (SOW and skills),  vision for each program, and program success  criteria 

  • Partner with internal and external stakeholders to review and scale the communications content.  

  • Be a “player-coach” for cross-functional teams including service delivery, and project management.

  • Lead and develop a diverse group of employees.

  • Implement a career coaching model that serves as a roadmap for employees’ growth and development 

  • Enable and support other programs.

  • Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position

Leadership Attributes:  

  • Relationship builder  

  • People management:  Ability to motivate, mentor and develop a high performing team.

  • Decisive leader committed to achieving program growth objectives.

  • Intellectually curious, hands-on leader

  • Dedication to client satisfaction with program

  • Highest level of integrity

Required Qualifications/Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, public relations or relevant field.

  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role.

  • Proven experience creating targeted content is advantageous.

  • Strong knowledge of communication practices and techniques.

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

  • Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure.

  • Excellent organizational and leadership abilities.

Physical Demand & Work Environment

  • Must have the ability to perform office-related tasks which may include prolonged sitting or standing onsite or remote

  • Must have the ability to move from place to place within an office environment onsite or remote

  • Must be able to use a computer and software applications

  • Must have the ability to communicate effectively 

  • Some positions may require occasional repetitive motion or movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers

Additional Information

Astreya Partners is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other factor protected by law.

title: Sales Manager, Queen Street West
description:
Warby Parker is seeking a service-oriented Sales Manager to support a team of exceptional Retail Advisors in creating the best possible glasses-shopping experiences. As a Sales Manager, you'll engage with customers, have a hand in process ideation and improvement, and participate in various special projects along the way. Through these responsibilities, you'll directly impact the success of our company while seeing our strategic operations in action and learning from our super talented business and Retail leaders. Ready to play an integral part in shaping and driving Warby Parker Retail? Read on!

What you'll do:

  • Communicate Warby Parker's values and brand philosophy to customers
  • Own troubleshooting for our point-of-sale system
  • Oversee the store's inventory management procedures
  • Develop new processes that improve Warby Parker’s ability to serve customers and optimize their shopping experiences
  • Manage and implement daily zoning schedules
  • Open and close the store
  • Lead meetings at the beginning of shifts and at the end of the day, plus roundtables and other meetings as needed
  • Direct a team of 8–10 team members, consistently demonstrating what great service looks like
  • Help conduct team members' biannual performance reviews with the Store Leader and Associate Store Leader
  • Assist with new hire on-boarding and ongoing training
  • Treat all of our customers with respect and cultivate an inclusive, service-minded work culture

Who you are:

  • Steeped in Retail experience, with 1+ year in a management position
  • Equipped with exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Backed by managerial experience in sales or operations at a complex, customer-focused retailer
  • A self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Eager to learn new skills
  • An upbeat and empathetic team player
  • Driven to do what it takes to be a top performer time and time again—and help your teammates reach their targets along the way
  • Able to bring a positive, fun energy to the workplace, even when working long hours
  • Not on the Office of Inspector General’s List of Excluded Individuals/Entities (LEIE)

Some benefits of working at Warby Parker for Full-Time Employees:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance
  • Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • Paid Holidays
  • Retirement savings plan with a company match
  • Parental leave (non-birthing parents included)
  • Short-term disability
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Bereavement Support
  • Optical Education Reimbursement
  • Free eyewear
  • And more (just ask!)

About Us:

Warby Parker was founded with a mission: to inspire and impact the world with vision, purpose, and style.

We’re constantly asking ourselves how we can do more and make a greater impact—and that starts by reimagining everything that a company and industry can be. We want to demonstrate that a business can scale, be profitable, and do good in the world—without charging a premium for it. And we’ve learned that it takes creativity, empathy, and innovation to achieve that goal.

Since the day we launched in 2010, we’ve pioneered ideas, designed products, and developed technologies that help people see. We offer everything our customers need for happier eyes at a price that leaves them with money in their pockets, from designer-quality glasses and contacts to eye exams and vision tests. 

Ultimately, we believe in vision for all, which is why for every pair of glasses or sunglasses we sell, a pair of glasses is distributed to someone in need through our Buy a Pair, Give a Pair program. Over eight million pairs of glasses have been distributed in over 50 countries; that means eight million people now have the glasses they need to learn, work, and achieve better economic outcomes. 

At Warby Parker, you can look forward to company outings and events, volunteering and learning opportunities, and just great company filled with curious, kind folks. Dreaming up and sharing ideas aren’t responsibilities reserved for certain teams or leaders; the challenge (a really fun one) of innovation is on all of our shoulders. Teammates can also connect around common interests, backgrounds, and identities, no matter their home base, through our various employee resource groups. (We’re happy to say that the Human Rights Campaign has named us a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ employees!) That sense of community and belonging keeps us excited to walk through the door every day, wherever that door may be. 

We're driven to continue building a workplace, based on inclusive behaviors and equitable systems, where all employees can bring their authentic selves, feel engaged, and share their perspectives as a valued member of Team Warby. Transparency is what we’re all about, and our annual Impact Report and Racial Equity Strategy lay out how we’re sticking to these values.

title: Senior Director, Sales Strategy
description:
What weâ€™re about

IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience, so itâ€™s not surprising that IMAX employees and their careers go beyond the ordinary. Our employees share a passion for quality in everything they do. Our Hollywood people are movie business insiders with years of production experience. Our technology experts are unashamedly geeky â€“ people who can talk for hours, and be riveting, about color gamut and lasers. Our business people are consummate sales and marketing professionals who are spreading the IMAX word around the world.  

Of course, we offer all the benefits youâ€™d expect from a company with over 50 years of history. Yet, beyond this, we know everyone works differently and is motivated by different things. Thatâ€™s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits â€“ to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.  

As the worldâ€™s leading entertainment technology company, IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies. Specializing in immersive motion picture technologies, our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places theyâ€™ve only dreamed of. 

Come explore IMAX â€“ where innovation, creativity and passion come together.

The Sr. Director, Sales Strategy will support IMAX in defining and executing the companyâ€™s business development strategy across the entire portfolio of products and services, with a particular focus on the core product offering (IMAX Theatres). The role will also administer budgets, oversee forecasts, and track strategy implementation, working in conjunction with each regionâ€™s sales teams. It will also play a key role in supporting the day-to-day management of global sales activities. Reporting to the Chief Sales Officer, the position will be based at the companyâ€™s offices in either Playa Vista (Los Angeles) or Mississauga (Toronto).

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Support the Chief Sales Officer in defining the companyâ€™s sales strategy and in executing it, delivering the integrated IMAX portfolio of products.
  • Work on global strategy projects as a cross-functional leader, acting as the liaison between Sales and other parts of the organization and bringing together key people from various business divisions.
  • Analyze territories and prepare market reports, in conjunction with the regional Sales teams, assessing their viability and level of opportunity for the IMAX business. 
  • Conduct and/or coordinate research, analysis, and modelling required for the sales strategy.
  • Work with product owners across the organization, with the aim of devising the best way of bringing products to market, determining feasibility, and defining a relevant sales strategy.
  • Develop and monitor critical success metrics and communicate actionable insights to the Chief Sales Officer and relevant stakeholders.
  • Lead budgeting and planning processes for the global sales team (e.g., forecasts, periodic reviews, annual budgets, and long-range plans).
  • Support the Chief Sales Officer on their broader executive responsibilities, including leading the preparation of presentations, reports and studies for the companyâ€™s senior management and board meetings
  • Create positive awareness of the IMAX business within the entertainment industry.
     

What weâ€™re looking for:

  • A recognized postgraduate degree.
  • 10 years of experience in sales, sales strategy and/or management consulting, preferably within the entertainment industries.
  • A seasoned executive with an outstanding reputation for his/her strategic business judgment, leadership skills and integrity, who can accomplish goals in a timely, productive, and fiscally responsible manner.
  • Strong planning and organizational skills to successfully manage sales strategies and support senior executives within a global organization.
  • Ability to adapt to diverse business environments and different cultures, across a variety of different territories.
  • Proven ability to take initiative, work independently, be creative and establish priorities to support business development in a competitive market.
  • Excellent communications skills for various settings.
  • High degree of flexibility is required for international travel; must hold valid passport.
  • Experience, or directly related job experience.

 

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Influencing Skills â€“ ability to enlist othersâ€™ support and assistance in influencing others; skilled at building agreement and cooperation and a unified sense of purpose, particularly in approaching others and trying to persuade them as well.  
  • Negotiation Skills â€“ creates a tailored experience for the customer with the products and solutions they need while also making sure the company is also financially benefitting.
  • Ability to partner and collaborate while building trust internally and externally.
  • Strategy â€“ develops a vision and translates it into action. Establishes clear targets and measures to track progress toward unit objectives.
  • Drive for results â€“ persists to complete tasks/responsibilities, even in the face of difficulties, is optimistic and tenacious all through. Operates with personal ownership and looks for ways and means to improve performance all the time.

 

Our commitment to you:

At IMAX you'll be part of a culture built on respect - one that recognizes the unique talents of everyone on the team. We're proud of the differences that make us all unique and we support unity, acceptance and equal rights for all. Diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a global company.

If you feel you can make a contribution to our growth and success, and you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, we encourage you to apply. While we can't make any guarantees, we will review your submission in full. Express your interest here. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Before you start with IMAX, all employment is subject to background and reference checks. Additionally, our U.S. employees are subject to our mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy.

IMAX is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

Thatâ€™s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits â€“ to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.', 'Create positive awareness of the IMAX business within the entertainment industry.', 'Support the Chief Sales Officer in defining the companyâ€™s sales strategy and in executing it, delivering the integrated IMAX portfolio of products.', 'Influencing Skills â€“ ability to enlist othersâ€™ support and assistance in influencing others; skilled at building agreement and cooperation and a unified sense of purpose, particularly in approaching others and trying to persuade them as well.', 'Strong planning and organizational skills to successfully manage sales strategies and support senior executives within a global organization.', 'Support the Chief Sales Officer on their broader executive responsibilities, including leading the preparation of presentations, reports and studies for the companyâ€™s senior management and board meetings', 'Excellent communications skills for various settings.', 'Lead budgeting and planning processes for the global sales team (e.g., forecasts, periodic reviews, annual budgets, and long-range plans).', 'Powered by JazzHR']

title: External Sales Manager
description:
Our client is hiring a team oriented External Sales Manager with strong sales acumen and a drive to succeed to join their Mississauga team!  Our client is an Independent Canadian lessor offering leases on small ticket technology and equipment.

This role is establishing and increasing the flow of business from the regional IT and Office Equipment population and assisting with processing the resulting flow of leasing transactions from small and medium sized business customers.

Job Challenges
  • Transacting and selling simultaneously
  • Selling to Salespeople
  • Opening up new relationships

Salary:
$50,000 - $60,000 / year

Bonus Structure:
0-35% Balanced Scorecard Bonus paid on basis of performance against volume and other targets, set on a quarterly basis.
Additional Profit Margin Bonus scheme.

Hours of Work:
8:30am to 5:00pm, Monday to Friday (40 hours per week).

Responsibilities

  • Developing and maintaining a sales relationship with a portfolio of dealerships to increase use of products and services.
  • Calling to arrange meetings, visits, new business volume, cycle time, delinquency and other performance trgets set by management.
  • Understanding, explaining and selling the lease product through dealers to customers, maximizing the various income opportunities available.
  • Processing lease transactions using credit scoring and other software, interacting with dealer and leasing customer as appropriate to close the transaction within market leading turn-around cycle time.
  • Efficiently performing the follow-up administration and paperwork for completed lease transactions.
  • Working efficiently and effectively with sales support partners and other team members.
  • Handling and resolving telephone inquiries from lease partners and dealers.
  • Supporting and participating in the ongoing marketing of the dealer base through direct mail, visits and telephone contact.
  • Actively participating in growing the business, flexibly handling ad-hoc tasks and special projects as they arise.
  • Completing company sponsored training to better understand the sector, financial tools used and sales skills.
  • Training more junior staff and sharing experience with the whole team.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 2 years account management and sales with proven ability to generate a flow of repeat business from initial sales contacts.
  • IT literate, numerate
  • Willing / eager to learn basic knowledge of financial analysis and credit.
  • Team oriented.
  • Flexible and willing to learn product and sector.
  • Motivated by bonus structure.
  • Degree from University is important.

Benefits

  • Being part of a progressive, fun, rewarding team environment.
  • Excellent culture with strong leadership.
  • Paid vacation and time off.
  • Substantive bonus structure.
  • On-site parking
  • Full benefits package (extended health care, dental, vision, life)

Other companies may call this role:
Account Manager
Sales Representative
Sales Executive
Business Development Manager

If you have 2 years of experience in an Account Management or Sales role, with a strong drive to succeed, CLICK APPLY below to learn more!

We thank all who apply for this position.  We commit to "communicate quickly, communicate often, and communicate well".  All applicants will be contacted within 5 business days.

*********
We value diversity!!  We recruit, hire, and promote, both internally and to our clients, without regard to race, national or ethic origin, colour, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics or disability.  Accommodations are available for candidates during all aspects of the selection process. IND1


Minimum of 2 years account management and sales with proven ability to generate a flow of repeat business from initial sales contacts. IT literate, numerate Willing / eager to learn basic knowledge of financial analysis and credit. Team oriented. Flexible and willing to learn product and sector. Motivated by bonus structure. Degree from University is important.

title: Buyer
description:
Buyer

Join us as Buyer, and you’ll be looking at a career-defining for the World's 2nd Largest Rail Car Manufacturer 

Set up full supplier selection process

Deploy commodities strategy

Ensure project execution in line with QCDT objectives

Support supplier Panel relationship (Supplier workload, negotiation, Specific agreement)


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Set up full supplier selection process

  • Prepare and launch of Request for Quotation with suppliers
  • Lead project negotiation
  • Monitor Procurement project QCDT & legal project evolution (FAI, Business Award, Product development)
  • Ensure work package sheet commitment respect
  • Prepare Business Award
  • Promote the Alstom Code of Ethics and adhering to the highest standards of ethical conduct.
  • Coordinate project with all métiers
  • Ensure the on-time delivery and quality are secured especially during the ramp-up phase of the project

Support commodity strategy

  • Consolidate the commodity needs, inputs
  • Participate actively to commodity strategy and panel elaboration
  • Provide imputes to build differentiation
  • Support of Commodity Manager in tender phase
  • Represent the commodities towards projects, platforms and solutions.
  • Ensure effective teamwork with internal customers and stakeholders in problem solving
  • Apply the Alstom Procurement process and provide return on experience.

Build Supplier relationship

  • Support global supplier panel relationship
  • Manage specific supplier panel relationship (negotiation, specific agreement, local supplier QCDT performances)
  • Measure the supplier's performance and develop them in coordination with supplier Quality Team
  • Assess properly all risky suppliers and manage the associated mitigation plan
  • Manage initial issues before escalation to line manager
  • Monitor Corporate Social Responsibility engagements and deviations
  • Respect Alstom code of ethics and guidelines

REQUIRED PROFILE:

  • Engineering or Business School master’s degree
  • Master in Purchasing (Desirable)
  • Sourcing professional background (0-5 years)
  • Ability to work in a matrix environment
  • Communication skills & Team spirit
  • Ability to challenge
  • Results oriented
  • Rigorous and structured
  • International mindset
  • Fluent in English
 
#LI-CR1

title: Service Manager
description:
Agriculture Service Manager

Job Description:

The Service Manager position at Robertson Implements offers a dynamic environment of which you will be a key in meeting the service levels our customers have come to expect from us. A normal day will have you in contact with customers discussing a variety of repairs, managing the day-to-day operations of the service shop, and managing work order flow through the shop to keep all techs at maximum efficiency. It requires an ability work independently and work as part of our store team.


Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of Ag equipment service experience
  • In-depth knowledge of a variety of agriculture equipment
  • Ability to multitask and handle the timeliness of customer needs
  • Experience in successfully managing a team
  • Proven work ethic and superior communication skills
  • Preference will be given to candidates possessing a journeyperson certificate

Robertson Implements is an employer of choice in our community. We offer a competitive compensation package including company supported health and dental plan, a pension plan, and a work environment that encourages teamwork with opportunities to develop and grow. Robertson Implements is part of the Robertson family Group and committed to employee development, customer service and to the communities we serve. For more information, or to apply now, please go to our website: https://robertsonfamilygroup.prevueaps.com/jobs/
skills: ['Proven work ethic and superior communication skills', 'Experience in successfully managing a team', 'In-depth knowledge of a variety of agriculture equipment', '3+ years of Ag equipment service experience']

title: Purchasing Coordinator
description:
Heritage Food Service Group of Canada is an industry leader in providing technical service for commercial kitchen equipment. We provide responsive service from experienced, highly trained professionals to make sure our customers' operations are kept running.

Heritage is looking for a permanent full-time Purchasing Coordinator. This individual contributes to the success of the organization by driving service excellence through working with manufacturers to reduce discrepancies in parts, producing reports, and tracking parts, and does so accurately, quickly, and cost-effectively. This position has major impact on customers' satisfaction because it directly affects the speed and quality of service, both in terms of parts delivery to end users, and in contributing to the Service Technicians' first-time fix rates.

Core responsibilities

  • Manages the relationship with manufacturers to resolve parts shortages, damages and other issues that arise.
  • Processes part returns to manufacturers and suppliers.
  • Processes replenishment within authority.
  • Processes relevant inventory reports.
  • Creates new part numbers for service.
  • Updates system with relevant tracking information

What you need to be successful:

  • High school graduation required.
  • Bilingual French and English skills are an asset.
  • Formal education in Purchasing, Inventory Management, or other relevant field.
  • Minimum 2 years experience working in a directly related field.
  • Experience with a current ERP system an asset.

Why Work for Us:

  • We are profitable, stable, and growing - which makes us exciting to be a part of.
  • Comprehensive group benefits
  • Training and development opportunities
  • We are the industry leader in technical expertise and market penetration.
  • An opportunity to learn what it's like to be part of a fast moving, growing company
  • Be part of a fun and collaborative team dedicated to the success of our business
  • Input and ideas are always accepted. Your opinion matters here!
  • We look for people with a clear drive for delivering service excellence with integrity, from a team-driven and dynamic mindset.

If this is the right fit for you, please provide your resume and let us know what makes you the right fit for Heritage!

title: Service Manager
description:
Service Manager

If you are driven to help people, passionate about customer service, and ready to lead a successful service team, then this opportunity is for you. We’re searching for an RV service manager who is motivated to excel and serious about a true career in this highly competitive industry. As service manager, our customers, and your team, will look to you for guidance, leadership and expertise.

Job Responsibilities

  • Monitor staffing attendance
  • Check previous day technician production numbers: premise time against work order time
  • Communicate with each technician
  • Walk through shop to see what all the technicians are working on
  • Check and respond to emails in a timely fashion
  • Review “Listen 360” reviews and address customer concerns as is necessary
  • Review work orders to ensure they are coded correctly
  • Available for consult and support for technicians, service writers, warranty writers and parts personnel
  • Ensure work orders on clipboards 
  • Review that insurance estimates are correct
  • Confirm external estimates are correct, review estimates for accuracy
  • Monitor technicians to ensure are punching in and out of jobs
  • Review the service doc and financial performance of the department daily
  • Provide customer service for issues that need to be addressed at management level
  • Check on next day service appointments
  • Review service logs for length of stay of units on the lot
  • Attend delivery meeting each morning to ensure deliveries are ready and to discuss with Sales and F&I managers barriers for delay
  • Attend service meeting at the end of each day with Service Writers to go over deliveries and incoming service appointment; review oldest service units on the lot and identify barriers
  • Schedule vacation for technicians and service writers
  • Follow-up on received parts for service

 Weekly

  • Check open work order report
  • Check weekly production of the shop
  • Attend weekly Management meeting

 Monthly

  • Review the DOC
  • Check monthly production of the shop
  • Check production of each technician
  • Check CSI
  • Accounts receivable for service and warranty

 On going

  • Interview applicants for the service department
  • Problem solving with employees
  • Ensure the service department is safe
  • Ensure staff have the right equipment and tools
  • Ensure staff have the education necessary to do the work
  • Ensure that there is a positive environment for staff to work in
  • Available to respond to the moment to moment needs of the team
  • Ensure a respectful workplace for all staff

Education and/or Experience

RV industry experience, management experience and service writer experience are preferred.

Benefits

  • Canada Life Coverage
  • RRSP Matching

About Us

Traveland RV Supercentres are here to provide you with quality and professional service from a dedicated team that will help make your RV and Motor Home experience a lifetime of enjoyment. Traveland is one of the largest RV dealers in Canada with locations in Langley BC, Kelowna BC, Duncan, BC, Airdrie AB, Grande Prairie AB and Saskatoon, SK.

Our goal is your complete satisfaction. We are proud to provide complete RV sales and complete RV service including: sales of new and used RVs, RV parts and accessories and RV rentals. If you have any questions about buying, renting or servicing please contact us.

We will provide you with the best price and honest answers from one of the finest and most knowledgeable staff in the RV industry. We are here to help you make an informed decision.

Traveland RV is family owned and operated.

Come visit Traveland RV Supercentres or contact us today!

title: Territory Manager
description:
Who is Mother Parkers?

We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North Americaâ€™s largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100 years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!

The Role:

We have an exciting opportunity for a dynamic and results-driven Sales professional to join our Sales team as a Territory Manager for Atlantic Canada. In this role, you will be responsible for achieving maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration for your assigned territory by effectively selling Mother Parkersâ€™ products, programs and/or related services. You will identify and secure new customers and new opportunities to grow the sales base within Atlantic Canada, leveraging our established reputation of integrity, dedication, and service.

We are looking for someone who has a passion for selling, a knack for building relationships with customers, is self-motivated, and a drive to succeed. A love for travelling is a must as you will be regularly visiting customers in New Brunswick, PEI, Nova Scotia and Newfoundland.

What you get to do:

  • Achieve territory sales, volume, and profitability objectives.
  • Establish and maintain business relationships with customers and key accounts.
  • Advise and provide recommendations regarding MP products, promotions, and sales opportunities.
  • Conduct regular business reviews and check-ins with customers to discuss product performance.
  • Make field sales calls to customers and prospects to maximize the sale of our products and introduce innovation within our product assortment.
  • Design and create customized presentations to meet our customersâ€™ needs and achieve desired sales outcome.
  • Develop clear and effective written proposals/quotations for current and prospective customers.
  • Work closely with national account managers and business development managers on territory specific opportunities, goals and objectives.
  • Forecast and meet territory forecasted sales.
  • Plan advanced weekly and monthly itinerary.
  • Monitor and report on competitive activity in assigned territory.
  • Conducts/facilitates customer training sessions and attends â€œwork withsâ€™ and industry trade shows and events.
  • General administrative/sales duties: Account Planning; Equipment requisitions/agreements; Expense reports; Trade Spend requests; Account deductions; Rebate/Accrual forms; National Account field support.

What you bring to the role:

  • Post-secondary degree in business or related field.
  • 3-5 years of Foodservice sales experience with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales goals.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to listen and persuade others.
  • Understands basic drivers of profitability.
  • Embodies strong traits such as negotiation skills, decision making, problem solving and possesses good judgment.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with a high consideration to detail and high level of accuracy.
  • Driven and highly self-motivated.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.
  • Previous experience with Dynamic 365 CRM, or another CRM system.
  • Valid driverâ€™s license and ability to travel extensively and as required within territory/region.
  • Bilingual in French would be an asset.

What we offer you:

  • Flex hours and the opportunity to work from home.
  • Competitive Total Rewards package â€“ health benefits coverage on day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, optional Health or Wellness Spending Accounts.
  • A company supplied vehicle.
  • Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
  • Tuition Assistance Program â€“ we value continuous learning and self-development.

 

 

While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Virtual Sales Account Manager
description:
Why You'll Love Cisco:

Are you ready to change the World? Do you want to be passionate about your employer and the brand you represent? Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more significant than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything imaginable -from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means you will take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with expert mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. We care about our customers, enjoy having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in your community. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.

What You'll Do:

Interested in being challenged and appreciated while embarking in a dynamic career? In an environment where colleagues become friends, where managers actively coach and where creativity and ambition are valued?

You will build direct relationships with customers, will work closely with and use the selected channel partners to increase new sales opportunities and renewals within your territory. You will manage all aspects of sales while using innovative technologies to remotely collaborate with customers and employ new sales models (cloud, services & software) to help customers improve their revenue.

* You will be selling the entire Cisco portfolio to our mid-market customers to help make their businesses run better and smarter

* You will accurately forecast your monthly, quarterly and annual revenue streams, driving growth

* You'll be responsible for driving new business as well as fostering your account base. We value a consultative sales approach focuses on driving business outcomes.

Who You'll Work With:

The Global Virtual Sales organization is one of Cisco’s fastest growing sales teams and is the talent engine for Cisco Sales with diverse and motivated teams that consistently deliver profitable growth. We serve our customer life-cycle through a series of selling motions to drive higher value and an optimal experience from Cisco solutions.

We are a dynamic and international team that brings excitement to the sales floor every day. We connect Cisco customers with solutions that can transform their businesses and change the world. We will provide you with a platform for success including coaching, training and on-the-job learning that will strongly support you in your career advancement.

You will discover an innovative, flexible and award-winning working environment using the latest Cisco technology to enable and empower you to perform to the very best of your abilities. Our teams promptly adapt to respond to market changes, and we are all highly encouraged to give back to our local communities.

Who You Are:

If you enjoy selling in a changing environment, are goal motivated and believe in performance rewards for exceeding annual sales goals through strong collaboration with partners and internal collaborators, we have a place for you.

* You have 3+ years’ B2B selling experience in a similar or adjacent industry.

* You exude a love for IT and ability to tap into technology.

* You have a history of career progression and desire for professional development

* You've got experience owning the full sales cycle (prospecting, customer demos, negotiating and closing the sale).

* Highly motivated with a "hunting spirit" to develop new opportunities and grow business

* You are able to demonstrate strong sales achievement i.e. consistent achievement at or above quota, or a history YoY growth in your target market.

* You are passionate about sales and building positive relationships

* You possess strong eye for business and can effectively value proposition to your customer base. Most importantly you have the ability to engage in active listening, to identify pain points-both current and future, and propose solutions to improve their process.

* You have phenomenal communication/presentation skills.

* You are a flexible and resilient problem solver; our strongest teammates have a sense of urgency to resolve issues.

* You thrive in a team environment and enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.

* You take pride in your positive and upbeat energy.

* Experience using digital selling tools such as Salesforce, Outreach and LinkedIn Navigator, are a plus.

We Are Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re "old" (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company, and a security company, and a blockchain company, and an AI/Machine Learning company! We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do -you can’t put us in a box! But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it). Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA). We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool…#WeAreCisco!
Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.
Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: International Customer Success Manager
description:
Job Summary:

The Customer Success Manager is an outside sales position designed to ensure the companyâ€™s Global customers are receiving the highest level of service and compelling value in all their business dealings on a day to day basis. This role is designed to support the Pharma customer sales teamâ€™scurrent business in theCanadian region.

 

The International Customer Success Manager is instrumental at positioning the sales teams to earn new opportunities for growth. The CSM role complements the strategic responsibilities of a Global Business Development Manager and/or Regional Sales Manager tasked with prioritizing new market growth and solution selling objectives. Expectations of this role will involve direct customer engagements, OEM and publisher partnerships, and embracing an internal SHI team selling culture.

 

The International Customer Success Manager will report to the International Sales Director.   This position is required to report to the SHI Toronto office location as determined by SHI management.

About Us:

Founded in 1989, SHI International is an $12 billion global provider of IT solutions and services. SHI currently has 5,000 employees worldwide.

To learn more about SHI International Corp, visit our website: www.shi.com/careers

What SHI Can Offer:

  • World Class Facility includes on site gyms and cafeterias
  • Ongoing opportunities for personal and professional growth and development due to our strong promote from within philosophy
  • Work in an up-beat, creative, and fun environment
  • Benefits including medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending
Responsibilities:

Includes but not limited to:

  • Serve as the primary contact for the onboarding of new customers, measuring adherence to project and program requirements, as well as post go-live support
  • Collaborate and partner with multiple resources at the companyâ€™s warehouse and Integration center to meet customer deployment requirements
  • Ensure inventory is secured with the OEMâ€™s and/or distributors for the timely deployment of devices, according to customer requirements
  • Engage with OEMâ€™s and SHIâ€™s internal product and vendor teams to keep abreast of emerging technologies, product transitions and/or constraints for timely communications to our customers
  • Work with Global Business Development Managers when new service and product opportunities (upsell or cross-sell) are generated through engagements
  • Collaborate with various pre-sales and engineering Subject Matter Experts within the company and/or OEM partners to deliver workshops and provide guidance to drive usage and help accelerate customer value for Integration Services
  • Regularly review processes between the customer organizations and the company to identify ways to automate or even eliminate processes to accelerate time to deployment and customers utilization of technology
  • Drive retention and growth by identifying customersâ€™ pain points and key initiatives to develop end-to-end solutions to accelerate customersâ€™ selection, deployment, and management of their technology platforms
  • Maintain a cadence of communication with customers about their upcoming needs and ensure forecast alignment with sales and supply chain management
  • Run monthly touchpoints with customers
  • Provide weekly activity reporting and pipeline management tracking
  • Secure customersâ€™ intent to deploy and clearly define business outcomes by developing an actionable roadmap and success plan outlining steps, risks, blockers, and related services opportunities
  • Continuously maintain and enhance proficiencies as a subject matter expert in the assigned practice areas
  • Quarterback the Statement of Work (SOW) process for services engagements and product upsells
  • Understand and clearly articulate the value proposition for Integration Services through SHI
  • Analyze Report data and account specific action plans
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum 2-years sales or sales support experience
  • Prior experience with IT hardware, software, and/or services sales
  • 3-5 years technical, business and/or sales experience working with numerous assigned medium to large organizations
  • Knowledge of solution products, including business model, architectures, and solutions
Required Skills:
  • Executive level communication, consultative and presentation skills are essential
  • Accustomed to working effectively within all levels of an organization, both internally and externally.
  • Ability to make diversified customer relationships
  • Skilled at escalation and issue management and managing customer expectations
  • Results-driven mentality
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into insights.
  • Flexible approach, able to operate effectively with uncertainty and change

 

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint preferred
  • Customer Success or similar experience
  • Utilization of Microsoft Dynamics CRM
  • Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite
  • Team-building, organization and time management skills are required
  • Proactive problem-solving and data analytics skills for sales reports and spend reports
  • Near native fluency in Dutch or another major European language
Certifications Required:
  • Must obtain sales certifications for Microsoft, VMWare, AWS, Apple and any other relevant ISV and OEM within 12 months from hire
Unique Requirements:
  • Some travel required for customer meetings
  • Extended hours are required to complete some special projects
Additional Information:

Additional Information: FOR USA POSTS ONLY

  • FLSA: Exempt

 

Equal Employment Opportunity â€“ M/F/Disability/Protected Veteran Status

title: Senior Director, Sales, Commercial Repair and Conversion
description:
The Sr. Director is accountable for the sales operation, revenue generation and profitability of repair and conversion at Seaspan Shipyards. This role leads the management of customer relationships by developing and securing new businesses, supervising fulfillment of contractual obligations, resolving operational issues and negotiating settlements. The role optimizes the utilization of Seaspan Shipyard’s equipment to meet customer requirements and increase profitability. This position maintains drydock planning and develops bid proposals for cases for new equipment anticipating future business needs and opportunities.

Duties and Accountabilities

  • Accountable for revenues and expenditures to achieve financial targets. Prepares annual budgets and forecasts equipment utilization, revenue, costs and profits.
  • Develops solid, long-term professional relationships with customers, prospects and industry leaders for Seaspan Shipyards. This includes identifying and pursuing new business opportunities (ship repair/refit and new ship construction) and following up with existing customers to improve service and customer value.
  • Understands customer’s business, anticipating issues and opportunities and providing innovative, cost-effective solutions to meet customer needs.
  • Owns the preparation of quotations for new business and helps negotiate major contracts.
  • Leads all aspects of contractual processes, obligations and issues, including orders, trip planning, invoicing, issues resolutions and negotiating settlements.
  • Reviews the capabilities of existing Seaspan Shipyards assets and makes recommendations for capital additions or removals ensuring fleet capabilities are well matched to customer requirements.
  • Identifies and evaluates growth/new business opportunities (ship repair/refit and new construction), by performing duties such as attending industry conferences, understanding emerging markets (domestic and international), meeting with current and new customers to discuss growth opportunities.
  • Leads the team to plan, coordinate and schedule various jobs and customer requests in a manner that improves efficiency and utilization of Seaspan Shipyards assets, ensuring strong financial returns on capital investment.
  • Works closely with the Maintenance & Repair Division to prioritize and schedule routine maintenance and repairs, ensuring high levels of asset availability and reliability while controlling costs.
  • Facilitates ongoing, regular communication with operations staff and seagoing personnel.
  • Provides input to senior management with regards to strategic planning and organizational improvement. Promotes corporate vision and acts as a role model for health and safety and other programs.
  • Represents Seaspan Shipyards on industry committees ensuring company’s interests are voiced and protected.
  • Performs additional duties as required.

Qualification Requirements

  • Diploma in relevant subject area (Business, Mechanical or Maritime Engineering preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience in marine operations, including experience in sales, customer relations, operations and contract negotiations, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 5+ years of experience in progressively senior leadership positions.

Skills, Knowledge and Competencies

  • Experience working with SalesForce is an asset.
  • Knowledge of marine transportation industry.
  • Customer focused with sound negotiation skills.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills, leading by “can-do” approach.
  • Ability to build and manage relationships as well as the management of customer accounts.
  • Leadership skills, including the ability to coach and mentor.
  • Ability to handle budgets and contracts.

title: Planner Buyer
description:
Company Description

Be part of a community of authentic, proud and trusted people

At UAP, we believe we don’t just deliver car and heavy vehicle parts all around the country; we also help keep Canadians moving forward. This makes for a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

Job Description

The Procurement Department of the Automotive Division is looking for a Buyer Planner to complete its team. The ideal candidate has a college or university education, combined with 2 to 3 years of relevant experience in a similar position. He (she) also stands out for his (her) analytical skills, rigour, dynamism and ability to adapt. His/her main contribution will be at the next level:  

  • Ensure the supply of regular, seasonal and promotional needs; 
  • Maintain and optimize the parameters of the replenishment system to ensure the desired service levels and appropriate inventory rotations; 
  • Initiate and/or participate in periodic or ad hoc meetings; 
  • Analyze exceptions to forecasts; Analyze seasonal fluctuations and customer buying patterns and make appropriate adjustments; 
  • Participate in projects to improve the operations of the department and other sectors of the company. 
  • Ensure good communication with the product department, distribution centers, stores and suppliers to achieve the desired service levels. 
Qualifications

To join our team, you need: 

  • College or university degree in operations management, mathematics, administration or other; 
  • 2 to 3 years of relevant experience; 
  • Mastery of the MS-Office suite (specifically Excel and Access); 
  • Bilingualism essential (oral and written) ; 
  • Knowledge of procurement software (Manhattan IO, AS 400, ISeries, IBMi) is an asset; 
  • Knowledge of advanced analytical tools/languages such as SQL is an asset; 
  • Knowledge of products (automotive parts) Asset; 
  • Open-mindedness, perspective, organizational and planning skills, ability to manage pressure, oral communication skills, autonomy, analytical skills, action-oriented.


Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Purchasing Coordinator
description:
Heritage Food Service Group of Canada is an industry leader in providing technical service for commercial kitchen equipment. We provide responsive service from experienced, highly trained professionals to make sure our customers' operations are kept running.

Choquette CKS is looking for a permanent full-time Purchasing Coordinator. This individual contributes to the success of the organization by driving service excellence through working with manufacturers to reduce discrepancies in parts, producing reports, and tracking parts, and does so accurately, quickly, and cost-effectively. This position has major impact on customers' satisfaction because it directly affects the speed and quality of service, both in terms of parts delivery to end users, and in contributing to the Service Technicians' first-time fix rates.

Core responsibilities

  • Manages the relationship with manufacturers to resolve parts shortages, damages and other issues that arise.
  • Processes part returns to manufacturers and suppliers.
  • Processes replenishment within authority.
  • Processes relevant inventory reports.
  • Creates new part numbers for services
  • Updates system with relevant tracking information

What you need to be successful:

  • High school graduation required.
  • Bilingual French and English language skills are an asset.
  • Formal education in Purchasing, Inventory Management, or other relevant field.
  • Minimum 2 years experience working in a directly related field.
  • Experience with a current ERP system an asset.

Why Work for Us:

  • We are profitable, stable, and growing - which makes us exciting to be a part of.
  • Comprehensive group benefits
  • Training and development opportunities
  • We are the industry leader in technical expertise and market penetration.
  • An opportunity to learn what it's like to be part of a fast moving, growing company
  • Be part of a fun and collaborative team dedicated to the success of our business
  • Input and ideas are always accepted. Your opinion matters here!

We look for people with a clear drive for delivering service excellence with integrity, from a team-driven and dynamic mindset. If this is the right fit for you, please provide your resume and let us know what makes you the right fit for Heritage!

title: Environments Analyst - SuccessFactors - 6 Month Contract
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

EY has been on an exciting multiyear HR system transformation journey that is delivering an integrated enterprise-wide cloud-based HR platform which enables the organization to meet its strategic talent/business goals.

 

The opportunity


The SuccessFactors Environments Analyst is a key member of the Digital Talent Product Support team, responsible for the delivery and support of high quality, proactive technology solutions to our clients for global EY HR systems. This role, reporting to the HR Systems Product Support – Data, Compliance and Environments Service Delivery Lead, will manage functional operations activities for their assigned systems, along with effectively manage our EY HR technology environment landscape, including but not limited to involvement in quality testing, issues and defect management, configuration and supporting continuous improvement initiatives across our SuccessFactors integrated technology landscape. 
 

Your key responsibilities

  • Identifies opportunities for product improvements across the SAP SuccessFactors Suite, as well as proposes options for those improvements, and works closely with the HR Systems Portfolio Manager on validating and prioritizing them.
  • Partners with the HR Systems Design & Deployment Team and Transition Acceptance Lead to ensure successful transition of new systems and updates to systems, into a business as usual (BAU) and continuous improvement environment.
  • Partners closely with the Product Support Operations team to plan for and support each product throughout all milestone events, following the schedule that has been agreed to by the business. This includes configuration and coordination with Vendor and other internal teams, to ensure the system will be ready for use within the timeframe required. 
  • Monitors issue logs and KPIs, supporting day-to-day operations of Talent technology. 
  • Proactively manages release cycles and updates, conducting in-depth change impact assessments, identifying risks and benefits, and developing implementation plans that are delivered to within agreed timelines.
  • Identifies risks that exist in the current environment and proposes solutions.
  • Manages the lifecycle of defects and enhancements using established processes & tools.
  • Manages the SuccessFactors non-production environments, including system refreshes, data masking and coordination with other Digital Talent and EY Technology teams.
  • Stays up to date on HR systems market trends, identifying ways to improve our systems. 
  • Builds and maintains effective working relationships within HR Services, Digital Talent, Global Talent Function, Process Leaders and IT Services teams.
  • Acts as an escalation point/third level support for issues that require intervention, ensuring the appropriate resources from the Vendor and relevant Digital Talent and Technology teams are engaged.
  • Performs primary analysis and provides feedback on diverse requirements and change requests from multiple countries. 
  • Maintains a pulse on user feedback and provides prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges to improve the user experience.
  • Works with the customer and various teams to evaluate and prioritize defects and enhancements as required; and to understand and communicate potential impacts of recommended changes.
  • Global travel may be required pending business needs.
  • Due to the global nature of the role, you will need to work outside of normal business hours to accommodate calls and meetings across time zones, and will need to partner and team with team members, clients and stakeholders virtually and across borders.

 

Skills and attributes for success

  • Ability to work and team in a virtual environment, across multiple countries, areas and cultures, and team effectively with clients and other team members.
  • Ability to produce detailed, relevant documentation and reports as required.
  • Ability to work well in stressful situations.
  • Ability to perform and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. 
  • Proven analytical experience and troubleshooting across a range of systems.
  • Proven track record of working with a senior stakeholder population.
  • Ability to work in a matrix organization and influencing multiple senior stakeholders to drive results. 
  • Ability to work with cross border teams in a virtual environment.

 

To qualify for the role you must have

  • Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)
  • 3+ years’ experience in enterprise HR systems support and continuous improvement, or related roles, preferably within the SuccessFactors.
  • Experience with SuccessFactors Jam, Reporting and Platform
  • Experience in environment management and administration

 

Ideally, you’ll also have

  • Experience as a product SME/analyst in a support role.
  • Experience in cross functional HR system design and support
  • Good interpersonal, communication, organizational, project management and client service skills. 
  • Basic understanding of software development processes, operations management and product management activities.

 

What we offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
     

Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 

EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided. 

 

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
 
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. 

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Technical Sales Manager “Canada” – Bridges / Infrastructure
description:
Technical Sales Manager “Canada” – Bridges / Infrastructure

Location

Toronto. Ontario.

 

Job description

mageba has supplied bearings, expansion joints, and seismic products to landmark structures across the country. The Pattullo Bridge Replacement (BC), New Champlain Bridge (QC), Nipigon River Bridge (ON), MacDonald Bridge (NS), Port Mann Bridge (BC), Deh Cho Bridge (NWT), and Golden Ears Bridge (BC), are just a few examples.

We are currently looking for a motivated "Technical Sales Manager Canada  – Bridges / Infrastructure" that is motivated and ready to continue to build our brand and mission. We pride ourselves on supplying durable, state of the art products. The candidate will lead a group of sales engineers, pursuing new infrastructure projects, as well as ensuring timely execution and 100% customer satisfaction.

If you are an individual that is never satisfied with the status quo and seeks to join a leader in the industry with over 50 years of experience, then we invite you to explore and apply.

 

Responsibilities

As an Sales Manager, you are in the lead of generating sales within the Canadian market with the following priorities and objectives:

  • Technical and commercial sales in the field of structural bearings and expansion joints including all operational, commercial and technical aspects (from lead management, technical consulting to actual bidding/tendering)
  • Tracking of offers and orders, maintaining partnerships (authorities such as DOTs, construction companies, engineering offices, other partners)
  • Contract management including negotiation and claim management
  • Structured hand-over of acquired projects to the project management team and monitoring the project manager to ensure qualitative, economic and timely aspects and requirements including the corresponding reporting are met
  • Operational planning and budgeting of projects together with the project managers
  • Interface for internal and external customers and all other involved stakeholders incl. planning of market activities (customer visits, standards committees, interest groups, etc.)
  • Consultancy of our customers with the willingness to a travel activity of approx. 10 to 20% within Canada.

 

Qualifications

For this diversified, challenging and exciting job opening, we are looking for an engineer (m/ f) who brings along the following qualifications:

  • An engineering degree, BSc or MSc, preferably in Civil Engineering
  • Proven track record in technical sales and possibly project management
  • Ability to understand our product line and to become a technical expert in our field
  • Minimum 5-10 years of work experience
  • Independent work style, high sense of responsibility and a focus on high quality
  • Team player with the necessary degree of assertiveness
  • Reliability, commercial sense, efficiency, organizational skills, and ambition are among your key attributes

 

Our commitment

We offer a challenging work environment where your duties will have a direct impact on the overall business success. In our agile organization, you can contribute to future developments both in your area of expertise and of the company as a whole. We offer independent and creative work and a competitive, performance-related, salary.

 

To Apply

We look forward to receiving your application by e-mail (hr.us@mageba-group.com), comprising the following documents:

  • Motivation letter
  • CV
  • Proof of successful performance in a similar position (e.g. short presentation in PowerPoint, certificates, awards, relevant publications, reference letters)
  • References (work testimonials)
  • Academic certificates
  • Copy of visa indicating authorization to work in the United States (if required)

 

Notice

mageba North America Corp. is an equal opportunity employer.

  • Principals only. Recruiters, please do not contact this job poster.
  • Do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.

 

Must-have qualifications

  • Are you legally authorized to work in Canada?

Ideal answer: Yes

  • Have you completed the following level of education: Bachelor's Degree?

Ideal answer: Yes

  • How many years of Project Management experience do you currently have?

Ideal answer: 5 or more

  • How many years of Civil Engineering experience do you currently have?

Ideal answer: 5 or more

title: Purchasing Coordinator (Food Packaging)
description:
Shah Trading Co. Ltd is a leader in the food industry with a 40 year history serving customers both in Canada and globally. With a deep understanding of food markets and food safety requirements we are committed to continued leadership, growth, and service to our customers.
Overview of Position:
Materials Purchasing Coordinator to manage the purchasing of food packaging materials, office supplies, cleaning supplies and other recurring purchases for all Shah Trading locations. The incumbent will coordinate, anticipate, and organize the needs of production through the purchasing and managing of production materials and execute all relevant POs.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Work with local and international suppliers
  • Negotiate and manage purchasing contracts
  • Accountable for maintaining sufficient materials stock levels to prevent disruption for production
  • Issue new purchase orders
  • Create and provide inventory reports as requested
  • Work with suppliers on the availability of product and production planning
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors
  • Coordinate suppliers with respect to shipments
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other departments such as Production and Quality Control for materials and cleaning supply planning
  • Source and order office supplies as requested
  • Facilitate reorders for recurring purchases
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:
  • Minimum 1 year experience in Purchasing Role
  • Experience using ERP systems, ideally NAV
  • Experience in food processing industry & packaging is a great asset
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented, possess high degree of initiative, and works well under pressure.
  • Excellent oral and written English language skills
  • Organized and detail oriented
Shah Trading Company is committed to providing equal opportunities for all applicants and employees regardless of race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences (for which a pardon has been granted), disability, marital or family status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us to provide your contact information. While we appreciate all resume submissions, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
